data.name: Abul Hussain
data.description: Abul Hussain was killed in an alleged encounter with RAB and the police.

data.name: Touhidul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A group of outlawed Gono Mukti Fouz (GMF) members were killed in a shootout between their cohorts and the police at Baria village in Sadar upazila early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Touhidul Islam, 35, son of Abdul Mannan from Swastipur in Sadar upazila. The police stated that they raided Baria graveyard at about 2:30 am following a tip-off that a group of outlaws led by Touhidul had gathered there. The police asked them to surrender, but they instead fired shots. The police retaliated with gunfire, resulting in an hour-long gunfight. Touhidul was killed in the crossfire while his accomplices managed to escape. The police recovered a shotgun and two bullets from the scene. They also mentioned that Touhidul was involved in the murder of businessman Ashraful Islam Bakul on November 22. Meanwhile, another police team arrested another member of the same group from Bottail area last night. The police apprehended Sahjahan Ali with six rounds of ammunition during the raid.

data.name: Nowab Ali
data.description: Police claimed that he jumped into the river out of fear of the police, and his dead body was recovered after two days. However, his family claimed that he was tortured to death and then dumped in the river.

data.name: Abdul Kadir
data.description: He was surrounded by RAB-10 and later killed in crossfire. In the incident, his wife Shahanara (25), Farid (22), Yamin (2), Nurjahan (50), and an officer of RAB were injured.

data.name: Alfaz Ali Sarkar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The officer-in-charge of Ghoraghat police station, Sheikh Abdul Hakim, stated that 25 to 30 robbers created obstacles on the highway in the Nurjahanpur area of the upazila at 11:30 pm on Friday. They intercepted a truck bound for Dinajpur from Dhaka. When the driver and his assistant stopped, the robbers stabbed them. When a police patrol reached the scene during the incident, the robbers started firing at them. Alfaz Ali Sarkar, 30, was shot dead when the police fired back. Later, he died at Ghoraghat Upazila Health Centre.

data.name: Alauddin Kalu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Kotwali Model Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Nuruzzaman Chowdhury told bdnews24.com on Monday, "Based on intelligence information, a special team of police raided the Talukdarhat area of Chandpura Union in Sadar Upazila and arrested Kalu on Sunday night." He said, "When Kalu admitted to having weapons during the initial interrogation, the police accompanied him to recover the weapons." OC Nuruzzaman said, "When the police crossed the area adjacent to the Jatraghata bridge on Saheberhat road at around 11:15 pm, Kalu's accomplices fired at the police. The police also fired back. At one point, the terrorists retreated." He said, "After that, the police surrounded the area and conducted a search, resulting in the discovery of a body. Locals identified the body as that of dacoit Alauddin, also known as Kalu.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: A young man named Habibur Rahman (17) in the custody of Chandgaon Police Station died on Wednesday afternoon while undergoing treatment at Chittagong Medical College (CMC) Hospital. He was taken to court around 2:30 pm, but the court police did not accept him due to his physical condition. Three policemen have been withdrawn in connection with the death. They were withdrawn and attached to the police line on Thursday morning as preliminary investigation found evidence of dereliction of duty. These three policemen are Sub-inspector Rashid of Chandgaon Police Station, Assistant Sub-Inspector Hafiz Uddin, and Habildar Abdul Ahad.

data.name: Shagor
data.description: He was severely tortured while in the custody of Bhairab Railway Station by OC Shohidullah.

data.name: Julhash
data.description: He was killed in a gunfight with RAB-2.

data.name: Monjur Alom
data.description: He came to the forest to visit his brother's garden, but the forest guard shot him dead, suspecting that he was a timber thief.

data.name: Samsul Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: He was allegedly found by the DB police while taking extortion money. Then they locked into a gunfight. He was killed in the crossfire.

data.name: Saidul Sarder
data.description: Saidul's family claimed that he was arrested and severely beaten by RAB. They alleged that RAB broke his legs and took him to an unknown location, where he was fatally shot. However, the police stated that he was injured in a crossfire with RAB and was subsequently taken to the hospital, where he passed away.

data.name: Abdur Rashid Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The extremists were identified as Abdur Rashid, also known as Mollah Rashid, who is 40 years old and a leader of the Purba Banglar Communist Party [ML-Janajuddha] in Chuadanga Sadar Upazila. Rashid is the son of Faizuddin Mollah from the village of Alokdia in Chuadanga Sadar Upazila. Speaking to bdnews24.com, Chuadanga Sadar police chief Ahsan Habib said they conducted a raid on a brick kiln in Bujruk Garari, Chudanga Sadar Upazila, at 3:45 am after receiving a tip-off about a group of extremists holding a meeting there. The extremists opened fire on the police, who retaliated, resulting in a 20-25-minute gunfight. Eventually, the extremists retreated, and the police found Rashid's body at the scene, along with a shotgun and three rounds of bullets, according to Habib.

data.name: Abu Sayeed Sarder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged top-ranking extremist was killed in a so-called gun battle with the police early on Saturday, the police said. Abu Sayeed Sarder, also known as Ranga Sayeed, 45, a leader of the banned New Biplobi Communist Party (red flag), was the latest casualty in the ongoing crackdown on outlawed extremists in the country's southern and southwestern districts. The incident took place at around 1:30 am in Aamvita village of Rangpur union under Dumuria upazila. Sayeed was a resident of Mothbaria and the son of Abdur Rahman Sarder. Superintendent of Police of Khulna, Mohammad Shamsuddin, told bdnews24.com that they received a tip-off that a gang of terrorists had assembled for a secret meeting at Aamvita High School ground. A special team of police raided the spot. "The miscreants opened fire on the police and the law enforcers retaliated, resulting in a gun battle," Shamsuddin said. Sayeed was found shot after the gun battle, while his accomplices fled the scene after a while, the SP added. He was taken to Dumuria health complex, where the duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Mobarok Hossain
data.identity: Member of the erstwhile Bangladesh Rifles
data.description: Yet another member of the Bangladesh Rifles (BDR) died under mysterious circumstances at the city's Pilkhana headquarters yesterday. The man was identified as Lance Nayek Mobarak Hossain. He fled the HQ shortly before the 33-hour mutiny ended on February 26 and later reported back to the barracks. With his death, the number of border troops who have died since March 9 stands at four. Three of them died at Pilkhana, and one in Joypurhat. Additionally, the BDR central mosque's pesh imam (someone who leads prayers), who reportedly witnessed the start of the bloodbath, died during the same period. However, Mobarak's relatives allege that he was tortured to death. They claim he was in good health when he returned to Pilkhana. Before coming to Dhaka on February 18 to join the BDR week, he was stationed at the Rifle Security Unit in the 29th Battalion of Chittagong. He held ID No. 48235. Requesting anonymity, his cousin told reporters yesterday afternoon, "My brother died an agonizing death after torture." Earlier, sources at Dhaka Medical College (DMC) morgue said the lance nayek's wrists, arms, knees, and shoulders were swollen and badly bruised.

data.name: Tota Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A dacoit was killed in an alleged gunfight between RAB and RAB in Chhota Kaliakair area of Savar. One RAB member was injured. RAB officials said that the deceased, Tota Mia (35), was the head of the bandit gang. He was the son of the late Tilam Uddin from the Maniknagar area of Singair police station in Manikganj district. They also mentioned that Tota had several robbery and murder cases against him in Dhamrai police station, including the murder case of Bangladesh Bank official Hedayetullah. RAB-4 Savar Camp Commander, Lt. Commander Ariful Islam, told bdnews24.com that they received information that 7/8 members of the inter-district dacoit group had gathered behind the Kaliakoi mosque in Chhota Kaliakoi area and were preparing to commit a robbery. A team led by RAB officer Shamshul Islam went to the spot around 5:30 am. At that time, the robbers started firing after sensing their presence. RAB member Ariful Islam was injured. At this time, the shooting started between the two sides. He said that the firing took place between the two sides for about 15 minutes. Later, Savar Thana Police reached the spot and rescued Tota Mia in a bullet-ridden state and took him to Savar Thana Health Complex. The on-duty doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Nasir Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A person named Nasir Uddin Nasir, also known as Nasir Kasai (28), was killed in an "encounter" with RAB early on Friday morning in Balur field of Jhilmil project in South Keraniganj. Three weapons, including a pistol and a revolver, were recovered from the spot. There are 10 cases against him, including multiple murders. AK Azad, director of RAB's legal and media wing, told bdnews24.com that the "encounter" took place around 3:30 pm. Before that, RAB-10 arrested Nasir Kasai. He said that based on the information obtained during the interrogation after his arrest, when Nasir's terrorist group went to retrieve weapons, they fired at RAB to take him away, and RAB fired back, resulting in his death. Meanwhile, the terrorists fled. He also mentioned that a pistol, a revolver, and a one-shotter (a domestically made weapon that imitates a gun) left by the terrorists were "recovered" with a total of five rounds.

data.name: Kazi Saidur Rahman
data.identity: Member of the erstwhile Bangladesh Rifles
data.description: Police recovered the body of another BDR member from the mutiny-hit border forces' Peelkhana headquarters in Dhaka on Thursday. New Market police sub-inspector Emadul Kabir told bdnews24.com that they had found the body of Kazi Saidur Rahman, 50. Emadul suspected that he might have died of cardiac arrest. Saidur was a habildar with the 13 Rifles Battalion. So far, 12 BDR members have died after the carnage, apparently due to suicide, heart attacks, and other reasons across the country.

data.name: Dulal Sarder
data.description: His family claimed that the police forcibly took him from a hospital and tortured him. Unfortunately, the man died before he could be sent to jail.

data.name: Siddiqur Rahman Biplob
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional leader of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Janajuddha) was killed in what law enforcers claimed was an exchange of gunfire with RAB and police in Jhenaidah early Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Siddiqur Rahman Biplob, son of Abdul Matlub of Bhabanipur. Jhenaidah superintendent of police, Jahangir Hossain, told bdnews24.com Tuesday morning that, after receiving a tip-off about the presence of extremists, RAB and police had raided Ramchandrapur of the Sadar Upazila. At one point, the extremists engaged with the law enforcers at around 11:45 pm. After a half-hour gun battle, the extremists fled the scene, Jahangir said. The police recovered Biplob's body, one motorcycle, two mobile phones, one revolver, one shutter gun, and one bomb from the scene, he added.

data.name: Lal Chand
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: An alleged leader of a terror gang was killed in a gunfight early Wednesday in Hossainabad village, Doulatpur Upazila, in the district, according to a RAB official. Lal Chand, 45, the alleged leader of the Lal Chand terror gang, died in the gun battle, said Major Suman of RAB-12 unit posted at Kushtia. Hafizur Rahman, Doulatpur police chief, said a dozen cases have been filed against Lal Chand with Doulatpur Police Station, of which six were murder charges. Tipped off by an informer, a RAB intelligence team went to Hossainabad on Wednesday at 5 am, where Lal Chand and his cohorts were present in Laldaha ground. Sensing the RAB presence, the alleged terrorists opened fire at them and RAB retaliated. Lal Chand was eventually found dead while others fled the scene.

data.name: Mohiuddin Ahmed
data.identity: Member of the erstwhile Bangladesh Rifles
data.description: Mohiuddin Ahmed continued working at Halishore barracks until he was arrested on March 22. His wife, Dolly, learned of his arrest only by talking to people present during the incident. They informed her that he had been taken by RAB-7, but no one could provide information on his whereabouts. She visited BDR headquarters, the police, and Dhaka Central jail, but was unable to obtain any information about him. Dolly attempted to contact Ahmed on his two mobile phones, but both were switched off. Dolly recounted to Human Rights Watch how she discovered where Ahmed was: A neighbor informed me on May 4 at night that there was a news report on TV stating that Ahmed was in the hospital, and suggested that I should go there. About an hour later, at midnight, I heard on the news that he had died of a heart attack. I didn't know what to believe, so we hurried to the hospital and found him deceased. According to Dolly, Ahmed had been in good health until his arrest. When she and her brothers went to Dhaka Medical College to collect his body, she noticed severe bruising. Her brother, who examined the body more closely, observed that the back area near the hip was completely black and blue, and there were severe lacerations on the legs and upper back. According to his family, a post-mortem report from Dhaka Medical College stated that Ahmed had been beaten on the lower half of his body. The family filed an unlawful death case with the police. According to his family, the police investigation revealed that Ahmed's body had been discovered near New Market on May 4, and that he had died of a heart attack.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Dilu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An alleged top gangster of Lalbagh in the capital was killed early on Wednesday in a so-called encounter with RAB in Shahidnagar Beribadh Kamrangirchar, a day after the local government minister said no more extra-judicial killings would be allowed. Delwar Hossain Dilu, 35, also known as Alamgir Hossain in the neighborhood, had seven cases, including manslaughter, filed against him. RAB said its corporal Joy Gopal Das and lance corporal Nasir Uddin sustained injuries during the skirmish. RAB's legal and media wing director, AK Azad, told bdnews24.com that after receiving a tip about a terrorists' meeting, a RAB-10 contingent reached Shahidnagar at 3:15 am on Wednesday. The terrorists opened fire on them, and the elite force retaliated. The gun battle continued for 20 minutes, he said. Eventually, the criminals fled the scene, and RAB recovered Dilu's body and two pistols, including six rounds of ammunition, from the spot. The locals identified the dead body as Dilu's, Azad added.

data.name: Hasanul Haq Hapu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A 'terrorist' was killed in an alleged gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Pangsha Upazila of Rajbari district on Wednesday midnight. The deceased is Hasanul Haque Khan Hapu (42), son of Abdul Hakim, former chairman of Jashai Union Parishad of Pangsha Upazila. Faridpur RAB-8 said in a press release on Thursday that two terrorist groups were having a secret meeting inside a building under construction of Adi Mahashmashan near Pangsha Upazila Complex at around 3 am. Meanwhile, the terrorists fired at the RAB. RAB also fired back, and both sides exchanged fire for 20-25 minutes. At one point, when the firing stopped, the RAB surrounded the area. Later in the morning, a dead body was found in and around the building. Locals and police identified it as Hapu's.

data.name: Saidur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged member of the PBCP-Janajuddha, identified as Saidur Rahman (32), was killed in a shootout between RAB personnel and PBCP members at Khaskarra village in Alamdanga Sub-District of Chuadanga on May 9. The PBCP members were allegedly holding a meeting at a mango orchard when RAB carried out the raid.

data.name: Unidentified
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two members of the United People's Democratic Front were killed in a "gunfight" with the army at Katalchhari early on Monday, according to an army official. The UPDF, a regional political party based in the Chittagong Hill Tracts, seeks to establish full autonomy in the region. The gunfight broke out when the army raided their hideout at 1:00 am and the UPDF men fired, Major Zillur Rahman, deputy captain of the army in Bandarban Sadar Zone, told reporters. He could not name the deceased individuals.

data.name: Unidentified
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)

data.name: Nuruzzaman
data.description: It was reported that he was arrested by Sub-Inspector Mr. Nazrul of Pirgaccha police station, brutally tortured, and brought into the police station. He died within half an hour after being brought to the police station.

data.name: Sohel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Two alleged gangsters were killed early on Friday during a so-called "gunfight" with RAB in Shabujbagh of the capital. RAB said that "Sohel" and "Babu" were members of the "Terror Shahadat Legion". Anisul Islam, sub-inspector at Shabujbagh Police Station, told bdnews24.com in the morning that the police and RAB had been seen setting up check-posts at different city localities and stopping and checking mobile transports. Quoting RAB sources, Islam said, "As a microbus in the Shabujbagh area refused to stop after being signaled to do so, RAB chased the vehicle." "Shots were fired from the fleeing van and RAB retaliated, resulting in the deaths of Sohel and Babu." RAB claimed that the two Shahadat group members had been engaged in extortion and other terrorist activities centered around the "jhut" (excess fabric, cut pieces) business in the city. RAB seized the microbus and recovered three pistols and narcotics. The police retrieved the bodies and sent them to Dhaka Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Jalal Akand
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A sacked leader of Jubo League was killed in a 'shootout' with RAB at the city's Dopdopia ferry point early on Friday. The deceased, Jalal Akon, 36, was the son of Motahar Akon from Nondopara of Boalia in Bakerganj Upazila. He was the general secretary of the ruling Awami League's youth front at Rongosree union. "A team of RAB surrounded the area after receiving news of clandestine activities by Jalal's group. They attempted to flee and fired at RAB," RAB-8 Lt Commander KM Mamunur Rashid told bdnews24.com. The elite force retaliated, and the shootout lasted for approximately 15 minutes. The group fled the scene, leaving a dead body behind. The locals later identified the body as Jalal's, he said.

data.name: Abdul Karim
data.description: He was shot and killed.

data.name: Manik
data.description: He was killed in a gunfight.

data.name: Moktar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: RAB claimed that an alleged gangster named Moktar Hossain, also known as Shooter Moktar, was killed in an alleged 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB). The incident occurred on Monday around 2:30 PM near the fence under Shah Ali police station in Mirpur. RAB Assistant Director ASP Md Menhajul Alam informed bdnews24.com, "On Monday night, a patrol team from RAB-4 was conducting a patrol along the embankment in Mirpur. At around 2:30 am, they stopped a car and were fired upon by the occupants. In response, the RAB fired back. Later, Moktar Hossain, also known as Shooter Moktar, was found dead with bullet wounds. A foreign revolver and 3 rounds were recovered from the scene.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam Azad
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: RAB killed an alleged robber in a shootout when he attempted to rob a CNG refueling station early on Sunday at suburban Aminbazaar. The 25-year-old Rafiqul Islam Azad, also known as Swapan, faced two murder cases for allegedly killing police sub-inspector Motiur and two RAB members. RAB personnel recovered a loaded foreign pistol and sharp weapons from the spot. Menhazul Alam, Assistant Director of Operations at RAB-4, said they had received prior information that the notorious "Gangchil Gang" of Savar would raid the CNG pump station. The gangsters swooped on the earmarked NR Filling Station at 2:30 am. As soon as the RAB-4 men arrived there, the robbers began fleeing the scene and RAB chased them. The miscreants fired at RAB men, and they retaliated. After the five-minute gun battle ceased, RAB took the bullet-hit Swapan to Savar Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead. Major Mohammad Sarwar of RAB 4 told The Daily Star that they chased Rafiqul, also known as Sumon, and his gang during a robbery at NR filling station. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang opened fire, prompting the security forces to retaliate. After the gunfight, they found Sumon's bullet-riddled body. However, the owner of NR filling station, Ramesh Chandra Ghosh, said he heard gunshots in the area but no incidents of robbery or shooting took place at his refueling station that night.

data.name: Zakir Hossain Bhuiyan
data.identity: Member of the erstwhile Bangladesh Rifles
data.description: The BDR issued a press release stating that initial assessments suggested Havildar Assistant Zakir Hossain Bhuiyan of the 19th Battalion in Feni had "committed suicide." He was found hanging from a ceiling fan at the Shainik Lines around 7:45 am. Zakir, who joined the BDR in 1988, is the son of M M Najir Ahmed Bhuiyan from Feni's West Chhagalnaiya village. The BDR will send his body to his village home after the postmortem. His family later claimed to Naya Diganta that he had been tortured.

data.name: Taher
data.description: He was killed in an encounter.

data.name: Mohsin Sheikh
data.description: Jinnah and Mohsin Sheikh were killed in the shootout at Manik Mia Avenue in the city on May 28th. At a press conference at the National Press Club yesterday, Jinnah's family members rejected the Rab's version that the two students were killed in the crossfire. They also termed it as a planned killing by Rab. Jinnah, son of the late Monirul Islam, a freedom fighter, was admitted to the polytechnic institute under the Muktijoddha quota, said his mother, Momtaj Begum. "I had dreamt that my son would become an engineer, but the law enforcement agencies shattered my dream… It is really unfortunate that Rab called my son a criminal," she said. Jinnah's brother, Humayun Kabir, said, "We will file cases against the alleged killer this week." Jashim Uddin, brother-in-law of Jinnah, read out a written statement at the press conference. Jinnah was a 6th-semester student of mechanical engineering and Mohsin was a final semester student of electrical engineering. Family members, as well as their teachers and other students, said Jinnah and Mohsin were members of Bangladesh Chhatra League, but they did not have any criminal records.

data.name: Guru Mongol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In a separate incident, a RAB-11 patrol team caught Guru Mongol and a gang of around eight highway robbers as they were stopping cars on a road in Shibpur, Narshingdi, between 3:30 am and 4 am, according to RAB-11 officer Jahangir Alam. The gang opened fire and the RAB retaliated, said Alam. Mongol, who was also identified as the son of Joynal Abedin Sarcar, chairman of Baghabo Union, died in the shootout that followed.

data.name: Akhter Hossain Kalu
data.description: Aktar Hossain Kalu was shot dead in an encounter with the police at the Botanical Gardens in the capital. Shah Ali police chief Jakir Hossain Mollah said Kalu was suspected of planning a crime. He has been accused in different cases, including mugging and extortion, Jakir said. Akbar Ali Babu, the elder brother of the victim, said Kalu sold vegetables at Mirpur-1 after being released from prison a month ago, having served six years in an arms case. Babu said the police picked Kalu up from Uttar Bishal in the capital's Mirpur area at around 7 pm on Sunday. When the family contacted the police station, they found out that he had not been taken there, said Babu. On Monday morning, they learned that he had been shot dead in an 'encounter' with the police at the Botanical Gardens, said Babu.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: According to the police, he was killed in a gunfight when he and his cohorts attacked a house.

data.name: Zakir
data.description: He was beaten to death by the Coast Guard.

data.name: Hamid
data.description: He was kicked and punched to death by ASI Harun Ur Rashid of DSB Police and two others. The locals apprehended him and handed him over to the OC of Dimla Police Station. They tortured him for not giving bribes to them. ASI Harun was later suspended.

data.name: Mozammel Hossain
data.description: The accused in a murder case, he was arrested on 06.06.09 and found hanged in the bathroom on 16 June. His family claimed that he was tortured to death.

data.name: Tarun Kusum Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly tied with the mainstream faction of the Parbatya Chattagram Jana Samhati Samiti (PCJSS) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A man was shot dead and another was arrested on Friday in an alleged gunfight at Majarer Channel near Shubhlong Bazaar in Rangamati, according to the police. The deceased, Tarun Kusum Chakma, 30, was the son of Shashimohon Master of Moitrinagar in Sadar Upazilla. The arrested individual, Elin Chakma, 27, was claimed to be a United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) activist by a leader of the hill tract-based party. Superintendent of Police Masudul Hassan stated that 10-12 gunmen arrived at Shubhalong Bazaar on an engine-boat at around 11 am. The troops stationed at the bazaar camp reached the location based on prior information and were met with gunfire. Tarun was killed when the army returned fire, he added. Hasan mentioned that the others managed to escape and the deceased body was sent to Rangamati General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: An apparel factory worker was shot dead on Saturday when Ansar personnel opened fire on the workers of a sweater factory who were demanding a pay hike at Jamnagar in Savar. At least 25 others who were injured in the incident were given first aid. Al Amin, 20, died after he was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, his co-worker Rana Parvez told bdnews24.com.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: He was shot and injured in a clash with the police. He was declared dead when he reached the hospital.

data.name: Rana Al Amin
data.description: A man suspected of attempting to murder a Jubo League leader on Wednesday night died on Thursday after being shot by the police in the Manikdi area of the capital, while two others sustained bullet injuries. The deceased has been identified as Rana Al-Amin, 30. "Rana and Masud, accompanied by other gang members, sought out Abbas Uddin, a local Jubo League leader, at the local construction workers' union office," said Ismail Hossain, sub-inspector of Cantonment Police Station. "Later, a mob chased Rana and Masud as they tried to escape towards Balughat. At that time, a shootout with the police occurred, and the two suspects were injured," said Hossain.

data.name: Tapan
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed and three others were wounded on Friday in a "gunfight" with RAB in Keraniganj on the outskirts of the capital, according to an official of the elite force. The deceased was named Tapan, 28, while the injured were identified as Hridoy, 22, Pappu, 18, and Mohammad Kamal, 25. The injured were admitted to Dhaka Medical College Hospital. The gunfight occurred at Khejurbagh when a group of six to seven criminals fired at a team of plainclothes RAB-10 officers at night. RAB returned fire, said Captain SM Kamal Hossain. The four individuals were captured at the scene and admitted to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where one of them died from bullet wounds, Hossain added.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two top underground operatives of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-Red Flag) were killed in a 'gunfight' with law enforcers in Atrai upazila of Naogaon early yesterday. The deceased were identified as Abdus Salam, also known as Topu, 40, the Naogaon regional chief of the outlawed party, and Jahangir, also known as Jalal, 38, the military affairs commander for the greater Rajshahi region. A Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) personnel and a policeman were taken to the hospital after sustaining injuries during the gunfight at Sadupur village at about 1:30 am, according to a Rab press release. After the gunfight, the law enforcers recovered an Indian-made automatic pistol, a shooter gun, two bullets, seven cartridges, PBCP leaflets, a mobile phone set, and two torches from the scene. A joint team of Rab and police rushed to the area following a tip-off that the PBCP operatives were holding a secret meeting at Mohadighi Sadupur in Atrai upazila to commit crimes on the occasion of the death anniversary of their spiritual leader, Dr. Mizanur Rahman Tutul, according to a Rab source. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the outlaws opened fire on them, resulting in a 10-minute gunfight between the criminals and law enforcers. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. The law enforcers and local people later found Topu and Jalal lying on the ground with bullet injuries. The injured outlaws were then taken to Atrai Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.description: An alleged regional leader of the Janajuddha faction of Purba Banglar Communist Party was killed in an encounter with the security forces at Nabdah area in Chuadanga District. The deceased was identified as Mozam Ali. Subsequently, the police recovered one pistol and three bullets from the incident site.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mirpur police assistant superintendent Alamgir Hossain said the police had gone to Bil Amla village at around 3:45 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of criminals had arranged a meeting there on the bank of the river Sagarkhali Mirpur. Sensing their presence, the gang opened fire at the police, and the police shot back, said Hossain. Two individuals were killed in the crossfire. The deceased men were identified as Jahangir Hossain, 30, and Yarul Islam, 28, from Kholishakundi village in Daulatpur Upazila.

data.name: Yarul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mirpur police assistant superintendent Alamgir Hossain said the police had gone to Bil Amla village at around 3:45 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of criminals had arranged a meeting there on the bank of the river Sagarkhali Mirpur. Sensing their presence, the gang opened fire at the police, and the police shot back, said Hossain. Two individuals were killed in the crossfire. The deceased men were identified as Jahangir Hossain, 30, and Yarul Islam, 28, from Kholishakundi village in Daulatpur Upazila.

data.name: Taiyab
data.description: A mugger was killed, and two people, including a woman, sustained bullet wounds in a shootout between the police and the muggers yesterday in the capital's Pallabi area. The deceased was identified as Taiyab, 35, while the injured were Kaniz Fatema Munni, 23, the wife of expatriate Helal Uddin of Tejkunipara of Tejgaon, and CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver Hafizur Rahman. Munni was rushed to Samarita Hospital with two bullets in the lower part of her body, while Hafizur was taken to Pangu Hospital for treatment. Officer-in-charge (OC) Abdul Malek of Pallabi Police Station said the gunfight ensued around 1:30 pm when a team of police, led by him, chased the gang in front of SKAMCO CNG filling station at Pallabi.

data.name: Roman
data.description: A suspected mugger was shot dead in a shootout with the police, following a scuffle in which a constable was stabbed and wounded, at Shayambazaar in the city on Thursday, according to the police. Sutrapur police chief Tofazzal Hossain told bdnews24.com that the deceased youth, Roman, 19, a resident of Postogola in Dhaka, died during "an exchange of fire" between the police and a gang who were attempting to rob a couple of traders at around 3 am. Babul, a greengrocer at Shyambazaar, told bdnews24.com that he was returning to his Faridabad home with his business partner Mamun in the early hours. "Three men stopped our rickshaw, threatened us with sharp weapons, and attempted to rob us," said Babul. Local police chief Hossain said, "A police van arrived, the policemen tried to apprehend the muggers, and a scuffle ensued during which a mugger stabbed police constable Abdul Ali and fled the scene." "The other two suspects then opened fire on the police as they tried to flee, and the police returned fire." "That was when Roman was shot. He died on the spot," said Hossain.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam Panku
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight with RAB after being arrested at Agargaon in the capital early on Wednesday. Assistant Police Commissioner Talebur Rahman told bdnews24.com that they had arrested Rafiqul Islam Panku, 32, at Banasree an hour before the gunfight. Panku informed them that he had firearms, and when the elite force went in front of Agargaon Music College at around 4 am to recover them, Panku's associates fired at them, he claimed. The gunfight lasted for "some time" before the criminals fled the scene. Panku was shot during the firefight and was taken to the National Institute for Traumatology, Orthopedics, and Rehabilitation, and later to Suhrawardy Hospital, where the doctors declared him dead. RAB also recovered one revolver, Rahman said. Earlier, another RAB team confronted a group of alleged muggers on Mohammadpur's Aurangzeb Road at around 3:30 am and fired at them when the muggers attempted to flee, leaving three injured.

data.name: Lutfar Rahman Gazi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional leader of a faction of the extremist outfit Purbo Bangla Communist Party was killed in a 'crossfire' on Wednesday when members of the police cornered him in central Satkhira. Police identified Lutfar Rahman Gazi, the leader of the Marxist-Leninist faction of the organization, as the deceased. He was from Shahapur village in Tala upazila. "Lutfar was hit by a bullet during the shootout, after which his accomplices fled the scene," said SM Kamruzzaman, officer-in-charge of Sadar Police Station, to bdnews24.com. Sub-inspector Ebad Ali and constables Aolad and Nazrul Islam were injured in the shootout, according to Kamruzzaman. A locally manufactured handgun and three rounds of bullets were recovered from the spot. A large number of people from Lutfar's home district arrived at Satkhira Police Station upon hearing the news of his death. Kamruzzaman stated that the deceased was declared dead at Satkhira Sadar Hospital shortly after the incident.

data.name: Naharul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged regional leader of the PBCP-Janajuddha, identified as Naharul Islam, was killed in an encounter with the police at Jagannathpur village in Kushtia District. After an hour-long encounter, the police recovered the dead body of Naharul along with one LG gun and 24 bullets from the incident site. However, the other militants managed to escape. Naharul was reportedly accused in at least 10 cases, including six murders, the police said.

data.name: Lalchand
data.description: He was reportedly killed in an encounter with a joint team of RAB and the police.

data.name: Mohammad Masud
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A suspected gangster was killed in a reported gun battle with RAB in Sutrapur, the capital, on Monday morning, said the police. Sub-inspector Monir Hossain of Shyampur Police Station said Mohammd Masud, also known as 'Bautta Masud', 26, faced at least four cases, including two for murder. He had more cases filed against him with other police stations in Dhaka, added Hossain. RAB-10 deputy director ASP ABM Enamul Kabir said that Masud had thrown a Molotov cocktail at a patrol vehicle of RAB-10 adjacent to Jurain graveyard at around 3:45 am. As RAB members challenged him, Masud opened fire and RAB retaliated, leaving him dead on the spot. The police retrieved a shutter gun, six rounds of .22 bore rifle bullets, and seven rounds of ammo. There was evidence and signs of a cocktail detonation, the sub-inspector said. At least 12 people have died in the last three months in the city in 'encounters' with RAB.

data.name: Atiqul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: According to the police, Atiqul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot during a gunfight between RAB-Police and members of the Bahini.

data.name: Shahinur Rahman Dablu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An extremist of the outlawed Gano Bahini (Lal) party was killed in a shootout with the police in Kushtia early Tuesday. Kushtia police superintendent Shahabuddin Khan said the deceased, 35-year-old Shahinur Rahman Dablu, was shot near Milpara crematorium. The police were tipped off that a group of armed militants was entering the town from Haripur village, Khan said. Kushtia Sadar police intercepted the gang near the crematorium at around 4 am. "The gang opened fire at the police and the police fired back." "At one point, Shahin was shot and died on the spot. Others fled the scene," said Khan.

data.name: Akhil
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Savar police chief A.K. Nasirullah told bdnews24.com that the two deceased individuals were identified as 'Akhil', 25, and 'Nayan', 22, both members of the local 'Gangchil' gang. The spokesperson for RAB-4 camp stated that, after receiving a tip-off, a contingent raided Abu Jahid's brickfield in the Dewanbarhi area by the Dhaka-Aricha highway at 2:30 am in order to apprehend some members of a violent criminal gang. The RAB retaliated when they were fired upon, according to the spokesperson. Sepoy Mizanuddin also sustained a bullet wound during the 10-15 minutes of exchange, after which the criminals fled. The elite force discovered two men with bullet wounds at the scene and transported them to Savar Hospital Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Rahat Khan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Khulna, the now defunct Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Lal Pataka) regional leader 'Rahat' (identified by The Daily Star as Rahat Khan), also known as Nipu and Zia, was killed in a 'crossfire.' Khulna police superintendent Mohammed Shamsuddin informed bdnews24.com that, based on information, Aichgati police under Rupsha upazila conducted a raid on a secret meeting location at Dearha Agradoot School grounds. The alleged criminals opened fire, and the police retaliated, resulting in the militants eventually escaping. The police took the injured 'Rahat' to Khulna Medical College Hospital, but he was pronounced dead upon arrival, according to Shamsuddin. Rahat was wanted in at least six murder and robbery cases filed with Khulna police stations. The police recovered a gun, four rounds of ammunition, and leaflets from the meeting spot.

data.name: Sumon Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Kushtia Sadar police chief AKM Farukh Hossain told bdnews24.com early on Thursday that at 10:45 pm, a gang of alleged gangsters fired at a contingent of detective police patrolling the East Mazampur area of the town. Reinforcements from the police station were rushed to the scene where the shooting continued for at least half an hour. The alleged criminals fled the scene in the face of heavy gunfire, Hossain added. Police found the bullet-riddled corpse of 'Sumon', 28. 'Sohel', 26, another alleged miscreant who was critically injured, died when taken to the hospital. Sohel was identified as the son of 'Majnu' and Sumon as the son of Kajem Mistri, residents of East Mazampur. Police recovered a gun and five rounds of ammunition from the spot, the police officer said. Police claimed that both were notorious gangsters and drug peddlers.
