data.name: Babul Joaddar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A suspected extremist was killed in a "crossfire" incident with RAB and police early on Saturday, against the backdrop of deteriorating law and order in the district, according to law enforcement officials. The shooting on Saturday resulted in the death of 38-year-old Babul Joaddar, also known locally as Babul Member. Police stated that he was the local leader of the outlawed extremist group Gono Bahini. The incident occurred near a beel, or water body, in Bamon village near the Islami University in Kushtia's Sadar Upazila, as reported by local police chief Motiar Rahman. A team of RAB 12 and police went to the beel, which was adjacent to the Bittipara-Patikabari road, at around 4 am following a tip-off about a meeting of the outlawed group taking place there, Rahman informed bdnews24.com. "The suspects opened fire; RAB and police retaliated. The extremists managed to escape the scene, and police discovered Babul's dead body at the location," Rahman stated. He also mentioned that a firearm and nine rounds of ammunition were found at the spot. "Babul was the main associate of Gono Bahini's leader, Ajibor Rahman," the police officer added. The body was sent to Kushtia Sadar Hospital for a post-mortem examination.

data.name: Ahsan Kabir Hasan
data.description: Ahsan Kabir Hasan and Mizanur Rahman were reportedly arrested in Dhaka on September 2 and were taken to Jessore. According to RAB, a clash occurred when the law enforcers went to Jessore with the two brothers to retrieve firearms based on their confession. As soon as the RAB and Jessore police arrived at the location, the accomplices of the detainees opened fire at the law enforcers, compelling them to retaliate. Ahsan and Mizanur were caught in the crossfire while attempting to flee and died on the spot.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman
data.description: Ahsan Kabir Hasan and Mizanur Rahman were reportedly arrested in Dhaka on September 2 and were taken to Jessore. According to RAB, a clash occurred when the law enforcers went to Jessore with the two brothers to retrieve firearms based on their confession. As soon as the RAB and Jessore police arrived at the location, the accomplices of the detainees opened fire at the law enforcers, compelling them to retaliate. Ahsan and Mizanur were caught in the crossfire while attempting to flee and died on the spot.

data.name: Arifur Alam Akkas
data.description: A 42-year-old suspect, identified as 'Akkas' or Arifur Alam Akkas by The Daily Star, was killed in an encounter with RAB at 3 am in front of the Hatiadanga Community Clinic in Koyra upazila, said Khulna police. Khulna Police Superintendent Md Shamsuddin told bdnews24.com that Akkas was arrested Friday evening at the city's Khalishpur Housing Estate. Police and RAB launched a joint operation to recover arms from a gang in Koyra early Saturday, taking Akkas with them as he had information about the suspects, said Shamsuddin. "The gang, who were gathered near the Hatiadanga clinic, opened fire at the police. RAB and police had to respond with fire." He said Akkas took a bullet when he tried to escape during the operation.

data.name: Murad Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Kushtia, a 32-year-old man named Murad Hossain Bhola, who was suspected to be an activist of the outlawed Gano Bahini party, was shot dead in Kumarkhali upazila. The chief of Kumarkhali police, Liakat Hossain, stated that law enforcement officers went to Child Heaven Kindergarten School at 3:30 am after receiving a tip-off about a group of armed men gathering there. The criminals opened fire on the police, who retaliated, according to Hossain. After being shot, Murad fled the scene. He was taken to Kumarkhali upazila health complex, where the attending doctors pronounced him dead, Hossain added. The body was then transferred to the morgue at Kushtia General Hospital.

data.name: Hasan Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Forty-year-old Hasan Koshai, identified by The Daily Star as Hasan Ali, a regional leader of the Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML Janajuddha) and a fugitive wanted in at least a dozen cases, was shot dead in a raid at Ataikula upazil, according to Pabna police superintendent Nibash Chandra Majhi. Majhi said the police went to Shimulchara Primary School at around 1 am on information that PBCP activists were holding a clandestine meeting there. The suspects opened fire at the police, forcing the law enforcers to fire back, Majhi said. Hasan was shot dead during the hour-long gun battle, said the police superintendent.

data.name: Abdul Hannan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mirpur at about 4:00 am. The operatives of the outlawed party were holding a meeting there. The party members opened fire on the police when they were asked to surrender, the police said. As the police retaliated, a gunfight ensued that left Abdul Hannan, also known as Hanu, 36, of Ambaria village, dead. However, his accomplices managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Tofazzal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Faridpur, a detective team of Rab came across a gang of robbers at Haat Krishnapur at about 3:30 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang took shelter in Krishnapur Primary School and opened fire on Rab personnel, prompting them to retaliate. After the incident, the body of Tofazzal Hossain, also known as Topu Khan, 40, from Jatra Bari village of Krishnapur union, was sent to Faridpur Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Ashraful Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: He was allegedly killed in the crossfire during a gunfight between RAB and miscreants.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged top outlaw was killed early on Wednesday in a reported shootout with RAB in Mirpur Upazila in Kushtia. Anwar Hossain, 37, son of Aman Malitha from Gachherdiar of Doulatpur upazila, was arrested by the intelligence squad of RAB in Dhaka on Tuesday evening, RAB-12 Kushtia unit squad commander Flight Lieutenant Nazrul Islam said. Anwar was a top leader of the banned Purbo Bangla Communist Party (ML-Janajuddho) in the Kushtia region, he said. Islam said that, acting on the information provided by Anwar, the RAB detectives and a RAB-12 Kushtia contingent set out to retrieve cached arms, taking the arrestee along with them. At around 6:30 am, a group of alleged outlaws ambushed the arms-hunting law enforcers in Mahdipur and a gun battle ensued. Anwar was shot and died when he tried to flee during the gunfight. The outlaws also escaped.

data.name: Kaiser Mahmud Bappi
data.description: According to RAB, on September 9, 2009, a team of officers led by Flight Lieutenant Raihan Asgar Khan conducted a raid at the construction site of an apartment block called Aftab Tower in Dhaka. According to Major Mohammad Sakhawat Hossain, then deputy director of the Legal and Media wing at RAB headquarters, RAB-1 had received specific information that a wanted criminal called Kamrul Islam Bappi was plotting a major crime at the spot. He claimed that criminals opened fire when the RAB team entered the building, and the team fired back in self-defense. After the shooting ended, RAB discovered a body, which they identified as Kamrul Islam. The deceased's family disputed the RAB claim, saying the victim's name was Kaiser Mahmud, and not Kamrul Islam. Kaiser, 24, also had the common nickname of "Bappi". An autopsy conducted on September 11, 2009, identified the deceased as Kamruzzaman Bappi instead of Kaiser Mahmud or even Kamrul Islam. Later, a probe committee formed by the Home Ministry found that Bappi did not die in crossfire, as reported to the media by RAB. The probe report refuted most of the other claims made by RAB. It concluded that it was evident that Kaiser Mahmud was wrongfully killed by RAB due to a mistake.

data.name: Sohel Ahmed Tokan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Another militant outlaw was killed in an alleged shootout with the police and RAB early on Thursday in Kushtia, bringing the total number of deaths to eight in the last two weeks. Doulatpur police chief Hassan Hafizur Rahman said the deceased, 30-year-old Sohel Ahmed Tokan, a resident of Khalishakundi of Doulatdia upazila, was an operative of the outlawed Ganomukti Fauz. Acting on a tip-off that a group of criminals was holding a secret meeting at the garden of Abdul Haque, a resident of Mistiripara of the Upazila, a team of RAB-12 stormed the spot, Rahman said. A gunfight ensued and at one stage, Sohel died on the spot.

data.name: Nasim
data.description: In Mymensingh, one 'Nasim', the ringleader of the notorious 'Nasim group', was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Nasim was identified as the son of Abdul Kader Matu from Balashpur. Major Sheikh Amin, RAB company commander, said the elite force raided Nasim's meeting place in Kewatkhali railway colony on Thursday evening and apprehended the gang leader, although his associates fled. At the RAB local office, after some questioning, Nasim provided information about an arms cache, and then the law enforcers began a search with Nasim accompanying them. As they approached Maurakhola at Kewatkhali, Nasim's cohorts opened fire at them. RAB retaliated, and the fight continued for about 15 minutes. Nasim was killed while everyone else escaped, and RAB recovered an LG, a pipegun, a round of ammunition, five ramdas (long-bladed machetes with long wooden handles), and a king-sized knife.

data.name: Ziko Parvez Samrat
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Kushtia Sadar police chief SM Faruque Hossain said that acting on a tip-off, RAB-12 and Kushtia Sadar police jointly conducted a raid in Bhadalia at 4 am. The alleged terrorists holding a rendezvous there opened fire on the intruding law enforcers. They fired back, and a gun battle ensued. Ziko Parvez, also known as Samrat, 32, son of the late Abdul Aziz of Baliaparha in Kushtia, died during the gunfight, but his cohorts fled the scene. Police retrieved a rifle, a shotgun, and four rounds of ammunition from the grounds. Samrat's body has been sent for autopsy. Faruque said the deceased was a member of the banned extremist outfit Gano Muktifouj.

data.name: Shahar Ali
data.description: Thirty-five-year-old Shahar Ali was shot dead in an encounter with the Rapid Action Battalion in front of the Dhaka City Corporation zonal office near Mirpur-10 roundabout shortly after 1 am, according to RAB-4 director Maj. Golam Sarwar. Law enforcement officials said Ali was a top criminal in the Mirpur area of the capital, who had previously evaded arrest by going abroad. "When we went to detain him in front of the Dhaka City Corporation zonal office last night, he opened fire on us," said Sarwar. The elite force fired back, and during the shootout, Shahar Ali was shot and killed, the RAB official said.

data.name: Faruk Khan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Khulna, meanwhile, Faruk Khan, identified by the police as a leader of a local pirate gang, was killed during a shootout with the police at Baroikhali village in Dakop Upazila at around 2:30 am. Khulna police superintendent Md Shamsuddin told bdnews24.com that a group of men opened fire on a police patrol from a room adjacent to Baraikhali pier, forcing them to fire back. The gang fled the scene after a half-hour gun battle. Police recovered Faruk's body, a shotgun, a pipe gun, and four rounds of ammunition from the site.

data.name: Marfat Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A police team from Sadar Upazila conducted a raid in Ailchara village at around 3:30 am when some Gono Bahini cadres, led by Marfat Hossain (identified as Gono Bahini leader Marfat Hossain, 40, son of Ishaq Biswas of Ailchara in Sadar Upazila), were holding a meeting beneath the Ailchara Bara Bridge. The police cordoned off the area and asked the outlaws to surrender, but the operatives opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. The body of Marfat was found on the spot after his accomplices had escaped. Police recovered a shotgun and eight bullets from the scene.

data.name: Biplob
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Biplob, a member of GMF, was taking care of the weapons in the hideout. He was killed in a police "crossfire" on September 13th last year.

data.name: Abu Bakkar Roni
data.description: They are Abu Bakkar Roni, also known as Lal Roni, 25, an accomplice of top terrorist Imon, and Samir Uddin, 38, a commander of the outlawed Gono Bahini. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Rab conducted a raid in the Mohammadpur area to apprehend the criminals. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire on the Rab personnel in front of Chandrima Real Estate at around 1:30 am. A gunfight ensued as the team retaliated. After the incident, Roni was found dead on the spot while his cohorts managed to escape the scene.

data.name: Samir Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An outlawed extremist was killed early on Monday in an alleged shootout with the police in Padmanagar village of Kushtia Sadar upazila. Kushtia assistant police superintendent, Alamgir Hossain, said 35-year-old Samir Uddin, a resident of Mohishadanga village, was a military operative of the outlawed JSD Gana Bahini. Being tipped off that a group of armed militants was holding a clandestine meeting beside a canal in Padmanagar village under Islamic University Police Station, the police launched a drive shortly after 4 am, Hossain said. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back, triggering a gunfight. At one stage of the 20-minute shootout, Samir Uddin was shot and killed. His associates fled the scene.

data.name: Babul Sarder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A so-called 'Sarbahara' extremist leader was killed early on Tuesday in Barisal in an alleged gun battle with the police and RAB. Police said Babul Sardar, 35, a regional leader of the 'Sarbahara Zia group' and a top terror suspect wanted by the police, died at Batajore crematorium quay under Gournadi police station. A light gun, a shotgun, a revolver, and seven rounds of ammunition were recovered from the spot. According to an RAB press release issued on Tuesday, a joint RAB-police patrol sensed the presence of a group of people at the crematorium and challenged them. The suspects suddenly started running and opened fire too when the law enforcers ordered them to stop. The law enforcers retaliated, and a gunfire exchange of 15-20 minutes ensued. The criminals at one point stopped shooting and fled, leaving Babul's dead body behind.

data.name: Masubor Haldar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A person named Masubor Haldar (40) was killed in a gunfight with the police in Khulna's Dumuria last Wednesday. He was identified as a leader of the New Revolutionary Communist Party. The officer-in-charge of Dumuria Police Station, Foukul Kabir, said the police engaged with terrorists after receiving news of a secret meeting. Following a 20-minute gunfight, Masubor was found injured and later pronounced dead at Dumuria Upazila Health Complex. A family member reported that Masubor was forcibly taken away by several individuals the previous evening.

data.name: Arabinda Mandol
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A local BNP leader was found dead early yesterday on a road in Doba village, under Rupsha upazila of the district. The deceased has been identified as Arabinda Mandol, 45, the general secretary of the Ghatbhog union unit of BNP in the upazila. Nilima Mandol, the wife of Arabinda, alleged that the police beat him to death after chasing him for about half a kilometer from his residence. Subhash Chandra Biswas, the officer-in-charge of Rupsha Police Station, said that Arabinda died of cardiac arrest while fleeing his home to escape arrest. The police said that a team of law enforcers, led by Sub-Inspector Azad Rahman, went to the house of Arabinda, who was accused in a case filed in 2008, to arrest him early yesterday.

data.name: Mohammad Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An alleged gangster from Mirpur, the capital, was killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB early on Friday. RAB stated that Mohammad Ali, 30, a member of the notorious 'Shahar Ali group', died in the shootout. The incident occurred at 2:45 am in the grounds of Mirpur outer stadium. Commander Abul Kalam Azad, director of RAB media and legal wing, told bdnews24.com that Shahar Ali, the leader of the gang, died in another 'shootout' on September 12. In an attempt to apprehend Shahar's accomplices on September 13, RAB-4 member Major Sarwar sustained injuries. This incident further strengthened RAB's efforts to capture the criminals, he said. A RAB-4 contingent raided the grounds of Mirpur outer stadium early on Friday after receiving information that some gang members were having a meeting there. The criminals opened fire at the law enforcers, and a gun battle ensued. Ali was shot and fell to the ground during the exchange, but all his associates fled the scene. He was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the doctor declared him dead, said Azad.

data.name: Shukkur Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of a banned extremist party was reportedly killed in a shootout with the police in Ataikula, Pabna, on Saturday. Special Branch officer Kafil Uddin said 35-year-old Shukkur Ali, of Khakharipara village in Ataipara, was the regional leader of the outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party (ML-Janajuddha). Kafil said the police launched an operation based on a tip-off that the Janajuddha operatives were holding a secret meeting at Nandanpur intersection in Ataikula at around 1 am. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to fire back, he said. At one stage of the half-hour exchange, Shukkur was shot dead, and his associates fled the scene, Kafil said. The police recovered one firearm and three rounds of ammunition from the spot, he said.

data.name: Amzad Hossain
data.identity: Member of the erstwhile Bangladesh Rifles
data.description: The BDR Authority claimed that Amzad died of a brain hemorrhage. However, a relative said he was interrogated after the BDR mutiny and severely tortured, which might have caused his death.

data.name: Rashedul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Top extremist Rashedul Islam was killed in a so-called gun battle with the police early on Wednesday in north Lahini, in the suburbs of Kushtia. Rashed, the chief of the 'Rashedul Legion of Kushtia,' was identified as the son of the late Rustam Ali of Mill Line Bhataparha in Kushtia Sadar. Kushtia Sadar police chief AKM Faruque Hossain said that acting on a tip-off that a gang of terrorists had assembled in a secret rendezvous in Taltala ground of North Lahini early on Wednesday, a RAB-12 contingent and Kushtia Sadar police raided the spot. The miscreants opened fire at them, and the law enforcers retaliated, he added. As Rashedul was downed during the 50-round exchange of fire, the terrorists fled the scene. Police retrieved a shotgun and three rounds of ammunition from there, Hossain said. Rashedul's body was sent for autopsy.

data.name: Tabibur Rahman Tota
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The dead was Tabibur Rahman, also known as Tota, from Harishpur village under Shalikha upazila in Magura. In Magura, Tota, a regional leader of the outlawed Sarbahara Party, was shot dead at Harishpur. Police said a joint team of the Rapid Action Battalion and police raided a jute field in the area where Tota and his cohorts were holding a secret meeting around 2:00 am. Tota opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. The gang members managed to flee the spot.

data.name: Aslam Byapari
data.description: An individual named Aslam Byapari (35) died yesterday in Faridpur Jail. His home is in the Haveli Gopalpur area of the city. Jail Superintendent Md. Badruddoja stated that Aslam was taken to Faridpur General Hospital after suffering from a heart attack around 9 am yesterday. He died around 2 pm. The hospital's on-duty physician, Shahana Parvin, confirmed that the death was due to a heart attack. However, Aslam's mother, Johora Begum, alleges that her son was tortured in custody and then taken to the hospital after being killed.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A man died in RAB custody in Dhaka on Friday. Additionally, three alleged robbers were shot by the elite force at the Mohammadpur Housing Estate playground early in the day. Abul Kalam Azad, 40, was declared dead by the duty doctor when he was brought to Dhaka Medical College Hospital by members of RAB-1 in the morning. Doctors at the DMCH noted marks of injuries on his body. "Abul Kalam Azad was arrested during the anti-narcotics campaign of RAB-1. He is an addict and had been ill previously," said Abul Kalam Azad, director of the Legal and Media Wing of RAB. When asked about the cause of death, RAB officials stated that nothing can be determined without the autopsy report. In the other incident, a patrol team of RAB, which had received a tip-off, raided the playground at Humayun Road at around 12:30 am on Friday, according to RAB official Azad. "The robbers started firing upon sensing the presence of RAB, and RAB retaliated. Later, the three were arrested with bullet wounds," he said.

data.name: Yad Ali Idu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two more people were killed in an alleged gunfight in Kushtia amid law and order enforcement operations to quell extremists. The deceased were identified as Yad Ali Idu (38) and Araj Ali (33) in the early hours of Friday. According to the police, Idu was a regional leader of the Revolutionary Communist Party, and Araj was a member of Gana Mukti Fauz.

data.name: Araj Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two more people were killed in an alleged gunfight in Kushtia amid law and order enforcement operations to quell extremists. The deceased were identified as Yad Ali Idu (38) and Araj Ali (33) in the early hours of Friday. According to the police, Idu was a regional leader of the Revolutionary Communist Party, and Araj was a member of Gana Mukti Fauz.

data.name: Obaidullah
data.description: He was arrested as an accused in a case filed in connection with the death of a CID constable who was injured in a land-related clash and later died in the hospital. However, Obaidullah's family alleged that he was tortured in custody, which caused his death.

data.name: Pathan Johnny
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An alleged gangster was killed in a so-called "gun battle" with the police in Dhaka's Mirpur early on Saturday. "Johnny" alias "Pathan Johnny", 28, was a member of the "Bikash terror gang", the police claimed. Al Amin, 30, an associate of the slain gangster, was arrested, while two others escaped. Mirpur police chief Mohammad Zakir Hossain told bdnews24.com that the criminals were roaming Kallyanpur in a white private car. Police asked them to stop, but they turned back. Police chased and stopped them at Balur Math (playground) but were greeted with bullets. The law enforcers also retaliated, and Johnny was killed on the spot.

data.name: Mahan Malitha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mohon (identified as Mahan Malitha by Prothom Alo), 42, a member of the banned Purbo Bangla Communist Party (ML) 'red flag', was the 19th victim of the ongoing crackdown against outlawed extremists in the country's south and southwestern districts. Squad commander of RAB-12 Kushtia unit, Flight Lt Nazrul Islam, said, "Acting on a tip-off that a gang of terrorists had assembled for a secret meeting near Trimohoni Bazar in Lalnagar village under Doulatpur Upazila, a RAB contingent raided the spot at around 3:15 am. "The miscreants opened fire on RAB and police forces, and the law enforcers retaliated, resulting in a gun battle," he said. Mohon's body was found after the gun battle, while his accomplices fled from the scene, Islam added. The officer said police retrieved a pipe gun, four rounds of ammunition, three hand bombs, and two local weapons from the spot. Officer-in-charge of Doulatpur Police Station, Hassan Hafizur Rahman, said Mohon faced five murder cases filed against him with Doulatpur and Bheramara Police Stations.

data.name: Fasiar Rahman Shanu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Police said Fasiar Rahman Shanu, 42, was wounded by a bullet during the firefight with them near Nandabala canal in the Chandpai range of the eastern division of the Sundarbans. Shanu was rushed to Mongla Hospital, but doctors declared him dead. Kazi Jalal Uddin Ahmed, officer-in-charge of Mongla Police Station, said they chased a group of five or six dacoits in the area based on information that they were preparing for a robbery. However, the suspected robbers, led by Shanu, opened fire at them upon sensing their presence. The security officials retaliated, and after nearly half an hour of fighting, they discovered Shanu's bullet-wounded body near the canal.

data.name: Sanjit Kumar Biswas
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A young man wanted on charges of murder was killed in an alleged shootout with the RAB and police in Faridpur early on Friday. Faridpur Kotwali police chief Noorey Alam Siddiqui claimed that Sanjit Kumar Biswas, 32, from Munshibazaar of Faridpur town, was wanted in more than one murder case. The dead body was recovered after the gunfight from in front of a house under construction beside the sugarcane purchase depot at Komarpur by the Faridpur-Dhaka highway. A RAB-8 Faridpur camp press release said that they were tipped off about an alleged band of gangsters holding a clandestine meeting in an unfinished house at Komarpur. RAB and police personnel cordoned off the place. The inmates opened fire at the intruders, and the law-enforcers retaliated, sparking a gun battle. After 25-30 minutes, the miscreants fled the scene, leaving the dead body of Sanjit there.

data.name: Kamidul Islam Zahid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An extremist cadre named Kamidul Islam, also known as Zahid (45), was killed in an alleged gunfight with the police on Sunday night in the field of Juranpur village in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga. He was the regional commander of the Communist Party of East Bengal (ML Red Flag). Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Damurhuda Police Station, Moshiur Rahman, said that a group of extremists was holding a secret meeting in the field of Juranpur village late on Sunday night. Sensing their presence, the extremists fired at the police. The police also fired back. A gun battle ensued between the two sides for 20-25 minutes. After the extremists fled, the police recovered Kamidul's body.

data.name: Asha Ghosh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Asha, also known as Daku Asha (38), identified by The Daily Star as Asha Ghosh, was killed in the early hours of Wednesday. Police have confirmed that she was a member of Panna Bahini, a terrorist group operating in the Padma River area. In relation to this incident, there have been at least 21 deaths in alleged gunfights with RAB and police in Kushtia over the past month and a half. Major Zakir Ahmed, an officer from RAB-12 Kushtia unit, informed bdnews24.com that a team of RAB conducted a raid in response to information about an armed terrorist meeting on the embankment of Faizullahpur village. When they arrived at the scene around 4:30 am, the terrorists opened fire and the RAB members retaliated. RAB official Nazrul stated that Asha's body was discovered at the location after the extremists fled following approximately thirty minutes of gunfire.

data.name: Reazul Haque Masud
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged militant was killed in a "gun battle" with the joint force of RAB and police in Bagerhat early on Thursday amid the ongoing clampdown on extremist elements in the southwestern region. Reazul Haque Masud, 32, was a member of the banned Purbo Banglar Communist Party, police said. Bagerhat police superintendent Mohammed Mizanur Rahman said that, acting on a tip-off, a police and RAB contingent had gone to raid a bamboo garden, a suspected militants' hangout in Chulkathhi under Khanpur union at around 3 am. "The militants assembled there opened fire at the law enforcers and a gun battle ensued between the two parties. At one point, the militants withdrew and a bullet-hit Masud was found there," said the district police chief. After Masud was taken to Bagerhat Sadar Hospital, the doctors declared him dead, he added.

data.name: Jane Alam Sohel
data.description: Sutrapur police chief Tofazzal Hossain told bdnews24.com that they had detained Jane Alam Sohel on Monday night. "We took Sohel to Dholaikhal Truck Terminal at around 5:15 am to recover arms. As we arrived, his associates fired guns at us," he said. "We retaliated, and Sohel died during the gun battle," the police official said. Sohel was an associate of 'Dakat' ('Robber') Shahid, he added. Police recovered one firearm and two rounds of bullets from the scene.

data.name: Mohammad Saijuddin Saju
data.description: RAB-10 Operations Officer ABM Enamul Kabir said that they received a tip-off about a group of criminals gathering in a field near Namapara slum, which is adjacent to Regal CNG Station in Jatrabari. They immediately went to the location at around 3 am. Upon sensing their presence, the criminals started firing, which led the elite force to retaliate, Kabir explained. During the gunfight, Mohammed Saijuddin, also known as Saju, was killed. Kabir mentioned that Saju had been involved in 13 criminal cases.

data.name: Picchi Abul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Abul Kalam Azad, the director of the legal and media wing of RAB headquarters, stated that two teams from RAB-4 and RAB HQ's detective wing conducted an operation in Mirpur's Paikpara at around 6 am to apprehend criminals. Azad mentioned that 'Pichchi' Abul, a member of the Shahdat gang, was killed during the shootout. RAB seized one revolver and five rounds of ammunition from the scene. The authorities reported that the three bodies are currently being held at the morgue of Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Korban Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Korban Ali was killed in a shootout between the police and his cohorts at Ghoshbila village in Alamdanga upazila, as reported by our Kushtia correspondent. Korban hailed from Binodpur under Alamdanga upazila and was a close associate of Gono Mukti Fouz leader Tagar. Tagar had escaped from Chuadanga jail on May 15, 2008, but was killed in a crossfire with Rab on May 22 of the same year. Upon receiving information, a team of Alamdanga police cordoned off Ghosbila field around 2:30 am and asked the outlaws, who were holding a meeting, to surrender. However, they defied the police and opened fire, forcing the police to retaliate. Korban was killed during the gunfight, while his accomplices managed to flee.

data.name: Lavlu Byapari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The deceased man, 34-year-old Lavlu Byapari, was a member of the extremist outfit Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Janajuddha-ML), according to a statement by RAB. Flt Lt Moinul Alam, the commander of RAB-8 Faridpur camp, informed bdnews24.com that patrol teams from the elite force and the police cordoned off Jashim Mancha at Ambikapur around 4 am based on a tip-off about a gathering of extremists. The criminals opened fire, and the law enforcers retaliated, resulting in Lavlu's death during the shootout. Alam also mentioned that three firearms and seven cartridges were recovered from the scene. Noor-e-Alam Siddiqui, the chief of Kotwali police, stated that Lavlu had 17 cases against him and was a fugitive lifetime convict in a case filed under the Explosives Act.

data.name: Hedayetullah Julhas
data.description: 28-year-old Hedayetullah Julhas, also known as Julu, was killed in the capital's Hajaribagh area. Talebur Rahman, the operation officer of RAB-2, told bdnews24.com that they received a tip-off about a group of criminals gathering near Ali CNG Filling Station, close to Hajaribagh dam. In response, a team from the elite force went to the scene. Upon their arrival, the criminals opened fire, prompting the elite force to retaliate, Rahman explained. During the exchange, the criminals managed to escape, leaving Julu with gunshot wounds. He was immediately taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the attending doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Sunnat Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A 35-year-old man named Sunnat Ali died in Kushtia Sadar Upazila. Kushtia Assistant Police Superintendent Sadar Circle CA Halim said that they received a tip-off about a group of extremists holding a secret meeting near the Steel Bridge of Ujan village. As a result, a police team raided the location at around 6 am. Upon sensing the arrival of the police, the criminals fired shots, forcing the police to retaliate. During the 20-minute shootout, Sunnat Ali sustained bullet wounds and later died. His associates managed to escape from the scene. The police recovered one light gun and five rounds of bullets from the area, according to Ali. The police superintendent stated that there were six cases against Sunnat Ali, who was the second in command of JSD Gano Bahini.

data.name: Moktar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: 30-year-old Mokhter Hossain was killed in Pabna Sadar Upazila. RAB-12 Pabna Camp Deputy Commander Flight Lieutenant Ahmed Faisal said they had gone to Kachhipara of Chartara Union at around 1:15 am on a tip-off that some operatives of the extremist Sarbahara Party were holding a secret meeting there. As the criminals sensed the presence of law enforcers, they opened fire, to which the elite force retaliated, he said. During the 30-minute shootout, Mokhter died on the spot, the official said. RAB recovered one locally-made pistol, three rounds of ammunition, and one big dagger from the scene. Mokhter, a regional leader of the Sarbahara Party, faced at least eight cases, including three murder cases, Faisal said.

data.name: Sakmal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: bdnews24.com Kushtia correspondent said that a 37-year-old man named Sakmal was killed in a gunfight with RAB and police at Bhadalia village of Sadar Upazila. Police stated that Sakmal Hossain, from Kushtia, was an extremist. Kushtia Sadar police chief AKM Faruk mentioned that Sakmal, from Baria village of the Sadar Upazila, was a regional leader of the outlawed extremist group Gano Muktifouj party. Faruk added that a joint team of RAB and police went to Bhadalia village based on a tip-off that the extremists were gathering there. The criminals and the law enforcers engaged in a shootout, resulting in Sakmal's death on the spot.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Apu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Police said Delwar Hossain Apu from Kushtia's Khulna was a criminal. He was killed in a gunfight with the police in Khulna. Delwar, a 28-year-old resident of Rajapur village in Rupsa upazila, was involved in six cases, including three murder cases, according to Khulna police superintendent Md Shamsuddin. The gunfight occurred at Sreephaltala ground in Rupsa, as stated by Rupsa police chief Subhash Chandra Biswas.

data.name: Alam Khan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Police said Alam Khan from Bagerhat was a criminal. The Bagerhat correspondent for bdnews24.com stated that 35-year-old Alam, who was the president of the Teleganti union's Jubo League, was killed in another gunfight with the police in Doibagyahati Union under Morelganj upazila. Ershadul Kabir Chowdhury, the police chief of Morelganj, stated that they had recovered a locally-made pipe gun and a large amount of ammunition from the scene. Police stated that Alam Khan, a registered criminal, was involved in at least 10 cases, including murder and extortion.

data.name: Smarjit Ghosh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A suspected extremist leader was killed in a gunfight with the police in Jhenaidah early on Sunday. Police identified the man as Smarjit Ghosh, 45, a central leader of the Bangladesh Biplabi Communist Party. Jhenaidah police superintendent Md Rezaul Karim said they received a tip-off that a group of extremists was holding a secret meeting at Depholbaria village under Sadar Upazila and raided the spot at around 2 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the suspects opened fire at the police, forcing them to retaliate in self-defense, he said. During the shootout, which lasted about 20 minutes, the other suspects fled the scene. Police recovered Smarjit's body and one light gun, four rounds of ammunition, and two handmade bombs from the spot, Karim said.

data.name: Amirul Islam Khan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Kushtia Sadar Circle Assistant Superintendent of Police, C.A. Halim, said that a 36-year-old man named Amirul Islam, also known as Amir Khan, was a leader of the military branch of the extremist Gano Bahini (Lal) party. Acting on a tip-off that the extremists were gathering at Bittipara village in Sadar upazila, the police team went there at around 5 am and engaged in a gunfight with the criminals, he said. Amir died during the gun battle, and his body was sent to the morgue at Kushtia General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Nirapad Bairagi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Khulna, the Dumuria police chief, Md Fauzul Kabir, told bdnews24.com that Nirapad Bairagi was an operative of the extremist New Biplobi Communist Party. A police team launched a raid at Ranai village at around 2:30 am after receiving a tip-off that a group of extremists were holding a secret meeting there, he said. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals fired shots at them, and the police retaliated. The criminals fled the scene, leaving Bairagi wounded. Bairagi was taken to the Dumuria upazila health center, where the attending doctors declared him dead, Kabir said.

data.name: Manju Mandal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mirpur police chief Sheikh Anwar Hossain said that a 45-year-old man named Manju Mandal from Char Mandalpara village in Sadarpur union was a top leader of the extremist Biplobi Communist Party in the Kushtia region and a wanted criminal. Acting on a tip-off that a suspect group was gathering beside a graveyard in Barbaria village of the upazila, the police went to the spot at around 4:30 am and became involved in a shootout with the gang, Hossain said. At one stage, Majnu was shot and killed on the spot, and his criminal associates fled, said the police chief.

data.name: Lilu Miah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An inmate of the Habiganj District Jail has allegedly been tortured to death. Deputy jailor Md Asad, however, said Lilu Miah fell sick on Saturday evening. He was rushed to the district modern hospital where the doctors declared him dead. It was a case of sudden death, he claimed. Contacted, the resident medical officer, Devapada Roy, said Lilu had died well before he was taken to the hospital. Besides, the body bore marks of injury, he admitted. After the post-mortem, an inquest report was prepared yesterday afternoon in the presence of executive magistrate MA Mahmudur Rahman at the district hospital. The victim's brother, Bachchu Miah, alleged that the body bore marks of injuries. "My brother was tortured to death. We shall file a case," he told newsmen yesterday while receiving the body at the hospital. Sub-Inspector Manoj Kanti Roy of Bahubal police station quizzed Lilu Miah for hours at the jail gate until Saturday evening in connection with a robbery case, the deputy jailor said.

data.name: Ajbahar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A suspected extremist was killed in an encounter with the police in Kumarkhali upazila, Kushtia on Monday. The police said that a 42-year-old man named Ajbahar, also known as Bahar, was a commander of an outlawed extremist group called Gano Muktifouj. In the past one and a half months, 26 people have been killed in gunfights with law enforcement in the district. CA Halim, the assistant superintendent of police in the Kushtia general circle, told bdnews24.com that acting on a tip-off about a secret meeting of the group at the Koya College ground in Koya village under Kunarkhali upazila, a joint team of detectives and police raided the location at around 4:30 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement officers, the criminals fired shots, forcing the police team to retaliate, claimed Halim. He said that Bahar was shot dead during the shootout.

data.name: Farid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Farid, 42, son of Razzak Mondol from Ajail of Khoksha Upazila, was the regional leader of the banned Gono Mukti Fauj and an assistant superintendent of police (ASP) at Kushtia Sadar Circle, according to CA Halim. A team from RAB-12, Kushtia unit, and another from Khuksha Police Station raided a brick kiln owned by Duru Miah at Shomspur at around 10:30 pm, where a group of criminals were meeting, he said. The criminals fired at them, and a gunfight ensued, Halim said. The extremists later escaped the scene. Farid was caught in the crossfire and died on the spot, he said.

data.name: Jinnah Chowdhury
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Bdnews24.com reporter Golam Maturza said that a suspected terrorist was killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB early Friday morning in Dholaikhal of the capital. The deceased's name is Jinnah Chowdhury, also known as Ratul (30). His father's name is Baba Amin Chowdhury. He hails from Kafrul, Dhaka. RAB Legal and Media Wing Director Abul Kalam Azad told bdnews24.com that a terrorist was killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB in the Dholaikhal area around 4 am. Arms and ammunition have been recovered from the spot. Sub-Inspector (SI) of Sutrapur police station, Abu Taher, told bdnews24.com that Jinnah's body was found under a banyan tree on the west bank of the C&B pond in Dholaikhal after receiving information from RAB. At first, his identity was not found. His identity was confirmed after he was brought to the Mitford Hospital morgue. He said that there were eight bullet marks on the victim's body: one on the head, two on the chest, two on the ear, one on the back, one on the hand, and one on the elbow.

data.name: Kala Badsha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Abu Nacher Manju, the Noakhali correspondent of bdnews24.com, reported that a person named Kala Badsha (45) was killed in a 'gunfight' in Caringchar of Hatia upazila. His house is in Hatia. Noakhali Superintendent of Police, Harunur Rashid Hazari, told bdnews24.com that Badsha was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at around 3:30 pm. He said, "Badsha was arrested from the Hathazari area of Chittagong on Wednesday night. The police went to that pasture to apprehend him and his accomplices. At that time, the terrorists who were riding camels fired at the police. Then the police also fired back." Police officer Harunur Rashid said that Badshah was shot dead on the spot during the exchange of fire. The body has been sent to Noakhali Sadar Hospital morgue for postmortem.

data.name: Babul Mia
data.description: A person named Babul Mia (45) died in the custody of Char Jabbar police station in Noakhali on Saturday. Babul's wife, Amena Begum, alleged that her husband died due to police torture while in custody. She told bdnews24.com, ""My husband was a radio-TV repairman. The police arrested him under a conspiracy and brought him to the police station, where they tortured him throughout the night. That is why he died."" However, Additional Superintendent of Noakhali District Police, Abdur Razzak, told bdnews24.com, quoting doctors, ""Babul died due to excessive alcohol consumption."" Abdul Motaleb, the resident health officer of Noakhali General Hospital, said, ""We have not provided any information to the police stating that Babul died due to excessive alcohol consumption. The cause of his death can only be confirmed once we receive the autopsy report."" Charjabbar police sub-inspector Habibur Rahman told bdnews24.com, ""Police arrested Babul from his house in Madhya Charbata village of Subarnachar upazila on Wednesday afternoon. According to the information provided by him, one hundred and four bottles of local liquor were found by digging the soil of the house's pond. When Babul was brought from police custody to Noakhali court on Saturday afternoon, he fell ill. Later, he was admitted to Noakhali General Hospital, where he died around 4:30 pm."" Police officer Habibur Rahman also claimed that Babul was a professional liquor dealer and his death was due to long-term alcohol consumption.

data.name: Jamal Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An outlaw was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and the police in Chatmohor upazila in Pabna yesterday. The deceased was identified as Jamal Uddin, 38, a regional leader of the Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-Janajuddha). Acting on a tip-off, Chatmohor police raided Kutibari Battala where the outlaws were holding a meeting around 3:00 am. Sensing their presence, the Janajuddha cadres opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Jamal was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. However, his accomplices managed to flee.

data.name: Ashiqur Rahman Shikder
data.description: An Interpol wanted criminal was found shot dead in Siddhirganj district yesterday. The deceased, Ashiqur Rahman Shikder, also known as Tofazzal Hossain Shikder, was 45 years old and served as the vice-president of Narayanganj district Jubo League. His body, riddled with bullet holes, was discovered on the road near Jalkuri Health Complex in the morning. After being alerted by locals, the police recovered the body. According to a police source, the International Police Organization (Interpol) issued a "red warrant" against Tofazzal and his brother, Golam Rasul Shikder, on March 12, 2007. "The warrant was posted on the Interpol website until the time of his death," the source said. Tofazzal was wanted in 20 cases, including two high-profile double-murder cases. Witnesses reported that two bullets had penetrated his forehead and one eye. The body was sent to the morgue for autopsy. However, family members claimed that Tofazzal had been arrested by RAB members from a residential hotel in the Tantibazar area of Dhaka on Wednesday and may have been killed in a "crossfire" situation.

data.name: Titu Hridoy
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An alleged criminal succumbed to his injuries after a shootout between the police and his cohorts in the city's Mirpur yesterday afternoon. The deceased was identified as Titu, also known as Hridoy, a 28-year-old alleged criminal associated with the Shohor Ali group. The Officer-in-charge (OC) of Mirpur Police Station, Zakir Hossain Mollah, told The Daily Star that four to five men from the group were loitering near Mirpur 10 when patrol police challenged them around 3:00 am. The criminals opened fire at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. After the shootout, the police arrested Hridoy, who had sustained bullet injuries, from the scene. Later, he was admitted to Pongu Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries at 2:00 pm. The police recovered four bullets, a machete, and three knives from Hridoy. "Hridoy was a listed criminal and a member of the Shohor Ali group," said OC Zakir Hossain.

data.name: Altaf Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two pirates were killed in a shootout between them and the police in the Poramahal area of the Sundarbans in Mongla upazila yesterday. The deceased were identified as Altaf Hossain, 38, son of Adil Uddin, and Mizanur Rahman Mizan, 40, son of Abdul Khalek of Chandrakhali village under Rampal upazila. Both were members of the 'Raju Bahini'. During the gunfight, two police constables -- Nurul Islan and Zakir Hossain -- were also injured. Police Superintendent M Mizanur Rahman said 6-7 armed pirates started firing on the police around 5:30 am while they were conducting a special drive in the Sundarbans following the Raash Mela at Dublar Char. Retaliatory firing by the police left two pirates dead on the spot. However, their accomplices managed to flee.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman Mizan

data.name: Amir Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An alleged miscreant was killed early on Friday near Ibrahimpur market in the capital in a so-called gunfight with RAB. Kafrul police chief Delwar Ahmed claimed that Amir Ali, 34, was a close associate of 'Taj', a top terror of the Mirpur area. Major Sarwar of RAB-4 told bdnews24.com that they were conducting a raid beside Ibrahimpur market in the early hours of Friday when they encountered 'a group of terrorists'. "During the raid, the miscreants fired at RAB members and as they retaliated, Amir Ali was hit by a bullet." Amir was later admitted to Dhaka Medical College and Hospital where he died from the wounds, Delwar said. He added that Amir had quite a few cases filed against him. However, his family members claimed to Jugantor that he was never involved in any criminal activity; rather, he was a shopkeeper.

data.name: Mojibar Rahman Babu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Alleged top militant Mojibar Rahman Babu (40) was killed in a gun battle with the police early on Friday in Mirpur, Kushtia. Mirpur police chief Sheikh Anwar Hossain said Babu, a regional leader of Gano Mukti Fouj, was killed at Swarupdaha village under Mirpur Upazila. "Tipped off about a clandestine rendezvous of extremist elements to be held near a culvert on Swarupdaha-Koimari road, the police raided the spot. The terrorists opened fire, triggering a shootout with the police," said the police chief. Mojibar was eventually shot and killed in the shootout, he said. The police recovered a firearm and five rounds of ammunition from the scene. Mojibar faced six cases filed against him with Mirpur police station. His body was taken to the Kushtia sadar hospital morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Kamruzzaman Oli
data.description: The Superintendent of Police at Pabna, Nibash Chandra Majhi, described Md Kamruzzaman Oli, 45, as the kingpin of crime in Pabna. In addition to being wanted for three murders, Oli had been involved in outlawed groups since the 1990s. He was the current chief of the outlawed Janajuddha, a faction of the Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP) in Pabna, and he was the chairman of Hadal Union Parishad. Oli had been in hiding since the caretaker government came to power in 2007. Md Abu Jafar, the officer-in-charge of Faridpur Police Station, said, "There were three warrants for his arrest. He was the top outlawed operative in this region." After receiving a tip-off about a secret meeting being held by Oli and faction members, the police cordoned off an area in Hadal Union at around 12:25 am on Monday. The criminals opened fire on the police when they raided the premises of 'Nuru Khar Bat-tala', and the ensuing gunfight lasted over half an hour. The police fired 37 rounds of bullets at the criminals. Oli died of his wounds at the scene of the 'shootout', while the rest of the criminals managed to flee, the police said.

data.name: Ilias Hossain Mamun
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Ilias Hossain Mamun, 38, from Meherpur's Gangni upazila, who was a leader of the outlawed Janajuddho, a faction of the Purbo Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-ML), was killed in a 'shootout' between the police and his cohorts at Khalishakundi village under Daulatpur upazila in Kushtia. Police sources said a team from the Detective Branch and Daulatpur police raided the village around 4:00 am after receiving information that Mamun was holding a meeting with his accomplices. Surrounded by the police, the operatives opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Mamun died on the spot, but his accomplices managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Mamun-ur-Rashid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mamun-ur-Rashid, also known as Mamun, 38, the son of Rezaul Karim from Akbarpur village in Gangni Upazila, was a regional leader of the banned Purba Banglar Communist Party (ML-Janajuddha), according to Daulatpur Police Station officer in-charge Hasan Hafizur Rahman. Mamun, who had 12 cases against him, including two for murder, was killed at around 4 am in Panch Pirtala village in Khalikundi Union. OC Rahman stated that a police team conducted a raid in the Aam Bagan area of Panch Pittala village based on a tip-off about a secret meeting of the group. Upon sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire, leading the police team to retaliate. Mamun was shot dead during the shootout, while the rest of the gang managed to escape the raid. Two guns, five rounds of ammunition, and a sharp weapon were recovered at the scene by the police. Mamun's body has been sent to Kushtia Sadar Hospital for an autopsy.

data.name: Aminul Islam Manik
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Jhenaidah, a member of the Biplobi Communist Party, Aminul Islam Manik, was killed at around 1 am in an "encounter." Jhenaidah police superintendent Mohammed Rezaul Karim told bdnews24.com, "A joint team of RAB and Police arrived near a spot beside the Baidanga road across Kalamtali on a tip-off about a clandestine meeting. Eventually, the criminals sensed the presence of the law enforcers and opened fire, forcing them to retaliate." Manik was hit during the gunfight. He was captured and sent to the Jhenaidah Sadar Hospital where he died.

data.name: Lutfor Khalashi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two brothers, alleged to be extremists, were killed in a reported shootout with RAB in Madaripur on Monday, within 48 hours of their relatives expressing fear that they might be killed, bdnews24 reported. A third brother had been killed in a similar incident earlier, said the family. RAB-8 officer Mahmud Al Mamun told bdnews24.com that the two brothers, 40-year-old Lutfor and 38-year-old Khairul Khalashi, were killed in a gunfight with law enforcers at around 3 am in Shirkhara village of Sadar Upazila. Both faced a multitude of cases, including murder, said the RAB officer. Bablu Khalashi, son of Lutfor, had held a news conference on Saturday and said his father and uncle, who were arrested from Jatrapur in Narayanganj district on Friday night, might be killed in 'crossfire'. Bablu claimed in the press conference that RAB had earlier killed another of his uncles, Obaidur, in a shootout. Mamun denied that the two brothers, Lutfor and Khairul, had been arrested earlier, but Madaripur Sadar police chief Giasuddin admitted to their arrest prior to the shootout.

data.name: Mohammad Hasan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A suspected outlaw was killed in a gunfight with the police in Jhenaidah early Tuesday. The police said 38-year-old 'Hasan' was an operative of the banned extremist Purba Bangla Communist Party (Janajuddha). Jhenaidah Assistant Superintendent of Police Reshma Khatun told bdnews24.com that a group of PBCP men opened fire on a patrol police team, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate at Baniakandar village in Sadar Upazila. At one stage of the shootout, the gunmen fled the scene, leaving Hasan's dead body, Khatun said.

data.name: Hazrat Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The alleged leader of an inter-district 'dacoit' gang was killed in a shootout with law enforcers on the Jhenaidah-Jessore highway on Saturday, according to the police. Jhenaidah police superintendent Md Rezaul Karim identified the deceased as 30-year-old Hazrat Ali of Patbila village in Kaliganj Upazila. Karim said the police came across the gang of robbers as they were setting up a barricade, by cutting down a tree, on the highway at Salabhara bus stand in Kaliganj, in order to stop vehicles and rob them. As the police patrol team arrived at the scene at around 5:15 am, the armed gang opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. Other members of the gang eventually fled the scene, leaving Hazrat's body behind, said the police official. Karim said the deceased was the leader of a well-known network of inter-district bandits.

data.name: Tajmul Taju
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An underground operative was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and the law enforcers at Habaspur village under Kumarkhali upazila of Kushtia district on Tuesday night. The deceased is Tajmul alias Taju, 38, a regional leader of the outlawed New Biplobi Communist Party (NBCP). Acting on a tip-off, police raided an area near Mir Mosharraf Hossain Bridge over Gorai river at the village where some NBCP men, led by Taju, were holding a meeting at around 10:30 pm. Sensing the presence of policemen, the outlaws opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Taju received bullet injuries during the gunfight and died on the way to Kushtia General Hospital at around 11:00 pm, police said.

data.name: Saad Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A suspected leader of the outlawed extremist outfit Purba Bangla Communist Party was killed in a shootout with law enforcers in Santhia, Pabna, early Friday, according to the police. Pabna Police Superintendent Nibash Chandra Majhi stated that 32-year-old Saad Ali, also known as Akash, was a "military leader" of PBCL (ML-Janajuddha). Majhi informed bdnews24.com that the police received a tip-off about a clandestine meeting of PBCL operatives in Madarbaria village. He mentioned that a police squad arrived at the location around 1:15 am. "The criminals opened fire at the police, forcing them to retaliate," said the police superintendent. During the shootout, the criminals eventually fled the scene, leaving behind Saad Ali's body, which was later discovered by the police.

data.name: Nuruzaaman Shumon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two suspected extremists were allegedly killed in a shootout with the police and RAB early Thursday at Bujrukgargari in Chuadanga, according to the police. The Chuadanga police claimed that the two, Rabi (identified by The Daily Star as Nuruzaaman Shumon), 36, and Sunnat Ali, 35, were members of the outlawed Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML). Chuadanga police superintendent Md. Abdul Baten told bdnews24.com that the two died following a gunfight inside a mango orchard at Bujrukgargari. He said, "A joint team of RAB and police force, acting on a tip-off, raided the secret meeting venue of the extremists.

data.name: Rokon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Superintendent of Kushtia police, Shahabuddin Khan, told bdnews24.com that Rokon, 32, and Samiruddin, also known as Hatkata Sagar, 34, were killed in a 'gunfight' with the police near Jagoti rail station in Sadar upazila. Khan said that a team from the Detective Branch of the police conducted an operation on a mango orchard near the railway station at 2:15 am when the extremists opened fire. The police retaliated in self-defense, resulting in the death of the two individuals. Their bodies were discovered after their associates fled the scene, and were later identified by local residents. Officer-in-charge of Sadar Police Station, AKM Faruk Hossain, stated that the two deceased individuals were associated with the outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party. Rokon had 12 cases against him, including five murder charges, while Sagar had 10 criminal cases against him.
