data.name: Monwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional leader of the outlawed Biplobi Communist Party (BCP) was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and the police at Munshiganj village under Alamdanga upazila of Chuadanga district yesterday. He was identified as Monwar Hossain, also known as Mono, 32, the son of Nabis Uddin in the upazila. According to the police, a gang of BCP cadres, led by Monwar, was holding a meeting at a banana orchard near Munshiganj bazar around 1:30 am. A team from Alamdanga Police Station, led by its Officer-in-charge Ilias Fakir, raided the place acting on a tip-off. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire and blasted a bomb. Monwar's accomplices fled the scene after a gun battle ensued, as the police reiterated. Later, the police found the injured Monwar and rushed him to Chuadanga Sadar Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries around 2:00 am.

data.name: Sheikh Murad
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Sheikh Murad, a leader of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Janajuddho), was killed in a gunfight with police early on Tuesday in Fakirhat district. The 32-year-old communist cadre had previously been sentenced to death by a court in connection with a murder case involving the death of SM Farhad Hossain, a local Awami League leader and industrialist, in 2001. The gun battle occurred at around 4 am on Tuesday in a mahogany plantation near Shubhash Mallick's house in Brahmanrakdia village, under Fakirhat Upazila. Murad's body was sent to Bagerhat Sadar Hospital for autopsy. Police recovered two shotguns, five rounds of .303 rifle bullets, 16 rounds of live ammunition, and seven empty ammunition cases from the scene. Fakirhat police chief Salahuddin Miah said they received a tip-off that Murad, who had been on the run for a long time, had returned to his area and was holding a meeting with his militant cohorts in the village plantation. Police raided the village to apprehend Murad, resulting in a gunfight. They claimed Murad was injured in the exchange and later died after being taken to the local health complex.

data.name: Rezaul Karim
data.identity: Member of the erstwhile Bangladesh Rifles
data.description: Habilder Rezaul Karim, 45, of Rifles Battalion-44, died in prison on Friday morning at the Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University. Karim's nephew, Liton Bashar, claimed that his uncle was tortured to death. He told bdnews24.com, "There were signs of torture on his body. While in jail, he (Karim) said he was severely tortured and might not survive. His fear has turned into reality." Karim was at Peelkhana during the mutiny on February 25-26 and was arrested immediately after the carnage. He was taken into the custody of law enforcement agencies and later admitted to BSMMU as his health deteriorated, Bashar added. When asked, the BDR chief dismissed the torture allegation. "He was in jail after his arrest. So there's no question of torture," Maj Gen Moinul Hossain Chowdhury, the director general, told bdnews24.com.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: The OC of Kadamtoli police station, Liaquat Ali, told bdnews24.com that the police challenged some suspects they saw while passing through Wasa Road. When the suspects fired at the police, the police retaliated. Later, the body of Delwar Hossain, also known as Grill Delwar, a notorious terrorist from old Dhaka, was found at the scene. The OC stated that Delwar was an associate of the infamous terrorist Dakat Shaheed from old Dhaka and had multiple cases against him.

data.name: Nezamuddin
data.description: In Sandwip Upazila of Chittagong, two individuals, Nezam Uddin (30) and Mohammad Belal (48), were killed in a gunfight with the police at Urirchar. The incident occurred when a group of armed men publicly brandished weapons, and the police arrived at the scene, according to police sources. The criminals fired at the police, who returned fire, resulting in the deaths of Nezam and Belal on the spot. Two others were injured and arrested. The officer-in-charge (OC) of Sandwip Police Station, Saikul Ahmed Bhuiya, confirmed the incident, stating that the deceased were criminals.

data.name: Md. Belal
data.description: In Sandwip Upazila of Chittagong, two individuals, Nezam Uddin (30) and Mohammad Belal (48), were killed in a gunfight with the police at Urirchar. The incident occurred when a group of armed men publicly brandished weapons, and the police arrived at the scene, according to police sources. The criminals fired at the police, who returned fire, resulting in the deaths of Nezam and Belal on the spot. Two others were injured and arrested. The officer-in-charge (OC) of Sandwip Police Station, Saikul Ahmed Bhuiya, confirmed the incident, stating that the deceased were criminals.

data.name: Khalil Sohel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected leader of a robber gang was killed in a gunfight with the police at Hathajari in Chittagong early on Monday. The deceased has been identified only as 'Khalil' alias 'Sohel', 37. Another suspect, Abul Hossain, was also injured during the gun battle and admitted to Chittagong Medical College Hospital. Babul Akhter, Hathajari circle assistant superintendent of police, told bdnews24.com that the police launched a raid at Bahbanipur village in the upazila at around 1:30 am, acting on a tip-off that Khalil and his associates were planning a robbery. Akhter said the suspects shot at the law enforcers, who returned fire. Khalil and Abul Hossain were both taken to CMCH, where the duty doctor declared Khalil dead, said the police officer. The police recovered two foreign and four locally made handguns and 33 rounds of ammunition from the scene, the police official said.

data.name: Firoz
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and the Rapid Action Battalion at Old Kochukheth Bazar in the city's Kafrul area early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Firoz, also known as Kosai Firoz, a 30-year-old resident of Kafrul in Mirpur. Major Khandakar Golam Sarwar of Rab-4 told The Daily Star that around 3:00 am, a Rab patrol team challenged a gang of six to seven criminals who were behaving suspiciously at Old Kochukheth Bazar. The gang opened fire on the Rab team, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. Firoz was caught in the crossfire and was found dead in front of Nur Masjid in the area, while his accomplices fled the scene. The law enforcers took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the attending doctors declared him dead, according to Rab sources. Officer-in-charge Delwar Ahmed of Kafrul Police Station said Firoz was accused in at least 15 cases. He used to support extortionists and snatchers who were active in Kafrul, Mirpur, Pallabi, and other areas, the OC added.

data.name: Aminul Islam Mintu
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A man arrested in an extortion case died in police custody in the city yesterday. The deceased, Aminul Islam Mintu, 35, was the president of the Ramna unit of Jatiyatabadi Samajik Sangskritik Sangstha (Jasas), according to family sources. Rezaul Karim, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Shahbagh Police Station, said police arrested Aminul from the Paltan area on Wednesday afternoon in connection with the extortion case. Aminul fell ill when he was brought before a Dhaka court yesterday. He was rushed to the National Medical College Hospital where he died in the evening, said the OC. However, Aminul's family members alleged that police arrested him from the Jasas office at Bijoynagar but did not bring him before the court within 24 hours. Instead, police filed an extortion case against him, they said.

data.name: Osman Gani
data.description: An alleged top crime gang chief was killed in a purported gunfight with the RAB and police in Chittagong's Fatikchharhi Upazila early on Saturday. The deceased was identified as 35-year-old Osman Gani, the chief of the 'Osman gang'. RAB-7 staff officer ASP Sajjad Hossain told bdnews24.com that they, along with police personnel, had raided Rangamatia at around 3:45 am on a tip-off that Osman had been staying there with his associates. The criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing the raiders to fire back, he claimed. At one point of the shootout, Osman was shot and his associates escaped. He was rushed to Fatikchharhi hospital where he was declared dead on arrival, Hossain said.

data.name: Manik Mia
data.description: Manik's father filed a murder case on February 8, accusing him and two others of killing his son while in custody. Adu Mia, Manik's father, filed the case with a Dhaka court against OC Md Asaduzzaman, Sub-Inspector Zahidur Rahman, and Assistant Sub-Inspector Harun-ur-Rashid. In his statement, he alleged that his son died as a result of torture while in the custody of Keraniganj Police Station sometime between January 27 and February 1. Adu Mia also claimed that Keraniganj police arrested Manik Mia on January 27 without any allegations against him. Judicial Magistrate Shahriar Arafat has scheduled a hearing on the acceptability of the report for February 15.

data.name: Mohiuddin Arif
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An employee of Apollo Hospitals, who was detained in prison for suspected links to two robberies in the capital's Pallabi area, was allegedly tortured to death by Rab on Wednesday. The Rapid Action Battalion (Rab), however, denied the allegation of torturing Mohiuddin Arif, 29, who was serving as an operating theatre technician at the hospital. The guards of Dhaka Central Jail brought him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital on Wednesday around 12:30 pm. The doctors declared him dead. The investigation report prepared by Executive Magistrate Mokbul Hossain yesterday at Dhaka Medical College morgue stated that marks of torture were found on different parts of Arif's body. Legal and Media Wing Director of Rab, Mohammad Sohail, said the allegation of torturing Arif by Rab is totally baseless as Rab personnel handed him over to the police on the day he was arrested. Besides, relatives of all criminals make the same claim after their dear ones are arrested, he added. He claimed that Arif confessed to Rab and the police about his involvement in the robberies. Arif's family did not know about his death until yesterday evening when the police informed them about it at his village home in Brahmanbaria Sadar upazila. Giasuddin, Arif's younger brother, told The Daily Star that a team of Rab-4 arrested his brother at their Pallabi residence on January 25 around 8:00 am. He said, "After 12 hours of the arrest, Rab with Arif in their custody raided our house again when we noticed torture marks on my brother's body. He was groaning and pleading with my father to save him." Arif was handed over to Pallabi police later that day, and a Dhaka court sent him to jail the next day. Officer-in-Charge of Pallabi Police Station, Iqbal Hossain, said Arif and two others arrested with him admitted their involvement in two robbery incidents in Pallabi. Iqbal Hossain also said he did not find any torture marks on Arif's body when he (Arif) was handed over to them.

data.name: Hobibor Kabiraj
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A criminal was killed in a "shootout" between his accomplices and law enforcement officers at Chilmari Char in Daulatpur upazila, Kushtia, early yesterday. Police said the deceased was identified as Hobibor, also known as Hobi Kabiraj, a 40-year-old son of Ahad Kabiraj from Philpnagar in the upazila. Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of Rab and Daulatpur police raided Chilmari Char, where Hobi and his men were holding a secret meeting around 3:15 am, according to the police. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement officers, the gang opened fire, prompting them to retaliate. Hobi was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Shaheen
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Shaheen, 24, a Rajshahi College Chhatra Shibir leader, died in Chapainawabganj early on Thursday in a gunfight with the police. The police claimed that Shaheen, from Meherchandi in Rajshahi, was accused of killing RU Chhatra League activist Faruq Hossain. He was a student of political science at RU and the social welfare secretary of the RU unit of Islami Chhatra Shibir. Chapainawabganj police superintendent Nazrul Hossain told reporters that the gun battle took place at the house of Toufizul Islam Tanu, a local Jamaat-e-Islami leader in Choitannyapur village under Shibganj Upazila. After receiving a tip-off about a meeting of some Shibir leaders and activists at Tanu's place, the police raided the house. "As the police cordoned off the place at 2 am on Thursday, shots were fired from the house and the police retaliated. Upon storming the house later, the police found the bullet-hit dead body of Shaheen there," said Nazrul. The police superintendent, however, claimed that Shaheen was hit by someone from his own side. The police arrested JI leader Toufizul and his son Mahfuz, 27, from the house. The body was sent to Sadar Hospital morgue for an autopsy. Local people said that following the death of RU student Faruq Hossain on Tuesday, some people, including Shaheen, had taken refuge at Toufizul's place. Faruq, an RU mathematics student, was killed in an attack by the CS activists, the police said. Two cases were filed in this connection on Wednesday against some 600 CS members, including 64 who were named specifically. Shaheen's name was not on the list of 64, but the police said his name would eventually be included in the list as a suspect.

data.name: Behai Pervez
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Muktijoddha Cooperative Market in the capital's Mirpur-13 yesterday. The deceased, Parvez, 32, also known as Behai Pervez, was a member of the Ibrahim gang active in the Kafrul area, the police said. An official of Rab-4 told The Daily Star that a patrol team of the elite force found a gang of seven to eight youths quarreling inside Muktijoddha Market around 3:00 am. As the Rab members tried to enter the market, the criminals opened fire at them, prompting the elite force to retaliate, resulting in a 15-minute-long gunfight. Parvez was caught in the line of fire while his cohorts managed to flee the scene, according to Rab sources. Delwar Hossain, officer-in-charge of Kafrul police station, said Parvez was accused in several cases, including murder, extortion, and snatching.

data.name: Samad Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An outlawed party member was killed in a "shootout" between his accomplices and the Rapid Action Battalion members at Bangram village in Rajbari Sadar upazila on Thursday midnight. The deceased was identified as Samad Mollah, also known as Samad Member and Aziz, commander of the banned Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML Janajuddha). Rab sources said that acting on a tip-off, a team of the elite force rushed to the spot and urged the outlaws to surrender. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a ten-minute-long gunfight. Samad, who was also the chief of Samad Bahini, was wounded in the gunfight while his cohorts fled.

data.name: Saidul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: According to RAB-Police, he was killed in crossfire while he was in a secret meeting with his accomplices.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A person was killed in a police firing on Tuesday night in Pangsha Upazila of Rajbari. The victim has not been identified. However, the police said that the person was a member of the dacoit group. Munsi Mofazzal Hossain, OC of Pangsha police station, told reporters that while preparing for a robbery in the Sealdangi area on the Daulatdia-Kushtia road, there was a shootout with the police. One person died at that time.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed during a shootout between Rapid Action Battalion personnel and their cohorts at Rustompur Beribadh in the city's Pallabi last night. The deceased, however, could not be identified, according to Rab sources. The bodies were taken to Pallabi Police Station. Additional Superintendent of Police Mohammad Mizanur Rahman of Rab-1 said the gunfight took place in a field in Rustompur around 11:00 pm when the robbers opened fire on Rab in an attempt to escape arrest. He said a Rab patrol team tried to stop a taxi when they saw people fighting over its steering wheel. The team chased the taxi near the field as it tried to flee. At one point, the criminals got out of the taxi and tried to escape on foot while firing shots at Rab personnel. A gunfight broke out, with the Rab team retaliating with gunshots. After the gunfight, the team found two bodies with bullet wounds at the scene.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed during a shootout between Rapid Action Battalion personnel and their cohorts at Rustompur Beribadh in the city's Pallabi last night. The deceased, however, could not be identified, according to Rab sources. The bodies were taken to Pallabi Police Station. Additional Superintendent of Police Mohammad Mizanur Rahman of Rab-1 said the gunfight took place in a field in Rustompur around 11:00 pm when the robbers opened fire on Rab in an attempt to escape arrest. He said a Rab patrol team tried to stop a taxi when they saw people fighting over its steering wheel. The team chased the taxi near the field as it tried to flee. At one point, the criminals got out of the taxi and tried to escape on foot while firing shots at Rab personnel. A gunfight broke out, with the Rab team retaliating with gunshots. After the gunfight, the team found two bodies with bullet wounds at the scene.

data.name: Abdus Sattar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Amidst continued criticism by human rights organizations and disapproval shown by the court, another incident of alleged 'crossfire' left two people dead in Keraniganj early on Sunday. The deceased were identified as Bappi, also known as Pappu (identified by New Age as Mohammad Azad Hossain Pappu), 26, and Abdus Sattar, 25. Both individuals faced multiple cases, including murder charges, according to Keraniganj police. South Keraniganj police chief Nilotpal Dey told bdnews24.com that Bappi had five cases filed against him, including one for murder. RAB-10 official ABM Enamul Kabir said, "We received a tip about the presence of armed terrorists, and a RAB contingent conducted a raid in South Keraniganj early on Sunday." "At around 1:30 am, terrorists hiding near Oriental Textile Mills High School in Mirerbag opened fire on RAB personnel as they approached the hideout, and RAB retaliated." During the gunfight, the terrorists fled the scene, leaving the bodies of Bappi and Sattar behind, according to RAB. RAB claimed that two of the criminals were killed in the shootout, while the mother of one of the deceased alleged that RAB had arrested her son on Saturday morning. Enamul said they recovered a foreign-made pistol, a revolver, and 13 rounds of revolver ammunition from the scene. Two RAB members were also injured in the shootout, he added. The bodies were sent to Mitford Hospital for autopsy. Bappi, a resident of Mirpur 11, was from Kalakopa Bandura under Nawabganj police station, his mother Shaheena Begum told reporters. She said a RAB contingent had detained Bappi from Mirpur on Saturday morning. Bappi used to run a phone-fax shop in Mirpur, she said. His wife Champa Begum also lives in Mirpur.

data.name: Mohammad Azad Hossain Pappu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Amidst continued criticism by human rights organizations and disapproval shown by the court, another incident of alleged 'crossfire' left two people dead in Keraniganj early on Sunday. "At around 1:30 am, terrorists hiding near Oriental Textile Mills High School in Mirerbag opened fire on RAB personnel approaching the hideout, and RAB retaliated." During the gunfight, the terrorists fled the scene, leaving the bodies of Bappi and Sattar behind, according to RAB. RAB claimed that two of the criminals were killed in the shootout, while the mother of one of the deceased alleged that RAB had arrested her son on Saturday morning. Enamul said they recovered a foreign-made pistol, a revolver, and 13 rounds of revolver ammunition from the scene. Two RAB members were also injured in the shootout, he added. The bodies were sent to Mitford Hospital for autopsy. Bappi, a resident of Mirpur 11, was from Kalakopa Bandura under Nawabganj police station, his mother Shaheena Begum told reporters. She said a RAB contingent had detained Bappi from Mirpur on Saturday morning. Bappi used to run a phone-fax shop in Mirpur, she said. His wife Champa Begum also lives in Mirpur. Pappu's mother told New Age that he had been arrested on February 26, 2010.

data.name: Mamunur Rashid
data.description: A suspected killer was shot dead in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in Old Dhaka's English Road early Tuesday. Twenty-nine-year-old Mamunur Rashid, alias Kala Mamun, of south Keraniganj, was a "hired killer," said Maj Mahbubul Islam of RAB-10 Lalbagh zone. Islam told bdnews24.com that acting on a tip-off, they came upon a gathering of some 10-12 suspects at English Road at around 3 am. The elite force, in plainclothes, challenged the group who ran away firing shots. RAB fired back, said Islam. After about 15 minutes of gunfire from both sides, the criminals fled the scene. RAB found Mamun's body on the spot. One 9mm handgun, one 6mm handgun, and seven rounds of ammunition were also recovered, Islam said. RAB said Mamun was accused in at least five criminal cases, including two for murder. His body was taken to Salimullah Medical College Hospital morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Manjurul Islam Manju
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Kushtia, a 30-year-old man named Manjurul Islam, also known as Manju, was the military commander of the banned extremist organization Ganabahini, according to CA Halim, assistant police superintendent. A joint team of Kushtia's police intelligence and Islamic University police conducted a raid at Piarpur village in the sadar upazila around 4:30 am based on a tip-off that the radical activists were holding a secret meeting, Halim said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, forcing the police to retaliate. During the 20-minute gun battle, the criminals eventually fled the scene, he said. The police discovered Manju's body at the location. Additionally, one light gun, five rounds of bullets, and five bullet casings were recovered, according to the police official. The body was sent to Kushtia General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Monir Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a gun battle with the Rapid Action Battalion in Jatrabari, on the outskirts of the capital. Additionally, a suspected outlaw was killed in a gunfight with the police in Kushtia. Major Kamruzzaman of RAB-10 stated that a 35-year-old man named Monir Hossain, also known as 'Kashai' (butcher) Monir, was killed in the gunfight with a RAB patrol team. He informed bdnews24.com that a gang was preparing to commit a robbery at Sutikhalpara around 1:00 am when a RAB team was patrolling the area. Upon sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire at the RAB team, and the battalion retaliated, according to Zaman. After approximately 15 minutes of exchanging gunfire, the criminals fled the scene. RAB discovered Monir's body at the location and seized one foreign pistol, one machete, and three rounds of ammunition, the official added.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.description: A case was filed with a Dhaka court yesterday against the officer-in-charge and the sub-inspector of Ramna Police Station on charges of torturing an accused to death in their custody. Shilpi Begum, the wife of victim Zakir, filed the murder case with the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate court against OC Shibli Noman and SI MA Aziz. Metropolitan Magistrate Zulfikar Hayat took the charges into cognizance and directed the Criminal Investigation Department to submit a probe report to the court after investigating the matter. In her complaint, Shilpi said the Detective Branch of police arrested her husband on March 4 and took him on a two-day remand. Later, Zakir was shown arrested on March 7 in a theft case by Ramna police and taken on a day's remand. The OC and the SI of Ramna thana took Zakir into their custody and demanded Tk 50,000 from his wife, promising that they would not torture him, said the complainant. Shilpi added that as she refused to give the amount, the police physically tortured him, causing his death.

data.name: Din Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and Rapid Action Battalion members in Siddhirganj Upazila of Narayanganj early Monday. The deceased was identified as Din Islam, also known as Dina, a 40-year-old leader of a robber gang. The elite force claimed that two of its members also received bullet wounds during the gun battle. Rab and the police said a gang of criminals opened fire on a patrol team of Rab-11 in the Ati Housing area at about 2:30 am, prompting the law enforcers to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. Dina was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. However, his cohorts managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Assaduzzaman Rubel
data.description: A suspect wanted in 11 cases, including eight involving murder charges, died from a gunshot to the head during a shootout with RAB in the capital's Demra area on Tuesday. Assistant Director of RAB-10, ABM Enamul Kabir, told bdnews24.com, "Based on a tip-off, RAB conducted a raid to apprehend Md Assaduzzaman (a.k.a Rubel) at Sarulia Garden Road area of Demra at around 3pm." "Rubel started firing at the law enforcers to avoid arrest and died from a headshot as RAB fired back in self-defense," the RAB-10 chief said. RAB claimed that a foreign-made revolver was recovered from the scene.

data.name: Abdul Khaleque
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged extremist leader was killed in a gunfight with police in Kushtia's Kumarkhali upazila early on Sunday. Thirty-seven-year-old Abdul Khaleque, also known as Jhoru, was a regional leader of the outlawed extremist party Gano Muktifouz, according to CA Halim, assistant superintendent of police (ASP). The detective branch of police in Kushtia and Kumarkhali police launched a joint operation based on a tip-off that Khaleque and his associates were holding a secret meeting in Koburhat village in the Upazilla at around 2 am, he said. As the police reached the meeting place, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to fire back, Halim said. At some point during the exchange of fire, the criminals fled the area, he added. The police claimed that they found Khaleque's body at the scene. The body was sent to Kushtia General Hospital morgue for autopsy, Halim said. One light gun, six rounds of ammunition, and nine bullet casings were also recovered from the spot, the police claimed. Khaleque was facing a number of cases, including three murder charges, the ASP said.

data.name: Ashraful Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A top leader of the outlawed Gono Bahini, Ashraful Islam alias Mandar, was killed in a shootout with Rab in the district town yesterday. Mandar, who was accused in 50 criminal cases, including 17 killings, claimed responsibility to the police and local journalists from the spots after the killings. Rapid Action Battalion officials said their team raided a field in Khordobakhail village in Sadar upazila at 8:15 pm when Mandar and his cohorts were holding a secret meeting. Sensing the presence of Rab, the gang opened fire and detonated bombs targeting the law enforcers. Rab retaliated, triggering the gunfight. At one stage, Mandar's accomplices fled the scene. After the shootout, the bullet-hit body of Mandar was found at the scene. Police recovered one rifle, one LG, two bombs, one knife, one axe, and 12 bullets from the spot.

data.name: Jahangir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Two alleged accomplices of the notorious gangster or dacoit Shaheed of Old Dhaka were killed in a gunfight with RAB-10. The deceased individuals are Jahangir Alam (35) and Sohag (25). The incident occurred at Balur Math of Par Gendaria in South Keraniganj of Dhaka on Friday morning. Two RAB members were also injured during the gunfight. RAB-10 CO SM Kamal Hossain informed Manabzamin that a group of terrorists were loitering at Balurmath in Gendaria around 3 pm on Friday. When the RAB arrived at the location based on secret information, the terrorists opened fire. RAB retaliated by firing back. Eventually, Jahangir and Sohag were fatally shot in the gunfight. When the two injured terrorists were rescued and taken to Sir Salimullah Medical College Hospital, the attending doctor declared that they had already passed away.

data.name: Sohag
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Two alleged accomplices of the notorious gangster or dacoit Shaheed of Old Dhaka were killed in a gunfight with RAB-10. The deceased individuals are Jahangir Alam (35) and Sohag (25). The incident occurred at Balur Math of Par Gendaria in South Keraniganj of Dhaka on Friday morning. Two RAB members were also injured during the gunfight. RAB-10 CO SM Kamal Hossain informed Manabzamin that a group of terrorists were loitering at Balurmath in Gendaria around 3 pm on Friday. When the RAB arrived at the location based on secret information, the terrorists opened fire. RAB retaliated by firing back. Eventually, Jahangir and Sohag were fatally shot in the gunfight. When the two injured terrorists were rescued and taken to Sir Salimullah Medical College Hospital, the attending doctor declared that they had already passed away.

data.name: Alamgir Mandal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Md Asaduzzaman, officer-in-charge of Kushtia Police Station, said that 35-year-old Alamgir Mandal was a member of Gana Mukti Fouz. He told bdnews24.com that a joint team of intelligence police and sadr police went to Darbeshpur village under Alampur union in the early hours of Sunday after receiving a tip-off that a group of extremists were gathering there. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire on them, and the law enforcers retaliated, Asad said. At one stage, during the exchange of fire, the men fled the scene. The police found Alamgir's body and recovered one gun, five homemade bombs, three machetes, and five rounds of ammunition, he said.

data.name: Ferdous Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Chuadanga, an alleged extremist was shot dead by the police when he threw a bomb at a patrol police car, according to police superintendent Nazrul Islam. He stated that the deceased, Ferdous Ali, 35, along with several members, were loitering near Kaliabokri beel when the patrol car encountered them early Sunday. The police fired at them after being hit by a bomb, the official explained.

data.name: Ansar Ali
data.description: According to RAB, he was arrested on April 14th. The next day, he was taken to a brickfield to recover firearms based on information that Ansar's men were staying there. Sensing the presence of RAB, the criminals opened fire on RAB, forcing them to retaliate. At one point, Ansar was killed after being caught in the crossfire. The family claimed that he was killed by RAB after being taken to the brickfield.

data.name: Jasim Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: One person was killed in a shootout with RAB near Wazedia under Baizid Police Station of Chittagong in the early hours of Friday. Jasim Uddin, also known as Five Star Jasim, hails from Daroga Bari in the same area. Saidul Islam, assistant superintendent of police and staff officer of RAB-7, told bdnews24.com that the elite force went on an operation in the Ananna residential area at around 3 am. He said that Jasim and his associates started shooting at RAB at that time. Jasim was critically wounded as RAB retaliated, he added. The RAB officer said that the duty doctor declared him dead after he was taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital. RAB recovered 2 light guns and 2 rounds of ammunition from the scene. Islam said there are 14 cases against Jasim, including three for murder in Chittagong. "Jasim is also said to have been involved with the Chattra Shibir," he said.

data.name: Abu Salek
data.description: Thirty-year-old Abu Salek was shot dead as the police opened fire when a group of people attacked the Akhaura health complex at around 2 am, said Osman Gani, additional superintendent of police.

data.name: Gias Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Gias Uddin, the alleged "second in command" of the outlawed Gono Mukti Fouj (GMF), was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and the police in Shailokupa Sub-District of Jhenaidah District on April 30th. Gias Uddin was accused in seven cases, including murder, the police said.

data.name: Asadul Haq
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) personnel in the Kaunia area of Barisal early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Asadul Haq, 25, also known as "Lady" Shahin. Rab sources said he was a prime accused in the Chhatra Dal leader Anik killing case. Anik was murdered on February 23 this year in broad daylight in Barisal city. Lt. Col. Monirul Haque of Rab-8 in Barisal told The Daily Star that a team of elite force was patrolling in the BSCIC area around 3:30 am where a group of youths gathered to commit a crime. When Rab men challenged them, they opened fire on the law enforcers. In retaliation, Rab members fired gunshots that triggered a 10-minute gunfight. Shahin was caught in the line of fire and found dead after the gunfight, he said.

data.name: Alim Biswas
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An "extremist" is alleged to have been killed in a gunfight with police in Kushtia's Mirpur upazila early on Tuesday. Thirty-five-year-old Alim Biswas was the regional leader of the outlawed extremist party Gano Bahini, said Kushtia's assistant superintendent of police, Syed Mostafa Kamal. The detective branch of Kushtia police went to the upazila's Kalabaria village at around 2 am after they were tipped off that a group of extremists were holding a clandestine meeting there, he said. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire at the police, forcing the law enforcers to fire back, he continued. At one stage, the criminals are said to have fled the scene, when the police found Alim's body on the spot. (But his family claimed to The Daily Star on Jul. 21, 2010, that he had been picked up by the police and the next day they came to know that he was killed in crossfire.)

data.name: Abdul Kader
data.description: Kader and Rokon were caught in a crossfire with the police, and unfortunately, Kader died in the hospital.

data.name: Md Manik Mia
data.description: An HC bench consisting of Justice AHM Shamsuddin Chowdhury Manik and Justice Md Delwar Hossain sounded the warning during a public interest litigation hearing regarding the death of Md Manik Mia on May 11 while in the custody of Chittagong police. Manik was a security guard at Anjuman Market in Reazuddin Bazar, Chittagong, and he was also accused in a theft case.

data.name: Mujibur Rahman
data.description: An undertrial prisoner of Sylhet Central Jail died at Osmani Medical College and Hospital on Tuesday. Mujibur Rahman, 37, hailing from the village of Ganikandi in Kanaighat upazila, was accused in a kidnapping case. He was admitted to the hospital on April 25 for psychiatric treatment, according to sources. After a post-mortem examination, the body was handed over to his family on Wednesday afternoon. Mujibur's mother told New Age that he had been tortured to death while in custody.

data.name: Rahat
data.description: A suspected criminal, Rahat, is alleged to have been killed in an exchange of gunfire with the police at the capital's Pallabi embankment. Rahat was involved in the killing of sub-inspector Mizanur Rahman from Ramna Police Station, claimed Mahbub Alam, the additional commissioner of Dhaka Metropolitan Detective Police. Acting on a tip-off that the criminals involved in the policeman's killing were gathering at the embankment, the team of detective police launched an operation there at around 3 am. As the criminals sensed the presence of the police, they fired at them, and the police also fired back, the commissioner claimed. Rahat died during the shootout, according to Alam. The body was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Md. Alauddin
data.description: Two other people died in old Dhaka's Gendaria. The deceased were identified as Shumon (28) and Alauddin (27). Deputy Director of RAB-10, DM Anamul Kabir, told bdnews24.com that a RAB team was patrolling in Gendaria. Upon hearing gunshots, the team went to the ground behind Gendaria School at around 2 am and found approximately seven to eight youths sitting there, he said. They opened fire at RAB members, and the law enforcers shot back, Kabir said. After a while, the youths fled the scene, leaving behind two bodies, two revolvers, and a few rounds of bullets, the RAB official said. Islam claimed that the deceased were associates of the top criminal 'Dakat Shahid', adding that there are at least 20 cases against them.

data.name: Suman Rahman
data.description: Two other people died in old Dhaka's Gendaria. The deceased were identified as Shumon (28) and Alauddin (27). Deputy Director of RAB-10, DM Anamul Kabir, told bdnews24.com that a RAB team was patrolling in Gendaria. Upon hearing gunshots, the team went to the ground behind Gendaria School at around 2 am and found approximately seven to eight youths sitting there, he said. They opened fire at RAB members, and the law enforcers shot back, Kabir said. After a while, the youths fled the scene, leaving behind two bodies, two revolvers, and a few rounds of bullets, the RAB official said. Islam claimed that the deceased were associates of the top criminal 'Dakat Shahid', adding that there are at least 20 cases against them.

data.name: Milan Fakir Jiban
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: bdnews24.com Kushtia correspondent reported that Milan Fakir Jiban (33), an alleged activist of the outlawed extremist party Gano Muktifouz, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Swastipur Sadr upazila. Kushtia assistant superintendent of police CA Halim said that the police went to a place in Swastipur village at around 2:30 am after receiving a tip-off that the extremists were holding a clandestine meeting there. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire at the police, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. During the shootout, the criminals ran away, leaving one body behind. Police recovered a gun and six rounds of bullets from the spot, Halim said. Jiban faced six cases, including two murder charges, with Kustia Sadar Police Station, the senior police official said.

data.name: Rabiul Islam Khokon
data.description: On May 13, 2010, a man named Rabiul Islam Khokon (23) died while in custody at the Chatkhil Police Station in Noakhali. The family members of the late Rabiul Islam alleged to the fact-finding team of Odhikar that Rabiul was admitted to the Noakhali General Hospital in a bad state after he was physically tortured by SI Abdul Mannan of the Chatkhil Police Station, who had taken Rabiul into remand. When Rabiul's condition deteriorated, he was admitted to the Dhaka Medical Hospital.
data.published: The Asian Human Rights Commission on May 31, 2010

data.name: Abdul Malek
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The elite law enforcement force, Rapid Action Battalion, killed two alleged "extremists" late Friday in so-called "shootouts" in Kushtia and Pabna. Abdul Malek, also known as Kata Malek, 40, was a member of the banned extremist group, Purbo Bangla Communist Party, and had six murder cases and seven other cases filed against him in different thanas of Pabna, according to RAB. The Pabna correspondent of bdnews24.com reported that Malek, the son of Habibur Rahman from Shibpur village, died in an ostensible gun battle at Falia village. BM Shahidul Karim, the camp commander of RAB-12 in Pabna, told reporters that RAB had conducted an operation at Falia village around 6 am after receiving information that members of the outlawed party were holding a secret meeting there. When the PBCP activists started shooting at the RAB personnel upon their arrival, the law enforcers also fired back, he said. After a 30-minute gun battle, the PBCP activists fled the scene, leaving behind Malek's dead body, Karim said. RAB also recovered a Chinese rifle, a shotgun, two Chinese axes, and six rounds of bullets, he added.

data.name: Shaidul Haque
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In another incident, a team of RAB-12 from Kushtia camp killed Shaidul Haque, 30, also in what RAB claims was a gun battle in the late hours of Friday. Shahidul was a resident of Atigram in Mirpur upazila, Kushtia. In the last 15 days, law enforcers have killed three people in so-called gun battles in the district. Police have claimed he was the second-in-command of the 'Jalil group', which belonged to another outlawed political outfit, the Revolutionary Communist Party. He had six cases, including two murder cases, filed against him, the police say. Maj Zakir Hossain, camp chief of RAB 12 in Kushtia, said that, having been tipped off that eight to ten extremists were holding a meeting at a brick field in the Atigram village, the law enforcers went on an operation around midnight. He said that the extremists started shooting at the RAB team as they arrived at the spot. After a gun battle that lasted for 15 minutes, the extremists fled the scene, leaving behind a dead body which villagers identified as Saidul Haque. The RAB official said that they recovered two guns, seven rounds of bullets, one hand bomb, and a local sharp weapon from the place.

data.name: Jogneshwar Shil
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Char Hogalpatia village in Babuganj upazila of Barisal on Saturday night. The deceased was identified as Jogneshwar Shil, also known as Joga, from Brahmandia in the upazila. Delwar Hossain, deputy assistant director of Rab in Barisal, said a patrol team of the elite force rushed to Char Hogalpatia at about 11:00 pm where a gang of seven to eight criminals was holding a meeting. Soon after being challenged by the Rab personnel, the gang opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to fire back. At one stage, the criminals managed to flee the scene. Later, Rab found the bullet-hit body of Jogneshwar lying on the spot and sent it to Barisal Sher-e-Bangla Medical College and Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Shamsu Mia
data.description: Shamsu Mia (40) died in Dhaka Central Jail after allegedly being beaten by the police. He was a driver and was taken from the jail to Mitford Hospital, where he died. He had been arrested along with a young man named Harun by Sub-Inspector (SI) Shamsul Islam of Jatrabari Police Station. Wazed Ali, the deceased's brother-in-law, claimed that Shamsu was falsely accused and beaten after failing to pay a demanded bribe. Acting officer-in-charge (OC) Moniruzzaman of Jatrabari Police Station denied the allegations, and Assistant Inspector Kamrunnahar was the investigating officer for the case.

data.name: Asadul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged leader of an outlawed extremist outfit was killed in a "shootout" with police in Chuadanga early on Tuesday. Md. Nazrul Islam, Superintendent of Chuadanga Police, claimed that Asadul, 40, was a regional leader of the Purbo Bangla Communist Party (ML). Islam said that the police organized a raid at the Nehalpur village of the Sadar upazila at around 3 am following a tip-off that the extremists were holding a meeting there. Sensing police presence, the criminals allegedly opened fire at the law enforcers, and a gun battle ensued with the police. Approximately 15 to 20 minutes after the gunfight started, the men fled the scene, leaving Asadul's body behind, Islam added. Police said that they recovered a gun and three bullets from the location. According to the superintendent, Asadul was a fugitive who had formed his own criminal gang six months ago. He faced four murder cases and had also been convicted in an arms case, for which he was facing a life sentence.

data.name: Ali Akkas
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in an apparent shootout with RAB and police in the port city early on Monday. The incident occurred near Ananya residential area adjacent to Mohra under Chandgaon upazila at around 3 am. A spokesperson from the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) said that Ali Akkas, 45, was a land grabber and criminal of Jungle Salimpur of the Sitakunda and Islampur area. Akkas and his group had allegedly occupied government khas land in the area and constructed buildings and lived there. There are nine cases and six general diaries lodged against him at different police stations for murder, rape, and extortion. Lt Col Sajjad Hossain, chief of RAB-7, told bdnews24.com that two separate groups of RAB and police were on their rounds in the Ananya residential area when around 3 am some criminals fired shots at them. Police and RAB fired back in self-defense, exchanging 30 to 35 rounds, said the RAB chief. Akkas died in Chittagong Medical College Hospital after he was taken there from the scene with bullet wounds. RAB has recovered one light machine gun and two bullet casings from the spot. A case has been filed with the Chandgaon Police Station.

data.name: Siddikur Rahman Siddik
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An "extremist" was killed in a "shootout" at Kurha of Mirpur Upazila early on Monday in the second such incident in nine days. Siddkur Rahman Siddik, 35, was the son of the late Ismail Hossain from the village of Chalk in Mirpur Upazila, Kushtia district. Police claimed that he was the district commander of the banned Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML-Janajuddho). Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Syed Mostafa Kamal said a joint force of Kushtia detective police and Mirpur police had raided the village on a tip-off at around 2 am on Monday. "The extremists were holding a secret meeting there. As the joint force reached GK canal, the terrorists opened fire on them. The shootout started as the police fired back," he said. After around 20 minutes of exchanging fire, the extremists fled. Siddik's body was found at the scene and sent to Kushtia General Hospital for a post-mortem. Police recovered one rifle, six bullets, three bullet casings, and five local bombs from the scene, said the ASP. Mirpur police chief Mehedi Hasan said there were five murder cases, nine other cases, and three general diaries against Siddik.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.description: A furniture trader died in the hospital on Tuesday after the Rapid Action Battalion arrested him on Monday night. The deceased was identified as Abul Kalam Azad, 44. RAB's legal and media wing director, Mohammad Sohail Hossain, said that doctors had declared him dead at around 8 am after they took him to the National Institute of Cardiovascular Diseases. "He died of cardiac arrest. It was a natural death," he claimed. Azad was taken to Bangladesh Medical College Hospital (BMCH) branch at Uttara at around 4 am soon after he complained of chest pain, Hossain said. Doctors at BMCH said Azad was suffering from cardiac disease. He was taken to NICVD when his condition deteriorated, he said. RAB said they were conducting a drive at Senakalyan Complex at Mohakhali on Monday night and detained Azad and his son Ripon on charges of keeping porn CDs. RAB said they had released Ripon earlier on Tuesday after his father became ill. Ripon said he and his father Azad were interrogated in separate rooms at the RAB-1 office on Monday. The family told Amar Desh, now defunct, that they believed Azad had been tortured.

data.name: Selim Sallya
data.description: Two people were killed in an encounter with the elite crime-fighting unit, Rapid Action Battalion, at South Begunbari in the capital on Wednesday evening, according to officials. The deceased individuals were identified as 'Jobbar', 32, and 'Selim', 30 (identified by New Age as Selim Sallya and Mohammad Jabbar, respectively). Captain Abu Khaled Al Noman, the operation officer of RAB-2, stated that a RAB team was patrolling the area when they encountered Jobbar and Selim. Noman claimed that the RAB members returned fire after the two individuals opened fire at them. Selim and Jobbar were both shot and were subsequently taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced them dead. The bodies were later sent for autopsy. Additionally, a revolver and a pistol were recovered from the scene, the official added.

data.name: Mohammad Jabbar
data.description: Two people were killed in an encounter with the elite crime-fighting unit, Rapid Action Battalion, at South Begunbari in the capital on Wednesday evening, according to officials. The deceased individuals were identified as 'Jobbar', 32, and 'Selim', 30 (identified by New Age as Selim Sallya and Mohammad Jabbar, respectively). Captain Abu Khaled Al Noman, the operation officer of RAB-2, stated that a RAB team was patrolling the area when they encountered Jobbar and Selim. Noman claimed that the RAB members returned fire after the two individuals opened fire at them. Selim and Jobbar were both shot and were subsequently taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced them dead. The bodies were later sent for autopsy. Additionally, a revolver and a pistol were recovered from the scene, the official added.

data.name: Nasirul Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An operative of the outlawed Gono Mukti Fouz was killed in a shootout between their cohorts and the police in Shailkupa upazila of Jhenidah early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Nasirul Islam, also known as Shuknal, 45, son of Nurul Islam, also known as Nuru Dakat, from Bogra village in Shailkupa. He was accused in 10 cases, including four for murder, the police said. Anwar Hossain, officer-in-charge of Shailkupa Police Station, said his team cordoned off a field at Komol Nagar village at about 3:00 am when the gang was holding a clandestine meeting there. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the outlaws fired shots, prompting the police to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. Shuknal was killed while his accomplices managed to flee. The law enforcers found his body near a bridge in the village. The body was sent to Jhenidah Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Kuddus Molla
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Kuddus Molla, also known as Nati Kuddus, was locally recognized as a member of a pirate group called 'Raju Bahini'. He was reportedly killed, along with two other members of the group, in a gunfight with a joint force of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and Coastguard members. A RAB official informed Banglanews24.com that, based on intelligence information, a team of RAB and Coastguard conducted a raid in Majherchar of Baleswar River. During that time, the Raju group was waiting to commit robbery. Upon sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the pirates opened fire, leading to a gunfight that resulted in the death of three pirates and the injury of two RAB officers.

data.name: Idris Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Idris Ali, also known as Ranga Idris, was locally recognized as a member of a pirate group called 'Raju Bahini'. He was reportedly killed along with two other members of the group in a gunfight with a joint force of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and Coastguard members. A RAB official informed Banglanews24.com that, acting on intelligence information, a team of RAB and Coastguard conducted a raid in Majherchar of Baleswar River. At the time, the Raju group was waiting to commit robbery. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement officers, the pirates opened fire on them, resulting in a gunfight that claimed the lives of three pirates and injured two RAB officers.

data.name: Arab Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Arab Ali was locally known as a member of a pirate group called 'Raju Bahini'. He was reportedly killed along with two other members of the group in a gunfight with a joint force of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and Coastguard members. A RAB official told Banglanews24.com that, acting on intelligence information, a team of RAB and Coastguard raided Majherchar of Baleswar River. At the time, the Raju group was lying in wait to commit robbery. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the pirates opened fire on them, triggering a gunfight that killed three pirates and injured two RAB officers.

data.name: Md. Rinku
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Two gangs of goons engaged in a gunfight in broad daylight in the capital's Jatrabari area on Sunday, leaving one person dead and two others wounded. The deceased has been identified as Rinku, 26, (also known as Md. Rinku by The Daily Star), while the injured individuals are Swapan and Faysal, both residents of Hatkhola area. According to Jatrabari police, the gunfight took place in front of a house near Kutubkhali School at approximately 11:45 am. It was a result of ongoing rivalries between the Sagor group and the Rinku group, as they vied for supremacy in the area. "Rinku was fatally shot during the encounter," stated a police official from the thana. Once the gunshots ceased, local residents promptly transported the injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Hospital authorities discovered a bomb in Swapan's pocket.

data.name: Yusuf Ali Sidhu
data.description: A young man was killed in a shootout with the elite crime-fighting force RAB in the capital on Tuesday midnight at Manikdi in Dhaka Cantonment. He was identified as Yusuf Ali Sidhu, 26. RAB-4 assistant director Flt Lt Khairul Mamun told the reporters that RAB challenged some young men sitting in Manikdi's Chowdhury Kunja at around 12:30 am. They opened fire at RAB personnel who then retaliated and later found a wounded Yusuf at the spot. Dhaka Medical College Hospital's duty doctor declared him dead when he was taken there. Khairul Mamun also said that two RAB officials were wounded in the shootout. A revolver and five rounds of ammunition were recovered from the spot. The RAB official claimed that Yusuf had a number of cases against him with Kafrul and Cantonment police stations. Yusuf is also one of the accused in the murder of Chhatra League activist 'Faruk'. His body has been sent to Dhaka Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Ehsan Kazi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A man, whom the law enforcers claim was a criminal, was killed in an alleged shootout with the elite law enforcement agency RAB in Kushtia early on Thursday. The man was identified as Ehsan Kazi, 38, from Kancherkol village in Jhenaidah's Shailkupa Upazila. Major Zakir Hossain of RAB-12 Kushtia camp told reporters that a RAB team raided the field adjacent to the Baliapara Government Primary School at 3:30 am based on information that the 'extremists' were holding a meeting there. The 'extremists' allegedly opened fire at RAB personnel, who then retaliated. Ehsan was found dead on the spot. Villagers identified the body in the morning. RAB claimed that Ehsan was a local leader of the banned left-leaning political outfit Gana Mukti Fauz and was leading the party in the absence of the outfit's top leaders, Mukul and Shahin. Ehsan had eight cases filed against him with different police stations in Kushtia and Jhenaidah, according to RAB. Zakir said RAB recovered a locally made gun, a light machine gun, and seven rounds of ammunition, a Chinese axe, and a knife from the spot. Kushtia Sadar police chief Asaduzzaman said Ehsan's body has been sent to the Kushtia General Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Babul Kazi
data.description: A CNG-run auto rickshaw driver was killed early yesterday when he fled from police custody and fell on the street in the city's Moghbazar, according to the police. However, the family had a different story to tell. The deceased was identified as Babul Kazi, 40, from the Modhubagh area in the city. The victim's family members alleged that Rab seized two CNG-run auto rickshaws, which Babul had hired. They also claimed that Sub-Inspector (SI) Altaf Hossain of Ramna Police Station demanded Tk 2 lakh in exchange for returning the auto rickshaws. They said Babul gave SI Altaf Tk 70,000 in two installments last week. When he refused to give the rest of the money, Altaf and his colleagues allegedly beat him to death.

data.name: Imdad Fakir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a supposed encounter with elite crime busters RAB and the police at Faridpur's Bhanga upazila, according to BDNews24.com. The incident took place at Nazirpur village of Manikdah union of the upazila around 4 am early Wednesday, said the police. The deceased was identified as Imdad Fakir, 35, allegedly a robber, said the RAB. Receiving the information that some robbers had gathered at an abandoned tin-shed house at Nazirpur for a meeting, a joint team of RAB and police surrounded the place, Faridpur RAB-8 said in a press release. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers started shooting and the law enforcers retaliated. After 5-7 minutes of shootout, the body of Imdad was discovered. Bhanga Police Station officer-in-charge Rafiqul Islam told journalists that Imdad had several cases against him in different police stations, including Madaripur and Khulna. Police also recovered a handmade firearm, three rounds of ammunition, three machetes, and five bottles of phensidyl from the spot, Rafiqul claimed. Major Waliur Rashid, commander of Rab-8, said Imdad was a member of an inter-district robber gang, as reported by The Daily Star.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman
data.description: Mizanur Rahman was a petty businessman who ran a small photo studio and also rented a sound system for socio-cultural programs. On the night of June 28, 2010, he was sleeping in his house in the Badda area along with the other members of his family, including his child and his wife, Mrs. Taslima Akther. At around 3 am on the early morning of June 29, they heard a group of people knocking on the door of their rented house. Afraid that those knocking at the door might be robbers or miscreants, the family decided not to open the door. At one point, they saw that some people were watching the residents of their house from the rooftop of the building opposite. Soon after, the strangers broke the main door of the house and entered it. Mr. Manik, who was receiving medical treatment at the DMCH, told Mizan’s wife that around midnight on June 30 (early morning of July 1), the police tortured him and Mizan in custody. The police wanted Mizan to confess that he was a car thief, which Mizan denied repeatedly. Around 1:30 am, Manik and Mizan were taken out of the police station to an isolated open-air field. The police shot Mizan and Manik in one of their legs each. Both individuals fell to the ground. Then, SI Anis told them to run away if they wanted to save their lives. Mizan attempted to flee. Suddenly, SI Anis shot Mizan’s other leg. Later, the police brought both of them to the DMCH. According to the official record of the Emergency Unit of the DMCH, the police brought Mizan to the hospital at 5:45 am with bullet injuries in both legs. Mizan succumbed to his injuries at 7:30 am due to non-stop bleeding from the bullet wounds.
data.published: The Asian Human Rights Commission on Jul 19, 2010

data.name: Majibar Hossain
data.description: The victim's family members alleged that the police picked up Majibar on Thursday evening from the Savar area. They tortured him to death and dumped his body into the Turag River. Majibar's brother, Ripon, told The Daily Star that four policemen, along with two informers, caught him while he was returning home with his 11-year-old son, Iqbal, from his father-in-law's house in Melartek. Quoting Iqbal, Ripon said that when his brother reached Melartek Ghat, four policemen, including two sub-inspectors, handcuffed him and took him on a boat. They also tied a rope around his throat and beat him mercilessly with rifle butts in front of his son, Iqbal. Meanwhile, Iqbal went to call his grandfather to the riverbank. When the two came back to the river, the police had already left with Majibar, Ripon said. "We found his body floating in the river in the morning," Ripon added. He said locals witnessed the police torturing the victim. Ripon also alleged that before Thursday's arrest, those two sub-inspectors apprehended his brother three times in the last 22 days and forced them to pay Tk 24,000 for his release. Darussalam police station Officer-in-Charge (OC) SM Mokter Hossain, however, denied the allegation of torturing Majibar to death but said they were investigating the matter. The OC also said Majibar was a drug peddler and he was killed by his rivals over a previous feud.

data.name: Majnu Khan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two members of the Rapid Action Battalion and 28 others have been charged in the killing of two individuals in Barisal. Chief judicial magistrate Md Altaf Hossain has ordered the officer-in-charge of Muladi Police Station to submit reports of the case along with the post-mortem report. Majnu Khan and Kalam Sardar were killed in a shootout with RAB members on June 5 at Noyakandi village under Muladi Upazila. The deceased Majnu's sister, Rina Khan, filed the case with Barisal's Senior Judicial Magistrate's Court on July 8. He then sent the case to the Chief Judicial Magistrate's Court. Tuesday has been set for the hearing. The two accused RAB officers are RAB-8 chief Lt Col Monirul Haque and company-1 chief Maj Rashedul Haque. The other accused individuals are locals, including one Bachchu Khan. Plaintiff Rina complained that Bachchu plotted with the RAB officers to kill her brother Majnu following conflicts over land. Following that, plain-clothed men in a microbus abducted Majnu and Kalam on July 4 at noon. They were later shot after having soil and pieces of clothing placed in their mouths and their hands and legs broken. RAB, however, claimed that Majnu and Kalam were members of a bandit gang and had several murder, robbery, and other cases against them.

data.name: Kalam Sardar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two members of the Rapid Action Battalion and 28 others have been charged in the killing of two individuals in Barisal. Chief judicial magistrate Md Altaf Hossain has ordered the officer-in-charge of Muladi Police Station to submit reports of the case along with the post-mortem report. Majnu Khan and Kalam Sardar were killed in a shootout with RAB members on June 5 at Noyakandi village under Muladi Upazila. The deceased Majnu's sister, Rina Khan, filed the case with Barisal's Senior Judicial Magistrate's Court on July 8. He then sent the case to the Chief Judicial Magistrate's Court. Tuesday has been set for the hearing. The two accused RAB officers are RAB-8 chief Lt Col Monirul Haque and company-1 chief Maj Rashedul Haque. The other accused individuals are locals, including one Bachchu Khan. Plaintiff Rina complained that Bachchu plotted with the RAB officers to kill her brother Majnu following conflicts over land. Following that, plain-clothed men in a microbus abducted Majnu and Kalam on July 4 at noon. They were later shot after having soil and pieces of clothing placed in their mouths and their hands and legs broken. RAB, however, claimed that Majnu and Kalam were members of a bandit gang and had several murder, robbery, and other cases against them.

data.name: Bashar Majhi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged pirate gang leader was shot dead by security forces on Tuesday in a reported shootout in Noakhali. The deceased has been identified as 'Bashar', the leader of the notorious Bashar Group and wanted in 31 cases, including murder, extortion, and kidnapping, by the police. Police sources said the gunfight occurred at Hatia's Bashar Majhir Bazaar in the early hours of Tuesday. Bashar's body has been sent to Noakhali General Hospital morgue for an autopsy. Noakhali superintendent of police, Harunur Rashid Hazari, told journalists, "Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of Rapid Action Battalion, police, and Coast Guard surrounded Bashar and his team at the bazaar where they were preparing for a robbery around 3 am." He added that the shootout began when Bashar's men fired at the law enforcers. The pirates fled at one point. Bashar's dead body with bullet wounds was found around 5 am, added the police official. However, no firearms were recovered from the scene, Hazari said. He also said that a burqa was found with Bashar, which he would use to disguise himself and vanish from crime scenes.

data.name: Faruk Sardar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected pirates were killed by law enforcement officers in a reported shootout at Patharghata Upazila in Barguna district on Friday. They were identified as Afzal Hossain, 35, a resident of Lathhimara village, and Faruk Sardar, 28, a resident of Padma village in the district. The two were suspected members of the Julfiqar group, a pirate gang. The Coast Guard's contingent commander, Lt. Mushfiqur Rahman, told journalists that a joint team of RAB, Coast Guard, and the police had been searching for fishermen abducted by pirates. "Around 4 am, we saw a pirate trawler and asked them to stop. But they opened fire on us, forcing us to retaliate," he said. "At one point, five to six pirates jumped into the water and escaped. We found Afzal and Faruk's bodies in the trawler afterwards," he added. Mushfiqur said they recovered three shotguns, 10 cartridges, and a machete from the trawler. Patharghata police chief Mah-e-Alam told bdnews24.com that with the latest case, five pirates had been killed in encounters with law enforcement officers in the last month. He said the other three pirates were killed in a gunfight on June 11. Mushfiqur said around a hundred fishermen were abducted by pirates in the last few days.

data.name: Nurul Haq
data.description: Another suspect died in police custody in Nabinagar Upazila on Sunday, only six days after the High Court asked the government to establish a committee to investigate custodial deaths. Nurul Haque, 45, a rickshaw-puller and resident of Bidyakut village, was wanted in two cases filed with Nabinagar police – one for gambling and the other for vandalism, according to Nabinagar police chief Rupok Saha. "Police from Shibpur camp, under Nabinagar police station, arrested him at his village home in the early hours of Sunday," he said. After the arrest, he experienced breathing complications and became ill. As his condition worsened, he was admitted to Nabinagar Upazila Health Complex around 4am, the police officer claimed. "However, Haque's condition deteriorated further and he was sent to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital, where the attending doctor declared him dead on arrival," Saha added. But a cousin of the deceased, Mohammed Faruk Miah, alleged, "The police severely beat up my brother immediately after his arrest. At one point, he lost consciousness and was taken to the hospital." The family of Nurul Haque, a rickshaw-puller, alleged to Manab Zamin that he was brought into police custody and severely beaten. He died at the hospital within 24 hours of his arrest.

data.name: Shahadat Hossain
data.description: Shahadat Hossain, 42, the imam of a mosque in the Nawhata area under Sherpur municipality, died in the custody of Sherpur Sadar police on Wednesday night. He was arrested in a case filed hours earlier by his younger brother, Samshad Hossain, on charges of torturing their mother. Shahadat's wife, Shahida Khatun, alleged that he was tortured to death. She told journalists that Samshad had bribed Sherpur Sadar Police Station's sub-inspector, Monir Hossain, to kill her husband. "The sub-inspector came to our house and told us that he would quit his job if he could not punish him (Shahadat)," she alleged. Shahadat's son, Shahin Miah, and daughters, Sabina and Shila, said his body bore signs of torture, including blood in the nose and face, and a broken tooth. The police, however, denied the allegation, stating that he fell sick after his arrest and was admitted to a hospital.

data.name: Shawkat Hossain Sheakat
data.description: Top-listed 'criminal' Shawkat Hossain Sheakat, 35, was killed in an alleged 'shootout' with security forces early on Friday morning. Babul Akter, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) of Hathazari circle, told bdnews24.com that Sheakat was killed during a raid by a joint force of RAB and police in the Paindang area of Fatikchhari. The joint force, which conducted the raid following a tip-off, recovered one pistol, one locally-made gun, 12 cartridges, two rounds of pistol ammunition, and 10 bottles of beer from the spot. Babul said that the joint forces fired back in self-defense after Sheakat and his compatriots opened fire on them. Sheakat's associates, however, managed to escape, leaving him behind with a bullet wound, said the police official. Sheakat was a leading member of the Jamal and Tipu gang of Fatikchhari and had 14 cases filed against him in different police stations, he added. Two separate cases have been filed with the Fatikchhari Police Station and are under process.

data.name: Abdul Aziz
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The bullet-ridden bodies of Aziz and Dipu (identified by The Daily Star as Abdul Aziz and Dipu Kumar Das, respectively) were recovered from Bhatshala road at around 6:30 am on Tuesday, Pangsha Police Station chief Munshi Mofajjel Hossain told bdnews24.com. An official from RAB-8 in the Faridpur camp, who requested not to be named, told bdnews24.com that they had gone to the scene upon receiving information of gunfire between two extremist groups early Tuesday morning. Upon noticing the presence of RAB, the extremists opened fire on them and RAB fired back. The extremists fled the scene at one stage. Then, RAB cordoned off the area and found the bodies of Aziz and Dipu lying there. RAB recovered a single shooter gun, two light machine guns, two rounds of LG bullets, three rounds of bullet casings, one machete, and another sharp weapon from the spot.

data.name: Dipu Kumar Das
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The bullet-ridden bodies of Aziz and Dipu (identified by The Daily Star as Abdul Aziz and Dipu Kumar Das, respectively) were recovered from Bhatshala road at around 6:30 am on Tuesday, Pangsha Police Station chief Munshi Mofajjel Hossain told bdnews24.com.
