RAB recovered a single shooter gun, two light machine guns, two rounds of LG bullets, three rounds of bullet casings, one machete, and another sharp weapon from the spot.

data.name: Yusuf
data.description: A young man named Yusuf (24) has allegedly died due to a beating by RAB in Daudkandi Upazila of Comilla. The incident led Yusuf's family and locals to protest, blocking the Dhaka-Chattogram highway for an hour on Wednesday morning. According to relatives, members of RAB-11 assaulted Yusuf, son of Chunnu Mia, in Mubarakpur village on Sunday night. Yusuf was first taken to Daudkandi Upazila Health Complex and then to Dhaka's Al-Arafat Hospital, where he died on Tuesday night. Yusuf's father, Chunnu Mia, and mother, Begum Necha, allege that local Jubo League leader Aktar Hossain assisted RAB in arriving at their house around 10 pm and began beating Yusuf with sticks. The family tried to stop RAB from taking Yusuf away, forcing them to leave without him. Major Arman Molla Chowdhury of RAB-11 informed local journalists that a team went to Chunnu Mia's house in Mubarakpur of Daudkandi after receiving information about gambling and drug addicts gathering there. The gamblers and drug users fled upon RAB's arrival, and the team left the scene. He denied any incident of beating or injury.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.description: A suspected extremist has been killed in an alleged shootout with the elite force Rapid Action Battalion, near the Saidabad bus terminal of the capital, RAB said. The deceased extremist leader has been identified as enlisted criminal Anwar Hossain, also known as Pichchi Anwar, aged 35. A RAB press release said on Friday morning that they were tipped off by sources that some armed extremists were gathering in the early hours of Friday. A patrol team from RAB-10 and a team from the RAB Crime Prevention Company-2, based in Jatrabari, went on an operation at an open space beside the rail track near the Saidabad bus terminal. Suspecting the presence of RAB forces, the extremists started shooting at the law enforcers, the press release claimed, and an exchange of fire ensued for about 20 minutes.

data.name: Rashidul Islam
data.description: A young man was allegedly beaten to death by Bangladesh Rifles personnel near the Mogholhat border area in Sadar upazila of Lalmonirhat on Tuesday night. The BDR men also allegedly threw the body of Rashidul Islam, 27, into the river Dharla, according to the victim's family members. Five BDR jawans from the Mogholhat BDR camp picked up Rashidul, from Chawratari village of the upazila, from a grocery shop in the village around 8:00 pm and took him to the bank of the river. The jawans mercilessly beat him, resulting in his death on the spot. Rashidul cried out for help during the beating, but no one came to his aid due to fear of the jawans, as alleged by family members and locals.

data.name: Elahi Baksh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) members killed a suspected extremist in a "shootout" at Rajshahi's Baghmara Upazila in the early hours of Wednesday. RAB officials claimed that the deceased, Elahi Baksh alias Mithu, 35, was an active member of the outlawed Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML). Mithu, the son of Anisar Rahman from the Upazila's Goalkandi village, had been on the run for a long time. Assistant Police Superintendent Shahjahan, in charge of Baghmara Camp under RAB-5, told bdnews24.com that a RAB team, informed by sources that some extremists were holding a secret meeting, conducted an operation at a mango field in the Bagichapara area at around 2.45 am. Suspecting the presence of RAB, the alleged extremists opened fire. Shahjahan said there was an exchange of fire for about ten minutes. Mithu's body was discovered after his companions escaped.

data.name: Shahidul Islam Chanchal
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Tejgaon Industrial Area in the capital early yesterday. The deceased, Shahidul Islam Chanchal, also known as Bhagne Chanchal, 35, was a nephew of Sweden Aslam, a top criminal who is now in jail serving a life sentence. Chanchal was killed in a gunfight with RAB in front of the BSTI (Bangladesh Standards and Testing Institution) office in the area around 1:30 am, according to Md Jahangir, sub-inspector (SI) of Tejgaon Industrial Area Police Station, as told to The Daily Star. "He is the owner of Janata Builders and also a first-class contractor," said Manager of Janata Builders, Md Mintu. "A group of plainclothes men, who introduced themselves as law enforcers, came to his [Chanchal's] Dhanmondi residence at around 12:30 am and took him away in a microbus. "In the morning, we learned that he is dead," Mintu said. RAB-2 officials said one of their patrol teams signaled the car Chanchal was riding in, but he did not stop and went into the side lane instead. The team then followed the car and at one stage cordoned it. Chanchal fired twice at the RAB personnel, prompting them to fire back. Later, they recovered the bullet-hit body of Chanchal, according to RAB officials.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Police and villagers gave two different explanations for the killing of Nurul Islam, 60. Policemen and Zebu's family members were locked in an argument as Zebu's father, Nurul Islam, asked about the cause of the arrest. At one stage, the police opened fire, and Nurul received a bullet in his left thigh and bled to death. Soon after, villagers surrounded the policemen, and they quickly released the arrestee and left the scene. However, Superintendent of Police, Habiganj, Mohammad Ali Miah, told the Daily Star yesterday afternoon that a team of five DB police officers arrested Zebu. While returning from the village with the arrestee, villagers attacked the policemen after Zebu shouted that dacoits had caught him. All the police personnel sustained injuries in the attack, and they opened fire in retaliation, causing the death of Nurul Islam.

data.name: Mokhlesur Rahman
data.description: Mokhlesur Rahman, 40, died in police custody in Goshairhat upazila of Shariatpur district on Tuesday evening. Mokhlesur's wife, Morsheda Begum, alleged that her husband died from police torture. Goshairhat police arrested Mokhlesur, a sweeper by profession, at Kuchaipatri Bazar on August 29 in connection with a case filed for killing two children of Faisal Ahmed from Mashurgaon village. He was interrogated at Goshairhat Police Station on Tuesday. Later, constable Jalal Ahmed found Mokhlesur hanging with a piece of cloth from the grill of a window inside the police station at 7:30 pm, according to the police. Ekram Ali Mollah, officer-in-charge of the police station, claimed that Mokhlesur committed suicide. An unnatural death case was filed with the police station. The body was sent to the sadar hospital morgue for autopsy. Shariatpur Police Superintendent AKM Shahidur Rahman, who visited the spot, confirmed that the man died in police custody.

data.name: Appel Mahmud Suman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and the police yesterday morning at Rupnagar of Pallabi in the capital. The deceased, Appel Mahmud Suman, 26, was identified by his brother Asaduzzaman Hira at Dhaka Medical College Hospital morgue. He was a resident of Rupnagar's Tin Shed Colony. However, the police named him as Alamgir Hossain. Officer-in-Charge of Pallabi Police Station, Iqbal Hossain, told The Daily Star that following an attempt around 12:30 midnight to break into a four-storey under-construction building at C block of Eastern Housing 2nd phase, locals chased a gang of five to six robbers. A team of patrol police joined in the chase. The robbers fired on the police while they were scaling the boundary wall of Botanical Garden to flee, the OC said. Suman came in the line of fire when the police team fired back. He received two bullets in his legs while other gang members managed to flee. Suman was admitted to Pangu Hospital at Sher-e-Bangla Nagar where he died around 5:00 am. His body was later sent to DMCH morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Abdul Rashid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An outlaw leader was killed in a shootout between the Rapid Action Battalion and his cohorts in Santhia Upazila of Pabna early yesterday. Abdul Rashid, 52, a leader of the banned outfit Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-red flag), was accused of several cases, including three for murder. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Rab raided Bilshalangi village of the upazila where a gang of outlaws was holding a secret meeting, Rab said.

data.name: Alimul Islam Ratan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A high-profile leader of the banned extremist political outfit, Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML Lalpataka), was killed in an alleged "shootout" with RAB in the early hours of Thursday in Rajshahi. The elite force, Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), claimed that the death of Ratan, also known as Titas and identified by New Age as Alimul Islam Ratan, marked the end of an era for Lal Pataka. The alleged shootout occurred at Thandar Para village in Bagmara Upazila at around 1 am. According to a press release from RAB-5, the intelligence team at the Bagmara camp had received information that the top leaders of the banned party were meeting with zonal leaders to reform the party. The party had been without direction since the death of its former Rajshahi commander, Elahi Box Mithu, on August 25 in another shootout. Acting on a tip-off, a RAB-5 team positioned themselves at a mango orchard in Thandar Para village at around 1 am. When the extremists suspected the presence of RAB, they attempted to flee. The release claimed that when RAB personnel chased the alleged extremists, they started firing at the law enforcers, forcing the RAB personnel to fire back in self-defense. Titas' body was found, while his companions managed to escape after a 20-minute gunfight, according to RAB.

data.name: Sharif
data.description: Police said Sharif was killed in a mob beating. However, his father claimed that he was arrested by the police and beaten to death while in police custody.

data.name: Mannan Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Kushtia, two people were killed in an encounter with the police and the elite force Rapid Action Battalion. The law enforcers claimed that a 'gunfight' took place in the early hours of Thursday at Darbeshpur village under Alamppur Union of Kushtia. The police identified the deceased as Mannan Molla, 45, from Darbeshpur, and Mohammad Ali Mandal, 42, from Khardda Bakhil village, near the Islamic University area. Kushtia Assistant Superintendent of Police (Sadar circle) CA Halim told bdnews24.com that, acting on a tip-off that some 'extremists' were conducting a secret meeting, a team of Rapid Action Battalion-12 of Kushtia unit, police intelligence, and the district police force raided a bamboo bush in Darbeshpur at about 2:30 am on Thursday. Suspecting the presence of the law enforcers, the 'extremists' started firing. Halim said there was an exchange of fire for about 20 minutes. The bodies were discovered after their companions had escaped. Local residents identified the bodies on Thursday morning. Molla was a local leader of the outlawed political organization 'Ganamukti Fauz,' and Mandal was an activist, Kushtia police chief Asaduzzaman claimed. "The deceased had eight cases, including five murder cases, filed against them with the Islamic University and Mirpur police stations," Asaduzzaman said. The bodies were sent to Kushtia General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Mohammad Ali Mandal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Kushtia, two people were killed in an encounter with the police and the elite force Rapid Action Battalion. The law enforcers claimed that a 'gunfight' took place in the early hours of Thursday at Darbeshpur village under Alamppur Union of Kushtia.
