Suspecting the presence of the law enforcers, the 'extremists' started firing. Halim said there was an exchange of fire for about 20 minutes. The bodies were discovered after their companions had escaped. Local residents identified the bodies on Thursday morning. Molla was a local leader of the outlawed political organization 'Ganamukti Fauz,' and Mandal was an activist, Kushtia police chief Asaduzzaman claimed. "The deceased had eight cases, including five murder cases, filed against them with the Islamic University and Mirpur police stations," Asaduzzaman said. The bodies were sent to Kushtia General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Akhtaruzzaman Khushbu
data.description: RAB claimed that the deceased, Akhteruzzaman Khushbu, 38, was a top criminal of Sandwip, Chittagong. Mostafizur Rahman, an assistant police superintendent and also a RAB-7 official, said the police received information that Khushbu and his gang had gathered on the Dhumkhali dike to commit some sort of criminal activity. When a RAB team raided the area, similar to other shootout or gunfight incidents, which were previously labeled as crossfire incidents by the law enforcers, Khushbu was killed when the suspected criminals exchanged fire with the RAB personnel. However, unlike the other gunfights, Khushbu was found wounded but alive after his companions managed to escape, Mostafizur claimed. Subsequently, however, it was reported that Khushbu succumbed to his injuries after being admitted to the local Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Mozam Sardar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of the outlawed Biplobi Communist Party (BCP) was killed in a shootout with law enforcers in Harinakunda upazila of Jhenidah early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Mozam Sardar, 32, son of Baburali Sardar of Pultadanga Taherhuda village in Harinakunda. Jahangir Alam, officer-in-charge (OC) of Harinakunda Police Station, said a joint force of Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) and Harinakunda police raided a field in Gopinathpur village based on information that eight to ten members of the outlawed party were gathered for a clandestine meeting at 3:00 am. The outlaws, sensing their presence, opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, said Jahangir Alam. Mozam Sardar was found dead on the spot after the gunfight, although his accomplices managed to flee, the OC said. The deceased Mozam Sardar was accused in five cases, including murder, abduction, and robbery. Police recovered two light guns and seven bullets from the spot. The victim's body was sent to Jhenidah Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Dipak Das
data.description: Dipok's wife claimed that the police asked for a Tk 30,000 bribe from him and that he was tortured to death for not being able to pay the money.

data.name: Mohammad Idris
data.description: Idris's mother alleged that he was tortured to death for stealing an energy bulb.

data.name: Sahidul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The Kushtia police have killed an alleged extremist in a so-called gunfight. The incident took place in the early hours of Wednesday at the Shwastipur village under Sadar Upazila. The deceased person was identified as Shahidul Islam, 35, son of Chand Ali from Bholadia village. CA Halim, assistant superintendent of police (Sadar circle), told bdnews24.com that the district and detective branch of police had jointly raided the Shwastipur village at about 1 am, based on information that a group of 'extremists' were arranging a secret meeting in a bamboo grove. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the 'extremists' apparently opened fire on the police. The police also exchanged fire in 'self-defense.' Shahidul's dead body was recovered from the spot, after the 'extremists' had escaped, at the end of a 25-minute gunfight.

data.name: Kazi Fazlur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: An expelled leader of the ruling Awami League (AL) was killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) at Bastuhara in Dumuria upazila of Khulna yesterday. Rab Sub-inspector Haridas Mazumder also sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight," Rab claimed. The deceased was identified as Kazi Fazlur Rahman, also known as Mohabbat. He was accused of several criminal charges, including the killing of freedom fighter Altaf Hossain. Mohabbat was expelled from the post of cultural affairs secretary of Khalishpur upazila unit of AL for his alleged involvement in Altaf's murder. Jahanara Begum, Altaf's wife, filed a murder case with Khalishpur police station one day after he was stabbed to death in front of their Khalishpur residence on May 26. Lt Col Mohammad Shoaib of Rab-6 said a Rab patrol team signaled Mohabbat to stop his motorbike at about 3:00 am. Mohabbat was returning to Khulna city from Dumuria accompanied by two of his accomplices. At one stage, they opened fire on the law enforcers, triggering a "gunfight." Mohabbat was caught in the line of fire while two of his accomplices managed to flee.

data.name: Amzad Hossain Mollik
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional leader of the outlawed Gono Bahini was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and law enforcers at Bhedmari village of Mirpur upazila in the early hours yesterday. The deceased, Amzad Hossain Mollik, 42, was working to regroup the party cadres in the area, police claimed. He was accused in five cases, including three murder charges. A joint team of Mirpur Police Station and the Detective Branch (DB) of the police raided a village field where Amzad and his associates were holding a secret meeting around 12:15 am. The gang threw two bombs at them, which prompted the police to retaliate with gunshots, added the police. "The law enforcers found Amzad's body on the field after the gunfight," said Assistant Superintendent of Police of Kushtia, Chokdar Abdul Halim. However, his accomplices managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Nazrul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A young man named Nazrul was killed on Monday at 12:15 a.m. in the Tejgaon Industrial Area of Dhaka during what was described as "a crossfire" by RAB. A RAB source told Prothom Alo that Nazrul was the brother of Saidul, who is allegedly a top gangster in Kawran Bazar, Dhaka. No other information was immediately available.

data.name: Faruk Hossain Paban
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: bdnews24.com Pabna correspondent reports that 'Paban' (identified by Jugantor as Faruk Hossain Paban), a 40-year-old top leader of Purba Banglar Communist Party (ML-Lal Pataka), was killed in a gunfight with the RAB at Baraichora village under Ishwardi Upazila in Pabna. RAB claimed to have conducted a raid at Baraichora village after receiving a tip-off about a secret meeting of criminals taking place there. The criminals opened fire on the law enforcers when they realized the presence of RAB. The lawmen retaliated by returning fire. Paban's body was found dead after his companions fled the scene. Police stated that Paban had six cases against him. In 2007, he was arrested once with eight sub-machine guns and 15 rounds of ammunition.

data.name: Rashed Uddin Chowdhury Babor
data.description: Babar (identified by Jugantor as Rashed Uddin Chowdhury Babor), 32, is claimed to be a criminal by RAB and the police. However, his family members allege that Babar's rivals had instigated the elite crime busters to kill him. The body of ruling Awami League activist Babar was found near Meherghona graveyard in the Farid Ahmed College area of the town. "Babar was killed in a gunfight with the RAB around 3:30 am early Wednesday," RAB-7 official Maj Ashfaque told reporters. Mohammad Shahjahan, the chief of Cox's Bazaar Model Police Station, said RAB members brought the body in the early hours of the day. Later, the police sent it to the hospital for autopsy. Babar's brother, Hiru, said his brother was recently charged in a case filed by another leader of the party. Babar went to the High Court for bail. He claimed that Sohel Sarwar Jahan Chowdhury, Jalalabad Union Chhatra League president, might have influenced the RAB for the killing.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An unidentified youth was killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB in the capital. According to the police, the incident took place at Banani Staff Road area on Wednesday midnight. Gulshan Ara, Deputy Inspector of Gulshan Police Station, told bdnews24.com that around 12 o'clock on Wednesday, some youths were preparing to rob. At that time, a patrol team of RAB-1 challenged them and the youth opened fire. A young man (25) was killed on the spot when RAB retaliated. Others ran away. A country gun and two rounds of bullets were recovered from the spot, he said. The police recovered the body and sent it to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital morgue. RAB media and legal wing director Commander Sohail told bdnews24.com, "The deceased youth was a robber. He was killed in retaliatory fire when he opened fire on the patrol party.

data.name: Manik Daktar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) killed two individuals in an alleged 'encounter' in Patharghata Upazila in the early hours of Saturday. RAB sources claimed that both Manik Daktar, 45, and Jahangir Hossain, 40, were pirates. They hailed from Bagerhat's Mongla Upazila. RAB-8 Patuakhali camp company commander Maj Kazi Shamsher Uddin told journalists, "Manik and Jahangir were killed in a shootout in Gyanpara area of Charduani village in south Patharghata around 2.30 am on Saturday." A shotgun, 12 one-shot guns, 2 foreign airguns, 89 cartridges, and a large number of airgun bullets were recovered from the scene. He added that the bodies were handed over to Charduani police camp. Patharghata police chief Sohrab Ali said that they were preparing to file a case in connection with the shootout.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) killed two individuals in an alleged 'encounter' in Patharghata Upazila in the early hours of Saturday. RAB sources claimed that both Manik Daktar, 45, and Jahangir Hossain, 40, were pirates. They hailed from Bagerhat's Mongla Upazila. RAB-8 Patuakhali camp company commander Maj Kazi Shamsher Uddin told journalists, "Manik and Jahangir were killed in a shootout in Gyanpara area of Charduani village in south Patharghata around 2.30 am on Saturday." A shotgun, 12 one-shot guns, 2 foreign airguns, 89 cartridges, and a large number of airgun bullets were recovered from the scene. He added that the bodies were handed over to Charduani police camp. Patharghata police chief Sohrab Ali said that they were preparing to file a case in connection with the shootout.

data.name: Abdul Mannan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Abdul Mannan, 40, the regional leader of Lal Pataka, a faction of the banned outfit Purba Banglar Communist Party, was convicted in a murder case, while Fayez is an accused in several criminal cases. Acting on a tip-off, a Rab team raided the Kadamtoli area of Belkuchi upazila where Mannan and his cohorts were holding a meeting in a brick kiln around 3:15 am, as reported by our Sirajganj correspondent. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the activists of the outlawed outfit opened fire at the law enforcers, pushing them to retaliate. Rab claimed that Mannan was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Fayez Ahmed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A RAB team challenged a gang of eight to ten men in the Tribardi area of Sonargaon upazila around 3:00 am when they were allegedly preparing for a robbery, as reported by our Narayanganj correspondent. Rab claimed that, fearing arrests, the criminals started shooting at the law enforcers, leaving the force no choice but to strike back. Fayez Ahmed, 30, was hit by a bullet during the gunfight and died on the spot, while the rest of the gang fled. Rab recovered a revolver, a locally made gun, and a sharp weapon from the scene.

data.name: Gulzar Hossain
data.description: One person was killed in the so-called 'crossfire' during a gunfight with RAB in Faridpur early on Saturday. The deceased was identified as Gulzar Hossain, 38. The shootout occurred in the early hours of Saturday near Piyarpur Government Primary School in Sadar Upazila, according to a RAB-8 press release. It also stated that Hossain and a few other miscreants were holding a secret meeting near the school around 2 am. Acting on a tip-off, a RAB-8 squad raided the place around 3 am when the gang fired at the elite force. The RAB squad retaliated in self-defense. At one stage, the miscreants ran away, leaving Hossain wounded with bullet shots. He was sent to Faridpur Medical College Hospital where the doctors on duty declared him dead. Hossain's body was kept in the hospital morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Shamsher Momin
data.description: One person was killed in the so-called 'crossfire' during a gun battle with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Mohammadpur area of the city in the early hours of Wednesday. The victim was identified as Shamsher Momin, also known as Shimul, a 31-year-old resident of Kamrangirchar area in the capital. Shafiul Sarwar, the assistant director of RAB-2, stated that they conducted a raid at Dhaka Park in Mohammadpur based on a tip-off about a gathering of criminals. Suspecting the presence of law enforcement, the 'extremists' opened fire, leading to a gun battle with RAB. Sarwar mentioned that the criminals managed to escape, while Shimul was found with a bullet wound after the exchange of fire between them and the law enforcers. Shimul was immediately taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the attending doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Matilal Shikder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A member of an outlawed extremist group has been killed in a shootout with the police in Khulna. The deceased has been identified as Matilal Shikder, a member of the outlawed New Biplobi Communist Party, according to the police. The incident occurred in the early hours of Sunday. Dumuria police chief Mohammad Abdul Aziz told bdnews24.com that Shikder, the regional leader of the party, and his assistants were holding a meeting at Khoriar Bil under Gutudia union in the district's Dumuria Upazila. When a police squad, acting on a tip-off, raided the area, the party members fired at the police. The police retaliated, and during the confrontation, all party members except for Shikder managed to escape. Shikder, who was critically injured, was taken to Dumuria Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. The body was sent to Khulna Medical College Hospital Morgue on Sunday morning for an autopsy.

data.name: Aksad Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Aksad Ali, a member of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Lalpataka), was allegedly killed in a crossfire by a joint force of RAB and the police.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two people have been killed in a so-called shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion in Savar. The incident occurred in the early hours of Friday near the Savar Cantonment. A RAB-4 team, acting on a tip-off, went to the location on Bishmile-Zirabo road, near Morning Glory School, around 3 am, according to Savar camp commander Maj Sheikh Tareque Aziz. Plainclothes RAB personnel were stopped by a gang of five or six individuals. When the group realized they were RAB officials, they opened fire on them. The RAB officials also fired back in self-defense. The two alleged gang members were found dead at the scene when the gang fled after a 30-minute shootout. The deceased individuals could not be immediately identified. RAB personnel recovered two foreign-made revolvers, 10 rounds of bullets, six bullet casings, and two knives from the location. Dewan Koushik Ahmed, Ashulia police sub-inspector, informed bdnews24.com that the bodies were found with three bullet wounds each and were later sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy. Two cases with Ashulia police are currently underway, he added.

data.name: Abdul Baten
data.description: Abdul Baten was killed by the police.

data.name: Fazal Haq
data.description: The deceased has been identified as Fazal Haq, 42, son of the late Ayub Ali from Lamapara, under the Sadar Upazila of the district. Fazal, also known as "Cadre Fazlu," was accused in eight cases, including murder, filed with the Shiddhirganj Police Station, according to Rab sources. A Rab press release states that a team from Rab-11 confronted a gang during a secret meeting at Naya Ati Housing area in the upazila around 2:30 am. During the encounter, the gang opened fire on the elite force members, prompting them to retaliate. Fazal was shot during the gun battle and was immediately taken to the Khanpur 200-bed hospital in the district, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Imran Hossain Bappi
data.description: A detainee at Jessore Kotwali Police Station has died in custody. The deceased has been identified as Imran Hossain Bappi, 24. He was arrested on Saturday noon and taken into custody, where he died at 11 pm. The police and Bappi's family have given conflicting accounts of his death. The police have claimed that Bappi committed suicide, while his family accused the police of torturing him to death. Kotwali police chief Moazzem Hossain told reporters that Bappi was arrested from the Shankarpur area on Saturday noon with a few sachets of heroin. A case under the Narcotics Control Act had also been filed against Bappi, the police officer said. Moazzem said that Gazi Abdur Rahman, a sub-inspector, arrested and brought Bappi to the police station. He was kept in custody after initial questioning. "At about 11 pm, he committed suicide by hanging himself from the ventilator of the cell," Moazzem added. Bappi's father, Ali Hossain, of Shankarpur Jamaddarpara area refuted the police claims and told reporters, "My son was beaten to death.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A mugger was killed in an alleged shootout with Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) personnel in Ashulia early on Tuesday. RAB-4 Savar Camp commander Maj Sheikh Tarek Aziz said a group of three to four muggers had swooped in on a man traveling by rickshaw from Bishmile to Gakulnagar around 1:15 am. A little beyond the military police check-post, the muggers had stopped the rickshaw and tried to rob the man. Hearing the man's call for help, a RAB patrol team rushed to the spot. The muggers opened fire on them and RAB personnel retaliated, the RAB officer said. A gunfight that erupted went on for more than half an hour when the rickshaw-puller and the man escaped from the scene. After half an hour, the muggers retreated, but one of them was killed in the shootout, according to RAB's version. RAB recovered a foreign-made revolver, one magazine, five rounds of bullets, and one empty shell from the scene. The recovered body of the unidentified mugger was sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital for an autopsy. Ashulia Police Station sub-inspector Kazi Khairul Alam said the man had six gunshot wounds on his chest, throat, and hands. Two cases were being filed in connection with the incident, he said.

data.name: Abdul Kuddus
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional leader of the outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-Janajuddha) was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) at Garamara village in Jhenidah Sadar upazila. The deceased was identified as Abdul Kuddus, also known as Boma Kuddus, 35, son of Montaj Uddin, also known as Kune Mondol, from Ashwasthali village in the upazila. Kuddus, the regional chief of the banned group, was wanted in eight cases, including murder, according to the police. Assistant Superintendent of Police Md Rezaul Islam of Jhenidah Rab unit stated that a team from Rab-6, acting on a tip-off, confronted a gang that was roaming the area at around 4:30 am. Sensing the presence of Rab, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight. The outlaws managed to flee the scene at one point. Later, Rab found Kuddus with a bullet wound and rushed him to Jhenidah Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Hakim
data.description: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) personnel have killed a key leader in Habiganj's narcotics dealers' network in an alleged shootout. Abdul Hakim, 45, a notorious drug dealer in the district, was shot dead by the elite force during a shootout that occurred in the early hours of Thursday at Belghar bus stand in Noapara village, under Madhabpur Upazila. RAB-9 Srimangal camp commander Kawser Mahmud told bdnews24.com that a RAB team, led by deputy assistant director Biplab Kumar Roy, was patrolling near the bus stand on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway around 2.30 am. They challenged Hakim and his henchmen, who then opened fire at the RAB team, triggering a retaliation. The gang fled the scene following a 15-minute gunfight. RAB personnel discovered Hakim's body and informed the police. Madhabpur police recovered the body on Thursday morning and sent it to the Upazila health complex for an autopsy, Mahmud added. He continued that a foreign-made pistol loaded with five rounds of bullets, a sharp-edged metal weapon, 100 bottles of foreign alcoholic drinks, 50 bottles of banned Indian cough syrup Phensidyl, and nearly 5 kilograms of marijuana were recovered from the spot.

data.name: Sagor Sohel
data.description: A teenage boy died in police custody at the city's Jatrabari five days into his detention on November 30 at Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH), allegedly from police torture, claimed his family members yesterday. The victim, Sagor alias Sohel, 17, was an employee of a workshop in Nayanagar. However, police denied the allegation, saying that locals handed over the boy to the police in the early hours of November 26 on charges of mugging. Nurul Islam, the brother of the victim, said police had picked up Sagor, along with four others, during the pre-hartal mass arrest while he was on his way to their home in Kutub Khali. Nurul Islam claimed that police tortured Sagor as his family had failed to give Tk 50,000 to Shahin, a sub-inspector (SI) of Jatrabari Police Station. "We offered Tk 3,000, which he refused to accept, and implicated my brother in a mugging case after torturing him severely," Nurul Islam alleged. SI Shahin, however, denied the allegation, saying he did not have any information regarding the arrest as Ismail Hossain, another SI, had made the arrest.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the capital's Gulshan area early yesterday. RAB officers recovered one pistol, three bullets, and two mobile sets from the scene. The identity of the deceased, who was approximately 30 years old, could not be immediately determined. Captain SM Shafiqur Rahman stated that a patrol team of RAB signaled two youths on a motorbike to stop at a checkpoint near Gulshan Shooting Club around 1:20 am yesterday. Ignoring the signal, the youths opened fire on the RAB officers, forcing them to retaliate with bullets that injured the passenger. The other youth, however, fled the scene on his motorbike, Captain Rahman added. The injured youth was immediately taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH), where the attending doctor pronounced him dead around 2:30 pm, according to the captain.

data.name: Tipu
data.description: A youth has been killed in a so-called shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the capital. The incident occurred in the early hours of Monday in Bangshal. The deceased was identified as 'Tipu' alias Killer Tipu, 21. RAB-10 Deputy Director Kismat Hayat told bdnews24.com that two RAB personnel were on a rickshaw in civilian clothing near the Armanitola field around 4 am. Three miscreants stopped their vehicle and searched it. Recognizing the passengers as the elite force, the group opened fire, triggering a shootout. RAB personnel were assisted by other members of the team who were waiting nearby. After a while, the gang fled, leaving 'Tipu' dead at the spot. A foreign-made pistol and three rounds of bullets were recovered from the scene. Bangshal Police Sub-Inspector (SI) Anwar Hossain told bdnews24.com that the body was sent to Sir Salimullah Medical College Hospital, commonly known as Mitford Hospital, for autopsy.

data.name: Siraj Mia
data.description: Siraj Mia was allegedly tortured to death by the police.

data.name: Abdullah Mohammad Nazimuddin Babu
data.description: RAB-3 Assistant Director Manjur Morshed Ansari told bdnews24.com that during the early hours of Friday, a RAB patrol at Malibagh asked three people riding a bike to stop. One of them was Honda Babu (reported by New Age to be Abdullah Mohammad Nazimuddin Babu). "The RAB personnel fired when the bikers started firing at them," he said. The RAB official said two other bikers, however, managed to escape. Ansari also said a pistol and two rounds of ammunition were seized from the spot. The body has been sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy, he added.

data.name: Durjoy Babu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: RAB-6 Meherpur camp commander, Assistant Police Superintendent Sheikh Zahidul Islam, told bdnews24.com that a RAB patrol surrounded a bamboo garden beside Malsadaha-Hariadaha road in Gangni around 4 am on Sunday after hearing shots coming from inside. "The miscreants fired around 10 rounds, and RAB fired around 30 rounds in response," he said. Afterwards, RAB personnel recovered the body of Bacchu, also known as Durjoy, a revolver, an LG, four rounds of ammunition, and some drugs from the scene, he added. Gangni Police Station's officer-in-charge, Motiar Rahman, said, "Bachchu had 11 cases, including six for murder, filed against him with the police station and the adjacent Alamdanga Police Station.

data.name: Al Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Barisal police, referring to RAB, said a patrol of the elite force stopped around eight people near Pyarpur Bridge around 4 am on Friday. The RAB patrol chased them and fired several rounds when they tried to run away. Bakerganj Police Station chief Shawkat Anwar told bdnews24.com that he sent a police team when the RAB informed him. Sub-inspector Moniruzzaman, who was in charge of the police team, said they recovered the body of Alamain, a shotgun, a nine-mm pistol, three rounds of ammunition, and a knife from the spot. Police said Alamin had 17 cases, including four for robbery, against him with the police station. But Alamin's wife, Rupa Begum, alleged that one 'Sabuj', a rival of Alamin, conspired with RAB to kill her husband.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two people have been killed in a so-called shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion in Savar. The incident occurred in the early hours of Friday near the Savar Cantonment. A RAB-4 team, acting on a tip-off, went to the location on Bishmile-Zirabo road, near Morning Glory School, around 3 am, according to Savar camp commander Maj Sheikh Tareque Aziz. Plainclothes RAB personnel were stopped by a gang of five or six individuals. When the group realized they were RAB officials, they opened fire on them. The RAB officials also fired back in self-defense. The two alleged gang members were found dead at the scene when the gang fled after a 30-minute shootout. The deceased individuals could not be immediately identified. RAB personnel recovered two foreign-made revolvers, 10 rounds of bullets, six bullet casings, and two knives from the location. Dewan Koushik Ahmed, Ashulia police sub-inspector, informed bdnews24.com that the bodies were found with three bullet wounds each and were later sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy. Two cases with Ashulia police are currently underway, he added.

data.name: Shahid
data.description: A youth was killed in an alleged shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the city's Bhashantek. The deceased was identified as 'Shahid,' also known as Jamai Shahid, 26. Referring to RAB-4, Kafrul police sub-inspector (SI) Masudur Rahman told bdnews24.com that the shootout occurred around 3 am on Monday, near a field at East Bhashantek. The police took Shahid to Dhaka Medical College Hospital in critical condition, where the doctors on duty declared him dead. SI Rahman said, again referring to RAB sources, that two weapons were recovered from the spot.

data.name: Mosharraf Hossain Musa
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A group of banned leftist organization Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-ML Red Flag) members has been killed in a RAB 'shootout' in Kushtia's Daulatpur Upazila. The deceased has been identified as Mosharraf Hossain Musa, 35, from Angdia village, Khalishakundi Union. RAB-12 Kushtia unit commander Maj S M Kamruzzaman informed reporters that based on a tip-off, one of their teams conducted a raid at Chatarpara field in the village during the early hours of Thursday. Musa and his group members were having a secret meeting there. Upon sensing their presence, the group opened fire, forcing the RAB team to retaliate. Eventually, the other members of the group managed to escape from the scene. Musa's body was discovered lying on the ground. The RAB team also seized two firearms and four live bombs from the location. Doulatpur police chief Alamgir Hossain informed bdnews24.com that Musa has four pending cases against him. The body has been sent to Kushtia General Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Azizul
data.description: Azizul's wife said he was arrested by the police on December 14th for stealing rice and was released the following day with severe injuries and torture marks on his body. He was taken to a hospital and died on the 18th.

data.name: Taku Alam
data.description: Taku Alam, 30, was shot dead in an alleged shootout with the RAB at Balurmath of Hazaribagh's Gajmahal around 2 am on Monday. The RAB said he was a criminal listed in both RAB and police records. He was an associate of the top criminal 'Emon'. RAB assistant director Mohammad Shafiul Sarwar told bdnews24.com that a RAB patrol unit, acting on a tip-off, conducted an operation in the area, where a group of criminals opened fire at the RAB personnel. However, as the RAB members retaliated, they fled the scene. Alam was later apprehended at the location with gunshot wounds and was taken to Mitford Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead. A foreign-made pistol, a light gun, a magazine, ammunition, three credit cards, a foreign phone SIM, and various drugs were recovered from the scene, the RAB official added. Alam resided at 290/3 Tali Office Road, Hazaribagh. He was originally from Munshiganj. He had six cases pending with Hazaribagh and Mohammadpur police stations.

data.name: Mohammad Mamun
data.description: In Tangail, an alleged "arms trader" was killed in another "shootout" with the RAB at Sener Makulla village under Simla Union of Tangail's Gopalpur Upazila around 12:30 am on Monday. The deceased was identified as Mohammad Mamun, 25. Gopalpur police chief Abul Khayer said an RAB-12 squad set out to recover arms from Mamun's residence and subsequently engaged in an encounter with Mamun and his group near a brick field. The encounter left Mamun dead on the spot, from where RAB personnel recovered two light guns, one foreign-made revolver, and eight rounds of ammunition.

data.name: Anisur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged regional leader of the Janajuddha faction of the Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-Janajuddha), identified as Anisur Rahman alias Anis Master (45), was killed in a shootout between his associates and the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) at Varara village of Pabna Sadar sub-district in Pabna District on December 21, as reported by the Daily Star. The RAB claimed to have recovered a rifle, one revolver, an LG, 10 bullets, and some sharp weapons from the scene.

data.name: Imtiaz Hossain Abir
data.description: On January 10, Imtiaz Hossain Abir, a 17-year-old student at Mohammadpur Northern College, was killed in a shootout in Pallabi, Dhaka. The police claimed that he was a member of a robber gang. Abir resided in Rupnagar area of Mirpur with his father, Qazi Golam Faruq, who is the deputy general manager of Titas Gas, and his mother, Monwara Begum, who works as an officer in the Mirpur branch of the same organization. His elder sister is a teacher at a private university, and his younger brother is a student at Monipur High School. Abir's uncle, Abu Zafar, informed bdnews24.com that there were no previous cases against Abir. Firoz Hossain Molla, the operation officer of Pallabi police, confirmed this. However, the police officer admitted that they had filed three cases against Abir on the same day - one under the Arms Act, one for attempted robbery, and another for attacking the police. According to Molla, the Pallabi police conducted a raid at Balur Math in Rampura based on a tip-off. He stated that the police fired at the robbers, who were having a meeting at the location. "Abir, who was among them, was shot in the leg," the police officer added. He also mentioned that a revolver was found at the scene. Abir's uncle alleged that his death was a result of police negligence. He questioned, "How could someone be shot in the leg and die?" When asked why they had not filed a case against the police, he replied, "They have portrayed Abir as a robber. If we file a case, Abir's father might be implicated as an arms dealer.

data.name: Humayun Kabir Biplob
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his associates and members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) at Shahjahanpur in the capital early yesterday. The deceased, Humayun Kabir Biplob, 37, was an Awami League activist of ward-33 of the city. RAB-3 officials claimed that he was a listed criminal. Shirin Kabir, his widow, rejected the claim and said Biplob was a mineral water trader in Motijheel. She said some plainclothes RAB members picked him up from their West Rampura residence around 10:45 pm on Tuesday. "This morning [yesterday], we heard that he was shot dead," she told The Daily Star. He was very close to local lawmaker Rashed Khan Menon, said Kamruzzaman, the owner of the house he had been living in for three years. Biplob left behind two children. According to RAB officials, a RAB-3 patrol team challenged a suspicious gang of four in Shahjahanpur Jhilpar area around 3:30 am today. Sensing danger, the gang opened fire at the RAB members who retaliated with gunshots, triggering a "gunfight". They also said they recovered a revolver and two bullets from the spot. "Biplob was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. At one stage, his cohorts fled the scene," said a RAB-3 official preferring anonymity. RAB officials claimed that Biplob was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. A number of people in the area, however, were surprised to hear the RAB version of the incident. One Abdul Kadir, who lives by the railway track, said he saw Biplob's body lying on the ground at Jhilpar. Asked by the police, he helped them pick up the body in a police van yesterday morning. Another resident, Taslima, said she heard two to three gunshots but could not say if it was a gun battle. Tofazzol Hossain, Officer-in-charge of Motijheel Police Station, said Biplob was accused in three cases filed with his station but could not ascertain the charges against him. Mijanur Rahman, Deputy Additional Director (DAD) of RAB-3, said his bosses knew everything about the shootout.

data.name: Sheikh Shah Alam Apu
data.description: Apu (identified by The Daily Star as Sheikh Shah Alam Apu), 27, a resident of Bangshal in Old Dhaka and son of the late Sheikh Ahmed, was gunned down in the early hours of Thursday near Chitra Cinema Hall. Police recovered his body around 9 am and took it to Mitford Hospital for an autopsy. Deputy Director of RAB-10 unit, Ismat Haider, said Apu died in a 'gunfight' with the elite crime force at around 4:30 am. He said plainclothes RAB members were on patrol near the cinema hall when they came across five young men gathering there. As their activities seemed suspicious, the RAB team challenged them. At one point, the group opened fire and the RAB had to retaliate, he added. Haider said Apu died on the spot while others fled, leaving his body behind.

data.name: Shaymol Bepari
data.description: A youth has been killed and another injured in a so-called 'crossfire' with the police in the city's Rampura area early on Saturday. The victim, 'Shyamal' (identified by The Daily Star as Shaymol Bepari), 25, hailed from Kishoreganj, while the injured 'Anik', 20, came from Munshiganj. The shootout occurred in the early hours in the Balurmat area of West Rampura, said Rampura police sub-inspector Swadhin Chandra Talukder. Talukder said a group was trying to hijack around 2 am and opened fire at the patrolling police squad, which chased them. The police retaliated in self-defense, he said. At one stage, the miscreants fled the scene, leaving the two injured. Later, the police took them to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where 'Shyamal' expired in the morning.

data.name: Jewel
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) yesterday evening at Pargendaria in the city's Keraniganj. The deceased, identified as Jewel alias Polti Jewel, 26, was an associate of Kala Jahangir, who was also killed in a shootout with RAB, said RAB sources. Upon receiving information that Jewel and his cohorts had gathered in front of a cold storage at Pergendaria, a team from RAB-10 went to the area around 6:45 pm and cordoned off the place, said Maj Harun Ur Rashid, deputy director of RAB-10. The criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate. During the gunfight, Jewel was shot in the head while his accomplices managed to flee.

data.name: Nabir Hossain Dabir
data.description: According to Iqbal Hossain, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Pallabi Police Station, a team of Rab-4 went to the Bauliabadh area of the city around 4:00 am to apprehend some criminals. Upon seeing the Rab men, the criminals began firing at the law enforcers. The Rab team retaliated and, unfortunately, Dabir was fatally shot. However, Dabir's accomplices managed to escape. Iqbal stated that a revolver, a single-shot firearm, and two bullets were recovered from the scene. The OC identified Dabir as the second-in-command of Zamil Group, a criminal gang that operates in the area. Dabir resided in Kalshi, Pallabi, and was accused in multiple cases filed with Pallabi Police Station, according to the OC.

data.name: Khalek Hawlader
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and members of the elite force, Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), in Barguna. The deceased has been identified as Khalek Hawlader, a 45-year-old ringleader from Badarkhali village in Sadar Upazila. The gunfight occurred at Gourichanna Bazar in the early hours of Saturday. Kazi Shemsheruddin, the commander of RAB-8 company, informed bdnews24.com that a RAB patrol team confronted a group of 5-6 youths as they were crossing Gourichanna Bazar at midnight on Friday. "They opened fire on us when we asked them to stop, which forced us to retaliate. After the gunfight, Khalek was discovered at the scene with bullet wounds." Shemsheruddin stated that Khalek was taken to Sadar Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Asgar Ali
data.description: A young man has been killed in a shootout between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the city. RAB Senior Assistant Director Nurul Amin told bdnews24.com that the incident took place around 2 am on Tuesday in the Manikdi Chowdhurykunja area under Cantonment Police Station. The deceased was identified as Asgar Ali, 35. The RAB official claimed a patrol team of RAB personnel came under attack when they approached a group of men roaming around suspiciously. When the patrol team returned fire, a gunfight erupted between the youths and the elite force members, leaving Asgar wounded, Amin said. He said Asgar was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he was pronounced dead at around 3 am.

data.name: Hafizul Islam Reza
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged operative of the Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP) was killed and another injured in separate "shootouts" with law enforcers in Pabna early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Hafizul Islam Reza, 35, the military commander of PBCP (ML-Janajuddha). Following a tip that Reza, who had been on the run for the last few days, was heading to his village home, a team from Rab-12 raided the village. They found Reza in front of a wetland and asked him to surrender, said Rab. Instead of obeying, he opened fire on Rab members, prompting retaliation. Sources said Reza was shot during the "gunfight" and died on the spot.

data.name: Abdul Hamid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional commander of Purba Banglar Communist Party (Lal-Pataka) was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and law enforcers at Ataikula in Pabna early yesterday. The deceased, Abdul Hamid alias Thosha Hamid, 32, son of Abdur Rashid of Kakilakhali village in Ataikula, was accused in a number of cases including three for murder, police said. A police team raided Kakilakhali village shortly after midnight following a tip-off that Hamid and his gang were holding a secret meeting there, said Habibul Islam, officer-in-charge of Ataikula Police Station. When the team reached near Kakilakhali Beel at about 3:30 am, the gang opened fire on law enforcers suspecting them as their rivals.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged extremist was killed in a so-called "shootout" with law enforcement in Jhenaidah early on Saturday. The Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and police said the deceased, Belal Hossain, was a member of Ganabahini, an extremist political organization. The incident took place in the early hours of Saturday at Bhayna village, they said. Harinakundu police station OC Jahangir Alam told bdnews24.com that a patrol unit of RAB arrived at a field near the village after hearing an explosion. A police squad also joined them. Alam claimed that when the law enforcers approached the field, a group of extremists opened fire, triggering the shootout that left Hossain injured. He was taken to Harinakundu Upazila Health Complex where the doctor on duty declared him dead. RAB-6 Jhenaidah camp captain Maj Shakhawat Hossain confirmed Belal's identity.

data.name: Md. Azibor Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional commander of Purba Banglar Communist Party (Lal Pataka) was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and law enforcers at Chatmohor upazila of Pabna early yesterday. The deceased, Md Azibor Rahman, 35, of Falia in Ataikula upazila of the district, was accused in six cases including two for murder, according to police sources. A police team raided Megharpara village at about 3:30 am following a tip-off that two factions of PBCP were locked in a gunfight there, said Syed Shahid Alam, officer-in-charge of Chatmohor Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the outlaws opened fire on them, starting a 40-minute gunfight between the criminals and police. At one stage, the outlaws fled the scene. Police later found Azibor's bullet-hit body lying on the ground, said the OC.

data.name: Maksudul Haq Khan
data.description: Maksudul Haq was allegedly beaten to death by the police.

data.name: Hasan Ali
data.description: Locals handed over Hassan Ali, 40, the son of Afsar Mollah from the village of Arkandi in Faridpur upazila, to the police allegedly after rescuing a five-year-old boy from him on February 14. However, Hassan died in the lockup of the Faridpur police station that night, and his body had injury marks, according to sources. The police immediately claimed that the victim committed suicide in the lockup. Pabna Police Superintendent Jahangir Hossain Matobbar suspended the on-duty officer SI Md Akhter Hossain and constable Golam Mostafa for negligence of duty and formed a four-member inquiry committee headed by Additional Superintendent of Police Md Mosharaf Hossain to investigate the incident. Denying the allegation of torturing Hassan to death, OC Md Abu Jafar said the police will face the case through the legal process.

data.name: Waliur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A pirate was killed in a shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) on the estuary of the Baleshwar River in Patharghata Upazila of Barguna early yesterday. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-8 conducted a raid in the Geyanpara area of Chardoani at about 3:20 am and confronted a notorious gang of pirates, locally known as the "Krishna-Sagor Bahini." Sensing their presence, the pirates opened fire on the elite force members, prompting them to retaliate. The gang leader, Waliur Rahman, also known as Krishna, 40, was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while his cohorts managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Dulal Bepari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two people have been killed in an alleged shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion and police in Shailkupa, Jhenidah. The incident occurred in the early hours of Friday by the Kali River at Jayantinagar village. The deceased have been identified as Moshiur Rahman, also known as Modhu or Misti, aged 31, from Shantidanga village under Islamic University police station in Kushtia; and Dulal Bepari, also known as Dulal Kashai, aged 33, from Padmanagar village under Harinakundu upazila of Jhenidah. A RAB-6 team, along with police personnel, went to the spot on the bank of the Kali River around 3:25 am, following a tip-off, said RAB-6 camp commander Maj Shakhawat Hossain. "When the combined patrol team chased the extremists, they opened fire on the patrol team. The RAB officials also fired back in self-defense," claimed the major. The two alleged gang members were found wounded at the spot when the gang ran away after a 20-minute shootout, he added.

data.name: Mashiur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two people have been killed in an alleged shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion and police in Shailkupa, Jhenidah. The incident occurred in the early hours of Friday by the Kali River at Jayantinagar village. The deceased have been identified as Moshiur Rahman, also known as Modhu or Misti, aged 31, from Shantidanga village under Islamic University police station in Kushtia; and Dulal Bepari, also known as Dulal Kashai, aged 33, from Padmanagar village under Harinakundu upazila of Jhenidah. A RAB-6 team, along with police personnel, went to the spot on the bank of the Kali River around 3:25 am, following a tip-off, said RAB-6 camp commander Maj Shakhawat Hossain. "When the combined patrol team chased the extremists, they opened fire on the patrol team. The RAB officials also fired back in self-defense," claimed the major. The two alleged gang members were found wounded at the spot when the gang ran away after a 20-minute shootout, he added.

data.name: Motaleb
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A shootout between pirates and members of the Rapid Action Battalion in the Tagra Ferryghat area in Pirojpur's Zianagar upazila on Tuesday night left Motaleb dead. Lt Col Munir, the commander of Rab-8, said the gunfight erupted when a joint team of Rab-8 men from Barisal and Rab-6 men from Khulna went to the area to apprehend Motaleb after tracking him through his mobile phone. The Rab men captured Motaleb, who had been shot, while his associates went into hiding.

data.name: Azizul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a team of Alamdanga police raided an abandoned house at Khaskarra village where Azizul and his men were holding a "secret meeting" at about 4:15 am, said the police. Sensing their presence, the gang threw two bombs targeting the law enforcers who retaliated, triggering a gunfight, the police added. Azizul Islam received gunshot wounds during the fight while his cohorts managed to flee the scene, said Officer-in-Charge Ahsan Habib of Alamdanga Police Station.

data.name: Kamrul Islam Tipu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Police said Kamrul Islam Tipu was a listed criminal and the leader of a gang named 'Tipu Bahini.' Acting on a tip-off, a team of Rab-11 went to Dakshin Misapur village at about 3:00 am where Tipu and his cohorts were preparing to rob a house. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire at the elite force members, prompting them to retaliate. Tipu was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, though his cohorts managed to flee the scene, said the police.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An unidentified pirate was killed by RAB in a shootout.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An unidentified pirate was killed by RAB in a shootout.

data.name: Raisuddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a team of Rab-12 raided an orchard in Modhupur at approximately 12:15 am, where the gang was holding a meeting. Sensing their presence, the gang opened fire on the elite force members, prompting them to retaliate. Raisuddin was struck by multiple bullets and died instantly, while his accomplices managed to escape the scene. Rab recovered his body from the location, along with two firearms, four bullets, and three sharp weapons.

data.name: Minu Parvez
data.description: A youth has been killed in a shootout with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and his associates in Keraniganj. South Keraniganj police chief Abul Bashar told bdnews24.com that a gunfight between a squad from RAB-10 and Tana and his associates took place at Khejurbagh early on Tuesday, leaving Tana dead. Police said Tana, 30, was wanted in a number of cases, including two murders. A shotgun and three rounds of bullets were recovered from the scene. The body was sent to Sir Salimullah Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy, Bashar said. Prothom Alo identified Tana as Minu Parvez alias Tonu alias Dadabhai.

data.name: Russel Ahmed Bhutto
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "shootout" between his accomplices and the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) in the old part of the capital early yesterday. The deceased, identified as Russel Ahmed alias Bhutto, 35, was the son of Nasiruddin and resided in Proshonno Poddar Lane. Russel was a listed criminal and was accused in 22 cases, including six for murder, alleged the officials of Rab and the police. However, Russel's family members denied the allegation and claimed that Rab had picked him up from the capital's Moghbazar on March 3. Golam Mustafa, the uncle of Russel's wife, said they had contacted Rab following the arrest early this month, but they denied the occurrence of any such event. "We wanted to file a general diary with Kotwali Police Station in this regard on March 5, but the police refused to do so," he added.

data.name: Mohammad Faisal Roni
data.description: A man arrested on suspicion of being a mugger allegedly died from torture in the city's Dhanmondi police custody yesterday. Refuting the allegation, the police said Md Faisal, also known as Roni, 40, succumbed to his injuries from a mob beating during the arrest in the Dhanmondi playground area on Tuesday. Roni was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital around 3:00 pm, where doctors declared him dead. Sources from the hospital morgue said the body had several marks of injury.

data.name: Gopal Chandra Das
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: The officer in charge of Kadamtoli police station, Ayubur Rahman, told bdnews24.com that the incident took place in the WASA Battola area around 2:30 am on Thursday. Police said the victim, Gopal Chandra Das, 29, was a resident of West Jurain and an identified terrorist in the area with 10 to 12 cases, including murders, against him. Gopal was killed in a gunfight between a Rapid Action Battalion (RAB)-10 patrol team and the criminals, according to Ayub. However, Gopal Chandra Shil's father alleged to New Age that the law enforcers had picked his son from the Dhaka court premises on 22.3.11 when he was coming out after appearing in court for a case. Kadamtali OC Kazi Ayubur Rahman said a patrol team of RAB-10 challenged Gopal and his associates when they were holding a meeting near the WASA tank at Shyampur. The group then fired at the battalion personnel, who fired back, resulting in a 'gunfight'. Gopal died on the spot.

data.name: Faruk Miah
data.description: An under-trial prisoner died at Narayanganj General Hospital in the early hours of Saturday. The deceased was identified as Faruk Miah, 32, son of Borhan Uddin from the Baburail area of the town. The district jail superintendent said police arrested Faruk in a drug case on March 22. The court sent him to jail on March 25 after two days of remand in custody. Faruk was rushed to the hospital as he experienced severe chest pain, where the attending doctor declared him dead late at night. Faruk's wife, Selina Begum, claimed that her husband died due to torture while in remand.

data.name: Rashedul Islam
data.description: Flight Lt Khairul Mamun of Rab-4 said a patrol team challenged Rashed and his gang while they were holding a "secret" meeting near High-Tech Hospital at Kachukhet at about 2:30 am. Sensing Rab's presence, the gang opened fire at them, compelling them to shoot back. Rashed was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while his accomplices managed to flee the scene, he said. Rashedul's family, however, told New Age that the battalion personnel in plainclothes had picked him up from a place behind the Sharif Market on March 29, 2011, when he was chatting with some of his friends. Rashedul's wife, Iti, also said that law enforcers had picked him up. She, along with others in the family, went to the nearby police station and the battalion camp to know Rashed's whereabouts. "But none could give any information on him.

data.name: Nurul Islam Sumon
data.description: A young man was killed in Dhaka in an alleged gunfight with the police, a day after the prime minister reiterated her stance against extrajudicial killings. The police claim that 'Sumon' (identified by The Daily Star as Nurul Islam Sumon), 30, a criminal, was killed in a gunfight in the early hours of Friday at Mirpur Botanical Garden. Saha Ali, the police chief, Abdul Latif, told bdnews24.com that 'Sumon' was accused in several cases, including three murders at Mirpur Police Station, and the police had been looking for him. "Tracking 'Sumon', the police reached the Botanical Garden around 1 am on Friday. His associates began firing on the police, and the police fired back. "After about half an hour of shooting, the associates 'escaped', while 'Sumon' was found lying dead," the police chief claimed.

data.name: Shafiqul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber has been killed, allegedly in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Araihazar. The gunfight took place in the Gopaldi Dakkhinpara area of the Upazila early on Monday. The deceased was identified as Shafiqul Islam, 42, son of the late Chan Mia of Daudkandi Upazila in Comilla. A RAB-11 press release said that acting on a tip-off, a team raided Gopaldi Dakshinpara where a group of men were reportedly preparing for a robbery. Sensing the RAB's presence, the robbers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight. At one stage, Shafique was caught in the line of fire while his associates managed to flee. The wounded Shafiqul was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where the doctors declared him dead. Shafiq's wife, Tahmina Begum, claimed to New Age that he had been picked up by the RAB on April 3, 2011, after he had gone to the Dhaka High Court to seek bail in a murder case.

data.name: Moniruzzaman Rubel
data.description: Mujahidul Islam, a doctor at Tangail General Hospital, told reporters that police brought Rubel, who owns a drug store, to the hospital in an unconscious state around 9:40 am on Thursday. "We tried to regain his consciousness with the help of oxygen, but in vain as he died within five minutes," he said. The victim's uncle, Asaduzzaman Moni Arju, said SI Mosharraf picked Rubel up and his neighbor Shariful Islam, 23, from Rubel's Adan Medical Pharmacy on Wednesday noon on charges of stealing a motorbike from the police officer. Arju said Shariful was released around 10 pm the same day. "Mosharraf and other cops beat up Rubel severely," he alleged. Officer-in-charge of the police station Jasim Uddin Sarker told bdnews24.com that Rubel had a case and a complaint against him for stealing the motorbike. "He was arrested following the case and sent to the hospital as he fell sick in the morning," he said.

data.name: Shafiqul Islam Raja
data.description: A youth died in police custody while undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) yesterday. The deceased is Shafiqul Islam Raja, 22, an employee of a cloth shop in the Sadarghat area in the capital. Raja's family members alleged that he died due to torture in police remand. According to family sources, Raja had a feud over land with his maternal uncles. They bribed the police to detain him. The police picked him up before filing any case and then showed him arrested in a pending murder case, claimed family members. Later, he was remanded for three days and tortured inhumanely. Anwara Begum, the mother of the deceased, told The Daily Stat that her father had five kathas of land at Begumganj lane in the Narinda area. Her brothers denied giving her a share of the land. They beat up Raja following a row over the land on April 11, and on that night, the police detained him from the Sutrapur area, she added. Raja told his cousin Mohammad Bappi at the hospital that law enforcers tortured him in remand. He also showed injury marks on his hands and legs. Contacted, Sub-inspector Jahangir Kabir Khan of Sutrapur Police Station said Raja was accused in a case for killing Ansar member Anisur Rahman on March 12. Three gunmen shot dead Anisur at a security checkpoint in Sutrapur. “We arrested him on April 12 from Sutrapur in that case and took him on a three-day remand from April 14 to 16,” added the SI, also the investigation officer (IO) of the case. Jahangir denied allegations of taking a bribe and torturing Raja, claiming Raja was injured in a clash with his relatives before the police picked him up.

data.name: Tikka Khan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An outlawed party leader was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and the police in Ataikula early yesterday. The deceased, Tikka Khan, 35, was the Ataikula unit chief of the Purba Banglar Communist Party (Lal Pataka). Hailing from Haripur village in Ataikula, he was accused in a number of cases, including four murders, according to the police. Sources informed law enforcement that some outlaws were moving towards Ataikula from Chandail of Atgharia. Acting on the information, a team of Ataikula police took positions at Shimulchura around 3:30 am, said Md Habibul Islam, officer-in-charge of Ataikula Police Station. Sensing the police's presence, the gang opened fire on them, forcing retaliation. Tikka was caught in the shootout and died on the spot, while his associates managed to flee the scene, added the OC.

data.name: Ziarul Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of the Janajuddha faction of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-ML) was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and Rab at Goashbari village under Ataikula Police Station in Pabna early yesterday. Ziarul Rahman, 28, also known as Bomaru Zia, son of Mofiz Uddin from the village, was the operational commander of the outlawed party. Habibul Islam, the officer-in-charge of the police station, said a patrol team of the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) challenged a gang of outlaws near Goashbari High School at about 3:00 am as they were suspiciously roaming there. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the outlaws opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back. Ziarul was caught in the line of fire while trying to flee the scene.

data.name: Akida Khatun
data.description: Police arrested Akida Khatun, also known as Begum, on May 2, 2011. Her mother claimed that the police tortured her and forcibly administered drugs into her mouth. Later, the police admitted her to Jessore Hospital, where she died on May 3rd.

data.name: Nayeem Mia
data.description: Nayeem's brother claimed that he died due to inhumane torture by the police in their custody. However, the police said Nayeem died due to a mob beating.

data.name: Mohsin Ali
data.description: A college student who was shot by the police in Dakkhin Khan in the city on April 28th succumbed to his injuries at Apollo Hospital yesterday. Mohsin Ali, 21, a first-year honors student in the management department at Government Titumeer College, died at 6:00 am. Police shot Mohsin in the right leg while he and his friend were crossing a police checkpoint on a motorcycle in Ashkona of Dakkhin Khan around 10:00 pm on April 28th. Dakkhin Khan police said they shot Mohsin as he fired at them, defying their order to stop in front of the checkpoint. Mohsin's mother, Ashiya Khatun, alleged to New Age that some of her relatives had provoked the police to kill Mohsin over a land dispute. Police claimed that Mohsin was wounded in a gunfight after the youth opened fire on the police when challenged. Mohsin died on May 12th, 2011.

data.name: Quddus Fakir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two pirates were killed in a gun battle with a joint team of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and Coast Guard in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat yesterday. A joint team of RAB-8 and Coast Guard conducted a raid at Dimer Char of Sharankhola range of East Sundarbans in the morning, said Lt. Bodruddoza, the operation officer of Coast Guard (west zone). Sensing their presence around 11:30 am, the pirates fired, targeting the law enforcers who retaliated, triggering a gunfight, told Yakub Ali Khan, Coast Guard's petty officer, also a member of the team, to The Daily Star. The gunfight left two pirates dead on the spot.

data.name: Jahangir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two pirates were killed in a gun battle with a joint team of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and Coast Guard in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat yesterday. A joint team of RAB-8 and Coast Guard conducted a raid at Dimer Char of Sharankhola range of East Sundarbans in the morning, said Lt. Bodruddoza, the operation officer of Coast Guard (west zone). Sensing their presence around 11:30 am, the pirates fired, targeting the law enforcers who retaliated, triggering a gunfight, told Yakub Ali Khan, Coast Guard's petty officer, also a member of the team, to The Daily Star. The gunfight left two pirates dead on the spot.

data.name: Md. Hamid Ali Khorshed
data.description: Police arrested Hamid on 18 May 2011 in drug and theft cases. The court sent him to jail on May 19. The jailer of Noakhali jail, Mahabubul Alam, said Hamid was rushed to the hospital on 26 May as he felt sick, where the attending doctor declared him dead. Hamid's family claimed to the Naya Diganta newspaper that he died due to torture by the police.

data.name: Abdullah Al Mamun
data.description: Mamun's family claimed that he was allegedly killed in police custody by the DB. They also alleged that Mamun had been tortured to death, as his body had multiple injury marks. They said Mamun's in-laws conspired with the DB police to have him killed while in custody. The DB police stated that Mamun had been arrested for drug possession based on information gathered by the DB branch. They claimed that Mamun had committed suicide by ingesting raw heroin.

data.name: Julfukar Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Julfukar Ali, also known as Julfu, a pirate, was killed in a shootout with RAB. Three other pirates also died in the shootout. Acting on a tip-off, RAB personnel went to Boro Shelar Khal in Supoti on three trawlers and confronted a gang of at least eight pirates who were roaming around the area on a trawler around 9:30 am. The gang opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to return fire, said Major Sabbir. The four individuals were killed on the spot during a one-and-a-half-hour-long gunfight. The remaining pirates disembarked on the bank of the canal and fled the scene, he added. Later, RAB members recovered the bodies and seized the firearms.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged dacoit was killed in a gunfight between the police and dacoits.

data.name: Nasir Ahmed Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The leader of a gang of pirates was killed in a shootout between his accomplices and the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab), while a policeman was injured in Botiaghata upazila of the district early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Nasir Ahmed Sheikh, 32, the leader of the notorious 'Nasir Bahini' of the Sundarbans responsible for crimes ranging from extortion and kidnapping to robbery and murder in the Sundarbans and around the coastal belt, said a press release from Rab-6. Abdul Quader Beg, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Botiaghata Police Station, said a joint squad of Rab and local police conducted a raid in Narayankhali around 4:20 am when the pirate gang was allegedly waiting to collect ransom from fishermen. Sensing the police presence, the pirates opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight that lasted for 15 minutes, said the OC. Nasir was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while his cohorts managed to flee the scene, he added.

data.name: Nur Hossain
data.description: One suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight between the police and his cohorts at the capital's Porabosti slum in Kalyanpur early yesterday. The police arrested three members of the gang, one of whom was shot, and recovered a private car, one pistol, five bullets, and two sharp weapons from their possession, said Kazi Wazed Ali, the officer-in-charge of Mirpur Police Station. Assistant Sub-inspector Zamilur Rahman was also injured in the leg during the gunfight. He was admitted to Rajarbagh Police Lines Hospital, Wazed added. The deceased is Nur Hossain, 32, who succumbed to his injuries at Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) around 5:45 am, approximately five hours after being shot in the leg.

data.name: Lutfur Rahman Ripon
data.description: Lutfur Rahman Ripon's family claimed that he died due to police torture while in their custody. His wife said that on 14.8.11 at about 10.00 pm, SI Ahsan Habib called Lutfur and he went missing that night. The next morning, on 15.8.11, Lutfur's dead body was found hanging from an electric pole.

data.name: Mamtaz Uddin Ahmed
data.description: Police arrested Mamtaz Uddin Ahmed, a Supreme Court lawyer and former deputy attorney general, at his Segunbagicha residence on August 11 on charges of assaulting police and obstructing them from discharging their duties on the SC premises on August 2 and 4. A source in the court said that police never informed the court about his arrest and hospitalization until August 17, despite being legally obligated to do so within a day. Selina stated that an unconscious Ahmed was admitted to the National Institute of Cardiovascular Diseases (NICVD) after suffering a heart attack five hours after his arrest. Ahmed regained consciousness two days later and was in a state of panic and fear towards the policemen. Selina mentioned that her husband was dragged into the police vehicle and was slapped and assaulted inside. Ahmed was then taken to a dark room where he was beaten up by police officials, according to Selina.

data.name: Shahed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Shahed, a bandit, was killed in a gunfight with RAB.

data.name: Manwar Hossain Monir
data.description: A young man died from his injuries while receiving treatment in police custody at Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital yesterday. The deceased is Manwar Hossain Monir, 28, from Gilatoil village in Jaintapur upazila. Monir sustained the injuries while in Rab custody after being arrested nine days ago, according to Altaf Hossain, the deceased's elder brother. He also claimed that the body had several injury marks. However, Rapid Action Battalion (Rab)-9, at a press conference in the city yesterday afternoon, denied the allegation, stating that the arrestee was in good health when he was handed over to the police on September 15. Within hours, the arrestee was handed over to Chhatak police in good condition. The police sent him to Sylhet Central Jail through a court on the same day. Monir, who was seriously ill, received initial treatment at the jail hospital for three days and was then transferred to the medical college hospital on Monday, according to Monir's brother, Altaf.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: A person named Nazrul Islam (50) from Gabbunia village in Rampal upazila of Bagerhat has died unexpectedly. The family alleges that he died due to police torture. On the other hand, the police claim that Nazrul died due to the impact of a tempo. Local people, including Nazrul's relatives, blocked the Bhaga-Rampal road following Nazrul's death. Nazrul's family members alleged that brutal police torture led to his death. They said Safayera Begum, the wife of Nazrul's younger brother Sofrul Islam, lodged a written complaint with Rampal police station against Sofrul, and the police went to his house on 24.9.11. Not finding Sofrul at home, the police took Nazrul to the police station and severely beat him, causing critical injuries. Later, the police took him to Rampal Jhanjhania health complex, where he died. Denying the allegation of torture, Rampal police station OC Shahidul Islam said Nazrul Islam was injured in a road accident, and local people took him to Jhanjhania health complex.

data.name: Zakir Hossain Poran
data.description: Zakir Hossain Paran (33) from Bara Mehdipur village in Begumganj upazila allegedly died in Noakhali Jail due to police actions. His family claims that his death was a result of police torture, describing Paran as an upstanding individual unfairly targeted by the police. On September 7, Paran and two others were arrested by Begumganj Police and sentenced to 7 days without labor. Although scheduled for release on September 15, Paran's family was informed on September 14 that he was critically ill. After being admitted to Noakhali General Hospital, he was transferred to Dhaka's Dhanmondi Renesa Hospital and then Bangladesh Medical College Hospital, but his condition did not improve. He died on Monday.

data.name: Rawshan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Rawshan, a pirate, was killed along with three other pirates by RAB-8 in a gunfight. A team of Rab-8 on three trawlers was patrolling the area around 11:00 am when they noticed suspicious movements of another trawler on the Bhoirav river near Dhanichabari of the upazila, said Lt Col Monirul Haque, commanding officer of Rab-8, who led the operation. The Rab team challenged the trawler. After some time, passengers from that trawler fired on the law enforcers, prompting them to fire back. At one stage of the firing, the pirates entered a canal of the Sundarbans forest, anchored their trawler, and fled. Later, the Rab members recovered four bullet-ridden bodies from deep within the forest.

data.name: Mukul Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mukul Hossain, 30, a regional leader of the banned outfit Biplobi Communist Party, was wanted in seven cases, including two for murder and four for abduction, according to The Daily Star's Jhenidah correspondent, quoting Maj Sakhawat Hossain, commander of Jhenidah Rab camp. A joint contingent of Rab and police cordoned off a field at Pairadanga village in Harinakunda upazila around 3:10 am after receiving information that a group of criminals were holding a secret meeting there, Maj Sakhawat said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the outlaws fired shots, prompting the security men to retaliate. After the gun battle, Mukul's bullet-ridden body was found lying on the spot, while his accomplices managed to flee. He was rushed to Jhenidah General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A team of RAB personnel raided a char area at Bilmaria in Lalpur upazila around 3:30 am after receiving information that some criminals were holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of the elite force, Jahangir's accomplices fired shots, prompting the RAB personnel to retaliate, which resulted in a gunfight, according to Squadron Leader Kamrul Islam, the RAB chief in Natore. The body of Jahangir Alam, 45, riddled with bullets, was found at the scene, while his accomplices managed to escape.

data.name: Sumoti Chakma
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: RAB claimed that an unidentified terrorist was killed in a 'gunfight' with terrorists in Jurgachari village of Lakshmichari upazila of Khagrachari. His family and a public representative identified the body of the deceased at Khagrachari Sadar Hospital yesterday evening. They claim that the deceased, Sumti Chakma (55), lives in Paschim Kaang Ghat village of Maschari union in Mahalchari upazila of Khagrachari. Sumati is a farmer, not a terrorist. He went to a relative in Jurgachhari to collect money to fill his elder son's examination form.

data.name: Ziaur Rahman
data.description: Two suspected muggers were killed in a shootout after a team of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) opened fire on the outskirts of Kushtia town. The deceased individuals could not be immediately identified. RAB-12 Captain Abdullah Al Mehedy told bdnews24.com that the battalion members received secret information that a gang of four to five individuals had hijacked an auto-rickshaw from Gazipur and were heading towards Kushtia. The RAB team positioned themselves near Bhadalia on the Kushtia-Jhinaidaha highway and intercepted them around 2:30 am as they were crossing the area. He stated that the three-wheeler skidded off the road and fell into a roadside ditch after being chased by the RAB personnel. The force claimed that five suspects suddenly exited the auto-rickshaw and opened fire on the security officials, prompting them to retaliate in a 20-minute fight. Two of the gang members were caught in the crossfire and died on the spot, while the others fled the scene, according to Mehedy. Prothom Alo identified them as Ziaur Rahman and Abdus Salam, citing family members who accused the RAB of killing them in cold blood.
