data.name: Rekha Begum
data.description: A female prisoner died under mysterious circumstances in Lalmonirhat district jail yesterday. The body of Rekha Begum, 25, the wife of Aminul Islam from Banvasamor village in the district, was sent to the hospital morgue for an autopsy. Jailer Nazrul Islam claimed that the woman prisoner died of a heart attack in the jail hospital at noon, but the victim's family alleged that Rekha was tortured to death by the jail authorities.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of an outlawed organization was killed in a so-called "gunfight" between his accomplices and the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) in Kamarkhand upazila of Sirajganj early yesterday. Rab said Khorshed Alam, 34, was a regional commander of Lal Pataka, a faction of the extremist outfit Purbo Banglar Communist Party. He lived in Jatibari Rasulpur village of the same upazila. Khorshed had a number of cases, including five for murder, pending against him. Rab-12 director Lt Col ATM Anisuzzaman told The Daily Star that a team led by deputy assistant director Mafiz Uddin raided Char Tangrail village around 2:30 am based on information that a gang of miscreants was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing trouble, Khorshed and his accomplices opened fire on them, prompting the elite force personnel to retaliate. Khorshed died on the spot while his cohorts managed to flee the scene, the Rab officer said. Rab members later recovered a foreign-made revolver, four local guns, three rounds of bullets, and sharp weapons from the spot. A case was lodged in connection with this incident.

data.name: Md. Roman
data.description: The victim's wife claimed that the DB police took Md Roman, a shopkeeper, from his shop on October 29, 2011, and beat him. The DB police demanded 500,000 taka as extortion money. Roman's father claimed that the DB police tortured his son to death.

data.name: Mannan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two members of an alleged pirate gang were killed in a three-hour-long gunfight with law enforcement yesterday at the Sundarbans under Dacop upazila in Khulna. The Rapid Action Battalion (Rab-6), West Wing of the Coast Guard, and East Wing of the Forest Guard conducted the operation in the Vedkhali Canal area of Nishankhali around 10:00 am. They claimed that Mannan, 30, and Masud, 38, the alleged associates of infamous pirate Waliur Rahman Razu, were caught in the line of fire during the firefight. Around 25 armed members of the Razu group managed to flee the scene unhurt.

data.name: Masud
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang

data.name: Hossain Raja
data.description: Chowkidar Abdul Halim, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) in Kushtia, stated that two Detective Branch police teams from Kushtia and Mirpur police stations conducted a raid on Boropukuria field at around 1:45 am, where the gang members were having a secret meeting. "Upon sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire and also threw two bombs at the law enforcement officers," ASP Halim said. The police teams retaliated in self-defense, leading to an hour-long gunfight, he added. "After the gunfight ended, we discovered two bodies at the scene," the ASP said, further noting that the police later identified the deceased as Hossain Raja, 27, and Liton Hossain, 28.

data.name: Liton Hossain
data.description: Chowkidar Abdul Halim, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) in Kushtia, stated that two Detective Branch police teams from Kushtia and Mirpur police stations conducted a raid on Boropukuria field at around 1:45 am, where the gang members were having a secret meeting. "Upon sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire and also threw two bombs at the law enforcement officers," ASP Halim said. The police teams retaliated in self-defense, leading to an hour-long gunfight, he added. "After the gunfight ended, we discovered two bodies at the scene," the ASP said, further noting that the police later identified the deceased as Hossain Raja, 27, and Liton Hossain, 28.

data.name: Diplal Robi Das
data.description: Within two hours of his arrest, a man was found dead at Tahirpur Police Station in Sunamganj on Tuesday night. Police claimed that Diplal Robi Das, 45, from Puran Barunka village of Balijuri union, committed suicide, while family members said he was tortured to death. The body of Robi was found hanging from the door with "his shirt" in the toilet around 7:30 pm, Kazi Bazley Maola, officer-in-charge of the police station, told The Daily Star yesterday. Robi's younger brothers, Ranaglal Robi Das and Bangolal Robi Das, however, said that while arresting Robi at their village home, the police did not allow him to wear a shirt. According to the agitating people, the police tortured him to death and were trying to pass it off as a suicide case. They said it is impossible to commit suicide inside a police station.

data.name: Mohammad Shahid
data.description: A young man was killed in a so-called shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) near Balur Math in the city's Bhashantek area early on Saturday. Police identified the deceased as 'Shahid' (Mohammad Shahid, according to The Daily Star), alias Nyara Shahid, 30, a resident of slum 1 in Bhashantek. Referring to RAB-4 sources, Kafrul police sub-inspector (SI) Mohammad Nuruzzaman told bdnews24.com that a group of miscreants had gathered at Balur Math around 2:30 am. The group had opened fire on a patrol unit of RAB-4, triggering the shootout, they claimed. At one stage, the group retreated from the scene, leaving 'Shahid' who was lying injured, they said. But Shahid was declared dead by doctors on duty after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital around 4:10 am, the police official said.

data.name: Mokaddes Moka
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-ML) was killed in a "shootout" between a Rapid Action Battalion team and his cohorts in Alamdanga upazila of Chuadanga early yesterday. The deceased, Mokaddes Moka, 40, of Bhadua village in the upazila, was the regional commander of the party. While patrolling Jamjami village, a team of Rab-6 chased some PBCP members around 2:00 am, according to Rab sources. The outlaws took refuge at a villager's house from where they opened fire on the elite force members. As the Rab men returned fire, a gunfight ensued, said Rab-6 Commander Hasanur Rahman Shanto. Moka was hit by bullets while his associates managed to flee, he said. The bullet-hit Moka was taken to the local health complex where he was declared dead, he added.

data.name: Md. Hasan
data.description: Five youths were killed in a Rapid Action Battalion firing on Sonargaon Janapath in Uttara, the capital, last night. Rab claimed that the deceased were muggers and they were killed during two firefights between Rab personnel and a criminal gang. The "gunfights" occurred between 8:30 pm and 8:45 pm.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Another policeman, seeking anonymity, said the law enforcers had no choice but to stand inactive in the face of agitated fishermen, who far outnumbered them. Barisal range DIG Abdur Rahim said the police found four pirates and an abducted fisherman dead when they searched the area after the gunfight. "The six others were beaten to death by locals as they tried to take shelter on a shoal," he said.

data.name: Babul Hawlader
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Babul Hawlader, a pirate, was killed in a gunfight between his accomplices and RAB.

data.name: Abdul Wahab
data.description: A man was killed in police gunfire as villagers tried to resist the law enforcers from arresting him in Jhenidah early yesterday. The victim was identified as Abdul Wahab, 50, a farmer from Paikpara village in Jhenidah Sadar Upazila, according to our correspondent there. Wahab was known as an honest figure in the area, according to locals. Jhenidah Superintendent of Police, Pankaj Kumar Bhattacharya, said a team from Betai Police Outpost broke open the door of Wahab's home around 12:30 am to arrest him and his son Rokon, as they had been accused in a complaint of illegally occupying land. Pankaj said that when the law enforcers entered Wahab's home, he started shouting and seeking help from his neighbors. Upon hearing him, villagers rushed to the scene and resisted the law enforcers from arresting Wahab and his son. Police said they opened fire on the villagers in self-defense. Wahab died on the spot, according to the SP.

data.name: Abul Kalam
data.description: Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) shot dead an alleged smuggler yesterday at Datbhanga, a bordering beel (water body) area in Sadar upazila. The deceased has been identified as Abul Kalam, 32, son of Efaz Uddin from Baliadanga village in the upazila. BGB sources reported that they chased a large gang of smugglers who entered the country from India through the border with contraband items at around 3:00 am. When challenged, the smugglers attacked the border guards with sharp and lethal weapons, forcing the BGB men to open fire in self-defense. Abul Kalam died on the spot.

data.name: Asif Ahmed Sajeeb
data.description: Referring to RAB officials, Sub-Inspector Mohammad Azizul Islam of Kotwali Police Station said that the alleged gunfight took place in an alley in Tantibazar around 2:30 am. The deceased has been identified as Asif Ahmed Sajeeb, the son of Mofu Mia from Syed Hasan Ali Lane. "A RAB-10 team went to the area based on a tip-off that miscreants were gathering there for extortion. Some youths who were standing in front of a jewelry shop started firing at the RAB team when they were challenged. Sajeeb died when the RAB team repelled the attack," the police officer explained.

data.name: Kibria Fakir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A suspected forest robber, Kibria Fakir, 30, was killed in a gunfight between the gangsters of "Jihad Bahini" and the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and Bangladesh Coastguard members in the Darjar canal area under the Sharankhola range of the Sundarbans on January 19. Nine firearms, 34 bullets, and six bullet shells were also recovered from the spot.

data.name: Abdullah Miah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Commander of Srimangal RAB-9 camp, Kawsar Mahmud, told bdnews24.com that a 40-year-old man named Abdullah Miah died after being caught in a 'crossfire' when the battalion members were attacked by a group of up to 10 suspected robbers. The robbers had stopped a microbus in the sadar upazila area with the intention to rob. The incident occurred near the Alipur Railgate area at around 2:30 am on Tuesday. Mahmud stated that when a RAB-9 patrol team arrived at the scene, two of the robbers got out of the microbus and opened fire at the RAB members. In self-defense, the battalion members had to fire back. Afterward, the robbers fled the scene with the microbus, taking the Alipur-Shahjibazaar road. The commander mentioned that they discovered Abdullah Miah's body at the scene after the microbus had already left.

data.name: Mobarak Hossain
data.description: At least six suspected muggers were killed and two others injured in a 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Narsinghdi Sadar Upazila on Monday, according to an official of the elite force. RAB informed the media that Anwar Hossain was a member of a gang of armed muggers who had snatched Tk 40,000 from a businessman at Narsingdi bus stand. The businessman reported the incident to RAB, who then chased the muggers and killed six individuals in an encounter when they attempted to flee. The families of the deceased individuals claim that they were innocent.

data.name: Md. Momin
data.description: RAB killed Momin in a gunfight. Momin's family claimed that he was picked up by RAB men in plain clothes in front of his house in Purba Charail, Keraniganj at around 3:00 pm on April 1, 2012. He was shot dead in another incident of 'crossfire' with RAB in a narrow street in the Mirpur area on April 2nd.

data.name: Tabibur Rahman
data.description: A person was killed last night in a fight between a team of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and a banned outfit, Ganobahini, at Kadamdi village in Kushtia. The deceased is Tabibur Rahman Tota, 42, from Shantidanga in Kushtia Sadar Upazila. Commander of RAB-12, Major Mahfuz, claimed that Tabibur, who was hit by four bullets, was a member of the party. Acting on a tip-off, a RAB team rushed to the scene when a gang from the outfit surrounded a house. Later, the gang hurled a bomb at the RAB men, Mahfuz claimed, adding that the law enforcers opened fire in response. The RAB men entered the house and found Tabibur dead. The rest fled from the scene, Mahfuz added.

data.name: Md. Alamgir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A gang leader was killed during a gunfight between his cohorts and the police in a hilly area in the port city yesterday. The deceased, identified as Md Alamgir, 27, was the top leader of Alamgir Bahini, a criminal group in Chittagong. The gang was involved in snatching, robbery, and abduction, using an isolated hill in the Central Railway Building (CRB) area as their den, according to the police. Upon noticing the movement of the gang, consisting of five to six criminals, at around 3.00 pm, locals informed the police and surrounded the hill. As the police started raiding the criminals' den, they began firing at the police, discharging around six rounds of bullets, said Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station, Abul Kalam Azad. Assistant Commissioner of Kotwali zone, Abdullah Al Mahmud, who led the raid, told The Daily Star that ASI Md Humayun shot Alamgir in an attempt to apprehend him. Injured Alamgir was rushed to Chittagong Medical College Hospital, where the on-duty doctor declared him dead, according to medical college sources.

data.name: Joynal Abedin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" between their cohorts and law enforcers in Companyganj upazila of the district early yesterday. Two of the deceased were identified as Joynal Abedin, 38, second-in-command of the infamous Nizam Bahini, and Jafar, 30, according to Rab. Acting on a tip-off, a joint team comprising members of Rab-11 and the Coast Guard, led by Rab's Lt Col Mohammad Mostafa, raided Char Balua Island under Char Elahi union around 4:00 am and besieged the robber den, according to Rab sources. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang members opened fire, prompting them to retaliate. During the gunfight, three robbers were caught in the line of fire. Two of them died on the spot, while another succumbed to his wounds on the way to the hospital, as stated by Rab.

data.name: Ibrahim Hossain
data.description: In Natore, prisoner Ibrahim Hossain, 35, son of Abdur Rahman from the village of Matiapara in Sadar upazila, died on Saturday. He was imprisoned in Natore district jail in a drug-related case, according to jail sources. Abdur Rahman, the victim's father, alleged that his son might have died from torture in the jail, as he saw blood on his head and nose. He demanded an investigation into the matter. Refuting the allegation, Prosanta Kumar Bhowmik, Jail Superintendent of Natore, said Ibrahim experienced severe chest pain early on Saturday. He was taken to Natore Sadar Hospital where his condition worsened. He was then transferred to Rajshahi Medical College and Hospital at night. However, the doctors on duty at the hospital declared him dead.

data.name: Shohrab Hossain Hawlader
data.description: The deceased, Sohrab Howlader, 38, was the leader of Sohrab Bahini. Masud Alam, the officer-in-charge of Morelganj Police Station, said that acting on secret information, a team of plain-clothes police conducted a raid at Sohrab's house in the village around 12:30 pm. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Sohrab and his gang opened fire on them, which triggered a gunfight. Sohrab was caught in the line of fire and died, according to Masud.

data.name: Bachchu Miah
data.description: On February 28, four members of a gang were killed in a gun battle with Rab members at Dudhmukhi Canal in the eastern part of the world's largest mangrove forest, under Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat district. Three of the deceased were identified as Jamal Hossain and Montu, also known as Member Montu, from Rampal upazila, and Bachchu Miah from Morelganj upazila of Bagerhat. All of them were members of the notorious "Gama Bahini".

data.name: Ranga Miah
data.description: A youth was killed in a "gunfight" with Rab in Bogra Sadar Upazila yesterday morning. Rab identified the deceased as Ranga Miah, 25, a trader of illegal firearms, whereas the authorities of a school in Sadar said he had worked as an assistant to the driver of a school bus, reports our Bogra correspondent. Describing the incident, Sumit Chowdhury, a senior assistant superintendent of police (ASP) and acting camp commander of Rab-12, told The Daily Star that his team, pretending to be arms buyers, had contacted a gang of illegal firearms traders and arranged a meeting in the Fire Service area. After extensive interrogation about the location of firearms, Ranga took them to an abandoned place nearby, from where Rab men recovered four cocktails and materials used for making explosives. Upon further questioning of the arrestees, Rab learned that Ranga and another member of the gang, Hafizul, had jointly purchased a revolver which they had hidden in a nursery in Rabibari area of the upazila. As the Rab team appeared at the nursery around 9:30 am yesterday, Hafizul began firing at them. He managed to flee but shot Ranga with his gun, injuring him, according to ASP Sumit. Critically injured, Ranga was admitted to Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College and Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries, hospital sources said. Miah's family claimed to New Age that Ranga was not an arms trader and that he worked as an assistant to the driver of a school bus.

data.name: Faruk Hossain Kamal
data.description: Faruk Hossain Kamal's sister has fixed January 26 for the cross-examination. In her statement, Parveen said the accused picked up Kamal from their home in the capital's Kafrul area and demanded Tk 50,000 as ransom. When refused, the trio tortured Kamal in police custody. Later, he was shown arrested in an extortion case and produced before a Dhaka court with a five-day remand plea. However, due to his health condition, the court sent him to jail instead. Kamal was admitted to a jail hospital and later transferred to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he died a week later, as stated by Parveen.

data.name: Abdur Rahim Sheikh
data.description: On February 29, 2012, at approximately 8:00 pm, the policemen of Badargonj Police Station arrested Abdur Rahim Sheikh (60), son of Md. Moez Uddin Sheikh and the late Kamrunnessa, of ward no 8 Sahapur, Mistripara, Badargonj Municipality in Rangpur District. His family alleged that he had been tortured while in police custody. On February 29, 2012, the Mobile Court sentenced him to one year of simple imprisonment. On March 2, 2012, Rahim Sheikh died at Rangpur Medical College Hospital while receiving treatment in the ICU (Intensive Care Unit) at approximately 1:50 pm.

data.name: Mohammad Mintu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Mohammad Mintu received bullet injuries when members of a RAB patrol team fired in retaliation, according to commanding officer Lt Col Abdullah Ibn Zayed. Mintu was described as a "25-year-old gangster" by the RAB-4 officer. He was declared dead when police took him to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Lt Col Zayed said Mintu was part of the "criminal gang that had been preparing for an operation" and that the RAB patrol team had been tipped off. The incident took place near the Kumir Shah Mazar, adjacent to the Mirpur Zoo. The army colonel claimed that his men had come under attack first and were therefore forced to return fire. Shah Ali police station SI Babul Akhtar, who took the injured man to DMCH, told bdnews24.com at 1:30 am (Wednesday) that Mintu was pronounced dead immediately upon arrival at the hospital.

data.name: Jihad
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: At least five robbers, including two ringleaders, were killed in a shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans on Friday. The deceased are ringleader Jihad, 40, and Sohag Farazi, 35, along with their cohorts Al-Amin, 30, Asad Boyati, 32, and Belal, 30, from various villages in Rampal and Sharankhola upazilas of Bagerhat district.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: Around 4:00 am, a plainclothes team of Mohammadpur police signaled a silver-colored car without a registration plate to pull over in front of Allahkarim Jame Mosque at Basila. The vehicle matched the description of the one hijacked from Khilji Road. "The car, with four youths on board, defied the signal and sped away, prompting the police team to pursue it," said Senior Assistant Commissioner Mashiur Rahman of the Detective Branch. Soon, separate teams of DB and Rapid Action Battalion received calls for backup and joined the chase. The car finally came to a halt when it crashed into a power pole near the Basila Bridge. Mashiur said the criminals opened fire on the police as soon as they got out of the car, forcing the law enforcers to respond in kind. The law enforcers found one carjacker dead at the scene and recovered a pistol, two knives, and a police signal light. However, the other three hijackers managed to flee the area. The deceased, Nazrul Islam, was accused in at least seven cases, including four murder charges, police claimed.

data.name: Mostafizur Rahman Mostaq
data.description: An alleged outlaw was killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Bagmara upazila of the district early yesterday. Identifying him as Mostafizur Rahman, also known as Killer Mostaq, Rab said he had been a close aide to the executed leader of Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh, Siddiqul Islam, also known as Bangla Bhai, who had spread Islamic militancy in the country under the banned organization. Mostaq had been leading the banned outfit Purba Banglar Communist Party (Red flag), Bagmara unit, according to Rab sources. According to a press release issued by Rab yesterday, a team of Rab-5 raided Goalkandi village around 2:45 am after receiving information that a gang of outlaws was holding a meeting there to plan "subversive activities". Upon seeing the Rab members, the gang started firing at them. The Rab men fired back, and during the exchange, Mostaq was hit by a bullet while the other outlaws managed to flee. Mostaq was rushed to the upazila health complex where doctors declared him dead, the press release states. At least 15 bullets were exchanged during the gunfight, Rab said in the press release.

data.name: Zulfikar Ali Gama
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mongla police gunned down Zulfikar Ali Gama, the chief of Gama Bahini, a notorious band of Sundarbans pirates, on Wednesday night. Gama was shot during a gunfight with the police at his residence in Siki Sonailtala village, as confirmed by Mongla Police Station officer in-charge Nikhil Chandra Mandal to bdnews24.com. He later died from his injuries at Khulna Medical College Hospital around 9:15pm.

data.name: Masud
data.description: Mohammad Masud, the police claim, was killed on March 25 in a shootout between a group of extortionists and law enforcers. He filed a murder case with the Dhaka Chief Metropolitan Magistrate's Court. According to the case statement, on the night of March 25, the police called Masud out from his residence and took him to a location in the city's Mirpur Zoo area. Police shot Masud dead there and informed the media that he had been killed in an exchange of gunfire between the police and a group of extortionists.

data.name: Bidhan Chandra Biswas
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) claimed that Bidhan Chandra Bishwas was killed as his associates shot at them during a patrol in Samaspur village. The group is notorious in the district. RAB Jhenaidah camp commander, Squadron Leader Abdul Hamid, said that the police also participated in the gunfight in the early hours of Saturday. "A joint patrol of RAB and police went to a mahogany garden in Samaspur village after hearing gunshots in the early hours. The gunfight occurred when the extremists started shooting at us," Hamid said. A body with bullet wounds was found in the garden after the fight had ended, he added. Local people identified him as Bidhan.

data.name: Masud Rana Tushar
data.description: The RAB is claiming that Tushar Masud, a 32-year-old, who was shot dead at the Green Road intersection, was the ringleader of a car and motorcycle-jacking gang. "A RAB patrol signaled the driver of a suspicious microbus to stop. The driver slowed down as if he was stopping but suddenly pulled away and tried to flee," said RAB-2 deputy commander Saiful Karim Saif to bdnews24.com. "RAB personnel chased the vehicle and shots were fired from the vehicle towards them. RAB retaliated and after exchanging gunshots for some time, the microbus eventually came to a stop." Saiful claimed they found Masud's body with bullet holes in the microbus, along with a revolver containing three rounds of ammunition and two mobile phone handsets.

data.name: Abul Basar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A man named Abul Basar was killed by police firing in Sadar Upazila of Magura last Thursday. According to the police, the deceased Basar was an accused in several cases. He was shot while fleeing after the robbery and later died in the hospital. Basar's family claims that the police raided the house in Parla village in the upazila to arrest Basar, and he was later shot dead. Deputy Inspector (SI) of Sadar Police Outpost, Asaduzzaman, stated that he was patrolling the Dhaka Road area of the city around 3:30 p.m. on Thursday. At that time, he witnessed the robbery and chased the robber Basar (40). Basar then entered the nearby Satdoha road. Basar later pointed a pistol at him (SI), and in self-defense, he fired three shots at Basar. Basar was injured and taken to Sadar Hospital around 4:30 PM, where he died.

data.name: M Giasuddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber, namely M Giasuddin, was killed and four policemen were injured in a gunfight in Moheshkhali upazila of Cox's Bazar on 22nd April, the police claimed. Giasuddin was the alleged ringleader of a robbery gang, said Ranjit Kumar Barua, officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station. Upon receiving information, the police raided Giasuddin's house around 2 am when a gang of bandits was holding a meeting there to plan a robbery on a trawler, the OC said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, forcing them to fire back, which triggered the gunfight, the OC said. After the shootout, Giasuddin was found with a bullet wound.

data.name: Shahed Miah
data.description: Shahed, a businessman, was allegedly tortured by members of the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) in Brahmanbaria. BGB members had detained him at their transit camp and beaten him. As a result, he allegedly suffered for four months and then died on 30.04.2012.

data.name: Nabakumar Halder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nobokumar Halder, an alleged member of a robber gang, was killed along with two others in a gunfight with RAB in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat. The deceased were members of a gang locally known as Akash Bahini, said Major Sabbir Rahman Osmani, Deputy commanding officer of Rab-8. He said that based on secret information, they raided a den of the robbers on the bank of Shapla canal around 10 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the RAB members to fire back, Osmani said. After the robbers fled the scene, Rab officials recovered the three bullet-riddled bodies, he added.

data.name: Mihir Roy
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mihir Roy, an alleged member of a robber gang, was killed along with two others in a gunfight with RAB in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat. The deceased were members of a gang locally known as Akash Bahini, said Major Sabbir Rahman Osmani, Deputy commanding officer of Rab-8. After the robbers fled the scene, Rab officials recovered the three bullet-riddled bodies, he added.

data.name: Motaleb Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of the extremist outfit Gonomukti Fauj was killed during a "gunfight" between his team and the Rapid Action Battalion in Kushtia yesterday around 10:30 pm. The deceased, Motaleb Hossain, 45, is the son of Kutub Ali of Khoksha upazila. Yesterday, two Rab teams went to the Mokhlurchar area on information that Motaleb and his associates were preparing for a robbery, said Major Asad of Rab-12 in Kushtia. Sensing their presence, the Gonomukti Fauj activists opened fire, prompting the elite force members to shoot back. After a short gun battle, Rab found Motaleb lying dead.

data.name: Didarul Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The victim was identified as Didarul Alam, also known as Dildar. According to Rab sources, at around 7:00 am, a team of Rab raided the den of the robbers in a dense forest of the upazila. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang of robbers opened fire on them, prompting the Rab team to return fire. The "gunfight" continued for thirty minutes, and Didarul died on the spot.

data.name: Abdul Malik
data.description: Abdul Malik was tortured at the Jokiganj Police Station on the night of June 12, 2012. The next day, June 13, he was taken to court in a case filed under section 54. On June 18, 2012, the court granted him bail, so he returned home on that day. He was severely ill as a result of the torture. Sadly, he passed away on June 23, 2012.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.description: Old Dhaka's alleged top criminal "Dakat" Shaheed and one of his associates, Kalu, were shot dead in what RAB called a 'crossfire' early on Wednesday. RAB spokesperson Commander M Sohail told bdnews24.com that they had information that Shaheed, 42, recently returned to the country after hiding abroad for a long time. "We had information that he returned to Dhaka on Sunday," he added. He was supposed to enter Luxmibazar with his associates on Tuesday night. "Acting on a tip-off, RAB set a trap for him." "Shaheed and his assistant died on the spot after being shot when the Rapid Action Battalion personnel fired on them in retaliation near the city's Luxmibazar area around 12.30 am." Shaheed and Kalu had to stop their motorcycle before a RAB barricade near the entrance to Luxmibazar. "And at one point, out of nowhere, they fired on us first. They were killed on the spot when we fired back at them," he added.

data.name: Kalu
data.description: Old Dhaka's alleged top criminal "Dakat" Shaheed and one of his associates, Kalu, were shot dead in what RAB called a 'crossfire' early on Wednesday. RAB spokesperson Commander M Sohail told bdnews24.com that they had information that Shaheed, 42, recently returned to the country after hiding abroad for a long time. "Shaheed and his assistant died on the spot after being shot when the Rapid Action Battalion personnel fired on them in retaliation near the city's Luxmibazar area around 12.30 am." Shaheed and Kalu had to stop their motorcycle before a RAB barricade near the entrance to Luxmibazar. "And at one point, out of nowhere, they fired on us first. They were killed on the spot when we fired back at them," he added.

data.name: Mintu Hossain
data.description: Two workers of Akij Bidi Factory in Daulatpur upazila were shot dead, and 35 others were injured yesterday as the factory security personnel fired on them when they were agitating for higher pay. The deceased were identified as Mintu Hossain, 30, and Rokibul Islam, 40, of Hosanabad in Daulatpur upazila of the district. Yesterday, they began their protest program around 12:00 noon at the factory's main gate. As the angry protesters began throwing brickbats at the factory, members of Bangladesh Ansar deployed there opened fire on them, the police said. Robiul Islam and Sukhen Karmakar, leaders of the Akij Bidi Laborers' Union, however, said they were carrying out their movement peacefully when the firing took place. Mintu died on the spot, while Rokibul, with severe bullet injuries, was taken to the local Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.description: Two workers of Akij Bidi Factory in Daulatpur upazila were shot dead, and 35 others were injured yesterday as the factory security personnel fired on them when they were agitating for higher pay. data.name: Kala
data.description: Kala, a worker at Akij Bidi Factory, died along with a colleague after Ansar personnel opened fire at a demonstration of Akij Bidi Factory workers demanding a wage hike in Daulatpur, Kushtia on July 15, 2012. Another worker named Kala was critically injured and died on July 17, 2012.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: According to the police, the victim identified as Mohammad Sumon was accused in arms and mugging cases with the Pallabi Police Station. Mohammad Ayub, an additional police superintendent deployed at Rab-4, said a gunfight broke out between four muggers riding two motorbikes and a Rab patrol team on Dhaka Zoo Road around 9:00 pm. After the shootout, the Rab personnel found Sumon lying dead on the ground with bullet wounds. However, the other muggers had managed to flee, Ayub added.

data.name: Mohammad Bhikhu
data.description: Mohammad Bhikhu, an accused in a drug case, died at Adhunik Sadar Hospital in the town on August 25, 2012. Golam Mortuza, the officer in charge (OC) of Sadar Police Station, said a police team arrested Bhikhu from the PTI area on charges of drug possession on August 24, 2012, at around 8:00 pm. His family alleged that Bhikhu was tortured at Chapainawabganj Sadar Police Station and died as a result of the torture.

data.name: Abdul Jalil
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Police shot and killed a local leader of the Purbo Bangla Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist Red Flag) in a gunfight in Mirpur, Kushtia early on Tuesday, according to law enforcement officials. Police stated that the altercation occurred at a brickfield in Kulapara around 3:30am. The deceased individual, Abdul Jalil, 43, had five murder cases against him and had previously been sentenced to 10 years in jail for a violation of the arms act. Senior Assistant Superintendent of Kushtia police, C A Halim, informed bdnews24.com that he led a joint operation involving the Mirpur Police Station and the Detective Branch of police in response to a tip-off regarding an extremist group planning a large-scale act of violence. "The extremists opened fire on us as they became aware of our presence. Jalil sustained gunshot wounds as we returned fire," he stated. Jalil was pronounced dead upon arrival at the Mirpur Upazila Health Complex, Halim added.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: RAB-8 Deputy Commander Maj Sabbir Rahman Osmani said they conducted a raid in the Narikel Baria area in the morning based on information that the gang members of Mortuza Bahini were present in that location. He stated that around 12:00 noon, the RAB team, suspecting something, instructed a boat on Chhapra Canal to stop. However, the gang members on board opened fire on the law enforcement officers and took cover in a nearby forest. The RAB members and the robbers engaged in a firefight for over half an hour. Eventually, the RAB recovered the bodies of two individuals after their associates had fled the scene. One of the deceased was identified as Nurul Islam by New Age, but the identity of the other individual remains unknown.

One of the deceased was identified as Nurul Islam by New Age, but the identity of the other individual remains unknown.

data.name: Iqbal Hossain
data.description: A youth has been killed in a reported "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Ashulia's Khejurbagan area. RAB-1 Commander Rashidul Islam told bdnews24.com that while patrolling the area around 11:30 pm on Wednesday, a RAB team signaled a motorcycle to stop as it looked suspicious. "But without stopping his bike, the rider shot at the RAB. He was killed when the fire was returned," he said. Islam said the deceased was identified as Iqbal, 27, the chief accused in Ashulia's Saiful murder case.

data.name: Rahat Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A top leader of the outlawed Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML) was killed in an alleged 'gunfight' with the police in the Mirpur area here in the early hours of Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Rahat Ali, 45, who, according to law enforcement, was accused in 11 cases, including five murder cases. In a statement, the police claimed that Ali and his associates opened fire at them as they raided the area near Kursha High School, where the outlawed party's activists were planning an attack. The police fired back in retaliation, and the leader was caught in the line of fire around 3 am, it said.

data.name: Lal Miah
data.description: On Tuesday afternoon, four plainclothes policemen went to Sunna village in the upazila. They chased a group of villagers who were playing cards in a field. During the pursuit, the law enforcers apprehended Lal Miah, a 40-year-old resident of the village, on a nearby road. They proceeded to physically assault him and then forcibly submerged him in a pond. Witnessing the incident, locals surrounded the policemen, managed to rescue Lal Miah, and promptly transported him to the upazila health complex. Unfortunately, the doctors at the health complex pronounced him dead. As news of the incident spread, enraged villagers retaliated by assaulting the policemen and confining them to a house.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: On September 27, 2012, the police asked for money from Nurul's Shop. Nurul denied giving it. Thus, ASI Towhidul Islam of Jatrabari Police outpost beat him mercilessly and took him to the Jatrabari Police Station. There, he detained Nurul Islam. Nurul Islam's wife gave 4,500 taka to the officer to free her husband. Later, on October 3, 2012, he died at Al Baraka Diagnostic Center.

data.name: Tofazzal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A 40-year-old "extremist" has been killed in a reported shootout with the elite crime-busting agency, Rapid Action Battalion, at a sandbank in the Padma River at Kushtia's Kumarkhali. The shootout took place at Charshadipur in Kumarkhali's Shilaidah area around 5:15 am on Wednesday, RAB-12 Kushtia Camp Commander, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Naimul Hassan told journalists. "RAB-12 Kushtia and Pabna unit personnel team raided the location on a trawler after being tipped off that extremists were gathering there to plan anarchic activities." "The terrorists, on sensing the presence of the law enforcers, shot at the RAB team boarding another trawler. RAB also retaliated, and an hour-long gunfight ensued." Hassan continued that the extremists retreated from the RAB fire, and the law enforcers found a bullet-ridden body. Locals identified the body as that of Tofazzal Hossain, son of Samir Uddin Mollah of Baruipara Village under Ambaria Union of Kushtia's Khoksa upazila.

data.name: Rony Mia
data.description: A team of Dhaka district police carried out a mission to arrest miscreants in various locations in Ashulia. During their operation, they noticed a speeding microbus on the road. They signaled for the microbus to stop, but instead, the occupants opened fire on them. The law enforcement officers retaliated. Unfortunately, Rony Mia, a second-year student in the commerce division of Mirpur Bangla College, sustained a bullet injury during the incident and later passed away at Savar Enam Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Jamal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Jamal Hossain, also known as Boro Jamal, an alleged criminal, was killed in a 'crossfire' between his accomplices and RAB members in Kachua upazila of Chandpur on October 24, 2012. Law enforcement officials said that based on a tip-off about Jamal and his gang preparing to commit a robbery, a team from Rab-11 of Narayanganj conducted a raid at Bachaiya village in the upazila around 2.00 am. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the gang opened fire on them, forcing the Rab to retaliate. After a gunbattle that lasted for about half an hour, Jamal's body, riddled with bullets, was found at the scene.

data.name: Sailendra Nath Biswas Sailen
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Sailendra Nath Biswas, head of the extremist organization New Biplobi Communist Party, was shot dead in what RAB called a 'crossfire' early on Saturday. RAB-6 official Lieutenant Commander Nur-e-Alam told reporters that Sailen, 48, was killed when a RAB team raided the Salua Bazar area near Rangpur union of Dumuria upazila in Khulna around 3 am. They had received information that he and his associates were meeting there. "Sensing our presence, Sailen and his associates opened fire at us. Sailen received bullet injuries when RAB fired back in self-defense," he added. "Doctors at the Dumuria Health Complex declared him dead when he was rushed there in critical condition.

data.name: Foysal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Foysal, an alleged pirate, was killed along with another individual in a "gunfight" with RAB and police forces at Harintana in Sundarbans in Sarankhola upazila on November 18, 2012. Lieutenant Colonel Farid, the commander of Barisal RAB-8, informed the media that they initiated an operation at the location based on a tip-off that a gang of 12 to 14 pirates were planning to commit robbery in the Sundarbans.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An unidentified alleged pirate was killed, along with another, in a "gunfight" with RAB and police forces at Harintana in Sundarbans in Sarankhola upazila on November 18, 2012. Lieutenant Colonel Farid, commander of Barisal RAB-8, told the media that they launched an operation at the spot based on a tip-off that 12 to 14 pirates from a gang were preparing to commit robbery in the Sundarbans.

data.name: Ershad Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On November 12, 2012, the police of Joypurhat Sadar Police Station arrested Ershad, a BNP activist, without any valid case. The police claimed 10,000 taka from Ershad and subjected him to torture. He was forcefully pressed against the wall, resulting in chest pain, and was beaten on his legs and waist. Sadly, on December 10, 2012, he passed away at the Joypurhat Jail Hospital.

data.name: Md. Nizam Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The deceased was identified as Nizam, 35, son of M Ruhul Amin, a resident of Shiba village in Ramgati upazila of Laxmipur. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Rab-11 raided a betel nut garden of one Azharul Islam in the village where Nizam, along with his cohorts, took position to commit a robbery at about 3.00 am, said Lieutenant Colonel Nawrose Ahsan, who led the operation. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang opened fire on the elite force. The Rab members also fired back in retaliation, triggering a gunfight in which Nizam was killed while his accomplices fled, added Nawrose.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: A youth was shot dead in an alleged encounter with the police at Pallabi, while a local Awami League leader was gunned down by some unknown miscreants at Jurain in the capital last night. Pallabi police rushed to Section-7, Mirpur when the youth, Shah Alam, 25, and two other criminals tried to commit extortion in front of a garment factory around 8:30 pm, claimed Officer-in-Charge Abdul Latif Sheikh. At one stage, the criminals shot at the police, forcing them to fire back and injuring the youth, said the OC. Alam was declared dead at Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam Majumder
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: BNP leader Rafiqul Islam Majumdar was found dead in Kushtia hours after he was allegedly picked up by the Rapid Action Battalion in Jhenidah on Saturday evening. When contacted, Lt Col Ziaul Ahsan stated yesterday that Rab had not picked up Rafiqul and that they were trying to find out who had and killed him later.

data.name: Nasir Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The Additional Police Superintendent of Cox's Bazar, Babul Akhtar, informed reporters that as part of his regular patrol, he was going to Pekua at one and a half o'clock on Saturday night. On his way, when he reached the Mohachhonia cut area on the Chakaria-Pekua-Mognama road, nearly 20 armed robbers had barricaded the road to stop his car. At that time, noticing the police, the robbers opened fire, to which the police retaliated. He claimed that although other robbers managed to flee at that time, one of the robbers was shot. He was admitted to the Chakaria Upazila Health Complex, where he later died while undergoing treatment.

data.name: Haresh Ali
data.description: The victim, Haresh Ali, 55, son of Fakir Ali Molla from Chokkoroi village in Bhatgram union of Nandigram upazila, was playing cards with four or five others near Hatkoroi Bazar at around 1:00 pm when the two policemen arrived. ASI Prodip Kumar kicked Haresh forcefully, resulting in his immediate death, according to locals. They claimed that the law enforcement officers became enraged when Haresh did not comply with their bribe request.

data.name: Malek
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A shootout between a gang of robbers and the police left the gang leader dead in Teknaf upazila in Cox's Bazar early yesterday. The deceased is Malek, 40, whose gang is known as the Malek Group. Tipped off, a police team raided a small hill at Noakhalipara around 3:30 am, said SP Azad. The gunfight erupted when the robbers, sensing their presence, opened fire on the law enforcers, who retaliated. Police found Malek's body, with bullet wounds, lying on the ground.

data.name: Azgor Ali
data.description: A group of people was consuming alcohol when members of the police, led by PSI Monir, arrived on the scene and detained Azgor, Ohidul, and Iktar. The arrestees were severely beaten by the law enforcers, and Azgor fell ill. He was taken to Chuadanga Sadar Hospital, where the doctor declared him dead. On the other hand, the family of Azgor Ali alleged that the police demanded 1500 taka as a bribe from Azgor Ali, and when he declined, police members struck him, leading to his death.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged pirate, Zakir Hossain, was killed in a 'crossfire' with the Rapid Action Battalion at Bhedakhali village under Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat district.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Gopalganj, a robber named Alamgir Hossain (40) was killed in a police crossfire. The incident occurred yesterday in the early morning at a place called Gangarampur on the Gopalganj-Tekerhat road, in the Mukshudpur sub-district. A.S.I Shahidul Islam of Gopinathpur police station reported that when the robbers were fleeing with a truck after breaking a barricade, the police targeted the truck and opened fire in Gangarampur. At that time, the robbers returned fire. During the escape, one robber was killed on the spot.

data.name: Enamul Haque
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML Janajuddha) member Enamul Haque has been killed in a 'gun battle' in Kushtia, police said. Bheramara-Mirpur Circle's Assistant Police Superintendent CA Halim told bdnews24.com that the 'encounter' took place behind Hidirampur Primary School in Mirpur upazila late Saturday night. The SP said police received intelligence that Enamul, along with some associates, had taken refuge behind the school for some violent action. "Kushtia Detective Branch and two squads from the Mirpur Police Station conducted a raid around 2:00 am." "They fired upon sensing the presence of police... Police fired back... After 15 minutes of the encounter, Enamul was hit. Others fled," said Halim. According to him, Enamul was rushed to Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Imran Khan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A man was killed in a gunfight between the police and pro-hartal activists at the Alankar intersection in the port city. The victim, Imran Khan, was a first-year student at Chittagong Polytechnic Institute. Jamaat claimed that the youth was its activist, but his father told The Daily Star that he was not involved in politics.

data.name: Shafiqul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: At least three people were killed and around 100 injured across the country yesterday as Jamaat-e-Islami enforced a dawn-to-dusk hartal. A pedestrian suffered injuries in the blasts. Admitted to Chittagong Medical College Hospital (CMCH), he succumbed to his injuries immediately after being taken to an operating theatre, doctors said. The victim, Afzal Ahmed, 25, was a vendor from Pahartali, Chittagong. Another pedestrian, Shafiqul Islam, 24, a garment worker, suffered serious injuries from being hit by sticks as he was caught in the clash.

data.name: Afzal
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: At least three people were killed and around 100 injured across the country yesterday as Jamaat-e-Islami enforced a dawn-to-dusk hartal. A pedestrian suffered injuries in the blasts. Admitted to Chittagong Medical College Hospital (CMCH), he succumbed to his injuries immediately after being taken to an operating theatre, doctors said. The victim, Afzal Ahmed, 25, was a vendor from Pahartali, Chittagong. Another pedestrian, Shafiqul Islam, 24, a garment worker, suffered serious injuries from being hit by sticks as he was caught in the clash.

data.name: Abid
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Abid, a leader of Jamaat's student wing, was found dead after sporadic clashes centering on the war crimes trial verdict against Jamaat-e-Islami's Assistant Secretary General, Abdul Kader Molla. His body was found at Dewanhat crossing of Dobolmuring Police Station in the city on February 5, 2013.

data.name: Bahadur Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: Bahadur, a watchman, suffered critical injuries during sporadic clashes in Chattogram centering on the war crimes trial verdict against Jamaat-e-Islami's Assistant Secretary General Abdul Kader Molla. A few days later, he succumbed to his injuries at Chittagong Medical College Hospital. The clashes killed at least five people in total, including two leaders of Jamaat's student wing.

data.name: Dulal
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In Thakurgaon, Md Dulal, a Shibir activist, died four days after he was hit by a bullet during a clash with law enforcers at Goreya village in Sadar upazila on February 28th. Dulal succumbed to his injuries around 10:00 am at Rangpur Medical College Hospital, said Md Rezaul Karim, officer-in-charge of Thakurgaon Sadar Police Station.

data.name: Selim
data.description: Three alleged electric transformer thieves (identified by New Age as Selim, Zakir, Sajid) were killed in a shootout with plainclothes police in the city's Turag area early Thursday. Contacted, Deputy Commissioner of Police (DB-PR) Masudur Rahman said a team of DB police chased a truck carrying 10-12 electric transformer thieves around 4:30 am. As it reached Diabari, Uttara, he said, the robbers fired gunshots at the detectives, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. In the line of fire, DC Masud said, three robbers suffered fatal bullet wounds. The three injured were taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Zakir
data.description: Three alleged electric transformer thieves (identified by New Age as Selim, Zakir, Sajid) were killed in a shootout with plainclothes police in the city's Turag area early Thursday. Contacted, Deputy Commissioner of Police (DB-PR) Masudur Rahman said a team of DB police chased a truck carrying 10-12 electric transformer thieves around 4:30 am. As it reached Diabari, Uttara, he said, the robbers fired gunshots at the detectives, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. In the line of fire, DC Masud said, three robbers suffered fatal bullet wounds. The three injured were taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Kashem
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in what the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) described as a gun battle in Maheshkhali upazila of Cox's Bazar early Friday morning. The deceased, 32-year-old Mohammad Kashem, son of Syed Ahmed from Nonachhari Kamachara area of the upazila, was accused in 25 cases of murder, robbery, abduction, and attacks on police, RAB-7 Staff Officer Assistant Superintendent Mofizul Islam told bdnews24.com. A RAB-7-led group raided the Kalubridge area upon receiving information about a planned robbery, RAB-7 Squadron Leader Nuruzzaman told bdnews24.com. An encounter followed in which Kashem was wounded and rushed to a nearby hospital where doctors declared him dead, he said.

data.name: Tofayel Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Tofayel Uddin was one of the four members of Jamaat, the student wing of Jamaat, and BNP who were shot dead by the police during a fierce clash between the two groups. The Jamaat and the student wing of Jamaat activists started pelting stones and brickbats at the law enforcers. The police retaliated by firing rubber bullets at the Jamaat and the student wing of Jamaat members. The district administration imposed section 144 in the town until further notice was issued. The firing ensued around 2:00 pm when several hundred activists of Jamaat-Shibir brought out processions in Rumaliachhara and Tarabaniachhara areas of the town after Juma prayers, demanding the release of Sayedee. 30 people, including pedestrians, sustained bullet injuries in the police firing.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: At least one person has died in a clash between the police and activists of the Jamaat-e-Islami and the Islami Chhatra Shibir in Comilla's Chauddagram upazila during the nationwide strike called by the Islamist party. The clash erupted in the upazila's Amzader Bazar area on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway at around 10 am on Monday, according to the police. The victim has been identified as Ibrahim, 24, from Anandapur in the Chauddagram upazila. Local Jamaat leaders have claimed that he was a Shibir activist.

data.name: Abdul Khalique
data.description: A 36-year-old man, arrested for possessing drugs, was allegedly tortured to death in police custody in Sylhet city on Tuesday night. Police denied the claim and said Abdul Khalique died a natural death. The victim, who lived in the village of Bohorgram in Gowainghat, had been arrested by detectives in the city on Tuesday night, allegedly with 10 bottles of Phensedyl. Mokbul Ali, the father of the victim, said there were injury marks on his son's arms and back. Khalique was a healthy man, he claimed, and did not have any major health problems.
data.location: Osmani Medical College and Hospital, Sylhet

data.name: Farid Ahmed
data.description: A 'drug addict' youth was allegedly killed by policemen for not paying them toll at Mahmudpur village of Sirajganj Sadar upazila on Wednesday night. Villagers, alleging death due to police torture, went on a rampage in Shaheed Minar area of the town. The deceased was identified as Farid Ahmed, 32, son of Rohiz Uddin of the village. Rohiz said that a team of police, led by sub-inspectors Abdus Salam and Md Selim, raided their home at around 9:00 pm and mercilessly beat his son, leaving him dead on the spot for not paying them illegal toll.

data.name: Mostafa Murshed Tahsin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Mostafa Murshed Tahsin was killed in Sylhet, where Islamists clashed with the police. Islamists, under the banner of 'Touhidi Janata', brought out processions from different mosques after Juma prayers, demanding punishment for the atheist bloggers who allegedly defamed the Holy Quran and made derogatory comments about the Prophet (SM). They vandalized the Ganajagaran Mancha in front of the local press club and set a police car on fire. The police opened fire to disperse them.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Abdus Salam was killed after Islamist protesters clashed with the police. He was identified as a madrasa (Islamic seminary) teacher.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: The two individuals were killed during clashes between Islamist protesters and the police in Gaibandha.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: The two individuals were killed during clashes between Islamist protesters and the police in Gaibandha.

data.name: Alal Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two people were killed and at least 20 others, including policemen, were injured in clashes during a strike called by the Jamaat-e-Islami in Pabna on Saturday. Clashes erupted when the police tried to disperse them in the Bangabaria area around 9:15 am, he said. Strike supporters threw stones, and the police lobbed tear gas shells to control them. Pabna Sadr Hospital Doctor Baten Molla confirmed receiving one dead body - that of Alal Uddin, 20, son of Jamshed Uddin from Sadar upazila's Dharmagram.

data.name: Sirajul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two people were killed and at least 20 others, including policemen, were injured in clashes during a strike called by the Jamaat-e-Islami in Pabna on Saturday. Clashes erupted when the police tried to disperse them in the Bangabaria area around 9:15 am, he said. Strike supporters threw stones, and the police lobbed tear gas shells to control them. Pabna Sadr Hospital Doctor Baten Molla confirmed receiving one dead body - that of Alal Uddin, 20, son of Jamshed Uddin from Sadar upazila's Dharmagram. The other was identified by Jai Jai Din as Sirajul Islam.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Four people were killed when strike supporters clashed with police and local residents in Manikganj's Singair upazila during the nationwide whole-day strike called by 12 small parties, according to the police. Manikganj Police Superintendent Mohammad Ali Hossain Mia confirmed to bdnews24.com that three deaths occurred and several policemen, including the Singair Police Station OC, were injured in the clash, which took place in the Gobindan area around 11:00 am. Witnesses stated that all three victims, Alamgir (35), Nazim Uddin (25), and Shah Alam, died from bullet wounds.

Manikganj Police Superintendent Mohammad Ali Hossain Mia confirmed to bdnews24.com three deaths and said that several policemen, including Singair Police Station OC, were injured in the clash, which took place in Gobindan area around 11:00 am. All three victims -- Alamgir, 35, Nazim Uddin, 25, and Shah Alam -- died of bullet wounds, witnesses said. The other individual was identified by New Age as Maulana Nasir Uddin.

data.name: Ali Asgar Khan Rahat
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two individuals, including an Islami Chhatra Shibir leader, who sustained bullet injuries in separate clashes with the police in Sylhet, succumbed to their injuries yesterday. The deceased are Ali Asgar Khan Rahat, the social welfare secretary of the Sylhet city unit of Jamaat-e-Islami-backed Shibir, and Abdur Rahman Shahin, a shop owner. Rahat, who was also an accounting student at Madan Mohan College, sustained injuries when the police opened fire on a Shibir procession on February 16. He was flown to the capital on the same day for treatment. The Shibir leader died at Apollo Hospitals, and his body was sent back to Sylhet, according to Fakhrul Islam, the assistant secretary of the Sylhet city unit of Jamaat. On the other hand, Shahin was injured on February 22 when the police fired gunshots to bring the situation under control after the Sylhet Central Shaheed Minar was damaged by Islamist demonstrators.

data.name: Abdur Rahman Sahin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two individuals, including an Islami Chhatra Shibir leader, who sustained bullet injuries in separate clashes with the police in Sylhet, succumbed to their injuries yesterday. The deceased are Ali Asgar Khan Rahat, the social welfare secretary of the Sylhet city unit of Jamaat-e-Islami-backed Shibir, and Abdur Rahman Shahin, a shop owner. Rahat, who was also an accounting student at Madan Mohan College, sustained injuries when the police opened fire on a Shibir procession on February 16. He was flown to the capital on the same day for treatment. The Shibir leader died at Apollo Hospitals, and his body was sent back to Sylhet, according to Fakhrul Islam, the assistant secretary of the Sylhet city unit of Jamaat. On the other hand, Shahin was injured on February 22 when the police fired gunshots to bring the situation under control after the Sylhet Central Shaheed Minar was damaged by Islamist demonstrators.

data.name: Rubel
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: The Bangladesh Police and Border Guard (BGB) fired blank shots and tear gas shells to disperse the attackers. The police and BGB opened fire, resulting in the death of Firoz, 24, and injuries to approximately 10 others. Later, a 13-year-old Shibir supporter named Rubel was found shot dead inside a shop. Munir Uddin, 20, and Nironjon, 25, from Goreya village, died from their injuries at Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital, according to the police.

data.name: Khokon
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: At least two people were killed as the demonstrators clashed with law enforcement at various locations in the district town. Police fired over 100 rounds of bullets from shotguns to regain control of the situation. According to police and eyewitnesses, a truck helper named 'Khokon', aged 20, died in police firing during the clash. In another incident, a youth named 'Liton' was gunned down during a clash between Shibir and the police at Rajganj Bazar in Begumganj upazila in the afternoon.

data.name: Nuruddin
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: In protest of the judgment awarding the death penalty to Delwar Hossain Sayeedi by the International Crimes Tribunal-1 for committing war crimes during the liberation war of 1971, rallies in support of a hartal called by Jamaat-e-Islami began on the Rajganj Bazar road early in the morning on February 28, 2013. On that day, at around 12:30 pm, Golam Mustafa, Nuruddin's brother, closed the shop and rode his bicycle towards home, while Nuruddin followed on foot. Twenty minutes after reaching home, an acquaintance notified him that Nuruddin was shot near the sawmill shops at Rajganj Bazar. From there, he was taken to Mother-Land hospital in Noakhali and later, due to his critical health condition, Nuruddin was admitted to the Noakhali Medical College Hospital where he died at around 6:00 am on March 1, 2013.

data.name: Ashikur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Five people were killed and 100, including 22 law enforcers, were injured in clashes between Jamaat-Shibir members and the police in Mithapukur and Pirgachha upazilas. The deceased were identified as Shibir activists Moshiur Rahman, 25, Shahed Mian, 45, an unidentified individual, Mahmudul Hasan, 20, and Ashikur Rahman, 23. Jamaat-Shibir members barricaded a road and attacked the police when they were asked to leave at Mithapukur Bazar around 2:45 pm. In addition to using batons, the police fired shots to disperse the protesters, resulting in 65 others being injured.

data.name: Nurulla Khan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two people died and 25 others were injured, many reportedly from gunshot wounds, during clashes between demonstrators and police amidst the nationwide strike. The Jamaat members tried to block a road in the upazila's Chandidasgati with logs. They attacked the police when the law enforcement officers intervened, according to eyewitnesses. The police and Rapid Action Battalion launched tear gas shells and fired rubber bullets to restore order. Nurulla Khan, 25, and Ruhul Amin, 16, who were injured during the clashes, succumbed to their wounds on the way to the hospital.

data.name: Foyezar Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A man was killed and several people, including an Assistant Superintendent of Police, sustained bullet wounds when BGB members opened fire on Jamaat activists in Chirirbandar upazila. The deceased has been identified as Foyezar Rahman, 30. Superintendent of Police Debdas Bhattacharjya stated that Jamaat pickets set fire to three business establishments at Nasaratpur on the Dinajpur-Rangpur Highway in the upazila. When the BGB personnel rushed to the scene, the Jamaat men attacked them. Subsequently, the BGB opened fire to disperse them.

data.name: Nasir Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: The Daily Star reported that Jamaat-Shibir members vandalized vehicles at Shibtala in the town during their protest against the death penalty awarded to one of their party leaders. Police, backed by anti-hartal activists, tried to resist them, but the attackers swooped on them with sticks, brick chips, and homemade bombs. The police opened fire on the attackers, leaving Nasir Uddin, a 23-year-old student of Nawabganj Alia Madrasa, dead and two others wounded.

data.name: Mesbah Uddin

data.description: The Daily Star reported that "unruly" Jamaat-Shibir members brought out a procession in Lohagara upazila, and the police tried to intercept it. During the confrontation, the law enforcers opened fire, resulting in the death of 26-year-old Shibir member, Mesbah Uddin.

data.name: Lokman Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A man was killed and at least 10 others, including police personnel, were injured in a clash between the police and demonstrators at Kathaltoli Bazar under Barlekha upazila in the afternoon. The clash erupted when the police intercepted a procession taken out by Jamaat and Shibir activists just after the announcement of the verdict against Sayedee. Later, the police opened fire indiscriminately to bring the situation under control, leaving a madrasa student dead on the spot. The deceased was identified as Lokman Ahmed, 25, son of Abdul Mannan of Dohalia of the upazila.

data.name: Sabed Ali

data.description: A Shibir activist was killed in a clash between protesters and the police at Sujabad under Shajahanpur upazila. The deceased was identified as Sabed Ali, 40, son of Monu Mia from Sujabad Dohopara village.

data.name: Miraj
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In Banshkhali, the injured Shibir activist Miraj (26) died yesterday morning. In the clash between Jamaat-Shibir and the police, two people have been killed. Yesterday, Shibir activists also barricaded the main road and vandalized four CNG-run vehicles.

data.name: Korban Ali
data.description: The complainant, Lokman Hossain, a resident of Bazra union in Sonaimuri upazila, said that his son, Korban Ali, 35, a day laborer, died on March 1st when a team of Rab and police from a van shot him in the head in the upazila's Bagadia area. He was shot around 1:45 pm while returning from offering Juma prayers at a local mosque, according to the complaint.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In Chittagong, three people, including a teenage boy, were killed and 30 others injured in a gunfight between Jamaat-Shibir members and the police at Satkania upazila yesterday. The deceased have been identified as Abu Taher, 30, son of Abdus Sukkur; Shaidul Islam, 15, son of Abu Taher; and Md Osman, 27, son of Abu Sayed. All of them were from Chhodaha union of the upazila and supporters of Jamaat-e-Islami and Islamic Chhatra Shibir, said Satkania upazila chairman Moshad Hossain. The activists of Jamaat-e-Islami obstructed the Chittagong-Cox's Bazar highway from February 28, 2013 onwards. On March 2, a large convoy of police and RAB units tried to remove the obstruction. The protesters threw bricks and allegedly Molotov cocktails at the police, who retaliated by firing shots.

data.name: Abdur Razzak Apon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An activist of the Islami Chhatra Shibir was killed and many others were injured as its supporters, along with those of the Jamaat-e-Islami, clashed with law enforcers in Nilphamari district town and Jaldhaka upazila town on Saturday. The violence continued for the third consecutive day over the conviction of Jamaat stalwart Delwar Hossain Sayedee. The Jamaat-Shibir men brought out a procession in Jaldhaka upazila in the afternoon, defying Section 144, and tried to set fire to vehicles. Police and Bangladesh Border Guard (BGB) personnel opened fire to disperse the "unruly" activists, resulting in the death of Apan Babu (identified by Amar Desh newspaper as Abdur Razzak Apon), a 16-year-old son of Anisur Rahman from Tenganmari Kabirajpara village, according to bdnews24.com. Nilphamari Superintendent of Police (SP) Hatem Ali told bdnews24.com that BGB personnel were deployed in Jaldhaka upazila headquarters in the morning. Additionally, Section 144 was enforced in the upazila town from 2pm to 12am. The BGB personnel intervened when the Jamaat-Shibir activists tried to set fire to a bus in Rajarhat area around 3pm, violating Section 144. At one stage, the unruly activists also attacked the BGB men, prompting the law enforcers to open fire to disperse the pickets.

data.name: Titu
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In the early hours of March 4, 2013, Prothom Alo reported that some mosques in the suburbs of Bogra had asked people to gather to protest the death penalty imposed on Delwar Hossain Sayeedi, a popular cleric associated with Jamaat-e-Islami. In the wake of this announcement, thousands of protesters gathered and attempted to take over the city center, where they clashed with police and RAB units. The security forces responded by firing bullets, killing two. In separate, sporadic incidents, two others were found dead. The deceased were reported to be Titu (22), Alamgir Hossain (27), Aftab Ali, Badal Hossain (25), and Liton Mia (20).

data.name: Arjina Begum
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: Atiar Rahman, an investigator at Shahjahanpur Police Station in Bogra, alleged to Prothom Alo that protesters affiliated with Jamaat-e-Islami vandalized two vehicles parked outside the station and proceeded to torch and vandalize the police station itself. When they attempted to hijack the arsenal, the police fired bullets, killing three women - Arjina Begum (45), Manjila Begum (38), and Asiya Begum (50) - and two men, Abdur Rahman (60) and Abdul Kachir (46). A platoon of army troopers from a nearby cantonment was deployed afterward to protect the police station.

data.description: A Prothom Alo correspondent reported that a group of activists associated with Jamaat-e-Islami and its student wing attacked the Mokamtala Police Investigation Center in Shibganj, Bogra. The police responded by firing live bullets, resulting in the deaths of Dulu Mia (56) and Ziaul Islam (30). The deaths of Babu Mia (18) and Abdur Rashid (20) were also reported, but at that time, they had not been confirmed by Fazlul Karim, Officer-in-Charge of Shibganj Police Station, Bogra.

data.name: Selim
data.description: A teenager succumbed to bullet wounds on Tuesday morning in Bogra. He is the latest victim of Sunday's shootings in the city during Jamaat's offensive against police stations and outposts. This attack forced the government to deploy the army. Selim, 17, from Bandighi Hapunepara in Bogra Sadar’s Erulia Union, died while receiving treatment for his bullet wounds at Shaheed Ziaur Rehman Medical College and Hospital around 6:00 am, according to his father Dudu Miah.

data.name: Forman Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: All forms of gathering and procession were embargoed in Joypurhat's Panchbibi upazila after six people were killed in violence between police and activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and its student front, Islami Chhatra Shibir, on Sunday. Joypurhat district's Superintendent of Police, Hamidul Alam, said four of the deceased were identified after the clash that left 12 others injured. They are Nasir Uddin, 27, Forman Ali, 32, Hisab Uddin, 50, and Abdul Barik, 32. Police fired from their guns as Jamaat supporters moved to attack the local police station around 11 am, said Panchbibi Police Station's Officer-in-Charge, Ahsanul Hoque. Three were killed on the spot while the others died from bullet wounds in the hospital.

data.name: Mujahid Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: A Jamaat-e-Islami leader and a minor were killed, while seven more were hit by bullets during clashes between strike supporters and the police on the first day of the 48-hour nationwide strike called by the Islamist party on Sunday. The deceased have been identified as Mujahid Hossain, 45, a Jamaat leader from Mahishalbari of Godaigari upazilla, and Rafiqul Islam, 12, son of Mostafa Ali from Bhagmantapur (in the upazila). Hossain is also the Imam of a local mosque. Rajshahi Police Superintendent Alamgir Hossain told bdnews24.com that the two died in clashes that erupted when the police tried to clear a road blockade on Rajshahi-Chapainawabganj Highway at Godagari Hall intersection.

data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim

Hossain is also the Imam of a local mosque. Rajshahi Police Superintendent Alamgir Hossain told bdnews24.com that the two died in clashes that erupted when the police tried to clear a road blockade on Rajshahi-Chapainawabganj Highway at Godagari Hall intersection.

data.name: Ismail Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: In Godagari of Rajshahi, five people, including women and children, have been killed in a clash between the police-BGB (Border Guard Bangladesh) and activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and Islami Chhatra Shibir. Nearly a hundred others, including nine who were shot, have been injured in the conflict. The clash began around 9:30 am when Jamaat-Shibir workers obstructed the main road near Ratna Cinema Hall in Godagari to protest. The clash erupted when the police intervened. To control the situation, the sub-district administration has issued Section 144, imposing an indefinite ban on large gatherings in Godagari. The deceased have been identified as Mujahid (48), the Imam of the Mahishalhat Jame Mosque, Ismail Hossain (18), Rafiqul Islam (13), Alim (18), and an unidentified woman (27). The officer-in-charge of Godagari Model Police Station, Ahidul Islam, said, "During the strike, supporters of the strike were parading and instigating violence. The casualties occurred at that time.
