data.name: Mahbubur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: According to eyewitnesses, Prothom Alo reported that activists of Jamaat-e-Islami attacked a convoy of the Border Guard of Bangladesh, which prompted them to fire back and kill Mahbubur Rahman (30) along with three others. One of the injured, Sohag (12), died in a hospital, according to a report by Jai Jai Din, a newspaper.

data.name: Sohag
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Citing eyewitnesses, Prothom Alo reported that activists of Jamaat-e-Islami attacked a convoy of the Border Guard of Bangladesh, prompting them to fire back and kill Mahbubur Rahman (30) along with three others. According to a report by Jai Jai Din, a newspaper, one of the injured, Sohag (12), a student of class five, died in a hospital.

data.name: Arif Billah
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two people have been shot dead by the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) during a clash with Jamaat-e-Islami activists in Kalaroa, Satkhira. The deceased have been identified as Mohammad Arif Billah, 40, and Mohammad Ruhul Amin, 30, both sons of Rahim Munshi from Kamarali village. Upazila Executive Officer Hussain Shawkat provided this information.

data.name: Aftab Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In the early hours of March 4, 2013, Prothom Alo reported that some mosques in the suburbs of Bogra had asked people to gather to protest the death penalty imposed on Delwar Hossain Sayeedi, a popular cleric associated with Jamaat-e-Islami. In the wake of this announcement, thousands of protesters gathered and attempted to take over the city center, where they clashed with police and RAB units. The security forces responded by firing bullets, killing two individuals. In separate, sporadic incidents, two others were found dead. The deceased were identified as Titu (22), Alamgir Hossain (27), Aftab Ali, Badal Hossain (25), and Liton Mia (20).

data.name: Mahfuz Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A child was killed as violence erupted in Sirajganj's Ullapara on Monday morning, the second day of the two-day strike called by the Jamaat-e-Islami to protest the sentencing of its leader, Delwar Hossain Sayedee, to death. The deceased has been identified as Mahfuz Hossain, 14, the son of Azizul Hoque from Falia village in Purnimagoti union. He was a student in Class X.

data.name: Kanchan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On March 4, 2013, during a gunfight between the police and robbers, a robber named Kanchan was shot dead.

data.name: Shah Alam Khokon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In Nayapaltan, a BNP worker was killed, who had been injured in the clash on Wednesday. Ruhul Kabir Rizvi, the Joint Secretary-General of BNP, stated that the victim was injured by police gunfire during the clash. The deceased, Shah Alam Khokon, was an active worker of Dhaka City BNP, he added. During a press briefing at the BNP office on Thursday, Rizvi said, "Khokon was admitted to Dhaka Medical College Hospital after being shot in Wednesday's incident. He passed away last night while receiving treatment.

data.name: Munnaf Hossain Munna
data.description: A drug dealer was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and RAB personnel in Savar early yesterday. The deceased, Munnaf Hossain alias Munna, 40, was accused in at least 30 cases for various offenses, including drug peddling, abduction, and murder, said Savar Police. Acting on a tip-off that a consignment of illegal drugs was on its way to Savar, a team of RAB-4 conducted a raid in the Khosrubagh area around 12:25 am, said the police. Md Asaduzzaman, officer-in-charge of Savar Police Station, claimed that a gunfight ensued after Munna and his gang opened fire on the law enforcers. Munna was killed on the spot, while his associates managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Daimul
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Another youth, who received bullet injuries during a clash between Jamaat-Shibir and the police at Goreya village in Thakurgaon on February 28, died on Thursday. Md Daimul Islam, 25, succumbed to his injuries at Rangpur Medical College Hospital. With Daimul, the death toll from the clash stands at six, said the police. Daimul was injured when Jamaat-e-Islami and Jamaat-backed Islami Chhatra Shibir clashed with law enforcers at Goreya village in Thakurgaon on February 28.

data.name: Golam Rabbani
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and its student front, Islami Chhatra Shibir, clashed with the police, leaving at least one man dead and 13 others injured during a daylong general strike in Sylhet on Wednesday. The casualty was reported in Biswanath Upazila in Sylhet, and Jamaat-e-Islami claimed the man was an activist of the party. "They charged with sticks when the police intervened. They were showering stones at the police. The police fired rubber bullets and shotgun rounds to bring the situation under control." Ten, including two policemen, were injured in the clash, he said. "One Golam Rabbani, 25, succumbed to his injuries on the way to Sylhet Osmani Medical College," Azad said. Jamaat claimed the youth was its activist.

data.name: Mohammad Saidul
data.description: The true identity of the young man, who was killed in a "gunfight" between the Detective Branch (DB) of the police and some criminals in the Hatirjheel area of the capital on March 21, was revealed yesterday. Immediately after the incident, the DB police claimed that he was a criminal. However, his family members stated yesterday that he was a garment worker. Kurchia Begum, the mother of the young man, identified the body at Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) and stated that her son, Mohammad Saidul, 27, had come to Dhaka about a year ago. She said he worked at a garment factory in the Rampura area of the capital.

data.name: Intajul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: BNP activist Intazul Islam, also known as Intaz, was shot dead during a clash between villagers, police, RAB, and BGB while attempting to arrest a suspect in a case on March 21, 2013.

data.name: SM Mahfizur Rahman
data.description: Another man, who received bullet injuries during a clash between the police and supporters of different Islamist parties in Sylhet city on February 22, died at a private hospital in Sylhet city on Thursday night. The deceased, SM Mahfuzur Rahman, was an acting headmaster of Nizam Ibne Dolil High School in Golapganj upazila of Sylhet.

data.name: Anisur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police went to apprehend Fazlur Rahman, the upazila chief of Jamaat-e-Islami, in Joypur of Dhakuria Union at around 5:45 am on Friday, according to district Assistant Police Superintendent Syed Mostafa. BNP and Jamaat members attacked the police after a local mosque broadcasted calls claiming that there were 'robbers in the village', he added. "The attackers vandalized a police vehicle and assaulted the law enforcement officers. Up to 12 policemen were injured. Later, shotgun rounds and tear gas shells were deployed to regain control of the situation." Anisur Rahman lost his life during the clashes, he further stated.

data.name: Moni Gaus
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Chandpur's Kochua sub-district, a robber has been killed in a gunfight with RAB (Rapid Action Battalion), as reported by the police. The deceased, Moni Gaus (46), was the son of the late Ohab Ali from Meghdair village in the sub-district. The Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Kochua police station, Mohammad Alamgir Hossain Majumdar, stated that on Sunday night, around 2:45 AM, a group of robbers were preparing for a robbery in Meghdair village. At that time, RAB-11 members, who were on duty, chased them, resulting in an exchange of gunfire between the two sides. During the incident, the robber Moni Gaus was killed at the scene.

data.name: Jiku
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A young man has been killed in an alleged gunfight with the police at Khilkhet Nikunja in the capital. The deceased, Jiku (32), is said to have been a drug dealer, according to the police. Officer-in-charge Shamim Hossain of Khilkhet police station informed that he was killed in a 'gunfight' in the Nikunja-2 area around 5:30 PM on Monday. He said, "At that time, the police were informed that a few young men were transporting drugs in a private car." "When the police signaled the car to stop, it did not stop and kept firing. The police then returned fire." While chasing the police vehicle, the gangsters jumped out of the car in the Airport roundabout area and fled, according to the OC. He stated that Jiku was later found dead inside the car.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A Jubo Dal man was killed and over 100 were injured when pro-Awami League activists attacked BNP men during Independence Day in Sarishabari upazila of Jamalpur on Tuesday. Belal Hossain, 25, a businessman of Aramnagar Bazar where the incident took place, died as gunshots were fired during the hour-long clash that prompted law enforcers to take action, as reported by The Daily Star's Jamalpur correspondent, quoting the police.

data.name: Waliullah
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Locals said that people from nearby villages encircled the law enforcers and hurled brick chips towards them, as reported by our Chapainawabganj correspondent. In retaliation, the police opened fire and lobbed several rounds of rubber bullets, resulting in the death of two people and the injury of 21 others. The locals identified the deceased as Waliullah, 18, from Omarpur village, and Rabiul Islam, 25, from Babupur village. They died on the spot. Another victim, Matiur Rahman, 45, from Gopalnagar village, succumbed to his injuries on the way to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital. Villagers mentioned that Waliullah and Matiur were supporters of Jamaat, while Rabiul was a BNP supporter.

data.name: Yunus Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: At least two people were shot dead in clashes that broke out as a group of Jamaat-e-Islami activists attacked the police during a raid in Belkuchi upazila of Sirajganj on Friday. The deceased have been identified as Faridul Islam, 18, son of the late Abdul Jalil from Sarbatulshi village of Dhukuria Bera union, and Chhatra Dal activist Yunus Ali, 17, son of Abdul Majid, from Kalyanpur village of the same union. Police and locals said cops raided Moupur village to arrest Jamaat activist Habibur Rahman at around 9:00 am over a case filed on charges of violence during a shutdown. Even as the police were engaged in a scuffle with the Jamaat supporters, local mosques broadcast calls to resist the law enforcers, leading to hundreds of Jamaat and BNP activists from the adjacent villages arriving at the site. They tried to snatch Habib from the police. As clashes broke out in the Kallyanpur High School field, the police opened fire and lobbed tear gas shells, ASP Ashok Kumar Pal said.

data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations

data.name: Md Rubel
data.description: An alleged mugger was killed in a "gunfight" with police in the capital's Rampura early yesterday. A mugging incident took place at East Hajipara around 4:30 am. On receiving information, police rushed to the scene. In the meantime, police discovered that another mugging incident was occurring nearby and proceeded to thwart the muggers' attempt. The miscreants then threw several Molotov cocktails at the advancing police officers, resulting in a clash between the police and the muggers. In response, the police opened fire on them. Later, the police found an injured mugger named Md Rubel, 20, from Uttarkhan, who was also a member of the local 'Baitta Sohel Group'. He was left alone at the scene after the other members of the group fled. The injured individual was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the on-duty doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Sahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Witnesses said students of Nuria Madrasa attempted to hold a procession in support of the long march of Hefazat followers. Local AL leader and activists also organized a counter-procession, which resulted in a clash between the two groups. "Upon receiving information, the police took action. At one point, they fired and launched tear gas shells to regain control of the situation, resulting in four injuries," reported an eyewitness account of the rioting. Shahidul was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, but the attending doctor pronounced him dead at around 6:00 pm.

data.name: Samiul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On Sunday, ASI Javed Mia and Constable Ziaul Haque of Ghoraghat Police Station were allegedly attacked by a group of robbers. In response, the police fired five rounds, resulting in the death of one of the suspected robbers, Samiul Islam (35), who died on the spot.

data.name: Mansur Ali Gazi
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: An activist of Jamaat-e-Islami was killed, and 15 people, including five policemen, were injured when law enforcers opened fire after being attacked by Jamaat-Shibir men in Dumuria upazila of Khulna on Thursday morning. The deceased, Mansur Ali Gazi, 40, son of Khan Jahan Ali Gazi of Chechuri village in the upazila, was a driver of a human hauler, as reported by our Khulna correspondent. The law enforcers opened fire to defend themselves and the panicking school students, said Abdul Kader Beg, additional superintendent of police in Khulna. Mansur was shot and died on the spot, while at least 15 personnel, including five policemen, were also injured, he added.

data.name: Selim Hawladar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: RAB claims to have killed three "robbers" in a "gun battle" in the Sundarbans in southern Bangladesh. It says the encounter was reported from Mrigmari Canal of East Sundarbans' Chandpai Range around 7 am on Tuesday. The RAB says those killed belonged to the notorious "Mortuza gang". One of those killed was identified as Selim, 37, who hails from Mongla Upazila's Sundarbans Union. RAB claims to have recovered seven weapons and some ammunition from the spot. RAB-8 chief Lt Col Faridul Alam told bdnews24.com that two RAB teams raided the area on Tuesday morning following a tip-off. "The robbers opened fire, provoking retaliation from RAB teams, which surrounded one of their hideouts three kilometers inside the Mrigmari Canal around 7:30 am. The encounter lasted for nearly 30 minutes," he said. Alam claimed the "robbers" retreated after a while, leaving behind three bodies and weapons.

data.name: Ali Limon
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: Ali Limon, 14, a seventh-grade student at Hamidullah High School, was the son of Lokman Hossain from the town's Upar-Rajarampur Mahalla. He died amidst the violence, according to Chapainawabganj Police Superintendent Bashir Ahmed, as reported by bdnews24.com. Witnesses said clashes took place in the Mahalla in the morning. Limon was first taken to a local clinic and later to the Chapainawabganj Sadar Hospital. On-duty doctor Shafiqul Islam declared him dead, stating, "Limon was shot in the throat. People forcibly took away his body.

data.name: Nurul Islam Nuri
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: One of them is Nurul Islam Noori (48), a BNP leader from Chenchua village in Sadar Upazila. Nuri Jagti Union was the former joint secretary of BNP. According to local sources, Nuri was strangled to death after being picked up by the DB police around 7:30 pm on Thursday. Dulal, the brother of the deceased, told BanglaNews that his brother was picked up in a microbus from BIDC Bazar in Sadar Upazila around 7:30 pm on Thursday evening by 6/7 people identified as DB Police. After that, they did not find Noori. Later on Friday morning, his dead body was found in a cornfield in Harra field of Sadar Upazila. Acting Officer (OC) of Kushtia Model Police Station, Shikder Moshiur Rahman, told BanglaNews that it is initially believed that he was strangled to death. However, District DB Police OC Atiyar Rahman denied taking Noori away.

data.name: Iqbal Hossain
data.description: An alleged illegal arms trader, who was arrested in Kushtia town with arms and ammunition, died in custody of the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) on Thursday. The deceased individual is Iqbal Hossain Maruf, a 25-year-old resident of Aruapara area in the town. Captain Mosaddek Ibne Mujib, the Company Commander of Rab-12 Crime Combat unit, stated that they apprehended Maruf with a brand new 9mm pistol and two bullets from a house in Courtpara area around 2:30pm. However, during interrogation at the Rab office around 8:45pm, the suspect suddenly fell ill. Captain Mujib added that doctors at Kushtia General Hospital declared Maruf dead around 9:00pm. The hospital's Residential Medical Officer, Ashraful Isam Anjan, stated that the deceased individual died before reaching the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Mamun
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Five people were killed and 30 others injured in a clash between Hefazat-e-Islam activists and law enforcement in Hathazari upazila of Chittagong on Monday. The deceased were identified as Mamun Miah, a teacher at a local school, Mohammad Hanif, 35, Jasim Uddin, 30, Mohammad Noman, 26, and Mohammad Mamun, 24, as reported by news agency UNB. Witnesses said the Hefazat men blocked the Rangamati-Khagrachhari road at Medical Gate in the morning to protest the removal of Hefazat men from Motijheel’s Shapla Chattar early Monday. The clash occurred when the police asked them to remove the blockade around 3 pm. A chase and counter-chase took place between the Hefazat men and the law enforcement, which included police, members of the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab), Border Guard Bangladesh, and Armed Police Battalion. At one point, the law enforcement fired several gunshots to disperse them, resulting in three deaths and multiple injuries. The injured were immediately taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital, where Jasim and Noman died around 5:30 pm.

data.name: Ebadat Ali
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: Ebadat Ali, an egg trader, was shot dead by the police during a clash with activists from the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: A man accused of murder and other crimes was killed in a gun battle with police in the early hours of Tuesday in Maheshkhali Upazila of Cox's Bazar district. Four policemen were also injured in the encounter, according to Additional Superintendent of Cox's Bazar Police, Babul Akhtar, who spoke to bdnews24.com. Akhtar stated that the police raided a location in the Adharghona area of Kalarmarccharha Union based on a tip-off about a gathering of a criminal gang at around 2:30 am on Tuesday. Delwar was arrested with bullet injuries, Akhtar said, but he succumbed to his wounds on the way to the hospital.

data.name: Nizam Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In the Ershad Nagar area of Tongi, Gazipur, a person named Nizam Uddin was killed after falling under a truck while fleeing from the police. In response to this incident, outraged locals set fire to a police pick-up van. According to the locals, on Tuesday night around 10:30 pm, Tongi Thana police arrested Aslam, a mango trader from the Ershad Nagar area. At that time, Nizam, a relative of Aslam and a rickshaw garage owner, kept pleading with the police to release Aslam, holding the hands and feet of the officers. A police officer then chased Nizam, who fell under a truck while trying to escape and was killed on the spot.

data.name: Jahirul Islam
data.description: Two suspected criminals were killed in a shootout between their cohorts and the members of Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) in the capital's Uttara area early Wednesday. The deceased were identified as Jahirul Islam, 28, and Saju Akand, 25. They were members of an armed gang, said Captain Avisheikh Ahmed, deputy director of the Legal and Media Wing of Rab headquarters. The members of the elite force also recovered two pistols, six bullets, three machetes, and one hammer from the spot. The shootout ensued around 4:00 am when a patrol team of Rab-1 signaled a microbus to stop on Sonargaon Road in Sector-11 of Uttara, a Rab official claimed. The members of the elite force opened fire on the criminals when they defied the Rab signal. At one stage of the shootout, the criminals stopped the microbus and two of the gang fled the scene. Later, the Rab personnel searching the microbus found two bodies, the Rab official claimed.

data.name: Rana Ahmed
data.description: Two "smugglers" died in an encounter with troops of the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) in Joypurhat's Panchbibi Upazila in the early hours of Wednesday. The deceased have been identified as Rana Ahmed and Mahidul Islam, both from Ratanpur village in Panchbibi Upazila. BGB troops pursued a group of smugglers after they entered Bangladesh through the Kaya border, leading to the encounter, said Joypurhat-3 BGB battalion CO Lt Col Shabbir. "The smugglers opened fire, and the BGB was forced to retaliate. The two smugglers were hit when our troops fired back." Both individuals succumbed to their wounds when they were rushed to Joypurhat District Modern Hospital, according to the BGB official.

data.name: Shamim Reza
data.description: Shamim Reza, who died in custody on Wednesday, was detained on May 14, not on May 19 as claimed by the police, and he was tortured for six days at an inspector's house in Sonargaon upazila of Narayanganj. His family gave Tk 2.50 lakh to the inspector, Arup Tarafdar of Sonargaon Police Station, in order for the torture on him to stop. These details came out in an investigation by The Daily Star yesterday. At least 15 neighbors described to these correspondents how the police took Shamim out of his house at the crack of dawn on May 14 and put him onto a police van, only to move him to a white microbus 100 yards away from his house in Protaper Char area.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A 'mugger' was killed in a police firing on Saturday night at Agargaon in the capital. The deceased was a male around 35 years of age, but his identity could not be established so far. Kafrul Police Station Sub-Inspector Rakibul Islam Khan said he and Constable Hamidur Rahman were on duty in that area. "Suddenly, six miscreants jumped off a roadside wall and landed on the street. They blasted a crude bomb and tried to mug us," he said. He added that both he and Rahman were injured in the bomb explosion. "We had to open fire from our pistol and shotgun to save ourselves," the police official said, adding that the 'muggers' fled when they retaliated. One of the muggers was shot dead.

data.name: Sheikh Shahidul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged pirates were killed on Wednesday in Sharankhola of Sundarbans in a reported gunfight with RAB personnel. Maj Sabbir Rahman Osmani, Deputy Commander of RAB-8 present at the site, told bdnews24.com that the deceased had been identified as Shahidul (identified by Jai Jai Din as Sheikh Shahidul Islam), 40, chief of Shahidul Bahini, and Mujibor (identified by Jai Jai Din as Mujibur Rahman Mollah), 38, of the Billal Bahini. Two days ago, RAB received information about the pirates' presence in Shelar Char area, RAB-8 Captain Shishir told bdnews24.com. A helicopter carrying two teams of personnel from RAB headquarters in Dhaka arrived in the area in the early hours of Wednesday to take part in the operation. They spotted several men who were moving around suspiciously in the area and challenged them. At one stage, the men allegedly fired at RAB, prompting the law enforcers to return fire. "The two dead were left behind, along with the weapons we recovered," Shishir said.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber was shot dead by the police when a gang waylaid a police patrol van at Gazipur's Sreepur early on Tuesday. The encounter, at the Sreepur-Mawna intersection, left one policeman injured. The robber, approximately 25 years old, has not been identified. Sreepur Station SI Golam Kibria said a police contingent was out at the Sreepur-Maona intersection at 3 am. A gang of 12-14 robbers blocked the street at Bokultala with a cement pole and attacked the vehicle with sharp weapons, Kibria said. "The bullet hit one of the robbers in the head as the police fired in self-defense. The others fled. SI Sobuj Miah, 35, was injured in the attack." The robber died on the way to Sreepur Upazila Health Complex. The injured policeman is receiving medical attention. The robber's body has been sent for an autopsy. The police are filing a case.

data.name: Shamim Sarkar
data.description: At least six policemen from two stations on the outskirts of the capital in Savar were suspended, with four of them arrested just hours after allegedly beating a young man to death when he refused to bribe them. The deceased was identified as Shamim Sarkar, 32, of Hemayetpur. Locals and sources in the police said a team of plainclothes policemen picked up Shamim from Hemayetpur on Wednesday night. They charged him with murder and then demanded Tk250,000 for his release. However, soon after his arrest, they must have realized Shamim was dead and rushed him to Dhaka's Mitford Hospital.

data.name: Zakir Hossain Raju
data.description: An alleged carjacker was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and DB police in the capital's Ramna Park area early yesterday. The deceased is Zakir Hossain Raju, 30, from Barguna district. Acting on secret information that a white private car was heading towards Ramna after disregarding a police signal from the Tejgaon industrial area, a team of Detective Branch (DB) police chased the car from Bailey Road at around 3:00 am, said Asaduzzaman, senior assistant commissioner of DB police. When the car reached near the gate of Ramna Chinese Restaurant, the carjackers opened fire on them, triggering a "gunfight," he said. During the "gunfight", Zakir was caught in the line of fire while the others managed to escape the scene, claimed Asaduzzaman.

data.name: Waris Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A man died at Sylhet Osmani Medical College Hospital (SOMCH) on Wednesday evening, allegedly due to severe torture in police custody in Chhatak upazila of the district. The victim was identified as Waris Ali, 45, son of the late Abdur Rahim, a resident of Bashkhala village under Chhatak municipality. Local sources said that Ansar members of Chhatak Paper Mills caught Waris red-handed while stealing fish from a pond of the mills in the early hours of Tuesday. After beating him, the Ansar members handed him over to Chhatak police station, branding him as a robber. Later, the police took Waris to Chhatak upazila health complex in critical condition at noon. As his condition deteriorated, he was transferred to Osmani Medical College Hospital, where he died at 7.00 pm on Wednesday. The victim's brother, Rahmat Ali, said that before his death, Waris told his family members about the severe police torture.

data.name: Shah Alam Sarder
data.description: A man was declared dead shortly after law enforcement chased their procession in Khulna city on Saturday morning, in breach of the election code of conduct. Shah Alam Sarder, 45, was an employee of Crescent Jute Mills in Khalishpur. While the main opposition party, BNP, claimed that Shah Alam was injured when members of the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) charged batons at the processionists, a doctor who attended to the victim said the man complained of chest pain. Rab men chased the processionists as they violated the electoral code of conduct, according to Sub-Inspector Mustaq of Khalishpur Police Station. "As the Rab men charged batons at us, we ran for cover," said Al Amin, an activist of Islami Shashontantra Andolon who also participated in the procession, told The Daily Star. Shah Alam fell to the ground, had a cardiac arrest, and later died, said SI Mustaq.

data.name: Mahbub Saijja
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Major Sabbir Rahman, deputy commander of RAB-8, said that during a regular patrol early on Thursday morning, RAB members discovered some individuals inside the forest of Bharani area in Pashurtala of the Sundarbans. When the RAB members confronted them, the individuals opened fire on the law enforcers. The RAB members returned fire. The gunfight, which began at 6:50 am, lasted for 25 minutes. At one point, the pirates retreated from the scene. Subsequently, the RAB members proceeded to the location and discovered three bodies, 13 firearms, and bullets. Two of the deceased were identified as Amjad, the leader of the 'Amjad Bahini', and Mahbub, also known as Saija, the leader of the 'Saija Bahini', while the identity of the third individual remains unknown.

data.name: Badal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, an alleged leader of a gang named Badal, 44, was killed in a gunfight with the police in the Mognama Ghat embankment area of Pekua upazila around 1:00 am. Acting on a tip-off, police sources said they conducted a raid in the early hours yesterday to apprehend Badal, the leader of a robbery gang. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers fired at them. In retaliation, the police also opened fire. Later, the police found Badal's body lying on the ground.

data.name: Hasmot Ali Bhutto
data.description: Reportedly, S I Selim from Bagha Police Station in Rajshahi arrested Hasmot Ali for drug possession and allegedly tortured him at the police station. After Ali was sent to jail, he fell ill and subsequently died. When his body was returned to his family, they reported observing numerous injury marks on his body. His family claimed that he was tortured to death by the police.

data.name: Yasin Bepari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected carjacker, who sustained bullet wounds early Tuesday in a "gunfight" with law enforcement in the capital's Gulistan, died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital yesterday. Three alleged carjackers, including the deceased, Yasin Bepari, 26, and a constable of the Detective Branch of Police suffered bullet injuries in the incident. All of them, including DB police constable Azizul Islam, 30, were admitted to the hospital where Yasin died from two gunshot wounds in the abdomen. Yasin's father, Abdus Sobhan Bepari, a resident of Shibchar upazila in Madaripur, told The Daily Star that his two sons used to live in the capital's Begunbari area and drive pick-ups. On Tuesday, detectives arrested Korban and made a phone call to Yasin asking him to come in front of Golap Shah Mazar, said Sobhan. When Yasin arrived with his pickup, the DB police shot him and seriously injured him, he added. DB police constable Azizul, however, told The Daily Star that the miscreants opened fire on them first, and his team retaliated. His team is in charge of preventing robbery and mugging in Dhaka south zone of DB police, he added.

data.name: Riaz Dalim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Two robbers were killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Sundarbans in Mongla upazila here yesterday. The deceased are Riaz alias Dalim, 27, and Kamal Sheikh, 42, of the upazila. A Rab team had received information that two gangs, Raju Bahini and Shirsha Bahini, were meeting near Andharmanik Forest Camp to team up and work together in the area, said Rab-8 Operation Commander Lt Sarfaraj Obayed. The team raided the area one kilometer north of the camp in the forest around 1:45 pm. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them. The team returned fire, said the Rab official. After about half an hour, the robbers fled into the forest. The Rab members recovered the bullet-hit bodies of the two and some arms, including a double-barrel gun, two single-barrel guns, four LGs, and nine bullets from the spot.

The deceased are Riaz alias Dalim, 27, and Kamal Sheikh, 42, of the upazila. A Rab team had received information that two gangs, Raju Bahini and Shirsha Bahini, were meeting near Andharmanik Forest Camp to team up and work together in the area, said Rab-8 Operation Commander Lt Sarfaraj Obayed. The team raided the area one kilometer north of the camp in the forest around 1:45 pm. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them. The team returned fire, said the Rab official. After about half an hour, the robbers fled into the forest. The Rab members recovered the bullet-hit bodies of the two and some arms, including a double-barrel gun, two single-barrel guns, four LGs, and nine bullets from the spot.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An activist of Jamaat-e-Islami was killed and four were injured after BGB men opened fire on them in Shibganj upazila of Chapainawabganj on Monday. The members of Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) fired bullets when the Jamaat men hurled bombs at them, reported our correspondent. Police and witnesses said that the activists of Jamaat and its student wing, Islami Chhatra Shibir, staged a demonstration blockading Chapainawabganj-Sonamasjid highway at Rasulpur area around 1:00 pm. When a patrol team of BGB tried to disperse them from the spot, the Jamaat-Shibir men threw brick chips at them. They also threw several handmade bombs targeting the law enforcers. At one stage, the BGB men opened fire, leaving Nurul Islam dead on the spot and injuring four others.

data.name: Ziaur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Latifur Rahman, the ameer of the city unit of Jamaat, said that another activist named Ziaur Rahman had also been killed in the BGB firing. Ziaur, a first-year student of the higher secondary certificate program at Krishna Gobinda College, succumbed to his injuries while he was being taken to Rajshahi, Latifur added.

data.name: Arifuzzaman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and its student wing, Islami Chhatra Shibir, were killed as law enforcers opened fire on them after being attacked in Kaliganj upazila of Satkhira during the countrywide daylong hartal (shutdown) on Tuesday. The deceased were identified as Arifuzzaman, 15, of Bazargram in the upazila and Ruhul Amin Gazi, 35, of Raghurampur in the same upazila. The Jamaat and Shibir members ambushed the law enforcers by placing logs and electric poles on Kaliganj-Shyamnagar road in Pawkhali area of the upazila. Upon receiving information that the party members had blocked the road, a team of 35 to 40 policemen led by Tajul Islam, assistant superintendent of police of Kaliganj circle, rushed to the scene around 6:00 am to remove the blockade. As soon as the law enforcers started to remove the barricades, the Jamaat-Shibir suddenly attacked them with sticks, said Islam. At one point, the Jamaat-Shibir members also opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire, he added. During the clash, nine policemen and five Jamaat-Shibir activists were injured, the police official added. Later, two Jamaat-Shibir members died.

data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)

data.name: Mohammad Mahadi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged top criminal who faced 18 cases related to robberies and extortion was killed in a "gunfight" between his gang and the police on Friday night in the capital's Rupnagar of Mirpur area. Mohammad Mahadi, 35, died on the spot during the gunfight around 10:30 pm, said Imtiaz Ahmed, deputy commissioner of Mirpur Police Division. "The gunfight started as the gang of seven criminals opened fire on a team of police patrolling in the Mirpur embankment area," he said. He added that at one stage, Mahadi's cohorts fled the scene and Mahadi was found lying dead. A US-made pistol was found on him. "The criminals had been planning to commit crimes in the area. As the patrolling police team challenged them, they opened fire," the DC said.

data.name: Md Sabuj Mia
data.description: Two suspected carjackers were killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion in South Keraniganj on the outskirts of the capital yesterday. RAB suspects that the deceased individuals are Sabuj Mia and Mohammad Sagar Ahmed, both aged between 35 and 40. RAB-10 Commanding Officer Lt Col Md Imran Ibne Abdur Rouf said that, concerned by the recent incidents of shooting by miscreants in the capital, RAB had set up a checkpoint on the Dhaka-Mawa link road five days ago. Around 1:00 am yesterday, RAB officials signaled a white private car to stop. However, it tried to speed away and one of the passengers even fired at the RAB officers, he said. The RAB members shot back, killing the driver and the person sitting next to him, he added.

data.name: Mohammad Sagar Ahmed
data.description: Two suspected carjackers were killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion in South Keraniganj on the outskirts of the capital yesterday. RAB suspects that the deceased individuals are Sabuj Mia and Mohammad Sagar Ahmed, both aged between 35 and 40. The RAB members shot back, killing the driver and the person sitting next to him, he added.

data.name: HM Zahid Siddique Tareque
data.description: Two people, including HM Zahid Siddique alias Tareque, an alleged killer of Jubo League leader Riazul Haque Khan Milky, were killed in a shootout on Wednesday night, according to Rab sources. Another person killed in the shootout, which took place in the Khilkhet area, was identified as Shah Alam, Rab Director (Media and Legal Wing) Wing Commander Habibur Rahman said. According to Habibur Rahman, a group of miscreants attacked a Rab vehicle carrying Tareque and tried to snatch the accused killer, triggering a gunfight between Rab men and the miscreants. Tareque and Shah Alam died on the spot as they were hit by bullets during the gunfight. Two Rab personnel were also injured in the shootout. Shah Alam was one of the members of the attackers.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Two people, including HM Zahid Siddique alias Tareque, an alleged killer of Jubo League leader Riazul Haque Khan Milky, were killed in a shootout on Wednesday night, according to Rab sources. Another person killed in the shootout, which took place in the Khilkhet area, was identified as Shah Alam, Rab Director (Media and Legal Wing) Wing Commander Habibur Rahman said. According to Habibur Rahman, a group of miscreants attacked a Rab vehicle carrying Tareque and tried to snatch the accused killer, triggering a gunfight between Rab men and the miscreants. Tareque and Shah Alam died on the spot as they were hit by bullets during the gunfight. Two Rab personnel were also injured in the shootout. Shah Alam was one of the members of the attackers.

data.name: Rashed Parvez
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a shootout with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in Narail Sadar upazila early Wednesday. The deceased was identified as Parvez, also known as Rashed, a 30-year-old man who was the son of Jabed Hossain from Junglegram village in the upazila, according to our Narail correspondent. Parvez, who was a listed criminal, had been accused in several cases filed with Narail and Jessore police stations, said Maj ABM Azizul Karim, the commanding officer of Rab-6. Karim stated that a team from Rab-6 raided the helipad area at Kurigram village around 2:00 am after receiving information that five to six criminals had gathered there to commit a crime. Sensing the presence of the Rab team, the criminals opened fire, forcing the Rab team to fire back and resulting in a gunfight. Parvez was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, Karim added.

data.name: Rubel Hossain
data.description: In the Tahirpur area of Bagmara upazila in Rajshahi, a businessman named Rubel was killed by police gunfire. Yesterday afternoon, around 1:30 pm, the police fired in response to a protest against extortion in the name of motorcycle checks. Rubel was shot and killed in the incident. SI Mahbub, the officer-in-charge of Tahirpur police outpost, has been suspended in connection with the incident. Locals report that for several days, the police had been harassing and extorting people in Tahirpur under the pretext of setting up motorcycle checkpoints. Agitated by this, the businessmen staged a protest rally from the Tahirpur municipal bus stand on Thursday afternoon. As the rally reached the Tahirpur police outpost, bricks were thrown at the local police outpost from the rally. At that time, the police opened fire. Rubel (27) was killed on the spot by police gunfire.

data.name: Azhar Uddin
data.description: A man was allegedly tortured to death in police custody at Nalitabari in Sherpur, prompting locals to protest with his body at a program of Agriculture Minister Matia Chowdhury yesterday. The victim, Azhar Uddin, 55, a resident of Sanyasivita in Nalitabari upazila, was reportedly given electric shocks at Nalitabari Police Station where he was kept. His wife, Saleha Begum, alleged that policemen tortured her husband to death and demanded a trial of those responsible. Police claimed that Azhar was arrested on Wednesday in connection with the murder of one Rahim. Suruj Ali, son of the victim, said he saw police giving his father electric shocks at Nalitabari Police Station when he went there with food for him on Thursday night. Soon afterward, he was driven away from the police station. He claimed his family had paid Tk 17,000 to the police so they would not torture Azhar. Police said Azhar was sent to the upazila health complex around 7:30 am yesterday as he complained of chest pains. They said the doctors on duty declared him dead.

data.name: Kalu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Kalu and two other alleged pirates were killed in a gunfight with the police. The police received information that Kalu was staying with his associates at an Alamin fishery project near Bhuiyarhat of Subarnachar upazila and planning a crime in the Meghna River. As Kalu and his associates sensed the presence of the police, they opened fire at the police, who also retaliated with gunfire.

data.name: Ripon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Ripon and two other alleged pirates, Kalu and Rubel, were killed in a gunfight with the police. The police received information that the pirates were staying at an Alamin fishery project near Bhuiyarhat of Subarnachar upazila and planning a crime in the Meghna River. Sensing the presence of the police, the pirates opened fire at them, and the law enforcers retaliated. After the gunfight, the three pirates were dead.

data.name: Rubel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Rubel and two other alleged pirates, Kalu and Ripon, were killed in a gunfight with the police. The police received information that the pirates were staying at an Alamin fishery project near Bhuiyarhat of Subarnachar upazila and planning a crime in the Meghna River. Sensing the presence of the police, the pirates opened fire at them, and the law enforcers retaliated. After the gunfight, the three pirates were dead.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and police personnel in Chuadanga Sadar upazila early Monday. Police identified the victim as Billal Hossain, 42, son of Atiar Rahman of Dakkhinchadpur village in Damurhuda upazila of the district, reports our Kushtia correspondent. Billal, a member of an inter-district robber gang, was accused in three cases filed with Chuadanga, Sadar, and Damurhuda police stations for murder, extortion, and mugging, police said. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police around 3:45 am conducted a raid at Ujalpur field where a gang of robbers was holding a clandestine meeting, said Gazi Ibrahim, officer-in-charge of Chuadanga Sadar Police Station. Sensing the presence of the policemen, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to fire back, triggering a gunfight, the OC said. The bullet-riddled body of Billal was found lying on the ground as his cohorts managed to flee the scene, he added.

data.name: Solaiman Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A Jamaat leader, who sustained injuries in a clash with the police on Tuesday, succumbed to his injuries at a Rajshahi hospital yesterday. The deceased, Solaiman Hossain, 29, hailed from Roghunathpur village under Mujibnagar upazila in Meherpur. He was a Jamaat-e-Islami leader of Amjhupi union in the upazila. Abdul Jabbar, the general secretary of Jamaat's Amjhupi union, said Solaiman joined Tuesday's hartal procession, the second day of the 48-hour hartal enforced by the party. He sustained bullet injuries to the head and chest as the police opened fire on the procession, Jabbar said, adding that Solaiman was rushed to Meherpur General Hospital first. He was later shifted to the Rajshahi Islami Bank Medical College Hospital (RIBMCH) to avoid arrest, where he died around 3:30 pm, Jabbar added.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: At least five pirates were critically injured and may have succumbed to their injuries during a marathon six-hour gunfight with the police in the Manpura upazila of Bhola early Sunday. The incident occurred at the Burir Don area near the Meghna estuary in Manpura. Md Maniruzzaman Monir, the district superintendent of police, citing eyewitness accounts, said the pirates were seen dragging away five of their fellow gang members when they fled the scene. It could not be confirmed whether any of the pirates had died. There were no police casualties. According to sources, the pirates are believed to belong to the notorious gang Kalam Bahini, and they opened fire on a police patrol team around 3 am. Police retaliated by firing back, triggering a six-hour-long fight. Policemen from Lalmohan, Tajumuddin, and Monpura police stations joined in the fray. Police reportedly fired 52 rounds of gunshots during the fight, while the pirates fired more than 200 shots. Later, the pirates retreated and took shelter in a forest in the remote Dhal Char. Police were yet to arrest any of the pirates or recover any dead bodies when this report was filed in the afternoon, but they said they would launch a raid soon. The pirates managed to get away as police forces were "less prepared" in terms of manpower and firepower compared to the pirates, Maniruzzaman said.

data.name: Yunus
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed and seven people, including five police personnel, were injured in a "gunfight" with the police in the Kalam Char area in Hatiya upazila here early yesterday. The deceased is Yunus, 38, the ringleader of the notorious "Yunus Bahini." Khorshed Alam, the officer-in-charge of Hatiya Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, the police had raided a remote area of Kalam Char around midnight. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, members of the robber gang had opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, Khorshed added. The police found Yunus dead and arrested Yunus's wife, Asma Akter, and Ismail Hossain, one of Yunus's accomplices, from the spot with bullet wounds. The rest of the gang escaped.

data.name: Saiful Islam Mithu
data.description: A man died at a hospital in the capital two and a half hours after he was picked up by the police from the Shahjahanpur area on Wednesday night. Police claimed that Saiful Islam Mithu, 38, a resident of Gulbagh in the Malibagh area, was a drug addict. Mithu and two others were detained in the Titipara area around 10:00 am when they failed to produce documents for the motorbike they were riding, said Ziauzzaman, the officer-in-charge of Shahjahanpur Police Station. Identifying all three as addicts, the police officer said they were riding the motorbike without helmets and also failed to show any documents. At the police station, Mithu complained of chest pain. Police rushed him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead around 12:30 am, the OC added.

data.name: Mohammad Boshir
data.description: Reportedly, Selim, a Sub-Inspector of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station, tortured Boshir, and as a result, he died.

data.name: Fazlur Rahman Fazlu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The leader of an extremist group was killed in the early hours of Sunday in what police described as a "gunfight." The encounter took place in Kushtia district's Khoksha upazila. The deceased, Fazlur Rahman Fazlu, was a leader of the extremist outfit, Gonomukti Fouz, according to the police. The incident occurred near the Uthli bridge in Khoksha. Superintendent of Kushtia Police, Mafiz Uddin Ahmed, said detective police raided the place acting on a tip-off about an extremist meeting. Gunshots were exchanged between the extremists and the police, he added. "Fazlu was shot dead on the spot. The others fled," said the police officer.

data.name: Emran
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Emran, an alleged pirate, was killed along with another individual in a gunfight with the police in Hatiya upazila, Noakhali.

data.name: Josim Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Josim Uddin, an alleged pirate, was killed along with another individual in a gunfight with the police in Hatiya upazila, Noakhali.

data.name: Jiarul Islam
data.description: An alleged smuggler was killed in a clash between Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) troops and smugglers along the Kakdanga border in Kolaroa upazila on Thursday night. The deceased was identified as Jiarul Islam, 35, son of Lutfor Rahman from Boalia village in the same upazila. BGB sources said that when a group of 40-50 smugglers entered the country along with Indian goods through the border, a BGB patrol team challenged them in the afternoon. The smugglers attacked the law enforcers with sticks and brickbats in an attempt to flee, triggering a clash between them. BGB personnel fired three rounds of bullets that left Jiarul wounded. The bullet-hit Jiarul was first taken to Kolaroa hospital and then shifted to the sadar hospital where he succumbed to his injuries at 10:45 pm.

data.name: Wahed Mohajan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged notorious leader of a robber's gang was killed in a shootout with police near Chalna Bridge in Sadar upazila of Pirojpur early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Wahed Mohajan, 42, son of Abdul Aziz Mohajon of Kalikati village in the same upazila. Two policemen were injured during the gunfight. Tipped off that a gang of 8-10 robbers, led by Wahed, was preparing to commit robbery in the area, a joint team of police and DB men raided the area around 2:30 am, said Sadar police sources. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire at the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight that left Wahed dead on the spot and two constables, Monir and Mohiuddin, injured. Later, police recovered a rifle and a few bullets from the spot.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An Islami Chhatra Shibir activist was killed in clashes with the police in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga on Thursday during an alleged attempt to vandalize idols of the Hindu goddess Durga. Our correspondent reported that Shibir activist Rafiqul Islam, 23, son of Delwar Hossain from Boalia in Chuadanga Sadar, died on the spot after receiving a bullet wound to the head during the unrest. The incident took place during Shibir's nationwide demonstrations demanding the release of the convicted or on-trial leaders of Shibir and Jamaat-e-Islami. Witnesses said a procession of around 500 Jamaat and Shibir men, equipped with sticks and brick chips, attempted to vandalize a Durga statue in the Darshana Gate bazar area around 3:30 pm. Damurhuda police station Officer-in-Charge Ahsan Habib said the Jamaat activists began pelting stones when the police intercepted them. "Police were compelled to fire 15 rounds from their shotguns, submachine guns, and Chinese rifles to dispel the gathering crowd," the OC said. Rafiqul Islam was taken from the scene to Chuadanga Sadar Hospital, where the doctors declared him dead, the OC said. The locality has been tense since the death of Rafiqul, who was a student of Bakibillah Kamil Madrasa at Badarganj in the same upazila.

data.name: Arif
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: An 18-party alliance led by BNP was carrying out a program on October 25, 2013, related to the ongoing political situation for the 10th parliamentary elections. On that day, in Faridganj of Chandpur, there was a clash among BNP, Jamaat, and the police. In this situation, the police fired 200 rounds of bullets, rubber bullets, and tear shells, resulting in the deaths of Arif and two other BNP activists.

In this situation, the police fired 200 rounds of bullets, rubber bullets, and tear shells, resulting in the deaths of Jahangir and two other BNP activists.

data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: BNP leader Saiful Islam Badsha and another activist of the same party were shot dead by police-BGB in Chokoria, Cox's Bazar during a procession.

data.name: Mohammad Mizan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Mohammad Mizan, an activist of BNP's student wing, and a leader of the same party, were shot dead by police-BGB at Chokoria in Cox's Bazar during a procession.

data.name: Moslem Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In a clash between the police and BNP-Jamaat, one Muslim Uddin suffered a bullet wound and later died at Rangpur Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Rashedul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A Shibir leader was killed, and 12 people, including seven policemen, were injured as BNP, Jamaat, and Shibir activists clashed with the police at Kajla area in Rajshahi city this afternoon. Rashedul Islam, 30, hailing from Dasmaria area, was the treasurer of the Motihar thana unit of Shibir, said Inspector Uttam Kumar, in-charge of Rajshahi Medical College Hospital police box.

data.name: Abu Ahmed
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Three people were killed and 25 others, including law enforcers, were injured in Kutubdia, Cox's Bazar during clashes between police and BNP-Jamaat supporters on Tuesday. The deceased were identified as Abu Ahmed, 50, Ismail Parvez, 25, and Azizur Rahman, 23. However, the police claimed that only two people were killed. According to locals, after the hartal, the BNP and Jamaat-Shibir members were holding a rally in Dakkhin Dhurum Bazar around 6pm. The clash occurred when the police obstructed them. The clash lasted for approximately two hours, during which at least 25 people, including 10 police officers, were injured. The police also claimed that the hartal supporters opened fire at them. The injured individuals were taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital, and the condition of three police officers was critical.

data.name: Tajul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: The deceased were identified as Jamaat activist Abu Ahmed, 55, Shibir member Azizur Rahman, 20, Tajul Islam, 27, and Parvez, 24.

data.name: Mortuza Hossain Rana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two robbers, including the kingpin of a gang, were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) in the Chandpai range of Sundarbans in Bagerhat yesterday. The deceased are Mortuza Hossain Rana, 32, of Joymoni village, and his associate Mosaref Sheikh, 30, of Ghol village under Mongla upazila. Major Anwarul Kabir, deputy commander of Rab-8, said a patrol team of Rab went to the east side of the Shela river on information that the robbers had abducted at least five fishermen for ransom. Sensing Rab's presence around 7:50 am, Mortuza, the linchpin of Mortuza Bahini (gang), and his cohorts opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to return fire. During the gunfight that continued for over half an hour, Rab shot at least 300 bullets, the Major said.

data.name: Nasir Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On November 4, 2013, during a clash between the police, Awami League, and BNP, the police opened fire, resulting in the death of BNP activist Nasir Uddin.

data.name: Jakir Sadik
data.description: ASI Masudur Rahman, in charge of Tekala Police Camp of Doulotpur Police Station in Kushtia, arrested Jakir Sadik, an alleged criminal, from his home and took him to the Doulotpur Police Station on November 13, 2013. Later that day, around 11:00 pm, the victim's family received news that he had died. The family alleges that Jakir Sadik died in police custody as a result of torture.

data.name: Badsha Mia
data.description: Workers of GMS Composite Knitting staged a demonstration and rampage through the workplace, demanding the arrest of an official who allegedly assaulted a female worker. During the demonstration, the police suddenly fired rubber bullets and tear gas at the demonstrators, resulting in the tragic deaths of Badsha and Ruma.

data.name: Ruma
data.description: Workers of GMS Composite Knitting staged a demonstration and rampage through the workplace, demanding the arrest of an official who allegedly assaulted a female worker. During the demonstration, the police suddenly fired rubber bullets and tear gas at the demonstrators, resulting in the tragic deaths of Badsha and Ruma.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Delwar Hossain, 25, was an auto-rickshaw driver. He was injured around 8:30 pm when several crude bombs were detonated from a procession of opposition supporters, as stated by Kotwali Model Police Station OC Mohiuddin Mahmud to reporters. However, the Chhatra Dal's Comilla south unit General Secretary claimed that Delwar was shot and killed by the police. He further claimed that at least 20 more of their activists were injured in police firing.

data.name: Siraj Khan
data.description: Baby taxi driver Siraj Khan was allegedly beaten to death by SI Asad, Ramzan Ali, Aminul, and ASI Azad, Harun, Jewel. On November 26, 2013, Siraj Khan and five others were playing cards when the aforementioned police officers arrived at the location and accused them of gambling. The officers then pursued them as they attempted to escape the area. The police apprehended Siraj and assaulted him. Subsequently, local residents chased the police team away from the scene. Meanwhile, Siraj was pronounced dead by doctors after being taken to the Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Yusuf Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Witnesses said the clash with the police erupted around 3 pm after Juba Dal supporters blocked the Dhaka-Bogra highway at Banani. The police fired rubber bullets and lobbed tear gas shells to disperse the opposition activists, while they retaliated by hurling crude bombs, the police said. Yusuf was struck by a bullet and died on the spot during the clash that lasted about an hour, according to witnesses. Shahjahanpur Police Station OC Mahmudul Alam confirmed the firing of rubber bullets and the lobbing of tear gas to take control of the situation. He also confirmed Yusuf’s death but did not say whether he was killed in police firing. Bogra Juba Dal President Al Bakhtiar claimed that five more Juba Dal leaders had received bullet injuries. He and 19 others were also injured.

data.name: Babul Mia
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On 26 November, during a blockade, blockaders allegedly vandalized and set fire to vehicles at Doulotganj bazaar in Laksam upazila of Comilla. During the incident, police indiscriminately opened fire, resulting in the death of Babul Mia, a rickshaw puller and an activist of BNP Sromik Dol.

data.name: Shamsur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A Jamaat-e-Islami supporter died after police opened fire during clashes with pickets in Satkhira early on Wednesday. The incident took place in the Agardari area of Sadar upazila at around 4 am, police said. The deceased was identified as Shamsur Rahman, 36, son of Abdul Mazed from Satkhira in Sadar. Police, Rapid Action Battalion (Rab), and paramilitary Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) were conducting a joint raid in the area when the pickets attacked. Thousands of Jamaat supporters called others in the area, making announcements on loudspeakers, Satkhira Sadar police Officer-in-Charge Inamul Haque said. They surrounded the law enforcers, blocked the road with logs, and began pelting stones, he said. Police were compelled to fire 150 rounds of rubber bullets, live rounds, and tear gas shells, the OC added. "We heard that one person died, but we could not recover the body." Later, additional forces were sent to rescue the trapped law enforcers. Satkhira Jamaat leader Abdul Khaleque Mondal claimed the casualty as one of his own and said some more supporters were injured.

data.name: Israil Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An activist of Islami Chhatra Shibir died, and 10 more were injured when the police opened fire during clashes in Kotchandpur upazila of Jhenaidah on Saturday. The local unit of the opposition called for a daylong hartal in two upazilas for Sunday in protest against the death. The incident took place during a fresh spell of a 72-hour blockade program called by the BNP-led opposition 18-party alliance. The deceased was identified as Israil Hossain, 23, a local activist of Jamaat-e-Islami's student wing, the police said. Kotchandpur circle police Assistant Superintendent Jahidul Islam said the police were compelled to open live gunfire to bring the situation under control. Kotchandpur upazila BNP President Sirajul Islam Siraj called for a daylong hartal in Kotchandpur and Moheshpur upazilas for Sunday in protest of the death.

data.name: Mafizur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: Rickshaw-puller Mafizur Rahman, who was wounded by a bullet during a clash between the police and the student wing of Jamaat in Daganbhuiyan, Feni, died from his injuries at Chittagong Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Shariful Islam Russel
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A youth was killed when the police opened fire on blockade supporters at Sitakunda Upazila in Chittagong in the early hours of Tuesday. Local BNP leaders claimed that the deceased, Shariful Islam Russell, 20, was the Vice-President of its volunteer front, Jatiyatabadi Swechchhasebak Dal's Muradpur Union unit. Sitakunda Police Station Inspector (Investigation) Aminul Islam said the police fired when the agitators tried to vandalize vehicles on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway. Shariful was shot and died on the spot. Swechchhasebak Dal called for a daylong shutdown in Chittagong north for Wednesday to protest the killing.

data.name: Hossain Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two people were killed and five were injured when blockade supporters clashed with the police at Debhata's Sokhipur in Satkhira. The deceased were identified as Hossain Ali, 14, and Arizul Islam, 20. District Jamaat's Publicity Secretary, Azizur Rahman, claimed that the two were Shibir activists and were shot to death by the police. However, the police did not confirm the incident. Rahman also claimed that party leaders Rashid Molla, Saddam Hossain, and Abdullah sustained bullet injuries. However, Satkhira Additional SP Joydev Chowdhury told reporters that the police and BGB personnel opened fire when pro-blockade activists hurled bombs at them while they were removing roadblocks placed on the Satkhira-Shymnagar road. In Satkhira, the 18-Party alliance's nationwide blockade coincided with a dawn-to-dusk general strike called in protest of the arrest of Jamaat's town unit chief, Fakhrul Islam. Meanwhile, suspected opposition activists lynched Gias Uddin, 32, a member of Awami League's Satkhira municipality Ward No. 7 unit, at Sadar Upazila's Talbarhia on Tuesday evening. Gias was going to Bhomra land port on his motorcycle when the activists of BNP and Jamaat waylaid him. "They beat him to death on the spot," said Sadar Police Station OC Enamul Haque. Barely a week ago, two more ruling party leaders had also been beaten to death by the BNP and Jamaat activists in Satkhira.

data.description: Siam Mastan, an eighth grader, and Tajul Islam Ratan, an activist of the student wing of BNP, were killed in a clash with the police at Kalibari around 10:30 am on December 4, 2013. At least five more suffered bullet injuries in the incident.

data.name: Harunur Rashid
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: The youth wing activist of BNP, Harunur Rashid, was killed in a clash with the police. Thirty other people were injured in the incident.

data.name: Mohammad Shafique
data.description: An alleged mugger was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Boro Moghbazar early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Mohammad Shafique, 38. The law enforcers claimed that they had arrested three of his accomplices. Papia Islam, the wife of Shafique, however, said her husband was a cloth trader and she had no information about his involvement in mugging. Major Md Sadiqur Rahman, the company commander of Rab-3, said, "The shootout occurred around 2:00 am when Rab personnel challenged a gang of muggers who were preparing to commit a crime. "Rab members shot back when the criminals started shooting at the law enforcers," he said. At one stage, the gang tried to flee in a car, but the car hit an electric pole at Moghbazar, the police claimed. The criminals took the injured Shafique to a hospital on Panthapath, where doctors declared him dead, said Nazmul Ahsan, sub-inspector of Ramna Police Station.

data.name: Alamgir Rahman Sumon
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: An eight-year-old boy has been shot dead in a crossfire between the police and the activists of the BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami in Sirajganj Sadar. The victim was identified as Alamgir Rahman Sumon (by New Age), who was the son of Anwar Hossain of Bohuli village. Witnesses said the police stopped opposition activists when the latter blocked the Sirajganj-Bohuli-Raiganj road.

data.name: Abdus Salam Mia
data.description: On 10 December 2013, Acting Company Commander Nayek Subedar Imtiajur Rahman of Modhugram BGB fired two bullets at CNG driver Abdus Salam's upper and lower knee in front of a Shaheed Minar near the road to Chagalnaiya from Shuvopur, Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Feni, according to a report from Inqilab newspaper. Subedar Imtiajur Rahman suspected Abdus Salam of being a smuggler and pursued him. Later, BGB personnel apprehended Salam and Imtiajur shot him during a confrontation. Local residents rescued the injured Abdus Salam and transported him to the hospital, but he died en route.

data.name: Mohammad Salman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In Feni, Mohammad Salman, a class-X student of Jamiatul Al Salayyha Madrasa, was killed in a clash between Jamaat-Shibir members and the police on Trunk Road in the town last night. The police said the clash erupted when a Jamaat-Shibir member hurled crude bombs at police vans. AKM Shamsuddin, the general secretary of the district unit Jamaat, claimed that Salman was a Shibir activist and was injured when the police opened fire. Salman, who was hit by a bullet, was rushed to a nearby private clinic where doctors declared him dead. The police deny shooting at the activists.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Jamaat activist Anwar Hossain was killed, and 38 people, including three policemen, were injured in Comilla after the police clashed with Jamaat members in Monoharganj upazila on the last day of the opposition alliance's blockade.

data.name: Shihab
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: At least five people, including a Juba Dal leader, were killed and at least 50 people received bullet injuries in a clash with members of RAB and the police at Laxmipur Sadar Upazila on Thursday morning. The deceased are: Iqbal Mahmud Jewel, senior vice-president of the district Juba Dal; Shihab Hossain, a Shibir activist; Sumon, a Juba Dal activist; Mahbubur Rahman, a businessman; and an unidentified youth aged around 30. The BNP activists locked in a clash at 7:00 am while the members of RAB and the police were raiding the residence of Sahabuddin Sabu, the general secretary of Laxmipur district. The police fired rubber bullets and shotgun bullets to disperse the BNP men. Jewel died on the spot, and Sahabuddin Sabu was among the 50 who received bullet injuries.

data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In Khulna, an 18-year-old boy named Nahid died after the police opened fire on Jamaat Shibir activists who had attacked the Nirala police outpost in the town. The police stated that the Jamaat members had thrown petrol bombs and cocktails at the outpost, which led to the police firing their weapons.

data.name: Khorshed Ali
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: In Noakhali, a blockade named Khorshed Ali, 40, died from bullet injuries yesterday. He was hit when law enforcers opened fire on a group of blockaders to clear the Chatkhil-Sonaimuri road at Afania in Begumganj upazila on Thursday. Imam Uddin, a rickshaw puller, was also injured in the police firing.

data.name: Faez Ahmed
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A leader of Jamaat-e-Islami was allegedly murdered in the Uttar Timuhoni area in the district town early Saturday. The deceased was identified as Dr. Faez Ahmed, the Nayed-e-Ameer of Jamaat-e-Islami’s Laxmipur unit. Family members alleged that a team of RAB members entered their house, breaking the gate and door at 12 am, and took him (Faez Ahmed) to the roof of their house. Later, the RAB members pushed him from the house after shooting him. However, the complaint was not confirmed by law enforcers or any reliable source. Laxmipur Jamaat has called for a daylong hartal in the district to protest the killing of their leader.

data.name: Abdul Aziz
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police shot dead eight activists of the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami, including Abdul Aziz alias Raihan, in Companiganj, Noakhali on December 14, 2013, during a clash. On that day, Jamaat-e-Islami activists organized a procession. The police attempted to obstruct the procession, leading to a clash with the activists. Eventually, the police opened fire, resulting in the death of eight activists.

data.description: Major Shahed of RAB-11 stated that BNP leader Ashaduzzaman was killed in a gunfight with RAB on December 15, 2013. However, the family of Johirul Islam Sumon, a BNP activist, alleged that he was also killed in the gunfight. Nevertheless, RAB refuted the accusation.

data.name: Johirul Islam Sumon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: The family of Johirul Islam Sumon, a BNP activist, alleged that he, along with BNP leader Ashaduzzaman, were killed in a gunfight with RAB. However, RAB denied the allegation and stated that only Ashaduzzaman died in the gunfight.

data.name: Insan Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Activists of Jamaat and its student wing, including Insan Ali, were shot to death in police firing during a clash with the police. In this incident, 20 people, including a woman, were injured. Among the injured, Abdur Rahman, a former UP member and activist of Jamaat, later succumbed to his injuries at Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Jahangir Alam

data.description: Five activists of Jamaat and the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami, including Jahangir Alam, were shot dead in clashes with joint forces. Of them, three died in Sadar upazila, while two died in Debhata upazila, in separate battles that ensued when the party supporters attacked the law enforcers who went to make arrests in connection with the latest spate of violence.
