data.name: Sohag
data.description: On December 18, 2013, an alleged criminal named Sohag was killed in a crossfire with the police in the Aftabnagar area of Badda, Dhaka.

data.name: Md Al Mahmud
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers, including Md Al Mahmud, were killed in a gunfight with the police in the Baniagati area under Kamarkand Upazila of Sirajganj District on December 24, 2013.

data.name: Mansur Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers, including Mansur Ali, were killed in a gunfight with the police in the Baniagati area under Kamarkand Upazila of Sirajganj District on December 24, 2013.

data.name: Hafizul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: A rickshaw-van puller was killed, and a bicycle mechanic was injured when members of the joint forces came under attack from blockaders and retaliated with gunshots in Satkhira Sadar Upazila yesterday. The deceased, Hafizul Islam, 21, who hailed from the upazila's Gobindakati village, was a supporter of Jamaat, said the police. Hafizul was standing at the roadside at that time. Haran was in his mechanical shop nearby when he was hit in the head. Hafizul's family members and a few Jamaat-Shibir men took his body and hid it in Rudrapur Beel, witnesses said. The police recovered the body from there around 2:45 pm and sent it to the Satkhira Sadar Hospital morgue. Hafizul's brother, Shahidul Islam, said locals had told them that if the police took the body, they would not return it. That is why they hid the body. He added that none of his four brothers was involved with any political party.

data.name: Mansur Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: One person died during a clash between the police and Jamaat-e-Islami supporters on Sunday at Dhaka's Malibagh. Rampura Police Station OC Kreepa Shindhu Bala said that the police stopped a procession of Jamaat activists heading towards Naya Paltan around 12 pm in the Malibagh area. "Handmade bombs were lobbed from the procession, so the police fired in the air," he said. One Mansur Ali, caught up in the clash, was injured in the explosions. Doctors declared Ali dead after he was brought to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH), said Rampura Police Station's operations officer Kamruzzaman. He said they came to know that Ali was a student of a private university in Uttara. DMCH police outpost's inspector Mozammel Haque said that he had been injured in the chest. The police, however, are yet to ascertain whether Ali was an activist of any political party.

data.name: Mohammad Jihad
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Mohammad Jihad, an activist of the youth wing of BNP hailing from Nobogram, Ullapara, Sirajganj, was shot dead by the police at Malibagh, Dhaka during the 'March for Democracy' movement led by BNP and its 18-Party Alliance.

data.name: Anarul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Anarul Islam, a Union Parishad Chairman, who allegedly had direct links with the recent violence in Satkhira, was killed in a "gunfight" between joint forces and Jamaat-Shibir activists in Vadra of Satkhira Sadar upazila. On December 30, 2013, the joint forces were patrolling the Vadra area of Kushkhali UP around 12:30 pm when approximately 250 Jamaat-Shibir activists attacked the law enforcers with brickbats and crude bombs. At one stage, the attackers opened fire on the lawmen, forcing them to retaliate with gunshots. After approximately an hour, the Jamaat-Shibir men retreated and law enforcers discovered the bullet-hit body of Anarul lying near a pond in the area.

data.name: Kismot Ali
data.description: In Khulna, an individual named Kismat Ali (50) has been killed due to police torture. However, the police have denied the allegation, stating that Kismat fell ill upon seeing the police, and doctors declared him dead after he was taken to the hospital. The incident occurred in the Barakpur area of Dighalia upazila on Monday night. Kismat's wife, Najma Begum, said that around 9:30 pm, two policemen and a village guard named Makbul came to their house. They then proceeded to make various accusations. Later, the police called her husband outside and struck him with a rifle. They took him to the union council, beating him along the way. Later that night, she found his dead body at the upazila hospital. There were signs of injury in various parts of his body. The acting officer-in-charge of the police station, Md. Rabiul Islam, said that Kismat was a drug user and died of a heart attack upon seeing the police.

data.name: Arman Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Akkelpur, Jaipurhat on December 31, 2013. The deceased was identified as Arman Ali (40), the son of the late Akkas Ali from the village of Puran Gopinathpur under Akkelpur. Md Hamidul Alam, the Police Superintendent of Jaipurhat, stated that upon receiving information about a group of robbers, led by Arman Ali, planning a robbery in Puran Gopinathpur, a police team quickly responded. However, as the law enforcement officers arrived at approximately 2:30 pm, the robbers opened fire on the police, who retaliated.

data.name: Abdul Jobbar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A ward-level Jamaat-e-Islami leader was killed in a gunfight between law enforcers and Jamaat-Shibir members in Sadar upazila on December 31, 2013. AKM Nahidul Islam, Superintendent of Police (SP) in Meherpur, said a team of joint forces arrested Jabbar from his residence at Hijuli village on December 30, 2013 in connection with recent violence unleashed by Jamaat and its student wing, Islami Chhatra Shibir, in the district. During the interrogation, Jabbar disclosed the identity of the party members in the area, as well as a cache of arms possessed by them, the SP said. Shibir cadres, led by Abdul Matin, Khulna divisional coordinator of Jamaat, were scheduled to meet him in the village that night, according to Jabbar's statement. Following the confession, a team of joint forces conducted a raid in the village around 2:00 am on December 31, 2013. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Jamaat-Shibir members opened fire on the joint forces, while the law enforcers fired gunshots in response. At one point, Jabbar, who was staying with the team during the raids, jumped out of the police van to flee the scene and was caught in the line of fire.

data.name: Faruk Patwary
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In Chandpur, an activist of Jatiyatabadi Jubo Dal, the youth wing of the BNP, was shot dead, and several others were wounded in a clash between blockaders and BGB personnel yesterday. This incident occurred on the first day of the BNP-led opposition's indefinite blockade across the country. According to police and witnesses, blockaders attacked a BGB motorcade carrying a magistrate as it reached Mahamaya in Sadar upazila around 5:15 pm. In retaliation, Border Guard Bangladesh personnel opened fire on the blockaders, resulting in injuries to Jubo Dal activist Faruk Patwary, 35, and several others. Faruk was quickly taken to Chandpur Sadar Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead. Magistrate Aminur Rahman, who was with the BGB team, stated that the BGB personnel opened fire on the attackers in self-defense, as reported by The Daily Star.

data.name: Rajib Biswas
data.description: A person who was arrested for police firearm theft was killed in a "gunfight" with the police early Sunday in Shalikha upazila of Magura. The deceased was identified as Rajib Biswas, son of the late Abdul Jalil. Magura Additional Police Superintendent Mizanur Rahman confirmed the death to the Dhaka Tribune. Mizan said, "Raju was arrested from the Simakhali Bazar area of the upazila on Saturday night for his involvement in the theft of a submachine gun (SMG) from police possession during election duty at Ghobra Primary School polling station in Shalikha upazila early Thursday." Following Raju's statement, the police conducted a drive along with Raju in a field near Ghobra Primary School to recover more arms and arrest other criminals. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Raju's cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. During this time, Raju died on the spot, Mizan said.

data.name: Anwarul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Anwarul Islam, a Jamaat activist, was killed, and five cops were injured in a gunfight between Jamaat-Shibir members and the joint force at Ghonapara of Debhata upazila on January 14, 2014.

data.name: Md Ismail Rajib
data.description: A day after the killing of a cop, Md Ismail Rajib and another accused in the case were killed in a "gunfight" between their associates and law enforcers in the Halishahar Beribandh area of Chittagong city on January 15, 2014.

data.name: Md Nasir Uddin
data.description: A day after the killing of a cop, Md Nasir Uddin and another accused in the case were killed in a "gunfight" between their associates and law enforcers in the Halishahar Beribandh area of Chittagong city on January 15, 2014.

data.name: Shohidar Rahman
data.description: An allegation has arisen of a person's death due to a beating by a member of the Border Guard Bangladesh's (BGB) intelligence branch in Kurigram. The deceased person is named Sahidar Rahman (38), son of Shohar Uddin from Baraipara village of Naodanga Union in Fulbari. Sahidar was injured in the beating and died in the hospital on Monday night. According to eyewitnesses, family members, and the police, Sahidar was returning home after dining at a relative's house on Monday evening. While passing by Kurusha-Ferusha Government Primary School, a member of the BGB's intelligence branch, Lance Naik Jalal, stopped him. Jalal challenged Sahidar, accusing him of possessing marijuana, leading to an argument between the two. Enraged, Jalal brutally attacked Sahidar with a tree branch, causing Sahidar to fall unconscious on the spot. Jalal then left him there and fled. Local residents rescued Sahidar and initially took him to Fulbari Hospital. Due to his deteriorating condition, he was transferred to Rangpur Medical College Hospital, where he died around nine at night. The company commander of Kurigram 45 BGB's Shimulbari company headquarters, Subedar Rahmat Ali, said that Sahidar's death might have been caused by a seizure. He assured that the matter would be thoroughly investigated, and necessary actions would be taken.

data.name: Mohammad Choton
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Islami Chhatra Shibir activist Mohammad Choton died in clashes between the joint forces and Jamaat-e-Islami in Satkhira Sadar upazila on 18 January. He is the son of Shahar Ali from Padmashakhara village of Satkhira Sadar, according to the local police. The joint forces attempted to conduct a raid in the area around 4:45 am to stop the efforts, Satkhira Sadar police station Officer-in-Charge Enamul Haque said. Jamaat activists attacked the joint forces with bricks and crude bombs in the east Bhomra area, he said. The law enforcers were compelled to open fire. Choton was found at the scene with bullet wounds and was rushed to Satkhira Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Golam Rabbani
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On December 15, 2013, at least 18 people in RAB uniforms raided a house in Panchagarh where Golam Rabban was staying and picked him up, according to his family. Later, on January 18, 2014, he was found dead in a bush beside Nilphamari Domar road. He was accused of attacking the motorcade of cultural activist-turned Awami League leader Asaduzzaman Noor.

data.name: Mossharof Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police recovered the bullet-wounded body of a local leader of the Islami Chhatra Shibir from Sitakunda upazila, Chittagong on Sunday morning. Law enforcers have identified the deceased as Mosharraf Hossain, 22, a municipal unit secretary of the Shibir, the student wing of the Jamaat-e-Islami, in the upazila. The body was recovered from Choto Darogarhat, adjacent to the Dhaka-Chittagong highway. Sitakunda police station Officer-in-Charge Iftekhar Hossain confirmed the incident. Mohammad Sahadat, one of the deceased's cousins, claimed that members of the elite force Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) had picked up Mosharraf on Saturday night. RAB 7 commanding officer Miftah Uddin Ahmad denied any connection to the incident, stating: “We did not conduct any operations within that area last night.”

data.name: Tarique Mohammad Saiful Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Tarique Mohammad Saiful Islam, Assistant Secretary General of the Meherpur unit of Jamaat-e-Islami, who was in police custody, was killed during a "gunfight" between Jamaat-Shibir members and law enforcement on January 20, 2014.

data.name: Atikur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: The body of Tupamari Union Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal joint secretary Atikur Rahman, 26, was recovered from the Dhola Gachha Nariya Khamba area of Saidpur bypass road on January 20, 2014. On the night of January 14, at least six people, who claimed to be members of the Detective Branch of the police, stormed into the house and abducted Atikur from Tangail, according to his family. Later, he was found dead. He was accused of attacking the motorcade of cultural activist-turned Awami League leader Asaduzzaman Noor.

data.name: Shahinur Rahman Shohag
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A Shibir activist, who sustained bullet wounds during the clash on January 19, 2014, with joint forces in Gaibandha, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital in Bogra on January 21, 2014. The activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and its student wing ambushed a police team while the law enforcers were raiding Kadamtala and Khanabari villages, known to be Jamaat-Shibir strongholds, in Sundarganj to arrest the people wanted in the cases filed in connection with the February 2013 violence in the district. On receiving information, members of the joint forces rushed to the areas to rescue the police team. The Jamaat men also attacked the joint forces, forcing the law enforcers to fire tear gas shells and rubber bullets to disperse the unruly activists.

data.name: Didarul Alam Didar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A former Juba Dal leader from Lakshmipur was killed in a gun battle between RAB and criminals. The deceased, Didarul Alam Didar, 40, was the former general secretary of Charshahi Union under Sadar Upazila. Juba Dal is the youth affiliate of BNP. Rezaul Karim Liton, the president of its Lakshmipur unit, said, "Didar does not belong to Juba Dal. He was expelled due to a violation of party discipline." The body was sent to the Sadar Hospital morgue early on Thursday. RAB was conducting a raid in Charshahi on Wednesday night to apprehend criminals, according to RAB-11 Major Sahed. The criminals fired at the RAB raiders, forcing them to retaliate, Major Sahed said. Later, Didar was found dead, possibly shot during the encounter, he said.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: The family of a young man from Munshiganj, named Suman, who was killed in Pallabi of the capital, has alleged that the police were responsible for his murder. Suman's father, Elemullah, made the accusation at the morgue of Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Elemullah claimed, "We have been living in the Pallabi Kalshi area for a long time. At various times, the police have planted a gun in my son's pocket and filed cases against him. Sometimes, they have arrested him without reason, filing false cases, and sent him to jail. After spending three years in jail, he was released seven months ago and took a job as a bus driver. He left home yesterday afternoon. After that, we lost track of him. Later, we learned from the police that Suman had died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital from a gunshot wound to the head." However, Sub-Inspector Abdul Jabbar of Pallabi Police Station said, "We found him under the Wapda building in the Dh Block of Pallabi's Kalshi area with a bullet wound in his head. He died after being taken to the hospital." It should be noted that Suman was shot in the back of the head and killed around 8:30 pm on Friday night at the Mohakhali Wireless Mor.

data.name: Enamul Haque Biswas
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: During gunfights between joint forces and Jamaat-Shibir members in Jhenidah and Satkhira on January 26, 2014, two Jamaat leaders and an Islami Chhatra Shibir activist were killed, and six policemen were reportedly injured. Enamul, a teacher at Balarampur High School and also a Jamaat activist, was hit during the 20-minute gunfight with the joint forces. He died on the spot in Jhenaidah.

data.name: Abul Kalam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police arrested Kalam and Maruf in their village, Kulia, in Debhata around 9:00 pm on January 25, 2014. Joint forces raided various locations in Debhata upazila to seize weapons and apprehend other individuals accused of violence and murder. According to the OC, when the joint forces entered Narkeli village, Jamaat-Shibir members encircled the law enforcement officers. As a result, two of them were killed in the ensuing gunfight.

data.name: Maruf Chhoto
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police arrested Kalam and Maruf in their village, Kulia, in Debhata around 9:00 pm on January 25, 2014. Joint forces raided various locations in Debhata upazila to seize weapons and apprehend other individuals accused of violence and murder. According to the OC, when the joint forces entered Narkeli village, Jamaat-Shibir members encircled the law enforcement officers. As a result, two of them were killed in the ensuing gunfight.

data.name: Azharul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Azharul Islam (35), a leader of Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal, the student organization backed by the Bangladesh Nationalist Party, was killed by joint forces in a 'gunfight' in the Magura Kheyaghat area of Tala upazila in Satkhira on January 27, 2014.

data.name: Touhidul Islam Shabuj
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An operative of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML) was killed in encounters with law enforcers in Khulna on January 28, 2014. Touhidul was killed in a shootout between his group and the police on January 28, 2014, at village Satiani under Phultala upazila of the district.

data.name: Rabiul Islam
data.description: Police said members of the joint forces went to Ziadanga village in Abhaynagar upazila to recover arms with Rabiul, who was arrested in connection with a mugging case earlier on Monday. At the spot, members of Mesbah Bahini opened fire on them, prompting the joint forces to retaliate. During the 20-minute "gunfight," Rabiul tried to escape and came into the line of fire. He was rushed to Abhaynagar Upazila Health Complex in critical condition, where the duty doctor declared him dead. Four police members were also injured during the gunfight, our Jessore correspondent added.

data.name: Javed Hossain
data.description: Javed Hossain, an alleged mugger who received bullet wounds in police firing at Pallabi in Dhaka, died at the National Institution of Traumatology and Orthopaedic Rehabilitation on January 29, 2014.

data.name: Bablu Molla
data.description: Bablu Miah was accused in the murder case of Awami League leader named Saiful Islam. RAB carried out an operation after receiving information that a group of miscreants was planning sabotage near the Jamuna River. Sensing the presence of law enforcement agencies, the miscreants opened fire. RAB also retaliated. In this incident, Bablu Miah was killed.

data.name: Golam Sarwar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In Sadar upazila of Feni, Golam Sarwar, 28, the senior vice-president of the Jubo Dal unit of Fazilpur Union, was killed in a "gunfight" between his associates and law enforcers yesterday afternoon. Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of police and Rab conducted a raid at Laskar Taluk in Uttar Fazilpur village around 4:00 pm to arrest Sarwar. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Sarwar and his associates opened fire on them. The joint team retaliated with bullets. Sarwar was caught in the line of fire during the "gunfight" and died on the spot, said Md Shamsul Alam, the assistant superintendent of police of Feni. A pipe gun and a light gun were recovered from the spot, reports a correspondent from Feni. Sarwar was a listed criminal and an accused in several cases, including robbery and extortion, police said.

data.name: Towhid
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Towhidul Islam, 42, the former joint convener of the Sonaimuri upazila BNP unit in Noakhali, was killed in an exchange of gunfire between his associates and the police at Medipur village in the upazila. Anisur Rahman, the superintendent of police (SP) of the district, said the law enforcers took Towhidul to his home in the village to recover firearms around 4:00 am. As they were returning from the location, Towhidul's associates started firing at the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a 30-minute "gunfight," he said. The police fired 40 bullets from their shotguns. Towhidul, the son of Nurul Islam Master of Bhandragaon village, was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. He was rushed to Noakhali Medical College Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries while undergoing treatment, the SP said. Earlier, he was detained in Dhaka and taken to Noakhali on Wednesday night, as reported by The Daily Star's Noakhali correspondent.

data.name: Ripon Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three alleged robbers were killed in a shootout with the police at Baldipukur in Mithapukur upazila on the Dhaka-Rangpur highway on January 31, 2014. Of the three deceased, Ripon Islam, also known as Ripon (35), and Jahangir Hossain Anwar (35) died on the spot, while the third, Ahmed Ali (35), died at Rangpur Medical College and Hospital at about 1:30 pm, according to the police and hospital sources. The police said the three were members of an inter-district gang of robbers.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain Anwar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three alleged robbers were killed in a shootout with the police at Baldipukur in Mithapukur upazila on the Dhaka-Rangpur highway on January 31, 2014. Of the three deceased, Ripon Islam, also known as Ripon (35), and Jahangir Hossain Anwar (35) died on the spot, while the third, Ahmed Ali (35), died at Rangpur Medical College and Hospital at about 1:30 pm, according to the police and hospital sources. The police stated that the three were members of an inter-district gang of robbers.

Of the three deceased, Ripon Islam, also known as Ripon (35), and Jahangir Hossain Anwar (35) died on the spot, while the third, Ahmed Ali (35), died at Rangpur Medical College and Hospital at about 1:30 pm, according to the police and hospital sources. The police stated that the three were members of an inter-district gang of robbers.

data.name: Shah Alam Mullah
data.description: Shah Alam Sagar, 25, died after what the police claimed was falling from the roof of a building on March 2. However, his family alleged he was tortured to death by the police. Sagar, who worked as a reporter for the weekly 'Saptahik Aparadh Daman', was called to the Uttara (west) Police Station to settle a case, said a police official who asked not to be named, as reported by BDnews24 at the time. The weekly newspaper had recently published a story on the principal of Uttara Trust College, Bashir Ahmed. Following the news report, both parties had filed written complaints against each other, according to the police official. The news of Sagar's death came around 8pm. Some locals suspected that he was pushed off the roof, but no one agreed to speak on record. Assistant Commissioner of Dhaka Metropolitan Police (North), Saifullah Mohammed, told bdnews24.com that the man died after 'falling from the roof'. When asked how it had happened, he said, "Neither the police nor the principal of (Uttara) Trust College pushed him off from the roof." "Shah Alam had no cases against him, so why would he want to escape? This is nothing but a pre-planned killing by the police," the victim’s elder brother, Kamal Mollah, told Dhaka Tribune.

data.name: Ahmed Bhuiyan
data.description: Bhuttu was shot in a gunfight with the police on May 26, 2014. Later, he succumbed to his injuries in the hospital on June 2, 2014. His wife claimed that the police killed him in a planned manner.

data.name: Ekramullah Babu
data.description: A 'carlifter' was killed and another injured in a shootout with the police in Satkhira Sadar Upazila. The slain carlifter has been identified as Ekramullah Babu, 40. The encounter took place in the Chaltetola area early on Wednesday, said Satkhira Sadar Police Station Inspector (Investigation) Nasir Uddin. The police intensified patrolling following a tip-off about a hijacked car being brought to Satkhira, Inspector Nasir told bdnews24.com. The police patrol signaled the car to stop early on Wednesday, but it did not. Instead, bombs were hurled, and bullets were fired at the police from the car. The police were forced to retaliate, which is when Babu and Shahidul were shot inside the car. Babu died on his way to the hospital. The car, owned by Lt Col Omar Faruque’s wife Sanjana Zerin, is now in police custody, Nasir said.

data.name: Mezbaur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: The suspected killer of a ruling Awami League leader has been killed in a so-called encounter with RAB in Abhaynagar Upazila, Jessore. Mezbaur Rahman, leader of a gang named after him, was the prime accused in the murder of Chaitanya Mandal, the youth and sports secretary of Ward No. 2, Prembagh Union. OC Khabir Uddin of Abhaynagar Police Station said the encounter took place at Shalbon beside the Upazila's Maloparha at 4:30 am on Friday. The OC said RAB members had raided Shalban following a tip-off that Mezbaur and his accomplices were holding a meeting there. The gangsters began firing at the RAB, triggering a skirmish. Mezbaur died in the exchange of gunfire. Doctors declared him dead when he was taken to the Upazila Health Complex, he added.

data.name: Siraj Shikdar
data.description: The leader of Siraj Bahini (group), Siraj Shikdar, was killed in a gunfight with the police at Koromjal, Mongla. On February 14, 2014, at around 4:00 am, the police arrested Siraj from Tujulpur village. Later, at 3:00 pm, the police went to Koromjol to rescue arms, according to the information gathered from Siraj. However, a gunfight ensued there as Siraj's associates opened fire on the police, who retaliated. Siraj was later found dead from bullet wounds sustained in the gunfight.

data.name: Salahuddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two people were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the capital's Jatrabari area on February 15, 2014. The deceased were identified as Salahuddin (28) and Jewel (30). The police claimed that the deceased were robbers and were wounded in a gunfight with the police. They were taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital, but they succumbed to their injuries on the way. The police said that they had chased three accused persons, including Salahuddin and Jewel, at Kajla around 4:00 pm. Salahuddin and Jewel were detained in that operation, however, their associates managed to flee. Later, the police carried out another operation along with the two arrested robbers in the Sutir Khalpar Balur Math area to recover the firearms of their associates who had managed to escape. As the police reached the area, some other associates of Salahuddin and Jewel opened fire on them.

data.name: Mohammad Jewel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two people were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the capital's Jatrabari area on February 15, 2014. The deceased were identified as Salahuddin (28) and Jewel (30). The police claimed that the deceased were robbers and were wounded in a gunfight with the police. They were taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital, but they succumbed to their injuries on the way. The police said that they had chased three accused persons, including Salahuddin and Jewel, at Kajla around 4:00 pm. Salahuddin and Jewel were detained in that operation, however, their associates managed to flee. Later, the police carried out another operation along with the two arrested robbers in the Sutir Khalpar Balur Math area to recover the firearms of their associates who had managed to escape. As the police reached the area, some other associates of Salahuddin and Jewel opened fire on them.

data.name: Kala Rajab
data.description: Police arrested Rajab from a location in Jhikargacha upazila around 11:15 pm on February 15, 2014. The OC of Jhikargacha stated that during preliminary interrogation, Rajab disclosed details about his arms den. Based on the information obtained from Rajab, a police team took him to his village home in Keshabpur to recover firearms around 1:45 am. When the law enforcers arrived near a bamboo cluster in the village, Rajab's associates opened fire at them. A gunfight ensued when the policemen retaliated. At one point, Rajab attempted to escape from the clutches of the law and ended up in the line of fire, sustaining bullet injuries. Police promptly rushed him to Keshabpur Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Babul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Police raided a rubber garden in Kulaura upazila around 2:00 am following a tip-off that a gang led by Babul was preparing to commit a robbery there. When the law enforcers approached the garden, Babul's associates sprayed bullets at them. In retaliation, the police fired back, resulting in a "gunfight," according to Alamgir Hossain, assistant superintendent of police (ASP) of Moulvibazar. Police discovered Babul's body lying in a pool of blood. Meanwhile, Babul's family members alleged that the law enforcers had detained and killed them.

data.name: Kiran Bepari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A member of Purba Banglar Sarbahara Party was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at village Bagmara under Shibchar in Madaripur on February 19, 2014. The deceased was identified as Kiran Bepari (29). The police arrested him on February 19, 2014. Later, at around 1:15 am, the police, along with Kiran, started another operation at village Baghmara to recover arms. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, associates of Kiran opened fire on them, triggering a gunfight that critically injured Kiran. Later, Kiran was taken to Shibchar upazila where a doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Ashraf Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between the police and his cohorts in Shyamnagar upazila, Satkhira on February 23, 2014. The police carried out an operation in the area, adjacent to the Sundarbans, around 12:30 am following information that Ashraf was holding a meeting with his associates there. When the law enforcers reached there on a speedboat around 4:00 am, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back. After a 15-minute gunfight, the police recovered Ashraf's bullet-hit body, but his associates managed to escape by a trawler.

data.name: Rakibul Hasan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Condemned militant Rakibul Hasan, also known as Hafiz Mahmud, was recaptured six hours after he, along with two other convicted militants of Jamaat-ul Mujahideen Bangladesh, snatched away a prison van. However, he was killed in an alleged "gunfight" with the police in Tangail on February 24, 2014.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Saddam Hossain was killed when police opened fire to quell a fight between activists of the Awami League and BNP-Jamaat after AL members had allegedly taken control of the Nandia Degree College polling station.

data.name: Mohosin Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mizanur Rahman, the officer in charge of Shibpur police station, said that the law enforcers arrested Mohsin from his home on Sunday midnight for his alleged involvement in a robbery at Everest Cable Industries in the area, which took place on February 1. He was kept in police custody where he was found dead early yesterday, said the OC. The police said Mohsin took his own life by strangulating himself with his muffler. However, the father of the deceased claimed that his son was an innocent farmer and accused the police of beating him to death in custody. The body was sent to Narsingdi Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Mohammad Wasim
data.description: RAB claimed that Mohammad Wasim and Sangram Chowdhury were killed in a gunfight while RAB went to a house in Kadomtoli to rescue four kidnapped individuals. They opened fire at RAB, who retaliated and killed the two during the gunfight. On the other hand, Wasim's wife, Sonia Akhter, alleged that RAB members entered the house, broke the bathroom door, and shot him dead. Sangram attempted to escape by rolling down from the building's pipe, but RAB shot and killed him. Mohammad Wasim worked as a toll contractor for the Postogola Bridge, while Sangram was his assistant.

data.name: Sangram Chowdhury
data.description: RAB claimed that Mohammad Wasim and Sangram Chowdhury were killed in a gunfight while RAB went to a house in Kadomtoli to rescue four kidnapped individuals. They opened fire at RAB, who retaliated and killed the two during the gunfight. On the other hand, Wasim's wife, Sonia Akhter, alleged that RAB members entered the house, broke the bathroom door, and shot him dead. Sangram attempted to escape by rolling down from the building's pipe, but RAB shot and killed him. Mohammad Wasim worked as a toll contractor for the Postogola Bridge, while Sangram was his assistant.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Savar, an alleged member of a gang of robbers was killed when the police opened fire at them in response to an attack with bombs on the law enforcement officers early in the morning on Dhaka-Aricha Highway in the Harannagar area in Rajfulbaria under Savar police station. Inspector Mostofa Kamal, the officer-in-charge of Savar police station, said that during the gunfight that took place around 3 am, four policemen also sustained injuries when the robbers hurled bombs at them. "Acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers had been preparing to commit robbery on the highway, a team of police rushed to the scene," Inspector Pradeep said. He added that upon sensing the presence of the police, the gang of robbers tried to flee, but the officers apprehended some of them and charged them with batons. Pradeep said that at one point, the robbers threw bombs at the officers, prompting them to retaliate with gunfire, resulting in the death of one member of the gang.

data.name: Shahadat Hossain Jasu
data.description: According to RAB, they conducted an operation in ward no. 6, Chorbalua village, Urirchar, Chorelahi union, Companiganj, Noakhali. Sensing the presence of RAB, the individuals opened fire in retaliation. During the gunfight, Shahadat Hossain Jasu was killed.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: A regional leader of the outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party was killed in a "shootout" with the police in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga early yesterday. The deceased, Abul Kashem alias Mekur Kashem, 35, was the son of Juran Ali of Boalmari under Mujibnagar upazila in Meherpur. He was the regional commander of Meherpur for the party and one of the most wanted criminals, said Kamruzzaman, assistant superintendent of police of Chuadanga. Kamruzzaman said a team from Damurhuda Police Station surrounded a mango orchard at Jagannathpur village in Damurhuda upazila around 4:00 am based on information that Kashem was holding a secret meeting with his cohorts there. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Kashem's associates threw bombs at the police personnel, triggering a "gunfight" between the police and Kashem's men, he said. Kashem was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Ripon Majhi
data.description: The police had fired gunshots to stop a group of miscreants from snatching ballot boxes from the polling center set up at the Bhumkhara Government Primary School. However, the police brushed aside the fact that Ripon was killed in the police shooting.

data.name: Abdul Quader
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three piracy suspects were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion at Tambulbunia, under the Sharankhola range of the Sundarbans in Bagerhat on March 6, 2014. Two of the deceased were identified as Quader (New Age identified as Abdul Kader) and Kalyan, while the identity of the third person could not be established. RAB-8 Deputy Commander Major Anowarul Kabir said that the three belonged to Shirsha Bahini, a gang of pirates, in the Sundarbans. Anowarul claimed that acting on a tip-off, a battalion team raided the hideout of the pirates at Tambulbunia, where they were planning a criminal operation. Sensing the presence of battalion personnel, the pirates opened fire at them, and the battalion personnel also retaliated, triggering the gunfight at about 9:30 am.

data.name: Kalyan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three piracy suspects were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion at Tambulbunia, under the Sharankhola range of the Sundarbans in Bagerhat on March 6, 2014. data.name: Sarder Niamat Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Sardar Niamat Hossain, the chairman candidate backed by the Awami League, was allegedly beaten up by BGB men during the election to the upazila parishad on February 27. Niamat, 56, passed away due to his injuries at Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University (BSMMU) in the capital at around 8:30 am on Tuesday. He was the current chairman of Fakirhat Upazila Parishad and the son of Sardar Akkas Ali from Satshaiya village in the upazila.

data.name: Nur Mohammad
data.description: Nur Mohammad (45) of Paschim Leda village under Lilla union was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazaar on March 20, 2014. Upon receiving information that a contingent of yaba was coming from Myanmar, a team of Rab went to the Jaillayadiya shrimp enclosure area around 4:00 pm. Sensing the presence of Rab, the smugglers fired on the law enforcers, prompting them to fire back. After the gunfight, Rab men rescued bullet-hit Nur Mohammad and recovered a long-barrel gun, two bullets, a pistol, and 3,000 yaba tablets from the spot. Upon receiving information, the police rushed there and took Nur Mohammad to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hadis Mia
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Hadis Mia, a local leader of the youth wing of BNP, was killed when BGB opened fire to disperse feuding supporters of BNP and AL in Akhaura over the capture of a polling station. The clashes broke out when AL men tried to capture the Taragan primary school center.

data.name: Laki Akter,
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A woman, the wife of a BNP rebel candidate vying for the chairman post in Gozaria upazila, succumbed to her injuries at the city's Apollo Hospital on March 27. The deceased was identified as Laki Akter, 35, the wife of BNP rebel candidate Mannan Dewan Mona of Gazaria upazila in the district and a resident of the area. Sources told banglanews24 that on March 23, she sustained bullet injuries in a clash between the police and villagers regarding upazila polls violence. She was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital and then transferred to Apollo Hospital, where she died around 10:00 pm after fighting with death for four days.

data.name: Selim Patwari
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: On March 23, 2014, the fourth phase of the upazila election was held. During the election, supporters of the AL-backed candidate tried to snatch ballot boxes from the polling center. The police fired 36 rounds of bullets to bring the situation under control. In this incident, Selim Patwari, Vice-President of Ward No. 9 youth wing of the AL unit, was wounded by a bullet. On March 28, 2014, he died at the hospital.

data.name: Rubel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Eight days after a gunfight between pirates and the police in the Meghna River in Gazaria, Munshiganj, the bullet-riddled body of an alleged bandit named Rubel has been recovered by the Gazaria police station. His body was found in the Meghna River on Wednesday, with bullet wounds on his head. It is worth mentioning that a gunfight between pirates and the police occurred in the Meghna River in Gazaria, Munshiganj on the night of February 4th.

data.name: Mohammad Jabed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: At Char Balua in Companiganj upazila, a shootout occurred between alleged members of the notorious pirate gang 'Jasu Bahini' and the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab), resulting in the death of two suspected pirates. The deceased were identified as Sumon, 25, and Javed, 22. Sajedur Rahman Sajed, the officer-in-charge of Companiganj Police Station, claimed that acting on a tip-off, a team from Rab-11 initiated a raid at Char Balua on Friday afternoon, leading to the arrest of Sumon and Javed. Following their arrest, the elite force, along with the two apprehended suspects, embarked on a mission around 5:00 am to recover firearms from different points in the char area. Upon sensing the presence of law enforcement, associates of Sumon and Javed engaged them by opening fire. This action prompted a return of fire from the Rab personnel, sparking a shootout. After the pirates retreated and fled the scene, the Rab team discovered the bodies of Sumon and Javed lying at the location.

data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang

data.name: Badsha Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Badsha Mia was shot in a gunfight in front of a tea shop on Post Office Lane around 11:45 pm on Wednesday night and died in the hospital around 1 am. Regarding the incident, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Badda Police Station, M.A. Jalil, claimed on Thursday that when on-duty patrol police asked three suspicious youths to stop, they opened fire at the police. In response, the police fired back, and Badsha was hit in the leg. Badsha Mia's wife, Rubina Akter, claimed he was neither a robber nor a gangster. She alleged that the police had arrested her husband and shot him dead.

data.name: Foridul Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Ramu rubber garden area on the Cox's Bazar-Naikkhangchhari road on 20 April. Five members of the police were injured, including Ramu police station Assistant Sub-inspector Milton Dey, who suffered bullet wounds. The deceased was identified as Faridul Alam, 30, son of Abu Siddique, from Nandakhali village.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: The body of an abducted Union Parishad member and a front-line upazila Jamaat-e-Islami leader was found in Jhenaidah Sadar upazila on April 20th. The deceased has been identified as Abul Kalam Azad, 40, son of the late Mohammad Ali Mondal from Kotchandpur upazila, according to the police. Azad was the serving Union Parishad member of Elangi union in Jhenaidah Sadar and the brother of Kotchandpur vice chairman and Jamaat Secretary Mohammad Moabiya. Kalam was abducted on Friday night from his residence, said Jhenaidah police Additional Superintendent Mohammad Hasanuzzaman. "Later, his bullet-hit body was recovered from the Mamunshia Bakultala area on Monday morning after locals spotted the body and informed the police." There were at least nine cases, including murder and vandalism, against Abul Kalam at Kotchandpur police station, he added.

data.name: Saiful Shikari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A man wanted for murder was killed in Jessore during an encounter with the police early on Wednesday. The shootout, which also injured five policemen, took place at Shankarpasha village in Abhaynagar Upazila, according to Abhaynagar Police Station OC Khabir Uddin. The victim has been identified as Saiful Shikari, 35. Shikari was arrested by the police on Tuesday evening and was taken along on a raid to recover firearms. OC Khabir Uddin informed bdnews24.com that the 'encounter' occurred when Shikari's accomplices opened fire on the police raiders. Shikari was caught in the crossfire and died on the spot, as claimed by the OC.

data.name: Nurul Amin Majhi
data.description: Alleged muggers Nurul Amin Majhi, Zahir Ahmed, and Kalu Majhi were killed in a 'gunfight' with Coast Guard members in Teknaf on April 25, 2014. Lt. Shahid Al Ahsan, Coast Guard commander of St Martin's Island Station, claimed that a gunfight began when the patrol team challenged a trawler carrying 'smugglers' on the Naf river. At one stage, the trawler fled into Myanmar, he said, claiming that the 'gang' had been trying to smuggle contraband yaba from Myanmar. On the evening of April 25, 2014, police recovered three bullet-riddled bodies of the alleged gang members raiding reportedly the same trawler anchored at the Bakkhali river in Cox's Bazar.

data.description: Alleged muggers Nurul Amin Majhi, Zahir Ahmed, and Kalu Majhi were killed in a 'gunfight' with Coast Guard members in Teknaf on April 25, 2014. Lt. data.name: Mohammad Jahid Hossain Jakku
data.description: Alleged yaba traders Mohammad Jahid Hossain Jakku and Mohammad Foridul Alam were killed in a gunfight at a checkpoint when they were given a signal to stop the car, but instead, they opened fire. Later, BGB-RAB retaliated by opening fire, resulting in the deaths of both individuals.

data.name: Mohammad Foridul Alam
data.description: Alleged yaba traders Mohammad Jahid Hossain Jakku and Mohammad Foridul Alam were killed in a gunfight at a checkpoint when they were given a signal to stop the car, but instead, they opened fire. Later, BGB-RAB retaliated by opening fire, resulting in the deaths of both individuals.

data.name: Aminur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An Islami Chhatra Shibir leader was shot dead, and seven other activists of the organization were hit by bullets during a police raid at a house in Satkhira town yesterday afternoon. Aminur Rahman, the 30-year-old president of the town unit of the pro-Jamaat student body, died on the way to Satkhira General Hospital. The injured were admitted to the hospital. Police had received a tip-off that around 50-60 Shibir men were holding a meeting at Mukul Hossain's house near Kamalnagar graveyard and planning to carry out violence. As the law enforcers conducted a raid at the house around 5:00 pm, Shibir activists exploded crude bombs targeting the lawmen, Enamul Hawlader, the officer-in-charge of Satkhira Sadar Police Station, told The Daily Star. "Later, the Shibir activists opened fire, prompting us to retaliate with bullets," the OC said. However, the injured activists claimed that the police had surrounded the house and shot them after blindfolding them. Nur Mohammad, one of the bullet-hit individuals, said six of them, including Aminur, were staying in the rented house. "Akhter and Azizul came to the house, and they were resting after having lunch. Suddenly, we realized that the police had surrounded the house," he said. At one stage, the law enforcers entered the house, blindfolded them, and shot them, leaving Aminur dead on the spot, he said.

data.name: AL Kamal
data.description: A college student was shot dead as the police opened fire to disperse agitated people at the Atapara-Chandali intersection in the Sirajganj municipal area on the evening of April 27, 2014. Locals of Atapara and Chandali have been locked in a series of clashes over gambling for the past week. The fresh clash erupted on April 27, 2014. As soon as the clash broke out, two teams of police led by Officer-in-Charge Habibul Islam and Sub-Inspector Ashfaqul Islam went to the area and opened fire to disperse the people, resulting in the death of AL Kamal.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed and three people, including two policemen, were injured in a "gunfight" with the police at Hasanpur on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway in Daudkandi upazila early Monday. The identity of the deceased could not be ascertained yet. Abdus Salam, the officer-in-charge of Daudkandi Police Station, said a gang of robbers intercepted a Cox's Bazar-bound private car from Dhaka on the highway at about 3:00 am. The robbers opened fire on Tajel Barua, the driver of the car, while he was trying to flee the scene. The police, in retaliation, fired back, leaving a robber also bullet-hit. The injured robber was rushed to Gouripur Hospital where the on-duty doctor declared him dead. A case was filed in this connection.

data.name: Sirajul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Jamaat-e-Islami activist Sirajul Islam was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Debhata upazila, Satkhira. OC Jalaluddin of Debhata Police Station stated in the newspaper that activists and leaders of Jamaat-e-Islami were conducting a secret meeting to plan for sabotage at Keuratola, Debhata. Upon receiving this news, the police went there. A gunfight ensued, resulting in the death of Sirajul Islam.

data.name: Dholu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two individuals have been killed in a gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Sundarbans of Bagerhat. RAB has identified the deceased as Dholu, the chief of a bandit gang known as Dholu Bahini, and the second in command, Bachchu. Lieutenant Colonel Faridul Alam, the commander of RAB-8, told Prothom Alo that a team from RAB-8 had started a covert operation in the area around Bhadra Station last Sunday based on information that extortion was being collected from fishermen. Today, around three in the afternoon, RAB challenged a local boat at the Bhadra Station's animal channel. At that point, a group of eight bandits on the boat opened fire at RAB, initiating a gunfight. The gunfight lasted for almost 20 minutes, during which more than a hundred and fifty rounds were exchanged. Eventually, the bandits retreated, and RAB members conducted a search at the scene, recovering the bullet-riddled bodies of two bandits. Local fishermen later identified the deceased as the chief of Dholu Bahini and the second in command, Bachchu.

data.name: Jamshed Alam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Feni Assistant Superintendent of Police (Sadar), Shamsul Alam, said the clash with the police was sparked off when leaders and activists of BNP attacked the 'Uttar Char Chandria Centre' around 10 am on Sunday. Jamshed Alam, an activist of BNP's youth front, was declared dead by doctors when he was rushed to Feni Sadar Hospital.

An activist of Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal, the BNP's student affiliate, Shahidullah, died within the next hour.

data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Joynal, 30, and Harun, 40, from the village of Khagrabari, were killed in police firing when opposition men attacked polling stations at the Basudevpur Government Primary School polling center around noon on January 5, 2014.

data.name: Enamul Haque
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In Chittagong, Shibir activist Enamul Haque, 26, from Adur Para in Lohagara, was killed when the police opened fire on Jamaat members after they attempted to snatch ballot boxes from the Bhabanipur polling center at approximately 3:30 pm on January 5, 2014.

data.name: Babul Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: BNP activist Babul Hossain died at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital after being struck by a bullet in Ramnagar, under Manda in Naogaon, around 11:00 am. Manda police officer-in-charge Abdullahel Baqui stated that the joint forces were compelled to open fire when the opposition members attacked them with bows and arrows.

data.name: Mamtazul Haque
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In Jaldhaka, Mamtajul Haque, 45, an activist of the local Jamaat, died on the spot as the police opened fire when over 200 Jamaat-Shibir men tried to prevent voters from casting their votes at the Kaimari Government Primary School polling center around 11:00 am.

data.name: Mohammad Rubel
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In Lakshmipur, Shibir activist Mohammad Rubel was killed when police opened fire on opposition activists at Machhimpur High School center in Ramganj upazila. Ramganj police officer-in-charge Rezaul Karim confirmed Rubel's death.

data.name: Motier Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A BNP activist was shot dead by law enforcement officers while looting a polling center and torching ballot papers in Monirampur upazila, as reported by our Jessore correspondent. The deceased has been identified as Motier Rahman, 28. The incident occurred at Bajitpur High School center around 3:00 pm, according to Syed Mostafa Kamal, assistant superintendent of Jessore police. Some opposition activists attacked the polling center and began hurling brick chips at law enforcement officers, stated the police official. In response, the officers opened fire, resulting in bullet injuries for both Motier and an Awami League activist named Abdul Azim, he added. Later, the BNP activist died while being transported to the local upazila health complex.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Alleged robber Anwar, along with another member of his gang, was killed in a "shootout" with police in the district's Ramu upazila on May 5, 2014. Saykul Ahmed Bhuiyan, OC of Ramu Police Station, said a team of patrol police took positions in the Toyangakata area around 2.30 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was planning to commit a robbery on Ramu-Marichya road. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire. The police also returned fire, triggering a "gunfight" between the law enforcers and the robbers, said the police official. During the gunfight, Anwar and Khalil were hit by bullets. The others managed to escape. Police took the duo to Ramu Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Ruhul Amin
data.description: The family of the deceased claimed that the police of Boalia Model Police Station tortured Ruhul Amin (22) to death in Rajshahi. Sirajul Islam, the elder brother of the deceased Ruhul Amin, alleged that on May 16, 2014, at night, some plainclothes policemen led by Sub Inspector Bajro Gopal of Boalia Police Station arrested Ruhul Amin with 250 grams of Ganja from the Namobhodra area of Rajshahi city. Later, the police tortured Ruhul Amin to death in connection with a top drug peddler of the Namobhodra area. The police claimed that Ruhul Amin committed suicide by hanging himself with a torn part of a blanket on a ventilator in the toilet.

data.name: Ripon Sikdar
data.description: The family alleged that on May 21, 2014, a police patrol team, led by Sub Inspector Anwar, beat up and killed a tea vendor at Nabinagar of Savar, on the outskirts of the capital Dhaka. Ripon's brother, Mohammad Jewel, told reporters at the Dhaka Medical College morgue on May 21, 2014, that Ripon was waiting for his wife, who was coming from Sayedabad in a bus, at the bus stand around 10:30 pm. After his wife arrived, they started heading home to the Niribili Residential area. The police stopped them at this point and frisked Ripon. The wife alleged that they also started beating him. After a few minutes, the policemen took him in their van and asked his wife to arrange money for his release. As his wife, Sathi, was trying to arrange money from her family, the victim called his friend Raja and sought his help. The mobile had been switched off since then. Ripon's friend, Kabir, later called the family around midnight and asked them to visit the hospital. Later, Jewel found his brother's body in the hospital.

data.name: Abdul Gaffar Tushar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of the outlawed outfit 'Purba Bangla Communist Party' has been killed in an 'encounter' with the police in Satkhira. The deceased, Abdul Gaffar aka Tushar, 45, was allegedly a military commander of the party's Khulna division. The police raided the area based on a tip-off that the extremists were holding a meeting there, according to Tala Police Station OC Sheikh Abu Bakar Siddique. As the police approached, the extremists fired and the police retaliated. Around 20 minutes later, they fled, leaving behind Tushar and Islam, who had sustained bullet wounds. They were rushed to the Upazila health complex where doctors declared Tushar dead.

data.name: Abdul Hamid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Ishwardi of Pabna, an individual named Abdul Hamid, also known as Hamez (32), was killed in a 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) on Thursday afternoon. According to RAB-12, Abdul Hamid was the second in command of a robbery group. He was the son of the late Dilbar Khan from Khudaipur Rakhalgachhi village in Dapunia union of Pabna. He was arrested earlier in the day. Later, based on information provided by him, RAB-12 members from the Pabna camp launched a campaign in Pakshi, Ishwardi, to recover arms and arrest terrorists. Around 5:00 pm in the area adjacent to the Guide Bank near the Hardinge Bridge over the Padma River in Pakshi, associates of Abdul Hamid who were lying in wait opened fire on the RAB members. After a gunfight lasting several moments, Abdul Hamid was killed. The officer-in-charge (OC) of Ishwardi Police Station, Biman Kumar Das, confirmed the incident, saying that the police had recovered the body and sent it to Pabna Medical College morgue for autopsy after receiving the news.

data.name: Abu Taher
data.description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and drug peddlers in Jessore Sadar upazila on May 30, 2014. The deceased, Abu Taher (40), was the son of the late Sona Ullah of Jhumjhumpur of the upazila, said Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-charge (investigation) of Kotwali Police Station. Taher was running a drug business in the Jhumjhumpur area, the police official said. The police said they conducted a raid at Moilakhana of Jhumjhumpur around 3:30 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of drug peddlers was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang started firing and throwing crude bombs at the police. The police returned fire, triggering a "gun battle," said Rafiqul. Taher received bullets during the "gunfight," and others managed to flee the scene. Taher was rushed to Jessore Medical College Hospital where he later died.

data.name: Ismail Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A suspected criminal has died from bullet injuries in Lakshmipur, and the police have been blamed for killing him in a fake encounter. Sub-inspector Md Zillur Rahman of Lakshmipur Sadar Police said that Khokan was found with bullet wounds in both legs around 11 pm on Monday at an orchard in Dighuliya Union. He died at Sadar Hospital where he was taken. However, locals said that Khokan, along with an accomplice, was detained by the police the previous night. Faruk Hossain told bdnews24.com that Khokan and Sabuj Hossain, 18, were nabbed by sub-inspectors Kamal and Sarowar of Daserhat Police. bdnews24.com's Jhenaidah correspondent spoke with him with the police's permission. "Police detained Khokan and me. They then whisked away Khokan in a microbus and brought me to Lakshmipur Police Station. I have no idea where they took him," said Hossain. But the police version is different. "A police patrol went to the area upon hearing gunfire and found Khokan with bullet wounds," said sub-inspector Zillur Rahman.

data.name: Mohammad Shahinur Alam
data.description: Family members of the victim alleged that Mohammad Shahinur Alam was tortured to death by Major Sakib Siddiqui, Head of Bhoirab RAB camp, under RAB 14 Unit. On May 20, 2014, the younger brother of the deceased, Maulana Mehedi Hassan, organized a press conference at the National Press Club and stated that on April 29, 2014, at noon, his brother was arrested by a member of RAB-14 from Boghdohor village under Nabinagar Upazila. On the night of that day, he was beaten on different parts of his body, particularly on his hip, feet, and elbow, for more than two hours. On April 30, 2014, RAB forced Abu Taher, a resident of Nabinagar Pashchimpara, to file a case against his brother Shahinur Alam. Later, his brother was sent to jail when he was produced before the court. His brother was first admitted to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital and later shifted to Comilla Medical College Hospital when he became ill. However, on May 6 in the evening, his brother died in the hospital while under treatment.

data.name: Shahin Molla
data.description: A young man named Shahin Molla (22) has allegedly died due to torture by the police at the Dasar police station in Kalkini, Madaripur. Shahin died while undergoing treatment at Madaripur Sadar Hospital around 10 pm last Saturday. On the night of June 8, around 8:30 pm, Shahin and his friends Mukit Akan and Shah Alam were arrested by SI Nazmul Hasan of Dasar police station while hanging out on the Naiyarbari Bridge in Gournadi, Medakul. Shahin's elder brother, Monir Molla, alleges that Shahin was shown arrested in a drug case on June 9 for not being able to pay the bribe and was sent to jail through court. On June 10, Monir visited Shahin in jail, where Shahin informed him that he had been subjected to inhuman torture at the police station for not paying the bribe. Monir said that when Shahin fell seriously ill inside the prison on Saturday, the jail authorities admitted him to Madaripur Sadar Hospital, where he died around 10 pm that night. SI Nazmul Hasan said, "False accusations are being made against me. There is no truth to the allegations of extortion or torture.

data.name: Islam Morol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. The deceased is Islam Morol (45). According to Inamul Haque, Officer-in-Charge of Satkhira Sadar Police Station, they received information that a gang of 16-17 robbers were preparing to rob a passenger bus in Chhoyghoria on the Satkhira-Jessore road. A police team went to the area around 3:45 a.m. on June 14, 2014. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers hurled bombs and opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate, Haque added. Morol sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight and fell to the ground while his cohorts managed to flee. The police took Morol to Satkhira Sadar Hospital where the duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abul Bashar
data.description: Abul Bashar, an alleged criminal and the chief of Bashar Bahini, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Jogikhal area of Begumgonj upazila in Noakhali on June 14, 2014. The police arrested Bashar on the morning of June 13, 2014, said S M Ashrafuzzaman, Acting Superintendent of Police in Noakhali. According to the police, based on his information, they went to Jogikhal with him to recover arms. When they reached the spot, associates of Bashar opened fire on the police in an attempt to snatch him away. Bashar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, he said.

data.name: Jahirul Islam
data.description: Family members have accused members of the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) of torturing Jahirul Islam, a man over fifty, leading to his death in Panchagarh. Jahirul was arrested by the BGB on Saturday morning. He was admitted to the hospital from the district jail on Saturday night, where he was declared dead 45 minutes later. According to the hospital records, Jahirul, who was known as a 'cattle trader,' was admitted from jail on Saturday night. At that time, he was experiencing abdominal pain, blood loss, bloody stool, and decreased blood pressure. Jahirul's family and locals allege that before the trial in a mobile court, members of the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) inflicted 'inhuman' torture upon him after his arrest. However, the BGB has denied these allegations. Relatives reported that in front of family members and villagers, Jahirul was tied up by his hands, feet, and waist, and was beaten on the ground. Nobody was allowed to intervene at that time. The deputy commander of the BGB's 18 Rifle Battalion, Major Shamim, stated that Jahirul was a noted drug trader and that no torture had been inflicted upon him. Therefore, the family's allegations are not true. He also mentioned that Jahirul was handed over to the mobile court by BGB members after being found with drugs.

data.name: Md Rokonuzzaman
data.description: Police arrested Rokonuzzaman (45), a real estate businessman, from his residence in the city's Bakalia around 1:20 am on June 19 in connection with a rape case filed with Panchlaish Police Station. While on the way to the police station, Rokon fell ill, and the police rushed him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, according to police sources. Rokon's family alleged that he was beaten to death in police custody.

data.name: Ferdous Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A man was killed in a said "gunfight" with the police in Dumuria upazila of Khulna at about 1:45 am on Friday. The deceased is Ferdous Islam, also known as Litu, son of Rejaul Karim, a resident of Thukra village of Raghunathpur union. Dumuria police sub-inspector Ajaharul Islam claimed that a team comprising Dumuria police and Khulna DB police arrested Ferdous from the house of Mokbul Goshai. Based on his information, the police started an arms rescue operation. When the police reached Alauddin Gazi's fish enclosure area at around 1:45 am, miscreants opened fire on the police. As the police retaliated, the attackers fled. Ferdous died as he was caught in the line of fire.

data.name: Ramzan Ali
data.description: Two alleged muggers were killed in a gunfight with DB police in Motijheel on June 29, 2014. According to the detectives, the criminals initiated the firing towards the police, and the law enforcers responded in kind. Ramzan and Aqmal were killed by the criminals' gunfire during the shootout. However, sources at Dhaka Medical College morgue stated that the two had been shot in the head and chest from the front at close range, not from behind. They mentioned that the duo had been shot 10 times, and five of the bullets fired from two guns were still lodged in their bodies. Ramzan's wife, Nusrat Jahan Jharna, expressed her suspicion to The Daily Star at their Rayerbagh home, claiming that her husband had been picked up the evening before and then murdered.

data.name: Rakib Hossain Aqmal
data.description: Two alleged muggers were killed in a gunfight with DB police in Motijheel on June 29, 2014. According to the detectives, the criminals initiated the firing towards the police, and the law enforcers responded in kind. Ramzan and Aqmal were killed by the criminals' gunfire during the shootout. However, sources at Dhaka Medical College morgue stated that the two had been shot in the head and chest from the front at close range, not from behind. They mentioned that the duo had been shot 10 times, and five of the bullets fired from two guns were still lodged in their bodies. Ramzan's wife, Nusrat Jahan Jharna, expressed her suspicion to The Daily Star at their Rayerbagh home, claiming that her husband had been picked up the evening before and then murdered.

data.name: Mowlana Ashraful Islam Morol
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Satkhira district Jamaat publicity secretary Maulana Azizur Rahman said police caught Ashraful from his residence on May 7, 2014 and fired at him, leaving him dead at Bhodrokhali High School premises. However, Kaliganj Thana Officer-in-Charge Golam Rahman said, "Jamaat leader Maulana Ashraful Islam had fled and was living in India for a long time. Returning from India on May 6, 2014, he took part in a secret meeting at Bhodrokhali High School premises. Being tipped off, police carried out a raid there. Some Jamaat activists exploded bombs targeting the police. In response, the police fired five rounds of bullets, leaving the Jamaat leader dead on the spot," said Rahman. "He had been accused in many cases at Kaliganj Thana, including an attack on the Thana," he added.

data.name: Moktarul Dhali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The leader of a robber gang, Moktarul Dhali, also known as Mokter, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Koyra upazila of the Sundarbans. Moktarul, who was 32 years old, was the chief of a gang that was named after him. He was the son of Moti Dhali from Bhutuswari Char in the upazila. Moktarul was accused in five cases, including four murder cases, in the Koyra and Dakop police stations, according to Subir Dutta, the officer-in-charge of Koyra Police Station.

data.name: Mahbubur Rahman Sujon
data.description: A youth died in police custody at the Mirpur police station on July 13, 2014, hours after he was detained by the police. Family members of the victim alleged that he was tortured to death. The deceased, Mahbubur Rahman Sujon (35), was accused in several cases, said Dhaka Metropolitan Police Deputy Commissioner (media and public relations) Masudur Rahman. Meanwhile, a sub-inspector of Mirpur police, Jahidur Rahman, was suspended in connection with this incident. Sujon was admitted to a local clinic and then transferred to the Suhrawardy Hospital at Sher-e-Bangla Nagar after he suffered respiratory problems around 4:00 am, where doctors declared him dead, said Mirpur division deputy commissioner Imtiaz Ahmed. The body was sent to the Dhaka Medical College and Hospital mortuary for postmortem. Mirpur police station officer-in-charge Salahuddin said Sujon was a listed criminal and a member of the criminal gang Shahadat Bahini. However, the deceased's brother Shameem said Sujon was an apparel products trader and was not involved in any criminal activities. He said that a sub-inspector, Jahid, was demanding extortion from Sujon and threatened to kill him unless he paid the money. 'Police stormed into Sujon's Sankar residence at night and took him. Moreover, he did not have any respiratory problems. Police tortured him to death,' said Shameem. DMHC morgue officials also said Sujon had several marks of injury on his body.

data.name: Siraj Akunji
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Local people alleged that Siraj Akunji, an activist of the Biplabi Communist Party, was killed in a gunfight on July 16, 2014. However, the police claimed that the victim was an activist of the underground Biplabi Communist Party and was killed in a factional clash within the party.

data.name: Giasuddin Apan
data.description: The prime suspect in the abduction and rape of a Cambrian College girl in Uttara, Dhaka, was killed by the Detective Branch of the police in a reported incident of "crossfire" at Hatirjheel on July 18, 2014. The police stated that the deceased, Giasuddin Apan (27), was a member of a mugging ring and the prime suspect in the abduction and rape of the college girl, as well as the killing of a security guard in Uttara on July 3, 2014. The DMP Deputy Commissioner (media and public relations), Masudur Rahman, stated that a gunfight occurred between the police and the miscreants at around 4:00 am in the Hatirjheel area, where Giasuddin was found injured. Badda police sub-inspector Jayantu Kumar Mandal mentioned that they recovered Giasuddin, who had been shot, and sent him to DMCH, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: SM Biplab Kabir
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A local leader of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party was killed by the police in a reported incident of a "shootout" at Tala upazila in Satkhira on July 18, 2014. The deceased, Tala upazila BNP joint secretary SM Biplab Kabir, was also a lecturer of mathematics at Shalika Degree College. The acting BNP secretary general, Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir, condemned the killing, stating that Biplab was killed in a police shooting and was also beaten up by local Awami League activists.

data.name: Anisur Rahman
data.description: Anisur Rahman was killed in a gunfight allegedly by the police in Bosotpur, Sarsha, Jessore on July 19, 2014.

data.name: Namir Talukdar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "shootout" with the police in the eastern Sundarbans under the Sharankhola range of Bagerhat early yesterday. The deceased, Namir Talukdar, 38, was a member of the robber gang known as Rezaul, also known as "Shirsha Bahini," according to the police. Kazi Abdus Salek, the officer-in-charge of Sharankhola Police Station, said the police arrested Namir from Arjunbahor Bazar on Saturday evening. During preliminary interrogation, Namir provided information to the police about a large cache of arms, and the police went to the eastern bank of the Bhola river to recover the firearms around 4:00 am yesterday, he said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Namir's accomplices opened fire. The police returned fire, resulting in a "gunfight" between the robbers and the law enforcers. Namir was hit by bullets during the "gunfight" and died on the spot, said Salek.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Jasim
data.description: In a legal complaint, the wife of Anwar Hossain, also known as Jashim, whose body was discovered with bullet wounds a few weeks earlier, accused several individuals of conspiring to kill her husband. These individuals include RAB's Deputy Assistant Director Rahmat Ullah, Rafiqul Islam, Sub-Inspector Nurul Alam, Assistant Sub-Inspector Mafizul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Hathazari Police Station Md Ismail, and others. She claimed that her husband was called by two individuals and subsequently killed by RAB. To avoid legal consequences, she alleged that RAB wrongfully implicated her husband in a case involving firearms. In a separate report, Samakal disclosed that while RAB did not confess to killing Anwar, they did admit to firing five bullets during an attempt to recover arms from Anwar's brother, who the lawsuit also alleged was framed by RAB.

data.name: Zohur Ahmed
data.description: Zohur Ahmed was allegedly killed by Ansar in Bholaganj, Companyganj Upazila, Sylhet while a group of stone lifters were attempting to steal stones from a restricted area of the Railway zone. Members of Ansar claimed that they opened fire in self-defense.

data.name: Nur Islam Ulka
data.description: Nur Islam, also known as Ulka, a murder suspect, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the village of Takia Kadma, Tarafpur union, Mirzapur upazila of Tangail at around 5:00 am on Monday. Two other men, Sagar and Shahed, were also injured in the "gunfight". The police claimed that Nur Islam is a suspect in the case of the shooting death of Tangail Sadar police assistant sub-inspector (ASI) Nurul Islam.
