Shahed and Sagar, who were injured, are said to be his associates, according to the police. Two pistols and 11 bullets were recovered from the scene by the police.

data.name: Shahed Miah
data.description: In Tangail, Nur Islam Ulka (26) and Shahed Miah (27) were allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police who were accused in the case filed for murdering Assistant Sub-Inspector Nurul Islam of Tangail Model Police Station. Mohammad Akhtaruzzaman, the officer-in-charge of the police station, said the police raided a house in Takia Kodma village of Mirzapur upazila at around 4:00 am on July 28, 2014, to arrest Ulka and his accomplices. Sensing their presence, Ulka and his accomplices opened fire, prompting the policemen to retaliate. Ulka was killed on the spot while his cohorts Sagar alias Dollar and Shahed sustained bullet wounds and were rushed to Mirzapur Kumudini Hospital. Later that day, they were shifted to Tangail General Hospital. The next day, they were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) as their conditions worsened. There, Shahed succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Manirul Islam,
data.description: Manirul Islam (35) was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Jhenidah's Shailkupa on July 28, 2014. Iqbal Bahar Chowdhury, OC of Shailkupa Police Station, said they received a tip-off that a gang of criminals had gathered at Kanapukurai village. When they raided the village around 3:00 am, the "criminals" started firing bullets at the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight. After the gunfight ended, the police recovered Manirul's body.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Rangpur, an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police on the Dhaka-Rangpur highway at Phulbari of Mithapukur upazila on July 30, 2014. Alamgir Hossain, 40, was the ringleader of Alamgir Bahini and the son of Javed Ali from Khamarpara Phulchouki village in the upazila. Acting on secret information that a gang of criminals was preparing to commit a robbery in the Bhelur Bridge area of the village, a team of police went to the spot around 11:00 pm, said Rabiul Alam, the officer-in-charge of Mithapukur Police Station. Upon seeing the law enforcers, the "robbers" opened fire, prompting the police to retaliate. Alamgir was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, according to the police.

data.name: Rajib Hossain
data.description: An alleged mugger was killed in an "encounter" with the Detective Branch of the police in the capital's Hatirjheel yesterday. The deceased was identified as Rajib Hossain, 27, of Rampura. However, Rajib's family claimed that the DB arrested him two days ago from Rampura and that the killing was pre-planned. Selim Miah, officer-in-charge (investigation) of Ramna Police Station, said a team of DB challenged a young man for his suspicious movement near the Bangladesh Red Crescent Society headquarters in Moghbazar around 3:45 am. Sensing danger, Rajib, who was on a motorcycle, fired gunshots targeting the DB personnel, prompting them to retaliate. Rajib received bullet wounds during the encounter. He was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital around 5:00 am, where he was pronounced dead, according to hospital sources.

data.name: Raju
data.description: Two people said to be members of Awal Bahini, prowling Sundarbans, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of Rapid Action Battalion-8 at Mrigamari area of Chandpai range, under Mongla upazila in Bagerhat.

data.name: Zakir
data.description: Two people said to be members of Awal Bahini, prowling Sundarbans, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of Rapid Action Battalion-8 at Mrigamari area of Chandpai range, under Mongla upazila in Bagerhat.

data.name: Aziz Ahmed Rony
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: An activist of Jubo Dal, the youth front of BNP, was killed in an alleged gunfight between his cohorts and the police at Chandraganj in Laxmipur Sadar upazila last night. Md Aziz Ahmed Rony, 30, son of Makbul Ahmed of Dewpara village, was allegedly a bodyguard of Jisan, the chief of the notorious Solayman Uddin Jisan gang, according to the police. Humayun Kabir, officer-in-charge (OC) of the Sadar Police Station, said a team of police conducted a raid in the Latifpur area to apprehend Jisan around 10:00 pm. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang members started firing at the policemen, forcing the lawmen to retaliate. At one stage, Rony was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet wounds. He was rushed to Laxmipur Sadar Hospital where he later succumbed to his injuries. Meanwhile, his father Makbul Ahmed alleged that Rony was an established businessman owning two shops in the local Chandraganj Bazar. He claimed that the Detective Branch of the police picked up his son in their patrol car from a shop at Palwan Bazar on Monday afternoon. Later, the law enforcers shot his son in the leg and killed him in a planned manner, Makbul said, demanding a fair investigation into the incident. Rezaul Karim Liton, President of the Laxmipur District Unit of Jubo Dal, said Rony was an activist of the BNP's youth front.

data.name: Nasir Russell
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) killed Nasir, also known as Russell (29), an alleged forest robber, in a 'crossfire' incident in Sunderban, Bagerhat.

data.name: Abdul Jalil alias
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of the outlawed Sarbahara party was killed on August 21, 2014, at Shilundia Bazaar of Babuganj upazila in Barisal in a 'shootout' with the Rapid Action Battalion. Captain Abul Bashar, Commander of company-1 at the Barisal headquarters of Rab-8, said a Rab team led by Deputy Assistant Director Abdur Rahman was patrolling Silundia area around 4:20 pm when they noticed a suspicious gathering. When challenged, the suspects opened fire on the Rab men, he said. The Rab team fired back.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Noakhali's Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP), MS Ashraf Uz Zaman, said that a gunfight between the police and the robbers started around 1 am at the Upazila's Abu Torab village, leaving four policemen injured. Police recovered three firearms and four machetes from the spot. The police officer said that Alam had been arrested from Dhaka on Tuesday. Based on the information gathered from him, the police took him to Noakhali and raided the area. "Khorshed's (Alam) accomplices fired at the police in a bid to snatch him. The police also opened fire. Khorshed died during the shootout," said ASP Zaman, adding that his accomplices managed to flee.

data.name: Jony
data.description: Police arrested Jony following a clash in the Bihari Camp area between two groups of Non-Bengali people on February 9, 2014. The victim's relatives alleged that the police had tortured him after his arrest. Jony, a driver, was among five individuals who were arrested by Pallabi police after a clash between two groups from Irani Camp and Rahmat Camp.

data.name: Yusuf Ali
data.description: On September 9, 2014, a youth named Yusuf Ali, son of Ibrahim and resident of Jhapaipara village under Chapainababganj Municipality area, died in the custody of Chapainababganj Police Station. The mother of the deceased, Amena Begum, informed that Yusuf died due to torture by the police after his arrest. Sub Inspector (SI) Monirul Islam of Chapainababganj Police Station led this operation. She was informed by local people in the area where Yusuf was arrested that the police beat him after his arrest. The police took him in a van at one point when Yusuf's mouth was bleeding. He was beaten again by the police even after being taken into the van. Due to the severe beating, Yusuf became seriously ill and died in Chapainababganj Sadar Hospital on September 9. She claimed that there were marks of injuries on Yusuf's body. The grandfather of Yusuf, Ahad Munshi, informed that the police beat Yusuf soon after his arrest. He was taken to the hospital by the police while bleeding. The police did not allow them to see Yusuf's body before it was officially handed over to the family. An eye-witness of the incident, Mirza Ronju, said that on September 12, at midnight, he was picked up by SI Monirul Islam at the police station for disclosing the matter to the media. But he was released the next morning as the incident of his arrest was exposed. He also said that SI Monirul Islam is threatening him and his family, trying to put them in jail by implicating them in a case for telling the truth. They cannot live at home due to fear.

data.name: Mejbah Uddin Tarek
data.description: The Dhaka Metropolitan Police arrested Mejbah on September 13, 2014, at around 3:00 am. Later, the police took him to the Mugda area to recover arms, where a gunfight broke out with Mejbah's associates. During the gunfight, Mejbah was wounded by a bullet. He was then transported to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Osman Dafader
data.description: Osman was killed in a gunfight between alleged criminals and police personnel. On September 13, 2014, the police arrested him. Following his statement, the police conducted a drive to recover illegal arms. During this time, the alleged criminals opened fire on the police. The police retaliated, leaving Osman dead on the spot.

data.name: Shah Alam Khondorar
data.description: The deceased's wife, Mariyum Begum, alleged that 15 to 20 people stormed their house in Bijaynagar of Barudi under Sonargaon upazila in Narayanganj around 10:00 am on September 15, 2014 and dragged Shah Alam into their boat, introducing themselves as the Detective Branch of Police. The police said that Shah Alam was killed during a gunfight with the DB police at the Wireless Gate of Mogbazar when he, along with his cohorts, attacked the police.

data.name: Motiar Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A police patrol team, acting on a tip-off, went to the Patbila area where a gang of robbers was preparing to loot night coaches by cutting down roadside trees. Sensing the presence of policemen, the gang opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. During the gunfight, Motiar received bullet injuries while the remaining gang members managed to flee. Motiar was taken to Jhenidah Sadar Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sekendar Ali Sarder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Sekendar Ali Sarder, an alleged leader of a robber gang, was killed in a gunfight with the police in Kalia upazila's Bijoynagar village early yesterday. Officer-in-charge Matiur Rahman of Kalia Police Station detained him on Wednesday evening and recovered a pipe gun, a shutter gun, and seven bullets with his assistance on Thursday. During the return to the police station around 3:00 am, Sekendar's aides opened fire, initiating a gunfight. Sekendar was hit and later declared dead at Kalia Upazila Health Complex, while his accomplices escaped.

data.name: Babul Miya
data.description: Violence during the by-election for chairman posts in the Champaknagar Union Parishad under Bijoynagar Upazila of Brahmanbaria resulted in one death. In Champaknagar Union Parishad, supporters of candidates Hamidul Haque and Zakir Hossain engaged in a gunfight around 2 pm. Police intervened, firing rubber bullets to control the situation. Babul Miya, 25, died, with conflicting reports on whether he was hit by a rubber bullet or died in the gunfight. Bijoynagar OC Md Abdur Rob attributed the death to the gunfight with the opposition.

data.name: Faruk Ahmed
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: He was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Chawak Bazar in Barisal city on February 10, 2014. The Battalion claimed that they found the dead ruling party leader, Faruk Ahmed alias Panama Faruk, after the gunfight. However, human rights defender Shaheen Aziz stated, according to the allegations of the victim's family, that Faruk was returning from Dhaka and was shot dead by the police at Barisal Lonch terminal in front of Ebadullah mosque.

data.name: Monir Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Monir Mia (35), an alleged leader of a robbery gang, was killed in a gunfight with the police at South Rumaliachhora in Cox's Bazar.

data.name: Timir Baran Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly tied with the Manabendra Narayan Larma (MN Larma) or the ‘Reform’ faction of the Parbatya Chattagram Jana Samhati Samiti (JSS)
data.description: Timir Baran Chakma, also known as Duranto Chakma Babu (52), died during medical treatment while in the custody of the Army at Matiranga Hospital. On the evening of August 9, Army members conducted an operation in the Indumoni area under Guiyamara Upazila in Khagrachhari Hill District and arrested Duranto Chakma Babu (52), Nishimoni Chakma (40), Amarkanti Chakma (18), and Romel Tripura (38) on the morning of August 10. Sudhakar Tripura, the Student & Youth Affairs Secretary of the Central Committee of Parbatta Gonoshonghoti Samity (MN Larma), alleged that Duranta Chakma died due to torture. Meanwhile, the Army stated that Duranta Chakma suddenly fell sick due to asthma and was admitted to Matiranga Hospital, where he died. Elena Chakma, the wife of Nishumoni Chakma, said that the Army surrounded their house at night and arrested them at around 5:30 am. After the arrest, all of them were severely beaten and kicked by the Army with their boots. Duranta Chakma's wife, Alotara Chakma, said that her husband had no disease related to asthma.

data.name: Abdul Hadi
data.description: Abdul Hadi, along with Shohag Hossain, was picked up by Jessore police on the night of October 13, 2014 and were later found dead, according to the father of the latter victim. However, the police refuted the claim and said the two might have been killed by rival groups due to an internal feud. Shohag's father, Rakibul Islam, a commander of Bangladesh Ansar, said that his son, along with Hadi and a few others, were sitting at a tea stall near their house. A team of DB police, accompanied by SI Masud Hossain of Khajura Police Outpost of Jessore Sadar Police Station, reached the spot around 11.30 pm and detained them along with two others - Mohsin Ali (17) and Opu Hossain (16), said Rakibul. DB stopped at Panchbera Bahadur bus stand and freed Mohsin and Opu, he said, adding that he heard the news of his son's detention on that night from other people sitting at the tea stall. "Police gave Mohsin and Opu Tk 200 each as bus fare before freeing them and told them that they were taking Hadi and Shohag to the police station," Rakibul claimed. The next morning, Rakibul came to know that the dead bodies of his son and Hadi were found in Jhenaidah. He demanded a proper investigation into the incident to unmask the real culprits.

data.name: Shohag Hossain
data.description: Sohag, along with Abdul Hadi, was picked up by Jessore police on the night of October 13, 2014 and were later found dead, according to the father of the latter victim. However, the police refuted the claim and said that the two might have been killed by rival groups due to an internal feud. Shohag's father, Rakibul Islam, a commander of Bangladesh Ansar, said that his son, along with Hadi and a few others, were sitting at a tea stall near their house. A team of DB police, accompanied by SI Masud Hossain of Khajura Police Outpost of Jessore Sadar Police Station, reached the spot around 11.30 pm and detained them along with two others - Mohsin Ali (17) and Opu Hossain (16), said Rakibul. The DB stopped at Panchbera Bahadur bus stand and freed Mohsin and Opu, he said, adding that he heard the news of his son's detention on that night from other people sitting at the tea stall. "Police gave Mohsin and Opu Tk 200 each as bus fare before freeing them and told them that they were taking Hadi and Shohag to the police station," Rakibul claimed. The next morning, Rakibul came to know that the dead bodies of his son and Hadi were found in Jhenaidah. He demanded a proper investigation into the incident to unmask the real culprits.

data.name: Abul Hashem
data.description: Abul Hashem, a 40-year-old fisherman, was fatally shot on Monday for allegedly breaching government restrictions by fishing in the Meghna River. Local police, river police, and coast guard all refuted claims that they had fired the bullets that led to his death. A family member of Hashem accused the police of the killing, as reported by Manab Zamin.

data.name: Babul Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged mugger was killed in a so-called gunfight with the police in Terokhada upazila on October 15, 2014. The deceased was identified as Babul Mollah. Sensing the presence of the criminals, they opened fire on the law enforcers. In retaliation, the police fired back, and Babul Mollah, while attempting to flee the scene, was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. The deceased was a regional leader of the Purbo Banglar Communist Party.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.description: Zakir Hossain, also known as Kangali Zakir, an accused in the killing of traffic sergeant Ahad, was killed in a gunfight with the police in the capital's Khilgaon early yesterday, according to Dhaka Metropolitan Police officials. Inspector Sirajul Islam, officer-in-charge of Khilgaon police station, said they found Zakir, 40, with bullet wounds near Khidmah Hospital around 3 am and took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. They also recovered a gun with three rounds of bullets from him. Masudur Rahman, deputy commissioner of police at DMP Media Centre, said a team from the detective branch of police was on duty near Bishwa Road due to complaints of frequent muggings of passengers of Sohag Paribahan in the area. "Police engaged in a gunfight with some armed men around 3 am when the latter fired at law enforcers," he said.

data.name: Rabbi
data.description: The alleged snatcher, Rabbi, and his accomplice, Jonny, were accused of snatching a pistol from a policeman after shooting him. They were killed in a police shootout at Alekharchar in Comilla.

data.name: Johnny
data.description: The alleged snatcher, Jinny, and his accomplice, Rabbi, were accused of snatching a pistol from a policeman after shooting him. They were killed in a police shootout at Alekharchar in Comilla.

data.name: Emdadul Hawlader
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Emdadul Hawlader and Saiful, both alleged robbers, were killed in a "shootout" with RAB in the Chandpai range of the Sundarbans in Bagerhat on November 11, 2014. The deceased individuals are Emdadul Hawlader, aged 34, and Saiful, aged 24.

data.name: Saiful
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Emdadul Hawlader and Saiful, both alleged robbers, were killed in a "shootout" with RAB in the Chandpai range of the Sundarbans in Bagerhat on November 11, 2014. The deceased individuals are Emdadul Hawlader, aged 34, and Saiful, aged 24.

data.name: Musharraf Hossain
data.description: A man was killed in a "gunfight" while in the custody of RAB a few hours after his arrest in Sandwip Upazila, Chittagong.

data.name: Hafizur Rahman
data.description: One of the young men, who was picked up and shot by the police in Jessore town, has died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital around 3:00 pm on Saturday. The deceased, Hafizur Rahman Sohel, 23, was the son of Harunur Rashid, a resident of Barandi Mollapara in Jessore town. The family of Hafizur said they would lodge a murder case against the police in this connection. The police shot both young men in their legs at dawn on November 13 in the Nursery Patti area near Jessore DC office. The police said both men were muggers and they hurled crude bombs targeting the police. The police also fired gunshots in retaliation, injuring both Hafizur and Mizanur. Family members of both victims rejected the police claim and accused the police of implicating the young men in a false case.

data.name: Mohammad Jasim Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: When the policemen reached No. 2 bridge on the Keranihat-Bandarbab road around 11:00 am, 15 to 20 Jamaat-Shibir activists opened fire on them, said Sub Inspector Najmul Haque of Satkania Police Station, who led the operation. The police fired back, he said. After 15 to 20 minutes of gunfire, all but two managed to escape. Jasim and Rafique were apprehended with bullet injuries and were taken to Satkania Upazila Health Complex. Meanwhile, the Shibir activists were taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital (CMCH) at around 3:30 pm. The hospital staff declared Jasim "brought dead". Challenging the police's statement, Karim Uddin, Rafique's younger brother, told The Daily Star that some plainclothes policemen had picked up the two friends.

data.name: Nazir Ahmed Sabuj
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A leader of a robber gang has been killed in a gunfight with law enforcers in Kaukhali upazila, under Pirojpur Town. The deceased is Sabuj (identified as Nazir Ahmed Sabuj by The Daily Star), 40, son of Abdul Awal from Jogairhat village of Suptagarh union, under Rajapur upazila in Jhalakathi. Captain Abul Bashar, of Barisal Rab 8, said, "A Rab team was on regular patrol in Kaukhali upazila of the district around 7pm. As soon as the Rab members reached the College area of the sadar, the alleged robber leader Sabuj and his associates, who were preparing to rob the area, started firing on the team," he added. In response, the team also returned fire, resulting in Sabuj's death at the scene, the official said. Rab recovered a foreign revolver with a magazine, a loaded gun, two one-shot guns, four cocktails, and other lethal weapons. Bashir added that a total of 18 cases had been filed against Sabuj, including robbery and murder.

data.name: Enamul Haque
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Deceased Enamul Haq, 35, was a regional commander of the PBCP. He was accused in 26 cases, including seven for murder, filed with different police stations in Kushtia, Meherpur, and Chuadanga, police said. Kazi Jalal Uddin, officer-in-charge of Mirpur Police Station, said Enamul demanded Tk 2 lakh as extortion from Sahidul Islam, a brick kiln owner of Bhanga Bot Tola, several days ago. He finally threatened to kill Shahidul and destroy his brick kiln as he refused to pay the money. "Separate teams of Kushtia Detective Branch (DB) and Mirpur police took positions near the brick kiln after receiving information that Enamul and his cohorts were going to the brick kiln at about 3:30 am," the OC said. At one stage, police cordoned off the outlaws and asked them to surrender. But defying the police call, the outlaws opened fire, forcing them to retaliate with bullets, the OC said. Enamul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot during the gunfight, he said, adding that the other outlaws managed to flee the scene. Police recovered a shotgun, several bullets, and a sharp weapon from the spot.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Abdur Rashid and Hazrat Ali, two members of the Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML), were killed by the police in two alleged incidents of gunfight in Jhenaidah. The officer-in-charge of Kotchandpur police station, Fazlur Rahman, said that Abdur Rashid was found dead following a 'gunfight' with the police on the night of July 12, 2014, at Dora as the police conducted an operation to arrest crime suspects. On the other hand, the officer-in-charge of Harinakunda police station, Ershadul Kabir, said that Hazrat Ali was found dead in another 'gunfight' with the police on July 12, 2014, as the police conducted another operation in Rishkhali Amtala to arrest robbers. "As the police reached the spot, the robbers fired at the police, who retaliated," he said.

data.name: Hazrat Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Abdur Rashid and Hazrat Ali, two members of the Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML), were killed by the police in two alleged incidents of gunfight in Jhenaidah. The officer-in-charge of Kotchandpur police station, Fazlur Rahman, said that Abdur Rashid was found dead following a 'gunfight' with the police on the night of July 12, 2014, at Dora as the police conducted an operation to arrest crime suspects. On the other hand, the officer-in-charge of Harinakunda police station, Ershadul Kabir, said that Hazrat Ali was found dead in another 'gunfight' with the police on July 12, 2014, as the police conducted another operation in Rishkhali Amtala to arrest robbers. "As the police reached the spot, the robbers fired at the police, who retaliated," he said.

data.name: Mohammad Roni
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An activist of the 'Jisan Group' was killed in a gunfight with the police at Lakshmipur Sadar on the night of December 5, 2014. He was identified as Md. Roni (30), the son of Mokbul Ahmed, from the village of Latifpur in Sadar upazila. Police and locals reported that three policemen were injured during the hour-long gunfight that occurred on the night of December 5, 2014, in the village of Latifpur.

data.name: Akram Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: The bullet-ridden body of a regional leader of the outlawed New Biplobi Communist Party (NBCP) was discovered in Khoksa upazila of Kushtia early today. The deceased has been identified as Akram Ali, also known as Bhadu dakat, a 40-year-old resident of Khoksa upazila in the district, according to our Kushtia correspondent. He was a close associate of one of the founders of NBCP, Akdil Hossain, also known as Buro, who was killed in a "shootout" with the police on February 1, 2008. A patrolling police team found a body lying on a road in Bashoa village around 4:30 am, said Motiar Rahman, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Khoksa Police Station. Later, the police recovered the body of Akram Ali with three bullet wounds on his chest, he added. "Akram had been involved in criminal activities, including robbery, in the area for the past 10 years." "He was accused in at least 10 cases, including four murder cases in Kushtia, Rajbari, and Jhenaidah." Bhadu was the main suspect in the murder case of police Sub-inspector Bashar in January 2010 in Jhenidah. However, the motive for the murder has not been determined. Bhadu's wife, Eti Khatun, alleged that Pangsha police in Rajbari arrested her husband from Pangsha bus stand at night on December 20, 2014. However, Abul Bashar, the OC of Pangsha Police Station, denied the allegation.

data.name: Ujjal Sheikh
data.description: Ujjal Sheikh was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police in Magura Sadar upazila. The deceased, Uzzal Hossain, 33, was the son of Awal Biswas from Chandpur village in the upazila.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain
data.description: A suspected snatcher was killed in a shootout with police at Gokulnagar in Iswardi upazila early Thursday. The deceased was identified as Jahangir Hossain, 27, son of Montaj Malitha of the upazila. Jahangir was a listed mugger and accused of a number of mugging cases, police said. Upon receiving information that a gang of snatchers had been engaging in mugging from passengers of different vehicles at Raju Cinema Hall area, a police team from Ishwardi thana went to the scene at about 2 am. The snatchers, sensing the presence of law enforcers, opened fire on them. Police also fired back in self-defense, resulting in his death.

data.name: Azad Khan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A suspected terrorist was killed in a "crossfire" with the Detective Branch (DB) of the police at Palpara Bridge area in Sadar upazila early Thursday. The deceased was identified as Azad Khan, 23, an associate of the listed terrorist Jira Sumon. He was the son of Shamsher Khan in the district town. Acting on secret information that a gang of terrorists was preparing to conduct a subversive act, a DB police team raided the Palpara Bridge area at about 2:30 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the terrorists opened fire on them. In retaliation, the police also fired back, triggering a gun battle that left Azad injured. Azad died on the way to Comilla Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Iqbal Hossain Bhuiyan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Iqbal Hossain Bhuiyan was tortured to death. The police arrested him from Protapganj bazaar at around 5:30 pm on December 25, 2014. On that day, at around 8:00 pm, he died at Bancharampur Health Complex. The family alleged that he died due to torture.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: Abul Kashem was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB members at Suterkhali in the district's Dakop upazila on December 26, 2014. Acting on a tip-off, a special team of RAB-6, led by Commanding Officer Lt Col Enamul Arif Sumon, raided an area near Suterkhali Forest Station around 9:45 p.m., said Harunur Rashid, the media officer of the battalion who is a Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police. Kashem, along with his aides, was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the presence of RAB personnel, the alleged criminals opened fire, triggering a "gun battle" between the gang members and the elite force, according to the Rab official. After half an hour of the "gunfight", Kashem was found dead. However, his cohorts managed to escape, he added.

data.name: Mojiruddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A BNP leader was shot dead when BNP members clashed with the police. Mojiruddin was the BNP ward unit vice-president of Maria Union in Charghat Upazila. He died on the spot after being shot in the head by the police.

data.name: Jamshed
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A BNP leader was killed when BNP members clashed with the police. The deceased, Jamshed Ali, was the president of the district unit of BNP.

data.name: Md. Rubel
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Supporters of the blockade were allegedly rampaging through the Chaumuhuni Rail Gate area in Begumganj upazila. When the police arrived at the scene, the blockaders began pelting the officers with bricks and stones, which forced the law enforcers to open fire. The injured individuals were transported to Abdul Malek Ukil Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced Rubel and Mohsin dead.

data.name: Md. Mohsin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Opposition protesters were allegedly rampaging through the Chaumuhuni Rail Gate area in Begumganj upazila. When the police reached the spot, the blockaders started pelting the policemen with brick chunks and stones, forcing the law enforcers to open fire. The injured were taken to Abdul Malek Ukil Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared Rubel, along with Mohsin, dead.

data.name: Sagir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A gunfight ensued on January 9, 2015, between RAB and forest robbers at Shimanarkhal, in the East range of Sundarban, Mongla, Bagerhat. Later, two dead bodies, identified as Sagir and another individual, were rescued from the incident place. However, the identity of the other person could not be determined.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A gunfight ensued on January 9, 2015, between RAB and forest robbers at Shimanarkhal, in the East range of Sundarban, Mongla, Bagerhat. Later, two dead bodies, identified as Sagir and another individual, were rescued from the incident site. However, the identity of the other person could not be determined.

data.name: Amir Hossain Ranga
data.description: A joint force arrested Ranga from the Haridhali area under Paikgacha. According to his confession, the team took him to the Kumkhali area to recover illegal arms and ammunition and to arrest his cohorts. As they reached the area at around 2:30 am, Ranga's cohorts, sensing the presence of law enforcers, opened fire at them. The police also retaliated by firing. Ranga was seriously injured and taken to the Paikgacha Upazila Health Complex, where the on-duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between the police and his accomplices in Howanok Bazaar, Moheshkhali, Cox Bazar on January 13, 2015, at around 7:30 pm. When the law enforcers arrived, the gang members opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate. The police recovered the bullet-ridden body of Abdur Rashid.

data.name: Motiur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A RAB team took Motiur to a mango orchard in Kansat to arrest his accomplices and recover arms and explosives around 3:00 am on January 16, 2015. Then, Motiur's accomplices started firing indiscriminately and throwing homemade bombs at the RAB team, forcing the RAB men to retaliate and sparking a 20-minute gunfight. Motiur sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and died on the spot. He had been arrested on January 15, 2015.

data.name: Mohan Bepari Molla
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On January 16, 2015, Sechchasebak Dal leader Mohan Bepari Molla died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital during treatment, under the supervision of the jail authority. The brother-in-law of the deceased, Mohammad Alamin, claimed that on January 12, 2015, police from Shah Ali Police Station arrested Mohan under a criminal case and beat him in the police van. Mohan was tortured throughout the night at the police station. After being presented before the court, he was sent to jail. However, his physical condition did not improve, and he was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital by the jail authorities on January 16, where he died.

data.name: Nuruzzaman Jony
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Yakub Ali, the father of Nuruzzaman, said that on January 19, 2015, at around 1:00 pm, Nuruzzaman, along with his friend Moin and 3 or 4 others, went to Dhaka Central Jail to meet his younger brother Hira. On the way back, a white private car stopped in front of them. 2 or 3 men came out of the car and identified themselves as DB police. Then they arrested Nuruzzaman and Moin. Since then, he has been missing. Later on, the family found his body at Dhaka Medical College Morgue. DB deputy commissioner Krishnapada Roy said that the police detained him from Nazimuddin Road on January 19, 2015, in the afternoon and took him to Jorapukur field of Tilpapara to arrest the other gangsters on January 20, 2015. After that, he admitted his involvement in the attack on the police van. A shootout took place in the area, and Nuruzzaman was caught in the line of fire. Later, the police recovered the bullet-riddled body of Nuruzzaman.

data.name: Solaiman Uddin Jisan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Anamul Haque, Sub-Inspector of Daudkandi police station, said that on January 23, 2015, at around 1:45 am, a patrol team of RAB-11 signaled Jisan to stop at Jigatola on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway when he was returning to Laxmipur from Dhaka by motorcycle. As he did not stop, another team of the RAB tried to intercept Jisan. He then fired two shots at the RAB. The RAB men were compelled to fire back. Jisan was hit by bullets and died on the spot around 4:00 am.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.description: Lt. Colonel Khandakar Golam Sarowar, Director of RAB-3, stated that on January 25, 2015, at around 2:30 am, a team from RAB-3 was patrolling in the Banashri area. RAB signaled a car to stop, and the car complied. Suddenly, a man from the car fired at the RAB officers and fled. Another man from the car followed suit. RAB pursued them and returned fire. The men, later identified as Solaiman Uddin Jisan and Abul Kalam Azad, were found with bullet injuries, and RAB transported them to DMCH. The attending doctor pronounced them dead.

data.name: Md. Sultan
data.description: Lt. Colonel Khandakar Golam Sarowar, Director of RAB-3, stated that on January 25, 2015, at around 2:30 am, a team from RAB-3 was patrolling in the Banashri area. RAB signaled a car to stop, and the car complied. Suddenly, a man from the car fired at the RAB officers and fled. Another man from the car followed suit. RAB pursued them and returned fire. The men, later identified as Solaiman Uddin Jisan and Abul Kalam Azad, were found with bullet injuries, and RAB transported them to DMCH. The attending doctor pronounced them dead.

data.name: Mahbubur Rahman Mahbub
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Police said that acting on a tip-off, a police team raided Bagaritala around 3:00 am after Mahbub, along with his aides, had blocked the Jessore-Monirampur road with logs to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire. The police also fired back, triggering a gunfight. Mahbub was hit by bullets and died on the spot.

data.name: Rafikul Islam
data.description: A police team arrested Rafikul Islam on January 27, 2015 in the afternoon, and the police took Rafikul to arrest his accomplices and recover arms and explosives around 3:00 am on January 28, 2015. Then, Rafikul's accomplices started firing indiscriminately at the police team, forcing the policemen to retaliate and sparking a 20-minute gunfight. Rafikul sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and died at Satkhira Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Nurul Islam Shahin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A police team arrested Nurul Islam on January 27, 2015, at around 9:00 pm. The police took Nurul in order to arrest his accomplices and recover arms and explosives, which occurred around 2:00 am on January 28, 2015. Then, Nurul's accomplices started firing indiscriminately at the police team, forcing the policemen to retaliate. Nurul Islam sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and died.

data.name: Mainuddun Bhuiyan
data.description: The family of Mainuddin alleges that he was beaten to death by RAB. He was reportedly beaten during his arrest by RAB. There was a visible injury on the left side of Mainuddin's head. However, RAB claims that on January 29, 2015, around 10:00 pm, they arrested Mainuddin and Jakir from a tin shed house in Mogbazar while they were in possession of yaba. RAB further states that after the arrest, Mainuddin suffered a heart attack and lost consciousness. Subsequently, RAB took him to a private clinic where the attending doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Ariful Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On January 29, 2015, in the evening, Ariful Islam was detained by a group of people who identified themselves as members of the DB from Kornofuli-4 steamer headed to 'Chorfashion'. Later, the police claimed that they found a dead body on that day at around 11:15 pm. [Rupnagar police recovered the body from Berybadh area around 9:00 am on Friday.]

data.name: Emdad Ullah
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An opposition activist was allegedly killed in an 'encounter' with a team from the Mirpur police station in the capital's Rupnagor area on February 2, 2015. The victim, Emdad Ullah, 18, from Jamalpur, was a first-year honors student at Dhaka College and a ward unit president of Islami Chattra Shibir. The officer-in-charge of the Mirpur police station, Salauddin Khan, said that miscreants hurled petrol bombs and used firearms when a police team, accompanied by the arrested man, went to Ena Properties to apprehend more miscreants. The youth was shot dead by the miscreants, according to the police. However, the student political organization alleged that policemen picked up the victim in front of his house in Section-6 of Mirpur at around 7:00 pm on January 31, 2015.

data.name: Saidur Rahman [Daily Star and Daily Sun calling him Saidul Islam]
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police alleged that on February 1, 2015, at noon, miscreants attacked a CNG-run three-wheeler with a bomb. In this incident, they arrested Mohammad Ali. According to Mohammad Ali's statement, the police went to Bakua village for an operation to arrest other miscreants. After reaching the place, miscreants threw a petrol bomb targeting the police. The police fired back, and Saidur got injured. On the other hand, Moulana Shahinur Alam, the Amir of Sirajganj District Jamaat-e-Islami, denied the police's statement. He claimed that Saidur was picked up by the police from a ceremony of death ritual (Kulkhani) and shot in his leg on the road. He was injured and later, on February 2, 2015, at midnight, he died at the Trauma Center of Sadar Hospital.

data.name: M Yusuf
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Two activists of the youth wing of BNP were knocked down and killed by a truck as they were trying to throw petrol bombs at the vehicle in Jessore on February 3, 2015, the police said. The victims were identified as M Yusuf of Taherpur and Mohammad Liton of Durgapur under Monirampur upazila. However, their families and associates claimed that the two were found dead on February 3, 2015, in the morning after being picked up by the police on February 2, 2015, at night. Monirampur upazila unit BNP president Shahid Iqbal alleged that the police had killed them and staged the drama of a road accident.

data.name: Mohammad Liton
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Two activists of the youth wing of BNP were knocked down and killed by a truck as they were allegedly attempting to throw petrol bombs at the vehicle in Jessore on February 3, 2015, the police said. The victims were identified as M Yusuf of Taherpur and Mohammad Liton of Durgapur under Monirampur upazila. However, their families and associates claimed that the two were found dead on the morning of February 3, 2015, after being picked up by the police on the night of February 2, 2015. Monirampur upazila unit BNP president Shahid Iqbal alleged that the police had killed them and staged the drama of a road accident.

data.name: Shakhawat Hossain
data.description: Shakhawat Hossain, along with Mujahidul Islam, were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in the capital's Jatrabari early on February 4, 2015. Commanding Officer Zamil Ahmad of Rapid Action Battalion-10 said a team of RAB-10 was patrolling in the Matuail area of Jatrabari around 2:15 am. Suddenly, bricks were hurled at the RAB vehicle. Several crude bombs went off on the road and gunshots were fired at the team, forcing the law enforcers to open fire on the thugs. Unable to withstand the RAB members, the criminals left the scene shortly after. An additional force then joined the RAB team and conducted a search in the area. They found the bodies of two people who had been shot, lying in a pool of blood there, as mentioned by Zamil Ahmad. He added that the law enforcers later sent the two injured individuals to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mujahidul Islam
data.description: Mujahidul Islam was killed, along with Shakhawat Hossain, in a "gunfight" with RAB in the capital's Jatrabari early on February 4, 2015. Commanding Officer Zamil Ahmad of Rapid Action Battalion-10 said a team of RAB-10 was patrolling in the Matuail area of Jatrabari around 2:15 am. Suddenly, bricks were hurled at the RAB vehicle. Several crude bombs went off on the road and gunshots were fired at the team, forcing the law enforcers to open fire on the thugs. Failing to hold out against the RAB members, the criminals left the scene a little later. An additional force then joined the RAB team and launched a search in the area. They found the bodies of two bullet-hit people lying in a pool of blood there, as mentioned by Zamil Ahmad. He added: Law enforcers later sent the two injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Nahid
data.description: On February 2, 2015, a civil team from the Pallabi police station, led by SI Touhidul Islam, picked up Nahid in front of Proshika Bhaban, Mirpur, Dhaka. Family members received information about Nahid from a source at the Pallabi police station. Meanwhile, family members also spoke with Nahid over the phone. During this time, they also spoke with SI Touhidul Islam Arefin and SI Subroto, while the police officers asked for money (5 lakh tk) from them. As they did not provide the requested money, on February 4, 2015, they discovered the bullet wounds on Nahid's deceased body at the Dhaka Medical College Morgue.

data.name: Monir Hossain
data.description: Police alleged that a youth on February 5, 2015, at around 3:15 am, threw two petrol bombs targeting the police in front of LDCL at Senpara Porbota, Rokeya Soroni. Then, the police fired back and found a bullet-hit dead body.

data.name: Shahbuddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police went to conduct an operation in the Shomsadipur area. At that time, activists of the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami hurled handmade bombs at the police vehicle. The police fired back and Shahbuddin suffered bullet wounds. Later, he was taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where he died.

data.name: Shahab Uddin Patwary
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: On February 6, 2015, police were patrolling the Dhaka-Chittagong highway when a group of miscreants hurled petrol bombs to create disruption. Police fired back, and Shahab sustained bullet wounds. He was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. However, the victim's brother alleged that his brother was picked up by plainclothes police from his house in Chandishkora, Chouddogram, Comilla on February 5, 2015.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Shahidul was killed in a gunfight, and Abdul Majid, another person, was left injured allegedly by the police on February 6, 2015. Jessore Additional Superintendent of Police, KM Ariful Haque, said a "gunfight" took place in front of Khanika Picnic Spot in the sadar upazila around 1:45 am. The police challenged a gang of miscreants who were heading towards Jessore in a microbus. They started firing, and the police also retaliated. The gunfight left one person injured by a bullet, as claimed by Ariful. The injured person was declared dead at Jessore Medical College and Hospital.

data.name: Bachchu
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Bachchu was attempting to create anarchy in the upazila by throwing petrol bombs at various locations. Police arrested him with two petrol bombs around 11:00 pm on February 6, 2015, in the upazila town. According to his statement during preliminary interrogation, a police team accompanied Bachchu to recover more petrol bombs. When the team arrived at the Nesarabad bus terminal area around 2:30 am on February 7, 2015, Bachchu's accomplices opened fire on the police. The law enforcers retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight" with Bachchu's associates. Bachchu was struck by bullets and died on the spot, as confirmed by the police official.

data.name: Swapan
data.description: Swapan was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight at around 1:30 am on February 8, 2015. He was arrested by Kotwali Model Police Station and handed over to Sadar South Model Police Station at around 1:00 am. Then, a police team from Sadar South Model Police Station conducted a drive to recover arms with him in his village, Rampur. However, on the way to Vatpara, Swapan's accomplice attacked the police. The police also fired back, and Swapan was hit by a bullet. Later, he was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where the doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mehedi Hasan
data.description: On February 7, 2015, RAB arrested Mehedi from his house at around 9 pm. Then RAB took him to a brickfield to recover arms at Kazipur late at night on February 8, 2015. A group of miscreants then fired at RAB, and RAB also fired back. However, Mehedi sustained bullet wounds. He was taken to Jessore General Hospital where the doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Jasim Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Madrasa student Jasim Uddin, 26, was killed in a "shootout" with the police in the capital's Taltola around 4:00 am. A statement, signed by Officer-in-Charge Ganesh Gopal Biswas of Sher-e-Bangla Nagar Police Station, said the police picked up six alleged Shibir men, including Jasim, on February 8, 2015, following an attack on traffic sergeant Golam Mawla at Shishu Mela crossing near Shyamoli. After obtaining information from Jasim, a police team took him to Taltola to arrest Shibir leader Delwar and his accomplices. As the team reached the area around 3:45 am, Delwar and his accomplices hurled crude bombs at and opened fire on the police. At one point, they snatched Jasim away from police custody. The police also opened fire on the criminals. Although the Shibir men managed to flee, Jasim's bullet-hit body was found later. However, the victim's brother Anisur Rahman claimed his brother was innocent and had been killed in a pre-planned way. "Police picked him up from Agargaon on 7th February afternoon. He had been missing since then," said Anisur at Dhaka Medical College morgue, where the body was sent for an autopsy. Jasim was badly wounded in the chest, said the brother.

data.name: Rasel Sarder
data.description: Police said a patrol team from the Detectives Branch of the Police came under attack in the area at 3:30 am on February 9, 2015, when some pickets hurled bombs and fired at them. The police retaliated by firing back, and at one point, Rasel was hit by bullets. "He was rushed to DMCH where doctors declared him dead at around 5:00 am," said DMP Deputy Commissioner (media and public relations) Masudur Rahman. However, Rasel's brother, Akash Sarder, claimed his brother was innocent and had no link to any political party. He went missing on February 5 after leaving the shop around 12:00 pm. He said they had been searching for him at different police stations in Dhaka and Narayanganj, but no one could tell them about his whereabouts. "We came to know through television news that a body was kept at DMCH morgue after a gunfight at Jatrabari. We went to DMCH and found the body," said Akash.

data.name: Arif
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Arif (22) was killed in a police "encounter" with alleged blockaders in Sitakunda, Chittagong on February 14, 2015. Arif was declared dead upon arrival at CMCH at around 11:30 pm. Saiful Islam, Assistant Superintendent of Police in Chittagong, claimed that a group of criminals threw a crude bomb at a police patrol team in the Nonachhara area around 9:30 pm. The group then fired at the team, prompting the police to retaliate, as claimed by the ASP.

data.name: Md. Mozammel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Md. Mozammel, an alleged robber, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Amtali upazila of Barguna early on February 14, 2015. Upon receiving information, a police team conducted a raid at a deserted house where the robbers were preparing to commit a robbery, according to Sukumar Roy, the officer-in-charge of Amtali Police Station. The gang initially fired bullets at the law enforcers, who then retaliated by returning fire, as informed by the OC. Later, Mozammel's body was found at the scene and was subsequently sent to the morgue at Barguna General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Moshiur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On February 17, 2015, Moshiur's son Kazi Nayon Hossain said that locals had seen the police chase his father and six other people who were chatting at a tea stall in Chhoigharia Bazar. "At one point, they [locals] heard gunshots and after some time, we learned that my father was shot," he said. Another bullet-hit, Rafiqul Patwari, was picked up by the police, locals claimed. However, law enforcers refuted the claim. The police said a patrol team led by Biplob Kumar Nath, officer-in-charge of Shalikha Police Station, came under attack at Chhoighoria village around 6:45 pm. As the law enforcers were crossing the Hazambari intersection in a van, they saw four to five men sitting there. "When we asked them about their whereabouts, the group opened fire and threw a bomb on the police van, prompting us to return fire," Moshiur was taken to Magura Sadar hospital where doctors pronounced him dead, said the police.

data.name: Motiar Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: He was shot during a raid by a team of police and BGB personnel at Ranirbandar of Dinajpur on February 17, 2015, at night. Police and locals said that during the raid around 8:30 pm, police arrested BNP activist Khoda Bakhs, an accused in several arson cases. As the team was taking him out of the area, Jamaat-Shibir and BNP men exploded several crude bombs and surrounded the team in a bid to snatch the arrestee. Police fired rubber bullets, and then the BGB men fired seven shots. Motiar, Bakhs' elder brother, who led the attack, was hit by three bullets, said Anisur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Chirirbandar Police Station. Law enforcers took Motiar, son of Abdur Rahman of Dakkhin Nashratpur, to Dinajpur Medical College Hospital. Later, he was moved to the capital, said Dinajpur Superintendent of Police Ruhul Amin. Police took Motiar's body to Dhaka Medical College morgue from NICD around 4:00 pm, but no one came for his body as of 12:15 am today, said morgue sources.

data.name: Liton Miah
data.description: Liton Miah, an alleged mugger, was killed in police firing while a gang was fleeing after snatching valuables from a man in Mymensingh town on February 15, 2015. Police said that four to five muggers took away a mobile phone set and TK 2,800 in cash from Abdul Wahab at Balashpur around 3:00 am. He was returning home from his workshop in the town's Mashkanda area. Hearing his screams, a police team patrolling the area chased the muggers, said Abu Mohammad Fazlul Karim, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang tried to attack the police team with sharp weapons. Police opened fire to retaliate. Liton was hit by bullets and died on the spot. The others fled, the police official said.

data.name: Mostafa Manjil
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Mostafa Manjil (32), a Jamaat activist and former president of Gaibandha Sadar unit Islami Chhatra Shibir, the student wing of the party, was the prime accused of the February 6 Gaibandha bus arson. He was killed in a "shootout" with the RAB in the district on February 17, 2015.

data.name: Rafique Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Rafique Uddin, also known as Chhoto Tareque, was a 40-year-old resident of a cluster village in Bishoykhali Bazar, located under Jhenaidah Sadar Upazila. According to the RAB, he was the regional leader of the Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-Janajuddah). However, his family claimed that he was an activist of Jubo League, a pro-ruling Awami League youth organization, and that RAB men had picked him up the day before. Two villagers stated that they had witnessed a RAB team detaining him on February 16, 2015.

data.name: Abu Sayeed
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Sayeed and Bajlu were detained by the police at Monirampur Police Station in the evening on February 17, 2015. Then, at around 3:00 am, they were taken to Begaritola to recover arms while their accomplices attacked the police. The police retaliated and opened fire. In this incident, Sayeed and Bajlu were killed.

data.name: Bajlur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Sayeed and Bajlu were detained by the police at Monirampur Police Station in the evening on February 17, 2015. Then, at around 3:00 am, they were taken to Begaritola to recover arms while their accomplices attacked the police. The police retaliated and opened fire. In this incident, Sayeed and Bajlu were killed.

data.name: Hossen Ahmad
data.description: Hossen Ahmad was allegedly killed by the BGB in a gunfight at Teknaf, Cox's Bazar on February 18, 2015. On that day, a group of yaba traders from Myanmar were waiting by the side of the river. After receiving information, the BGB went to the location, and a gunfight ensued. As a result, Hossen Ahmad was killed in the gunfight.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.description: On February 19, 2015 Rafiqul Islam was killed in a gunfight. However, eye-witnesses Abdul Kadir, Jalal Uddin, Shamim and Babul Mia informed that he was arrested by the police before the gunfight.

data.name: Tipu Hawlader
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Tipu Hawlader, along with Kabir Molla, were killed in a shootout with the police in Agailjhara of Barisal on February 21, 2015. They were accused in a case for firebombing a fruit-laden pick-up on February 9 in Agailjhara and had been on the run since then, said Monirul Islam, officer-in-charge of Agailjhara Police Station. OC Monirul said a team of Agailjhara police, with the help of DB police in Dhaka, caught Kabir from his relative's house in Ashulia around 4:00 am on February 21, 2015. Around an hour later, the same team arrested Tipu from Keraniganj, on the outskirts of the capital. Around midnight, the two were taken to Agailjhara to apprehend other suspects in the arson case. As the law enforcers reached Jobarpar, they came under a firebomb attack around 2:10 am on February 22, 2015, he claimed. They also opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate with gunfire, said the OC. After the gunfight, police found the bullet-riddled bodies of Tipu and Kabir on the ground.

data.name: Asadul Hawlader
data.description: A group of police officials, led by SI Mukul and Russel of Bhanga Police Station, came to Miapara village on February 21, 2015, and detained Asadul and Johor Ali while they were working in the field. Johor escaped and jumped into the pond. On the other hand, the police dragged Asadul with a chain from his throat, resulting in his death.

data.name: Abdul Odud
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Abdul Odud was arrested in the morning, and then at night, he was taken to Kalayanpur Housing for possessing arms. During that time, his accomplices opened fire, and the police retaliated. As a result of this incident, he was killed.

data.name: Shaheen
data.description: Shaheen was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Sreenagar upazila on February 25, 2015. Sheikh Mahbubur Rahman, the officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said a police team launched a raid at Rudrapara village around 1:30 pm based on intelligence that a group of armed thugs had gathered there to commit criminal activities. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, leaving one person named Al Amin injured. Upon receiving the information, an additional police force went to the location and cordoned off the area. At that time, the criminals once again opened fire on the police, prompting the officers to retaliate with gunfire, resulting in Shaheen's death on the spot. The other criminals managed to escape from the scene.

data.name: Daud Ali
data.description: A leader of an outlawed party was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Magura Sadar upazila in the early hours of today. The deceased, Daud Ali alias Tiger Daud, 42, was the ringleader of the party locally known as Daud Bahini, said Sudarshan Roy, assistant superintendent of police (ASP) in Magura. Daud was accused in eight criminal cases, including six for murder, the ASP said. Acting on a tip-off, the police arrested Daud in the Boroichara area around 1:30 am today and launched a drive with him in the Chhoto-Khalimpur area to recover arms based on his information, our Jhenidha correspondent reports, quoting the police official. As the police team, along with Daud, reached the area, his associates fired gunshots at the law enforcers, prompting them to shoot back, triggering a "gunfight," the ASP said. Daud, a resident of Nandipara village in the upazila, suffered bullet wounds during the "gunfight" as he tried to flee from the police capture but died on the spot, he added. The ASP claimed that four policemen were injured during the "gun battle." The law enforcers retrieved three firearms and 21 bullets from the spot.

data.name: Saddam Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Lt. Col. Faridul Alam, Commanding Officer of RAB-8, said they had information that some members of Sagar-Saikat Bahini had set up a den at Katleswar Khal, locally known as Katlar Khal, under the Sharankhola range and had been holed up there. A RAB-8 team led by Maj. Adnan Kabir reached the area, approximately 45 kilometers south of Sharankhola, around 7:00 am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire, prompting the RAB men to retaliate, said the RAB-8 CO. After approximately half an hour of "gunfight", the robbers retreated and the RAB men found three bullet-riddled bodies of Saddam Mollah, Sohel, and another unidentified man lying on the ground, he said.

data.name: Rezawanul
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Rezawanul was shot dead by the police while a clash ensued between the police and local people regarding the arrest of Habibur Rahman, a leader of BNP and the father of Rezawanul.

data.name: Mohammad Monsur Ali
data.description: A fisherman named Mohammad Mansur Ali was shot and killed by the police in Sunamganj's Jalmahal, leading to a clash between the police and other fishermen. The police had fired 11 live rounds to disperse the fishermen from Jalmahal.

data.name: Arif Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On March 1, 2015, Arif and Mainuddin received bullet injuries in a gunfight with the police. Later, Arif succumbed to his injuries on March 11, 2015.

data.name: Nazmul Huda Lablu
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Nazmul Huda Lablu, the President of Shramik Kalyan Federation and former President of Islami Chhatra Shibir, was killed in a clash with the police in Mithapukur, Rangpur. The police informed that on March 9, 2015, at around 3:30 am, a group of criminals were cutting trees in the Baldipukur area of the Rangpur-Dhaka Highway. At that time, the criminals threw cocktails and petrol bombs at the police when they put up a barrier. The criminals fled when the police opened fire in self-defense. Later, Nazmul Huda Lablu was rescued with bullet wounds and taken to Rangpur Medical College Hospital, where the doctors on duty declared him dead. The brother-in-law of the deceased alleged that on March 8, at around 7:00 pm, Lablu was picked up by some men in plain clothes who identified themselves as members of a law enforcement agency at gunpoint from Shanerhat Kalanur Shahpur village under Pirganj Upazila. On March 9, at noon, the police informed them to bring the body. The deceased's father, Nurunnabi Shah, said, "The police staged a drama of a 'gunfight' after killing my son.

data.name: Mohammad Apu
data.description: The family alleges that Mohammad Apu was picked up by the DB police on March 10, 2015. Later, his dead body was found on March 11, 2015. The police claimed that they found the dead body at 11 am and sent it to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital for a post-mortem examination. They alleged that he was a suspected mugger.

data.name: Hasan Ali Sana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged leader of a robber gang was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Hongshu Rajerchar area of the Sundarbans on March 12, 2015. Acting on a tip-off, law enforcers conducted a raid in the Dabura area of Shyamnagar upazila in Satkhira on March 11, 2015, and arrested Sana. He was handed over to Koyra police around 11:00 pm. After gathering information from Sana, a police team took him along with them and launched a raid in the Hongshu Rajerchar area around 2:00 am to recover arms. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Sana's cohorts opened fire in an attempt to snatch him, forcing the police members to retaliate by firing. As a result, Sana died in the gunfight.

data.name: Md. Israfil
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: The family alleged that plainclothes police had killed him after picking him up.

data.name: Mukter Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed, and four of his aides were injured in a "gunfight" with the police at Joydevpur area under Alfadanga upazilla in Faridpur on March 16, 2015.

data.name: Yunus Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" with police in the Panchbaria area on the Jessore-Magura Highway in the district on March 17, 2015. After receiving information that a gang of robbers was preparing to loot night coaches and trucks loaded with goods on the highway by felling a tree, a police team went to the scene at around 4:00 am, said Akkas Ali, OC of Jessore Kotwali Police Station. Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers detonated crude bombs and opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Yunus Ali sustained bullet wounds and died on the spot while his accomplices managed to flee, the OC said.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On March 19, 2015 Jahangir was arrested by police from Chakbazaar of Old Dhaka as a suspect of a dacoity case. Police produced him in the court and appealed for remand. In the remand period on March 20, 2015 police claimed that Jahangir hanged himself to death. However, family alleged that he died due to torture by police. There were marks of torture in his body.

data.name: Iqbal Hossain
data.description: Iqbal was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and the police in the Kaliganj Kanchatala Bazar area under Kaliganj upazila of the district on March 21, 2015. The deceased was Iqbal Hossain (28), the son of Abul Kashem from Arpara village.

data.name: Mobarok Ullah Monti
data.description: Mobarok was killed in a shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's TT Para slum area on March 22, 2015. He was identified as Mobarok Ullah Monti, 45, an accused in the recent murder of Sumi Akter in the Motijheel area, said the battalion officials.

data.name: Al Amin Hossain
data.description: T M Rokunuzzaman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Khulna district Detective Branch (DB) of the police, said that acting on a tip-off, a joint team of DB and Koyra police arrested Al Amin from Chandkhali in Koyra around 10:15 pm on March 29, 2015. After gathering information from Al Amin, the police raided the Jhapjhopiarchar area, which is adjacent to the Sundarbans, in search of his hideout and weapons. The law enforcers took him with them at that time. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, other members of the gang in the area opened fire on the police, leading to a gunfight that lasted for almost an hour. Al Amin was found dead when the shooting ended. However, his accomplices managed to escape.

data.name: Lokman Hossain
data.description: Lokman Hossain was shot to death by the police during a clash that occurred regarding the UP election for vote counting in Rangpur. At the Chowdhurypara Madrassa vote center, while the presiding officer announced that Sohel Rana had won, the other contestant, Abdul Matin, protested. A clash ensued, and as a result, the police opened fire. Lokman received bullet injuries and died sometime later.

data.name: Kamrul Sheikh
data.description: He was allegedly killed by Rob in a gunfight on April 1, 2015.

data.name: Bellal Hossain
data.description: Bellal was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police on April 6, 2015, at Panirghat, Sharankhola, Bagerhat.

data.name: Omar Faruk
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A procession was brought out at Maizdi when the police opened fire. During the incident, Omar sustained a bullet injury and died.

data.name: Farhad
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged forest robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in Alki of the Sundarbans in Koyra of Khulna on the night of August 4, 2015. Khulna RAB-6 Commanding Officer Khalikuzzaman said that, based on a tip-off that the forest robber gang was preparing to commit robbery in the area, a team of the elite force launched a drive there at about 7:30 pm. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. Farhad was caught in the line of fire and seriously injured, while other members of the gang managed to flee the spot. Farhad was rushed to Koyra Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead at about 9:30 pm.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: On April 12, 2015, at around 3:00 am, Shahidul Islam was detained by the DB police from Rajshahi Islami Bank Medical College Hospital while he was on duty at that time. However, Secretary Raihanul Islam of the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami claimed that the police took him to Noudpara near the police station and shot him dead.

data.name: Anisur Rahman Anis
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police alleged that on April 12, 2015, Anis threw two cocktails in front of the police station. He was arrested by the police. Later, he died in a crossfire while his accomplices came to rescue him.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Keraniganj, an alleged unidentified robber, aged around 28, was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and the police at Prohori Bita in Keraniganj.

data.name: Milon Ahmed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The leader of an inter-district robbery gang was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Mirpur upazila on April 21, 2015. The deceased, Milon, was the son of Abdus Sattar from Laxmidhardia village in the upazila. Milon's family alleged that two police officials - Sub-Inspector Abdul Halim and Assistant Sub-Inspector Atiqur Rahman - picked up Milon on the night of April 18, 2015, and fabricated the "gunfight" story.

data.name: Uzzal
data.description: Uzzal was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight on April 21, 2015.

data.name: Sohel Rana
data.description: Sohel Rana was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight on April 25, 2015.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with the police. Acting on a tip-off, at around 3:00 am, a joint team of Joypurhat DB and Panchbibi police raided Bhutgari village where approximately seven to eight "robbers" were preparing to commit a robbery, according to the police. As soon as the law enforcers reached the scene, the criminals started firing at them. The law enforcers retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight," said Abu Hena Mostafa Kamal, officer-in-charge of Panchbibi Police Station. After the "gunfight," the police found two bodies of Abdus Salam and Babu Mia at the scene, which were then sent to Joypurhat Modern Hospital for autopsy.

data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang

As soon as the law enforcers reached the scene, the criminals started firing at them. The law enforcers retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight," said Abu Hena Mostafa Kamal, officer-in-charge of Panchbibi Police Station. After the "gunfight," the police found two bodies of Abdus Salam and Babu Mia at the scene, which were then sent to Joypurhat Modern Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Al Mamun
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Khulna city on May 5, 2015. A special team, led by Officer-in-Charge Sukumer Biswas, went to the Bagmara Burir Bagan area in the city along with the two robbers to arrest their cohorts and recover firearms at around 8:30 pm, said Assistant Commissioner of Khulna Metropolitan Police, Ziauddin Ahmed. Sensing the presence of the policemen, the cohorts of the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one stage, the robbers retreated. Police found Al Mamun dead.

data.name: Dholu Hossain
data.description: Three alleged human traffickers - Dholu Hossain, Jahangir Alam, and Zafar Alam - were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar on May 8, 2015. "Acting on a tip-off, a team of police conducted a raid at the Hatchery Beach area in Teknaf around 3:30 am," said Ataur Rahman Khandakar, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the human traffickers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a 30-minute "gunfight," he said. The gunfight left the three traffickers dead on the spot.

data.description: Three alleged human traffickers - Dholu Hossain, Jahangir Alam, and Zafar Alam - were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar on May 8, 2015.
