data.name: Imam Hossain
data.description: He was arrested by the police on May 6, 2015 from Purba Shakpura village, Boyalkhali. On May 7, 2015, he fell sick before appearing in court. He was then taken to Upazila Govt Hospital and later referred to Chittagong Medical College Hospital. On May 11, 2015, he died in the hospital. The family alleged that he died due to torture.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.description: A human trafficking suspect was killed by the police in a reported "gunfight" in Cox's Bazar, while an anti-human trafficking team of the Coast Guard and the Navy detained 116 Malaysia-bound job seekers from the Bay of Bengal near St Martin's Island. The human trafficking suspect, Belal Hossain, 38, from Kawarpara village under Khoroskhool union of Cox's Bazar, was involved in a "gunfight" at Meherghona village under Cox's Bazar sadar upazila at about 5:00 am, according to the police.

data.name: Saiyan Islam
data.description: Saiyan Islam was stabbed to death by BGB members at the Hilli border in Dinajpur on May 10, 2015. He passed away in the hospital on May 12, 2015.

data.name: Rezaul Karim
data.description: Rezaul was arrested and beaten with a chain on May 14, 2015, at around 11:30 am. During the incident, Rezaul fell to the ground and was subsequently taken to a car by the police. Although he received medical treatment, he unfortunately passed away.

data.name: Sultan Khokon
data.description: Sultan, also known as Khokon, was allegedly killed in a shootout with the police in Meherpur Sadar upazila. Ahsan Habib, the officer-in-charge of Meherpur Sadar Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, the police raided Sultan's hideout at College intersection in Meherpur district town and arrested him. According to Sultan's statement, a police team took him to Rajnagar village in Meherpur Sadar upazila around 5:00 am to recover weapons and apprehend his accomplices. When the law enforcement officers reached near a bridge in the village, Sultan's associates opened fire on them. The police retaliated, resulting in a gunfight. At one point, Sultan attempted to escape but was caught in the crossfire and died on the spot.

data.name: Hazrat Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged highway robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Joypurhat's Khetlal upazila on the night of May 20, 2015.

data.name: Sohel
data.description: Sohel was allegedly shot by the police while he was snatching. Later, he died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Altaf Hossain Sagar
data.description: He was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight on May 28, 2015, at Motijheel.

data.name: Ishaq Miah
data.description: The police claimed that the suspect, Ishaq Miah, 45, had committed suicide in a toilet at the police station, while the family alleged that the police were bribed to kill him. He died in the custody of Kotwali Police Station in Chittagong.

data.name: Najim Uddin
data.description: Najim Uddin was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police on July 7, 2015.

data.name: Mohammad Jasim Uddin
data.description: Mohammad Jasim Uddin was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight.

data.name: Selim Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Selim Sheikh was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Kanaipur in Sadar upazila on June 13, 2015. Upon receiving information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the area, a police team conducted a raid at around 3:30 am. Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. During the exchange, Selim received fatal gunshot wounds and died on the spot, while the others managed to escape.

data.name: Mohammad Jamal
data.description: Shah Jamal was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" with RAB-08 in Sarankhola.

data.name: Nazmul Islam Sagar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nazmul Islam Sagar was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" between the police and his accomplices at Katlamari under Mirpur upazila on June 19, 2015. Mirpur police officer-in-charge Jalal Uddin said they had information that 10-12 robbers were preparing to commit a robbery on the Kushtia-Meherpur road. A police team conducted a raid in the area around 2:15 am, he said. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering a gunfight.

data.name: Mamun Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" between RAB and his cohorts in the Haidarabad area of Gazipur on June 23, 2015. Muhith Kabir, the operation officer of RAB-1, said a gang of robbers intercepted a patrol microbus of the elite force at Haidarabad on the Tongi-Kaliganj road around 3:30 am. When another microbus of RAB reached the spot, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, as reported by our Gazipur correspondent. "The RAB members fired back in retaliation, which triggered a gunfight," he said, adding that they recovered the bullet-hit body of Mamun from the spot while his cohorts managed to flee.

data.name: Shamim Ahmed
data.description: Shamim Ahmed was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police in the Purano Paltan area of the capital.

data.name: Shahin
data.description: Shahin was killed, along with Sultan, by BGB men at Birampur in Dinajpur on the afternoon of June 30, 2015. OC Md Amiruzzaman said that a BGB team seized Indian smuggled clothes from Birampur Railway Station around 4.00 pm and left the station. Immediately after the seizure, the smugglers gathered in the area and tortured a BGB source, he said. Upon hearing this, the BGB members returned to the area when the "smugglers" attacked them. Quoting the BGB members, he said the BGB team opened fire in self-defense, resulting in the deaths of Shahin and Sultan on the spot. However, locals claimed that Shahin and Sultan were "common people" who used to run shops in the area. As the news spread, locals blocked the Birampur-Dinajpur highway by felling tree logs and placing the bodies on the road, according to police and locals.

data.name: Md. Sultan
data.description: Sultan was killed, along with Sahin, by BGB men at Birampur in Dinajpur on the afternoon of June 30, 2015. OC Md Amiruzzaman said that a BGB team seized Indian smuggled clothes from Birampur Railway Station around 4.00 pm and left the station. Immediately after the seizure, the smugglers gathered in the area and tortured a BGB source, he said. Upon hearing this, the BGB members returned to the area when the smugglers attacked them. Quoting the BGB members, he said the BGB team opened fire in self-defense, resulting in the deaths of Shahin and Sultan on the spot. However, locals claimed that Shahin and Sultan were "common people" who used to run shops in the area. As the news spread, locals blocked the Birampur-Dinajpur highway by felling tree logs and placing the bodies on the road, according to police and locals.

data.name: Md. Yusuf
data.description: Md. Yusuf was shot dead by the police in the capital's Hatirjheel area on June 30, 2015, although the deceased's family members said that he was picked up by the police on June 28, 2015. The deceased's wife, Ruksana Begum, said that Tejgaon Industrial police picked up Yusuf on the night of June 28, 2015, and they saw him at the police station on June 29 in the afternoon. Yusuf told his family members that the police demanded Tk 50,000 for his release. The police station's officer-in-Charge, Mizanur Rahman, however, brushed aside the allegations and said that Yusuf was shot during a gunfight.

data.name: Mohammad Jony
data.description: An undertrial prisoner named Mohammad Jony died in Rajshahi Central jail as a result of torture by the police while in custody. However, the police claimed that Jony committed suicide by hanging himself with a local towel (gamcha). The victim's family alleged that Jony was arrested by the police as a suspect of theft and was tortured to death in Rajshahi police line custody.

data.name: Abdus Sobhan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his accomplices and the police in Burumaria, Pangsha of Rajbari on August 7, 2015. Abu Samad Md Hayat, the officer-in-charge of Pangsha Police Station, said the police arrested the robber from Charkalimohar at around 10:00 pm on August 6, 2015. Later, a team of police, along with Sobhan, conducted a raid at a mango orchard owned by Akter Master in Burumaria around 1:30 am to recover firearms. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Sobhan's associates opened fire on the police, prompting the police force to retaliate and resulting in a gunfight. Sobhan was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Yasin Sarkar Rajon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A sanitation worker and Juba League activist was shot dead by RAB at Taltola in Agargaon after he was allegedly abducted by the force on July 12, according to the victim's family members. The deceased has been identified as Yasin Sarker Rajon, 32. However, RAB claimed that the deceased was a mugger and accused in several cases, including murder. RAB-2 Commanding Officer SM Masud Rana claimed that their patrol team challenged a gang of muggers in the area around 2:30 am when they were trying to flee. The RAB team chased the gang, and at that time, the gang opened fire. RAB officers retaliated, and Rajon sustained bullet injuries. Later, Rajon was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. The victim's brother, Nazmul Haque Panna, however, said that Rajon was going to his relative's house that night when four to five motorbikes intercepted him and he was picked up into a microbus.

data.name: Suman
data.description: In Rangpur, two brothers were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB personnel in the city's Dhap area. Two RAB men, Sub-Inspector Saiful Islam and Constable Imran, were also injured during the "gunfight" and admitted to Rangpur Medical College Hospital. According to the RAB, a team of RAB-13 challenged the duo around 3.00 am. They tried to escape the scene by opening fire on the RAB men, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered the "gunfight" and left the duo dead on the spot, claimed the RAB officials. The victims were identified as Suman, 26, and Manik, 25, sons of Abdul Malek, residents of Khaliphatari in the city.

data.name: Manik
data.description: In Rangpur, two brothers were killed in a "gunfight" with the RAB personnel in the city's Dhap area. Two RAB men, Sub-Inspector Saiful Islam and Constable Imran, were also injured during the "gunfight" and admitted to Rangpur Medical College Hospital. According to the RAB, a team of RAB-13 challenged the duo around 3:00 am. They tried to escape the scene by opening fire on the RAB men, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered the "gunfight" and left the duo dead on the spot, claimed the RAB officials. The victims were identified as Suman, 26, and Manik, 25, sons of Abdul Malek, residents of Khaliphatari in the city.

data.name: Palash Malitha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Acting on a tip-off that a group of robbers were preparing to commit a highway robbery in Bhangabottala village of the upazila, a police team raided the area around 2:30 am, said Kazi Jalal Uddin, OC of Mirpur Police Station. When the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals opened fire on the police, prompting them to return fire, which triggered a "gunfight".

data.name: Md Abu Zafar
data.description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in an encounter with the Rapid Action Battalion at Patenga Sea Beach in Chittagong city on July 26, 2015. Major Maksudul Alam, Assistant Director of RAB's Legal and Media Wing, stated that Zafar, a drug lord of the South Chittagong zone, was killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB 7 officials.

data.name: Tarikul Islam Taru
data.description: Taru was reportedly killed in a "gunfight" with the members of Rapid Action Battalion-8 in the Majhgram area of the district town on July 27, 2015. Taru went missing on July 17, according to a general diary filed with Sadar police station by his wife, Rekha Begum.

data.name: Miarul Islam
data.description: An alleged ringleader was killed in a gunfight with the police. A team arrested Miarul, accused in 10 cases including two for murder, from Nurpur village on August 1, 2015, said Ahsan Habib, OC of Meherpur Police Station. While he was being taken to recover firearms, his cohorts arrived and a gunfight ensued, resulting in his death.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: Salam's mother, Rawshanara Begum, alleged that the police killed her son after taking a bribe from his rivals. She admitted that her son had been accused in several cases and was detained in prison several years ago. The house owner said Salam had rented the room a month ago and had been living there with his wife, Ruby, and their two-and-a-half-year-old child. According to them, the police first entered the building and asked residents not to move, and then stormed Salam's room. A few minutes later, the tenants heard three to four gunshots. About one and a half hours later, the police took away an unconscious Salam, who was bleeding, neighbors said.

data.name: Siddiq Sana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Six alleged tiger poachers - Siddiq Sana, Ansar Ali Sana, Rafiqul Islam, Mamun Gazi, Bappi Dhali, and Majid Gazi - were killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in the Sundarbans on August 9, 2015. The police claimed that all six were 'tiger poachers' and members of a Sundarbans-based robber gang. Acting on a tip-off that some 'tiger poachers' were in the Alki Mandarbaria area of the West Sundarbans in Koyra upazila, a police team raided the area at around 3:45 pm, said Harendranath Sarkar, OC of Koyra Police Station. The victims' families and locals alleged that they were detained by the police the day before the gunfight.

data.name: Sardar Abdur Rob
data.description: On August 10, 2015, a gunfight ensued when Sardar Abdur Rob was allegedly killed by the police.

data.name: Zahidul Islam Alo
data.description: An alleged yaba trader was killed on August 17, 2015, in what RAB claimed was a gunfight, but the victim's family claimed he was murdered. Major Shahid Sarwar of RAB-7 said the incident occurred when a RAB team was patrolling the Dhaka-Chittagong highway and came across a pick-up van on the Port-Bhatiary link road at 2:45 am. They saw two people in the van and asked them to stop as they were trying to drive away. At that time, the two men opened fire at the RAB team, and a gunfight followed. The pick-up managed to flee after a while. Later, RAB members found Zahidul's bullet-riddled body. He was rushed to Chittagong Medical College Hospital only to be declared dead on arrival. Family members refuted the RAB statement, calling it a cooked-up story. Yasmin Akhter, the wife of the deceased, said her husband was abducted by 7-8 people in plainclothes from a friend's house in Dhaka at around 8:00 am on August 15, 2015.

data.name: Arzu Miah
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Arzu Miah was killed in a gunfight between his associates and RAB members in the capital's Hazaribagh area on August 18, 2015, around 12 hours after he and his friends allegedly beat a teenage boy to death. Police and locals said Hazaribagh BCL President Arzu Miah, 28, and a couple of his friends beat a boy, Raja Miah, in Hazaribagh on August 17, 2015, allegedly for stealing mobile phones and a laptop. Several hours after Raja's death, Arzu was picked up by RAB-2 personnel from Hazaribagh park area, said Arzu's brother Masud Mia. Ferdawsi Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-2, said members of the elite force took Arzu, the main suspect in the Raja murder case, to Baroikhali area of Hazaribagh to arrest the others involved in the murder. His cohorts opened fire on the Rab members at 2:35 am on August 18, 2015. Wounded, Arzu was found lying there after the gunfight. He was later taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mehedi Hasan Ajibor
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A joint team of detectives and police gunned down Ajibor. Ajibor, the third accused in the case of shooting a man dead and injuring a pregnant woman in Magura, was a former executive member of Magura Municipality BCL.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A ruling party activist who was allegedly involved in the August infighting that left one person dead in Kushtia was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in the district town on August 19, 2015. Sabbir Ul Alam, the officer-in-charge of the Detective Branch of Police, said the "gunfight" took place at Jagati area of Kushtia Sadar upazila at around 1:30 am. The police conducted a raid in the area after receiving a tip-off that a gang of criminals was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang opened fire on them, forcing the police to retaliate and triggering a gun battle. Zakir was found lying on the spot while the others managed to flee the scene. He was taken to Kushtia General Hospital where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Md Mozibur Rahman Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Mozibur Rahman was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB at Shamarghat under Sadar upazila in Tangail in the early hours of August 21, 2015. The victim was identified as Md Mozibur Rahman Sheikh, son of the late Sona Mondol of Kashinagar village under Sadar upazila in the district. Company Commander of RAB-12, Additional Police Superintendent Muhammed Mohiuddin Faruki, said they raided the Shamarghat area based on a tip-off that two gangs of ultra-left extremists had gathered there. Suspecting the presence of law enforcement, the "extremist" groups opened fire, triggering a gun battle with RAB. Faruki said the criminals had fled at one stage while Mozibur was found bullet-hit in a Mehegini tree garden with a 7.65 foreign pistol and two rounds of bullets after the exchange of fire between them and the law enforcers. Mozibur was immediately taken to Tangail Medical College Hospital where the duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Police said Jubo League ward leader Saidul Islam was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and members of the Detective Branch of Police at Salna in Gazipur on August 21, 2015. Inspector of Gazipur DB, Amir Hossain, said police arrested Saidul, an alleged criminal, on August 21, 2015, and took him to the Salna area to arrest his associates and recover firearms around 12:00 am on August 22, 2015. Sensing the presence of police, the associates of Saidul opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage, Saidul was caught in the line of fire, added the officer. Saidul was taken to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Yusuf Akhter
data.description: Yusuf Akhter was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight. The family alleged that he was arrested before the gunfight and later a drama was staged to sort out arms, while Yusuf died in the gunfight.

data.name: Khalilur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion on August 31, 2015, at Darjarkhal in the Sundarbans under Sharankhola of Bagerhat district. The Commanding Officer of RAB-8, Faridul Alam, said the gunfight took place when his forces went to Darajarkhal on a tip-off that a group of thugs were planning a robbery there. Cohorts of the slain robber opened fire on the forces of RAB-8, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. The body was sent to Bagerhat General Hospital for a post-mortem examination.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: On September 1, 2015, Sumon was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight at Sadar Upazila, Comilla.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two leaders of an outlawed party were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Rajbari's Pangsha upazila on September 4, 2015. The deceased, Kamal Hossain and Omar Kha, were from Shantikhola and Borochoubaria villages of the upazila. Kamal was the prime accused in a case filed in connection with the murder of Mizanur Rahman, a former OC of Pangsha Police Station. Omar, one of Kamal's accomplices, was also the ringleader of an inter-district robber gang, as claimed by the police. They were arrested before the gunfight, and the police brought them to recover arms. Then, a gunfight ensued.

data.name: Arman Hazari
data.description: On September 5, 2015, Arman Hazar was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight in Chittagong.

data.name: Akash Ferdous
data.description: On September 6, 2015, Akhash alias Ferdouse (30) was allegedly killed in police firing at Wari in Old Dhaka. Wari police Sub-Inspector Shariful Islam took Akash to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries at about 5:15 pm, said Sub-Inspector Sentu Chandra Das, who is posted at the hospital.

data.name: Faruk Hossain
data.description: Three people - Faruk Hossain, Shameem, and Shyamal Chandra Pal - were killed as the police opened fire at local people who clashed with them during their protests against an alleged case of sexual harassment at Kalihati upazila in Tangail on September 18, 2015. Witnesses said that the locals of Kalihati and Ghatail were staging protests at about 4:30 pm on September 18, 2015, on the Tangail-Mymensingh Highway against the alleged sexual harassment of a local woman in front of her son on September 15. The police charged batons on the protesters to disperse them from the highway, triggering clashes between the police and the protesters.

data.name: Shameem
data.description: Three people - Faruk Hossain, Shameem, and Shyamal Chandra Pal - were killed as police opened fire on local people who clashed with the police during their protests against an alleged sexual harassment in Kalihati upazila, Tangail on September 18, 2015. Witnesses said that the locals of Kalihati and Ghatail were staging protests at about 4:30 pm on September 18, 2015, on the Tangail-Mymensingh Highway against the alleged sexual harassment of a local woman in front of her son on September 15. Police charged batons at the protesters to disperse them from the highway, triggering clashes between the cops and the protesters.

data.name: Rubel
data.description: Rubel was injured when the police opened fire at local people who clashed with them during their protests against an alleged case of sexual harassment at Kalihati upazila in Tangail on September 18, 2015. Later, he was admitted to Dhaka Medical College Hospital. On September 20, 2015, Rubel succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Alal Gazi
data.description: Alal, along with Shahidur, was allegedly killed in a reported gunfight with the police on the bank of the Kholpetua river under Shyamnagar upazila in Satkhira on September 28, 2015.

data.name: Shahidur Sarder
data.description: Shahidur, along with Alal, was allegedly killed in a reported gunfight with the police on the bank of the Kholpetua river under Shyamnagar upazila in Satkhira on September 28, 2015.

data.name: Abu Jaher Ahmad
data.description: Abu Jaher was allegedly killed in a reported gunfight with the police in west Latifpur, under Lakhsmipur district, on September 29, 2015.

data.name: Akkas Rahim
data.description: Akkas was allegedly killed in a reported gunfight with the police on the bank of the Shela River, in the Amgachiya area of Bagerhat, on September 30, 2015.

data.name: Toufiqul Islam [Should be Mohammed Javed, also used in description box]
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: He was arrested by the police on October 4, 2015 as an alleged member of a militant group. Then he was taken into custody for interrogation. The police said that on October 6, 2015, he was taken to the Ananna residential area of the city to recover grenades. Once the police reached there, Jabed's associates hurled a grenade at the police. As a result, Jabed died. Therefore, he was under the custody of the police and was found dead, with no information obtained from the family.

data.name: Asadul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the RAB in Sirajganj Sadar upazila on October 9, 2015. The deceased is Asadul Islam, 35, of Guttara village in Tangail's Bhuapur upazila. According to RAB, acting on information that some robbers, including Asadul, were preparing to commit a robbery in the Chinabandh area, a team of RAB-12 went there to conduct a drive around 4:00 am, said Hasibul Hasan, Commander of Sirajganj RAB camp. Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers opened fire on the elite force members, said Hasibul, who is also an assistant superintendent of police. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, Asadul was found dead on the spot.

data.name: Enamul Haque
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Jessore police picked up Enamul Haque and Mahmud Hasan from their house in Ichali village, under Sadar upazila, Jessore on October 9, 2015. Later, Enamul's body was found at Jhenaidah Barobazaar Rail crossing. Enamul's family alleged that he died due to torture by the police.

data.name: Mohklesur Rahman
data.description: Two police officers allegedly beat a man to death in Bogra's Gabtoli upazila on October 15, 2015. The victim was Mokhlesur Rahman (45) of Daripara village in the upazila. Two cops, ASI Abdus Sabur and Constable Abdur Rahman of Gabtoli Model Police Station, were suspended in connection with the incident. Following his death, locals and family members confined Sabur and Rahman, who were accused of beating Moklesur to death. The two had to be rescued by additional police forces. Police sources said the victim's younger brother filed an allegation against him over a family feud on October 14, 2015. In response, the two officers in question went to investigate the allegation and allegedly beat and kicked Mokhlesur after apprehending him. He died instantly, according to the family's allegations.

data.name: Rezaul
data.description: On October 16, 2015, Rezaul was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight at Joypurhat.

data.name: Akbar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two members of Puba Banglar Communist Party - Akbar Hossain and Manu Miah - were killed, and three others were injured in a gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Maisha village of Hugra union in Tangail on October 21, 2015. Sensing the presence of the RAB members, the party members opened fire on the RAB, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight.

data.name: Manu Miah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region

data.name: Abdur Rahim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Laxmipur Sadar Upazila on October 22, 2015.

data.name: Johirul Islam Bijoy
data.description: On October 22, 2015, Johirul was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB-1 at Adorshonagar, Badda, Dhaka.

data.name: Habibur Rahman Habib
data.description: Habibur Rahman Habib was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" with DB police in Faridpur town on the night of October 23, 2015. Acting on a tip-off that Habib was making a deal with his buyers to sell firearms, a team of DB police raided the East Khaspur Launch ghat area around 11:30 pm, said Mohammad Kamruzzaman, Additional Superintendent of Faridpur police. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Habib and his aides attacked the police with sharp weapons. The police then opened fire on them, triggering a gunfight between the police and the criminals. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene, and the police found Habib's bullet-hit body on the spot.

data.name: Arshad Ali Bepari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged inter-district robber gang leader was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Rajbari's Goalando on October 26, 2015. The police said the deceased, Arshad Ali Bepari, was accused in seven cases, including murder and robbery.

data.name: Shipon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was reportedly killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion members at Mrigamari canal of Chadpai in Mongla upazila of Bagerhat on October 28, 2015.

data.name: Rajib Hasan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Rajib Hasan was killed in an alleged "gunfight" with the police in the capital's Uttarkhan on November 2, 2015. The police said Rajib was a wanted criminal and died in a "gunfight" between the police and some robbers who were his cohorts. The OC of Uttarkhan police station, Yunus Ali, said that Kotwali and Uttarkhan police jointly conducted a raid at Shahid Nagar Balur Math area based on a tip-off that some robbers were preparing to commit a robbery in the early hours there. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting the lawmen to retaliate, he said. As the robbers fled, the bullet-hit Rajib was found dead there, the OC said. His body was taken to Dhaka Medical College and Hospital morgue for a post-mortem examination.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.description: The deceased was identified as Kamal Hossain, 28, of Lebutala under Jessore Sadar district. Jhenaidah RAB camp commander, Major Mohammad Suruj Mia, said that RAB had signaled a motorcyclist to stop at Koroitala area on the Jhenaidah-Jessore highway around 2:30 am on November 2, 2015. The bike had two additional passengers. The motorcyclist did not comply and, instead, the passengers targeted the RAB men and opened fire, prompting RAB to retaliate. Two of the passengers managed to flee. Kamal, who had been shot, was apprehended by the RAB men and taken to Kaliganj Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam Rafiq
data.description: RAB-1 Operations Officer Akramul Hasan said they were acting on a tip-off that a group of miscreants had gathered at Bangoan Kumarkhada and raided the area around 1:30 am on November 2, 2015. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the miscreants opened fire at them, prompting the RAB members to strike back, which led to a 'gunfight'. Rafiq was caught in the line of fire while his associates were able to run away, Akramul said.

data.name: Picchi Sentu
data.description: Sentu, also known as Picchi Sentu, was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight on November 5, 2015. He was arrested and taken to Kathadiya for the recovery of arms. During that time, a gunfight broke out, resulting in his death by the hands of the police.

data.name: Shohag Mridha
data.description: Shohag was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight on November 5, 2015.

data.name: Towhidul Islam
data.description: Towhidul was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight on November 5, 2015. He had been arrested prior to the gunfight. When the police took him to recover arms, his accomplices arrived to rescue him, resulting in a gunfight. He was killed during this altercation.

data.name: Rashid Ahmmad
data.description: An accused in an abduction case was killed in a "gunfight" with the police on the Eidgaon-Eidgarh road at Panerphara Dhala in Sadar upazila on November 16, 2015. The deceased was identified as Rashid Ahammad. Tipped off, a team of police conducted a raid in Ramu upazila and arrested Rashid at about 3:30 am, said Sub-Inspector Minhaz, in-charge of Eidgaon Police Camp. When the law enforcers, along with Rashid, reached Panerphara Dhala on the Eid-gaon-Eidgarh road in Sadar upazila, Rashid's cohorts opened fire at the police, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. Rashid was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while his other associates managed to flee.

data.name: Shakib Uddin
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police at Kosba, Brahmanbaria.

data.name: Mahfuz Shahadat
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: On November 25, 2015, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police at Dipnagar, Gabtoli. He was a suspect in throwing a bomb during the incident of attacking Hossaini Dalan in Old Dhaka.

data.name: Ramjan Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Ramjan was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight on November 29, 2015. He had been arrested prior to the gunfight. When the police took him to recover weapons, his accomplices arrived to rescue him, resulting in a gunfight. Unfortunately, he was killed during the exchange of gunfire.

data.name: Md. Monir Khalifa
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Monir Khalifa, 30, who led a gang named after himself, was among two alleged robbers killed in a shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) in the Sundarbans. Acting on a tip-off that some robbers were near the Urubunia canal in the Chandpai range of the Sundarbans East Division, a team of the elite force raided the area around 7:30 am, said Lt Col Faridul Alam, commanding officer of Rab-8. Sensing the presence of the Rab members, the criminals fired at them. The elite force then retaliated, sparking a gunfight between the robbers and Rab. After the 45-minute battle, the elite force members found Monir and Nur Islam dead on the spot, said the Rab official.

data.name: Nur Islam Sardar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nur Islam Sardar, also known as Bhola, an alleged robber, was killed along with an associate in a gunfight with RAB-8 at Urubariar Khal, Chandpai range, Purba Sundarbans.

data.name: Covered van driver
data.description: Members of the Armed Police Battalion received information that certain individuals were smuggling arms and illegal goods using a covered van. Subsequently, the APBn personnel pursued the van. At one point, they blocked the road with a microbus and motorcycle, signaling for the van to halt. However, the van failed to comply. In self-defense, the APBn officers fired at the van, resulting in the death of the van's driver.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The man was allegedly killed in a gunfight by the police while he and his accomplices were preparing for a robbery.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged gunfight between the police and robbers at East Gunagori under Banshkhali in Chittagong on December 7, 2015. The body was sent to Chittagong Medical College Hospital morgue for an autopsy. The OC of Banshkhali police station said that a gang of armed robbers entered the house of Belal Master around 1:30 am. As the family members tried to resist, the robbers opened fire on them and hacked them with sharp weapons, leaving four of them injured. On receiving information, the police rushed to the spot and encircled the house of one Belal around 1:45 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight that left one of the robbers bullet-hit.

data.name: Abu Sayeed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On December 14, 2015, Abu Sayeed, an alleged robber, was killed in a gunfight with the police in Tala Upazila, Satkhira.

data.name: Mohammad Osman Goni
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Mohammad Osman Goni was allegedly shot dead by the police. At around 2:30 pm on December 15, 2015, he was having his lunch at his house. In the meantime, a police team in plainclothes arrived there in a black microbus. Upon receiving the news about the police, Osman attempted to escape through the back door of the house. The police chased him and shot him in the waist. He died on the spot.

data.name: Bashir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Rashid, an alleged robber, was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and the police at Dharanti village in Sarail upazila on December 6, 2015. Upon receiving information that a gang of 10-12 robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the village, a police team conducted a raid there around 3:00 am, said Ali Arshad, OC of Sarail Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police team, the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Rashid was shot and died on the spot, while the rest of the gang managed to escape. The police recovered Rashid's body and sent it to the Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Sagir Bhandari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: On December 23, 2015, the ringleader of a robber gang in Sundarbans East Zone was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Panighat area under Sarankhola upazila of the district. Upon receiving information that members of 'Nayan Bahini' had gathered at Panighat, the RAB, in association with the DB police, took positions in the area around 7:30 am, said Harun-or-Rashid, Assistant Director of RAB-6. Sensing the presence of the RAB men, the gang opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. After 15 minutes of gunfight, the gang members retreated, said Harun, who is also a senior assistant police superintendent. Later, RAB members found Sagir, who had been hit by a bullet, in the area. He was rushed to Sarankhola Upazila Health Complex, where the on-duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Omar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Three suspected activists of the Purba Banglar Communist Party were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Omarpur in Tangail on December 24, 2015. Additional Superintendent of Police Mohiuddin Faruki, commander of Crime Prevention Company 3 of RAB-12, said a team of the battalion conducted a raid at Omarpur around 4:00 am to arrest the PBCP men as they gathered there for a meeting. Sensing their presence, the PBCP men opened fire on RAB personnel, prompting them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the extremists retreated from the spot, leaving three of their associates - Omar, Kashem, and Saddam - wounded by bullets. They were taken to Tangail Medical College Hospital where physicians declared them dead.

JMB suspects hiding in the house hurled homemade bombs, injuring a RAB-1 member, as claimed by RAB Deputy Director Major Maksudul Alam. The RAB-1 team retaliated with gunfire and cordoned off the area.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Suspected robber Abul Kashem, also known as Akash, along with an associate, was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with the forces of RAB-08 on December 28, 2015.

data.name: Sheikh Farid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The suspected robber, Sheikh Farid alias Maijha, along with an associate, was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with the forces of RAB-08 on December 28, 2015.

data.name: Mohammad Mintu
data.description: In the Khulna Sadar Police Station area, allegations have arisen that Mintu, the alleged leader of an inter-district motorcycle theft ring, was beaten to death by the police. The police from Sadar Police Station had arrested him earlier in the night at around 8 pm in front of the Khulna shopping complex in the city. According to the police statement, he fell ill after being mob-beaten at the time of his arrest. On Monday morning, around 8 am, a duty-bound doctor at Khulna Medical College Hospital declared him dead. However, the deceased's family alleges that Mintu was beaten to death by the police inside the police station. They have stated that they are afraid to take legal action due to fear of police intimidation.

data.name: Ripon Hossain Gazi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description:
Ripon’s maternal Uncle, Habibur Rahman Gazi, alleged that on November 30, 2016, plainclothes men introducing themselves as members of the police picked up Ripon from Choto Achra intersection. He alleged that the police shot Ripon to death. However, the OC of Kotwali Police Station stated that at around 1:00 am on December 1, 2016, two groups of miscreants were exchanging fire at Panchbariya in the Jessore-Magura Highway. When the police arrived, the miscreants had already left. The police found the bullet-wounded body of Ripon Hossain Gazi, aged 28. 

The key accused in the attack on an Ansar man in Benapole two weeks ago was killed in a "gunfight" between two criminal gangs early yesterday, according to the police. The "gunfight" occurred hours after the death of the Ansar member, who was fatally injured in the attack at Benapole land port while trying to foil an attempted theft. For the latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel. The man killed in the gunfight was Ripon Hossain, 30, from Chotoachra village in Jessore's Benapole. Ilias Hossain, the officer-in-charge of Jessore Kotwali Police Station, said Ripon suffered bullet injuries when two criminal gangs were exchanging fire near a school in Panchbaria in Jessore Sadar upazila around 1:30 am yesterday. Upon receiving information, the police went to the scene and took Ripon to Jessore Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, according to the police official. The OC said Ripon was accused in several cases and was the main accused in the case filed in connection with the attack on the Ansar man, Firoz Hasan, 31. Feroz, from Baskshipur village in Jhenidah's Shailakupa, died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital around 5:00 pm on Wednesday. Witnesses said that on the night of November 15, some criminals, led by Ripon, attacked Feroz at the land port while he was on duty. They beat him up with iron rods and hammers. According to sources at the port, Feroz caught two accomplices of Ripon stealing imported goods from the port. The two were later

data.name: Dulal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with members of RAB at Jhaul, Kamarkhand, Sirajganj on December 1, 2016. DAILY SUN: A robber has been killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Jhaoeel foot-over bridge area of the district's Kamarkhando upazila on Wednesday night. The deceased, Dulal Hossain, 42, son of Afzal Hossain, was from Sameshpur village in the district's Belkuchi upazila. ASP Hasibur Rahman Hasib Alam, RAB 12 camp commander, said that on a tip-off, a team of Rab conducted a raid in the Jayl area near the western part of Bangabandhu bridge around 11:00 pm while a gang of robbers was preparing for a robbery. Sensing the presence of the elite force members, the robbers opened fire on them and the law enforcers also retaliated with gunfire, triggering a gunfight. After the gunfight, the RAB members arrested Dulal, who had been shot. However, the other robbers fled the scene immediately. Later, Dulal was rushed to the local hospital where the on-duty doctors declared him dead. Dulal was wanted in more than 10 cases, including murder and rape cases, said the RAB official. The elite force members recovered a pistol, a shotgun, seven rounds of bullets, and a machete from the scene. OBSERVER: 'Robber' killed in 'gunfight'. SIRAJGANJ, Dec 1: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) at Jhaoil in Kamarkhanda upazila on Wednesday night. The deceased was identified as Dulal Hossain, 42, son of Afzal Hossain, a resident of Sameshpur village in Belkuchi upazila. Assistant Superintendent of Police Hasibul Alom, commander of Sirajganj RAB-12, said that on secret information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery, a team of the elite force conducted a raid in the area around 9:30 pm. UNB

data.name: Abdullah Noman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Two alleged operatives of the banned militant outfit JMB - Abdullah, also known as Noman, and Kamal, also known as Hiran - were killed in an "encounter" with law enforcers in the capital's Hazaribagh. Hiran was accused in a case filed over the killing of a police constable in an attack on a checkpoint in Ashulia in November last year, said Sanwar Hossain, Additional Deputy Commissioner (DB) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. He said a team of DB police raided a house in Kamrangirchar and arrested three militants around 10:30 pm. Acting on the information provided by the arrestees, DB police conducted a drive near ZH Sikder Women's Medical College at around 11:30 pm. As they were carrying out a search, militants on two motorbikes threw handmade grenades at the DB team, prompting the DB to open fire. Two of the militants were wounded, and two more fled the scene on a bike. The injured were taken to Dhaka Medical Hospital where doctors pronounced them dead around 12:45 am.

data.name: Shahabul Islam
data.description: Mohammad Ali, the brother of Shahabul Islam, recounted that on January 16, 2016, at around 1:30 am, SI Abul Kalam arrested Shahabul from his house and beat him up on the spot. Later, he was assaulted again at the bus station at the Choykuro intersection. At one point, SI Abul Kalam demanded and took 9,000 tk from Mohammad Ali in exchange for not further torturing his brother. Shahabul was subsequently taken to Satkhira Police Station and later to court, where he was granted one day's remand. Afterwards, he was sent to jail. Tragically, Shahabul died in Dhaka Medical College Hospital on February 24, 2016.

data.name: Rofiqul Islam
data.description: Members of Border Guard Bangladesh opened fire on a group of cattle traders along the Jaluli border in Maheshpur upazila during a clash on January 30, 2016. Local people informed that members of BGB searched for a cattle trader. However, they started beating up the villagers who were sitting at the crossing of the road in Matila village after not finding the cattle trader. On the other hand, in protest, the villagers went to the BGB camp. At that time, BGB members opened fire from inside the camp. As a result, Rofiqul Islam died on the spot. Another man, Feroz Hossain, 28, succumbed to his wounds at Jhenidah Upazila Health Complex later.

data.name: Feroz Hossain
data.description: On January 30, 2016, members of Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) opened fire on a group of cattle traders during a clash along the Jaluli border in Maheshpur upazila. Local people reported that the BGB members were searching for a cattle trader, but instead began beating up villagers who were sitting at the crossing of the road in Matila village. In response, the villagers protested and went to the BGB camp. It was during this time that BGB members opened fire from inside the camp. Tragically, Rofiqul Islam was killed instantly, and Feroz Hossain, 28, later succumbed to his wounds at Jhenidah Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Moshiur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Moshiur Rahman was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight at Sundarbans. The Daily Star reported that an alleged robber, who was said to be the second-in-command of a notorious gang, was killed in what Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) described as a gunfight at Sundarbans in Bagerhat this morning. Acting on a tip-off, a patrol team of the elite force cracked down in Chara Putiar Khal in Chandpai range around 8:30 am, according to Lt Col Faridul Alam, commanding officer of RAB-8. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the gang opened fire. RAB retaliated by opening fire. After the battle subsided, Moshiur's body was found lying on the spot. Eleven local and foreign firearms, including 450 rounds of ammunition and explosives, were recovered from the scene. The deceased was identified as Moshiur, 35, who was said to be a top leader of the infamous Majnu Bahini, as reported by our Bagerhat correspondent quoting the police.

data.name: Motahar Hossain
data.description: The prime accused in the Keraniganj school boy Mohammad Abdullah murder case was killed in a gunfight with RAB in the Chitakhola area of South Keraniganj. RAB said that a patrol team of the battalion challenged some motor bikers in Chitakhola at around 4:00 am. When challenged, the bikers opened fire on the battalion men, triggering a gunfight. One of the offenders was caught in the line of fire and was injured by a bullet. RAB members apprehended the injured man and sent him to Mitford Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. According to The Daily Star, the prime accused in a case filed for abducting and killing an 11-year-old boy in Dakshin Keraniganj of Dhaka was killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion early today. Victim Motahar was the mastermind behind the abduction and murder of Abdullah, Jahangir Hossain Matabbar, commanding officer of Rab-10, told The Daily Star today. According to the Rab official, a patrol team of Rab-10 signaled four individuals on two speeding motorcycles to stop at Chitakholay around 4:00 am. Sensing danger, the motorcycle riders opened fire on the elite force members, prompting them to retaliate, Matabbar said. Of the two motorcycles, one managed to flee while the other skidded off the road as one of the riders was hit by bullets during the "gunfight". Later, the other passengers of the second motorcycle ran away. The elite force members took the bullet-hit victim to Mitford Hospital in Dhaka, where doctors declared him dead, he added. Rab members confirmed Motahar's identity from the national ID card and ATM card recovered from his pocket, the commanding officer said. Motahar and his wife went into hiding after the police had found the body of Abdullah, son of Badal Hossain, an expatriate living in Kuwait, and Rina Begum inside a plastic barrel on the first floor of a two-story building. The building, owned by Rina's maternal uncle Motahar, is located within 50 feet of the boy's house at Mugarchar area under Keraniganj Model Police Station. Family sources said the child's family paid Tk 2 lakh as ransom against a Tk 5.5 lakh demanded by the captors. Law enforcers later arrested three

data.name: Akam Uddin Hia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two alleged outlaws were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kushtia. The deceased individuals, Akam Uddin Hia and Liakat Ali, were top cadres of the banned Gana Mukti Fouz, according to RAB. Akam was involved in four cases, including two murder cases, while Liakat was involved in eight cases, including three murder cases. Zoynal Abedin, additional superintendent of police in Kushtia, stated that Akam was accused in four cases, including two murder cases, and Liakat was accused in eight cases, including three murder cases. RAB-12 commanding officer Major Mosaddek Ibne Mujib said that acting on a tip-off, a team of the elite force raided the Swastipur area around 3:00 am, where a secret meeting of the party was taking place. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on the RAB members, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight, the RAB official said. At one point, Akam and Liakat were hit by bullets. The two were taken to Kushtia General Hospital, where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Anisur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Anisur, a Sramik Dal leader, was killed on November 2, 2016. His brother, Azizur Rahman, claimed that the police picked up Anisur on October 30 and took him to the DB office. The police demanded a Tk 10 lakh bribe for his release, but Anisur was killed as they couldn't pay the money. The police claimed that he was killed in a reported gunfight between two groups of criminals at Begaritala in Manirampur upazila. According to the Daily Observer, a Sramik Dal leader was killed in a reported gunfight between two groups of criminals at Begaritala in Manirampur upazila early Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Anisur Rahman, 38, an activist of Sramik Dal and the son of Anwar Hossain of Lauri village in the upazila. Manirampur Police Station OC Biplab Kumar Nath said two groups of criminals, one led by Mizan-Mahfuz and another by Anisur, exchanged gunfire over establishing supremacy in the area on Tuesday night. Upon receiving information, the police rushed to the spot and recovered Anisur's blood-stained body. Later, he was taken to Jessore General Hospital where doctors declared him dead around 2 am. Anisur was wanted in Krishak League leader Kamal and Jubo League activist Shaheen murder cases, said the OC. The police also recovered one pipe gun and two rounds of bullets from the spot. However, Anisur's brother, Azizur Rahman, claimed that the police picked up his brother on October 30 and took him to the DB office. He said the police demanded a Tk 10 lakh bribe for his release, but they couldn't pay the money.

data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and the police in Baddapara. Ali Arshad, OC of Sarail Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the area, a police team conducted a drive there at around 4:10 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire and hurled brick chips at them, forcing the law enforcers to return fire, triggering the gunfight, the police official said. At one stage, Ratan was caught in the line of fire, while his other associates managed to flee. Ratan was admitted to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital where he later died.

data.name: Jewel Hasan
data.description: A suspected criminal, Jewel Hasan, 25, was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Tongi upazila of Gazipur early today. Rab-1 members conducted a raid in the Tongi river port area around 3:30 am after receiving information that criminals were preparing to commit a crime there, Commander Mufti Mahmud Khan, director of Rab Legal and Media wing, told Prothom Alo. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the alleged criminals opened fire on the team, triggering a "gunfight". Jewel was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, he added.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Mahbub
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On February 16, 2016, Anwar Hossain Mahbub, Joint Secretary of Dhaka South City Corporation's 23rd numbered ward unit BNP, who was detained in jail, died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. His relatives claimed that Anwar was severely tortured by the police during remand after being arrested under a politically motivated case on January 15, 2016. His younger brother, Maksud, said that Anwar Hossain Mahbub did not have any physical problems or illnesses. His brother was severely beaten by the police on the street while they were taking him to the police station after arresting Anwar. Hundreds of people witnessed this incident. Later, he was tortured in custody after being taken into remand.

data.name: Mohammad Masuk
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion, as the special force claimed to have foiled a robbery attempt at a Sonali Bank branch in Dhamrai, Dhaka on February 19, 2016. Mohammad Masuk was a motorcycle mechanic in the capital's Dholaikhal area and lived with his family in Bangshal, according to his family members.

data.name: Chantu Mia
data.description: Chantu Mia, a murder accused, was killed in a gunfight with the police in Moheshpur, Jhenaidah on February 23, 2016. He was accused of killing Akimul from Samanta village, according to the police. Aminul Islam Biplab, the officer-in-charge of Moheshpur police, said they had arrested Chantu in Kushtia on February 23, 2016. According to his statement, the police launched a drive to recover arms and ammunition on the same day. Around 3:30 am, when they approached the Balidapara area, Chantu's associates opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. During the gunfight, Chantu's cohorts retreated from the spot, and Chantu, who had been hit by a bullet, was found dead.

data.name: Bachchu Miah
data.description: An accused in the Habiganj four-child murder case was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the district's Chunarughat upazila on February 25, 2016, eight days after law enforcers allegedly picked him up. The deceased, Bachchu Mia, was a CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver who had been traceless since being "detained by plainclothes officials" on February 17, according to his family members. The family has been making this allegation since the day after his "detention". Bachchu was one of the accused in the case filed with Bahubal Police Station in connection with the killing of the four schoolboys. Kazi Moniruzzaman, Company Commander of RAB-9, claimed that they had detained Shaheed, one of the accomplices of Bacchu. A team of the elite force conducted a drive in Dawargachh area to arrest Bacchu as Shaheed informed them that he was preparing to flee to India. Sensing the presence of RAB members, Bachchu along with his accomplices "opened fire on them". The RAB team fired back, triggering the "gunfight", the official said. Later, the bullet-hit body of Bachchu was found and sent to Chunarughat Upazila Health Complex for autopsy. But the family members turned down the RAB version. "My husband never touched a gun, let alone operate it. How come he engaged in a gunfight?" said Bachchu's wife Rina Akther in a tearful voice. She alleged that two men in plainclothes on the afternoon of February 17 came to their house at Sundrateki village of the district looking for her husband. "After talking to them outside the house, my husband came back and told me that the police asked him to meet them for some reasons. He did not tell me the reasons and went away," After a while, she called her husband on his mobile phone, but he was not picking it up. At one stage, she found the phone switched off, Rina said. Contacted repeatedly, the police could not provide any information on him, she added. Bachchu's mother Elai Bibi alleged that it was the RAB that picked up her son and killed him. "My son was not involved in the killings. Even if he had been involved in the murders, the court was there to

data.name: Golam Mawla Mridha
data.description: An alleged Yaba trader was killed in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in Patuakhali town on February 29, 2016. The deceased was identified as Golam Mawla Mridha, son of Nurul Haque Mridha of Kalikapur area in the town. He was accused in a number of cases, including an arms case, according to KM Tariqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Patuakhali Police Station. The "shootout" took place in the Hatalia area of Kaliakpur village at 4:00 am. After the "gunfight," police recovered the bullet-hit body of Mawla and sent it to Patuakhali General Hospital morgue for autopsy, the police official said. The Daily Star reported that an alleged Yaba trader was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Patuakhali town early today. The deceased was identified as Golam Mawla Mridha, 35, son of Nurul Haque Mridha of Kalikapur in the town. He was accused in a number of cases, including an arms case, said KM Tariqul Islam, officer-in-charge of Patuakhali Police Station. The "shootout" took place in the Hatalia area of Kaliakpur village at 4:00 am, according to our Patuakhali correspondent. After the "gunfight," police recovered the bullet-hit body of Mawla and sent it to Patuakhali General Hospital morgue for autopsy, the police official said. The elite force members recovered two firearms, some bullets, and more than 600 pieces of Yaba, according to a text message sent from Rab-8 Patuakhali camp. After hearing the news of the death, local businessmen distributed sweets among the townspeople. Mawla used to collect toll from businessmen of Hatalia Badhghat bazaar, according to local trader Ruhul Amin. He was also constructing a market occupying a portion of Hatalia canal, he added.

data.name: Al Amin Jony
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Al Amin Jony was picked up from his house on December 29, 2015 and killed during a 'gunfight' with RAB in the capital's Mirpur area on January 3, 2016. Al Amin Jony, a candidate for the position of secretary in the Rupnagar JCD unit, was 30 years old and wanted in at least 13 cases, including murder and extortion. These cases were mostly filed with Pallabi police station, although the family claimed that most of them were politically motivated. The family also alleged that Al Amin was taken from their house in the early hours of December 29, 2015, with their door being broken and the doors of their neighbors in the six-story building in Rupnagor area being locked. They further alleged that nearly a dozen people, introducing themselves as 'men from the administration', broke open the door, tied up his mother and wife, and took him away blindfolded.

data.name: Zahirul Islam
data.description: Two individuals accused in a double murder case were killed, and another was injured in a "gunfight" with the police at Nagoriakandi in the Narsingdi municipality area on March 3, 2016. The deceased were Zahirul Islam, 25, from Nagoriakandi, and Md Rakib, 24, from Tongi in Gazipur. The Officer-in-Charge of Narsingdi Sadar Police, Mostafa Hossain, stated that the "gunfight" occurred at around 4:00 am when the police conducted a raid to apprehend the murder suspects. During the "gunfight," Zahirul, Rakib, and Hossain Ali were injured, according to the OC. They were taken to Narsingdi General Hospital, where the on-duty doctors pronounced Zahirul dead and referred Rakib and Hossain to Dhaka Medical College and Hospital, the police reported. Rakib died on the way to DMCH, while Hossain was admitted to DMCH.

data.name: Aminul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Aminul Islam was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police in the Kasundi area of Magura. He was reportedly the leader of an inter-district robber gang. The gunfight took place in the Kushundi Boro Bridge area of Magura Sadar upazila early on Monday. The deceased has been identified as Aminul Islam, also known as Litan Hossain Molla, aged 33. He was the son of Idris Molla and a resident of Azampur area in the upazila. He was accused in three robbery cases filed with Magura Sadar Police Station and Kushtia Sadar Police Station. Sudarshan Kumar Roy, the officer-in-charge of Magura Sadar Police Station, stated that a police team conducted a raid in the area. When the robbers realized the presence of the police, they opened fire at the law enforcement officers. In response, the police retaliated, resulting in a gunfight around 1 am. Aminul sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight and was immediately taken to Magura Sadar Health Complex. However, doctors declared him dead upon arrival. Four policemen were also injured during the incident, according to the OC. The police recovered a 9-mm pistol, one magazine, five rounds of bullets, and two machetes from the scene.

data.name: Pias
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected military wing commander of the banned militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh was killed in a 'gunfight' with the Detective Branch of Police in the capital's Khilgaon on March 8, 2016. Pias was the JMB's military wing chief in the Dhaka region, as claimed by the DB. DB Deputy Commissioner of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, Mashrukur Rahman Khaled, said that Pias opened fire at the DB personnel when they conducted a drive at the rail tracks near Khidmah Hospital in Khilgaon at around 3:30 am on March 8, 2016. In retaliation, the police fired back, leaving Pias injured. He was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jasim Molla
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Jashim Molla, 38, an alleged robber, died at Dhaka Pongu Hospital after being shot by the police in Sudkkhira of Singair Upazila, Manikganj. According to Syeduzzaman, the officer in charge (OC) of Singair Police Station, Jashim was injured during a gunfight with the police on March 8. The confrontation occurred as he was about to commit robbery on a property owned by Mazakat Company.

data.name: Monir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Four suspected robbers from the notorious Nayan Bahini of the Sundarbans, including Monir, were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB-08 and Coastguard forces at 6:30 am on March 10, 2016, in the Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of the Sharankhola range, under the east wing of the Sundarbans forest division.

data.name: Enam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Four suspected robbers from the notorious Nayan Bahini of the Sundarbans, including Enam, were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB-08 and Coastguard forces at 6:30 am on March 10, 2016, in the Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of the Sharankhola range, under the east wing of the Sundarbans forest division.

data.name: Obaidur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Shalikha upazila of Magura on March 17, 2016. The deceased is Obaidur Rahman of Hatbaria village in the upazila. According to the police, Obaidur was accused in four robbery cases filed with different police stations in Magura and Jessore. He was the chief of an inter-district robber gang. Abu Jihad Fakhrul Alam Khan, OC of Shalikha Police Station, said that around eight to ten robbers blocked the Jessore-Magura highway near Ramkantopur bridge by placing logs to commit a robbery. As soon as the police reached the spot, the criminal opened fire on them. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. After the gun battle, the police found Obaidur lying on the spot, while others fled. He was rushed to Shalikha Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Delu
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight with the police in Tongi. According to The Daily Star, an alleged criminal named Delwar Hossain, also known as Delu, was killed in a shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Tongi, Gazipur, early yesterday. Delwar, 36, was from Arichpur in Tongi. Acting on a tip-off that some criminals had gathered near the Tongi Noubandor area to share money they had collected through drug trading and extortion, a RAB team went to the scene around 2:45 am, said Nazmul Hasan Razib, the operation officer of RAB-1. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the gang opened fire on them. The RAB team retaliated with gunshots, resulting in a gunfight. The criminals eventually fled, but Delwar, who was wounded, was found lying at the scene. He was declared dead after being taken to Tongi General Hospital, according to the RAB official. The RAB claimed to have recovered a pistol, two bullets, a magazine, 196 yaba tablets, and Tk 10,000 in cash from the scene. Two RAB members were injured during the gun battle. They received primary treatment, as claimed by the RAB official. Delwar's body was sent to the morgue of Gazipur Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital for an autopsy. Firoz Talukder, the officer-in-charge of Tongi Police Station, stated that Delwar was accused in at least 10 cases, including murder, at the police station, as reported by our Gazipur correspondent. However, Delwar's wife, Mahmuda Khatun, told reporters that her husband was a jhut (garment waste) trader. She claimed that she was not aware of her husband's involvement in extortion or yaba trade.

data.name: Mohammad Mostafa
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On January 4, 2016, Mostafa was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB at Magurata under Tangail Sadar upazila. Prothom Alo reported that an alleged ringleader of a robber gang was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Enayetpur area in Tangail early Monday. The deceased was identified as Mostafa, a ringleader of a robber gang in the district and accused in several cases, including those involving robbery. Upon receiving information about a robbery attack on the house of local resident Arjun Kumar, a patrol team of the elite force surrounded the house around 3.30 am, according to additional SP Mahiuddin Farooqi, commander of RAB-12. Sensing the presence of the elite force members, the robbers opened fire at them and hurled two hand bombs towards them, leaving two RAB men injured and prompting them to fire back, resulting in a gunfight. Mostafa was killed on the spot during the gunfight. The law enforcers also detained 10 robbers along with one foreign pistol, one magazine, three firearms, four locally made sharp weapons, and various robbery equipment and goods, including cash, taka, and gold ornaments. The injured RAB members are Lance Corporal Zia and Constable Najmul. They were admitted to Tangail Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Babul Matubbar
data.description: On February 3, 2016, at around 9:30 pm, a patrol team from Shah Ali Police Station in Dhaka, along with their informant Delwar, went to the Gudaraghat area and demanded extortion from a tea stall owner named Babul Matubbar. As Babul Matubbar did not give them money, the police hit the kerosene stove with a stick, and the police informant Delwar pushed Babul onto the stove, causing him to catch fire. The police then left the scene, leaving Babul in a serious condition. Soon after the incident, Babul's relatives took him to the burn unit of Dhaka Medical College Hospital. On February 4, Babul Matubbar died in the hospital. Sub-Inspectors Mominur Rahman Khan, Sreedham Chandra Hawlader, Niazuddin Molla, Assistant Sub-Inspector Debendra Nath, and Constable Jasimuddin were temporarily suspended due to this incident. An inquiry committee was set up to investigate this incident. On February 7, 2016, the inquiry committee submitted its report to the Dhaka Metropolitan Police Commissioner. In the inquiry report, four police personnel from Shah Ali Police Station were recommended to receive departmental punishment. However, the committee did not mention extortion in the report. Babul Matubbar was accused of being a drug peddler, and the police informant Delwar and his five associates were accused of causing his death.

data.name: Anowarul Islam
data.description: Bangladesh police killed four protesters on April 4, 2016. They were among hundreds of farmers protesting against the acquisition of their agricultural lands without consent or adequate compensation for the purpose of establishing a coal-fired power plant at Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong District. The victims have been identified as Anowarul Islam, also known as Angur (60), his brother Mortuza Ali (50), Mortuza's son-in-law Zager Ahmed (35), and Zaker Hossain (50). According to the villagers, around 30 people, including women and children, suffered injuries in the police shooting spree. The police have also arrested the bullet-riddled victims being treated in hospitals, as well as relatives of the deceased victims.
data.published: The Asian Human Rights Commission on Apr 5, 2016

data.name: Fazlu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged members of an outlawed group were killed in a gunfight with members of RAB at Jugni Haat in Tangail on April 7, 2016. The deceased are identified as Fazlu and his associate Uzzal. Locals said that a robbery had taken place in the area a few days ago. Upon receiving information that a gang of criminals was preparing to commit another robbery in the area, a RAB team raided the village around 1:00 am, according to Mohiuddin Faruqe, Rab-12 Company Commander in Tangail. Sensing the presence of the RAB members, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the RAB members to retaliate. According to the Daily Sun, two members of the outlawed party were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion members at Jugnihat in Sadar upazila early Thursday. The deceased were identified as Fazlu Driver and Uzzal, members of the banned Pubo Banglar Communist Party. Further details about them were not available. Acting on a tip-off that a group of outlaws were holding a meeting at Jugnihat, an elite force team conducted a raid there around 1am, said commander of Rab-12 Tangail unit, additional police superintendent Mohiuddin Faruki. However, the outlawed party members opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. Fazlu and Uzzal were found dead after the gun battle, which also left two Rab members injured, he said. The Rab team also recovered a revolver and a pistol from the scene.

data.name: Kamrul Hasan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Mirsarai upazila of Chittagong on April 18, 2016. The deceased are Kamrul Hasan of West Shewrapara in the capital and Yakub Ali of Mothbaria upazila in Pirojpur. The deceased were involved in the robbery of Shamim Jewellery shop in Baroiarhat Bazar of the upazila on February 26, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmed, commanding officer of Rab-7. The Daily Star reported that Yakub Ali and Kamrul Hasan were involved in the robbery at Shamim Jewellers shop in Baroiarhat Bazar in the upazila on February 26, according to Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmed, commanding (CO) officer of Rab-7. The duo was seen looting jewellery from the shop in the CCTV footage collected after the robbery, Lt Col Miftah said. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Rab-7 conducted a raid at Muhuri Project area under Jorarganj Police Station around 4:00 am when a group of "robbers" were preparing to commit robbery at the shop there, the Rab official said. Sensing the Rab men's presence, the gang opened fire on the elite force. Then, the law enforcers retaliated with gunfire, triggering the "gunfight," he claimed. The bodies of Yakub and Kamrul were found on the spot after the gunfight, he added. The elite force members also recovered eight firearms, bullets, and sharp weapons from the spot.
