data.name: Abdul Kadir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed and four policemen were injured in a "gunfight" in Suhilpur area of the Brahmanbaria Sadar Upazila on April 26, 2016. The deceased was identified by New Age as Abdul Kadir, 35, son of Nowab Mia from the village of Kalikacho in Sarail Upazila. Brahmanbaria Sadar Model Police Station OC Mainur Rahman said that acting on a tip-off, a patrol team of the police went to the area while the robbers were preparing to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of the police, the miscreants started firing at them and in retaliation, the police also opened fire on the miscreants. Abdul Kadir, an accused in six robbery cases, died on the spot during the gunfight.

data.name: Amirul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional leader of the outlawed party Ganobahini was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in the Housing Mondal Filing Station area of Kushtia town on April 27, 2016. The deceased was identified as Amirul Islam, son of Jaber, a resident of Sonaidanga village under the Islamic University police station. Four policemen were injured during the gunfight. According to the Daily Sun, a regional leader of the outlawed party Ganobahini was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in the Housing Mondal Filing Station area of the district town early Wednesday. The deceased was identified as Amirul Islam, son of Jaber, a resident of Sonaidanga village under the Islamic University police station. Sabbirul Islam, officer-in-charge of Kushtia Detective Branch (DB) of police, said that acting on secret information that a gang of outlawed party members was preparing to commit robbery on the Kushtia-Rajbari road by placing logs in the area, a team of police conducted a raid at 2:15 am. Sensing the presence of the police, Amirul, along with his accomplices, opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to fire back, resulting in a gunfight. At one point, Amirul was caught in the line of fire and injured, while his accomplices managed to flee the scene. Later, the police arrested Amirul and rushed him to Kushtia General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. Four policemen were injured during the gunfight. The police recovered four firearms, some sharp weapons, and several rounds of bullets from the scene. Amirul was wanted in several cases, including murder and kidnapping, added the OC.

data.name: Monir Khan
data.description: Drug peddler killed in gunfight: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Gazipur Sadar upazila on Tuesday night. The deceased is Monir Khan, 35, son of Kabir Khan of Haldoba village under the upazila. For all the latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided Haldoba around 10:45 pm and detained Monir along with 100 yaba tablets, said Harun-ur-Rashid, a sub-inspector of Joydebpur police. Later, the police took Monir to another place near the third gate of Rajendrapur National Park to arrest his accomplices. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on the police. The police then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". Monir was shot dead while trying to flee from police custody, said the SI. The body was sent to Gazipur Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital morgue for an autopsy. Monir stood accused in 27 cases, including extortion and drug dealing, with Joydebpur Police Station and Gazipur court, according to the police. According to the rights body Ain o Salish Kendra, 146 people were killed in such "gunfight" or "shootout" last year with different forces.

data.name: Alam Khan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged gang leader of robbers was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and RAB in the Chandpai range of the Sundarbans at East Zone on May 6, 2016.

data.name: Din Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A person named Din Islam has died in police custody in Narsingdi, a claim his family has made, but police say he died during a mob beating while attempting to escape arrest. Din Islam, the son of Abdur Rahman from West Bhelanagar in Narsingdi city, was allegedly arrested and tortured to death by the police. The incident began with the arrest of a man named Ismail Mia for robbery, who implicated Din Islam. A team from the district Detective Branch (DB) went to Din's house to arrest him, but he tried to flee and was injured by local residents. He later died at Narsingdi Sadar Hospital. Din's mother, Sabiya Begum, claimed that DB police took her son at six in the morning and demanded five lakh Taka. The Sub-Inspector of the district DB police, Abdul Gaffar, denied the money demand allegation and stated that Din tried to escape when they attempted to arrest him, leading to his injury by local residents and subsequent death at the hospital.

data.name: Mohobbat Kha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mohabbat Khan was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police at Shashai village, Bijoynagar upazila, Brahmanbaria on May 25, 2016. According to The Daily Star, an alleged robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in the Shashai area under Bijoynagar upazila of Brahmanbaria early yesterday. Four policemen, who sustained injuries during the 'gunfight', were admitted to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital. They are Sub-inspector Shafiqul Islam and constables Rajab Ali, Sohag Mia, and Tariqul Islam. Officer-in-Charge (OC) Ali Ashraf of Bijoynagar Police Station said a police team, acting on a tip-off, cordoned off the area on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway where a gang of armed robbers was preparing to commit a robbery around 3:30 am. Sensing the presence of the policemen, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate. Mohabbat sustained bullet injuries while his cohorts managed to flee the scene. He was taken to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital where the doctors declared him dead. Police recovered a pipe gun and some machetes from the spot. Mohabbat was wanted in a number of cases filed with different police stations in the district, the OC added. The deceased was identified as Mohabbat Khan, 29, son of the late Hanif Khan of Koyarpur village in Nasirnagar upazila of the district.

data.name: Abul Hashem
data.description: Abul Hashem was accused of a murder case. He allegedly killed his wife in demand of dowry. On May 29, 2016, police arrested him from the Gulshan area of Dhaka and then took him to Sorishabari Police Station. The next day, at around 4:30 am, he died. Police claimed that he committed suicide, whereas family members alleged that he died due to torture. The Daily Star reported that a murder case accused has died in police custody in Jamalpur's Sharishabari upazila early today, hours after he was arrested from the capital Dhaka. However, the family of the victim could not be reached immediately. Sharishabari upazila police caught Hashem from Dhaka's Gulshan area last evening, said Billal Uddin, officer-in-charge of Sharishabari Police Station. He was taken to Jamalpur around midnight. Hashem complained of chest pain after midnight. He was taken to Sharishabari Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead around 4:35 am, he added. The OC did not elaborate on how his forces went to Dhaka and captured him on a case that was filed yesterday by Mosiur Rahman, a sub-inspector of Sharishabari police. Hashem's wife died on April 14. An autopsy later revealed that she was strangled. A case was filed in this regard yesterday. Accused of murdering his wife, deceased Abul Hashem, 35, was arrested from Dhaka's Gulshan area last night, our local correspondent reports quoting police.

data.name: Salim Howlader
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Amanatganj Bazaar in the village of Baliatali, Muladi upazila in Barisal on June 1, 2016. The deceased was a resident of Safipur union in Muladi and was the leader of the so-called Salim Bahini, a robber gang. Matiur Rahman, the officer-in-charge of Muladi police station, stated that they arrested Salim on the afternoon of May 31, 2016, as he was accused in 11 cases, including 4 murder cases. The gunfight occurred when Salim's associates attacked the police and attempted to snatch Salim from them while they were going to recover weapons with the miscreant, according to the OC. Salim was shot dead during the gunfight, he added, and the body was sent to Barisal Sher-E-Bangla Medical College Hospital for post-mortem examinations.

data.name: Tariqul Islam
data.description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the joint force of the police and Border Guard Bangladesh at Panchbibi in Jaipurhat on June 2, 2016. Meanwhile, Guljan Begum, the mother of the deceased, Tariqul Islam of village Ratanpur, claimed that BGB personnel picked up her son on the night of June 1, 2016, before the news of his death reached her. She said that four BGB men picked up Tariqul around 10:00 pm while he was playing carrom in front of the house. He was released from jail after getting bail in a case and came home on June 1, 2016. Police said Tariqul was accused of more than 11 cases related to narcotics filed with different police stations, including Panchbib. Panchbibi police officer-in-charge Ashraful Islam said the joint force conducted a drive at Ratanpur in response to a tip-off that drug peddlers were smuggling narcotics through the area. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers carried out an attack on them with local weapons and opened fire. The law enforcers also retaliated, leaving Tariqul critically injured. His accomplices managed to flee.

data.name: Kausar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Lakshmipur Police Superintendent ASM Mahtabuddin said the police conducted a raid in the Borokul area of Sadar Upazila around 3:30 am to apprehend some troublemakers. Sensing the presence of the police, the miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers, initiating a gunfight. Later, the police discovered Kawser with bullet wounds in critical condition at the scene. He was quickly taken to Sadar Hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries around 4:00 am.

data.name: Tajmul Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Gangni, Meherpur on December 6, 2016. The deceased were identified as Tajmul Hossain, 25, and Mahidul Islam, 22, from the village of Manikdia, and Tuhin Hossain, 28, from the village of Bholadanga, all within Gangni upazila. According to a police officer, unidentified miscreants opened fire on a police patrol as they approached a brick kiln. The police responded by firing back. After the gunfight, the police, with the assistance of locals, searched the area and discovered three bodies with bullet wounds, he added. The police then sent the bodies to Gangni Upazila Health Complex for a post-mortem examination.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" between his associates and the police near the office of the multinational pesticide company Syngenta at Panchbaria on Jessore-Magura Road on June 8, 2016. The police could not confirm his identity. Ilias Hossain, the Officer in Charge of Kotwali Police station, said that the unidentified "robber," aged between 45 and 50, died on the spot in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and a police team while the gang was committing robbery on Jessore-Magura Road under Kotwali police station. "At around 2:40 am, when a patrol team of police reached the spot and a gunfight ensued, leaving the robber dead on the spot." The police recovered the body and took it to Jessore Medical College Hospital for post-mortem.

data.name: Kawsar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected member of the banned militant outfit, Jamaat-ul Mujahideen Bangladesh, who was allegedly involved in the attack on a Shia mosque in Bogra, was killed in a gunfight with police at Haripur of Shibganj in Bogra on June 8, 2016, police said. The deceased was identified as Kawsar, son of Amir Ali of Kamargram in Jaipurhat. Deceased Kawsar Ali, 25, was an alleged member of the banned militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB). An expert team of the Detective Branch of police and Shibganj police took position near Lohar bridge at Jamtoli village in Shibganj upazila after receiving information that some JMB men were going to carry out an attack in the area, said Senior Assistant Superintendent of Bogra police (B Circle and Media) Gaziur Rahman. Around 3:30 am, the team noticed at least three people carrying bags moving in the area suspiciously. They signaled to stop them, but the gang started firing, forcing the law enforcers to fire back. As the alleged militants managed to flee the scene, police rescued injured Kawsar and rushed him to Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College and Hospital (SZMCH) in Bogra town where doctors declared him dead. They also recovered a foreign-made pistol, one magazine, two bullets, two cartridges, five hand bombs, and three sharp weapons including a machete from his possession. Two policemen -- Abu Raihan, 24, of Shibganj Police Station, and Altaf Hossian, 26, of the Detective Branch of police – were also injured in the “gunfight”. They were undergoing treatment at the local Police Lines Hospital. Kawsar’s body was sent to SZMCH morgue for an autopsy. On November 26 last year, armed assailants stormed a Shia mosque during prayers and opened fire on people, killing the muezzin of the mosque and injuring three others. Later, police in connection with the case so far arrested seven persons, who disclosed the name of Kawsar who played the key role in the mosque attack.

data.name: Kamal Parvez
data.description: A suspected mugger was killed in a gunfight with RAB in the capital's Rampura. Abdul Karim, the operation officer of RAB-3, said that Parvez was apprehended with a gold bangle at around 3:00 pm on June 8, 2016, after he and his three accomplices had mugged a woman at Taltola in Khilgaon. A team from RAB-03 then took him to the Balurmath area to arrest his accomplices in the middle of the night. Sensing RAB's presence, the criminals opened fire. Law enforcers retaliated by firing shots, leaving Parvez injured. He was later declared dead at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. According to The Daily Star, another similar incident occurred in Rampura, where a suspected mugger was killed. The deceased, Kamal Parvez, 35, was a resident of the Uttar area, as stated by Abdul Karim, the operation officer of RAB-3. Rab reported that Parvez was apprehended with a gold bangle at around 3:00 pm on Wednesday after he and his three accomplices had mugged a woman at Taltola in Khilgaon. A team from Rab-3 then took him to the Balurmath area to arrest his accomplices in the middle of the night, according to Rab sources. Sensing Rab's presence, the criminals opened fire. Law enforcers fired shots in retaliation, leaving Parvez injured. He was declared dead at Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Tuhin Arif
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A man was shot dead in a "gunfight" between the police and his cohorts at Malancha village in Gobindaganj upazila of Gaibandha at around 2:00 am. The incident happened when a team of police went to raid Jahangir Hossain's house after receiving information that JMB men had gathered there, said Mozammel Huq, OC of Gobindaganj Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, JMB men opened fire at them. The police retaliated with gunshots. Within half an hour, members of the outlawed group fled the scene. Police later recovered a body, one detonator, and explosives from the spot, he added. Law enforcers claimed that the deceased was a JMB man but could not identify him. The OC said the house owner, Jahangir, was an active member of the JMB and is currently on the run.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: An alleged leader of a doping gang, Nazrul Islam, was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion at a checkpoint in the Prottasha bridge area under Turag Police Station at around 1:45 am, said Lt. Commander Md Shoaib, Deputy Director of RAB-1. According to The Daily Star, Nazrul Islam, an alleged leader of a doping gang, was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion at a checkpoint in the Prottasha bridge area under Turag Police Station around 1:45 am. Lt. Commander Md Shoaib, deputy director of Rab-1, informed The Daily Star that Nazrul and two others were crossing the checkpoint on a motorcycle. As Rab men signaled for them to stop, they opened fire from the running motorcycle. The Rab members fired back. Nazrul, hit by a bullet, fell off the bike, according to the Rab official. The injured was taken to Tongi General Hospital where doctors declared him dead around 2:30 am, he added. Lt. Col Tuhin Mohammd Masud, commanding officer of Rab-1, stated that Nazrul had been involved in criminal activities, including mugging and human trafficking. The Rab claimed to have recovered one pistol and two bullets from the spot.

data.name: Mozaffar Sana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged outlaw was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the district's Tala upazila early yesterday. The deceased, Mozaffar Sana, 40, of Dohar village in the upazila, was a regional commander of the banned Purba Banglar Communist Party, said the police. According to law enforcement officials, Mozaffar was accused in 18 cases, including murder and robbery, at different police stations in Satkhira and Naogaon. Additionally, 10 people were killed in incidents of "shootout" or "gunfight" following the killing of the wife of the superintendent of police on Sunday. According to a press release from Satkhira police, a team of law enforcement officers, led by Officer-in-Charge of Tala Police Station Sagir Mia, was conducting a special operation. Around 2:30 am, the police noticed a motorcycle approaching and signaled for it to stop at Chara Bat Tola. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals detonated two bombs and opened fire on them. The law enforcement officers then returned fire, resulting in the "gunfight". Mozaffar sustained bullet injuries, while two other motorcyclists managed to escape, leaving the vehicle at the scene. Mozaffar was taken to Tala Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead. The police also claimed to have recovered the motorcycle, a firearm, and three bullets from the scene. The police filed three cases in connection with this incident.

data.name: Rakib
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged "gunfight" between his accomplices and the police at Dighalia Dokkhinpara village in Lohagora upazila on June 11, 2016. The victim was identified as Rakib, the son of Mokles Hossain, a resident of Chanchai village under the upazila. The OC of Lohagora police station, Biplop Kumar Saha, said that they responded to a tip that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the vicinity. It was when a team of police launched a raid there at around 2:30 am. As the robbers sensed the presence of the police, they opened fire, prompting the police to retaliate. A gunfight then broke out, which left Rakib injured with bullet wounds. He was rushed to Lohagora upazila health complex, where doctors declared him dead. The other members of the gang managed to escape from the scene.

data.name: Sohel Rana
data.description: Two people allegedly involved in the killing of AK Azad, a newly elected Union Parishad chairman, were killed in a "shootout" with the police in Joypurhat on June 14, 2016. The deceased are Sohel Rana, son of Nurul Islam from Sawalpara, and Munir Hossain, son of Lutfur Rahman from Kuchkuri village under Joypurhat Sadar upazila. The "gunfight", which took place at around 4:00 am, also left three law enforcers injured, according to the police. Mollah Nazrul Islam, Superintendent of Police of Joypurhat, stated that upon receiving information that criminals had gathered in Gopalpur to attack the house of the late AK Azad, law enforcers raided the village. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire on them and also attacked them with sticks and sharp weapons. The law enforcers retaliated with gunfire, resulting in the deaths of the two individuals on the spot, as claimed by the district police. The bodies were sent to Joypurhat General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Rubel Hossain
data.description: A youth accused of killing a police officer was killed in a "gunfight" after his arrest on June 15, 2016, at Pakshey Natunpara under Ishwardi upazila. The deceased, identified as Rubel Hossain, son of Idris Ali of village Diar Baghoil, was the prime suspect in the killing of Assistant Town Sub-Inspector (ASI) Sujaul Islam. Assistant Town Sub-Inspector Md Sujaul Islam of Pakshey police camp was killed in a turmeric field near the Pakshey Rail Station area on October 4, 2015, when he was on duty in the area. The body was recovered from the spot on October 5, and a case was filed with the incident.

data.name: Jibon Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a shootout between his accomplices and the police on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway near Bariura Bridge at Sarail in Brahmanbaria on June 15, 2016. A police team conducted a raid in the area around 2:00 am, said Rupak Kumar Saha, OC of Sarail Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. Jibon Mia, 32, son of Mahram Ali of Shahbazpur village, was caught in the line of fire while others managed to flee. The police took the injured Jibon to Sarail Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In an incident at Kamalpur, a robbery suspect was killed in a 'gunfight' between the robbers and the police around 2:30 am. The incident took place while the gang was committing a robbery on Rajarhat-Chuknagar Road at Kamalpur under Kotwali Police Station, said Ilias Hossain, OC of Kotwali Police Station. Yusuf Ali, Medical Officer at Jessore Medical College Hospital, said the bullet-hit youth was brought to the hospital dead around 3:00 am on June 16, 2016.

data.name: Aidul Sagor
data.description: A "criminal" was killed in an alleged shootout between his cohorts and the Rapid Action Battalion at Agargaon in the capital on June 17, 2016. The deceased, Aidul alias Mama Sagor, 25, was an "extortionist" in the Karwan Bazar area and accused in several arms cases, claimed the elite force. The "gunfight" took place around 1:45 am after a RAB patrol team approached a group of criminals near the Sher-e-Bangla Agricultural University, said Lt Col Mohiuddin Ahmed, commanding officer of the RAB-2. Instantly, the criminals opened fire at the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate with gunshots. At one point, all the attackers except Aidul, who was shot in the incident, fled. The RAB members rescued and took him to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Golam Faizullah Fahim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Hizb-ut Tahrir, an Islamist fundamentalist organization
data.description: Golam Faizullah Fahim was killed in a "shootout" with the police on June 18, 2016. The police claimed that miscreants, sensing their presence, opened fire. The police fired back, triggering a gunfight. After a while, the police found Faizullah lying on the ground with bullet wounds. He was taken to Madaripur Sadar Hospital, where he was pronounced dead. However, locals captured the youth while he, along with two others, was trying to flee after hacking Ripon Chakraborty, a lecturer at Government Nazimuddin University College, on June 14, 2016. He was placed on a 10-day remand in an attempted murder case filed by the police on June 17, 2016. Earlier, on June 16, the Madaripur police chief said that during interrogation, Faizullah claimed to be a member of Hizb-ut Tahrir, an outfit banned in October 2009 for public security.

data.name: Kamal Hossain Sarder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Magura Sadar upazila on June 19, 2016. After the "gunfight," the police recovered the body of Kamal Hossain Sarder, 40, a leader of the district-based inter-district robber gang, from the Moghirdhal area on the Kushtia-Khulna highway. Locals later helped the law enforcers to identify the deceased. Kamal, the son of Afsar Hossain of Shawladanga in Magura Sadar upazila, was accused in five robbery cases filed with different police stations of the district, according to reports quoting the police. Azmol Huda, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Magura Sadar Police station, said that they had information that a group of robbers was preparing for a robbery by blocking the highway with logs. The robbers opened fire on the law enforcers when a patrol team of the Sadar Police Station raided the area around 3:30 am. The "gunfight" took place between the police and the robbers when the law enforcers retaliated. At one stage, Kamal Hossain Sarder was found dead.

data.name: Shariful Sakib
data.identity: Allegedly affiliated with the Ansarullah Bangla Team, an Islamist militant organization
data.description: The prime suspect in the murders of bloggers Avijit Roy and Niladri Chattopadhyay Niloy was killed in a "gunfight" with DB police in Meradiya Banshpotti around 2:00 am in Khilgaon, Dhaka on June 19, 2016. Shariful, who hailed from Khulna, was a top organizer of the banned militant group Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT), according to Masudur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (Media) of DMP. The police had previously announced a Tk 5 lakh bounty on him when they found evidence of his presence at the crime scene at TSC in Dhaka University, where Avijit was hacked to death on February 26, 2015, according to the Dhaka Metropolitan Police website. His direct involvement was found in a number of killings, including those of blogger Avijit and Niladri Niloy.

data.name: Abdus Sattar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and his cohorts in Sarail upazila of Brahmanbaria on June 21, 2016. The deceased is Abdus Sattar of College Para village in the upazila. Rupok Kumar Saha, Officer-in-Charge of Sarail Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that some robbers, including Sattar, were preparing to commit robbery in Gonara village, the police raided the village around 1:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on them. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight," the police official added. Sattar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Others managed to flee. According to the Daily Star, an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and his cohorts in Sarail upazila of Brahmanbaria early yesterday. The deceased is Abdus Sattar, 30, of College Para village in the upazila. Rupok Kumar Saha, officer-in-charge of Sarail Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that some robbers, including Sattar, were preparing to commit robbery in Gonara village, the police raided the village around 1:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on them. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight," the police official added. Sattar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Others managed to flee. Four policemen, including Sub-inspector of Sarail Police Station Rakib Hasan, were wounded during the gun battle. Two of them were admitted to Sarail Upazila Health Complex, while two others received first aid, the OC said. The police also claimed to have recovered a firearm, one bullet, and several sharp weapons from the spot. According to the police, Sattar stood accused of eight criminal cases, including robbery, with Sarail Police Station.

data.name: Mohammad Dulal Mridha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On June 23, 2016, Mohammad Dulal Mridha was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police at Banaripara upazila, Barisal. RisingBd reported that a man was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Sholiabakpur in the district's Banaripara upazila early Friday. The deceased was identified as Dulal (35), son of Ismail Hossain, a resident of Chandipur village in Babuganj upazila. The police said that Dulal was a suspected member of a robber gang. The officer-in-charge of Banaripara Thana, Ziaul Ahsan, said that acting on secret information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the area, a team of police went there to conduct a raid. However, upon sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire at them, forcing the law enforcers to return fire, which triggered a gunfight and left Dulal dead on the spot. A police constable also sustained injuries during the "gunfight." However, the others in the gang managed to flee the scene, the OC also said. The police also recovered 8 rounds of bullets, two pipe guns, and some other weapons from the spot.

data.name: Pranto Chandra Dey
data.description: Kamrul Islam, Officer in Charge of Mymensingh Police Station, claimed that Pranto Chandra Dey of Mymensingh town's Golpukurpar area died after suffering a heart attack. However, Pranto's family members and neighbors said he was "innocent" and might have been "tortured to death". According to TDS, a youth died in police custody on Friday night, approximately four hours after being detained allegedly with 15 Yaba tablets in Mymensingh. Pranto Chandra Dey, 21, of Mymensingh town's Golpukurpar area, died after suffering a heart attack, claimed Kamrul Islam, the officer-in-charge of Mymensingh Police Station. For the latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel. Pranto's family members and neighbors, however, said he was "innocent" and might have been "tortured to death". According to Ain O Salish Kendra, a rights organization, five people were tortured to death by members of law enforcement agencies in the first five months of this year. Additionally, there were allegations that some law enforcers threatened to implicate innocent people in narcotics cases if they failed to pay them money. Officer-in-Charge Kamrul claimed that Pranto was an addict and a drug peddler and had been detained with "15 Yaba tablets" at Durgabari on Friday. The youth, who had been "arrested on several previous occasions", fell sick and was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) around 9:00 pm that day, he claimed. Dilip Kumer Sarker, a doctor at the hospital's emergency unit, told The Daily Star that Pranto had been "brought dead" to the hospital. He also said the reason behind his death could only be known after an autopsy. Family members and neighbors said Pranto, the second of four siblings, was neither an addict nor a drug peddler. "He was physically fit and had no heart issues," said Mithu Chandra Dey, the elder brother of the deceased. Pranto, a school dropout, had been working as a salesman at a store in Mymensingh town for the last two years. He left the job last month. He went out around 5:00 pm on Friday, said Mithu, adding

data.name: Masud
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in Char Chandia union of Sonagazi upazila on June 25, 2016. Shafayet Ahmed Fahim, camp commander of RAB-7, said that based on secret information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery, a team of the elite force conducted a raid in the union around 2:00 am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. Masud was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. The Daily Star reported that an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Sonagazi upazila of Feni early today. Acting on a tip-off, Rab men conducted a raid at Char Chandia union in the upazilla when a gang of robbers led by Masud was preparing to commit a robbery there around 2:30 am, the Rab official said. Masud was killed in the "gunfight" while two Rab members also suffered critical injuries, the SMS reads. Bangla daily Prothom Alo reports that Masud, a member of a local robber gang called "Kalam Bahini," was planning to rob the house of a UAE expatriate named Enam. "On receiving information, a Rab team raided the area. Sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to fire back and triggering the gunfight," the daily said, quoting Squadron Leader Safayet Jamil, captain of Rab-7 Feni camp. Bullet-injured Masud was rushed to Feni General Hospital where he was declared dead. Humayun Kabir, officer-in-charge of Sonagazi Model Police Station, said Masud was accused in at least 12 cases, including murder, robbery, and extortion. The deceased Gabba Masud, 34, was a listed criminal, according to a short-message service (SMS) sent by Assistant Superintendent of Police Amir Hossain, media officer of Rab-7 in Chittagong.

data.name: Faruk Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A man, who was allegedly abducted on July 1, 2016, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in Jessore on July 2, 2016. The deceased is farmer Faruk Hossain, 42, son of Abu Bakar of Daulatdihi village under Kotwali Police Station, said family sources. Ilias Hossain, Officer-in-Charge, said an unidentified 'robber' died at Khulna Medical College Hospital after he was shot in a 'gunfight' between his cohorts and the law enforcers. The incident took place when a gang was committing robbery at Kanaitala on Rajarhat-Chuknagar road around 2:30 am, the OC said, adding that Faruk was killed in the firing by the robbers.

data.name: Ibnul Islam Parvej
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An Islami Chhatra Shibir activist was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and his cohorts in Uttar-Kastasagra village of Jhenidah Sadar upazila on July 2, 2016. The deceased, Ibnul Islam Parvej, 27, was the son of Jahangir Hossain of Bananipara in the district town. Parvej was the former president of Jhenidah Sadar unit Shibir, a pro-Jamaat-e-Islami student body. Hasan Hafizur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Jhenidah Sadar Police Station, said a police team was patrolling Porahati village. When their van reached near the Madhupur graveyard, some criminals opened fire. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Parvej was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Parvej's father, Jahangir Hossain, said some plainclothes men picked up his son from a house in Mohammadia Housing Society in the capital's Mohammadpur area on June 16. Jahangir claimed that a week ago, he gave Tk 5 lakh to the police as a bribe for his son's release. But they did not free his son. Instead, they killed him. Jahangir, however, declined to say who took the bribe. Contacted, OC Hasan said they would look into the matter if Jahangir told them the name. Lutfar Rahman, the grandfather of the victim, claimed that Parvej was not involved in any subversive activity. He was not facing any case.

data.name: Tarek Hossain Milu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Deputy Commissioner Mashrukur Rahman Khaled of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police's Detective Branch said that two members of JMB were killed in a gunfight in Pallabi, Dhaka, early on June 7, 2016. Tarek was involved in the killing of Rajshahi University English professor AFM Rezaul Karim Siddiquee, and Sultan was involved in the Bogra Shia mosque attack, he claimed. Additional Commissioner and head of the Counter-Terrorism unit, Monirul Islam, stated at a press conference at the office that the two were leaders of JMB based in the northern districts. He said that the police had received information that some JMB members were heading for Dhaka. They encountered a police team near Lohar Bridge at Kalshi in Pallabi, and gunshots were fired. The police retaliated with gunfire, which led to a gunfight, leaving the two injured, he said. Sub-Inspector Anwar Hossain of Pallabi Police Station stated that the "gunfight" occurred between 2:30 am and 3:00 am, during which the duo sustained bullet wounds. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the attending physicians declared them dead around 6:00 am.

data.name: Sultan Mahmud
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Deputy Commissioner Mashrukur Rahman Khaled of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police's Detective Branch said that two members of JMB were killed in a gunfight in Pallabi, Dhaka, early on June 7, 2016. Tarek was involved in the killing of Rajshahi University English professor AFM Rezaul Karim Siddiquee, and Sultan was involved in the Bogra Shia mosque attack, he claimed. The police retaliated with gunfire, which led to a gunfight, leaving the two injured, he said. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the attending physicians declared them dead around 6:00 am.

data.name: Jamal Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: In Rajshahi, a JMB operative who allegedly supplied a bomb in the 'suicidal' attack on an Ahmadiyya mosque in Baghmara, Rajshahi, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in Godagari district on June 7, 2016. The deceased was a resident of Shibganj in Chapainawabganj. Godagari police officer-in-charge, SM Abu Forhad, said that Jamal was an accomplice of Tarek Rahman, who caused explosions at an Ahmadiyya Muslim mosque on December 25 of the previous year and died on the spot. Police arrested Jamal in the Babu Dying area of Chapainawabganj around 11:00 pm on June 6, 2016. Based on his information, the police conducted a raid to arrest another accomplice in Farajpur, Godagari, in the early hours of June 7, 2016. The accomplices of Jamal opened fire on the police at that time, claimed the OC, and the law enforcers retaliated, resulting in a gunfight. Jamal died on the spot during the gunfight. The body was sent to the morgue at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital for an autopsy. No information was obtained from Jamal Uddin's family.

data.name: Rubel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Abdul Kader, officer-in-charge of Nasirnagar Police Station, claimed that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in Tullahpara village. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire. Police fired back triggering a gunfight. Seriously injured Rubel was taken to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, he added.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: Two suspects in the Mitu murder case were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rangunia upazila of Chittagong. The deceased are Nurul Islam alias Rashed, 27, of Islampur and Mohammad Nurunnabi alias Nabi, 28, of the upazila's Rajanagar area. However, Rashed's family alleged that police had picked up both of them on June 23, 2016 and "fabricated the shootout story after killing them". Recently, on June 29, 2016, the law enforcement agency issued a ban on the two suspects leaving the country. Officer-in-Charge Humayun Kabir of Rangunia Police Station said that acting on a tip-off, the Detective Branch (DB) of Chittagong Metropolitan Police (CMP) raided Ranirhat around 3:10 am on July 5, 2016 to arrest the "killers" of Mitu, the wife of SP Babul Akter. When the police reached the Thandachhari area, the criminals, who were hiding, opened fire and attacked the law enforcers with sharp weapons. The police retaliated with gunfire, resulting in the "gunfight", said the OC. The incident left Rashed and Nabi injured. They were declared dead upon arrival at a local health complex, said DB Assistant Commissioner Md Kamruzzaman, who is also the investigation officer of the Mitu murder case.

data.name: Mohammad Ali
data.description: On September 7, 2016, Sub Inspector Khokon Chandra Sarkar of the Detective Branch (DB) of Police in Norshingdi conducted a raid at Mohammad Ali's grocery shop on suspicion of selling drugs. The shop is located in the Matialpara area under Belabo Upazila in Norshingdi District. During the raid, Mohammad Ali was beaten with an iron rod and hit with bricks after he denied the allegations of selling drugs. Later, he was taken to Belabo Police Station and a case was filed against him after the police confiscated 100 Yaba tablets. Witnesses and family members of Mohammad Ali stated that around 3:00 pm, he was brought to Norshingdi District Hospital with severe injuries and he died there in the evening. Saidur Rahman, the Officer-in-Charge of Detective Branch of Police (DB) in Norshingdi, said that Mohammad Ali was in good health when he was arrested. Later, he was taken to the hospital when he fell sick, and as a result, he died while under treatment.

data.name: Oliullah Mollah
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A BNP man was killed in a so-called gunfight with the police in Satkhira on July 10, 2016. The deceased, Oliullah Mollah, 40, was the general secretary of Kashimari Union BNP in Shyamnagar upazila, according to his brother Habibullah Mollah. The alleged shootout took place in the Ganghati area of the upazila around 3:30 am. Sub-inspector (SI) Kamal Hossain of Satkhira SP office said a police team, led by SI Sudhangshu Kumar Mondal, was patrolling the Ganghati Chorakhali Culvert area. During that time, a number of people were speeding through the area on bikes. The police asked them to pull over, but they did not stop. Instead, they started hurling bombs and opening fire on the law enforcers. When the policemen retaliated with gunshots, one of the attackers was shot and fell to the ground. The others fled, said the police official. The bullet-hit man was taken to Shyamnagar hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead. However, Oliullah's elder brother Habibullah said the man was innocent. Oliullah had been working as a supervisor at a garments factory in Dhaka for a long time. He left home for Dhaka at 6:00 pm on July 9, 2016. He was traveling by a bus bound for Dhaka from Kaliganj. Habibullah claimed that the police picked up Oliullah from the bus in Devhata Parulia area. Later, he came to know that his brother had been killed in police firing, he added. The police denied the allegation.

data.name: Abdul Bari
data.description: A freedom fighter was allegedly beaten to death by some railway police personnel after he had gotten into an altercation with them over detaining his nephew in a block raid at Jamalpur railway station on July 11, 2016. The victim, Abdul Bari, 68, was a resident of Hatchandra vicinity of Jamalpur municipality. He was a veteran freedom fighter and a retired member of the Bangladesh Army, said Md Safiqul Islam, commander of Jamalpur Zila Muktijoddha Sangsad. The victim's family and witnesses said Bari went to the General Railway Police station in Jamalpur after being informed that the police had detained his nephew, Majaharul Islam Babu, an MBA student at Rajshahi University, for traveling without a ticket. The officer-in-charge of Jamalpur railway police station, Goura Chandra Majumdar, said that Babu was detained by the railway authority as he boarded a Bangabandhu Bridge-bound train from Chittagong without a ticket. Bari was trying to get his nephew freed from police custody. During a heated altercation, Bari punched a constable of the police station named Tapon Barua, according to witnesses. The constable then indiscriminately punched Bari in the face, causing him to bleed severely from his nose and mouth, said FF Haider Ali, the commander of Jamalpur sadar upazila muktijodha command, quoting some witnesses. Bari fell to the floor, according to the witnesses. He was rushed to Jamalpur General Hospital and then transferred to the Combined Military Hospital in Mymensingh as his condition deteriorated around 12:00 pm. "There were injury marks on his face, and considering his critical condition, he was referred to CMH of Mymensingh," said Mushair-ul Islam, Civil Surgeon of Jamalpur. The freedom fighter succumbed to his injuries around 2:45 pm, said FF Haider Ali.

data.name: Shawkat
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police on the Magura-Jhenaidah highway in the Pashchim Ramnagar area of Sadar Upazila on November 7, 2016. The deceased was identified as Shawkat, 38, son of Moyen Uddin, a resident of Komorpur village in Mashukhali Upazila of Faridpur district. Upon receiving information that a robber gang was preparing to commit robbery by placing logs on the highway, a team of law enforcers conducted a raid in the area around 2:00 am, said Azmal Huda, OC of Sadar Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police, the gang opened fire at them, prompting the police to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight. The gunfight left Shawkat dead on the spot, added the OC. BDnews24: The incident occurred early on Monday at West Ramnagar along the Dhaka-Khulna highway, said Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police Sudarshan Roy. The deceased has been identified as 38-year-old "Shawkat," son of Moyen Mandal from Kumarparha village in Faridpur. The "bandit" and his gang cut down a tree to block the highway near the West Ramnagar parking area for buses, said police official Roy. "A police team was sent to confront the bandits," he said. "When the bandits saw the team, they opened fire and the police were forced to respond. The bandits eventually retreated and 'Shawkat's body was then recovered from the spot." A pistol, a bullet, a magazine of ammunition, and four sharp weapons were recovered from the scene, he said. "Shawkat" was the leader of a local bandit group and several cases had been filed against him at the police station, added Roy.

data.name: Montajul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On December 7, 2016, both of them were killed in a gunfight with the police at Keraniganj, Dhaka. The deceased in the Keraniganj incident were identified as Montajul Islam, 35, and Sabuj, 34. Shah Mizan Shafiur Rahman, superintendent of police in Dhaka, said they apprehended Montajul and Sabuj from Mawa Road on December 7, 2016. Based on the information gleaned from the two, the police took them along to the Porahati area of Ruhitpur in search of illegal arms. Associates of Montaj and Sabuj at one stage opened fire on the police, and the police also returned fire, the SP said, adding that the two detainees sustained bullet injuries during the shootout. After they were shifted to Mitford Hospital, the doctors on duty declared them dead at around 3:00 pm. TDS: 4 'robbers' killed in 'gunfights' Four alleged robbers were killed on Wednesday in separate "gunfights" in Keraniganj and Faridpur, claimed the police. In Keraniganj, the gunfight took place at Ruhitpur between a group of robbers and the police, leaving two alleged robbers killed. For all the latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel. The other gun battle, in Faridpur, was between two groups of robbers, the police said. The deceased in the Keraniganj incident were identified as Montajul Islam, 35, and Sabuj, 34. Shah Mizan Shafiur Rahman, superintendent of police in Dhaka, said they apprehended Montajul and Sabuj from Mawa Road on Wednesday afternoon. Based on the information gleaned from the two, the police took them along to the Porahati area of Ruhitpur in search of illegal arms. Associates of Montaj and Sabuj at one stage opened fire on the police, and the police also returned fire, the SP said, adding that the two detainees sustained bullet injuries during the shootout. After they were transported to Mitford Hospital, the doctors on duty declared them dead at around 3:00 pm. Montaj was the leader of a robbery gang that was active in Dhaka and surrounding areas, and he used to propagate against the government using a Facebook account, claimed the SP. The gunfight in

data.name: Lokman Miah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and the police at Mirpukurpar in Brahmanbaria's Kasba upazila early yesterday. The deceased was Lokman Miah, 32, of the upazila. Acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the area, a police team conducted a raid there around 3:00 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang members opened fire on them, prompting the policemen to retaliate, which triggered a "gunfight," said Mahiuddin Ahammed, officer-in-charge of Kasba Police Station. At one stage, Lokman was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while his associates managed to flee the scene, he added. Three policemen -- SI Suhel Sikdar, ASI Faruq Ahmed, and constable Rajib Ahmed -- of the police station were also injured in the incident. They received primary treatment at the upazila health complex, Mahiuddin said. The police recovered the body and sent it to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital morgue for an autopsy. A pipe-gun, four bullets, and four sharp weapons were found at the scene, said Sub-Inspector Suhel Sikdar. Lokman was accused in five robbery cases, according to the police.

data.name: Tareq Hossain
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in what police claimed to be a gunfight at Makardhos in Sadar upazila of Laxmipur district this morning. The deceased was identified as Tareq Hossain, a member of the criminal gang 'Bashar Bahini' and the son of Abdur Shukur alias Siraj Miah, a resident of the same village. For all the latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police conducted a raid in the Makardhos area to arrest Tareq when he and his associates were present there around 3:00 am, Assistant Superintendent of Police Mohammad Junayet Kawser said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Tareq's associates opened fire on them, forcing the police personnel to fire back, which triggered a gun battle. Tareq was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while his associates managed to flee the scene. Police recovered the body and sent it to Laxmipur Sadar Hospital morgue for an autopsy in the morning. They also recovered one light gun and six rounds of bullets from the spot. Four policemen were injured during the gunfight. Tareq was wanted in several cases, including murder and extortion, the ASP added.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged "gunfight" with the police at Akhaura in Brahmanbaria early on July 18, 2016. The deceased was identified as Saiful Islam, son of Idris Mia, of Jangal. He was wanted in six cases, including five for robbery, the police said. The officer-in-charge of Akhaura police, Md Mosharraf Hussain, said that the police responded to a tip that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery near Tanmandal bridge. A team of Akhaura police conducted a raid there, he said. As the police approached the spot around 2:15 am, the robbers, sensing the police presence, opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate and triggering a gunfight, Mosharraf added. At one stage, a number of robbers jumped into the adjacent canal and fled, Mosharraf said. The police then found Saiful's body at the scene.

data.name: Bagha Jewel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Tongi police claimed that a suspect in several cases, including murder, robbery, and extortion, succumbed to gunshot wounds after being caught in a crossfire right after his arrest on July 21, 2016. Bagha Jewel, 25, the son of the late Sentu Ahmed from Brahmanbaria's Bancharampur upazila, was arrested at Duttapara-Bonomala road in Tongi of Gazipur during a raid around 3:45 am following a tip-off, claimed Tongi Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Firoz Talukder. His accomplices then shot at the police, who retaliated, leading to a gunfight, he alleged. The accomplices fled, and Jewel was sent to Tongi Sadar Hospital and later transferred to the National Institute Of Traumatology and Orthopaedic Rehabilitation, where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Abdul Karim
data.description: An undertrial prisoner of Munshiganj jail died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on July 22, 2016. The family of the deceased, Abdul Karim, alleged that he was tortured by the complainant before being handed over to the police, who also beat him in jail afterwards. Karim, 35, from Adhariatola village under Munshiganj Sadra upazila, was sent to DMCH for treatment from Munshiganj jail on July 21, 2016, due to severe chest pain, said Farid Uddin Rubel, jailer of Munshiganj jail. He claimed that when Karim was sent to the jail from the police station on July 11, he was already physically sick. Karim was first admitted to Munshiganj General Hospital for treatment and later sent to DMCH, the jailer added. Karim's wife, Moyna Begum, said their neighbor Md Shamim was building a house and Karim, along with others, wanted some money from him for arranging a picnic earlier this month. Later, Shamim and his relative Khorshed Alam took Karim to Shamim's office at Adhariatola and beat him mercilessly before handing him over to the cops on July 10, she alleged. She also alleged that a sub-inspector of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station tortured Karim at the station and damaged a part of his ear. Shamim also filed an extortion case against Karim the same day, and the police sent him to Munshiganj jail on July 11, she said. Moyna alleged that Karim's younger brother, Abdus Salam Khan, who was also detained in Munshiganj jail in another case, told her that Karim was groaning due to stomach pain on July 22, but when they called a doctor from the local hospital, he said that Karim had no problem. Sonjoy Kumar Poddar, a doctor at Munshiganj General Hospital, said that as Karim was seriously ill, he was sent to DMCH for better treatment. When asked about the reason behind his illness, the doctor said that they did not perform any tests on Karim before sending him to DMCH. Yunus Ali, officer-in-charge of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station, refuted the allegations, saying that the police did not torture him.

data.name: Mizan Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged inter-district robber gang leader was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Kalia upazila of Narail on July 24, 2016. The deceased is Mizan Ali, also known as Mizan Kazi, 38, from Bagudanga village in the upazila. According to the police, Mizan was leading the robber gang and was accused in at least a dozen cases, including murder, rape, and robbery, in different police stations in Narail and Bagerhat. Mahabubur Rahman, the officer-in-charge of Naragati Police Station in Kalia, said a team of Naragati police, led by Sub-inspector Mohiuddin, with the help of Gopalganj police, arrested Mizan from his hideout in Gopalganj on the evening of July 23, 2016. According to Mizan's statement, the team was taking him to his village home in Bagudanga at night to recover firearms. Around 2:30 am, Mizan's accomplices attacked the police van to snatch him when it reached near Balurmath in Pohordanga, the OC added. The criminals opened fire, and the law enforcers returned fire, resulting in the "gunfight". Mizan was caught in the line of fire when he tried to flee from police custody, while others managed to escape, the police official told this correspondent over the phone.

data.name: Johurul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) at Salimpur village in Ishwardi upazila on July 29, 2016. The deceased was identified as Johurul Islam, 30, son of Borat Ali Mondol of Punkharua village in Ullapara upazila of Sirajganj. He was allegedly the ringleader of a gang of robbers in Sirajganj and also the regional chief of the "Johurul Gang," RAB said. The Daily Star reported that an alleged robber was killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) at Salimpur village in Ishwardi upazila in the early hours of yesterday. The deceased was identified as Johurul Islam, 30, son of Borat Ali Mondol of Punkharua village in Ullapara upazila of Sirajganj. He was allegedly the ringleader of a gang of robbers in Sirajganj and also the regional chief of the "Johurul Gang," according to a report from our Pabna correspondent. Acting on a tip-off that criminals were holding a secret meeting, a team of Rab-12 raided a litchi orchard owned by Atiar Rahman at Salimpur village in Ishwardi around 3:00 am, said ASP Akramul Hossain, company commander of Pabna Rab camp. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the elite force to retaliate, he said. After a gunfight for around 30 minutes, the criminals retreated, leaving Johurul, who was shot, behind, he added. The victim was taken to Pabna Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the Rab commander said, adding that two of his men received minor injuries. Johurul is accused in nine cases in Pabna and Sirajganj, said Rab, who recovered a revolver, three bullets, and three sharp weapons from the spot.

data.name: Ramzan Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the law enforcers in Moheshpur upazila of the district early yesterday. The deceased, Ramzan Ali, 45, was the son of Kuran Mondal of Krishnapur village in the upazila. Police said a team of law enforcers, acting on a tip-off, raided the Katakhali area when a gang of criminals was planning to commit robbery on the Kaliganj-Jibonnagar road by felling logs around 2:30 am. Sensing the police presence, the gang opened fire at them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire, triggering a "gunfight". During the 10-minute "gunfight", Ramzan was caught in the line of fire.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Nazrul Islam, also known as Hasan or Bike Hasan, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Rajshahi city. He was an alleged member of the banned militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB). According to the Daily Star, Nazrul Islam, who was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Rajshahi city on Tuesday, has been identified as Nazrul Islam, also known as Hasan or Bike Hasan. He was an alleged member of the banned militant group Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) and a key accused in the murder case of a Hindu priest in Panchagarh. He earned the nickname Bike Hasan because he would transport militants on his motorcycle during criminal activities such as murder, as reported by the Rajshahi Metropolitan Police (RMP). Nazrul, 26, was popular among his fellow militants in the "Suicide Squad" for successfully transporting killers to crime scenes and back to their hideouts on his motorcycle. Police have linked him to 13 militant attacks in Rajshahi, Rangpur, Dinajpur, Panchagarh, Sirajganj, Kushtia, Jhenidah, Tangail, and other districts, resulting in the deaths of eleven people. The victims include Rajshahi University teacher Prof AFM Rezaul Karim Siddiquee, Panchagarh Hindu priest Jogeswar Dasadhikari, Tangail tailor, and Kushtia homeopath. Nazrul, an alleged member of JMB, was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and the police near Ashrafer Mor during an anti-militancy operation by law enforcement early Tuesday. RMP Commissioner Shafiqul Islam revealed the identity of the "militant" during a press briefing yesterday. Nazrul was one of two fugitives for whom the Rajshahi police declared a reward of Tk 1 lakh for their capture in the murder case of RU teacher Rezaul. Nazrul, the son of Mohammad Abdullah, also known as Munna, from Sonarhar Gochpur village in Panchagarh's Debiganj, brought three killers of Rezaul to the crime scene at Shalbagan on his motorcycle, according to Detective Branch of RMP Inspector Rezaus Sadik, who is also the investigating officer in the Reza

data.name: Shafiul Islam
data.description: Two militants, including Shafiul Islam who was among the Sholakia attackers, were killed in a gunfight between RAB and Shafiul's associates in Mymensingh, according to claims made by RAB and the police. The identity of the second victim could not be immediately determined. However, Commanding Officer of RAB-14, Lt Col Shariful Islam, claimed that he was an associate of Shafiul and was among those who attacked the RAB convoy. The RAB official stated that Shafiul, also known as Saiful, had been receiving treatment at Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) under Rab custody since he was apprehended at the attack scene in Kishoreganj on Eid day. After being released by doctors on August 4, 2016, he was being transported to Kishoreganj to be handed over to the police. They came under attack in Nandail when the assailants attempted to snatch Shafiul by throwing bombs and opening fire, according to the RAB official. A gun battle ensued when RAB retaliated, resulting in both individuals being shot, he added. Nandail police reported that the gunfight occurred around 11:00pm near a brickfield in the Dangrigoshpala area, under the Chandipasha union, approximately three to four kilometers east of Nandail upazila headquarters. Arif Mohammad Ziauddin, emergency medical officer at Nandail Upazila Health Complex, stated that the two were pronounced dead around midnight. Shafiul is originally from Dinajpur.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and the police during an anti-militancy drive in the district's Bagmara upazila on August 7, 2016. The identity of the deceased, aged around 34, could not be immediately known, said Moazzem Hossain Bhuiyan, superintendent of police in Rajshahi, while addressing a press briefing. Moazzem said that acting on a tip-off that some criminals had gathered in a mango orchard belonging to Mohammad Sumon in Jhikra Joan Bhatpara village around 3:30 am, a joint team of the Detective Branch of Rajshahi district police and Bagmara police raided the orchard. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals exploded several crude bombs and opened fire. The police also returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, the police found the man lying in a pool of blood. He was declared dead after being taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital (RMCH), the police official added. The other criminals managed to flee.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and the police during an anti-militancy drive in the district's Bagmara upazila on August 7, 2016. The identity of the deceased, aged around 34, could not be immediately known, said Moazzem Hossain Bhuiyan, superintendent of police in Rajshahi, while addressing a press briefing on August 7, 2016, at noon. Moazzem said that acting on a tip-off that some criminals had gathered in a mango orchard belonging to Mohammad Sumon in Jhikra Joan Bhatpara village around 3:30 am, a joint team of the Detective Branch of Rajshahi district police and Bagmara police raided the orchard. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals exploded several crude bombs and opened fire. The police also returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, the police found the man lying in a pool of blood. He was declared dead after being taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital (RMCH), the police official added. Other criminals managed to flee. Six policemen were injured in the "gunfight" and they received first aid at the RMCH, claimed the SP. The police also claimed to have recovered a pistol, three bullets, 13 crude bombs, several sharp weapons, and some jihadi books from the spot.

data.name: Sadir Miah
data.description: A sub-inspector was suspended over allegations of police beating an old man to death in Moulvibazar on August 11, 2016. The victim was Sadir Miah, 60, from Kalenga village in Kamalganj upazila of the district. His son, Shipon Miah, is an accused in a case filed with Kamalganj Police Station, according to Mullah Md Sahin, assistant superintendent of police of Moulvibazar. The police went to raid Sadir Miah's house to apprehend Shipon, he said. Sadir's wife, Safina Begum, said a police team conducted the raid around 4:00 am on August 11, 2016. Not finding Shipon at home, the law enforcers dragged his father out and beat him. Due to the severe beating, her husband died on the spot, Safina added. Local people organized a procession and held a rally in the area to protest the incident. Holding the police responsible for the killing, they issued a 24-hour ultimatum for the suspension of Sub-inspector Nazrul Islam.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: A suspected leader of the outlawed Biplobi Communist Party was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and party operatives at a bamboo grove in Garakhula, under Phultala in Khulna, on November 8, 2016. The deceased was identified as Billal Hossain, 35, from Jugnipasha village in Phultala. ASI Md Asmot Ali stated that a team of Phultala police, acting on secret information, conducted a raid in the Garakhola area. As soon as the police team reached a bamboo grove in the area, the outlaws opened fire on the police at approximately 1:30 am. He added that the police retaliated by firing back. The police officer mentioned that after the gunfight, the police searched the area and found Billal, who had been hit by bullets, left abandoned. The police took him to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Liton
data.description: In Dhaka, a "gunfight" occurred between a group of seven to eight alleged drug peddlers and members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Postogola in the Kadamtoli area around 4:15 am on August 12, 2016. Delwar Hossain Liton was found lying at the scene after the incident, according to Jahangir Hossain Matubbar, the commanding officer of RAB-10. He was taken to Mitford Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead, added the RAB official. Delwar's wife, Rozina, stated that her husband's name was Liton Miah, 26, and he was a local drug peddler. However, she claimed that he never had any weapons in his possession. She added that someone called her husband and took him away from the Chittagong Road area on the evening of August 11, 2016, and since then, he had been missing. Delwar's body was sent to the Sir Salimullah Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Shahidul Islam Pancha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB members at Falsi Battala in Jhenidah's Harinakundo upazila on August 12, 2016. The deceased is Shahidul Islam Pancha, 42, of Pardakhalpur village in the upazila. Jhenidah RAB-6 Commander Monir Ahmed said a RAB patrol team had gone to the Falsi Battala area after being informed that a gang of robbers was planning to commit a robbery there. As the RAB team reached the area, the robbers opened fire, prompting the elite force members to retaliate. Shahidul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. The other robbers, however, managed to flee.

data.name: Anarul Sana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Anarul Sana, an alleged robber, was killed in Koyra upazila in a "gunfight" with the police on August 12, 2016. He was accused in 10 cases, including robbery, according to the police. Anarul was arrested from the Koyra Bazar area around 2:35 pm on August 11, 2016, said Sheikh Shamsher Ali, officer-in-charge of Koyra Police Station. Later, based on the information he provided during questioning, the police took him along with them on a raid in the Kharkharia river area inside the Sundarbans to recover firearms, the OC said. As soon as the law enforcers reached there, Anarul's cohorts opened fire, triggering a gunfight that left Anarul and three policemen injured, he said. Anarul was taken to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, Shamsher added. The injured police members were undergoing treatment at the hospital.

data.name: Abdur Rashid Biswas
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On August 13, 2016, Abdur Rashid Biswas was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. However, family members of Abdur Rashid claimed that he was picked up by plainclothes men claiming to be members of the police at around 9:30 pm on August 12, 2016. According to the Daily Observer, an alleged robber was killed during a "gunfight" with law enforcers on the Jhenidah-Kushtia highway in Shailkupa upazila of Jhenidah early Sunday. The deceased was identified as Abdur Rashid, 45. Gopinath Kanjilal, assistant superintendent of police (Sadar Circle), said that acting on secret information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery in front of the Dudhsor Housing Project site on the highway, a team of police launched a drive there around 3 am. Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. At one stage, a member of the gang was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while others managed to flee the scene, the police said. Two police constables, Nazrul Islam and Amad Ali, were also injured in the incident. The police recovered one shutter gun, two bullets, five live bombs, and some sharp weapons from the scene.

data.name: Mohammad Shamim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On August 15, 2016, Mohammad Shamim, also known as Fokir, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. The Daily Star reported that an alleged robber was killed and a policeman was injured in a "gunfight" in Madarganj upazila of Jamalpur last night. Shamim was accused in 14 cases, including murder and robbery, according to Rampada Mondal, the officer-in-charge of Madarganj Police Station. Razzak, a sub-inspector of the police station, suffered bullet injuries during the gunfight and is currently receiving treatment at Jamalpur Sadar Hospital. Acting on information that robbers were planning to commit robbery at Koalikandi village, a police team raided the area around 8:45 pm yesterday, as stated by OC Rampada. As the police arrived, the robbers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight" with them. The gunfight resulted in Shamim and SI Razzak being wounded by bullets, according to the OC. Shamim was taken to Madarganj Upazila Health Complex and later transferred to Jamalpur Sadar Hospital as his condition worsened. He succumbed to his injuries at Jamalpur Sadar Hospital around 11:00 pm last night. The deceased, Shamim Ahmed, 35, was the son of Lal Mahmud Fakir from Fakirpara village in the upazila, as reported by our local correspondent.

data.name: Nurunnabi
data.description: On August 19, 2016, at midnight, a group of police led by two Sub-Inspectors from Kotwali Police Station, Tareq and Tofazzal, raided Golzar's house in Birbhodra Balahati village of Mahiganj in Rangpur town. They arrested him under a motorbike theft case. Later, two police officers demanded a bribe of one hundred twenty thousand taka from Golzar's family. At one point, his family gave the police eighty thousand taka and informed them that the rest of the money would be given the next day. However, Golzar's elder brother Nurunnabi found this unacceptable and got into an altercation with the police. This enraged the police, and they apprehended Nurunnabi on allegations of theft. The police also demanded money from him. As he was unable to pay, he was severely beaten by the police. Nurunnabi fell to the ground and died on the spot.

data.name: Rahis Miah
data.description: An alleged drug smuggler was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and the police at Konabari in Kosba on August 24, 2016. The deceased was identified as Rahis Miah, 48, son of the late Sawdagor Ali Fakir, of Pathariatek village in Akhaura upazila. The Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Kosba police station, Mohiuddin Ahammed, said that they received a tip-off and a team of police conducted a raid in the area where a gang of drug smugglers, including Rahis, was staying at around 1:30 am. According to the Daily Star, an alleged drug smuggler was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and the police at Konabari in Kosba upazila of Brahmanbaria early today. The deceased, Rahis Miah, 48, was the son of the late Sawdagor Ali Fakir of Pathariatek village in Akhaura upazila. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police conducted a raid at Konabari when a gang of drug smugglers, including Rahis, was staying there around 1:30 am, said Mohiuddin Ahammed, the officer-in-charge of Kosba Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the alleged criminals opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate, which triggered a "gunfight" between them. At one stage, Rahis was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while his associates managed to flee the scene. Five policemen, including a sub-inspector, were also injured during the "gunfight," according to OC Mohiuddin. The law enforcers recovered one firearm, four cartridges, 100 bottles of liquor, 15 kilograms of hemp, and 300 yaba tablets from the spot.

data.name: Sanwar Hossain Sanu
data.description: Two alleged criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Kamarkhand upazila of Sirajganj on August 25, 2016. They were Sanwar Hossain Sanu, 32, from Bharanga village of the upazila, and Lutful Ali, 55, from Ankutia village in Pabna's Chatmohar. The two were accused in eight criminal cases with different police stations, according to RAB. Shahabuddin Khan, commander of RAB-12 in Sirajganj, said RAB members arrested Farhad Ali, one of the prime suspects in the murder case of Awami League leader Mahbub Alam Milton, on August 9. On June 19 of this year, Milton, who was also a UP member in Kamarkhand, was hacked to death by criminals. A case was filed with Kamarkhand Police Station in connection with the murder. The elite force later took charge of the case, sources said. During interrogation, Farhad mentioned some names, including Sanwar and Lutful, stating that they were involved in the murder, according to the RAB commander in a press release. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB from Sirajganj camp went to Jamtoil station around 3:00 am on August 25, 2016, where the Milon murder suspects were hiding to apprehend them, he said. When the team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire. The RAB men then returned fire, resulting in the "gunfight". During the gun battle, Sanwar and Lutful were hit by bullets. They were taken to Sirajganj General Hospital where the doctors declared them dead.
