data.name: Abu Bakar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected ringleader of a Sundarbans-based robbery gang was killed in a 'gunfight' between robbers and Rapid Action Battalion members in the forest in Khulna on August 26, 2016 morning. The deceased was identified as Abu Bakar, 40, suspected chief of 'Saijya Bahini' in the Sundarbans, RAB said. Tipped off that a gang of robbers had gathered in the Phultala area to commit robbery, a RAB team raided the area around 7:30 am, Khulna RAB-6 operation officer Zahid Hossain said. Sensing RAB members' presence, the criminals opened fire on the battalion personnel, who retaliated. At one stage, the robbers fled the scene and while searching the spot, RAB men found a bullet-hit body. The gunfight took place around 8:00 am in the west zone's Fultala area of Koyra upazila. The deceased was identified as Abu Bokkar Sardar alias Bakka, head of the notorious forest robber gang 'Saija Bahini'. Additional DIG Khondokar Rafikul Islam, director of RAB-6, said that they were tipped off that members of the forest robber gang were staying in the area, so a team of the elite force carried out a raid there. Sensing the presence of the RAB personnel, members of the gang opened fire on them, forcing the elite force to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight, he said. As the two sides exchanged shots, the members of the robber gang finally gave up and managed to flee the scene. Later, the body of Bakka was recovered from the spot. The elite force also recovered a gun, a rifle, several rounds of bullets, and some native weapons from the spot.

data.name: Mukul Munshi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On August 27, 2016, Mukul Munshi, aged 40, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB-12. According to Prothom Alo, a man was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Mirpur upazila of Kushtia early Sunday. The deceased was identified as Mukul Munshi, 40. The RAB stated that Mukul was a notorious robber and had been sued by various police stations in Kushtia. RAB-12 Kushtia camp commander, Major Mosaddek Ibne Mujib, confirmed to Prothom Alo that the "gunfight" occurred at about 3:30 am. He said the RAB members conducted a raid in the area at about 3:30 am based on information that a gang of robbers had gathered for a robbery near Kushtia-Meherpur highway. Sensing the presence of RAB personnel, the robbers opened fire at them. The RAB members then retaliated. Later, the body of a man was found at the scene. The RAB commander claimed that two RAB members were injured in the incident. He also claimed that the RAB recovered one pistol, two rounds of bullets, and a machete.

data.name: Khaled Hasan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected top leader of the "Neo JMB" and another key operative of the organization were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Bogra's Sherpur upazila on August 29, 2016. The deceased militants were identified as Khaled Hasan, 30, also known as Badar Mama, and Ripon, 29, also known as Golam Tareque or Abu Ibrahim. They were allegedly involved in several militant attacks in the country's northern region last year. Khaled, a military commander of the northern region, masterminded the attack on Italian physician Piero Parolari, the bomb attack at Kantaji Mandir, the attack on Iskcon temple, and the looting of a petrol pump in Dinajpur in November and December last year, said Gaziur Rahman, senior assistant superintendent of police in Bogra.

data.name: Arif
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight between the DB Police and his accomplices in Madhabdi. The deceased was identified as Arif, son of Md Haklim from the Birampur area in the upazila. Delwar Hossain, Officer in Charge of the DB, stated that upon receiving information about a mugging, law enforcers went to the Saikadi area and encountered three youths on a motorbike. Sensing the presence of the DBs, the youths began shooting at them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, according to the OC. Arif was shot during the shootout, while the other two managed to escape. Arif was taken to Narsingdi General Hospital but died while being transferred to DMCH.

data.name: Lal Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On September 2, 2016, Lal Mia was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. However, family members claimed that he was picked up by the police before the gunfight on September 1, 2016. BDnews24: The district's Additional Superintendent of Police, Sheikh Azbahar Ali, said the incident took place around 3 am on Friday at Pirojpur Karhaitola on the Jhenaidah-Jessore highway. Although he was unable to identify the deceased, he said that two police constables had been injured in the 'gunfight'. He told bdnews24.com that a group of robbers had barricaded the highway to stop vehicles and loot passengers at Pirojpur Karhaitola. "When a police team on routine patrol arrived there, the robbers started shooting and hurled bombs at them. One of the robbers got shot when the police returned fire." The man was taken to Kaliganj Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors declared him dead, said Ali. He said the police had also recovered five crude bombs, a gun, bullets, four machetes, and two saws for cutting trees from the scene. The injured constables, Ratan Kumar and Al Amin, were treated at the Upazila Health Complex too.

data.name: Asadul Fakir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On May 9, 2016, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. The Daily Star reported that an alleged outlaw was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and the police in the district's Mirpur upazila early yesterday. The deceased, Asadul Islam Fakir, 39, from Radhanagar village in the upazila, was a regional leader of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML-Lal Pataka). Acting on a tip-off, the police raided Kaligarhmath village when a gang led by Asadul was preparing to commit a robbery on the Kushtia-Meherpur highway by blocking the road with logs around 2:30 am, said Kazi Jalal Uddin, the officer-in-charge of Mirpur Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them. The police then returned fire, triggering the gun battle. At one stage, Asadul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. The others managed to flee. According to the police, Asadul was accused in 14 cases, including seven for murder, filed with Mirpur Police Station. The police also claimed to have recovered two firearms, six bullets, and several sharp weapons from the spot.

data.name: Sagar
data.description: An alleged snatcher was killed and another sustained bullet wounds in police firing in the capital's Dhanmondi on September 6, 2016. Law enforcement also nabbed their accomplice, Bashar, when he was trying to flee the scene. Police said the deceased is Sagar, 26, a listed snatcher. The injured individual is Hazrat Ali, 28. The trio, in a private car, attempted to snatch valuables from a rickshaw passenger near Matsya Bhaban intersection around 6:00 am, said Maruf Hossain Sorder, Deputy Commissioner (Ramna division) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. He said that upon receiving information, a patrol team from Shahbagh police chased them to Road-3 in Dhanmondi. At one stage, the criminals stopped the car there as police put a barricade on the road. Abu Bakar Siddique, OC of Shahbagh Police Station, said that when the criminals were trying to flee the scene, police opened fire, injuring Sagar and Hazrat. Bashar was caught at the spot. Sagar and Hazrat were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared Sagar dead.

data.description: The "gunfight" took place when the robbers were planning to commit a robbery in Shreekhondia village, said Mohoshinul Quadir, OC of Ashulia police. When a police patrol team reached the spot around 4:30 am, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to fire back and thus triggering a gunfight between them, the OC said. Anwar died instantly, he mentioned, adding that Anwar was accused in at least five cases, including murder and robbery.

data.name: Al Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged leader of a gang of robbers was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" in the Hatirjheel area on September 12, 2016. The deceased was identified as Al Amin, 28, who had several cases against him. According to the Daily Star, an alleged gang leader of an inter-district robber group was killed in what the police described as a gunfight in the Hatirjheel lake area in Dhaka early today. The deceased, Al Amin, also known as Robin, Manik, Akash, Adi, Maznu, Patha Mazid, 28, is said to be a wanted criminal accused in seven cases, according to Mazedul Huq, a sub-inspector of Tejgaon Industrial Police Station, who spoke to The Daily Star. Al Amin died on the spot when a group of robbers opened fire at the law enforcers after sensing the presence of a police patrol team there, the SI said. The deceased was from Raipura in Narsingdi, the police official said. A revolver and three rounds of bullets were recovered from the spot, he added.

data.name: Fadur Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A man accused in several murder cases was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and the police in Bajitpur upazila on September 15, 2016. The deceased, Fadur Ali alias Ripon, 35, was the son of the late Morshed Mia of Dari Ghaghatia village in the upazila. Police arrested Fadur from Narsingdi's Belabo upazila on September 14, 2016. Later, the police, along with Fadur, raided Satirchar village to recover firearms around 3:00 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Fadur's associates opened fire on the policemen, prompting them to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight". Fadur was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, the police added. BDnews24: Bajitpur police OC Md Moqbul Hossain Molla claimed the 'gunfight' took place at Gazirchar Union's Sadirchar village early on Thursday. He identified the deceased as Fadur Ali alias 'Ripon', 35. Molla said Ripon was accused in 15 cases, five of which were for murder and the rest for robbery and mugging. The police official told bdnews24.com that they had arrested Ripon from Bajitpur on Wednesday. Based on information given by him, Molla said the police launched a raid at Sadirchar early on Thursday to seize illegal arms. They also took Ripon along with them. "Criminals ambushed the policemen, and Ripon was shot dead in the crossfire. The criminals fled when the police returned fire." The OC said they recovered four guns and nine bullets from the spot after the 'shootout'.

data.name: Rakibul Islam
data.description: A union parishad member, who was also the prime accused in the abduction and killing of schoolboy Mahfuz Alam Sajib, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion members in a mango orchard at Gobindapur under Damurhuda in Chuadanga on September 18, 2016. The deceased was identified as Rakibul Islam, aged 28, son of Iman Ali of village Alukdia under Chuadanga Sadar. He was a member of Alukdia union parishad and went into hiding after the abduction and killing of Sajib. According to Bd News, Rakibul Islam Rakib, a member of Alokdia Union ward-1, was killed around 2 am on Sunday in Gobindahuda village of Damurhhuda Upzaila. RAB-6 Jhenaidah camp Commander Major Monir Ahmed has said that a RAB team conducted a raid on Gobindahuda field after receiving a tip-off about a group of miscreants holding a secret meeting there. “RAB retaliated when the miscreants opened fire. One of the injured miscreants was declared dead after being taken to Damurhhuda Upazila Health Complex,” he said. Later, the locals identified him as ‘Rakib Member,’ said the RAB official. RAB found one revolver and two rounds of bullets at the scene. Rakib was the main accused in the murder case of Mafuz Alam Shajib, an eighth grader of V J School in Chuadanga, who was abducted and later killed. On July 29, Shajib was abducted from a fair held inside the Damurhhuda Upazila Parishad premises. The kidnappers demanded Tk 2 million as ransom from his family. On August 31, RAB recovered Mahfuz’s body from a septic tank inside a factory owned by Rakib in C & B Parha area. Shajib’s uncle Abdul Halim filed a case against six people, including Rakib as the main accused, at Damurhhuda Police Station. Human chain protests have been held in Chuadanga demanding justice for Shajib.

data.name: Humayun Kabir
data.description: An alleged abductor was killed in a gunfight with policemen in Pirganj upazila of Rangpur on September 20, 2016. The deceased was identified as Humayun Kabir, 27, son of Abdus Sattar of Dhefulia village under Barisal Sadar upazila. A police team arrested five people, including Humayun Kabir, from Chandipur village on charges of abducting a trader on the evening of September 19, 2016, said Rezaul Karim, officer in charge (OC) of Pirganj Police Station in Rangpur. "Later, the police went to Chandipur village, taking Humayun with them to recover arms as per his statement. As the police arrived there, Humayun's cohorts snatched him away, firing several gunshots. The police also fired back, leaving Humayun dead on the spot.

data.name: Farid Khokon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Deceased Farid, also known as Khokon, was the ringleader of a robber group locally known as "Khokon Bahani," according to our Barisal correspondent, Harun-or Rashid, the acting officer-in-charge of Bakerganj Police Station. He was wanted in 16 cases, including murder, robbery, and blasts, the OC said. Farid, the son of Zabed Ali from Maheshpur village in Bakerganj, was arrested yesterday morning from a hideout in the upazila, the OC said. Based on his information, police, led by Assistant Superintendent of Barisal Police (ASP) Sahabuddin Kabir, raided Pourasava Govt Primary School under ward No. 7 around 1:00 am, the police official said. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, his cohorts opened fire, targeting the police and forcing them to retaliate. "Farid came in the line of fire and suffered bullet wounds," the OC added. He was taken to Bakerganj Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead. Police recovered a shutter gun, a pipe gun, two sharp weapons, and nine bullets from the spot.

data.name: Omar Siraj
data.description: He was arrested by RAB on September 18, 2015, from the UGC office in Agargaon, Dhaka, for leaking questions of medical college and university admission exams. Then, he was taken into RAB custody for interrogation. On October 1, 2015, he fell sick and was taken to the National Heart Disease Institute. Unfortunately, he passed away in the hospital on that day. The family alleges that he died due to torture.

data.name: Shah Alam Nayan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Shah Alam Nayan, aged 42, the organizing secretary of the Savar municipality unit Jubo Dal, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. SM Kamruzzaman, OC of Savar Police Station, said a team picked him up from Mohammadpur in the capital and took him to a nursery of Krishibid Foundation in the Birulia area around 2:30 am to recover firearms. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire on the police, who also retaliated. At one stage, Nayan was shot, the police said. He was rushed to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. The police claimed he used to run a drug racket in Savar, Ashulia, and Amin Bazar on the outskirts of the capital. However, his family members alleged that the police "shot him dead" for his political affiliation with the BNP and also for money and then cooked up a story.

data.name: Nizam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber was killed and three policemen were injured in a "gunfight" with the police at Bibirhat of Ramgati upazila of Lakshmipur on October 1, 2016. The deceased was identified as Nizam, 28, son of Abdus Salam of Char Jabbar in Noakhali district. Iqbal Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Ramgati Police Station, said Nizam was arrested in Boyar Char area in Ramgati on the night of September 30, 2016. Based on his information, the police took him to the Bibirhat area to arrest his accomplices, who opened fire on the law enforcers. The police retaliated with gunshots, and Nizam was killed in the "crossfire".

data.name: Nurun Nabi
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight with members of RAB in Tangail on October 3, 2016. The deceased is Nurun Nabi, also known as Munshi, aged 35, from the Thanapara area in the town.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The family alleges that a group of plainclothes men picked up Delwar Hossain on October 9 at around 11:00 pm from a road near his house. The next day, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police early in the morning. The police claim that he was killed in a gunfight. According to the Daily Star, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with the police in the Uttar Koroya area of Raipur upazila in Laxmipur early today. The deceased has been identified as Delwar Hossain Rajon, son of the late Syed Ahmmed. He is accused in three arms and eight robbery cases. Md Lokman Hossain, the officer-in-charge of Raipur Police Station, said the police arrested the listed robber Rajon from the area early yesterday. Later, the police conducted a drive with Rajon in the area around 4:00 am today. Sensing the presence of the police, his cohorts opened fire at them. In retaliation, the law enforcers also fired back, which triggered a gunfight. Rajon was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Meanwhile, five police personnel were injured in the incident. The police also recovered a light gun (LG), three rounds of bullets, and three machetes from the spot.

data.name: Mahbub Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged leader of a robbery group, Mahbub Alam (45), was shot during an alleged gunfight with the police and later died in a hospital, according to Mymensingh Police Super Syed Nurul Islam, who spoke at a press conference on Thursday.

data.name: Manik Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On October 13, 2016, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police after 26 hours of his arrest. The Daily Star reported that an alleged robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in Sarail upazila of Brahmanbaria early today. The deceased, Manik Mia, 36, hailed from Chunta union and was the ringleader of an inter-district robber gang, according to the police. Bangla daily Prothom Alo also reported on this. He was arrested around 11:00 pm on Wednesday while preparing to commit a robbery. Rupak Kumar Saha, the officer-in-charge of Sarail Police Station, informed Prothom Alo that a gang of 15 to 20 robbers was planning to carry out a robbery at an expatriate's house in Lambahati village of Pakshimul union around 11:00 pm on Wednesday night. Upon hearing the screams of villagers, the police rushed to the scene. The robbers opened fire at the police while attempting to flee, according to the official. The police arrested Manik and seven others from the spot, along with firearms. Later, a police team, accompanied by Manik, was going to recover arms from different villages of Pakshimul union at night when a gang of robbers attacked the police and opened fire in an attempt to seize him in the Brammongaon area around 1:00 am, the police official added. The police retaliated with gunfire, triggering a 'gunfight'. At one stage, Manik was critically wounded as a bullet shot by the miscreants hit him. He was rushed to Sadar Hospital, where the duty doctor declared him dead. The OC added that SI Abdul Alim, ASI Amzad Hossain and Shah Alam, police constable Rabiul Alam, and Faruk Mia were also injured during the 'gunfight'. Two pipe guns, two rounds of bullets, and two sharp weapons were recovered from the scene. Manik was accused in 10 cases filed with Sarail Police Station, including murder and robbery.

data.name: Unidentified
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An armed member of the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) was killed in a gunfight with a team of joint forces in Khagrachhari Sadar upazila on the evening of October 14, 2016. However, the identity of the victim could not be immediately determined. Lt. Col Mohammad Rashidul Hasan, director of ISPR, stated that the forces became aware that approximately 15-20 armed members of UPDF were having a secret meeting with their party chief at Kutukchhari. They were planning to engage in subversive activities in various areas. After the meeting, they returned to their hideout, as stated in the ISPR's statement. A team of forces went to Datkupia and Bhuachhari areas around 6:00 pm, discovered the hideout, and surrounded it, according to the statement. Upon sensing the presence of the forces, the criminals opened fire. The joint forces retaliated, resulting in a gunfight. During the exchange, a member of the UPDF was killed. The others managed to escape, the statement concluded.

data.name: Abul Bashar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A Jamaat-e-Islami activist was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and the police in Satkania upazila, Chittagong on the morning of October 16, 2016. The deceased, identified as Abul Bashar, 40, son of the late Dudu Mia of Kanchana area of the upazila, was involved with Jamaat-e-Islami, according to the police. They also stated that eight police personnel were injured in the gunfight and received primary treatment at the local health complex. Farid Uddin Khandakar, Officer-in-Charge of Satkania Police Station, said a police team arrested Bashar in Banshkhali upazila on the evening of October 15, 2016. After preliminary interrogation, the police conducted a raid with the arrestee in Chhonkhola area of Eochia union around 6:30 am on October 16, 2016. When his cohorts sensed their presence, they opened fire at the police force. The police fired back, resulting in a gunfight, and at one point Bashar was injured by a bullet. He was sent to Satkania Upazila Health Complex where the duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Sabuj Hossain
data.description: Two individuals accused in a schoolboy murder case were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga on October 20, 2016. The deceased are Sabuj Hossain, 23, from the C&B area in Chuadanga town, and Shakil Hossain, 21, from Darshana town in the district. Both were accused in the murder case of Mahfuz Alam Sajib. Major Monir Ahmmed, Deputy Director of RAB-6 in Jhenaidah, stated that a RAB team initiated a raid in the Shantipara area of the upazila around 2:45 am after receiving information that a group of criminals were holding a meeting there. Upon sensing the presence of RAB members, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the RAB team to retaliate with gunfire. Eventually, the criminals fled the scene. The RAB team subsequently conducted a search of the area and discovered the bodies of Sabuj and Shakil.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: On October 20, 2016, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight by members of RAB-11 in Siddhirganj, Narayanganj. According to The Daily Star, a suspected criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) at Burma Stand in Siddhirganj upazila of Narayanganj early Sunday. The deceased was identified as Delu, also known as Master Delu, a top terrorist in the area, according to the police. Delu and his cohorts were preparing to commit a robbery at Barma Stand at night, said M Sharafatullah, officer-in-charge of Siddhirganj Police Station. After receiving a tip-off, a team of RAB conducted a raid. However, upon sensing the presence of the elite force members, Delu and his associates opened fire at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight around 3:30 am, the OC said. During the altercation, Delu sustained bullet injuries. He was later taken to a private clinic where doctors declared him dead. Delu was wanted in 11 cases filed with several police stations, including robbery, drug peddling, and arms smuggling.

data.name: Rasel Dewan
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Kurgaon area under the Ashulia police station in Dhaka on October 23, 2016. The deceased was identified as Rasel Dewan, aged 32, son of Piyar Ali from the Niribili area of Ashulia. Ashulia police officer-in-charge Mohsinul Quadir said that acting on a tip-off, a team of Ashulia police arrested Rasel on the night of October 22, 2016. Later, the police team, along with Rasel, went to the Kurgaon area to recover illegal firearms and apprehend his accomplices. The OC claimed that criminals opened fire at them after they arrived in the area at about 3:30 am, and the gunfight ensued as the police retaliated. Rasel received bullet injuries in the clash while his accomplices managed to escape. The OC said that they first took him to Ganosasthya Kendra and later to Savar Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Biplob Kumar Bepary allias Bipul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two alleged members of the outlawed Naxal Bahini were killed in a shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion on October 28, 2016, claimed RAB. The incident took place in the Goyeshbari area under Ataikula in Santhia upazila. One of the deceased was identified as Biplob Kumar Bepary, also known as Bipul, 28, son of Abdul Pramanik from Bil Shalangi village. The other was Moyen Uddin, 27, son of Motaleb Hossain from Paiksha village under Ataikula of Santhia upazila in the district, according to RAB. Acting on a tip-off that members of the outlawed party were holding a secret meeting near Goyeshbari Government Primary School, a RAB team was sent there, said Bina Rani Das, commander of RAB12 in Pabna. The RAB team was shot at when they raided the place around 4:00 am. The RAB team fired back.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On October 29, 2016, three alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with members of RAB-7. The deceased, although not yet identified, have been labeled as robbers by law enforcement officials. According to RAB, a microbus carrying members of RAB-7 was attacked by robbers around 2:30 am in Nizampur of Mirsarai on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway. The law enforcers were patrolling the area in plain clothes at the time. The robbers set up barricades and fired at the vehicle, stated Chandan Debnath, Assistant Director of RAB-7. The RAB personnel retaliated. Minutes later, when the gunfight ceased, three of the attackers were found with bullet wounds, Chandan said. The injured were taken to Mirsarai Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.description: On October 29, 2016, two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with police at Gobindgunia on the Kushtia-Pabna highway in Kushtia. In Kushtia, the police, having been tipped off, conducted a drive at Gobindgunia on the Kushtia-Pabna highway. The incident left two robbers dead on the spot while their associates fled.

data.name: Kulu Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected member of the banned extremist outfit Jamaatul Mujahideen Bangladesh was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Kaburhat, Kushtia on October 31, 2016, according to police. The deceased was Kulu Mollah, aged 30, a resident of Khajanagar under Sadar Upazila and a regional commander of JMB, said the Detective Branch of Kushtia police. The Daily Star reported that a regional commander of the banned militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) was killed in a gunfight with law enforcement in Kushtia Sadar Upazila early today, according to police. The deceased, Tulu Mollah, 33, of Khajanagar village in the upazila, was a regional leader of JMB, according to Sabbirul Islam, officer-in-charge of local Detective Police. Police recovered a foreign-made pistol, two rounds of bullets, three machetes, and some cartridges from the scene, he said. Police claimed that four detectives -- Sub-Inspector Abdul Halim, Assistant Sub Inspector Abdur Rashid, Constable Alim, and Saiful -- were injured in the incident. The incident took place inside a rice mill, reportedly a secret hideout of the outfit, the OC said. A team of detectives rushed to the scene and cordoned it off around 3:30 am after receiving information that militants were holding a meeting there, the OC said. Sensing the presence of the policemen, the militants opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire, which triggered the "gunfight," he said. The detectives found Talu Mollah lying at the scene and sent him to Kushtia General Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the DB official said. Detectives gathered information from three JMB men, Azizul Islam, Taz Uddin, and Saidul, during interrogation about a secret meeting by JMB for committing sabotage activities in the area. They arranged the meeting to be held at the abandoned rice mill owned by one Abdus Sobhan of the area, the police official said. The three JMB men are in Kushtia jail. Police took them into remand on Saturday, he added.

data.name: Jasim Uddin Khokon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On the night of July 10th, around 3 a.m., another young man named Jaseem Uddin Khokon (35) was killed in a gunfight in the Ramu tea garden area. The deceased, Khokon, was the son of the late Wahidul Alam from Bharuakhali West Para area of Cox's Bazar Sadar Upazila. Police have claimed that Jaseem Uddin Khokon was a notorious robber.

data.name: Alal Miah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Habiganj on November 9, 2016. The deceased was identified as Alal Miah, 25, son of Rahmat Ali from the village of Sultansi in Habiganj Sadar Upazila. Habiganj Sadar Police Officer-in-Charge Yasinul Haque said that a gang of suspected robbers made a sudden attack on a patrol team of the police at around 3:00 am while the lawmen were patrolling in the Machhulia area near the River Khoai, leaving four policemen injured. The gunfight took place as the police retaliated by firing, the OC said. Later, the body of Alal, who had received bullet injuries, was recovered from the spot. He added that it was sent to Habiganj Sadar Hospital morgue for post-mortem examinations.

data.name: Manik
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Three people were shot dead by police during clashes on November 14, 2016, between two local groups of the ruling Awami League and the police in four contiguous villages in Nilokhiya union, Raipura, Narsingdi. Relatives of the deceased alleged that Manik, Khokon, and Mamun were killed in police firing. New Age reported that at least four people were killed and 35 others injured, including five police officers, during clashes that lasted for five hours starting at 11:30 AM on Monday. The clashes occurred between two local groups of the ruling Awami League and the police in four contiguous villages in Nilokhiya union, Raipura, Narsingdi. The root cause of the clashes, which occur from time to time in the union, leaving many casualties over rivalry for controlling the troubled area with sizeable khas land in newly formed chars, according to locals. Police said clashes were a regular phenomenon in the area. During Monday's clashes, one group was led by union parishad chairman Tajul Islam and the other by former UP chairman Abdul Haque Sarker, both local AL leaders. The deceased include Manik Mia, 42, Mamun, 39, and Shahajahan, 40, of Amirabad village, and Khokna, 38, of Sonakandi village, all supporters of the former UP chairman. Relatives alleged that Manik, Khokon, and Mamun were killed in police firing, while Shahajahan was killed by a spear thrown by rivals. Relatives said that two of them died on the spot and one died on the way to the hospital, all due to police firing. One of them was hit by bullets at Sonakanda, while two were hit at Amirabad, they said. At least 10 houses of supporters of the former UP chairman were set on fire and reduced to ashes, and 20 other houses of his supporters were damaged by rivals, according to locals and the police. Police and witnesses said hundreds of supporters of the new UP chairman, carrying sticks and sharp weapons, led by Sumed Ali, Zakir Hossain, and Abdur Rahim, launched simultaneous attacks on the houses of supporters of the rival camp in Gopinathpur, Birgaon, Amirabd, and Haripur, four contiguous villages at about 11 AM. They said that the attack was a sequel to Sunday's attacks carried out by the supporters of

data.description: Three people were shot dead by the police during triangular clashes on November 14, 2016, between two local groups of the ruling Awami League and the police in four contiguous villages in Nilokhiya union, Raipura, Narsingdi. Relatives of the deceased alleged that Manik, Khokon, and Mamun were killed in police firing.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Lalpole area. The identities of the two could not be determined. Squadron Leader Safaat Jamil Fahim of RAB-7 said that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the area on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway. A team from the battalion conducted a drive there around 2:45 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on the battalion personnel, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a 30-minute gunfight. Two robbers received bullet injuries during the gunfight. They were taken to Feni General Hospital, where the on-duty physician declared them dead.

data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Police claimed that a youth named Jahangir Alam (30) was killed in a 'gunfight' between two groups of criminals. The victim's family alleged that police picked up two brothers, Jahangir Alam (30) and Abid Hasan (27), from their house and shot Jahangir dead. There was no information about the whereabouts of Abid. Abdur Rahman, an uncle of Jahangir Alam, said that on November 18, 2016, at around 1:30 am, some policemen came to their house with three vans and picked up Jahangir and Abid. Later, Jahangir's family searched for them but found no trace. The next day, Abdur Rahman phoned one of his relatives who works at Jessore General Hospital and found out that police had left Jahangir's body in the hospital at around 3:00 am. Jahangir was involved in politics with one group of the Jessore Awami League unit.

data.name: Md Abdul Jabbar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected ringleader of a robber gang was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and the police at village Kalagachhia under Amtoli upazila in Barguna on November 24, 2016. The deceased was identified as Md Abdul Jabbar, 45, son of Amjed Hawlader, a resident of the village. Amtoli Police Station sub-inspector Shah Alam said that on a tip-off, a team of Amtoli police raided the village while the gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery in the area. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the suspected robbers opened fire on them around 3:00 am, prompting the police to retaliate and triggering a gun battle. At one stage, Jabbar sustained gunshot wounds while his cohorts fled the scene, Alam said. Jabbar was taken to Amtoli Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Rustom Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Four suspected robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Pabna on November 25, 2016. According to the Rapid Action Battalion, the four robbers died from bullet injuries they sustained during an exchange of fire when the RAB confronted and chased a gang of 15 to 20 robbers while they were robbing a rice mill at Joynagar in Ishwardi around 3:00 am. Three other suspected robbers, who were injured during the gunfight, were undergoing treatment at Pabna Medical College Hospital. Before succumbing to his injuries, one of the deceased robbers, aged 30, identified himself as Rustom Ali, according to the RAB. The other three deceased individuals, Badsha Miah (32), Shafikul Islam (35), and Monjurul Islam (36), from Mymensingh and Chandpur, were identified by their wounded associates who were apprehended by the RAB.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: An alleged member of the outlawed militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Bagerhat Sadar upazila on November 27, 2016. Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of DB police and Bagerhat Model Thana police raided the Rasulpur Bridge area around 1:00 am, said Pankaj Chandra Roy, Superintendent of Police in Bagerhat. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, miscreants opened fire and hurled crude bombs at the police vehicle, triggering a "gunfight," he added. At one stage, the attackers fled the scene, leaving one of their cohorts with bullet wounds, he informed. The unidentified injured JMB suspect was whisked off to Khulna Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Probitra Samaddar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Rampura in the capital on November 30, 2016. The Rab identified the deceased as Probitra Samaddar, 28, son of Notobor Samaddar from Jhalakathi, and Mohammad Ali Swapan, 30, son of Siraj Mia from Shariatpur. The firefight took place around 2:00 am when a team of RAB raided the Balur Math area of Rampura with information that a gang of criminals would commit robbery at the location, Lt Col Khandakar Golam Sarwar, Commanding Officer of RAB-3, said. The criminals, sensing RAB's presence, started firing shots at the law enforcers in an attempt to flee the scene. The RAB also returned fire, injuring two of the gang members. Other members of the gang managed to escape by the time the shootout was over, the RAB CO added. The RAB, with the assistance of local police, transported the injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Dulal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged ringleader of a robbery gang was killed in a "gunfight" with the RAB when the law enforcers raided a hideout of the criminals in the Jhaoil area near the Bangabandhu Bridge in Sirajganj. The alleged robber, Dulal Hossain, 45, son of Afzal Hossain from Shamsherpur village under Belkuchi upazila, died of bullet injuries after being taken to Sirajganj General Hospital, claimed Hasibul Hasan, commander of RAB-12 at Sirajganj camp. Meanwhile, the ringleader of another robbery gang was killed in a separate "gunfight" with the Rab last night when the law enforcers raided a hideout of the criminals in the Jhaoil area near the Bangabandhu Bridge in Sirajganj. The alleged robber, Dulal Hossain, 45, son of Afzal Hossain from Shamsherpur village under Belkuchi upazila, died of bullet injuries after being taken to Sirajganj General Hospital, claimed Hasibul Hasan, commander of Rab-12 at Sirajganj camp. Dulal was accused in a dozen of cases, including robbery, murder, and other criminal charges, he said, adding that they recovered two firearms and a machete from the spot.

data.name: Abu Hanif
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Jhaubada village in Dhamrai upazila of Dhaka early Monday. The deceased was identified as Abu Hanif, 30, son of Shamsul Haque, hailing from Jhalua village in Kamrangirchar area of the capital. He was accused in nine robbery cases filed with different police stations. Rezaul Haque, officer-in-charge (OC) of Dhamrai Police Station, said that on secret information that a group was preparing to commit robbery, a team of police conducted a raid at the village early in the morning. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire at them, prompting a retaliation that triggered a gunfight. The gunfight left Hanif with a bullet injury while the other members of the gang managed to flee the scene. Later, the injured was taken to the upazila health complex where doctors declared him dead. Police also recovered one pistol from the spot.

data.name: Al Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged bandits were killed on December 7, 2016, during a "gunfight" between an unspecified number of bandits and the Rapid Action Battalion in the eastern Sundarbans under Sharankhola range. Major Adnan Kabir, Deputy Commander of RAB-8, quoting local fishermen, identified the two killed as Al Amin, 45, and Hossain Mollah, 30, who belong to the bandit group "Shamsu Bahini".

data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang

data.name: Yusuf
data.description: Police claimed that on December 11, 2016, at midnight, Yusuf was injured in a gunfight between two groups of miscreants. Later, he died in the morning at Jessore General Hospital during treatment. However, the family claimed that on December 9, 2016, he was picked up from Chachra intersection of the city. Then, the police demanded 5 lakh taka from the family members. As they did not give the money to the police, the police shot Yusuf in the leg. Later, he died in the hospital.

data.name: Dalim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A pirate was killed and a police constable injured in a "gunfight" between pirates and law enforcers in the Meghna River near Sreemoddi area of Homna upazila here on Saturday evening. Police also arrested two alleged pirates in connection with this incident. The deceased was identified as Dalim, 24, of Kalshindhu village under Araihajar upazila in Narayanganj district. Sources said that a team of police, led by Sub-Inspector (SI) Quamrul Islam of Homna Police Station, raided the area when some pirates were preparing to commit robbery in some trawlers at 5:30 pm and arrested two pirates. However, other pirates tried to snatch away the arrested individuals from the police and threw cocktails at them, leaving Constable Jamal Mollah, 33, injured. Police retaliated with counter shots, triggering a gunfight that left Dalim shot and seriously injured. Later, he died on the way to Dhaka. Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Homna Police Station, Rasul Ahmed Nizami, said that during the gunfight, they arrested Robiul, 28, son of Anisur Rahman, and Jewel, 29, son of Badsha Mia, both from Chandanpur village of the upazila. Police also recovered one LG, one 7.56 bore revolver, three rounds of ammunition, seven bombs, three big choppers, one dagger, three speed boats, four helmets, and 10 life jackets from their possession. A case was filed in connection with this incident, the OC added.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: On December 11, 2016, Abdus Salam was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB.

data.name: Sohel Rana
data.description: A 30-year-old man died in the custody of Melandah police in Jamalpur a few hours after his arrest at his house in Paharipatol under Melandah upazila on December 18, 2016. Around 7:30 pm, Sohel fell sick after complaining of severe chest pain while in custody. He was rushed to Melandah Upazila Health Complex. As the on-duty physicians could not read his pulse, they referred him to Jamalpur General Hospital, said police and upazila health complex officials. However, he was brought dead to Jamalpur General Hospital around 8:45 pm, said Ferdous Hassan, Resident Medical Officer. On December 19, 2016, at noon, police sent the body to the hospital's morgue for a post-mortem examination after preparing an inquest report in the presence of executive magistrate Mohammad Imranul Haque, said Mazharul Karim, OC of the police station. The executive magistrate said no injury marks were found on the body of the deceased. Meanwhile, the victim's family members alleged that Sohel was tortured to death by the police while he was in their custody, said local union parishad chairman Mominul Haque Babu, quoting a member of his family. "They (family members) claimed that Sohel was quite well when he was arrested," he said. Melandah police denied the allegation.

data.name: Shahadat Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The police in Faridpur recovered the bullet-riddled body of a 33-year-old man named Shahadat Sheikh. The discovery was made on Thursday morning near a brick kiln in Lakshmipur village, situated within the Kanipur Union of Faridpur Sadar. According to family members, locals, and a representative, Shahadat and his nephew had been forcibly taken from their home by the police last Wednesday. Following this, Shahadat's body was found bearing gunshot wounds. While the police categorically denied any involvement in Shahadat's death, they claimed that he had been implicated in a bus robbery on the Dhaka-Khulna highway in Madhukhali, Faridpur, the previous Tuesday night. OC Nazim Uddin Ahmed of Faridpur Kotwali police station provided further details, stating that locals found Shahadat's body on Thursday morning near KB Bricks in Kanipur. The police then recovered the body and transferred it to the morgue at Faridpur Medical College Hospital for an autopsy.

data.name: Dulal Matubbor
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber named Dulal Matubbor (40) has died while under treatment at Faridpur Medical College Hospital after being injured in police gunfire in Kashiani, Gopalganj. The robbery suspect died on Saturday evening. He was the son of Ranga Mia from the Salta sub-district in Faridpur. The Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Kashiani police station, AKM Alinur Hossen, informed that late on Saturday night, while preparing for a highway robbery on the Dhaka-Khulna highway at Panchaboti, the thieves were challenged by the police. At that time, the robbers opened fire at the police, who returned fire in self-defense. Dulal was arrested in an injured condition from the scene. As his condition deteriorated, he was admitted to Faridpur Medical College Hospital, where he later succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Sharif Mia
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police at Ashuganj, Brahmanbaria on December 25, 2016.

data.name: Kashem Khalifa
data.description: In Kushtia, allegations have surfaced of an elderly man's death due to police beating. The deceased, Kashem Khalifa (67), was a resident of Koburhat in the Sadar Upazila. His daughter, Rina Khatun (35), reported the incident, which allegedly occurred on Sunday afternoon. However, Kushtia Model Police Station has denied the allegations. Rina Khatun stated, "Around 4:30 in the afternoon, SI Azizur Rahman of Kushtia Model Police Station came to our house and called my father. He started shouting as he said he had come to arrest my father in a land-related case. When my father went to show Aziz the documents related to the case, he threw them away and pushed my father to the ground, then started beating him with a rifle before taking him away." OC Shahabuddin Chowdhury of Kushtia Model Police Station has claimed that the elderly man was not tortured. He stated that the accused Kashem was arrested in a land-related case. On the way to the station, the accused fell ill, and he was taken to Kushtia Sadar Hospital, where he died while undergoing treatment.

data.name: Md Abdul Khaleque Biswas
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Robbery suspect killed in Rajbari 'gunfight'. A man was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police on the Rajbari-Kushtia highway at Kalibari point in Rajbari early Thursday, claimed the police. The deceased was Md Abdul Khaleque Biswas, 55, of Dhekipara under Pangsha in the district. Biswas was wanted in at least six highway robbery cases and had served 10 years in prison in a robbery case, said Rajbari police officer-in-charge Abul Bashar Mia. The police officer told New Age that they had been tipped off about a planned robbery on the highway by felling trees. According to the police, as they reached the spot, the robbers opened fire on them and they fired back at about 3:30 am. The police later found Biswas critically wounded and took him to Rajbari Sadar Hospital where he was pronounced dead. The police claimed to have seized a shooter gun, two rounds of bullets, and six sharp weapons from the spot. Any confirmation of the incident from the deceased's family was not available. TDS: 2 'robbers' killed in Noakhali, Rajbari Two alleged robbers were killed in separate incidents in Noakhali and Rajbari yesterday. In Noakhali, a suspected robber was beaten to death by a mob at Chhobirpaik in Kabirhat upazila early yesterday morning. For all the latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel. The deceased was Shahabuddin, 35, of Ewazbalia union in Sadar upazila, reports our Noakhali correspondent. On Wednesday night, 10 to 12 masked robbers stormed the house of one Humayun Kabir at Chhobirpaik. They held the members of the house hostage at gunpoint and looted cash and gold ornaments. After the robbers left, the members screamed for help. Locals then made an announcement about the incident over the loudspeaker of a mosque, prompting people to chase the robbers. They managed to catch Shahabuddin and gave him a good beating. The other managed to flee. Injured Shahabudin was taken to Noakhali General Hospital where he died yesterday morning, said Nibhu Ranjan Datta, sub-inspector of Kabirhat Police Station. Moktar Hossain,

data.name: Abul Bashar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with the police on the morning of December 31, 2016. The victim was Abdul Bashar, a resident of the village Sonapur under the district's Sadar upazila. According to the police, the "gunfight" broke out as the police reached the Kajjalipur area under Sadar upazila to prevent a robbery attempt. The robbers opened fire as they sensed the presence of the police. New Age: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Sonapur in Lakshmipur Sadar early Saturday. The deceased was identified as Bashar, son of Sayed Ahmad, a resident of the village Kazzalipur. He is said to be the chief of the notorious terrorist gang 'Bashar Bahini'. Abdullah Al Mamun Bhuiyan, officer-in-charge of Sadar police station, said that acting on secret information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery in the area, a team of police conducted a raid there around 1:30 am. Sensing danger, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting a retaliation that triggered a gunfight. At one stage, Bashar was caught in the line of fire and injured while others managed to flee the scene. He was taken to Lakshmipur General Hospital where physicians declared him dead. Three police personnel — sub-inspector Omar Faruk, and constables Kuddus and Utpal — were also injured in the incident. Police also recovered a locally made gun, some sharp weapons, and five bullets from the scene. Bashar was wanted in 15 cases filed for robbery, murder, and kidnapping, said the police officer-in-charge.

data.name: Rabiul Badsha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police and members of his gang on July 1, 2017, at Madrasa Road in Chuknagar, under Dumuria upazila of Khulna. The deceased man was identified as 35-year-old Rabiul, also known as Badsha, son of Jaffar Sheikh from the village of Malotia, under Dumuria upazila of the district. According to the police, he was the leader of a band of robbers. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Charge of Dumuria Police Station, said that Rabiul was arrested on June 30, 2017. He confessed to possessing illegal firearms, and based on the information extracted from him, the police raided the area in the early hours of July 1, 2017. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Rabiul's cohorts opened fire on the police, and they retaliated, resulting in Rabiul being shot dead.

data.name: Bishwa Chandra Dey
data.description: On October 1, S.I. Suman of Nalitabari Police Station detained Bishwa with 60 grams of Ganja and took him to the police station. During that time, they beat him mercilessly, leaving him critically injured. However, the police released him. Later, he succumbed to his injuries at around 2:00 am. Bishwa's sister, Sheuly Dey, alleged that he was killed by police torture.

data.name: Mohammad Russel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: The body of one man has been recovered after a shootout between bandits in Jessore. The dead man has been identified as 25-year-old 'Rasel' alias 'Roni', the son of Kumor Ali of Chaugaccha Upazila's Mathparha. Police received news around 2:30 am on Tuesday that two gangs of bandits were engaged in a shootout at Joghati on the Jessore-Chaugaccha Highway, said Jessore Kotwali Model Police Station OC Ilias Hossain. "When the police arrived at the spot, they found one person lying on the ground. He was taken to Jessore Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead," said OC Ilias. Police recovered a firearm, a bullet, ropes, and sharp weapons from the spot, the OC said. The man who the police brought to the hospital around 2:30 am had died before he arrived, said Dr. Kajol Mollik told bdnews24.com. Chaugaccha Police Station OC Mashiur Rahman confirmed the identity of the deceased and said that Rasel had eight cases pending against him and had been accused of robbery.

data.name: Jalal Uddin
data.description: On January 15, 2017, Jalal Uddin was allegedly shot to death by police in Narsingdi. At least 15 people, including 5 policemen, were injured, some sustaining bullet injuries, when police opened fire during a clash with Baul supporters in the remote Darikandi village under Nilokhya union in Raipura upazila of Narsingdi last evening. The condition of two of the injured was said to be critical. According to local people, medical sources, and police, Baul Abdul Khaleque Fakir died 40 days ago. His followers, led by Abdul Hadi of Darkandi village, organized his 'chehlam' and the singing of Baul songs at his house for two days. Yesterday, they offered a mass meal and slaughtered a cow. The people and the organizers publicized the event, and several shops were set up at the place. However, a team of riot police from the Raipura police station attacked the 'pandal' (a large tent) and smashed the stage and furniture. As news of the police action spread, hundreds of irate supporters of the Baul arrived at the spot, resulting in a clash. Stones were pelted at the law enforcement personnel. The police finally opened fire, injuring 10 people. Local villagers rushed the wounded to the Narsingdi Sadar Hospital. Later, doctors there referred two men, identified as Jalal Uddin and Shamsu Mia, to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) because of their critical condition. The officer-in-charge (OC) of Raipura and the assistant superintendent of police did not respond when efforts were made to contact them for their comments.

data.name: Abdur Razzak
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A "top outlaw" was killed in an alleged shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion in Santhia upazila of Pabna early Monday. Abdur Razzak, 42, of Bilshalangi village in the upazila, was a regional leader of a faction of the outlawed Purba Bangla Communist Party, according to Rab. Bina Rani Das, commander of Rab-12 (Pabna camp), said that acting on a tip-off that Razzak and his accomplices were preparing for a robbery, a Rab team raided the Haludgar Bazar area around 4:00 am on Monday. Sensing the presence of Rab, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate by firing back, leading to a gunfight, Bina said. Razzak died after being shot, but the accomplices escaped. His body was sent to Pabna Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Amirul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged member of the outlawed Gono Bahini (GB) was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Alampur, under the Sadar upazila of the district, on January 19, 2017. The victim was identified as Amirul Islam, 45, from Ambaria village in Mirpur upazila. The police stated that the deceased was a listed robber and the second-in-command of the notorious GB leader Serajul Islam's "Seraj Bahini.

data.name: Abul Kalam
data.description: On January 20, 2017, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber died at Rangpur Medical College Hospital on January 26, 2017, three days after being injured in a police firing at village Magurmari under Panchagarah Sadar. He was undergoing treatment in the hospital under police custody. The deceased was Delwar Hossain, 41, from village Magurmari. Delwar died at RMCH around 7:30 am on January 26, 2017, according to Bhajanpur highway police officer-in-charge Enamul Huq. On January 23, the police officer claimed that the highway police had signaled a motorcycle without a number plate to stop while checking vehicle documents at Magurmari. Instead of stopping, the rider crossed the police check post. Enamul added that Delwar later returned with his associates and as they tried to attack the police with sharp weapons, the police personnel opened fire and one of the bullets hit his waist. He was then rescued and taken to RMCH, where he died.

data.name: Sharif Hossain
data.description: A man who was accused of shooting two policemen was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Atghoria upazila of Pabna on January 29, 2017. The deceased, Sharif Hossain, 30, from Gaspara village in Pabna Sadar upazila, was one of the main suspects in the shooting of two on-duty policemen in the Dangergram area of Atghoria upazila. According to a second source, a suspect involved in the shooting of two police officers was killed in a shootout in Pabna's Atghoria. The shootout took place near a small bridge in the Shutir Bil area around 4am on Sunday, as stated by Pabla Additional Superintendent of Police Gautam Kumar Biswas. The deceased is 25-year-old Sharif Hossain, a resident of Gachparha. He is listed as a 'criminal' in police documents and is the prime suspect in the attempted murder of two police sub-inspectors in Dengargram, Atghoria, on January 25, according to Police Superintendent Biswas. A police raid was conducted in the Shutir Bil area after receiving information about the presence of the attackers. "The criminals fired at the police team upon their arrival, and the police returned fire. Sharif's dead body was found at the scene after his accomplices fled," said Biswas. A firearm, sharp weapons, and bullets were recovered from the location, added the police superintendent. Sharif's body has been sent to the Pabna Sadar Hospital morgue. Three police officers were injured in the shootout and are currently receiving treatment at Pabna Sadar Hospital, Biswas confirmed. Last Wednesday, two police officers were injured in Atghoria Upazila when criminals opened fire. Injured police sub-inspector Tofazzal Hossain named three suspects and accused three to four other unidentified attackers in two separate cases.

data.name: Rahat Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Mithapukur upazila of Rangpur on January 2, 2017. The deceased is Rahat Hossain, 32, of Bujruk-Shontoshpur village in the upazila. Humayun Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Mithapukur Police Station, said that based on information, police arrested Rahat at his home around 10:30 pm on January 1, 2017. After gathering information from Rahat, police went to recover firearms and took Rahat with them. When the police van reached near a bridge in Bheluarmor around 5:00 am, some robbers opened fire to snatch him. Police then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Rahat was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Banglanews: Robber killed in Rangpur 'gunfight' Robber killed in Rangpur 'gunfight' RANGPUR: A robber was killed in an alleged shootout with police members in Shukurerhat area under Mithapukur upazila of the district on Monday (January 2). The deceased was identified as Rahat Hussain, son of the late Shahidulla, hailed from Buzruk Shantuspur village of the area. Mithapukur thana officer-in-charge (OC) M Humayun Kabir confirmed the matter to Banglanews. The police team conducted a drive in the area to catch the accomplices of Rahat, who was arrested on Sunday and informed the matter. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robber opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, Rahat was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while his cohorts managed to flee. Two police members -- SI Shapon and constable Momin -- sustained bullet injuries in the incident, OC added. The body was sent to Rangpur Medical College morgue, he added. However, a case was filed with the thana in this connection.

data.name: Moshiur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Rangpur, two "robbers" identified as Moshiur Rahman, 37, from Alampur under Taraganj upazila and Bijoy Chandra, 32, from Kursha-Boloram under Rangpur Sadar upazila, died during a "gun battle" that took place near Lengtisera Bridge on Dinajpur-Rangpur highway in Taraganj upazila. According to the police, they dispatched a team to the spot on information that a 10-member gang of highway robbers, including Moshiur and Bijoy, were getting ready to rob passengers in vehicles on the highway. As soon as they arrived at the scene around 3:00 am, the gang started to retreat while firing gunshots at the law enforcers. The two "robbers" died on the spot as the police also returned fire, said Abdul Latif, officer-in-charge of Taraganj Police Station. DAILY STAR: Three alleged criminals were killed in separate "gunfights" with the police in Rangpur and Magura districts early today. Of them, two alleged robbers -- Moshiur Rahman and Bijoy Chandra -- were killed in Rangpur while Zuban Ali, who was accused in 13 cases, was killed in Magura, reports our Dinajpur and Magura correspondents. In Rangpur, a police team on information raided the Lengtisera bridge area on Dinajpur-Rangpur highway in Taraganj upazila as 10 members of a robber gang were taking preparation there, according to local police. As soon as the law enforcers reached there around 3:00 am, the robbers fired shots. In retaliation, the police fired back, triggering a "gunfight" that left Moshiur and Bijoy dead on the spot, said Abdul Latif, officer-in-charge of Taraganj Police Station. Later, the police recovered their bodies and sent them to Rangpur Medical College Hospital for autopsy. In Magura, an alleged drug trader was killed and four police personnel were injured in another "gunfight" with law-enforcers in the district's Sadar upazila early today. The deceased, Zuban, was accused in 13 different cases, our Magura correspondent reports quoting the police. data.name: Zuban Ali
data.description: In Magura, an alleged drug trader was killed and four police personnel were injured in another "gunfight" with law enforcers in the district's Sadar upazila early today. The deceased, Zuban, was accused in 13 different cases, according to our Magura correspondent who quotes the police. A patrol team of police noticed some people holding a clandestine meeting beside Magura-Binodpur road, said Sudarshan Roy, additional police superintendent (circle) of the district police. Upon seeing their suspicious movement, the police team challenged them, he said. The miscreants opened fire at the police, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire in self-defense, the ASP also said. Later, Zuban was found lying on the ground, but his cohorts managed to flee the scene, he said. He was rushed to Magura Sadar Hospital where he was pronounced dead, Sudarshan said.

data.name: Amijul Al Amin Rony
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected neo-JMB member was killed in a reported gunfight with police in Jamnagar, Sherpur upazila on March 2, 2017. The deceased was identified as Amijul alias Al Amin Rony, chief of neo-JMB in the northern region and son of Nurul Islam, a resident of Bujrum Radharampur village in Godagari upazila of Rajshahi. Tipped off, a police team conducted a raid in the area when Amijul and his associates were there around 3:00 am, said Sonatan Chakrabarty, Additional Superintendent of Police. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, they opened fire on them, forcing the police to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. Amijul was caught in the line of fire and injured while his associates managed to flee the scene. Amijul was taken to Bogra Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. Police sent the body to the hospital morgue for autopsy. The Daily Star reported that Amijul Islam, killed in a "gunfight" with police in Bogra early on Thursday, was coordinating the activities of "Neo JMB" militants across the country and reorganizing the outfit's military wing, according to police. He was made the organization's North Bengal chief based on "seniority and expertise in military tactics" after the law enforcers had arrested his predecessor Fazlur Rahman Taher alias Raj in Chandpur Pabnapara village of Natore on January 13, Superintendent of Bogra police Md Asaduzzaman told The Daily Star yesterday. The country's northern region is considered a stronghold of militants, the SP added. A police press release said Amijul was killed in a "gunfight" at Jamnagar in Bogra's Sherpur upazila. Taking him along, a police team went there to recover arms. The "gunfight" ensued around 3:00 am when some "unidentified terrorists" tried to snatch Amijul. As he tried to flee, he was caught in the line of fire, read the release. Law enforcers recovered a pistol, two magazines, and three bullets from the spot. His body was later sent to Shahid Ziaur Rahman Medical College in Bogra for an autopsy. A team of the Bogra Detective Branch of police arrested the 24-year

data.name: Billal Mir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected forest robber has been killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Sundarbans. The gunfight took place at Sukhpara Char area of Sharankhola range under the east Sundarbans early Thursday. The deceased, Billal Mir alias Kana Billal, was a member of the 'Samsu Bahini', an infamous forest robber gang. Deputy Commander of RAB-8, Major Adnan Kabir, said a team from RAB-8 in Barisal conducted a raid in the area to arrest robbers in the early hours of Thursday. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. Billal was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while the others managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Bulbul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A "gunfight" between "robbers" and the Detective Branch of Police (DB) took place at Khetabari in the upazila around 3:30 am. Robber Bulbul Islam, also known as "Builla," from Kalisima village in the upazila, was found dead after the shootout, said Ali Arshad, the officer-in-charge of Bijoynagar Police Station. The police stated that Bulbul was accused in five cases. According to the Daily Sun, a suspected drug peddler and a robber were killed in separate incidents of a "gunfight" with the police in Bijoynagar upazila early Thursday. The deceased were identified as drug peddler Nurul Islam and robber Bulbul. Ali Arshad, the officer-in-charge of Bijoynagar Police Station, said the police arrested Nurul Islam from the Singabil area on Wednesday night. After gathering information during a preliminary interrogation, a team of police, along with Nurul, conducted a raid in the Merashani Bazar area in the early morning. When the team reached the area, his associates opened fire on the police, prompting the law enforcers to fire back, triggering a gunfight. Nurul died on the spot during the exchange of fire. The police also recovered two kilograms of hemp, a pipe gun, two-round cartridges, and two machetes from the scene. Additionally, Bulbul was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and the police as a team of police conducted a raid on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway in the Khetabari area while a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery early in the morning. Mofiz Uddin, the officer-in-charge of the detective branch of police, said that a policeman was also injured in the gunfight.

data.name: Moktar Hossain Amir
data.description: Moktar Hossain, also known as Lengra Amir, the main suspect in the Parag abduction case in Keraniganj, was killed in an alleged encounter with the police at Mirerbag area in South Keraniganj, Dhaka. The incident occurred around 1:45 am on August 1st.

data.name: Saiful Islam Jhilki
data.description: Saiful Islam Jhilki, 32, son of Motiur Rahman and a resident of Madaritula village in the upazila, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police in Baniyachong upazila, Habiganj.

data.name: Shahjalal Miji
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and law enforcement in Munshiganj town on February 13, 2017. The deceased is Shahjalal Miji, 33, from the Dakkhin Courtgaon area in the town. Jayedul Alam, superintendent of Munshiganj police, said Shahjalal was arrested in the Dakkhin Courtgaon area at around 5:00 pm on February 12, 2017. Based on information obtained from Shahjalal, a team of the Detective Branch of police and local police was going to the Baikhar area in the town to recover firearms, said the police. Shahjalal was with the law enforcement officers. When they reached the Parulpara area around 2:30 am, approximately 10 to 12 accomplices of Shahjalal suddenly opened fire and attempted to snatch Shahjalal from them, said the police. The police then returned fire, resulting in a "gunfight". After the gun battle, the police found the bullet-ridden body of Shahjalal. They took him to Munshiganj General Hospital where doctors declared him dead...... Independent: A suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and the police at Boikhor in Munshiganj district town early yesterday, reports UNB. The deceased was identified as Shahjalal Miji, an accused in 22 cases filed with different police stations in the district. The police superintendent of the district, Mohammad Jayedul Alam, said Miji was arrested on Sunday afternoon and the police, acting on his statement, conducted a raid in the area the following day to recover weapons. Sensing the presence of the police, Alam said his associates opened fire, prompting the law enforcement officers to fire back, resulting in a gunfight. Later, the police recovered Miji's bullet-ridden body from the scene. The police recovered two pistols and two sharp weapons from the scene. Three policemen were also injured in the gunfight. data.description: A "criminal" was killed in a gunfight between criminals and an army patrol in Naikkhong Mukh Para in the district's Lama upazila on February 13, 2017. The identity of the deceased could not be known at the time of filing this report. Major Mustafizur Rahman, acting commander of Alikadom zone, said the deceased, a member of Parbatya Chattagram Jana Sanghati Samiti (PCJSS), was in army uniform. The army patrol cordoned off the Naikkhong Mukh Para area around 4:00 pm upon receiving information that an armed gang was present. "Shortly afterwards, the criminals opened fire on the troops. The army men retaliated, firing shots. The two sides fired at least 50 shots during the gunfight that lasted for around 10-15 minutes," added the acting zone commander. According to the Daily Sun, a suspected terrorist was killed and two children suffered bullet wounds in a gunfight between Bangladesh Army personnel and criminals in Lama upazila on Monday. The identity of the deceased could not be immediately determined. An army team took position at Naikkhongmukh of Ruposhipara union on Sunday night following information that a group of terrorists had gathered there, said Major Mehedi Hasan of the Bangladesh Army. The army team encircled the gangsters when they arrived at the spot today at noon to collect extortion money. Sensing danger, the criminals opened fire on the army personnel, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. One terrorist was killed in the gun battle while the rest managed to flee, Mehedi said, adding that two children were injured by bullets fired by the criminals. Two magazines and various equipment were also recovered from the spot. According to Prothom Alo, a suspected terrorist was killed and two children suffered bullet wounds in a gunfight between Bangladesh Army personnel and a group of people in Lama upazila on Monday. The identity of the deceased could not be immediately determined. data.name: Sagar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. Newagebd: A suspected robber was killed early Tuesday in a gunfight between the police and a robber gang in the Tantibazar area of Old Dhaka. The deceased is identified as Sagar from Naria in Sariatpur. Assistant Commissioner of Dhaka Kotwali zone police, Shahen Shah, said Sagar was a wanted offender, so they went to arrest him last night at Tantibazar. But sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Sagar and his associates fired gunshots at them while the police also retaliated, triggering the gunfight, he said. Severely injured Sagar was taken to Sir Salimullah Medical College and Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, he added. Police recovered a pistol and two rounds of bullets from the spot. Thedailystar: In another incident, an alleged robber was killed in what the police claimed to be a gunfight in Shankhari Bazar of old Dhaka. The deceased, Sagor alias Dakat Sagor, stood accused in at least five cases. He died during a raid in Radhika Mohan Boshak Lane around 2:45 am, Shahen Shah Mamun, assistant commissioner (Kotwali zone) of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police, told The Daily Star. A police team went to the spot, acting on a tip-off that some robbers were preparing to commit a robbery at a jewelry shop in Shankhari Bazar, he said. Around 2:30 am, the police team challenged six to seven youths, finding their movement suspicious. They then hurled a crude bomb at the law enforcers. At one stage, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a "gunfight," said the police official. All of the robbers except Sagor managed to flee. He was found lying on the street and taken to Mitford Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the police official said. Police also claimed to have recovered a pistol and two bullets from the spot.

data.name: Abu Musa Samiul

data.description: The deceased, Abu Musa, also known as Abujar, Abu Talha, and Samiul, was 32 years old and served as the chief of the Pabna, Kushtia, Natore, and Sirajganj regions of the "Neo JMB" militant group. Musa was accused in cases related to the killings of homeopath Mir Sanaullah in Kushtia Sadar upazila and shopkeeper Shunil Gomez at Bonpara Bazaar in Natore, according to the police. Nur-e-Alam Siddiki, the officer-in-charge of Kahaloo Police Station, stated that some criminals suddenly opened fire on their van when they reached Patonja village around 2:45 am on February 14, 2017. Musa and his team were returning to the police station after a patrol. In response, the police returned fire, resulting in a "gunfight." After the altercation, they discovered Musa's body at the scene, while the others fled. The Independent reported that an alleged regional commander of the New JMB militant group was killed in a gunfight with law enforcement in the Patanja area of Kahalu upazila in Bogra early yesterday. The deceased was identified as Abu Musa, also known as Abu Jar, Abu Talha, Rabin, and Samiul, a 32-year-old resident of Hemayetpur Betepara village in Pabna sadar upazila. He was the main coordinator of the New JMB in Pabna, Kustia, Natore, and Sirajganj districts and a close associate of Rajib Gandhi, the mastermind behind the Gulshan attack, according to Officer In-charge of Kahalu Police Station, Md Nur-E-Alom Siddique. Abu Musa was the main suspect in the murder case of homeopathic physician Dr. Sanaulla Mia in Kustia and was also accused in the murder of Sunil in Bonpara, Natore district, according to police sources. Upon receiving information that New JMB militants were holding a meeting in the Patanja area, a team of Kahalu police rushed to the scene around 2:30 am yesterday. Sensing the presence of the police, the militants opened fire. The police retaliated, and Abu Musa was injured in the gun battle, stated the OC. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station, said that the police, as part of their regular patrol, went to the spot around 4:00 am.
