data.name: Nizam Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An outlawed party operative was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Bera upazila of Pabna on February 15, 2017, said the police. The deceased, Nizam Uddin alias Nistar, 40, of Kathulia village in Sadar upazila, was a leader of the outlawed Sarbahara Party, said Tazul Huda, officer-in-charge of Aminpur Police Station. Nizam used to run the "Nistar Bahini," which was involved in various criminal activities, including robbery. Nizam was the Secretary of the recently dissolved committee of Jatiya Samajtantrik Dal (JSD-Inu) of Sadar upazila unit, said Kanu Shannal, vice-president of the district unit JSD. Amirul Islam Ranga, president of the JSD unit, said Nizam was not involved with their organization now. OC Tazul said the police went to the Dobirchar area around 3:00 am, acting on information that two gangs -- "Nistar Bahini" and "Julhas Bahini" -- were locked in a gun battle. At one stage, the police opened fire to disperse the criminals and nab them. Nizam was hit by bullets and died on the spot. The others managed to flee, the police official said. DailySun: An extremist leader was killed during a "gunfight" between his team and the police at Bera upazila in Pabna on Tuesday night. The deceased was identified as Nistar Alias Nizam, 40, and a resident of the upazila. The Officer-in-charge (OC) of Aminpur police station of the upazila, Tazul Huda, said that upon being informed, two groups of the team locked into a clash in the area, and the police rushed to the spot. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire at the police, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight, leaving Nizam dead on the spot. The police recovered the body and sent it to the hospital for an autopsy. The police also recovered firearms and weapons from the spot. data.name: Moktar Hossain
data.description: According to The Daily Star, two suspected criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch (DB) of the police in Fatullah, Narayanganj. The deceased are Moktar Hossain, also known as "Killer Moktar," aged 42, and his accomplice Manik, also known as "Killer Manik," aged 40. Moktar was accused in several cases, including murder, according to the police. Acting on a tip-off that some criminals were hiding near Pagla's Sahibazar, a DB team raided the location around 6:30 pm, as stated by Kamaluddin, officer-in-charge of Fatullah Model Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement officers, the criminals opened fire on them. The DB officers fired back in retaliation, resulting in the "gunfight." The deceased were identified as Moktar Hossain, also known as "Killer Moktar," aged 42, and his accomplice Manik, also known as "Killer Manik," aged 40. Moktar was accused in several cases, including murder, according to the police. Acting on a tip-off that some criminals were hiding near Pagla's Sahibazar, a DB team conducted a raid at around 6:30 pm, as stated by Kamaluddin, officer-in-charge of Fatullah Model Police Station. Upon sensing the presence of the law enforcement officers, the criminals opened fire on them. The DB officers fired back in retaliation, resulting in the "gunfight." Two of the attackers were killed instantly, and one DB officer was injured, added Kamaluddin. Abdul Aziz, a 28-year-old assistant sub-inspector of DB, was shot in his right leg and was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, according to Sub-inspector Bacchu Mia, in-charge of the DMCH police outpost.

data.name: Zia Sana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: According to The Daily Star, an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the city's Khoiyabazar area early yesterday. The deceased is Zia Sana, also known as Hat Kata Zia and Bomaru Sana, 45, from Gutudia village in Dumuria. Acting on information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery, a team of police conducted a raid in Khoiyabazar around 2:30 am, said Mizanur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Harintana Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate with gunshots. At one point, Zia was caught in the line of fire and critically injured. The others, however, managed to flee.

data.name: Syedur Rahman Prakash
data.description: Syedur Rahman Prakash, a fugitive convicted gunsmith, was found dead with a bullet wound to the chest following a gunfight during a police raid on an uninhabited hill in Cox's Bazar's Maheshkhali upazila on March 3, 2017. The body of Syedur Rahman, son of Azam Ullah of Boro Maheshkhali union, was sent to the district hospital for an autopsy. A team of 50 policemen, acting on a tip-off, surrounded Keruntol hill and were fired upon around 11:00 am. They retaliated with approximately 40 shots before reaching the camp, said a police official. According to Risingbd, a wanted arms maker was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Kerontali hill area of the district's Moheshkhali upazila on Friday morning. Law enforcers also recovered 13 locally made firearms and 30 rounds of bullets from the scene. The deceased was identified as Khuillya Mia, 40, a top-listed arms manufacturer. He was accused in at least 12 cases filed with different police stations, including Maheshkhali. Prodeep Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Maheshkhali Police Station, confirmed the news. He said, "Acting on a tip-off that a gang of miscreants, including Khuillya Mia, was making arms at Kerontali hill in Moheshkhali, a police team conducted a raid there in the morning. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the miscreants fired at them. In retaliation, the police also fired at them, triggering a three-hour 'gun battle'. Later, the cops recovered the body of Khuillya Mia. However, his other cohorts managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Sohel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Sohel, 35, an alleged criminal and accused of the murder of Fulgazi upazila chairman Ekramul, was reportedly killed in a gunfight with members of RAB on July 3, 2017. RAB members conducted a raid in the Birinchi area of Feni town around 4:30 am, acting on information that some criminals were preparing to commit a robbery, according to Squadron Leader Shafayet Jamil Fahim, commander of RAB-7. Upon sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire. In response, RAB returned fire, resulting in a "gunfight". Sohel was struck by bullets and died on the spot during the exchange, Fahim added.

data.name: Idris Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber, Idris Ali, 32, was killed in an alleged gunfight with the police in Rangpur's Mithapukur upazila on July 3, 2017. Mozammel Haq, the officer-in-charge of the police station, said that the police arrested Idris on July 2, 2017, while he was preparing to commit a robbery. Gathering information from Idris, the police, along with him, went to recover firearms. When their vehicle reached near Joyrampur village around 3:00 am, cohorts of Idris opened fire and snatched Idris, the OC said. The police then fired back, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, the police found the body of Idris lying on the ground, while his aides managed to flee.

data.name: Sabuj Malitha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Four people were killed in what the police called a gunfight in Meherpur on March 14, 2017, after allegedly being arrested earlier. The police arrested two of them from Dhaka on March 13, 2017, for their alleged involvement in the killing of two people in Meherpur’s Sonapur village. The double murder took place a week ago. The two who were arrested and killed are identified as Sabuj Malitha, 25, son of Mashiur Malitha, and Ramesh Karmaker, 22, son of Rashomoy Karmaker. Both of them were residents of Sonapur village in Meherpur sadar upazila. Barely 24 hours after their arrest, the duo, along with two others - Shohag Islam, 27, son of Monirul Islam, and Kamruzzaman Kanon, 25, son of Abul Kalam - from nearby Pirojpur village, were killed in a police 'gunfight' in the early hours of March 14, 2017. The police said all of them used to carry out terrorist activities and extortion. However, their family members outright denied the allegations and claimed that they were just construction workers in Dhaka. Family members also said the duo used to live in Dhaka long before the double murder. BDnews24: The ‘shootout’ took place around 2:30 am on Tuesday morning at Pirojpur Union’s Nurpur intersection, said District Additional Superintendent of Police Abdullah Al Mahmud. The deceased have been identified as Pirojpur Union residents Saddam Hossain, 25, ‘Ramesh’, 24, Shohag, 27, and ‘Azizul’ aka ‘Kanon’, 25. “Police were giving chase to a group of criminals when they started shooting,” said police official Mahmud. “There was an exchange of fire, and four criminals were killed on the spot." “Around 3:45 am, police brought four bullet-ridden individuals to the hospital, but they were dead before they arrived,” said Doctor Abu Ehsan Raju of Meherpur Sadar Hospital. Meherpur Assistant Superintendent of Police Ahsan Habib and five others were injured in the shootout and received first aid at the hospital, said police official Mahmud. More details will be available at a press conference at 11:30 am,

data.name: Tajul Islam Mahmud
data.identity: Allegedly affiliated with the Harakat ul-Jihad-I-Islami/Bangladesh (HUJI-B)
data.description: An alleged member of Harkat-ul-Jihad-al-Islami (Huji) was killed in police firing during a raid in Brahmanbaria's Kasba upazila on March 16, 2017. The deceased, Tajul Islam Mahmud, 45, was a resident of Sadullapur village in Habiganj's Nabiganj upazila. According to the Daily Sun, a suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight between the police and his cohorts in the Kuti Choumohoni area under Kasba Upazila early Thursday, as reported by UNB. The deceased has been identified as Tajul Islam Al Mahmud, also known as Mama Hujur, 45, from Nabiganj in Habiganj district. Police suspected that Tajul had a link to the murder of a local kabiraj (herbal medicine practitioner), said Mohiuddin Ahmed, officer-in-charge of Kasba police station. He said, "Acting on a tip-off, a team of police raided the Kuti Choumohoni area where Tajul, along with his associates, was preparing to commit subversive activities. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals hurled crude bombs and opened fire on the police, prompting them to fire back, triggering a gunfight." "During the gunfight, police found Tajul's bullet-hit body while the others managed to flee the scene," added the OC.

data.name: Abdus Selim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Adabaria village in Kushtia's Daulatpur upazila on March 17, 2017. The deceased, Abdus Selim, 40, was from Modhugari in the upazila. Police claimed that Sabbirul Alam, officer-in-charge of the Detective Branch (DB) of Kushtia police, said a joint team of DB and Daulatpur police conducted a raid around 3:00 am at Shialia field after being tipped off that Selim and his seven to eight accomplices were holding a secret meeting there to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire. The "gunfight" ensued when police retaliated with fire, the OC said. With bullet injuries, Selim was taken to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, he said. The body was sent to Kushtia General Hospital for an autopsy. According to the police, the deceased Selim Molla, 32, was accused in multiple cases of robbery and mugging. Police conducted a raid early Friday in Shehala Adabarhia's 'Bot Tola' after being tipped off about a gang of robbers plotting crimes in the area. "The robbers opened fire when police interrupted their secret meeting," said Kushtia Detective Branch OC Sabbirul Islam. "A gun battle began that continued for about 30 minutes. Some fled but Selim was injured in the firing. He died at a hospital," he told bdnews24.com. Two firearms, two knives, and some ammunition have been recovered from the spot.

data.name: Zahirul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with the police in Brahmanbaria. The deceased robber was identified as Zahirul Islam, 35, from Kayempur village under Kashba Upazila in Brahmanbaria. A team of police launched a raid at Kayempur village in Kasba Upazila around 4:00 am on March 18, 2017, after receiving information that robbers were preparing for a robbery there, said Mahiuddin Ahammed, officer-in-charge (OC) of Kasba Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police, the gang members opened fire on them, prompting the police personnel to retaliate, which resulted in a gunfight, according to the OC. During the exchange of fire, Zahirul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while his associates managed to flee the scene, added Ahammed. The police later recovered his body and sent it to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy. According to Bdnews24, the shootout took place in the Hazipur area of Kasba Upazila around 4 am on Saturday, as stated by Kasba Police Station OC Md Mohiuddin. The victim has been identified as 35-year-old Jahirul Islam, also known as 'Kala Jahir', who was from Kamalpur village in the Upazila. Police arrested Jahir near his home on Friday morning, said OC Mohiuddin. After interrogating him, a police team took him along on a raid to locate a cache of weapons in the Hazaripur area. "Jahir's accomplices, who were lying in wait, noticed the police team and began firing at them," he said. "The police returned fire in self-defense. After the shootout, Jahir's bullet-ridden corpse was recovered from the spot." Three policemen were injured in the shootout and received treatment at a local medical center, according to OC Mohiuddin. Police found 12 crude bombs, two sharp weapons, a firearm, and five cartridges at the scene. OC Mohiuddin stated that Jahir is accused in six cases of robbery.

data.name: Fakir Ahmad
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Feni, a suspected drug peddler named Fakir Ahmad was killed during a police raid on their den in Sonagazi upazila of Feni on March 18, 2017, the police said. The gang members opened fire on the police, forcing them to shoot in retaliation. Six police personnel were injured during the incident, according to Humayun Kabir, officer-in-charge of Sonagazi Model Police Station. The deceased, Fakir Ahmad, 35, hailed from Chharait Kandi village under Sonagazi upazila in Feni. The Independent reported that a suspected drug peddler who suffered bullet wounds during a brief gunfight with the police at Charaitkandi village in sadar upazila on Friday night died at Feni Sadar Hospital yesterday morning. Meanwhile, a suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Hazipur village in Kashba upazila of Brahmanbaria on the same day, according to UNB. Acting on information, the police raided the house of 'drug peddler' Nurul Afsar Fakir Ahmed, 35, at night, said Md Humayun Kabir, officer-in-charge of Sonagazi Model Police Station. Sensing the police presence, Nurul along with his family members attacked them, prompting the law enforcers to fire in retaliation, which left Nurul wounded with bullets. He was taken to a local hospital where he succumbed to his injuries in the morning. The police also arrested his two brothers -- Moin Uddin Alamgir, 32, and Salah Uddin, 21-- along with 10 kilograms of hemp, 805 pieces of Yaba pills, and heroin and liquor. The OC also claimed that six policemen were injured during the fight. Meanwhile, a suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Hazipur village in Kashba upazila early yesterday. The police arrested Zahirul Islam alias Kala Zahir from Kamalpur village and then conducted a drive there with him to capture his cohorts as well, said Mohiuddin Ahmed, officer-in-charge of Kashba Police Station. As the police were raiding the village, his cohorts opened fire on them, prompting them to fire back, which triggered the ‘gunfight’, leaving Zahir dead on the spot. The body of Zahir, an accused in

data.name: Nurul Amin
data.description: A 55-year-old person died allegedly after being tortured and given electric shocks in police custody in Feni. Police refuted the allegations raised by the victim's family, claiming that Nurul Amin had suffered a stroke. Feni Model Police Officer-in-Charge Rashed Khan Chowdhury claimed that they had arrested Amin as a warranted criminal from the town's Pagla Mia Road on March 23, 2017. Later that night, he suffered a stroke and was taken to a local hospital, the OC said, adding, "Amin was finally shifted to Chittagong Medical College Hospital for better treatment where he died on March 24, 2017, morning." Amin's son, Nurul Afsar Manik, alleged that his father had been beaten up and then electrocuted at the police station. He said that the case in which the police had shown him arrested was filed by a local over previous enmity. "The complainant bribed the police to arrest and torture him," he claimed. Manik said that they would file a case against the police. New Age: A small trader was tortured to death in the custody of Feni police early Friday, hours after his arrest at his house under Feni Sadar, the victim's family alleged. The deceased was Nurul Amin, 54, of village Kashimpur. He was an expatriate and recently began a tea stall near his house. Feni Model Police Station Officer-in-Charge Rashed Khan Chowdhury said on Thursday evening that Sub-Inspector Azadur Rahman arrested Nurul in a case filed by one of his neighbors for assaulting him. He claimed that Nurul suddenly became ill around 8:30 pm and was rushed to Feni Sadar Hospital. The doctor referred him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where the victim was declared dead around 3:30 am, he claimed. The OC claimed that Nurul died of a heart stroke. The victim's family claimed that Nurul never complained about heart disease. The victim's son-in-law, Kazi Nurul Islam Jewel, who was with the victim in the hospital, said he found marks of torture on the victim's body. He said there were many injury marks on both hands and chest of the victim while he was sent to the CMCH. He also alleged that the victim died at Feni Sadar Hospital but the police sent the body to the CMCH

data.name: Kawsar Bhuiyan
data.description: An alleged drug dealer was killed in an alleged gunfight with the Detective Branch of the police in the Bhatshala area of the district, amid an anti-narcotics crackdown that began two months ago. The deceased is Kawsar Bhuiyan, 45, son of Abdul Razzak from the town's Kandipara area. "He was carrying drugs in a pick-up van and started firing at us after we asked him to stop, forcing us to retaliate as well," said DB Officer-in-Charge Md Mafiz Uddin in the evening. Two of his accomplices managed to escape. According to New Age, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a 'gunfight' with detectives at Bhatshala Rail Station in Brahamanbaria early Sunday. The gunfight occurred when a gang of drug peddlers opened fire at the detectives while they were patrolling the area around 2:30 am, said Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch of the district, Mafiz Uddin Bhuiyan. In retaliation, the detectives fired back and the alleged drug dealer, M Kawsar Bhuiyan, 45, a resident of Kandipara in the district town, was killed. However, the other members of the gang managed to flee, said OC Mafiz, adding that they also recovered 198 pieces of Yaba pills, one pipe gun, and two cartridges from the scene. However, Rina Begum, the wife of the deceased, claimed that a group of plainclothes individuals picked up Kawsar from his home on Saturday afternoon.

data.name: Ruhel Ahmed
data.description: An alleged yaba trader was killed in a 'police firing' during a clash between the police and drug traders in the Berirpar area of Moulvibazar town on January 4, 2017. The deceased was identified as Ruhel Ahmed, the son of Shayesta Miah from the village of Ghorghor in Sadar upazila. Mohammad Shah Jalal, the superintendent of police, stated during a press briefing at 1:00 pm on January 5, 2017, that a team of police had been tipped off and conducted a raid in the area around 11:30 pm. During the operation, the police opened fire on Ruhel, causing him to sustain bullet injuries. He was later taken to Sadar Hospital, where attending doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mojid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with police at Dugbi village under Matlab Uttar Upazila of Chandpur district. The deceased are Mojid, of Matlab Uttar Upazila, and Habu of Lakshmipur district. According to the Dhaka Tribune, Mojid and Habu were killed in the incident. Matlab Uttar OC Alamgir Hossain said, "Acting on a tip-off, we conducted a raid in the area around 3:30 am on Wednesday. Sensing our presence, the robbers opened fire, targeting us." In retaliation, the police fired back, resulting in the death of the two robbers. Three policemen were also injured in the incident. The OC further stated, "Mojid is accused in eight cases, while Habu faces four cases.

data.name: Mohammad Sohagh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed during a shootout with the police at the Bhairab Bridge area in Bhairab Upazila of Kishoreganj. The victim was identified as Md Sohagh, 23, son of Mohammad Ali from the village of Bhairab Dakhhinpara. Upon receiving information that a gang of robbers in the Bhairab Bridge area was preparing to commit a robbery, a police team led by Officer-in-Charge Muklesur Rahman from Bhairab Police Station raided the area around 3:30 am, according to Mohammad Ali Zinnah, Officer-in-Charge (Investigation) of Bhairab Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police, the alleged robbers fired approximately 30 rounds of bullets at the police team, stated the OC. In response, the police retaliated with 20 rounds of gunshots. After the gunfight, the police found a wounded Sohagh and rushed him to Bhairab Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shipan Hossain
data.description: Two suspected criminals were killed in a reported gunfight between the police and their cohorts at Gangni in Meherpur early on Friday. The deceased were identified as Shipan Hossain, 25, son of Madar Ali, from the village of Dulalnagar, and Alamgir Hossain, 29, son of Abed Ali, from the village of Chandpur in Gangni. Acting on a tip-off that a group of criminals had gathered at Haridaho field to commit a crime, a team of Gangni police conducted a raid there around 3:00 am, said Anower Hossen, officer-in-charge of the police station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the alleged miscreants opened fire on the police personnel, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight, he said. The duo received bullet wounds during the gunfight and died on the spot, while their associates managed to flee, according to the police officer. Four police personnel also got injured during the gunfight, the police official claimed. They were admitted to Gangni Upazila Health Complex, he said. The police also recovered firearms and bullets from the scene, he added.

data.name: Sohel Sheikh
data.description: Sohel Sheikh was killed in a "gunfight" with DB police in the city's Bhashantek area on April 17, 2017, four days after he was called out from his Ashulia house allegedly by a criminal gang. Sohel's family members alleged that suspected criminal "DSP Babu" called him out from his home on April 13, 2017, to talk about the gun attack on Chiku. Sohel phoned his sister Minara Akter on April 14, 2017, to inform her that he was in the custody of the Detective Branch of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. "My brother called from his mobile phone and asked us not to worry about him. The conversation lasted for only a few seconds," Minara told. Talking to this correspondent at his house in Bhashantek slum, Sohel's father Manju Sheikh alleged that DB officials "cooked up the story of a shootout after killing his son in custody". Prothomalo: A suspected criminal was killed in a reported gunfight with detectives in the city's Mirpur area early Monday. The deceased is Chiko Jamal alias Musa, 40, reports news agency UNB. Acting on secret information, a team of Detective Branch (DB) conducted the drive at Bhashantek near Dewanpara Lohar Bridge around 2:00 am, said DC DB (west zone) Md Sajjadur Rahman. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals fired gunshots, prompting the DB men to fire back, triggering a gunfight. Later, the DB team found Sohel lying at the scene with bullet wounds. He was then taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead. They also arrested two other criminals -- Hiron and Sohag -- and recovered two revolvers, one pistol along with several rounds of bullets from the spot. Earlier, Chiko Jamal alias Musa, 40, a listed criminal of the city's Bhasantek area, who suffered bullet wounds in an attack by his rivals near Shilpirtek slum on Tuesday, died at the DMCH on Saturday. Following the incident, the law enforcers have been carrying out drives in the areas for the last few days.

data.name: Romel Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly tied with the mainstream faction of the Parbatya Chattagram Jana Samhati Samiti (PCJSS) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: There was an allegation that a college student had died due to torture by the military in Rangamati Hill District. The victim's family alleged that on April 5, 2017, members of the Army took Romel Chakma to their camp. Romel Chakma was a Higher Secondary School Certificate (HSC) examinee of Naniyarchar Degree College and was also the General Secretary of Naniarchar unit Pahari Chhatra Parishad in Rangamati. Later, Romel was handed over to the police. On April 19, 2017, Romel died in Chittagong Medical College Hospital. On April 21, the Army allegedly cremated his body without following any religious customs.

data.name: Yunus Hossain
data.description: On April 20, 2017, Yunus Hossain, 40, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police in Keshobpur, Jessore, Ashashuni, Satkhira. The deceased was the son of Mokbul Hossain and a resident of Ashahuni in Satkhira.

data.name: Forhad Hossain
data.description: On April 23, 2017, Forhad Hossain was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police at Noyapara, Khutakhali, Chokoriya, Chittagong-Cox's Bazaar highway.

data.name: Mohammad Rahim
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with Khulna Sadar Police on April 28, 2017.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.description: A suspected cattle thief was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion at Majlishpur in Gazipur city on January 5, 2017, according to RAB. Additional Superintendent of Police Mohiul Islam of RAB-1, Gazipur, said that based on a tip-off about cattle thieves escaping in a truck, the battalion personnel set up a checkpoint at Dakkhin Salna in the city. At around 3:30 am, the RAB personnel signaled a truck loaded with cows to stop, but the driver, disregarding the signal, attempted to flee, prompting the RAB personnel to pursue the vehicle. As they entered the village road and approached Majlishpur High School, approximately two kilometers away from the checkpoint, they became stuck. The suspected thieves then opened fire on the law enforcers, and the RAB personnel retaliated by firing back. Eventually, the suspects managed to escape from the truck. The battalion members apprehended Rafiqul, who had been shot, at the scene.

data.name: Mohammad Rajib
data.description: In Jessore district, a youth was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" by the police after being picked up. Mohammad Rajib (35), the deceased's family alleged that the police arrested him from his house in the afternoon of April 5, 2017. Later, the police stated that Rajib escaped from the police by unlocking the handcuffs. After that, the police searched for him but did not find him. Later, the family received information that Rajib's body was in the morgue of the hospital. The Officer-in-charge (OC) of Jessore Kotowali Police Station, A K M Ajmal Huda, stated that on April 5, 2017, Sub Inspector (SI) Jamil and Mokhles conducted an operation in plain clothes and arrested Rajib. But on the way to the Police Station, Rajib escaped from the police by unlocking the handcuffs. At around 3:00 am, the police received information that firing between two groups of miscreants was taking place in the Kholadanga area of the town. The miscreants started firing at the patrol police when they reached the scene. The police then fired back in response. Later, the miscreants left the area and the police found Rajib, who had been shot in the head. Rajib died on the way to the hospital. OC A K M Ajmal Huda also stated that "gunfight" incidents are occurring all over the country. It was also that kind of incident. He did not want to put himself in danger by providing more details about the incident.

data.name: Jalal Uddin
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Akhaura, Brahmanbaria on August 5, 2017. The deceased was identified as Jalal Uddin, also known as Budo, a 45-year-old son of Dharo Miah from Bawtala village in Akhaura upazila. However, Jalal's family members claimed that the police killed him in custody during a staged crossfire incident. Md Mosharaf Hossain, the office-in-charge of Akhaura police, stated that Jalal Miah was a known drug peddler and locals detained him, handing him over to the police on August 4, 2017. The police officer added that Jalal had confessed to possessing illegal firearms and drugs. Later, the police, accompanied by Jalal, conducted a raid based on his information in the Nurpur area around 2:00 am on August 5, 2017. "Upon sensing the presence of law enforcement, his associates opened fire on the police, and the police retaliated by firing. Jalal Mia was shot and died on the spot during the gunfight," Mosharaf said. Jalal's wife, Halima Begum, claimed that the police arrested her husband and she met him in police custody on Friday morning and afternoon. She alleged that the police murdered her husband in custody during a staged gunfight. TDS: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a "shootout" between his associates and the police in Nurpur village, Akhaura upazila, early yesterday. The police claim that locals handed over 25-year-old Jalal Uddin Badu, son of Daru Mia from Bautola village under Mugra union, after beating him up around 9:00 am on Friday. However, Jalal's family and locals claimed that no such thing happened. "After interrogation, we obtained information about his associates. When we took him to Nurpur village around 2:15 am last night, his associates opened fire on us," said Mossarrof Hossain Tarafder, the officer-in-charge of Akhaura police. "As the law enforcers retaliated, a gunfight ensued, and Jalal was shot by his associates. Jalal was rushed to Akhaura Upazila Health Complex, where duty doctors declared him dead," he

data.name: Sobuj Uddin Sobuj
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Sajeda Begum formally filed a complaint with the Prime Minister on May 15, 2017, through Faridpur's Deputy Commissioner, stating that her son, Sobuj Uddin, had been killed by the police. She wrote, "My son was a trainee driver without any criminal history. Yet, the police wrongfully labeled him as a robber and had him killed." The Faridpur police had earlier issued a press release, claiming that Sobuj Uddin and another young man were killed in a gunfight between two rival groups of robbers on May 9, 2017. Faridpur Police Superintendent Subhash Chandra Saha reiterated this claim, insisting that the police had no involvement in Sobuj Uddin's death. He explained that when the police arrived at the scene, having been informed of the ongoing firefight between the two groups of robbers, they found Sobuj Uddin's dead body. The other individual killed in the incident was identified as Pavel Munsi, the son of Abdul Karim from Bhanga, Faridpur.

data.name: Bappi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two regional leaders of the Purba Banglar Communist Party were killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in the Rakhalgachhi area of Goalonda upazila on May 13, 2017. The deceased were identified as Bappi, chief of Lal Potaka Bahini, and his associate Lalon. Rois Uddin, Additional Superintendent of Police and also the company commander of RAB Faridpur camp, said that based on secret information, a team of RAB conducted a raid in the area around 3:00 am. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the outlaw leaders opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, which triggered a 'gunfight'. The gunfight left the duo dead on the spot.

data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region

data.name: Lalon Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed during a reported gunfight between law enforcement officers and a group of robbers in Gangni upazila of Meherpur early Thursday, according to news agency UNB. The deceased is identified as Lalon, 30. Acting on a tip-off, the police went to Meherpur-Kushtia road in the Chokhtala field area of Gangni in the early hours while a group of robbers were preparing to commit a robbery there, said Anwar Hossain, the officer-in-charge of Gangni police station. As is usual in the police version of a 'gunfight', upon sensing the presence of law enforcement officers, the robber gang fired at them first, forcing the police to retaliate and triggering the gunfight, relayed OC Anwar Hossain. During the gunfight, Lalon sustained a bullet injury. Later, doctors at Gangni upazila health complex pronounced him dead when he was taken to the hospital, the OC said.

data.name: Russell
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Dattopara in Lakshmipur Sadar upazila on May 19, 2017. The deceased was identified as Russell, 30, son of Abdul Karim of Chhayani Togba village of Chatkhil upazila in Noakhali. Russell, along with his associate Babul, was arrested with a gun at an abandoned house at Kabirajbari of North Joypur village, said Officer-in-Charge of Chandraganj police, Mokhtar Hossain. Based on the information given by him, the police took him to Dattapara in Binodpur on a drive to recover more firearms. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, Russell's associates opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight," the OC claimed. Russell was wounded during the "gunfight" and was rushed to Lakshmipur Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nazrul Islam Babu
data.description: Nazrul Islam Babu, 32, a Class IV employee of Jaintapur Upazila Administration office and son of the late freedom fighter Abdul Zalil of village Kohaigar under the upazila, was found dead in a detention cell hours after his arrest, the police said. His family alleged that he was tortured to death by the police on May 20, 2017.

data.name: Raju Ahmed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in the Paschim Tutpara area of Khulna city on May 20, 2017. The deceased was identified as Raju Ahmed, 27, son of Siddiqur Rahman. Acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers numbering 10 to 12 were preparing to commit a robbery in the area, a team of police conducted a raid there around 3:00 am, said Mizanur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Kotwali police station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate, leaving Raju with bullet wounds. Later, he was rushed to Khulna Medical College and Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries around 4:00 am.

data.name: Ashrafuddin Dhol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in what the police claim was a gunfight in Trishal upazila of Mymensingh on May 24, 2017. The deceased, Ashrafuddin Dhol, 28, of Ragaichati village in Mymensingh's Gafargoan upazila, was detained from Kishoreganj around 9:00 pm on May 23, 2017, said Additional Superintendent of Mymensingh police (South), Mohammad Noor-e-Alam. A team led by Imarat Hossain Gazi, officer-in-charge of the Detective Branch of Mymensingh police, took Ashraful Dhol along when they raided a den of robbers at Bhaga village in adjacent Trishal upazila around 3:00 am the same night. The robbers started firing at the police, prompting them to retaliate, Noor-e-Alam said. Ashraful suffered bullet injuries in the gunfight and was declared dead after being rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, the police official said.

data.name: Muktar Hossain Mukti
data.description: An alleged drug trader was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and the police at Birulia area in Savar, on the outskirts of the capital on May 26, 2017. Police said they arrested Muktar Hossain Mukti, 45, a presumed drug trader on May 25, 2017. Later, the police, along with Muktar, conducted a raid in the area to arrest his associates, said SM Kamruzzaman, Officer-in-Charge of Savar Model Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire towards the police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight between them around 3:30 am. At one stage, Muktar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while his cohorts managed to flee, he said.

data.name: Nurul Islam Marzan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Both of them were alleged members of Neo JMB, and they were allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. According to the DAILY STAR, two 'Neo JMB' leaders have been arrested. One is a key financier of the outfit, and the other allegedly supplied arms and explosives for the Gulshan attack in 2016. The police claimed to have arrested Akram Hossein Khan Niloy, 26, who allegedly funded “Neo JMB” and was involved in all its activities. He was also the mastermind behind the Hotel Olio International blast in Panthapath on August 15 last year, according to a counterterrorism official. The other arrestee, Hadisur Rahman Sagor, 36, allegedly supplied arms and explosives used in the Gulshan attack. He is also said to be the brother-in-law of Nurul Islam Marzan, a top “Neo JMB” operative who was also a planner of the café siege. Marzan was killed in a “shootout” with the Counter Terrorism and Transnational Crime (CTTC) unit of the DMP on January 6 last year. A team of Bogra police arrested Niloy and Sagor from the Shibganj area of the district around 2:00 am yesterday and handed them over to CTTC personnel, said Mohibul Islam Khan, deputy commissioner of the unit. Police recovered two cell phones from the arrestees that “show evidence of their connection with militancy,” officials say. Later in the day, CTTC officials produced them before two separate Dhaka courts, seeking 10-day remand for each. The courts granted six days for Niloy and seven days for Sagor. Metropolitan Magistrate Aminul Haque passed the order on Niloy after hearing the remand petition. When the court asked Niloy about his past whereabouts, the suspect replied that he was in Malaysia and was studying at a university there, court sources said. When asked whether he knew café attacker Nibras Islam, who was also a student at a Malaysian university, Niloy got angry and asked Aminul Haque if he was a magistrate. As the magistrate replied in the positive, Niloy said, “You can remand or punish me, even sentence me to death, but I despise you and your order as I only obey the rule of Allah.” Hailing from Kishoreganj, Niloy is the son of Abu Torab Khan. Counter

data.name: Firatul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A man was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Nurpur village in Meherpur Sadar upazila on June 6, 2017. The deceased was identified as Firatul Islam, 48, son of Ayub Ali, a resident of Pirojpur village in the upazila. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police conducted a raid at a jackfruit orchard in the area around 2:00 am while Firatul, along with his associates, was preparing to commit robbery, said Ahsan Habib, Assistant Superintendent of Police of Meherpur. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire on the police, prompting the police to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight, he said. After the gunfight, Firatul was found dead on the spot while his associates managed to flee the scene, the ASP added.

data.name: Ibrahim Miah
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at the village of Chandidwar in Kosba upazila, Brahmanbaria on June 6, 2017. The deceased was identified as Ibrahim Miah, 34, son of the late Samraj Miah, a resident of the village Latuamora in the upazila. Kosba police Officer-in-charge, Mohammad Mohiuddin, said that a police team, led by Sub Inspector Rafiqul Islam, conducted a raid at village Latuamora and arrested Ibrahim's wife, Renua, with six kilograms of hemp at around 10:00 pm. While the law enforcers were on their way to the police station with Renua, Ibrahim and his associates launched an attack on the policemen. Ibrahim and his cohorts opened fire on the police personnel, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight.

data.name: Majom Ali
data.description: Majom Ali's family alleged that members of BGB picked him up and tortured him, leaving him dead. Robiul Islam, UP member of Ward No. 6 of Boroshoshi Union, stated that BGB members tortured Majom in front of him.

data.name: Alia Bhulu
data.description: Alia Bhulu, an alleged drug peddler, was arrested by the police in the afternoon on June 16, 2017. Later, the police took him to Pakshi Rail Station to recover drugs. His cohorts arrived on motorbikes and a gunfight ensued. The victim was then taken to Pabna General Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries around 4:00 am.

data.name: Selim Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Brahmanbaria, an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and the police in Sarail upazila on June 19, 2017. The deceased, Selim Mia, 32, was the son of Tajul Islam from Malihata village. The OC of Sarail Police Station, Rupok Kumar Saha, said Selim was arrested while he and his accomplices were preparing to commit a robbery in Bertola village. Later, Selim's accomplices opened fire, targeting the policemen in an attempt to free him, which prompted the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point, Selim was caught in the crossfire and died on the spot, according to the OC.

data.name: Sabbir Hossain
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police on June 19, 2017. The police said Sabbir, 25, son of Saidul Islam from Khalilpur village of Bagharpara, fled from police custody by breaking handcuffs earlier in the day. A police team found him wounded at about 2:45 am following a 'gunfight' between two groups of drug dealers.

data.name: Joban Ali
data.description: On June 29, 2017, the police arrested Joban Ali (55) and his wife Maleka Begum, their son Arif aged 10, and their daughter China Khatun aged 12 at Sorishabari railway station. They were then taken to Sorishabari Police Station. Family members alleged that he died due to torture.

data.name: Shamsu Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Alleged pirate leader Shamsu Sheikh, also known as 'Kopa Shamsu', 45, was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Sundarbans on Tuesday afternoon. He was the ringleader of the notorious 'Shamsu Bahini', according to RAB officials. The gunfight took place in the Mrigimari canal under Mongla upazila of Bagerhat. Zahid Hossain, the operation officer of Khulna RAB-6, stated that Shamsu, who was hit by a bullet, was captured after a 15-minute gun battle with Shamsu Bahini. However, his accomplices managed to escape, he added. Shamsu was rushed to the Mongla Upazila Health Complex in critical condition, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dulal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in what the police claimed to be a gunfight at Kahalu upazila of Bogra early today. The deceased were identified as Dulal Hossain (known as Kamal Sheikh alias Dulal by The Daily Manabzamin), 45, of Dupchanchia, and Ibrahim Ali, 46, of Nandigram in the district, according to our Bogra correspondent, Nur-e-Alam Siddiki, the officer-in-charge of Kahalu Police Station.

data.name: Ibrahim Ali
data.description: On February 7, 2017, both of them were allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police at Fakirpara area.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: The police recovered the bullet-ridden body of a young man, who was allegedly picked up by plainclothes police, from a field near Medda Sishu Paribar in the Brahmanbaria municipality area early on February 7, 2017. The deceased was named Al Amin, 28, the son of Zilu Mia from the Kandipara area. Upon receiving information about a gunfight in the area, a team of police went to the scene and found Al Amin lying in a pool of blood, according to Narayan Chandra Das, a sub-inspector of Sadar Model police station. Later, he was taken to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead. Tanjina Begum, the wife of the deceased, alleged that a team of plainclothes police picked up Al Amin from his residence around 4 pm on February 6, 2017, and shot him to death. She demanded punishment for the "responsible policemen" involved in his death. However, Additional Superintendent of Police Iqbal Hossain denied the allegation of Al Amin being picked up by law enforcers. According to The Independent, police recovered the bullet-ridden body of a young man, who was allegedly picked up by plainclothes police, from a field near Medda Sishu Paribar in the municipality area early yesterday, as reported by UNB. The deceased was identified as Al Amin, 28, the son of Zilu Mia from the Kandipara area. Upon receiving information about a gunfight in the area, a team of police went to the scene and found Al Amin lying in a pool of blood, said Narayan Chandra Das, a sub-inspector of Sadar Model Police Station. Later, he was taken to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead. The police also recovered one firearm, cartridges, and five sharp weapons from the scene, according to the SI. Tanjina Begum, the wife of the deceased, alleged that a team of plainclothes police picked up Al Amin from his residence around 4 pm on Monday and shot him to death. She demanded punishment for the "responsible policemen" involved in his death. However, Additional Superintendent of Police Iqbal Hossain denied the allegation of Al Amin being picked up by law enforcers.

data.name: Mohammad Mostafa
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police on March 7, 2017. According to The Independent, a suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with detectives at Loribagh in Burichang upazila of Comilla early on Wednesday. Upon receiving information, a team of detectives, led by Additional Superintendent of Police Abdullah Al Mamun, conducted a raid at Loribagh to apprehend the other members of the gang around 12:10 am. However, upon sensing the presence of the DB men, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight. The two groups exchanged several gunshots during the gunfight, resulting in Mostafa, ASP Mamun, and constable Dayal Kanti sustaining bullet wounds. Mostafa was then taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead around 12:45 am. Two DB men were admitted to the police hospital.

data.name: Oltu Mondol
data.description: In Chuadanga, Oltu Mondol (40), a local leader of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party, was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) in Khashkarra village of Alamdanga upazila early on June 8, 2017. He was accused in seven cases, including the killing of a Chuadanga fish farmers' leader, Ziaur Rahman, on April 19 of this year, reported The Daily Star, quoting Rab.

data.name: Korom Ali
data.description: In Rajbari, Korol Ali (36), a regional leader of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party faction Lal Pataka, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Chardalandi village in Goalondo upazila early on June 8, 2017. He hailed from Tenaponcha village in Goalondo upazila and was arrested from a hideout in Hemayetpur of Dhaka on the afternoon of June 7, as reported by The Daily Star, quoting the police.

data.name: Mojjammel Haque
data.description: Both of them were killed in a gunfight with the police on June 7, 2017.

data.name: Sujon
data.description: Both of them were killed in a gunfight with the police on June 7, 2017.

data.name: Nannu Molla
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A leader of a "forest robber gang" was killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion at Chunkuri canal in the Satkhira range of Sundarban west division. Local fishermen identified the deceased as Nannu Molla, 47, the second-in-command of a robber gang who went by the name of "Zonab Bahini" in the area, said ANM Zahidul Kabir, the Crime Prevention Company-1 Commander of RAB-6. Being tipped off, a RAB team raided a canal located about five kilometers away from the mainland around 9:30 am, he said. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them and prompted the RAB team to retaliate. Nannu was shot in the ensuing gunfight, which lasted for half an hour, while the other members of the gang fled the scene, claimed the commander.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain
data.description: A suspected mugger was killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Dhakeshwari, near the capital's Lalbag on July 13, 2017, afternoon. The deceased was identified as Alamgir Hossain, 35. Major AH Mohiuddin, Second-in-Command of RAB-10, said two members of a motorcycle patrol team of the elite force chased a private car after witnessing a snatching in front of the Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education around 4:30 pm. At one stage, Alamgir was killed.

data.name: Guddu Babu
data.description: Suspected drug peddlers Guddu Babu, 26, and Al Mahmid, 25, were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Khulna. Both of them were killed in a gunfight with the police in the railway station area in Khulna Sadar on July 17, 2017.

data.name: Md Al Mahmud
data.description: Suspected drug peddlers Guddu Babu, 26, and Al Mahmid, 25, were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Khulna. Both of them were killed in a gunfight with the police in the railway station area in Khulna Sadar on July 17, 2017.

data.name: Abul Kalam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Abdul Kalam, an alleged robber, was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Pologround area of Chittagong city on July 19, 2017. A team of Rab-7 raided the Pologround area around 3:00 am, acting on a tip-off that some arms dealers were trading firearms there, said Mimtanur Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-7. He said that when the RAB team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, the RAB team found a bullet-hit man and took him to a hospital where he was pronounced dead on arrival. However, the victim's family said that Kalam went outside his rented house in the Baizid area on July 18 morning, saying he was going to work, but he did not return home at night. Md Ripon, the elder brother of Kalam's wife, said, "In the morning, we came to know about his [Kalam] death from TV news. Family members of Kalam asked me to see whether Kalam was alright. I came to the hospital and identified his body." "My sister's husband [Kalam] used to catch fish and look after their cattle in his village in Feni. He came here [Chittagong city] around six months ago. He used to work as a daily laborer. On July 18 morning, he told my sister that he was going to work in a vehicle as a helper," Ripon said. But the claim of exchanging fire between Kalam and RAB was not true as he had no firearm, he added.

data.name: Mosharraf
data.description: Two suspected muggers, who allegedly posed as DB police and robbed people, were shot in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Azimpur, the capital, on July 25, 2017 afternoon. Mosharraf, 39, and Monir Hossein, 35, suffered bullet wounds in their right and left thighs. They were undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, according to RAB. The alleged gunfight occurred between a group of muggers and a team of Rab-10 after the law enforcers, acting on a tip-off, went there to apprehend them. The duo was injured during the exchange of fire, stated Shahabuddin Khan, commanding officer of Rab-10.
