data.name: Mahfuzur Rahman
data.description: The family alleged that Mahfuzur Rahman was tortured by the police while in the custody of Nachol Police Station. However, the police claimed that he committed suicide due to the death of his brother in police custody. Following this, six policemen, including the officer-in-charge of Nachole Police Station, were sued on August 6, 2017 for murder. The policemen involved are OC Anwar Hossain, sub-inspectors Abdul Barik, Ahsan Habib, Johrul Islam, ASI Md Shamsul, and constable Chan Jarul from the police station. Shahinur Alam, the brother of the deceased Mahfuzur Rahman, filed a complaint with the cognizance court of the senior judicial magistrate, seeking justice.

data.name: Rukon Mia
data.description: Rokon Mia, 45, son of Yaqub Mia from Suhilpur village in Brahmanbaria Sadar upazila, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police in Sarail, Brahmanbaria.

data.name: Yousuf Mia
data.description: Yousuf Mia, a 28-year-old alleged drug peddler and son of Nurul Islam from Maiskhar village, was reportedly killed in a gunfight with the police at Kosba, Brahmanbaria.

data.name: Jajj Miah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Acting on a tip-off about a gang of robbers planning to commit a robbery in the Jhilmil project area of Keraniganj upazila, a team of DB police from Dhaka district (South) established a checkpoint in the area early in the morning, according to Officer-in-Charge (OC) of DB of Dhaka district (South), Dipok Chandra Saha. Sensing the presence of the team, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight. During the exchange, Jajj Miah, 35, was caught in the crossfire and sustained four gunshot wounds, while his associates managed to escape the scene. He was immediately rushed to the hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead. A shooter gun and three sharp weapons were recovered from the location, as stated by Monirul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Keraniganj Dakkhin Police Station. The OC added that Jajj Miah was accused in several robbery cases.

data.name: Abdur Rouf
data.description: He was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight.

data.name: Hossain Shikder Victor
data.description: Hossain Shikder Victor was allegedly killed in a gunfight with members of RAB-06 in Mollahat Upazila, Bagerhat.

data.name: Imran
data.description: An alleged drug peddler named 'Imran' was killed during a confrontation with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Old Dhaka. RAB conducted an anti-drug raid, during which Imran and others reportedly opened fire at the officers. He was found with bullet wounds and later declared dead at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. RAB-10 Additional SP Mohiuddin Faruki identified the deceased as 'Imran', 35. He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB in the Kadamati area of Dhaka.

data.name: Ismail Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Police shot and killed Ismail Hossain, 32, the son of Shahidul Islam from Shyampur village in Birulia, as he and others attacked the law enforcement officers in an attempt to snatch a listed criminal named Al-Amin Hossain in Birulia, Savar on the outskirts of the capital on June 8, 2017. Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police Mahbubur Rahman stated that four policemen, led by Sub-Inspector Toriqul Islam, conducted a raid in the Shyampur area to apprehend Al-Amin Hossain at around 11:00 pm. The police successfully arrested him at his residence, but they came under attack when Al-Amin, who had already sensed the presence of the law enforcement officers, announced through a loudspeaker that robbers had entered his house, Mahbubur added. During the altercation, family members of Al-Amin, including his sister, brother, and others, managed to snatch Al-Amin from the police. In self-defense, the law enforcement officers opened fire on the attackers, according to the official. Upon receiving the information, additional forces from Savar rushed to the scene and brought the situation under control. Ismail, who was the main accomplice of Al-Amin, was shot and died while being transported to Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Enamul Haq
data.description: A key suspect in a college student abduction case was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Shibpur village of Kushtia Sadar on August 22, 2017. Enamul Haq, 33, son of Mostofa Ali of Shibpur village, was accused of abducting and killing college student Sagar Saha. Sagar, 19, son of Pradeep Saha, was abducted on August 16, 2017. Police recovered Sagar’s body in an abandoned toilet at Harinarayanpur village on August 19, 2017. Ratan Seikh, officer-in-charge of Islamic University Police Station, said they arrested Enamul on August 20, 2017. In the preliminary interrogation, Enamul told police that his partner in the crime was a villager named Shipon Ali. According to the OC, police teams took Enamul with them to Shibpur village to search for Shipon. "On the way, the police teams were attacked near a banana orchard. They shot at the police to snatch Enamul. A gunfight ensued. Enamul, handcuffed, was shot dead when he tried to escape from the police van," Ratan claimed.

data.name: Mamun
data.description: A man, allegedly involved in a shooting incident on August 12, which left a DB police officer injured, was killed during a "gunfight" in the capital's Jurain on August 22, 2017, with the police. The deceased was identified as Mamun, 30. He was a suspect in a police shooting case.

data.name: Masudul Haque Pintu
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A BNP leader was allegedly tortured to death by the police in Bogra on August 22, 2017, following a family feud over who had the right to fish in a local pond, the deceased's family has claimed. Family members alleged that Kaigari police outpost in-charge, Inspector Anisur Rahman, and three other officers picked up Pintu from his home without any arrest warrant on August 22. "The police pulled my father out of the bathroom and hit him with their rifle butt on his head, chest, neck, and other places before taking him away on a CNG-run auto-rickshaw," Pintu's daughter, Meherunnesa said. She also said that family members rushed to the police station, but her father was not there. Police informed us that he had died at the hospital. According to the family, Pintu was severely tortured with rifle butts while in custody and later succumbed to his injuries at Shahid Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Arman Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A suspected member of Neo Jamaatul Mujahideen Bangladesh was reportedly killed in a gunfight between his associates and the police at village Boalia of Daulatpur in Kushtia on August 25, 2017, the police claimed. The deceased, Arman Ali, 42, was the son of Ahsan Ali, a resident of village Thakur Soulatpur in Bheramara upazila. The officer-in-charge of Daulatpur police station, Shah Dara Khan, said that based on secret information, a police team conducted a raid in the area while Arman and his associates were holding a secret meeting at about 3:30 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the JMB members opened fire on the policemen, forcing the police to fire back, which triggered a gunfight, the police officer said. After the reported gunfight, the police found Arman dead with bullet wounds while his associates managed to flee. Later, the police took Arman to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors confirmed his death.

data.name: Badu Monir
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch (DB) of the police at Noljani in Gazipur on January 1, 2017. Badu Monir, 30, a resident of the Tin-Shed colony area in BARC and an accused in 17 cases, was declared dead at Shahid Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital, said detectives. Police claimed that sensing the presence of DB police, Badu and his men opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to fire back in the T&T colony area of Segun Bagan.

data.name: Mintu Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police on March 9, 2017. The Daily Star reported that an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Kushtia's Khoksa upazila early yesterday. The deceased, Motiur Rahman Mintu, 28, was from Pangsha upazila in Rajbari. The police claimed that he was a listed robber and a member of an inter-district robber gang. The "gunfight" occurred at Shimulia Bazar on Kushtia-Rajbari highway around 3:30 am when the police went there after being informed that eight to nine robbers, including Mintu, were preparing to commit a robbery, said Nazmul Huda, officer-in-charge of Khoksa Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate, triggering the "gunfight," the OC said. With bullet injuries, Mintu was taken to Khoksa Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, he added. The police claimed to have recovered a homemade gun, a pistol, and four bullets from the spot. Mintu was accused in seven cases, including two for murder, four for robberies, and one for abduction, filed with Rajbari's Pangsha, Kushtia's Khoksa, and Jhenidah's Sailkupa police stations, they said. Bdnews24 reported that the "shootout" occurred at Shimulia in Khoksha Upazila, said Kushtia Detective Police OC Chabirul Alam. The deceased has been identified as 30-year-old "Mintu," who the police say was linked to an inter-district bandit group. The bandits had felled a tree across Shimulia Bridge around 2 am in an attempt to rob vehicles passing through the area, OC Chabirul told bdnews24.com. When a detective police team was dispatched to the area, the bandits began firing at them. "Police returned fire and Mintu was hit by a bullet," he said. "The other bandits managed to flee. Mintu was brought to a Khoksha Upazila Health Complex for treatment, where doctors declared him dead." The police have recovered two revolvers, three bullets, a saw, and three sharp weapons from the scene,

data.name: Mojaharul Islam
data.description: Mojaharul Islam died in the custody of RAB on 9/9/2017, hours after members of the RAB arrested him in Naogaon. He was declared dead at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital at 4:37 am, according to hospital and police officials. Executive Magistrate Rohima Sultana Bushra prepared an inquest report at RMCH morgue, mentioning marks of injuries on various parts of his body. Swollen marks from hits were observed on the back of his head, forehead, throat, both hands, legs, left waist, and back. The family members of Mojaharul Islam informed reporters that he was tortured to death.

data.name: Robbani
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Syed Nurul Islam, Superintendent of Mymensingh police, said that a patrol team from Mymensingh DB police, led by its officer-in-charge Ashiqur Rahman, went to the Boilor area around 3:30 am. They were acting on information that eight to ten robbers were there to commit a robbery. The team discovered a gathering of approximately 200 people at Boilor, where the gang attempted to carry out the robbery. However, they were chased by locals and fled in two pickups. One of the gang members was caught by locals while trying to escape and was beaten to death on the spot, according to the SP. Upon hearing the news, the police team pursued the gang and learned that the criminals were hiding in the Jhitka area. When the law enforcement officers reached the location, the gang members opened fire. In response, the police returned fire, resulting in a "gunfight". During the exchange of gunfire, Robbani was shot and killed instantly, as stated by the police. However, the other members of the gang managed to escape.

data.name: Saidur Rahman
data.description: Nuruzzaman Chowdhury, Officer-in-Charge of Kalai Police Station, said that a team of law enforcers raided Harunza village to arrest Md Shapla Hossain, who was accused in a case filed under the Women and Children Repression Prevention Act by Shyamoli Akhter, a resident of the same village. Witness Ruma Khatun alleged that the police were in an angry mood during the raid and were assaulting villagers regardless of their gender. At one point, Saidur Rahman stepped forward and protested against their actions. The policemen engaged in an altercation with Saidur and later started beating him up in front of the villagers. According to Nadira Begum, Saidur's wife, as he collapsed unconscious on the ground, the policemen took him away. They then took him to Kalai Upazila Health Complex where he died from his injuries around 8:30 am. The father of the victim alleged that the police refused to file a case regarding the death of his son due to police torture in Kalai, Jaipurhat.

data.name: Maulana Saidur Rahman
data.description: Maulana Saidur was tortured to death by the members of Satkhira Sadar Police on September 16, 2017. SI Asaduzzaman and his team from Satkhira Sadar Police Station had arrested Saidur from his house, claiming that he was involved in two sabotage cases. Later, the police took him to Kathonda Bazar where they mercilessly beat him. During this time, his nephew Muttasim Billah requested the release of 5000 taka and left his uncle. However, the police demanded one lakh taka. Since Saidur couldn't pay this amount, he was taken to Satkhira Police Station where he was brutally tortured. After being taken to court, the authorities refused to accept Saidur due to his illness. Subsequently, the police took him back to Satkhira hospital. Once he recovered, the police brought Saidur to court again at around 5pm. In the afternoon, Saidur was sent to Satkhira jail. The superintendent of Satkhira Prison stated that when he fell sick that night, he was taken to the prison hospital and then transferred to Satkhira Sadar Hospital at midnight for treatment. Dr. Farhad Jamil, the residential medical officer of Satkhira Hospital, said that Saidur was being treated after being brought to the hospital. He died in the early morning and a post-mortem examination will be conducted. Dr. Jamil also mentioned that marks of torture were found on the body of the madrassa teacher, Maulana Saidur.

data.name: Miraz Hasan Teny
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight with the police in the Pipulbaria-Baliadanga field at Daulatpur in Kushtia. The deceased was identified as Teny, 27, son of Alam Mandal, a resident of the village Chatardara in Aria union of the upazila. Shah Dara Than, Officer-in-Charge of Daulatpur Police Station, said that on a tip-off, a team of police led by sub-inspector Rahim conducted a drive in the area around 03:45 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, members of the gang opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Later, the police rescued the bullet-hit Teny from the spot. He was rushed to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jalal Uddin
data.description: On April 10, 2017, Jalal Uddin was allegedly beaten to death by the police when they went to an operation to arrest a criminal at Parkasunda village, Atrai, Naogaon. The police went to the house of one Askan to arrest Mostafa, a 25-year-old alleged criminal. However, they did not find Mostafa there. At one point, Askan's nephew, Jalal Uddin, became involved in an altercation with the police. As a result, the police beat him up, and he eventually died at the scene of the incident.

data.name: Rabiul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed during a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Hadda Khal area of Sundarbans on June 10, 2017. The deceased man, Rabiul, 30, was the gang leader of Rabiul Bahani according to RAB-6. He hailed from Burigoalini village under Munshiganj upazila of Satkhira district. Khondokar Rafiqul Islam, the commanding officer of RAB-6, said that after receiving information, a RAB team went to patrol the Sundarbans with the help of local police at around 1:00 pm. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Rabiul opened fire on them and the law enforcers fired back in retaliation. During the exchange of fire, the law enforcers found Rabiul's dead body.

data.name: Nazmul Sheikh
data.description: Nazmul Sheikh, 35, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police in Berpasha, Jhalkathi on July 11, 2017.

data.name: Mamun Mia
data.description: Mamun Mia was arrested on August 9, 2017, in Nabinagar Upazila of Brahmanbaria. Later, the police took him to Deura village to recover arms. There, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police.

data.name: Moniruzzaman Shahin
data.description: Moniruzzaman was killed during a "gunfight" with the DB police around 4:30 am. The "gunfight" occurred when a team from the Detective Branch of the police raided a drug den in Galachipa, Narayanganj city, according to Md Sharifuddin, Additional Superintendent of Police in the district.

data.name: Shahinur Rahman
data.description: Officer-in-Charge Sabbirul Islam of the Kushtia Detective Branch of Police stated that they arrested Shahin and proceeded to Silaidah Kasba Ghat under Kumarkhali in Kushtia, along with the accused, to apprehend another suspect wanted in the case of murdering an expatriate. Upon sensing the presence of law enforcement, a group of criminals opened fire on the police, leading them to retaliate and resulting in a gunfight, he explained. After the gunfight concluded, Shahin, who had been shot, was rescued and transported to Kushtia General Hospital, where the attending doctors pronounced him dead, Sabbirul added.

data.name: Mokter Molla
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The "second-in-command" of a forest robber gang was killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) members in the Shailo Khal area of the Sundarbans on Monday morning. The deceased, Mokter Molla, was the second-in-command of the notorious forest robber gang "Liton Bahini".

data.name: Mohammad Selim
data.description: Major Ruhul Amin, Company Commander of Cox's Bazar RAB-7, said that they arrested Selim from the New Fishery Ghat area. Gathering information from him, a RAB team conducted a raid in the Kurushkul area around 2:00 am to apprehend his associates and recover firearms. Sensing the presence of RAB officials, his associates opened fire on the elite force, prompting them to retaliate, the officer said. He claimed that Selim died on the spot after being shot by his associates. However, Selim's associates managed to escape, according to Major Ruhul.

data.name: Mohammad Faruk
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a "gunfight" with members of RAB at Barisal Colony in Chittagong city. The deceased was Mohammad Faruk. Mimtanur Rahman, Senior Assistant Director (Media) of RAB-7, said that a team of RAB members conducted a raid at Barisal Colony to recover drugs around 2:00 am. Sensing their presence, Mimtanur claimed that drug peddlers opened fire on the RAB members, forcing them to retaliate and triggering the gunfight. During the gunfight,

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A youth was killed in a gunfight with police personnel at Tighria village in the Binauti union of Kosba upazila. The identity of the deceased could not be ascertained immediately. Police claimed that he was a robber. Mohammad Mohiuddin, officer-in-charge of Kosba Police Station, said that they conducted a raid after receiving information from local people. A group of 15 to 20 armed robbers attacked Tighria village for robbery. Sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire on the police officers. In response, the police fired back in self-defense. Later, the robbers managed to escape from the scene. Police recovered the body of an unknown person with bullet wounds from the location.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.description: An accused in the case filed over the murder of Malaysian expatriate Rafiqul Islam was killed in a gunfight with the police in Kushtia's Kumarkhali. Abdul Khalek, OC of Kumarkhali police station, said a joint team of Kumarkhali police and the Detective Branch of Police in Kushtia raided Joynabad village around 2:30 am, acting on information that some criminals were holding a meeting there. Cordoning off the spot, the police asked the criminals to surrender. Instead of listening to the law enforcers, they opened fire, the OC said. In retaliation, the police returned fire, triggering the gunfight that lasted for half an hour, the police official said, adding that they found the body of Anwar on the spot after the gunfight.

data.name: Rashel
data.description: A businessman named Rashel (25) was allegedly tortured to death by the Detective Branch (DB) of Police for one hundred thousand taka in Kaunia's Haldibari area, under the Rangpur District. Rashel's younger sister, Sohana, alleged that on October 28, 2017, at around 10:00 pm, a group of DB police led by Sub Inspector Shafi arrested her brother from Haldibari Bazaar. Later, at around 1:00 am, SI Shafi went to their home and demanded a one hundred thousand taka bribe for releasing Rashel. When they said they did not have the capacity to pay this amount, SI Shafi threatened her father and brother with being accused in a criminal case. Later, the DB police inflicted torture on her brother. Due to the torture in custody, the DB police admitted Rashel to Rangpur Medical College Hospital. On October 29, her brother died in the hospital while receiving treatment.

data.name: Afajuddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber was killed in a gunfight with the police while his gang was preparing to commit a robbery in Gazipur city. The deceased is Afajuddin from Pachahar village in Pagla, Mymensingh. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided the area, and upon sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire on them, triggering the gunfight, said Sakhawat Hossain, Additional SP (Gazipur Sadar-Tongi Circle).

data.name: Anwar Hossain Anar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the RAB in the Kaundia area of Savar on January 11, 2017. The deceased is Anwar Hossain Anar, 40, of Kaundia. He was the ringleader of the robber gang named "Gangchil Bahini," said RAB sources. Members of RAB-3 raided the house of the late Liakot Mia in the Kaundia Melartek area around 4:45 am, acting on a tip-off that some robbers were staying there, said Lt Col Khandker Golam Sarwar, Commanding Officer of RAB 3. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then retaliated, triggering the "gunfight," the RAB official said. After the gun battle, the RAB members found Anar injured. But others managed to flee the scene, said Sarwar, adding that Anwar was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police.

data.name: Faisal
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Lemua, Fenion, on July 11, 2017.

data.name: Yusuf Fakir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: RAB says that the two victims, Yusuf Fakir and Ruhul Amin, are members of the 'Forest Robber Abbas Gang'. They did not provide any further details about the two. "For the past fifteen days, some robbers who split off from various gangs have joined together to kidnap and ransom fishermen from different places in the Sundarbans and the Bay of Bengal," said Al-Razib. "RAB received a tip-off on Wednesday morning that eight to ten robbers were preparing near Katla creek. A team was sent to the area. The robbers noticed the team and started shooting. After a 45-minute shootout, the robbers escaped deeper into the woods. RAB then found two bodies at the scene. "Local fishermen identified them as members of the Forest Bandit Abbas Gang." Seven firearms and 124 rounds of ammunition were found at the scene, according to the RAB official.

data.name: Ruhul Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: RAB says that the two victims, Yusuf Fakir and Ruhul Amin, are members of the 'Forest Robber Abbas Gang'. They did not provide any further details about the two. "For the past fifteen days, some robbers who split off from various gangs have joined together to kidnap and ransom fishermen from different places in the Sundarbans and the Bay of Bengal," said Al-Razib. "RAB received a tip-off on Wednesday morning that eight to ten robbers were preparing near Katla creek. A team was sent to the area. The robbers noticed the team and started shooting. After a 45-minute shootout, the robbers escaped deeper into the woods. RAB then found two bodies at the scene. "Local fishermen identified them as members of the Forest Bandit Abbas Gang." Seven firearms and 124 rounds of ammunition were found at the scene, according to the RAB official.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: Al Amin, also known as Akash, 32, was killed in what the police claimed was a crossfire between the DB police and his armed accomplices in South Keraniganj. He was killed hours after the police apprehended him in Munshiganj. Dipok Chandra Saha, the Officer-in-Charge of Dhaka District Police's Detective Branch (South), stated that a police team, accompanied by Al Amin, conducted a raid in the Khejurbagan area around 2:30 am to seize weapons and drugs. However, when the armed gang members began shooting at the police in an attempt to free him, he was shot and died.

data.name: Mokarram Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A "top robber" enlisted by the Home Ministry was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and RAB in Cox's Bazar. The deceased, Mokarram Hossain, 38, led the local gang "Jambu Bahini," according to RAB. Major Ruhul Amin, Commander of RAB-7 in Cox's Bazar camp, claimed that they had received a tip-off about a gang preparing to conduct a robbery at sea. In response, they positioned themselves with firearms in Kutubjom. Sensing the gang's presence, they opened fire on them, and the force retaliated in self-defense, he claimed. After a 30-minute encounter, the gang fled, and the criminal was found with bullet wounds. He was declared dead at a local hospital, he said.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers, Saiful Islam and Safiq Mollah, were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB members at Chatlar Ghat under Hatia in Noakhali. Saiful, wanted in nine cases for murder, robbery, and abduction, was the alleged ringleader of the notorious pirate gang "Saiful Bahini," while Safiq was one of his cohorts, according to RAB. RAB-11 Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police Jasim Uddin said that they received information that the Saiful gang members were staying at Chatlar Ghat and conducted a raid in the area around 4:00 am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, and RAB members retaliated by firing, resulting in a gunfight that left the two robbers dead on the spot.

data.name: Safiq Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers, Saiful Islam and Safiq Mollah, were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB members at Chatlar Ghat under Hatia in Noakhali. Saiful, wanted in nine cases for murder, robbery, and abduction, was the alleged ringleader of the notorious pirate gang "Saiful Bahini," while Safiq was one of his cohorts, according to RAB. RAB-11 Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police Jasim Uddin said that they received information that the Saiful gang members were staying at Chatlar Ghat and conducted a raid in the area around 4:00 am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, and RAB members retaliated by firing, resulting in a gunfight that left the two robbers dead on the spot.

data.name: Palash Mandol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Palash Mandal, Second in Command of the Munna robber gang, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Bhayenar Khal of Sunderban, said Koira police officer-in-charge Enamul Haq. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers started firing, triggering a fight which left Palash dead, said Enamul.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Shah Alam died in police custody after he was picked up with his two sons and two nephews from their house in Hazaribagh over a robbery case filed by one of their neighbors. He fell sick during a court hearing and was first taken to the nearby National Medical College Hospital. However, doctors referred him to DMCH as his condition deteriorated. DMCH doctors declared him dead. The victim's daughter, Umme Kulsum, said that the police arrested her father, two brothers—Osman Gani and Murad Hossain—and two of their cousins from their house in Hazaribagh without any warrant. "They were kept in police custody, tortured, and we were not told the reason for their arrest," said Umme Kulsum.

data.name: Billal Hossain Selim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in what police claimed was a shootout between the police and his armed cohorts in the capital's Khilgaon area. Billal Hossain Selim, 45, son of Syed Ali of Tangail, was killed hours after the police had picked him up from Demra in Dhaka. He was suspected to be a leader of an inter-district robbery gang and was accused in at least 10 cases, according to the police. Anwar Hossain, deputy commissioner (Motijheel) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, said a team of Khilgaon police took Billal on a drive in the Mostafa Majhir area to arrest his cohorts and recover firearms around 2:00 am. As the police reached there, an armed group opened fire on them in an attempt to free Billal. The law enforcers claimed they returned fire and Billal was shot at one point. He was declared dead upon arriving at DMCH, the DC said at a press conference at his office.

data.name: Abbas Sarder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged member of the Purba Bangla Communist Party was killed in a gunfight with the police at the Kalitola Kheyaghat area of Beninagar village under Rajbari Sadar. The deceased was Abbas Sarder, also known as Khokon (46). Tarik Kamal, Officer-in-Charge of Rajbari Sadar Police Station, said a team from Sadar Police Station and DB Police drove to the Kalitola area at around 3:30 am. As the police reached there, an armed group opened fire on them. The law enforcers claimed they returned fire, and Khokon was shot at one point. He was declared dead upon arrival at Sadar Hospital. Police recovered a Kata Rifle, three cartridges, and one shooter gun from that place.

data.name: Mohimuddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An alleged member of the student wing of Jamaat was killed in a shootout between RAB and his associates in Chittagong. According to RAB, Mohin was known to be an operative of the notorious student wing of Jamaat member, Sazzad. The shootout took place in the Rajganj area of Panchlaish around 4:00 am, said Ashequr Rahman, Lt Commander and deputy director of RAB7. Acting on information that a group of armed criminals, led by Mohin, had gathered at Rajganj, a RAB team from Chandgaon camp went to the location to arrest them. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers. As the RAB team fired retaliatory shots, the criminals fled the area, leaving Mohin, who had been hit by bullets, behind. Law enforcers later recovered Mohin's body from the scene.

data.name: Bidyut Kumar Bachhar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Tala upazila of Satkhira on March 12, 2017. They were Bidyut Kumar Bachhar, 46, of Maguradanga village, and Talha Sheikh, 26, of Sujanshah village in the upazila. Hasan Hafizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Tala Police Station, said a police team, led by sub-inspectors Mozaffar Hossain and Nazmul Haque, was on a regular patrol on March 11, 2017 night. During the patrol, the team came to know that some robbers were in a mango orchard in Rahimabad village to commit a robbery. When the law enforcers reached near the spot around 3:15 am, the criminals opened fire. The police then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gunbattle", the police found the bodies of Bidyut and Talha lying on the spot. The others managed to flee, the police official said. According to the Daily Sun, two robbers were killed in a gunfight with the police at Rahimabad area in Tala upazila of the district early Sunday. The deceased were identified as Biddut Kumar, 46, a resident of Maguradanga village in the upazila, and Talha Sheikh, 26, a resident of Sujonshah village of the same upazila. Officer-in-charge of Talha police station, Hasan Hafizur Rahman, said that upon receiving information, a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery. The police conducted a raid at the mango garden in the area around 3:15 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they fired on them, triggering a gunfight that left two people dead on the spot. The police also recovered two pistols, four cocktails, two bullets, and some homemade weapons from the spot. According to Bdnews24, Tala police station OC Hassan Hafizur Rahman said the encounter was reported around 3 am early on Sunday from Rahimabad village in a mango orchard owned by one Laxman Das. Those killed have been identified as Bidyut Bachharh and Sheikh Talha. The police said Bachharh headed the 'Bidyut Bahini' faction of the now-def

data.name: Afzal Hossain
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. According to The Daily Star, an alleged drug peddler was killed when the police, who came under a machete attack, opened fire in Rajshahi city early today. Afzal Hossain, in his early 30s, was shot after he injured three policemen with a sharp weapon during a raid at his house in the Dasmari Satbaria area of the city, as reported by our Rajshahi correspondent, Officer-in-Charge of Motihar Police Station Humayun Kabir. Afzal was declared dead after being taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital. His body was sent to the hospital morgue for an autopsy. Assistant Commissioner of Rajshahi Metropolitan Police, Sushanto Chandra Roy, who led the raid, is among the three injured policemen. They were admitted to the police lines hospital, the OC said. In the raid conducted around 2:00 am, Afzal attacked the policemen with a machete soon after they reached the house, prompting the law enforcers to fire in retaliation. Afzal was accused in a case filed with Motihar Police Station for drug trade. According to New Age, a local drug dealer was killed early Monday in a reported gunfight with the police in the Jahajghat area of Rajshahi City. The deceased was identified as Afzal Hossain, also known as Faysal, 32, accused in several cases filed for drug peddling, according to the police. Officer-in-charge of Motihar police station, Humayun Kabir, told New Age that they conducted a raid at Afzal's house based on a tip-off. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, Afzal fired gunshots at the police, who retaliated, triggering the gunfight, he said. After the gunfight, Afzal was wounded by a bullet and rushed to Rajshahi Medical College and Hospital, where the on-duty physician pronounced him dead, the OC added. The police also recovered a pistol from the spot. Four police officials were also injured during the 'gunfight', he added.

data.name: Abdul Halim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) near Jhaoil bridge in Kamarkhanda upazila early Wednesday. The deceased is Abdul Halim, 38, son of the late Kamal Sarkar from Panchbaria village of the upazila. Major Shafayet Sumon, commanding officer of RAB 12 crime prevention branch, stated that acting on a tip-off about some robbers preparing to commit robberies, the RAB members conducted a raid there in the dead of night. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the gang opened fire at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. Later, the RAB personnel sent Halim's body to Sirajganj Sadar Hospital morgue for a post-mortem examination.

data.name: Didarul Alam Chowdhury Sohel
data.description: Mimtanur Rahman, Assistant Director of the media wing at RAB 7, said that a RAB team went to Durgapur beside the Dhaka-Chittagong highway around 3:30 am. They were acting on information that some criminals were carrying a consignment of phensidyl to Chittagong in microbuses from Dhaka. Five to six criminals came out of two microbuses and opened fire on the RAB men after they were intercepted at a checkpoint, forcing them to return fire. Didar was hit by bullets, said Squadron Leader Safayat Jamil Fahim, Company Commander of RAB-7, who led the operation. Didar was declared dead when he was taken to Mirsarai Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Modon Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber, Modon Mia alias Mozammel, 40, son of the late Rahman Miah of Bhadeshwar union in Bahubal, has been killed in a reported gunfight with the police in the Daragaon tea garden area under Bahubal upazila of Habiganj district. Mazharul Islam, officer-in-charge of Bahubal Police Station, said Modon stood accused in seven cases, including those related to arms, robbery, and murder. The police arrested him and took him to the tea garden area to apprehend his associates around 3:30 am, as per his statement, the police official said. Sensing the presence of the police, Modon's associates opened fire. In retaliation, the police fired back, triggering the "gunfight". Modon was caught in the line of fire when he was trying to flee from police custody. He was pronounced dead after being taken to Habiganj Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Sirazul Islam
data.description: Police arrested Sirazul, an accused in the killing of Sadia, who was raped and killed on December 4th, 2017. The next day, he was brought before the court and admitted to the incident. On December 8th, he suddenly fell ill at Barisal Central Jail. He was then rushed to Sher-E-Bangla Medical College Hospital, where he later succumbed to his injuries. Based on the doctors' prescription and information, it was determined that he fell ill due to torture and subsequently died.

data.name: Abdullah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the capital's Tejgaon area. Abdullah, 30, from Kishoreganj, was a wanted criminal, said Mohammad Rasheduzzaman, an inspector of Tejgaon Industrial Area Police Station. He said the police raided the BG Press field around 3:30 am on information that some criminals had gathered there to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". When the criminals fled, the police found the bullet-hit body of Abdullah lying on the spot, the police official said. Abdullah was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, he added.

data.name: Anu Ahmed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: On Friday night, around 4 o'clock, an incident of a gunfight with the police occurred in front of City College on the Kushtia-Rajbari road. During this time, Anu Ahmed, also known as Alam (40), was killed. He was the son of Abdul Latif from Jatrapur village in the Kaliganj sub-district of Jhalokati. According to the police, Alam was a member of an inter-district robbery gang. Kushtia DB Police's OC Shabbirul Islam reported that four police members were injured in this incident.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police (Kanaighat circle), Aminul Islam Sarker, said a team of police led by sub-inspector Bashir raided Habibur's house in village Charipara as he was wanted in many robbery cases. The police were attempting to arrest him. Sensing the presence of the police, Habibur opened fire on them, while his family members attacked the police with knives. The police fired back, injuring at least 8 people, including Habibur and four officers, according to Aminul. "Habibur was sent to SOMCH in critical condition after being recovered from the scene, but he died on the way to the hospital," the police officer said.

data.name: Mohammad Russel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a shootout during a police raid in Debidwar, Comilla. The deceased were identified as Russell and Omar Faruk. According to Comilla DB police, a shootout ensued when a police team led by Additional Police Superintendent Abdullah Al Mamun arrived in the Hatimara area of Debidwar. They were acting on a tip-off that a team of 10-15 robbers was preparing for a robbery there. The robbers opened fire after sensing the lawmen's presence, triggering a response from the police. Two robbers were killed on the spot, and five policemen were injured. Police arrested five members of the gang and seized a firearm along with ammunition and lethal weapons from the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Omar Faruk
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a shootout during a police raid in Debidwar, Comilla. The deceased were identified as Russell and Omar Faruk. According to Comilla DB police, a shootout ensued when a police team led by Additional Police Superintendent Abdullah Al Mamun arrived in the Hatimara area of Debidwar. They were acting on a tip-off that a team of 10-15 robbers was preparing for a robbery there. The robbers opened fire after sensing the lawmen's presence, triggering a response from the police. Two robbers were killed on the spot, and five policemen were injured. Police arrested five members of the gang and seized a firearm along with ammunition and lethal weapons from the spot.

data.name: Kohinur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A high-ranking member of the outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party (ML Janajuddho) faction was killed in a shootout with the police in Sadar upazila of Chuadanga. The police arrested Ketu from a hideout in Keraniganj, Dhaka, and later brought him to Chuadanga Sadar Police Station in the evening. During interrogation, Ketu admitted to having firearms in Bhalipur village in the district," said Amir Abbas, Officer-in-Charge (OC-operation) of Chuadanga Sadar Police Station. "The police accompanied Ketu to recover the hidden firearms. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot on Chuadanga-Jhenidah highway, Ketu's associates opened fire, leading to a gunfight between them and the police," he said. "Ketu was killed in the line of fire when he tried to flee from police custody with handcuffs.

data.name: Riad Sharif
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with the DB Police in Rupganj. Riad, who was accused in several robbery cases, said the police. Acting on information that a gang was planning to commit a robbery in the Kanchan bridge area, detectives conducted a raid there. However, upon sensing the presence of the police, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to return fire, said the Narayanganj district DB. They also recovered a foreign pistol, four bullets, a machete, and a large knife from the scene.

data.name: Shamim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The Detective Branch of the police in Comilla stated that a suspected robber was killed in a gunfight between the DB police and a group of robbers in Chandina. DB sub-inspector Shah Kamal Akand explained that the gunfight occurred while a DB police team was patrolling different areas of Chandina. "When we reached Chhaygharia on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway around 2:40 am, the robbers intercepted our microbus with local weapons and rod bars in an attempt to rob the vehicle, not realizing that we were law enforcers," he said. The DB members chased the robbers who, in return, opened fire on the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight that left Shamim critically injured. The other robbers managed to escape, but the detectives recovered one locally made gun and sharp weapons from the scene. Later, Shamim was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, the SI added. However, Shamim's family members alleged that Shahim was picked up by some men in plainclothes from his village home on Saturday.

data.name: Yunus Mia
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Yunus Mia was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police while they were conducting an operation to catch miscreants at Dimagurunda village, Chunarughat, Hobiganj at around 11:30 pm on December 31, 2017. The police claimed that Yunus attacked them and, in retaliation, they opened fire, resulting in Yunus Mia's death. On the other hand, Yunus's wife, Kazi Shahana Akhter, informed that the police had picked up Yunus Mia in the evening.

data.name: Anowar Hossain
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with members of RAB at Dharmapur, Sadar Upazila, Feni on December 31, 2017.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Raju
data.description: A person was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Feni. The deceased was Anwar Hossain Raju, son of Jahangir Alam of Dharmapur in Feni Sadar. Anwar's father, Jahangir Alam, alleged that his son, who was released on bail only 10 days earlier, was picked up by RAB personnel from the house around 4:00 am. Later, they heard that his son was killed in a "gunfight". Feni Camp Commander of RAB-7, Squadron Leader Shafayat Jamil Fahim, claimed that on a tip-off that a gang of drug traders had gathered at Dharmapur, a team of the battalion raided the area. The drug traders opened fire on RAB personnel, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. Anwar received bullet wounds during the gunfight. He was taken to Feni General Hospital where on-duty physicians declared him dead.

data.name: Lutfar Rahman
data.description: Officer-in-Charge Ansari Jinnat Ali of Mohanganj Police Station stated that Lutfar was apprehended, and the police initiated a nighttime operation with Lutfar in Noapara to retrieve illegal weapons. While conducting the operation, Lutfar's associates fired shots at the police, prompting them to retaliate and resulting in a gunfight. Lutfar was injured by a bullet during the exchange of gunfire and was subsequently transported to Mohanganj Health Complex, where attending doctors pronounced him deceased.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Narayanganj, a suspected robber was killed in what the police described as a "shootout" in Fuldee village of Sonargaon upazila. The deceased was Nazrul Islam, 36, from Dudkhatha village in the Upazila. A police team was patrolling the Fuldee area when a local resident announced through a mosque loudspeaker that 10-12 robbers inside a bush were preparing to commit a robbery, according to Morshed Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Sonargaon Police Station. When the team arrived at around 4:00 am, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcement officers retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight". After the exchange of gunfire, the police discovered the bullet-riddled body of Nazrul at the scene, while the others fled.

data.name: Abdur Rahim
data.description: Abdur Rahim, 20, who was accused of raping the girl in Chakaria upazila on March 26, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. The incident occurred in the Ulubania area, adjacent to Katakhali Bridge, under Dulahazara union, around 12:30 am. Company Commander Maj Md Ruhul Amin of RAB's Cox's Bazar camp said that criminals opened fire on a patrol team of the elite force. The crime busters returned fire and drove away the criminals. The RAB team recovered the bullet-hit body of Rahim from the spot.

data.name: Haider Ali
data.description: Mimtanur Rahman, Media Officer of RAB-7, said that acting on a tip-off, RAB conducted a raid around 12:30 am to arrest miscreants. "After some criminals sensed the presence of law enforcers, a 'gunfight' ensued between them and the RAB members. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene," he said, adding that they recovered Haider's bullet-ridden body from the spot.

data.name: Monir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A suspected top terrorist from the Mohammadpur area was killed in a shootout reportedly taking place in Keraniganj, Dhaka, early Wednesday (August 1). He was identified as Monir. RAB-2 Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police, Md Rabiul Islam, told Banglanews that they conducted a raid based on information that a gang of robbers was attempting to commit robbery in the Ati Bhawal area of Keraniganj. RAB fired back in retaliation as the robbers opened fire at them. At one stage, Monir died on the spot after being shot.

data.name: Nazim Uddin Shikder
data.description: The police stated that he suffered from cardiac arrest. However, the deceased's family members claimed that he was tortured to death by the DB Police. He subsequently passed away at Jamalpur General Hospital.

data.name: Solaiman
data.description: An alleged kidnapper of a child was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Ashuganj. Police arrested Solaiman on charges of kidnapping Rifat (7), the son of Bahar Mia from Khariala village in the upazila. Following his statement given during the primary interrogation, a team of police raided the abandoned Ankhi Trading and Boiler House in Bahadurpur area to arrest the prime suspect Mizan in the case, said Officer-in-Charge of Ashuganj Police Station, Badrul Alam Talukder. Sensing the presence of the police, Solaiman's accomplices opened fire on them. As the police returned fire, a gunfight ensued, and a bullet fired by his cohorts hit Solaiman. He was pronounced dead upon arrival at Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Bashar Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Brahmanbaria, two suspected robbers who were arrested on Saturday were killed in a "gunfight" in Sarail upazila early yesterday, as reported by our district correspondent. The deceased individuals are Bashar Mia, 30, from Swajangram village in Habiganj's Lakhai upazila, and Abdul Wahab, also known as "Enta Dakat", 28, from Sotiara village in Brahmanbaria Sadar upazila. Law enforcement officials stated that Wahab was accused in six cases, including murder and robbery, while Bashar was accused in five cases. Mofijul Islam, the officer-in-charge of Sarail Police Station, said, "The police went to recover firearms based on the information provided by the two suspects. When the police team reached Shahbazpur-Deora regional road in Sarail upazila around 2:45 am, their accomplices attacked the police in an attempt to snatch the two suspects." The "criminals" opened fire, and the police retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight". Wahab and Bashar were killed on the spot. The police claimed to have recovered a homemade gun, two cartridges, and several sharp weapons from the scene.

data.name: Razaz Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Rangpur city. Saifur Rahman, the Additional Superintendent of Police in Rangpur, said that upon receiving a tip-off about a gang of robbers preparing for a robbery in the Dharmadash area near the Rice Research Institute, a police team was dispatched to the location. When the law enforcers arrived at around 4:00 am, the gang opened fire at them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. One member of the gang was killed in the ensuing "gunfight," while the others managed to escape. The police recovered the deceased body and sent it to Rangpur Medical College Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: A man was killed and two others were injured in a clash between the police and a group of villagers in Sitakunda upazila of Chittagong. The deceased was Saiful Islam, 22, son of Shamsul Alam of Telipara village under Bhatiari union. A team of plainclothes policemen went to the village to detain some criminals around 9:00 pm. The clash broke out as the villagers tried to stop the law enforcers from making the arrests, said locals. "Suddenly, the criminals tried to escape. At one point, the police opened fire, leaving one dead and two injured," said Nazim Uddin, chairman of Bhatiari Union Parishad. Later, the villagers blocked the Dhaka-Chittagong highway near the village for an hour in protest. They left after the chairman assured them of justice.

data.name: Swapan Pyada
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Barguna, three "robbers" of a gang were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. Officials of RAB-8 said the gang, locally known as Munna Bahini, was involved in abducting fishermen and honey collectors from the Bay of Bengal and the Sundarbans for ransom. Acting on a tip-off, the RAB men raided the Majherchar area around 5:30 am. When the RAB team reached the area, the robbers opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight," said Hasan Al Rajib, Company Commander of RAB-8 in Patuakhali. Three bodies were found on the spot after the "gun battle.

data.name: Liton Khondokar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang

data.name: Iman Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a shootout with police in Chuadanga. Ahsan Habib, Assistant Superintendent of Police in Chuadanga, said a police team, led by him, raided the village around 1:30 am on information that some robbers were preparing to commit robbery on the highway. Sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire. The police returned fire, triggering the gunfight. During the gun battle, Iman was hit and he died on the spot, while others fled, the police official said.

data.name: Mohammad Naim
data.description: A suspected snatcher was killed in an alleged incident that police claimed was a 'gunfight' between the police and suspected snatchers at Balashpur Balurchar area. The deceased, Md Naim, 22, of Krishtapur area of the town, was the prime suspect for the murder of Ananda Mohan College HSC student Ibrahim Khalil, who was stabbed to death by suspected snatchers in the town's Patgudam area on January 15, police said. Mymensingh Kotwali Police Station officer-in-charge Khandaker Saker Ahmed said a team of the Detective Branch of Police, upon receiving information that a group of snatchers including Naim were staying at Balshpur, conducted a drive in the area to arrest the suspects of Ibrahim Khalil's killing. Sensing the presence of the police, the snatchers opened fire, forcing the cops to shoot back. Naim sustained bullet injuries while his accomplices managed to flee. Police took him to the Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Julhash Mondol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged top leader of an outlawed party was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Dhalarchar area of Pabna's Bera upazila during a drive to recover illegal firearms. Pabna Police Superintendent Jihadul Kabir said Julhas was a listed criminal and had been in hiding for some time. A team from Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) had arrested Julhas in the capital's New Market area and then handed him over to Pabna police. Acting on information obtained from him, Aminpur police took Julhash along with them during a raid to recover a cache of arms in Dourir Char of Bera upazila. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, his cohorts fired shots at the police near Balaz Member intersection in Dhalar Char area around 1:00 am, prompting the police to retaliate and thus triggering a "gunfight". At one point in the "gunfight", Julhash's cohorts fled, leaving Julhash's body behind, Sukumar Mohonto, Officer in Charge of Aminpur police station, said.

data.name: Rinku Dewan
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station, Alamgir Hossain, said that acting on a tip-off, the police went to the Charbeherpara area to arrest Rinku around 12:00 noon. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Rinku opened fire at them. Sub-Inspector Sanjay was shot in the leg. The police opened fire in retaliation and, at one stage, Rinku was shot and killed. The police recovered his body and a firearm from the spot. The Superintendent of Police, Mohammad Jayedul Alam, claimed that Rinku was a "notorious criminal" and involved in various offenses.

data.name: Sohorab Hossain Sourav
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in what police claimed was a gunfight between the police and suspected robbers at Pathannagar, under Chhagalnaia in Feni. Family members of the deceased, Sohorab Hossain Sourav, 30, son of Mohammad Amin from the village of Pathannagar, under Chhagalnaia upazila, alleged that the police shot Sohorab to death after taking him from their residence. Chhagalnaia Police Station Officer-in-Charge MM Morshed said they arrested Sohorab for his alleged involvement in a recent incident of robbery, which resulted in the death of a Saudi expatriate in Pathannagar. Based on his information, the police said they conducted a raid at Pathannagar when the suspected robbers, who were also associates of the deceased, opened fire on the police personnel upon sensing their presence. The police claimed that this prompted the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. He said that Sohorab received a bullet during the gunfight, and the police rushed him to Feni Sadar Hospital, where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurul Islam Nura
data.description: Nurul Islam Nura, a suspect in the Merul Badda murder, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police's Detective Branch (DB) near Badda's Satarkul area in Dhaka. The OC said Nura was sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) for treatment after being detained. A DB team took him on a late-night drive. Upon reaching Satarkul, the DB team was allegedly fired upon by Nura's associates. A stray bullet allegedly hit Nura, who was taken back to DMCH, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Anu
data.description: Major Ruhul Amin, Company Commander of RAB-7, said that RAB conducted an operation, acting on a tip-off, around 4:00 am to arrest Anwar. "After the presence of law enforcers was sensed by some criminals, a "gunfight" ensued between them and the RAB officials. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. RAB recovered Anwar's bullet-ridden body and took it to Chakaria Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Selim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Boro Kumira area in Chittagong. Around 3:30 am, a group of six armed robbers waylaid a Laksham-bound pickup in the Boro Kumira area on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmad, Commanding Officer of RAB-7. The vehicle, coming from Hathazari upazila, was carrying 21 people, including children and women, and wedding gifts for a bridegroom. The criminals beat up the people and looted valuables, including gold ornaments, and cash from them. The victims informed a RAB patrol team of the matter. After a short search, the RAB personnel found the robbers under a bridge where they were distributing the looted valuables among themselves. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire, forcing the RAB men to retaliate. After the "gun battle," the RAB team found a bullet-hit man on the spot and the looted valuables. The others managed to flee. He was declared dead after being taken to Sitakunda Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspect in the robbery at the house of Awami League lawmaker Dabirul Islam in a village in Thakurgaon was killed in what the police claimed was a gunfight between the suspected robbers and members of the detective branch of the police at Haripukur, under Sadar upazila in Thakurgaon, early on Tuesday. The identity of the deceased, who was around 30 years old, could not be determined until Tuesday evening. Thakurgaon detective branch of police officer-in-charge, Md Rafiqul Islam, told New Age that based on secret information about a gang of robbers involved in the robbery at Dabirul Islam's house, a team of DB raided the Haripukur area. As the police arrived, he said, the suspected robbers opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate. "After the suspected robbers fled and the gunfight was over, we found a youth with a bullet wound there. He was rushed to Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital, where the on-duty doctors declared him dead," he said.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: On April 2, 2018, a group of 10-12 smugglers entered Bangladesh from India with Indian sarees. During that time, BGB members from Kakdanga camp challenged them. The smugglers then opened fire on them, prompting the BGB members to retaliate in self-defense, resulting in one person being shot and wounded. Local people rushed him to Khulna's Gazi Clinic, where he later died.

data.name: Ibrahim Majhi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in what RAB claimed to be a gunfight between suspected robbers and RAB at Char Elahi under Companiganj Upazila in Noakhali. The deceased was Ibrahim Majhi, from Sandwip Upazila in Chittagong. His name was on the list of robbers prepared by the Home Ministry. Additional Superintendent of Noakhali police, AKM Zahirul Haq, said that a team of RAB-7 from Chittagong conducted a raid in the area. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on RAB members, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. At one stage, Ibrahim was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while others managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Quazi Md Emran Hossain Saiful
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Saiful was killed in police custody in what the police claimed was a gunfight between the police and suspected robbers at GM Hat area in Phulgazi, Feni. However, the victim's family claimed that the man was picked up by the police and shot in the head, allegedly due to enmity with some influential locals over his soil business. Phulgazi Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Md Humayun Kabir, stated that they conducted a raid at GM Hat area to arrest Saiful, but he managed to flee after attacking Constable Abul Khayer, 45, who sustained serious injuries. Later that night, the police lodged a case with the Phulgazi police station and arrested Saiful at his residence. He added that the police later conducted another raid at GM Hat area with Saiful, and when the team reached near GM Hat Brickfield, Saiful's accomplices opened fire on the police. The police retaliated by firing back, resulting in the shooting of three suspected robbers, including Saiful. All the injured individuals were rushed to Feni Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared Saiful dead.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In the Kadamtali area of the capital, a man named Abdur Rashid (40) has been killed in a 'gunfight' with the police. The police claim that the deceased, Rashid, was a robber. OC Abdul Jalil of Kadamtali Police Station reported that around 5:30 am yesterday, information reached the police that an organized gang of robbers was present in the area near the WASA pond under the jurisdiction of the Kadamtali police station. At that time, when police officers arrived at the scene, the gang members targeted the police with gunfire and Molotov cocktails. In response, the police retaliated, and one bullet struck the left leg of a robber named Rashid. Severely injured, he was rescued by the police and admitted to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors later pronounced him dead.

data.name: Badsha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Gabtoli area. The "gunfight" took place when a RAB team signaled a truck, carrying a group of robbers, to stop around 3:30 am, said RAB-10 Deputy Director Major Jamshedur Rahman. He added that the elite force had set up checkpoints at several spots, including Gabtoli, Mirpur-10, and Airport Road, based on information that a gang was heading towards Dhaka to commit a robbery. In Gabtoli, one of the RAB teams signaled a mini-truck to stop at the checkpoint, but the driver tried to speed away. When another team stationed ahead intercepted the truck, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, said Muhammed Mohiduddin Faruqe, Company Commander of RAB-10. At one stage, the robbers tried to escape without the vehicle when two of them were shot and left behind. Badsha was declared dead upon arrival at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, while Hanif succumbed to his injuries around 2:30 pm.

data.name: Hanif Hamid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Gabtoli area. The "gunfight" took place when a RAB team signaled a truck, carrying a group of robbers, to stop around 3:30 am, said RAB-10 Deputy Director Major Jamshedur Rahman. He added that the elite force had set up checkpoints at several spots, including Gabtoli, Mirpur-10, and Airport Road, based on information that a gang was heading towards Dhaka to commit a robbery. In Gabtoli, one of the RAB teams signaled a mini-truck to stop at the checkpoint, but the driver tried to speed away. When another team stationed ahead intercepted the truck, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, said Muhammed Mohiduddin Faruqe, Company Commander of RAB-10. At one stage, the robbers tried to escape without the vehicle when two of them were shot and left behind. Badsha was declared dead upon arrival at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, while Hanif succumbed to his injuries around 2:30 pm.

data.name: Hasan Ali
data.description: A man suspected to be the main accused in the murder of Dhaka Metropolitan Police's Detective Branch Inspector Jalaluddin was killed in what police called a gunfight between DB officers and suspected criminals at Pirerbagh. The photograph of Hasan Ali, the main suspect in Jalaluddin's murder, matches with the man who was killed in the gunfight. Metropolitan Police Detective Branch (West Division) Deputy Commissioner Mohammed Mokhlesur Rahman said that, acting on a tip-off, a DB team conducted a raid at the Bhanga Bridge area of Pirerbagh around 2:30 am to apprehend the suspects of Jalal's murder and recover firearms. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement officers, the criminals opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate by firing back. An unidentified young man, approximately 25 years old, was caught in the crossfire and sustained bullet injuries while the others managed to escape the scene. Later, the police rescued the critically injured man and took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jahirul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Dakkhinkhan Police said that a robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in Dibrabari. They said local people caught five robbers during a robbery at a house in the Mollartek area of Dakkhinkhan Police Station. Among the five robbers, the police launched a drive with Jahirul Islam in the Diabari area around 3:00 am. Sensing the police presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, leaving Jahirul shot. Tapan Kumar Saha, Dakkhana Police Station Officer-in-Charge, claimed. The OC further demanded that, after being rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, the duty doctor declared him dead at around 5 am.

data.name: Uzzal Mia
data.description: The main suspect in the stabbing of a police officer was killed in what the police claimed was a gunfight between the Detective Branch of Police and suspected drug traders in the Saheb Kachhari area. The deceased was Uzzal Mia, 26, the son of Samor Ali from the Jailkhana Road area in Gouripur municipality in Mymensingh. Ashiqur Rahman, the Officer-in-Charge of the Mymensingh district Detective Branch, claimed that a team of district DB, acting on secret information, conducted a raid at the Saheb Kachhari area at around 2:00 am to apprehend Uzzal. He said that Uzzal and his accomplices, upon sensing the presence of the police, opened fire on the law enforcement officers, prompting them to retaliate. The police officer stated that after the gunfight ended, they found Uzzal seriously injured and rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shahid Uddin Mallik
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Shahid Uddin Mallik was killed on Tuesday in what police are describing as a gunfight between "two groups of gangsters." Apurba Haldar, the Officer in Charge (OC) of Benapole Police Station, stated that Mallik had 21 drug charges against him and was caught in the crossfire between rival gangs. Shahid's brother, Monir Hossain Mallik, told reporters that his sibling had been arrested by individuals claiming to be police officials in front of the Sharsha Sub Registry Office, and he had been missing since then. When confronted with these allegations, Haldar, the OC, firmly denied ever arresting Mallik.

data.name: Krishnapada Das
data.description: A person has died in police custody in Bhola. The deceased, Krishnapada Das (52), is the son of Sunil Das from the Pandit Bari of Ward No. 3 in Bapta Union of Bhola Sadar Upazila. Krishna's wife, Chatur Rani Das, and son, Sujon Das, allege that a local UP member's son is involved in the marijuana and yaba trade. He had been pressuring Krishna to carry drugs for him. But when Krishna refused, the individual threatened to have him arrested. Sujon Das said that on Friday morning, UP member Manju Matubbar's son, Joni alias Roni, arrested his father and handed him over to the police through the UP chairman, along with some marijuana. Subsequently, there was torture. Sujon said his father was pulled by a rope tied around his neck, resulting in his death in police custody. Bhola's Civil Surgeon, Dr. Rathindranath Majumdar, said that after bringing Krishnapada to Sadar Hospital, oxygen was administered. He then died during an ECG. "An autopsy has been performed. Details will be provided once the report is received," he said. Regarding this matter, Bhola Model Police Station OC Mo. Chogir Mia said, "Krishnapada was caught with drugs. He died from a stroke." Bhola Model Police Station SI Rafiqul Islam Firoz said that the UP member's son was also present when Krishnapada was brought to the police station.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three people were killed on the Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya at around 4:30 pm in an "exchange of bullets" with RAB, the police said. The identities of the three individuals could not be determined. Major Mohammad Ali, the Second in Command of Battalion-2, stated that they launched a operation in the area based on information that some highway robbers were planning to commit a robbery in the Keliya area. Upon sensing the presence of the battalion members, the robbers fired gunshots at them, forcing them to retaliate and resulting in a gunfight. Eventually, the gang members fled the scene, leaving three bodies behind.
