data.name: Saidul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A suspected member of an underground party was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and the police at Jakura Balurghat in Sadar upazila, Rajbari district. Asma Siddiqa Mili, the Police Superintendent of Rajbari, stated in a press briefing that the law enforcers conducted a raid when the underground operatives were holding a meeting at Jakura Balurghat around 2:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, they fired gunshots at them, forcing the police to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. During the altercation, Saidul sustained bullet wounds while his cohorts fled the scene. Later, the police took Saidul to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Khokan Sutradhar
data.description: A man was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Akhaura hours after his arrest. Khokon Sutradhar was the son of Ramesh Sutradhar, a resident of Singarbil in Bijoynagar upazila in the district. Local people caught him when he was trying to snatch money from Makib Deb, a manager of a tobacco company distributor on Lalbazar road. The locals caught him and handed him over to the police. His brother Makhon Sutradhar alleged that "it was murder". Akhaura Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mosharaf Hossain said the police conducted a raid, taking Khokan with them to arrest his associates. Around 2:45 am, when the police reached near Akhaura Titas Bridge, Khokan's associates opened fire, forcing the police to "retaliate" in self-defense. The police officer claimed that "Khokan was injured by a bullet from his friends." Later, the police claimed that they took him to Akhaura Health Complex where the doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Babul Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in police custody during a reported 'gunfight' between the police and suspected robbers in the Raipur area. The deceased, Babul Hossain, 35, was the son of Iman Ali from the Purcherchar area under Madhabdi upazila in the Narsingdi district. Officer-in-Charge Mizanur Rahman of Daudkandi Police Station said that the police arrested two individuals - Babul and Maruf Hossain Lablu from Shibchar in Madaripur - in connection with a case of hijacking a covered van that was reported to his police station on April 11. The police recovered the stolen goods in Dhaka based on the information provided by the suspects. The suspects were then taken to Daudkandi Police Station, and a police team was sent to the Raipur area on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway to apprehend the accomplices of Babul and Maruf. When the team arrived in Raipur at around 3:00 am, the cohorts of the detainees, sensing the presence of the police, opened fire on them and attempted to snatch the detainees. The police retaliated by firing at the suspects. The Officer-in-Charge claimed that after the 'gunfight' ended, they found Babul critically injured and transported him to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Halim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Abdul Halim, a suspected robber, was killed by the DB Police in the Kongshonagar area. The police said that based on information, they launched a operation in the area as some robbers were planning to commit a robbery on the Comilla-Sylhet Highway Road. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers fired gunshots and threw bricks at them, forcing the police to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. At one point, the gang members fled the scene and one body was found lying in the area, while two robbers were detained. The police took the deceased to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where the doctor on duty declared him dead.

data.name: Abdur Razzaq
data.description: A man accused of murdering an autorickshaw driver was killed in a gunfight with the police in the Gudaria area. According to AKM Mahbub Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Phulpur Police Station, Razzaq is an accused in the auto-rickshaw driver Alim Uddin murder case filed with the police station. A team of DB police, led by its Officer-in-Charge Md Ashiqur Rahman, raided the Gudaria area on Mymensingh-Sherpur road to arrest Razzaq around 4:30 am. Sensing the police presence, the accused and his cohorts fired several gunshots at the police team, prompting the police to shoot back. Razzaq was hit in the chest during the exchange. He was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Sohag Hossain
data.description: An alleged rapist has been killed in a gunfight with the police in Kolaroa. Officer-In-Charge of Kolaroa Police Station, Biplob Kumar Nath, said that Sohag raped a nine-year-old student from a primary school in Keragacchi union. The victim's maternal grandmother filed a case against Sohag with the police station. Based on this information, a police team, led by Sub-Inspector Solaiman, went to the area to arrest Sohag. While the police were passing by Hizoldi field, some miscreants shot at the police and also hurled brickbats at them. The police retaliated by firing back. After exchanging gunshots for about 20 minutes, the criminals fled. One person was found with a bullet wound and lying on the spot. The police rushed him to Kolaroa Health Complex, where the on-duty emergency doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Atikul Islam Atik
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB in the Kuicchagara area. Sources said that a gang of highway robbers set up a barricade on the Kuicchagara-Argara road around 12:15 am to rob vehicles when a regular patrol team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp arrived on the scene. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang opened fire on the RAB team, who also retaliated. After some time, the gang retreated, leaving behind two members who had been hit by bullets. The RAB took them to Gomostapur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Rajib
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB in the Kuicchagara area. Sources said that a gang of highway robbers set up a barricade on the Kuicchagara-Argara road around 12:15 am to rob vehicles when a regular patrol team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp arrived on the scene. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang opened fire on the RAB team, who also retaliated. After some time, the gang retreated, leaving behind two members who had been hit by bullets. The RAB took them to Gomostapur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Al Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with the police in Muradnagar. Manzur Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Muradnagar Police Station, said that upon receiving information that robbers had taken positions along the road, a team led by Additional Superintendents of Police Shakhawat Hossain (North) and Mohammad Jahangir Alam (Muradnagar circle) raided the Shushunda area on Eliotganj-Muradnagar road around 1:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the gang opened fire on them. The police also returned fire, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the robbers left the spot, leaving the wounded Al Amin behind. He was pronounced dead upon arrival at Comilla Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with RAB in the Amberia area. The identity of the deceased could not be determined, but locals confirmed that he was a member of Sattar Bahini, said RAB-8 Patuakhali Company Commander, Additional Superintendent of Police Surat Ali. Upon encountering a patrol team of RAB-8, a gang of robbers opened fire, initiating a gunfight. Subsequently, a body with bullet wounds was discovered in the area.

data.name: Abdul Hakim Mintu
data.description: Abdul Hakim Mintu, an accused in a child rape case, was killed in a gunfight with RAB-7 in Banshkhali. The gunfight took place at a border area between Banshkhali and Pekuya thana when a team of RAB went there to arrest the alleged rapist, said Deputy Director of RAB-7, Lt. Com Ashequr Rahman. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB conducted a raid to apprehend Mintu. Mintu and his associates opened fire at the RAB personnel, and RAB retaliated by returning fire. The bullet-riddled body of Mintu was recovered from the Toitong area under Pekuya union after the gunfight concluded. Mintu was rushed to the Pekuya Health Complex, where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saiful Islam Arif
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a gunfight with the police at Char Haydrabad. Md Alamgir Hossain, the Officer-in-Charge of Munshiganj Police Station, said they arrested Saiful in possession of 110 pieces of contraband yaba tablets. He mentioned that they obtained information about illegal drugs from Saiful, and at around 1:30 am, a police team, accompanied by Saiful, went to recover the drugs. The OC stated that when the team reached the Char Haydrabad area, Saiful's accomplices opened fire on the police. As Saiful attempted to flee, he was shot. The police immediately rushed the bullet-hit Saiful to Munshiganj General Hospital, where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurul Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The Chandraganj Police Station Inspector (Investigation), Md Zafar Ahmed, reported that Nuru was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Chandraganj Ganipur. He claimed that a team of police, acting on secret information that a group of robbers had gathered in the Ganipur area to commit robbery, conducted a raid in the area at about 3:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate and engage in a gunfight. During the gunfight, Nuru was shot and died on the spot.

data.name: Raihan Sardar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Raihan was killed in a gunfight between a team of RAB-5 and suspected robbers by the side of Bagha-Charghat road in the Hajirdhalan area. RAB-5 Deputy Commander AM Ashraful Islam claimed that a patrol team of RAB-5, while patrolling in Charghat, learned that a group of robbers had gathered in the Hajirdhalan area at around 12:30 am. They conducted a raid there. He claimed that when the RAB-5 patrol team reached near the Hajirdhalan area, the suspected robbers opened fire on them and RAB also retaliated by firing. After the gunfight ended and the suspected robbers fled the scene, they searched the area and found Raihan, who had been hit by a bullet. They rushed him to Charghat Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared him dead. The victim's wife, Beauty Begum, said that her husband left the house and did not return home, while the people of Hazir Dhalan Beel area said that they did not hear any fighting in the area at night.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a reported gunfight with detectives in Mymensingh town early today, hours after he was arrested by the law enforcers. The deceased, Abdus Salam alias Kala Chan, 42, was the son of Abdus Sattar of Rally intersection in the town. A team of the Detective Branch of the police arrested Salam in the Rally intersection area around 1:45 am, said Ashikur Rahman, the officer-in-charge of DB who also led the operation. The incident took place around 2:15 am when the DB team, along with Salam, went to the Alia Madrasa area to arrest Siraj Uddin, a local drug trader, he said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Siraj and his cohorts opened fire at the detectives, forcing the police to retaliate, which triggered the "gunfight". Salam was hit by a bullet when he came into the line of fire, the police official said. Injured Salam was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the DB official added.

data.name: Nabab Ali Mollah
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Abaderhat area. The deceased was identified as Nabab Ali Mollah. Satkhira Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC), Maruf Ahmed, said that Patkelghata police arrested the fugitive Nabab Ali from Patkelghata. He was handed over to Satkhira Police Station as he was accused in several cases with them. During interrogation, Nabab Ali confessed to the possession of arms. A police team took Ali to the Abaderhat area around 4:00 am. About 200 yards from the spot, members of Ali's gang started shooting at the police team from an abandoned house, triggering a gunfight. The injured were taken to Satkhira Sadar Hospital, where doctors in the emergency department declared Nabab Ali dead.

data.name: Jabed Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in what police claimed was a gunfight between his cohorts and the police in Kaitala village under Nabinagar Upazila. Chittaranjan Paul, Additional Police Superintendent of Nabinagar circle, said that he was arrested for involvement in a theft case. Acting on information that a cache of arms was hidden near Bhanga Bridge, a team of police took him to the spot. "When we took him to Bhanga bridge of local Moheshpur road around 3:15 am, his associates opened fire and tried to snatch him away from us," the police official said. As the law enforcers retaliated, a gunfight ensued and Jabed was shot by his associates. Jabed was rushed to Nabinagar Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in the Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. The deceased were members of the notorious gang 'Hasan Bahini', according to Hasan Al Rajib, Wing Commander of RAB-8. The identities of the deceased could not be ascertained. When a patrol team of RAB-8 chased a trawler in the Bhaleshwar river around 6:00 am, the gang members took shelter in Majherchar. When the RAB members reached the spot, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in the Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. The deceased were members of the notorious gang 'Hasan Bahini', according to Hasan Al Rajib, Wing Commander of RAB-8. The identities of the deceased could not be ascertained. When a patrol team of RAB-8 chased a trawler in the Bhaleshwar river around 6:00 am, the gang members took shelter in Majherchar. When the RAB members reached the spot, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight.

data.name: Abdul Kuddus
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An outlawed party leader was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Kushtia's Kumarkhali upazila. The deceased, Abdul Kuddus alias Sagar, 47, from Urakandi village in Rajbari Sadar upazila, was the regional leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party's Lal Pataka faction. A RAB team cordoned off the area around 3:30 am and requested the criminals to surrender. Instead of complying, the criminals opened fire, according to the RAB official. The RAB members then returned fire, resulting in the "gunfight". After an hour-long battle, the criminals fled and the RAB team discovered a body at the scene.

data.name: Altab Hossain
data.description: An alleged mugger was killed in a gunfight with the police in Daulatpur upazila. The deceased was Altab Hossain, son of Golam Mostofa of Boalia in the upazila, said Sabbirul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch (DB) of the police in Kushtia.

data.name: Mehedi Hasan
data.description: A suspected drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Nagolkot upazila. Nazrul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Nagolkot Police Station, said the shootout took place as a team of law enforcers raided the Olipur area based on information that two drug dealers had gone there to sell drugs. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug dealers attacked them with machetes and started shooting at the police. The law enforcers also returned fire, resulting in a "gunfight". At one stage, the police found Mehedi with bullet injuries and rushed him to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Lelin
data.description: In Dhaka, an alleged criminal identified as Lelin, 35, from Shreenagar upazila in Munshiganj, was killed in a "gunfight" with detectives in the Khilgaon Nandipara area, according to Deputy Commissioner (Media) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, Masudur Rahman. Rahman stated that the police conducted a raid in the area around 3:15 am after receiving information that a gang of criminals had gathered there to commit a crime. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the gang opened fire on the police, leading them to retaliate. Lelin was injured during the "gunfight", while his accomplices managed to escape. He was pronounced dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital by the police.

data.name: Zakair Sana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers in the Sunderbans were arrested after a "gunfight" between the suspected robbers and Coast Guard West Zone members at Kalabagi canal. A team from the Coast Guard's West Zone at Mongla launched a special drive in the Sunderbans. When the team entered Kalabagi canal, members of the Asaful Bahini gang opened fire on the raiding team, and the Coast Guard men retaliated by firing back. A Coast Guard official claimed that they arrested Tajel and Zakir from the area when the gang had been trying to flee.

data.name: Tajel Gazi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers in the Sunderbans were arrested after a "gunfight" between the suspected robbers and Coast Guard West Zone members at Kalabagi canal. A team from the Coast Guard's West Zone at Mongla launched a special drive in the Sunderbans. When the team entered Kalabagi canal, members of the Asaful Bahini gang opened fire on the raiding team, and the Coast Guard men retaliated by firing back. A Coast Guard official claimed that they arrested Tajel and Zakir from the area when the gang had been trying to flee.

data.name: Sarfan Islam Babu
data.description: Sarfan Islam Babu, an accused in a case filed for the murder of electrician Peu Babu, was killed in a so-called gunfight between law enforcers and criminals in Mymensingh city on May 14th. According to the DB police, Babu was arrested in Dhaka on Sunday. Later, he was taken to the Teenkona Pukurpar area in Mymensingh city to arrest other accused individuals in the murder case, said Ashikur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch of Police. Sensing the presence of the police, Sarfan's accomplices opened fire on the law enforcers around 2:30 am, resulting in a "gunfight". Sarfan, who was in handcuffs, was shot in the chest and back when he tried to flee. He was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hamidul Islam
data.description: In Kushtia, an alleged criminal named Hamidul Islam, aged 47, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Milpara area of the town. Commander Mohaiminur Rashid of RAB-12 stated that Hamidul was the top leader of the Hamidul-Rashul Bahini and was wanted by the Kushtia police. Mohaiminur mentioned that a RAB team conducted a raid in the Milpara area at around 4:00 am based on information that a group of drug dealers were having a meeting there. Upon sensing the presence of the law enforcement officers, the criminals opened fire, prompting the officers to retaliate, resulting in a "gun battle". Eventually, the suspects managed to escape from the scene, but RAB discovered a body, which was later identified as Hamidul.

data.name: Rikhon Hossain
data.description: Rikhon Hossain, 36, from Meherpur, was killed in a "gunfight" in Narayanganj. Lt. Col. Kamrul Hasan, the Commanding Officer of RAB-11, stated that around 4:30 am, following a tip-off, RAB established two checkpoints at Siddhirganj on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway to seize a consignment of yaba pills arriving from Chittagong on a truck. As RAB intercepted the truck, three individuals exited the vehicle, and one of them began firing at RAB. RAB retaliated, resulting in a gunfight that lasted for seven minutes. Rikhon was found injured and was taken to Narayanganj General Hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: San Ahmed
data.description: Police recovered the bullet-riddled body of a young man named San Ahmed (22) yesterday morning from Belgachi Gangachara field in the municipal area of Chuadanga. San was the eldest son of Helal Hossain from the old town in the municipal area. District Police Superintendent Mahbubur Rahman informed in an afternoon briefing that San was a notorious criminal. Police sources revealed that after receiving information from the local people, the police recovered the body around eight-thirty and sent it to the morgue of the district hospital. The deceased's left hand and right rib had two bullet marks, his mouth was taped, and his eyes were covered with a vest. San's aunt, Kawsari Begum, said that San was at her house last Monday. In the evening, five police members in plain clothes came to her house in Chuadanga Sadar market. As soon as they entered the house, they started looking for San. Being accused in two assault cases and sensing police presence, San fled. Those individuals then left, threatening that if they found San, he would be killed in a crossfire.

data.name: Musa Alam Masud
data.description: Daganbhuiyan Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Abul Kalam Azad, said that they arrested Musa and interrogated him. Later, based on information extracted from him, the police raided the Khushipur area under Daganbhuiyan in Feni, along with Musa, at about 2:00 am to arrest Musa's accomplices and seize illegal firearms. As they arrived at the spot, Musa's accomplices opened fire on the law enforcers, and Musa was shot. After the gunfight ended and his accomplices fled, Musa was rushed to Daganbhuiyan Upazila Health Complex, where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Azizul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The District Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge, Ashiqur Rahman, said that a 29-year-old suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" between the DB police and robbers on a road in front of Baroihati Battala Araj Ali High School, under Gaforgaon in the district, at about 3:00 am. The OC said the DB police raided the area based on information that the robbers were robbing vehicles and passers-by by felling tree logs on the road.

data.name: Parvez
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Md Shahjalal, Inspector (Investigation) of Fatullah Police Station, said that upon hearing the news that two gangs of muggers were exchanging bullets in the Dapa Al-Amin Nagar area around 2:30 am, a team rushed there to intervene. Both gangs opened fire on the police, who retaliated in response. When the gangs eventually retreated, Parvez was discovered with bullet injuries and was later pronounced dead at Narayanganj General Hospital.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: Two people were killed in a "gunfight" between alleged drug dealers and Rapid Action Battalion personnel in Chittagong city's Barisal Colony around 11:40 pm. Deputy Director Ashequr Rahman of RAB-7 said that when RAB started a drive in the colony under Sadarghat Police Station following a tip-off, the "gunfight" ensued. After the "gunfight," RAB found two bullet-riddled bodies on the spot, said RAB-7's Media Wing Senior Assistant Director Mimtanur Rahman.

data.name: Mohammad Mosharaf
data.description: Two people were killed in a "gunfight" between alleged drug dealers and Rapid Action Battalion personnel in Chittagong city's Barisal Colony around 11:40 pm. Deputy Director Ashequr Rahman of RAB-7 said that when RAB started a drive in the colony under Sadarghat Police Station following a tip-off, the "gunfight" ensued. After the "gunfight," RAB found two bullet-riddled bodies on the spot, said RAB-7's Media Wing Senior Assistant Director Mimtanur Rahman.

data.name: Abul Hasan
data.description: A man was killed in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Kashiadanga area of the city early Thursday. The deceased was identified as Abul Hasan, also known as Hasan Ghatiyal, aged 45 and the son of Abdul Malek. He hailed from Sonaikandi village in Paba upazila, Rajshahi. RAB-5 deputy commander Major AM Ashraful Islam stated that acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-5 conducted a raid in the area around 1:00 am on Thursday. Meanwhile, upon sensing the presence of the elite force, the criminals opened fire on RAB members, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. This resulted in Abul Hasan being shot and injured. Later, he was rushed to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where the duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Alim
data.description: A suspected drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Tantipara ghat in Shibganj. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp went to the Tantipara ghat area for an anti-drug drive around 1:50 am, said Abul Khayer, an official of the RAB camp. Sensing the presence of RAB personnel, the criminals opened fire. RAB members returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gun battle", the RAB men found Alim bullet-wounded. He was taken to Chapainawabganj Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead. However, Alim's wife, Motiara Khatun, said that RAB members picked up her husband from a tea stall at Ghora Stand of Sadar upazila. Motiara said she came to know this from locals and found her husband's body at the hospital morgue. Contacted, the RAB official denied the allegation of picking up Alim.

data.name: Habibur Rahman Sheikh
data.description: Habibur, Abdul Kalam, and Milon were killed in a reported gunfight with RAB-6 at Bagdah Madhyapara under Abhaynagar upazila on Nawapara-Paira Road at about 2:45 am. RAB-6 Company Commander Lieutenant Commander Jahid said that a battalion patrol team stopped a motorcycle rider at the place at about 2:30 am, and after some time, another Nawapara-bound motorcycle started firing at the battalion personnel as they saw the searching of the biker from 20-30 meters back. In response, the battalion personnel fired back and found the three wounded as the 'gunfight' was over. They rushed the wounded to Abhaynagar Upazila Health Complex where the attending doctor declared them dead. Ibrahim Sheikh, the elder brother of Habibur, said that his brother and two other victims were picked up by plainclothes men from their respective houses.

data.name: Mohammad Emon
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch of Police, Ashiqur Rahman, stated that Emon was arrested for the killing of auto-rickshaw driver Md Rana, aged 15, in Nandail. Emon was killed in a gunfight between the DB police and the crime suspects at approximately 2:30 am. Ashiqur mentioned that they accompanied Emon to the area to apprehend his accomplices, and the gunfight broke out when Emon's cohorts opened fire on them. In response, they fired back. Emon sustained a bullet injury while attempting to escape the scene. They immediately rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where the doctors on duty pronounced him dead.

data.name: Abul Quasem
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Abul Quasem from Shripur village in Mehendiganj upazila, in the district, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the Detective Branch of Barisal Metropolitan Police in Charaicha village, under Barisal Sadar upazila. Metropolitan Police Assistant Commissioner (Detective Branch), Nasiruddin Mallick, stated that a DB patrol team confronted a suspected gathering at Bottola of Charachia around 2:40 am. The robbery suspects opened fire on the police, and the police retaliated by firing, resulting in the gunfight.

data.name: Dalim Hossain
data.description: A suspected drug dealer, Dalim Hossain, 35, from Jessore Railgate Pashchimpara in the district town, was killed in a 'gunfight' on Jessore-Chhutipur Road at Sujalpur, on the outskirts of Jessore town, at around 4:00 am. Officer-in-Charge AKM Azmal Huda of Kotwali Police Station stated that Dalim was pronounced dead by the attending doctor at Jessore General Hospital after being rushed there.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain
data.description: Alamgir Hossain, 33, from Paschim Pathangar village in Chhagalnaiya upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in Pathangar, Chhagalnaiya. The "gunfight" took place when drug peddlers fired at the police, and the police responded by firing back during a raid on a drug den in Pathangarh village, according to Officer-in-Charge MM Murshed of Chhagalnaiya Police Station.

data.name: Raziul Hasan Biplap
data.description: A suspected drug dealer, Raziul Hasan Biplap, 45, from the district town, was killed in a 'gunfight' with DB police at Mashkanda Gonshar Mor in the divisional town. Officer Ashikur Rahman from the District Detective Branch of Police stated that the gunfight took place when a DB team raided the area at approximately 2:00 am.

data.name: Mohammad Emon
data.description: A mugging suspect, Md Emon, 22, from Pustakamuri village in Mirzapur upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police on Mirzapur-Balia road at Pustokamuri Dakkhinpara Bridge point under the upazila. Officer-in-Charge AKM Mizanul Haq of Mirzapur Police Station said that the gunfight occurred when they received a tip-off that a group of muggers was robbing buses on the road. They raided the area at around 2:00 am.

data.name: Babu
data.description: A suspected drug trader, Babu, 45, from Teghora Narayanpur village in Biral upazila, Dinajpur, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Sardarpara in Biral upazila, according to Biral Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abdul Majid. Babu's son, Al Amin, stated that his father was taken by the DB police, but Additional Police Super Mahfuz Zaman Ashraf denied the allegation.

data.name: Momtazur Rahman Munna
data.description: Three "former drug peddlers" were killed in "gunfights" at a location between Kholadanga and Mandalgati villages and at Taraf Nawapara, both under Kotwali police station, in Jessore. The police claimed that the three were killed in "gunfights" between gang members of drug peddlers, although the families alleged that they were once involved in drug peddling and had since become innocent. Momtazur's brother, Sohrab Hossain, said that his brother was picked up and the body was found later. Sirajul's son, Ripon Hossain, said that his father was an innocent farmer and was picked up by law enforcers. The families and local people said that the three had given up drug peddling and were leading a normal life.

data.name: Sabdul Mondol
data.description: Sabdul Mondol, 42, son of Mohammad Ali Mondol of Narendrapur village, was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Golam Morshed, Company Commander of RAB-6, said that the gunfight that left Sabdul dead ensued when the RAB team was signaled to stop a motorcycle on information that a consignment of drugs would pass through the area around 1:30 am. Abdul Mannan, a neighbor, however, said some plainclothes men picked up Sabdul around 5:00 pm when he and Sabdul were working in their crop fields.

data.name: Liakat Ali Mondol
data.description: The man who was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Puthia of Rajshahi has been identified as Liakat Ali Mondol, 45, son of freedom fighter Zakkar Ali Mondol, from Namajgram village in the upazila. The incident occurred after a RAB team went to a mango orchard in Jamira village for an anti-drug operation. Liakat's daughter, Sharmin Akhter Hashi, stated that her father had been missing since Sunday afternoon when two individuals, Feroz and Momin, who claimed to be RAB members, took him away from home. Liakat's wife, Neher Banu, mentioned that he was previously involved in drug trafficking but quit earlier this year and started raising cattle. She filed a general diary with Puthia Police Station reporting his disappearance.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.description: In the Deulabari area of Tangail, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the RAB at around 12:30 am. Tangail RAB-12, CPC-3 Company Commander Rabiul Islam said, "Acting on a tip-off, we went to the area to arrest the drug traders, but upon sensing our presence, they opened fire at us." In retaliation, the elite force members fired back, fatally injuring Abul Kalam Azad, 45, of the east Pakutia area. The other suspects managed to flee the scene, but Azad was taken to Tangail General Hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Iman Ali
data.description: In Narsingdi, a 'wanted drug peddler' named Iman Ali from Kauriapara in the district town, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB at Ghorashal toll plaza under Palash upazila in Narsingdi at around 4:00 am, according to RAB-11 Company Commander Jasim Uddin.

data.name: Jonab Ali
data.description: In Chuadanga, a suspected drug peddler named Jonab Ali, 32, from Uthali village under Jibannagar upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at approximately 12:45 am, according to Officer-in-Charge Mahmud Hossain of Jibannagar Police Station.

data.name: Rezaul Islam
data.description: In Tongi, Gazipur, a suspected drug trader named Rezaul Islam, also known as Rony, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at around 3:00 am. Kamal Hossain, the Officer-in-Charge of Tongi Model Police Station, stated that a police team was conducting a drive in the area based on a tip-off. "Upon sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug traders opened fire on us, which forced us to retaliate, resulting in the gunfight." Rony was caught in the crossfire and died on the spot. He had been apprehended by the DB police around 2:00 am on Saturday.

data.name: Russell Mia
data.description: A young man named Russell Mia (19) has died after falling from the roof of a police station in Brahmanbaria, following his arrest in a theft case. He was allegedly subjected to police torture and subsequently fell. He died in critical condition at Dhaka Medical College (DMC) Hospital on Thursday morning. Russell's elder brother, Liton Mia, confirmed the death to Jugantor. He accused that, under the directive of Additional Police Superintendent Iqbal Hossain, Russell was taken to the roof of the police station and brutally beaten. In an attempt to escape the beating, Russell fell from the roof and was seriously injured. Regarding the matter, Brahmanbaria District Police Superintendent Anowar Hossain Khan told Jugantor on Thursday afternoon that an investigation committee has been formed for this incident. If any police member is found involved, action will be taken against them. He also stated that Russell's death would be thoroughly investigated.

data.name: Sharif
data.description: Officer-in-Charge Mohammad Abu Salam Mia of Kotwali Police Station stated that Sharif, a suspected drug trader aged 26 from Moheshpur village, and Peer Ali, aged 28 from Shuvapur village in Sadar upazila, were killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Bibir Bazar in Sadar upazila around 1:30 am on Tuesday.

data.name: Peer Ali
data.description: Officer-in-Charge Mohammad Abu Salam Mia of Kotwali Police Station stated that Sharif, a suspected drug trader aged 26 from Moheshpur village, and Peer Ali, aged 28 from Shuvapur village in Sadar upazila, were killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Bibir Bazar in Sadar upazila around 1:30 am on Tuesday.

data.name: Mohammad Bachchu
data.description: Rapid Action Battalion-11 Company Commander Anwar Hossain stated that a suspected drug trader named Mohammad Bachchu, from the Dakhkhinkhan area in Dhaka, was killed in a gunfight with RAB members on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway at Shimultali, under Araihazar in the district, around 5:00 am.

data.name: Mohammad Probal Hossain
data.description: In Dinajpur, a suspected drug trader named Md Probal Hossain, 35, from the village of Damodorpur under Birampur, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Manirampur playground in Birampur municipality early on Tuesday, according to Birampur Police Station's OC, Abdus Sabur.

data.name: Shukkur Ali
data.description: In Chittagong, Shukkur Ali, 45, was killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Debarpara area at around 2:30 am. Assistant Superintendent of Police Mimtanur Rahman of RAB 7 said that acting on a tip-off, a team of the elite force conducted a raid in the area. Sensing the presence of RAB, a gang of drug traders opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, triggering the gun battle, which left Shukkur dead on the spot.

data.name: Kamruzzaman Sadu
data.description: In Chuadanga, Kamruzzaman Sadu, 38, from the village of Hardi under Alamdanga upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police near Alamdanga Police Station around 1:30 am, as claimed by OC Abu Zihad Fakhrul Alam Khan of Alamdanga Police Station.

data.name: Shahin
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers, Shahin, 28, and Jalil, 32, from Nichu Colony in Saidpur Municipality, were killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Badhyabhumi, under Saidpur, early Tuesday, according to Saidpur Police Station OC Golam Pasha.

data.name: Jalil
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers, Shahin, 28, and Jalil, 32, from Nichu Colony in Saidpur Municipality, were killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Badhyabhumi, under Saidpur, early Tuesday, according to Saidpur Police Station OC Golam Pasha.

data.name: Amzad Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In Netrakona, Amzad Hossain, 32, from Paschim Nagra Gainpara in the district town, was killed in a reported gunfight between the police and suspected drug traders at Boroari under Sadar upazila early Tuesday, according to Sadar Police Station's officer-in-charge, Md Borhan Uddin. S M Moniruzzaman Dudu, the Organizing Secretary of District BNP, stated that Amzad Hossain was an active student wing of BNP's activist.

data.name: Dhon Mia
data.description: In Brahmanbaria, a 'drug trader' named Dhon Mia, aged 35, from the village of Morichakandi in Bancharampur district, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB-10 members at Sonarampur of Bancharampur early on Tuesday.

data.name: Mohammad Faruk
data.description: RAB said that "drug trader" Mohammad Faruk, 35, was killed in a "gunfight" during an operation of RAB 7 in Daudpul area under Feni Sadar around 11:10 pm. RAB-7 Company Commander Shafayat Jamil Fahim said that "drug trader" Manjurul Alam Manju, 49, of Satkania in Chittagong was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Lemua under Sadar upazila early Tuesday.

data.name: Manjurul Alam Manju
data.description: RAB said that "drug trader" Mohammad Faruk, 35, was killed in a "gunfight" during an operation of RAB 7 in Daudpul area under Feni Sadar around 11:10 pm. RAB-7 Company Commander Shafayat Jamil Fahim said that "drug trader" Manjurul Alam Manju, 49, of Satkania in Chittagong was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Lemua under Sadar upazila early Tuesday.

data.name: Oltu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: In Alamdanga Upazila's Khashkarara village, a person named Oltu Mandal (38) was killed in a gunfight with RAB. The deceased, Oltu, was the son of Jharu Mandal from the Tiurbila village of Alamdanga Upazila. Commander Major Monir Ahmed of Jhenaidah RAB-6 informed that on Monday night at around 2 AM, based on secret information, a team from the Jhenaidah RAB Regional Office positioned themselves at Khashkarara field in Chuadanga's Alamdanga Upazila. Within a short while, sensing the presence of RAB, members of the infamous gangster Oltu Gang started firing at the RAB members. At this stage, the RAB members present at the location returned fire in self-defense. A gunfight between the two sides lasted for several minutes. Later, when the firing stopped, the RAB members rescued Oltu in a gunshot-wounded condition from the scene.

data.name: Liton Sheikh
data.description: In Kushtia, two suspected drug traders were killed in separate "gunfights" with the police in Bheramara and Kumarkhali upazilas in the early hours of the day. Kushtia Superintendent of Police (SP) SM Mehedi Hasan said, "The incident took place when the police conducted a raid in Haowakhali brick field and near a bridge in Lahini Para.

data.name: Aktaful
data.description: In Thakurgaon, an alleged drug trader named Aktaful from Baliadangi upazila was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Pirganj upazila's Banbari village early yesterday. This incident occurred hours after he was apprehended by law enforcement officers. Thakurgaon SP Farhad Ahmed stated that the gunfight occurred around 4:00 am when a police team brought Aktaful to Banbari in order to apprehend his "associates".

data.name: Nurul Absar
data.description: In Comilla, alleged drug trader Nurul Absar Isa was killed in a "shootout" in the Tikkar Char Bridge area near the Gumti embankment early yesterday. Tanveer Salehin Emon, Additional SP of Comilla, said that the police picked up Nurul on Tuesday afternoon from his house in Gazipur village. The "gunfight" took place around 12:45 am when the law enforcers took him near the embankment to recover Phensidyl.

data.name: Mosharaf Hossain Bidyut
data.description: Jamalpur District Superintendent of Police, Delwar Hossain, said that a suspected drug peddler named Mosharaf Hossain Bidyut, aged 39, from the Bogabaid Boardghar Bazar area on the outskirts of Jamalpur town, was killed in a shootout by the police at Chhankanda Madrassah Ghat under Jamalpur Sadar Upazila early Wednesday. The deceased's wife, Shilpi Begum, alleged that the police killed her husband by staging a so-called gunfight. "Three police officials, including Sub-Inspector Mehedi Hasan, had visited my house on three occasions from Monday afternoon to early Tuesday. The officials took my husband out of the house, claiming they needed his help for a job," Shilpi said, adding that the police officials frequently visited her house.

data.name: Shahinur Rahman
data.description: A New Age correspondent in Rangpur, quoting Officer-in-Charge Babul Miah from Kotowali police station, reported that a suspected drug peddler named Shahinur Rhaman, aged 30, from the Suchanchowki area in Rangpur city, was killed in a gunfight at Hazirhat on the outskirts of the city early Wednesday. Babul claimed that the police seized a sack full of Phensidyle and a pistol from the scene.

data.name: Raju Mia
data.description: In Gaibandha, a top drug dealer named Raju Mia, aged 30, was killed in a village of Palashbari upazila around 3:00 am, according to a local official of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) who requested anonymity.

data.name: Nure Alam Eshar
data.description: Lalmonirhat District Superintendent of Police, SM Rashidul Huq, said that a suspected drug peddler, Nure Alam Eshar, was killed in a gunfight with the police at Char Kulaghat under Sadar upazila early Wednesday.

data.name: Abdul Aziz
data.description: Satkhira police claimed to have recovered the bullet-ridden body of Abdul Aziz from Choubaria village in Kaliganj upazila around 6:00 am yesterday. Aziz's wife, Ayesha Khatun, said a group of unidentified men picked up her husband after iftar on Wednesday. She heard about his death yesterday morning.

data.name: Shamit Hossain Shamim
data.description: Feni's Phulgazi Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Humayun Kabir, said that suspected 'drug peddlers' Sahmit Hossain Shamim, 25, of Maij village, and Majnu Mia, also known as Manir, of Mantala village under Phulgazi upazila, were killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Jammura in the upazila at about 3:30 am. Shahmit's mother, Anwara Begum, alleged that Phulgazi police station sub-inspector Shafique picked up her son from a land adjacent to her house where he had been collecting grass for their cows. She alleged that the police demanded Tk 2 lakh from them, and her son was shot dead by the police as she failed to pay the money. Majnu's sister, Rejina Begum, alleged that DB police in plain clothes had picked him up from her house in Feni district town and later demanded Tk 1.5 lakh. "We went to the district superintendent of police office, from where we were driven away," she said. She also stated that her brother was an activist of Jatiyatabadi Chattra Dal and the police lodged a number of 'false cases' against him. Rejina alleged that her brother was killed because her family could not pay the money.

data.name: Babul Mahi
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Model Police Station (Investigation), Salauddin Ahmed, said that suspected drug peddlers Babul Mahi, 35, son of Hafiz Ahmad from Bidderkhil village in Chouddagram, and Rajib, 38, son of Shah Alam from Sadar South upazila, were killed in a 'shootout' by the police on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway in Chouddagram of Sadar South upazila around 2:15 am.

data.name: Rajib
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Model Police Station (Investigation), Salauddin Ahmed, said that suspected drug peddlers Babul Mahi, 35, son of Hafiz Ahmad from Bidderkhil village in Chouddagram, and Rajib, 38, son of Shah Alam from Sadar South upazila, were killed in a 'shootout' by the police on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway in Chouddagram of Sadar South upazila around 2:15 am.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman Kalu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Md Chhoyruddin said that suspected drug peddlers Mizanur Rahman Kalu, 43, of Bhayana village and Ayub Hossain, 50, of Niznanduali village in Sadar upazila were killed in a reported gunfight in the Parnanduali Housing Project area in the district town early Thursday. The police said that acting on information that two drug-peddling gangs were exchanging gunfire between them to establish supremacy, a team of police went to the Parnanduali Housing Project area around 1:00 am and recovered the bodies of two alleged drug peddlers with bullet wounds. The family of the deceased alleged that some plainclothes armed people picked them up from their house. Ref: Prothom Alo 25. 5. 18

data.name: Amir Kha
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Akhaura Police Station, Mosharaf Hossain, said that a suspected drug peddler, Amir Kha, 40, son of the late Suroj Kha from the village of Chanpur under the north union of Akhaura, was killed in a gunfight with the police in Akhaura around 2:00 am. Amir Kha's daughter said that on May 21, some people came to their house and claimed to have an arrest warrant against him. They then took Amir away at dawn. Ref: Prothom Alo 25.5.18

data.name: Mohammad Shamim
data.description: In Jhenaidah, a suspected drug peddler named Md Shamim, 40, was killed in a gunfight with the police at WAPDA math under Kaliganj upazila at around 11:00 pm, according to Kaliganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Md Mizanur Rahman Khan.

data.name: Mohammad Hasan
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, police recovered the bullet-ridden body of alleged yaba trader Md Hasan from the Uttaran residential area around 3:30 am yesterday. Farid Uddin Ahmed, Officer-in-Charge of Cox's Bazar Police Station, said 35-year-old Hasan was killed in a "gunfight" between two groups of yaba traders. However, Hasan's brother Shohor Mulluk said a group of plainclothes men picked up his brother from his house early on Tuesday.

data.name: Selim
data.description: In Narayanganj, an alleged drug peddler named Selim was killed in a "shootout" with the police in the Maghmara area of Siddhirganj upazila early yesterday, according to Abdus Sattar, the Officer-in-Charge of Siddhirganj Police Station.

data.name: Mohammad Mostak
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: The ring leader of a terrorist group, Mohammad Mostak, 37, was killed in a "gunfight" with his rival group led by Mahmudul Haque at Pahartali in Moheshkhali upazila around 10:00 pm yesterday, said Pradib Kumar, officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station.

data.name: Kamrul Islam
data.description: In the capital, Kamrul Islam was killed in a "shootout" with RAB in the Tejgaon industrial area early yesterday. His wife, Taslima Begum, said her husband used to peddle drugs around 10 years ago. He quit the trade after their first daughter was born. Kamrul was accused in two cases, Taslima added. Sathi Begum, the sister-in-law of the deceased, said Kamrul went to her house in the Dakshinpara area on Tuesday and had iftar there. He left the house for his hotel around 7:30 pm. "Around 8:00 pm, a few people picked him up from in front of the hotel," Sathi said, adding that Kamrul's phone had been found switched off since then.

data.name: Osman Goni
data.description: In Netrakona, two alleged drug traders were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the town's Monag area. One of the deceased is Osman Goni from Cox's Bazar, as stated by Md Borhan Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Netrakona Police Station. The identity of the other individual could not be verified.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Netrakona, two alleged drug traders were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the town's Monag area. One of the deceased is Osman Goni from Cox's Bazar, as stated by Md Borhan Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Netrakona Police Station. The identity of the other individual could not be verified.

data.name: Rajon Mia
data.description: In Mymensingh, an alleged drug peddler named Rajon Mia, who was approximately 32 years old, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Purohitpara area of the city yesterday, according to Kandaker Shaker Ahmed, Inspector (Investigation) of Mymensingh Sadar Police Station. Rajon's father, Harun, stated that his son used to take drugs in the past but was not involved in the drug trade. He was accused in two cases. Harun, a security officer of a private organization, also mentioned that his son had been missing since the police took him from his house early on Tuesday.

data.name: Azad
data.description: Azad, 28, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Satpakia area of the district's Sadar upazila early on Friday. Md Aminul Islam, the Additional Superintendent of Police for Sherpur Sadar Circle, said the incident occurred around 3:00 am when a police team conducted a raid in the area. However, Azad's family members claimed that the police had picked him up from his home on Thursday morning and they have been unable to locate him since then.

data.name: Jewel Mia
data.description: In Gaibandha, an alleged drug trafficker named Jewel Mia, aged 35, was shot dead in a "shootout" with the police in the Falia bridge area, approximately seven kilometers away from the district town, according to Khan Mohammed Shaharier, the OC of Gaibandha Sadar Police Station. The police claimed to have recovered a firearm, ammunition, and 500 yaba pills from the scene. Jewel's wife, Rozi Begum, stated that her husband had left home to buy iftar items on Wednesday afternoon. He went missing after two unidentified men picked him up. Abdul Mannan Mia, the superintendent of police in Gaibandha, stated that Jewel was accused in a dozen cases.

data.name: Younus Ali
data.description: In Satkhira, an alleged drug peddler named Younus Ali was killed in a "gunfight" between two groups of drug traders in Sonabaria village of Kolaroa upazila, according to Biplob Kumar Nath, the OC of Kolaroa Police Station. Younus's wife, Rabeya Khatun, stated that the police had apprehended her husband around 9:30 pm on Thursday after he had returned home from attending Taraweeh prayers.

data.name: Mohammad Kamal
data.description: Burichang Police Station Officer-in-Charge Manoj Kumar Dey said that suspected drug peddler Md Kamal, 51, of Rajmangalpur area in Sadar upazila, was killed in a gunfight with police at Mahismara under Burichang upazila at about 2:00 am. Kamal's relative, Abu Taher, alleged that the police chased and caught him from his house Thursday night and then demanded Tk 1.5 lakh from the family. "The family failed to pay the money, and we heard the news of his death Friday morning." Manoj denied the allegations.

data.name: Akter Kamal
data.description: The body of Akter Kamal, a member of Sabrang Union Parishad in Teknaf, was found lying beside Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road in Darianagar area, according to Monirul Islam, in-charge of Himchhari Police Outpost. The police official stated that Kamal, a listed yaba dealer, died from bullet wounds he sustained during a "gunfight". His relatives claimed that some plainclothes men had picked him up from the Sabrang area on Thursday evening.

data.name: Babul
data.description: In Comilla, alleged drug traders Babul, 40, and Almas, 35, were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Brahmanpara upazila early yesterday, according to Syed Abu Mohammad Shajahan Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Brahmanpara Police Station. Almas's wife, Taslima Begum, said her husband worked as a day laborer and was the sole breadwinner for her family. He was apprehended by the police from his village home on Friday.

data.name: Almas
data.description: In Comilla, alleged drug traders Babul, 40, and Almas, 35, were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Brahmanpara upazila early yesterday, according to Syed Abu Mohammad Shajahan Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Brahmanpara Police Station. Almas's wife, Taslima Begum, said her husband worked as a day laborer and was the sole breadwinner for her family. He was apprehended by the police from his village home on Friday.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: In a gunfight between the police and drug peddlers, alleged drug trader Abdur Rahman was killed in Pabna's Mohendrapur area. A resident of Kabirpur village in the district, the 45-year-old man was arrested in the village on Friday noon. The gun battle broke out after the police had taken him to the area to arrest his associates, said Goutam Kumar Bishwas, Additional Superintendent of Police in Pabna.

data.name: Ibrahim Hossain
data.description: Emteaz Kabir, the Officer-in-Charge of Bhurungamari Police Station, stated that Ibrahim Hossain, a 37-year-old 'drug peddler' from Naodor Uttarpara village in the upazila, was killed during a 'gunfight' with the police in South Bashjani village at approximately 4:30 am.

data.name: Mohammad Shahjahan
data.description: Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman of Mymensingh District Detective Branch of Police stated that a suspected drug peddler named Md Shahjahan, aged 30, was killed in a gunfight with the police at Atharobari in Ishwarganj around 1:30 am.

data.name: Rentu Mia
data.description: RAB-5 Camp Commander Shamim Hossain stated that a suspected drug peddler, Rentu Mia, aged 40, from Uttargopalpur under Panchbibi upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the battalion members at a brick kiln in Bhimpur under the upazila.

data.name: Saddarul
data.description: In Dinajpur, suspected drug traders Saddarul, from Nandail village, and Abdus Salam, from Mohorarpur of sadar upazila, were killed in gunfights with the police and the battalion. RAB-13 Crimes Prevention company commander Talukder Najmus Sakib said that Saddarul was killed in a 'gunfight' with the battalion at Basudebpur of the upazila. Mohammad Raju, son of Saddarul, said his father had been missing since Friday evening and his phone was found switched off. Additionally, suspected drug peddler Abdus Salam was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Paschimpara under sadar upazila, said Redwanur Rahim, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station.

data.name: Abdus Salam

data.name: Mobarak Hossain
data.description: In Thakurgaon, an alleged drug trader named Mobarak Hossain was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Pashchim Begunbari village early yesterday, according to Abdul Latif, the OC of Thakurgaon Police Station. His wife, Monowara Begum, 35, admitted that her husband was involved in the drug trade. She alleged that the police picked up her husband from their house on Tuesday evening. However, the OC denied the allegation of picking up Mobarak.

data.name: Sagir Khan
data.description: In Barguna, the police recovered the body of a suspected drug trader named Sagir Khan from the Jakirtabak area. According to locals, Sagir was killed in a gunfight with the police.

data.name: Ekramul Haque
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Ekramul Haque was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB at Noakhalipara under Teknaf upazila early Sunday. Major Ruhul Amin, Rapid Action Battalion-7 Company Commander in Cox's Bazar, said, "Ekramul was at the top of the list prepared by the Department of Narcotics Control [DNC] and the home ministry." Ekramul's brother, Ehsanul Haque Bahadur, said that some plainclothes men from "an intelligence agency" picked up his brother from their house around 9:30 pm on Saturday, saying they would talk to him about the purchase of a plot of land. "My brother was never involved in yaba trade. He had no links to it whatsoever," Ehsanul added. Ekramul's wife, Ayesha Begum Ashu, said the RAB's claim that her husband was a drug dealer is totally false.

data.name: Rafikul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In Jhenidah, Shailkupa police claimed that suspected drug dealer Rafikul Islam, 36, was shot dead during an exchange of fire between two groups of drug peddlers near the Jhenidah-Kushtia highway early yesterday. However, Rubel Hossain, brother-in-law of Rafikul, said that several plainclothes men picked Rafikul up on Friday night from his home.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Mymensingh District Detective Branch of Police, Ashiqur Rahman, stated that an unidentified drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with the police at Morakhola in the city around 1:30 am.

data.name: Mohammad Rihan Prakash
data.description: In Chittagong, a suspected drug peddler named Md Rihan Prakash, 27, from Golabaria of Sitakunda upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in the Guliakhali Sandwip ferry ghat area at approximately 12:45 am, according to Sitakunda Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mozammel Haque.

data.name: Abul Kalam
data.description: In Khulna, a suspected drug peddler named Abul Kalam from Ichhamati, under Abhoynagar upazila in Jessore, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in the Barakpur Siddiqpasa ferry jetty area, under Dighalia upazila, at approximately 3:00 am. This information was provided by Khulna District Superintendent of Police, SM Shafiullah.

data.name: Mitul Biswas
data.description: In Bagerhat, a suspected drug peddler named Mitul Biswas, 45, from Chingguri village under Chitalmari upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in an orchard at the village at around 3:15 am, according to Chitalmari Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Anukul Chandra Sarker.

data.name: Hasan Mia
data.description: Noakhali District Additional Superintendent of Police, AKM Zahirul Islam, said that a suspected drug peddler, Hasan Mia, from Banoai village under Sonaimuri upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Bogadia under the upazila at about 3:00 am. Mohammad Humayun, the elder brother of Hasan, said that some police personnel detained his brother from Sonaimuri Bazar on Saturday. (Ref: Prothom Alo, 28.5.18)

data.name: Halim Mandal
data.description: In Kushtia, a suspected drug peddler named Halim Mandal, 35, from Baria village under Sadar Upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in the housing D-block field area in the district town at around 1:30 am, according to Nasir Uddin, the Officer-in-Charge of Kushtia Model Police Station.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.description: In Thakurgaon, a suspected drug peddler named Rafiqul Islam, 55, from Bhornia village under Ranisankail upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Miradangi under Ranisankail upazila early on Sunday, according to Thakurgaon Superintendent of Police, Farhat Ahmed.

data.name: Selim Mia
data.description: In Chandpur, a suspected drug peddler named Selim Mia, 35, from Upadhi village, was killed in a reported gunfight at Hazirdon under Matlab South Upazila at approximately 2:50 am, according to Officer-in-Charge Kutub Uddin of Matlab Police Station.

data.name: Hafizul Islam Hafi
data.description: In Meherpur, a suspected drug dealer named Hafizul Islam Hafi, aged 45, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Gangni, as stated by OC Harendra Nath Sarkar of Gangni Police Station.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: In Dhaka, a suspected drug peddler named Nazrul Islam, also known as Nazu Sardar, aged 42, from Rupnagar, was killed during a reported gunfight with the Detective Branch of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police. The incident took place at an under-construction building located at a staff quarter of the Public Works Department in Rupnagar at approximately 2:30 am.

data.name: Enamul Haq Dolan
data.description: Two suspected drug dealers – Enamul Haq Dolan, 35, of Bhinglabari Mirzanagar under Debidwar, and Nuru, 55, of Kalikapur under Sadar Upazila – were killed in 'gunfights' with the police at Debidwar and Sadar South Upazilas, respectively. Nuru was killed in a 'gunfight' at Golia-Lakshmipur village at about 2:00 am, said Comilla Assistant Superintendent of Police Golam Ambia Mahmud.

data.name: Nuru
data.description: Two suspected drug dealers – Enamul Haq Dolan, 35, of Bhinglabari Mirzanagar under Debidwar, and Nuru, 55, of Kalikapur under Sadar Upazila – were killed in 'gunfights' with the police at Debidwar and Sadar South Upazilas, respectively. Nuru was killed in a 'gunfight' at Golia-Lakshmipur village at about 2:00 am, said Comilla Assistant Superintendent of Police Golam Ambia Mahmud.

data.name: Wahiduzzaman Ohid
data.description: In Pirojpur, a suspected drug peddler named Wahiduzzaman Ohid, 50, from Nesarabad upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at village Kourikhara under sadar upazila at about 2:00 am, according to Pirojpur Additional Superintendent of Police GM Abul Kalam Azad. Another suspected drug peddler, Mizanur Rahman, 35, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the cops at village Gotichara under Mathbaria upazila at about 1:30 am, Abul Kalam said.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman
data.description: In Pirojpur, a suspected drug peddler named Wahiduzzaman Ohid, 50, from Nesarabad upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at village Kourikhara under sadar upazila at about 2:00 am, according to Pirojpur Additional Superintendent of Police GM Abul Kalam Azad. Another suspected drug peddler, Mizanur Rahman, 35, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the cops at village Gotichara under Mathbaria upazila at about 1:30 am, Abul Kalam said.

data.name: Emdadul Huq
data.description: Satkhira Sadar Police Station Sub-Inspector Prabir Kumar Das said that two 'drug peddlers' - Emdadul Huq of Modhumollardangi in the district town and Khalilur Rahman of Lakshmidari village under Sadar Upazila - were killed in a 'gunfight' between two groups of 'drug peddlers' at Bankal-Agunpur under Sadar Upazila. Emdadul's elder brother Mafijul Islam Mafi alleged that his brother was killed four days after he was picked up from their house by people who identified themselves as cops. 'There is no case, not even a general diary, against him at any police station. Ajgar Ali, father of Khalilur Rahman, alleged that Khalilur was picked up by the DB Police in front of the Court premises around 1:00 pm on Sunday when he went to Satkhira Judge Court to appear in a case.

data.name: Khalilur Rahman
data.description: Satkhira Sadar Police Station Sub-Inspector Prabir Kumar Das said that two 'drug peddlers' - Emdadul Huq of Modhumollardangi in the district town and Khalilur Rahman of Lakshmidari village under Sadar Upazila - were killed in a 'gunfight' between two groups of 'drug peddlers' at Bankal-Agunpur under Sadar Upazila. Emdadul's elder brother Mafijul Islam Mafi alleged that his brother was killed four days after he was picked up from their house by people who identified themselves as cops. Ajgar Ali, father of Khalilur Rahman, alleged that Khalilur was picked up by the DB Police in front of the Court premises around 1:00 pm on Sunday when he went to Satkhira Judge Court to appear in a case.

data.name: Abdul Khaleque
data.description: In Singra upazila of Natore, RAB stated that Abdul Khaleque, a suspected drug dealer aged 45, was killed in a "shootout" with members of the elite force, as mentioned by Assistant Superintendent Azman Khan of RAB-5.

data.name: Ejjat Ali Pramanik
data.description: Pabna District Superintendent of Police, Zahidul Kabir, stated that a suspected drug peddler named Ejjat Ali Pramanik, aged 28, from Haturia village in Bera upazila, was killed in a supposed 'gunfight' with police officers at Brishali village in the Bera municipal area at approximately 1:00 am.

data.name: Abu Sayeed Badsha
data.description: In Chandpur, a suspected drug peddler named Abu Sayeed Badsha, also known as Lal Badsha, aged 45, from the village of Purba Gobindopur under Faridganj upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with police at Boichatoli of the upazila at approximately 2:00 am, according to Shah Alam, the Officer-in-Charge of Faridganj Police Station.

data.name: Sumon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported shootout with the police in Sonargaon of Narayanganj early Tuesday (May 29). The deceased was identified as Sumon, also known as 'Tower Sumon'. Sonargaon Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC), Md Morshed Alam, said a team of police launched a drive in the Shantibazar area under Barodi union, based on information that a gang of robbers was attempting to commit robbery. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire at them. The police fired back in retaliation, forcing the robbers to flee. The bullet-hit body of Sumon was found lying as the shootout ended.

data.name: Liton
data.description: Muradnagar Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Manjur Alam said that drug peddlers Liton, 44, of Paiyapathar village, and Baten, 35, of Bakhranagar village under Muradnagar upazila were killed in a gunfight with the police in front of a brick kiln near Gomti Protection Dam at Gunjor under the upazila. Baten’s father, Shaheed Mia, said that people in plainclothes picked up his son sometime after iftar on Monday and asked them to contact the police station. Liton’s sister, Momtaj Begum, said that they had a 'good relationship' with cops who often used to visit their house. 'The police called him from home and took him away after iftar on Monday.'

data.name: Anisur Rahman
data.description: Biplab Kumar Nath, the Officer-in-Charge of Kalaroa Police Station, stated that Anisur Rahman, a suspected drug peddler aged 40 from Pakuria village in Kalaroa upazila, was killed in a supposed 'gunfight' with the police at Pilapul field in the upazila around 2:00 am. Nazma Begum, the wife of Anisur, alleged that a group of plainclothes police officers apprehended her husband on Monday morning.

data.name: Firoz Mridha
data.description: In Barguna, a suspected drug peddler named Firoz Mridha, aged 45, from the Betagi municipal area, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion at Kumrakhali village, under the Betagi upazila, according to a message sent to the media by the battalion.

data.name: Harun
data.description: In Thakurgaon, a suspected drug peddler named Harun, aged 45, from the village of Shitalpur under Haripur upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at his village, according to Harirampur Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ruhul Quddus.

data.name: Jony Mia
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Brahmanbaria police claimed that the alleged drug dealer, Jony Mia, 30, was killed in a "gunfight" between two groups of drug peddlers in the Khalajora area. However, Jony's wife, Jotsna Akter, said that eight to ten men in plainclothes went to their home on May 21, handcuffed her husband, and took him away. She stated that her husband was never involved in drug trading.

data.name: Ashraf Uddin Hridoy
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Ashraf Uddin Hridoy, the leader of the notorious "Dhilchora Party," has been killed in an alleged gunfight with the police in Ashulia, Savar. The incident occurred late on Tuesday night in the Moragang area on the Tongi-Ashulia-EPZ road. The deceased, Ashraf Uddin Hridoy, was the son of Hazrat Ali Bhutto from the Tek area of Dhaur Sumon, under Turag police station in the capital. OC Abdul Awal of Ashulia Police Station said that on Tuesday night, a team of Dhaka District North Detective Police went on a raid with the arrested Rasel and Masud. At that time, while preparing for a robbery on the Tongi-Ashulia-EPZ road, the robbers detected the presence of the police and opened fire. The police also retaliated, and Ashraf Uddin Hridoy was shot. After rescuing him, he was taken to the Savar Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Asir Ali
data.description: Officer-in-Charge AKM Azmal Huda of Jessore Kotwali Police Station stated that two suspected drug peddlers, Asir Ali (56) from Mondolgati village and Malik (26) from Raipara in the district town, were killed in a supposed 'gunfight' in the Chanchra Raipara area around 3:00 am.

data.name: Malik

data.name: Ataur Rahman
data.description: In the capital's Bhashantek Dewanpara area, an exchange of fire took place between members of RAB-4 and drug peddlers, resulting in the deaths of Ataur Rahman, 46, Mostafa Hawlader, 52, and Faruq Islam, 37, according to the RAB. Jony, the son of Ataur, said that his father was allegedly picked up from their house in Savar by a group of people who claimed to be from the administration on May 28. Jony did not know whether his father was a drug trader or not. Sujan Hawlader, the son of Mostafa, said that his father was picked up from their house by people claiming to be from the administration on May 22. Ref: Prothom Alo 31. 5. 18

data.name: Majibur Rahman
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, Majibur Rahman, 42, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB near Kabitachattar point sea beach area around 12:00 am. RAB-7 Company Commander in Cox's Bazar, Maj Ruhul Amin, said Majibur was a top-listed drug dealer in Netrakona.

data.name: Mohammad Ishaq
data.description: In Chittagong, Md Ishaq, 35, was killed in a "shootout" between RAB and a group of drug dealers in the Pologround area around 1:30 am, said RAB-7 Deputy Director Ashequr Rahman.

data.name: Rosmat Ali
data.description: In Comilla, Officer-in-Charge Manoj Kumar Dey of Burichang Police Station said that a suspected drug peddler named Rosmat Ali, aged 40, from Choygram village in Burirchang, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Laribagh in the upazila early on Wednesday.

data.name: Sajib
data.description: In Narail, a suspected drug peddler named Sajib, 27, from Duttapara village under Sadar upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Malibagh under the upazila around 2:30 am, according to Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge Anwar Hossain.

data.name: Tanjil Hossain
data.description: In Chuadanga, Tanjil Hossain, 40, was killed in a gunfight with the police at Satgari Natunpara in the municipality area around 3:00 am, said Abdul Khalek, Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station. However, Tanjil's cousin, Akram Hossain, said they heard that Tanjil was arrested by plainclothes men on Monday night from the Bostapatti area of Chuadanga town. "Since then, we have had no communication with him," he said.

data.name: Ahsan Habib
data.description: In Sirajganj, an alleged drug peddler named Ahsan Habib, aged 45, was killed in Kamarkhand upazila, according to Md Sakibul Islam, Commander of RAB-2, Sirajganj camp.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An unidentified individual (approximately 35 years old) has been killed in an alleged gunfight with the police in Ashulia. The incident occurred around 3 am near the Moragang area on the Baipail-Tongi highway in Ashulia. The police were unable to identify the deceased person but stated that he was a known robber. They further informed that on Tuesday night, a group of robbers began throwing bricks at moving vehicles on the Abdullahpur-Baipail highway. A patrolling police team noticed the incident, and the robbers targeted them with gunfire. The police returned fire, leading to a gunfight between the two sides, during which one member of the robber gang was shot.

data.name: Bacchu Chopdar
data.description: In Magura, three alleged drug dealers were killed in a gunfight at Batikadanga in Sadar upazila at around 2:00 am, said Magura Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ilias Hossain.

data.name: Raihan Dhali
data.description: In Magura, three alleged drug dealers were killed in a gunfight at Batikadanga in Sadar upazila at around 2:00 am, said Magura Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ilias Hossain.

data.name: Kishore Odhikari
data.description: In Magura, three alleged drug dealers were killed in a gunfight at Batikadanga in Sadar upazila at around 2:00 am, said Magura Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ilias Hossain.

data.name: Liton Hossain
data.description: Two alleged drug peddlers -- Liton Hassan (35) and Rabiul Islam (40) -- were killed in a "gunfight" in Boro Archa area of Benapole around 3:00 am, said Apurba Hasan, OC of Benapole Port Police Station. However, the families of the victims claimed that the deceased were innocent. They were picked up by the police and killed in a planned manner.

data.name: Robiul Islam
data.description: Manab Zamin's staff reporter from Jessore reports that two drug dealers have been killed in a gunfight in Benapole of Sharsha upazila in Jessore. The deceased have been identified as Liton Hossen (35), son of Mazharul Islam from Bhaber Ber village in Benapole, and Robiul Islam (40), son of Isarat Ali from Bag Achara village. According to police claims, both of the deceased were known drug dealers, and multiple cases were registered against them at Benapole port police station and various other stations. However, their family members claim that they were innocent and that the police deliberately took them from their homes and killed them. The Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Benapole Port Police Station, Apurba Hasan, said, "Last night around 3 am, we received information about a shootout between two groups of drug dealers in the bordering area of Bara Anchra village. Upon the arrival of the police, the drug dealers fled the scene. Later, two bullet-ridden bodies were recovered from the area.

data.name: Islam Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed during a "gunfight" with the police in Kulaura upazila of Moulvibazar early today. The deceased was identified as Islam Uddin, also known as Islam Ali, 45, son of Motsin Ali from Kamalganj upazila. Shamim Musa, Officer-in-Charge of Kulaura Police Station, said that a team of police raided the Paboi area of the upazila around 4:00 am based on information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery there. However, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate, which triggered the "gun battle". Islam was hit by a bullet during the "gunfight" and died on the spot.

data.name: Raju Ahmed
data.description: In Jessore, Sub-Inspector Nasirul Haque Khan of Bagharpara Police Station said that Raju Ahmed, 28, from Dighalsingha under Chaugachha upazila in Jessore, was killed in a reported "gunfight" at Bhatar Amtala under Bagharpara upazila at about 2:00 am. Raju's mother, Kohinoor Begum, at Jessore General Hospital, however, alleged that her son was called out from a local mosque after Taraweeh prayers on May 30th, by a police officer who contacted him on his mobile phone. "My son was a garment worker in Chittagong and he came home two months ago. He was innocent," the mother claimed.

data.name: Bacchu Khalifa
data.description: In Madaripur, Bacchu Khalifa, 45, a suspected drug pusher and the son of Safar Ali Khalifa, was killed in a reported gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers at Shambhuk in Shibchar upazila around 4:00 am, according to Sarwar Hossain, the superintendent of district police.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.description: In Rajshahi, Major Ashraf Hossain, the Company Commander of Rapid Action Battalion-5, stated that two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with the battalion at Karamja under Karanhat Police Station at around 11:30 pm. Amena Begum, the wife of Belal, said her husband used to work as a day laborer over a decade ago and was involved in fish farming. Amena mentioned that two plainclothes members of a law enforcement agency visited their house in Poba Upazila around 1:30 pm on May 30th and questioned her husband about his involvement in drug peddling. Approximately thirty minutes after leaving the house, one of the law enforcers called Belal and instructed him to go to the Nawhata area. Belal was confident that he would face no problems as he was no longer involved in the drug trade.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Rajshahi, Major Ashraf Hossain, the Company Commander of Rapid Action Battalion-5, stated that two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with the battalion at Karamja under Karanhat Police Station at around 11:30 pm. Amena Begum, the wife of Belal, said her husband used to work as a day laborer over a decade ago and was involved in fish farming.
