Belal was confident that he would face no problems as he was no longer involved in the drug trade.

data.name: Babu
data.description: Babu, the main accused in the murder case of Awami League activist Abbas Mollah, was killed during a "gunfight" with a Rapid Action Battalion. Major Zia, Commander of the Jessore camp, RAB-6, said that acting on a tip-off that a group of criminals had gathered for a meeting in Mirzapur village, a RAB team went to the area around 4:00 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang fired at them, triggering a "gunfight".

data.name: Kamrul Khan Kamu
data.description: Alleged drug dealer Kamrul Khan Kamu, 40, who was killed in a "shootout" with DB police in Gazipur on Friday, was picked up a day before from his home by plainclothes policemen, claimed Kamrul's wife, Asma Begum. Asma said, "Five to six plainclothes policemen came to our house around 5:00 am on Thursday and took Kamrul with them." "During that time, the policemen, in the name of searching the house, took away some valuables, including a TV set, a mobile phone, some cash, ornaments, and documents," she claimed. Asma said she got married eight years ago, and during these years, she never heard of any case filed against Kamrul. She said her husband used to work at a garment factory.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.description: In Comilla, Saddam Hossain, 36, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Chauddagram upazila around 2:40 am. Abul Faisal, Officer-in-Charge of Chauddagram Police Station, said a police team went to Koroibon based on information that a gang of drug peddlers had gathered there. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate with gunshots, triggering the "gunfight". The police then found Saddam's bullet-riddled body at the scene. Saddam's brother-in-law, Saiful Islam, claimed that the victim was picked up by individuals identifying themselves as police from in front of their residence sometime after 8:00 pm. He also claimed that Saddam was a drug addict but not a peddler.

data.name: Shahjahan
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, Shahjahan, who the police said was the chief of a criminal gang called "Shahjahan Bahini," was killed in a "gunfight" in Chakaria upazila. Bakhtiar Uddin Chowdhury, Officer-in-Charge of Chakaria Police Station, said they recovered Shahjahan's body from the spot and sent it to the Sadar hospital morgue.

data.name: Ruhul
data.description: In Tangail, an alleged drug peddler named Ruhul was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Kalihati upazila. The 30-year-old man was from Paschim Golora village of the upazila. According to a text sent by Maj Rabiul Islam, a Company Commander of RAB-12 in Tangail, a team of RAB-12 started an anti-drug drive in the Golora area around 2:30 am. Sensing the presence of Rab personnel, the criminals opened fire, prompting them to retaliate. After the "gunfight," the RAB team found Ruhul injured and took him to Tangail General Hospital where doctors declared him dead. However, Ruhul's wife, Rashida Akter, said, "One Sumon Bhai of the adjacent Taratia area called my husband out of the house around 11:00 am on May 31." "Sumon Bhai took Tk 6 lakh from my husband about one and a half months ago to remove his name from the list of drug traders," said Rashida, the mother of a six-month-old boy. "Ruhul was involved in drug trading previously but left the trade about six to seven months ago and started running a shop near Chhatihati Bazar," said his elder brother Bahadur.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam Opi
data.description: In Rangpur, the police claimed to have recovered the bullet-ridden body of the alleged criminal Rafiqul Islam Opi, who was killed in a "gunfight" in Kaunia upazila, according to Saifur Rahman, Additional Superintendent (circle A) of Rangpur police.

data.name: Rakib Howlader
data.description: A 15-year-old film actor was killed in an alleged "gunfight" between mugging suspects and police on Toyenbee Circular Road at Wari in Dhaka. However, the family alleged that the boy, Rakib Howlader, a school dropout who played the role of a child character in a movie, was picked up on April 4 and killed in custody. Wari Police Station Officer-in-Charge Rafiqul Islam, however, claimed that Rakib was a 22-year-old and was the prime suspect in the killing of Daffodil University student Khandaker Abu Talha in October 2017. Police officials said that he was earlier arrested on October 10, 2017, just two days after the killing of Talha. Wari police station sub-inspector Shah Alam claimed that a group of eight or nine suspected muggers opened fire on a police patrol team behind Bangladesh Homeopathic Medical College Hospital at about 3:20 am. Police also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight. After the gunfight, the police found bullet-hit Rakib. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Azad Kha
data.description: Police claimed to have found the bullet-riddled body of a suspected drug dealer in the Alalpur area of Faridpur, two days after he was allegedly picked up by several plainclothes DB police. AFM Nasim, Officer-in-Charge of Faridpur Sadar Police Station, said that a police team recovered Azad's body after receiving information from local people. They recovered the body around 12:15 pm and sent it to Faridpur Medical College Hospital for autopsy. Azad's sister, Sahera Begum, said that several plainclothes men, identifying themselves as detectives, picked up my brother from his friend's house in the Gazaria area around 2:00 am on 2 June. My brother has been missing since then.

data.name: Mohammad Ashraful Mia
data.description: Aslam, who was picked up by the Detective Branch (west) of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) for interrogation, died at the Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH). Aslam, from Gazipur, was a suspect in the abduction of a youth from the Shah Ali area of Dhaka, according to police officials. DB Inspector Md Mahbub, who took Aslam to the hospital, stated that he brought him to the Rajarbagh Police Lines Hospital and then transferred him to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital at around 10:30am. The doctors recommended some laboratory tests. Inspector Mahbub mentioned that he was informed that Aslam was pronounced dead at approximately 5:45pm, when he returned after completing the tests. Devdas Bhattacharya, the Additional Commissioner (Detective Branch) of the Metropolitan Police, stated that a team of DB police detained Aslam in connection with an abduction case. Aslam complained of abdominal pain and fell ill while being transported to the Detective Branch office.

data.name: Shahjahan Hossain
data.description: In Rangpur, Shahjahan Hossain, also known as Dabirul, aged 50, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Kaunia upazila around 3:30 am last night, as reported by our Dinajpur correspondent, Saiful Islam, the additional superintendent of Rangpur police (Circle A).

data.name: Rigan Liton
data.description: In Bogra, a suspected drug peddler named Rigan, also known as Liton, was killed in a gunfight with the police at the Matidhali intersection under the upazila at approximately 2:30 am, according to Additional Superintendent of Police Sanatan Chakraborty.

data.name: Munna
data.description: In Mymensingh, the police recovered the bullet-ridden bodies of suspected drug peddlers, Munna and Idris Ali, from the Charkalibari area under Sadar Dakhshin Upazila. The bodies were found in the Brahmaputra rail bridge area, as stated by Kotwali Police Station's Office-in-Charge, Mahmudul Islam. The Superintendent of Police for Mymensingh district, Syed Nurul Islam, mentioned that the two individuals were killed in a gunfight resulting from a dispute among drug peddlers. The families of the victims in Mymensingh have alleged that on June 1, their loved ones were taken away by individuals in plain clothes who claimed to be members of the Detective Branch (DB) from the Mashkanda Sheba Drug Rehabilitation Centre.

data.name: Idris Ali

data.name: Yunus Miaji
data.description: In Chandpur, a suspected drug peddler named Yunus was killed in a gunfight with the police at Purba Sriramdi in the district town around 1:45 am, according to Chandpur Police Officer-in-Charge Wali Ullah Oli.

data.name: Manik Mia
data.description: Abdul Ahad, the Officer-in-Charge of Gafargaon Police Station, stated that a suspected drug peddler named Mani, who was also involved in several cases, was found dead at Klibari Char in the upazila. The police officer mentioned that they were informed by the locals and subsequently recovered the body. He claimed that the drug peddler may have been killed in a gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers. However, the victim's brother, Rajab Ali, contradicted this statement and said that the police had apprehended Manik from the local bazaar on June 4, and since then he had been missing.

data.name: Abu Sayed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three suspected forest robbers, including the gang leader of the Kalu gang, were killed in a gunfight between the police and suspected forest robbers at Maidapesha canal near Kasiabad forest station in the Sunderbans, according to the police. Koyra Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Mohammad Enamul Haque, said members of the Kalu gang had abducted four fishermen, demanding ransom on June 5. Acting on secret information, the police raided a den of forest robbers at Maidapesha canal to rescue the abducted fishermen. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers fired on them, forcing them to fire back, said Enamul. After the gunfight, the police found the three forest robbers who had sustained bullet injuries and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex, where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Selim Mia
data.description: In Kishoreganj, a suspected drug peddler named Selim Mia from the Panchabati area under Bhairab upazila in the district was allegedly involved in ten cases. He was killed in a gunfight with the police at Gachtalaghat area of Bhairab upazila, according to Bhairab Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mokhlesur Rahman.

data.name: Akash Hossain Jiban
data.description: A man, accused in at least six criminal cases, was reportedly killed in what the police had claimed to be a gunfight between two groups of hoodlums at Bablatala of Shankarpur under Kotwali police station in Jessore on Friday, according to the police. The victim was identified as Akash Hossain Jiban, in his thirties, from Baubazar in Jessore town. Kotwali police sub-inspector Tareq Nahian said the 'gunfight' took place at about 3:30 pm on Friday. Upon receiving information, the police rushed to the scene and took the man to Jessore General Hospital, where the attending doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Shamim Hossain
data.description: In Thakurgaon, an alleged drug peddler named Shamim Hossain, 42, the son of the late Abdus Sattar from Bhabanandapur village, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in Ranishankoil upazila of the district. Abdul Mannan, the Officer-in-Charge of Ranishankoil Police Station, stated that they received information that a group of traders were preparing to deal drugs on Bhradreswari-Jagdal road in Bhradreswari village of the upazila. As a result, the police conducted a raid there around 1:30 am. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the drug peddlers opened fire. In response, the law enforcers retaliated, leading to the "gunfight". Shamim was struck by bullets while the others fled the scene. The police took Shamim to Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, according to the OC.

data.name: Abu Musa
data.description: In Rangpur, a suspected drug peddler named Abu Musa, 26, son of Abdul Kuddus, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Rangpur city around 2:00 am. The gunfight occurred when a police team from Rangpur Sadar Police Station conducted a raid in the Kukrulful area of the city to recover drugs. A group of drug peddlers attacked the law enforcers, according to Saiful Islam, Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP) in Rangpur.

data.name: Abdur Razzak
data.description: In Dinajpur, the police recovered the bullet-ridden body of an alleged criminal, Abdur Razzak, from the village of Danihari-Kanakpuri under Sadar upazila. The incident took place in Kharipara under the same upazila, where Razzak was killed in a gunfight, according to Redwanur Rahim, the Officer-in-charge of Kotwali Police Station.

data.name: Md. Sumon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police on the Chandina-Debidwar road in Debidwar upazila. Mizanur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Debidwar Police Station, said that the deceased was Md Sumon, 35, son of Habibur Rahman of Kuroin in the upazila, who was also an accused in 15 cases. Upon receiving information that a gang was preparing to commit a robbery in the area, a police team raided the location. The robbers opened fire, prompting the police to retaliate. Sumon sustained bullet injuries and later died at Comilla Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Sohagh
data.description: In Comilla, Officer-in-Charge Abu Salam Mia of Kotwali Police Station stated that a suspected drug peddler named Sohagh, aged 32, from the South Chartha Thirura Pukurpar area under Sadar upazila in the district town, died from his injuries at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on June 8. The OC mentioned that Sohagh was wounded in a gunfight between members of Chawakbazar police outpost and suspected drug peddlers at Mellarkhil area under Sadar upazila on June 1. He was immediately taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital and later transferred to DMCH, where he passed away on June 8.

data.name: Shahin Sheikh
data.description: In Sirajganj, Additional Superintendent of Police Yusuf Ali said that a suspected drug peddler, Shahin Sheikh, 35, from Mahmudpur in the district town, was killed in a gunfight with the DB police at about 2:15 am.

data.name: Shariful Islam
data.description: A murder suspect was killed in what the DB police claimed was a gunfight in the Bhatara cattle market area. According to Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (North) of the Detective Branch of Police, they received information that a gang of hired killers had gathered on 100-Foot Road in Bhatara to commit a targeted killing. In response, a team of DB police launched a drive to the location. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the gang opened fire on them, leading the law enforcers to retaliate. Following the "gunfight," the bullet-hit suspect, Shariful, was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rony Mia
data.description: Suspected peddlers, Rony Mia, 30, of Krishtapur, and Anwar Hossain, alias Anar, 38, of Banshbari Colony, were killed in a gunfight with the Detective Branch of Police at Kalibari Road, Mymensingh City at about 1:45 AM, said District DB Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman. According to him, the DB seized 1,750 yaba tablets, a pistol, and three empty cartridges from the spot. However, family members claimed that Anwar was picked up by plainclothes police around a week ago, and Rony had been missing since June 11.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.description: Suspected peddlers, Rony Mia, 30, of Krishtapur, and Anwar Hossain, alias Anar, 38, of Banshbari Colony, were killed in a gunfight with the Detective Branch of Police at Kalibari Road, Mymensingh City at about 1:45 AM, said District DB Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman. According to him, the DB seized 1,750 yaba tablets, a pistol, and three empty cartridges from the spot. However, family members claimed that Anwar was picked up by plainclothes police around a week ago, and Rony had been missing since June 11.

data.name: Jakir Farazi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and members of the police in Syedpur village in Haziganj upazila of Chandpur district early Thursday. The deceased, Jakir Hossain, 40, son of Abdul Latif from Swarna village in the upazila, was a ringleader. A team of patrol police found Jakir and his associates preparing for a robbery in Syedpur village around 2:30 am, said Haziganj police station officer-in-charge (OC) Jabedul Islam. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the OC added, the robbers opened fire on the policemen, prompting them to take action in self-defense. A gun battle took place in the area, leaving Jakir injured with bullets, he said.

data.name: Montaz Ali
data.description: A New Age correspondent in Jessore reported that two drug peddlers, who had been apprehended earlier, were killed in two separate 'gunfights' at Chengutia in the Abhaynagar upazila early Monday and near Kutcheymora Poultry Farm on Nabharan - Sathkhira Road in Sharsha upazila, Jessore, early Friday. The deceased were Shahidul Islam, 34, from Nawapara industrial town, and Montaz Ali, 40, son of Jabed Ali from Khedapara village, under Monirampur police station. Montaz's relatives stated that he had been missing since June 12, when the Khedapara camp police took him from Gangulia. Sub-inspector Md Ainuddin, in-charge of the Khedapara police camp, admitted to the arrest of the victim and told New Age that he had been picked up from the Monirampur Municipality area, not from Gangulia, at around 8:30 pm on that day. He was produced in court the following day.

data.name: Rezaul Karim
data.description: In Bogra, an alleged criminal named Rezaul Karim, also known as Dipjol, aged 38, from Malgram Uttarpara in the district town, was killed in a 'gunfight' in the Shilimpur New Bypass area of the town early on June 15. This information was provided by Bogra's additional superintendent of police, Sanatan Chakrabarty.

data.name: Ruhul Amin Bagha
data.description: In Shariatpur, Ruhul Amin Bahga, 50, son of Moslem Bagha of Char Jushirgaon in Gosairhat upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight between his associates and DB police at Bhadrachand in the upazila around 1:30 am on June 15, said the district Superintendent of Police, Abdul Momen.

data.name: Rehena Akhtar
data.description: Police recovered the bullet-ridden body of a listed woman 'drug peddler', Rehena Akhtar, 35, the wife of the late Azizul Islam from the Sankipara area in Mymensingh town on June 17. Mahmudul Islam, the Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Model Police Station, stated that Rehena may have been killed in a clash between two groups of drug peddlers over the sharing of drug money. However, Rehena's daughter, Ajeda Begum, alleged that her mother was picked up by the police from in front of their residence at around 4:00 pm on June 16.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.description: A New Age correspondent in Jessore reported that two drug peddlers, who had been apprehended earlier, were killed in two separate 'gunfights' at Chengutia in the Abhaynagar upazila early Monday and near Kutcheymora Poultry Farm on Nabharan - Sathkhira Road in Sharsha upazila, Jessore, early Friday. He was produced in court the following day.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: In Sherpur, Al Amin, also known as Fakir, 28, the son of Sahibor Rahman from Balaichar village under Sadar upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight at Chunierchar at night. After being informed by locals on June 20 in the morning, the police recovered the body from the scene. Nazrul Islam, the Officer-in-Charge of Sherpur police, stated that the incident occurred at night. The Company Commander of Battalion-14, Razib Kumar Dey, mentioned that their team conducted an anti-drug operation in the area on June 19 at night, during which they exchanged gunfire with drug traders, resulting in his death.

data.name: Hridoy
data.description: Police said that they recovered the bullet-hit body of a suspected drug peddler near the railway crossing on the Chuadanga-Darshana Road at Damurhuda in Chuadanga on June 21. Hridoy, the son of Bacchu Mia from Hatathpara, Darshana, Chuadanga district, was a listed drug peddler, according to Damurhuda police station officer-in-charge Sukumar Biswash. The OC said that after being informed by locals that a bullet-hit body was lying near the railway crossing, the police recovered it at about 11 AM. The OC also mentioned that he suspected Hridoy was killed by rival drug peddlers. However, Hridoy's family claimed that the police had picked him up from a shop on June 19 and he had been missing since then.

data.name: Ali Hossain
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Mymensingh district Detective Branch of Police, Ashiqur Rahman, stated that Ali Hossain was killed in a gunfight with the DB Police near an auto-rice mill on Tarakanda-Phulpur road at approximately 2:45 am. Mujibur Rahman, a member of Ward no-2 of Kakni Union Parishad, quoted neighbors who said that Ali was taken from his house on the night of June 18 and has been missing ever since.

data.name: Swapan Mia
data.description: Mymensingh Trishal Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Zakiur Rahman, said that a suspected drug peddler named Swapan was killed in a gunfight with the police near Jatiya Kabi Kazi Nazrul Islam University in Trishal upazila around 4:00 pm. He was apprehended by the police from the Trishal Bus Stand area on June 21 around 6:00 pm while he was on his way to Trishal Bazar to buy meat. Swapan was then taken to the police station, according to Rubel Mia, Swapan's younger brother who works for a local newspaper. Rubel claimed that they had met Swapan at the police station, provided him with food, and left around 2:00 am. However, in the morning, they received the news that he had been killed in a gunfight.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain
data.description: In Sirajganj, a suspected drug peddler named Jahangir Hossain, 32, son of the late Hatem Ali from Railway Colony Purbapara area, was killed in a 'gunfight' with drug dealers at Mahmudpur field area, according to the police. Acting on a tip-off, a police team raided the area around 3:00 am, stated Mahmud Daud, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station. The criminals opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate. Afterwards, the police recovered Jahangir's body.

data.name: Abdul Mannan
data.description: Police recovered the bullet-ridden body of drug trader Abdul Mannan, 45, son of the late Ali Hossain, at Kandapara in the Tangail municipal area. Police said they suspect Mannan may have been killed in a gunfight following a dispute between two groups of drug traders. However, the deceased's brothers Golam Rasul, Golam Maula, and his son Nazmul Hasan Sumon said police picked up Mannan from his house at 2:00 am on June 22. Sanjit Kumar Roy, Superintendent of Police (SP) in Tangail, stated at a press briefing that police discovered Mannan's body when they raided the Charabari area at 7:00 am after receiving information from locals.

data.name: Mohammad Nizam Uddin Mondol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Pabna, Sabahara Party leader Md Nizam Uddin Mondol was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with the police. According to the police, Nizam, from Mirpur in Aminpur thana, Bera upazila in Pabna, was the regional leader of a faction of the Sarbahara Party. The police described Nizam as the main suspect in the murder of three police officers at Dhalarchar police camp in 2010. Neighbors said that Nizam was watching a World Cup soccer match on TV at a neighbor's house at 10:15 PM on June 23 when he was picked up by uniformed police. Pabna Additional Superintendent of Police Goutam Kumar Bishwas said that a team from Amirpur thana police raided Dhaarchar Daspara following a tip-off that a group of dacoits were preparing to commit dacoity. He said the dacoits opened fire, forcing the police to retaliate, and Nizam was hit by a bullet. The police took him to Bera Upazila Health Complex where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Monirul Islam
data.description: A New Age Correspondent in Jessore, quoting Monirampur police station officer in-charge Mokarram Hossain, reported that the police recovered the bullet-ridden bodies of two suspected miscreants from a crop field at Chhatiantala under Monirampur upazila early on June 24. The OC claimed that the duo was killed in a 'gunfight' with a rival group. After the bodies were taken to Jessore General Hospital for a post-mortem examination, relatives identified the 30-year-old Monirul Islam of Ranagati, Abhaynagar, Jessore. His brother, Mehedi Hasan, told reporters that plainclothes police picked up Monirul Islam from the Jessore Central Jail's main gate in the afternoon of June 21 after he was released on bail in a murder case. The police, however, could not identify the other victim.

The police, however, could not identify the other victim.

data.name: Mohammad Kaiyum
data.description: In Chapainawabganj, a suspected drug peddler named Md Kaiyum, 28, son of Abdul Kuddus from Chokha Monaksha village under Shibganj upazila, was killed in a gunfight with the police at around 2:30 am, according to District Superintendent of Police TM Mozahidul Islam.

data.name: Nayem Islam
data.description: Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Mirpur Police Station, said that police arrested Nayem and Joyar on June 25 in connection with the abduction of Deb Dutta, a 9-year-old son of Pabitra Dutta and a class III student at Chitlia Primary School. Based on the information provided by the duo, the police recovered Deb's body from under the ground beside a toilet in Nayem's house around 2 pm on June 25. Later that night, the police conducted a raid in the village with the duo to apprehend other criminals. When the team reached the village, their accomplices opened fire on the law enforcers. The law enforcers retaliated, resulting in a gunfight between them, according to the police. The murder suspects sustained bullet wounds as they attempted to flee the scene during the gunfight. They were taken to Mirpur Hospital, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Joyar Ali
data.description: Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Mirpur Police Station, said that police arrested Nayem and Joyar on June 25 in connection with the abduction of Deb Dutta, a 9-year-old son of Pabitra Dutta and a class III student at Chitlia Primary School. Based on the information provided by the duo, the police recovered Deb's body from under the ground beside a toilet in Nayem's house around 2 pm on June 25. Later that night, the police conducted a raid in the village with the duo to apprehend other criminals. When the team reached the village, their accomplices opened fire on the law enforcers. The law enforcers retaliated, resulting in a gunfight between them, according to the police. The murder suspects sustained bullet wounds as they attempted to flee the scene during the gunfight. They were taken to Mirpur Hospital, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Jakir Hossain
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a reported gunfight with detectives in the Bagmara Beribadh area in Sadar upazila of Bhola. The deceased was identified as Jakir Hossain, 50. Upon receiving information that a group of drug traders was conducting a secret meeting in the area, a team of detectives conducted a raid at around 3:45 am, said Shahidul Islam, officer-in-charge of the Detective Branch of the district police. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the drug traders opened fire on them, prompting the detectives to retaliate in self-defense. After the gunfight, the police recovered the body from the scene while others managed to flee.

data.name: Manik Sheikh
data.description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in what the police claimed was a gunfight in the Bagmara area of the city on June 27, hours after their arrest amid the ongoing anti-narcotics drive. However, Raju's family claimed that the police demanded Tk 10 lakh for his release and killed him as they failed to pay the sum. Humayun Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Khulna Sadar police, said a team of law enforcers from Khulna arrested Raju and Manik in Dhaka on June 26 and brought them to the city as they were listed as drug peddlers. After interrogation, the police took them to recover drugs in the Bankers Lane area around 3:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, their cohorts opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage, the police recovered the bodies of Raju and Manik, while their cohorts fled. Titli Begum, Raju's wife, said that the police picked up her husband from the New Market area in Khulna on June 26. "I met the police and requested them to free him, but they demanded Tk 10 lakh for that. We wanted to arrange a press conference at Khulna Press Club, but the civil police did not allow us," she alleged.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: Abdur Rahman, also known as Lalu, Sayed, Akkas, and Kawsar, is a 34-year-old who police claim was the commander of the military wing of the Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh in the Dhaka division. Police stated that Rahman was the one responsible for shooting and killing progressive writer Bachchu on June 11. On June 24, Rahman was arrested at a JMB hideout in Gazipur. Jayedul Alam, the Superintendent of Police in Munshiganj, announced during a press briefing yesterday that his team had recovered firearms and one of the motorcycles used in Bachchu's murder. He added that Rahman and several other suspected JMB members had rented a house in Bachchu's neighborhood in Sirajdikhan upazila of Munshiganj three months prior to executing their plan to kill him. Although four suspects participated in the murder, two others were also involved. Yesterday, a police team raided the house around 1:00 am, taking Rahman with them. When the suspects sensed the presence of the police, they fled. As the team was returning, Rahman's associates opened fire on the police in an attempt to free him from custody. A gunfight broke out when the police retaliated. The Superintendent of Police stated that Rahman was found lying on the ground with bullet wounds. He was taken to Sirajdikhan Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zahid Hasan Tokon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A Jubo League leader was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Kaemkola Bagmara Beel in Jhikorgachha upazila of Jessore on June 29. The deceased, Zahid Hasan Tokon, 32, son of Ali Aslam of Krishnanagar village under the upazila, was the joint convener of Jhikorgachha upazila Jubo League. The victim's father has alleged that the police picked up his son Tokon from their rented house at Chachra area in Jessore town at around 9:30 pm on Friday. Jhikorgachha Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Masud Karim said that after his arrest, Tokon confessed to possessing arms and bullets. At around 3:00 am, the police took him to Kaemkola Bagmara Beel to confront his accomplices. Sensing the police presence, Tokon's accomplices fired at the law enforcers, and the police retaliated by firing seven rounds of bullets. The gang members all fled the scene, and the police recovered the injured Tokhon, who had been shot in his head during the gunfire exchange. The police took the critically injured Tokon to Jessore General Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead on arrival, the OC said.

data.name: Idris
data.description: Narsingdi District Additional Superintendent of Police, Zakir Hasan, reported that the police arrested Idris on the evening of June 29th from Ghorashal, under Polash Upazila in the district. He was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and his cohorts when the police conducted a raid based on his "confession" to apprehend suspected carjackers at Shilmandi, under Sadar, to arrest his associates around 1:00 am.

data.name: Abu Taher
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with Comilla DB Police in the Amtoli area near the Gumti river of Comilla Sadar around 1:30 am. Officer-in-Charge Monjur Alam of Comilla DB police said that the DB police were conducting a special drive near the Gumti in Amtoli. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on the policemen resulting in a gunfight. Taher was shot dead on the spot.

data.name: Abdur Rab Hawladar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight between his accomplices and the police at Patka in Sreepur upazila around 3:30 am. The deceased was Abdur Rab Hawladar, 35, hailing from Goshairhat upazila in Shariatpur. Around 3:00 am, a team of police was patrolling the area when the robbers shot at their vehicle. The team fired back, resulting in the "gunfight," said Joynal Abedin, Assistant Sub-Inspector of Sreepur Police Station. At one stage, Abdur Rab sustained injuries after being hit by a bullet fired by one of his accomplices, claimed the police. He was declared dead at Sreepur Upazila Health Complex. The body was sent to Gazipur Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Mohammad Prince
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed and another was injured in a "shootout" with the police. The deceased was Md Prince, 28, and the injured individual was Golap Hossain Bappi, 27, from Amubari village in Madaripur. Bappi is currently receiving treatment at Rangpur Medical College Hospital. Acting on information that a gang of robbers was planning a heist near Keramatia Government School in the Munsipara area of Rangpur city, the police conducted a raid, according to Abdul Aziz, Inspector (Investigation) of Rangpur Sadar Police Station. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the gang attacked the law enforcement officers, who retaliated. The remaining gang members fled the scene. The body of the deceased was sent to the Rangpur Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Bachchu Mia
data.description: The DB official claimed that a team of DB police, acting on a tip-off that a gang of drug peddlers had gathered at Shambuganj to share their drug money, raided the location at around 2:45 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug peddlers hurled bricks at them and later opened fire, forcing the DB police to retaliate. After the gunfight ended, the police found Bachchu with bullet wounds and rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jalal Uddin
data.description: An alleged drug dealer, Jalal Uddin, was killed during a skirmish in Bhaluka Upazila's Habirbari area around 2:15 am on July 4, according to Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman of the district Detective Branch of Police. He stated that a team of DB and police raided the area to apprehend a gang of drug dealers.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: Two suspects in the June 15 murder of Awami League leader Farhad Hossain were killed in a 'gunfight' with the DB Police in the Santarkul area. Deputy Commissioner Mashiur Rahman of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police's Detective Branch (north) stated that a team of DB, acting on secret information that a group of miscreants had gathered at some under construction buildings near Santarkul Projapoti Garden area, conducted a raid at around 3:00 am. He claimed that upon sensing the presence of the police, the suspects opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate by firing. After the 'gunfight' ended, the police discovered two individuals with bullet wounds on the ground floor of the under-construction building. They were then sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where the on-duty doctors declared them dead.

They were then sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Nusrat Jamil Nitul
data.description: The drug addict killed in a gunfight was identified as Nusrat Jamil Nitul (25). Md. Ashiqur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of the Detective Branch in Mymensingh District, reported that a drug dealer had stabbed and killed one person and injured a police constable. Upon receiving this information, the police proceeded to the Naogaon area, the site of the incident. The injured police constable was admitted to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital. Nitul fled upon seeing the police. The police launched an operation to arrest him around 1:30 pm on Naogaon Mosque Road. During this time, Nitul was killed at the scene in a gunfight with the police.

data.name: Golam Mustafa
data.description: In Narail, the police said the suspected drug trader, Golam Mustafa, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Chandmari. The police said they were on an operation when the drug peddlers suddenly attacked the cops, who returned fire in self-defense. After the gunfight, the police recovered the bullet-hit body of Mustafa from the spot.

data.name: Sazzadur Rahman
data.description: According to the Rapid Action Battalion, two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB in Pabahati, Jhenaidah. The killed suspected peddlers were identified as Sazzadur Rahman, 42, from the Baghajotin area, and Abdul Razzaq, 35, from the Udaypur area in the district town, according to RAB. RAB 6 Company Commander Golam Mourshed stated that a plainclothes RAB team raided the Khajura area around 1:00 am based on a tip-off. Upon sensing RAB's presence, the suspected drug peddlers fled the scene on motorcycles and encountered a RAB check post. "The drug peddlers opened fire on RAB members in an attempt to evade the checking. RAB retaliated, resulting in two suspects sustaining bullet injuries and dying," RAB reported. Two RAB officers, Touhidul and Saidul, were also injured in the incident, according to RAB.

data.name: Faruque Mia
data.description: In Mymensingh, a suspected drug peddler was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Atharbari, Ishwarganj, Mymensingh. Ahmed Kabir, the officer-in-charge of Ishwarganj police station, stated that they received a tip-off about drug money splitting taking place, which led to a police raid in the Atharbari area. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the drug peddlers threw brick chips and opened fire on them. In self-defense, the police retaliated, and during the ensuing gunfight, the peddler allegedly managed to escape, according to Kabir. However, the police later discovered Faruque Mia, who had been injured by a bullet, and sent him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Shamsul Huq
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Gaibandha, an alleged robber named Shamsul Huq, 38, from Bedkapa village in Palashbari upazila, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Khan Md Shahriar, OC of Gaibandha Sadar Police Station, stated that based on information, a combined force of Gaibandha Sadar police and Sadullapur police raided the Dholbhanga bazar area in Palashbari and arrested Shamsul on July 7. Following Shamsul's statement, the police, accompanied by him, conducted a search in his house to recover firearms and apprehend his accomplices at around 4:00 am. However, when they reached the Shakoya bridge area, his gang members opened fire at the police officials in an attempt to rescue him. In response, the police fired back. Shamsul sustained bullet injuries in the "shootout," and his associates managed to escape. Critically wounded, Shamsul was taken to Gaibandha Sadar Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: An alleged drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Satgiri Jamal village in Sundarganj upazila. Assistant Commander of Gaibandha's RAB-13, Habibur Rahman Habib, said that after receiving a tip-off, one of their teams was on their way to raid Abdus Salam's house at around 3:00 am. When they were close by, criminals sensed their presence and around five to six of them opened fire on the law enforcers. As RAB officials retaliated, the criminals fled, but Abdus Salam, the "ring leader" of the group, was found with bullet wounds. He was taken to Sundarganj Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Kalu Sikder
data.description: Shariatpur Police Superintendent Abdul Momen said that drug peddler Kalu might have been killed in a gunfight between two drug peddler groups. According to Kalu’s paternal uncle, Selim Sikder, plainclothes men identifying themselves as the Detective Branch of the police, along with a man from Palang Bazaar, had picked up Kalu from Khokon Shah’s residence at Khelsi in the district town on the evening of July 6. Selim said that when family members went to the district DB office and Palang police station, they denied having detained anyone with the name of Kalu. On July 7, they went to Palang police station to lodge a general diary regarding Kalu’s disappearance, but they refused to record the GD. Kalu’s mother, Shanti Begum, said that Rashed Sardar, a villager of Chandsar under Palang police station, demanded Tk 50,000 for his release, but they failed to pay the money. However, Rashed denied the allegation. SP Momen also denied that the DB had picked up or detained Kalu.

data.name: Ibrahim Hossain Babu
data.description: In the capital, Ibrahim Hossain Babu, 35, was killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB at the Beribundh area in Mirpur. According to RAB-4 Commanding Officer Chowdhury Manjurul Karim, at 4 AM on July 10, two riders on a motorcycle opened fire on RAB men at a checkpoint in Mirpur Beribandh area, ignoring their signal to stop. The RAB men retaliated, leaving one rider injured with bullets, while the other one fled. He said that the injured rider was swiftly taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. Later, the RAB commander stated that the deceased rider was identified as a drug peddler named Ibrahim. Ibrahim's elder brother, Md Sumon, who identified the body at the DMCH morgue, said that his brother had been missing since early June when some plainclothes men, identifying themselves as law enforcement personnel, picked him up in Chapainawabganj.

data.name: Mohammad Nadim Hossain
data.description: At Rupganj, Narayanganj, Mohammad Nadim Hossain, also known as Nadim or Pochish, aged 35, allegedly died in a 'gunfight' with the RAB at 2:30 AM on July 10. According to the police and the RAB, Nadim, who was from the Mohammadpur camp of Stranded Pakistanis, also known as Mohammadpur Geneva Camp, in the capital, did not reside in the camp. Senior Assistant Police Superintendent Rabiul Islam of RAB-2 stated that they received a tip-off about drug peddlers delivering yaba tablets to fellow peddlers at Purbachal. The rendezvous was raided at approximately 2:30 AM, resulting in a gunfight with the peddlers. After the gunfight ended, RAB discovered the body of Nadim, who had been hit by a bullet, at the scene.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Belal was killed in a "gunfight" with the police around 4:00 am in the Hazirhat area, on the outskirts of the city. Babul Miah, the officer-in-charge of Kotowali police, said that the gunfight occurred when suspected robbers opened fire on them, leading the police to retaliate.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: RAB-8 officials claimed that the unidentified deceased was a member of a forest robber gang. RAB-8 Deputy Assistant Director Md Nuruddin said the 26-year-old forest robber was killed on the morning of July 10 in a gunfight with the RAB at Ambaria, under the Sarankhola range of the Sunderban east division. Sarankhola police station officer-in-charge Md Kabirul Islam said that RAB-8 DAD Kabirul Islam lodged a case in this connection, and they sent the body to Bagerhat General Hospital morgue for post-mortem examinations.

data.name: Bablur Rahman Babla
data.description: The victim was identified by relatives as Bablur Rahman Babla, 26, of Hashimpur in Jessore Sadar upazila. Babla went missing immediately after being released on bail from Jessore Central Jail on July 10. Mokarram Hossain, Officer in-Charge of Monirampur Police Station, said police recovered Babla's body from Jessore-Rajgonj Road at Gangulia under Monirampur upazila at about 6:00 am. "He might have died in a gunfight between two groups of miscreants," he added. Shaukat Hossain, nephew of the victim, identified him at Jessore General Hospital later. Shaukat told reporters that Babla, accused in several cases, had been missing since he was released from the Jessore Central Jail on bail on July 10.

data.name: Md Sohel Rana
data.description: In Lakshmipur, the man killed in a "gun battle" has been identified as Sohel Rana, approximately 37 years old. He hailed from Raipur upazila in the district. According to the police, they apprehended Sohel, who was accused in 22 cases, near Jhumur Cinema in the town on the afternoon of July 10. Subsequently, around 3:00 am on July 11, they conducted a raid in the Raipur area, taking the detainee with them. During the operation, Sohel's associates attacked the police team, prompting the officers to retaliate with gunfire. Sohel was hit by bullets as he attempted to flee, as stated by Azizur Rahman, the Officer-in-Charge of Raipur Police Station. He was immediately rushed to Raipur Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Nur Hossain Nuru
data.description: In Dhaka's Keraniganj upazila, alleged drug trader Nur Hossain Nuru, 35, was killed in a "gunfight" between criminals and the Detective Branch of the police. Monirul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of DB, said the gunfight took place near the Diamond Melamine Factory in Deushur area, as reported by UNB.

data.name: Abdul Malek
data.description: The alleged drug peddler, Abdul Malek, died from his bullet wounds at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital on July 11. Malek passed away at 2:00 am, according to a staff member of the hospital, who added that he had been admitted with bullet injuries to his left leg. The 48-year-old man was injured when a team of detectives opened fire on a group of drug peddlers in Charghat upazila on July 6, said Ataur Rahman, OC of the Detective Branch of Rajshahi district police. He claimed that the police opened fire after coming under attack from criminals.

data.name: Phutu Monna
data.description: At Kushita, suspected drug peddlers Phutu, also known as Monna, 35, son of Ahmed Ali, and his nephew Russel Ahmed, 30, son of Rabiul Islam, from Rajarhat, were killed in a 'gunfight' with the RAB at Katdah Char under Mirpur in the district on July 11. RAB-12 Commanding Officer Md Mohaiminul said that the duo were top drug dealers according to the list of suspected drug peddlers prepared by the Ministry of Home Affairs.

data.name: Russel Ahmed
data.description: At Kushita, suspected drug peddlers Phutu, also known as Monna, 35, son of Ahmed Ali, and his nephew Russel Ahmed, 30, son of Rabiul Islam, from Rajarhat, were killed in a 'gunfight' with the RAB at Katdah Char under Mirpur in the district on July 11. RAB-12 Commanding Officer Md Mohaiminul said that the duo were top drug dealers according to the list of suspected drug peddlers prepared by the Ministry of Home Affairs.

data.name: Osman Gani
data.description: In Natore's Boraigram upazila, an alleged drug peddler named Osman Gani died from his bullet wounds at a local hospital on July 11, approximately half an hour after being injured in a "gun battle" between RAB and suspected criminals. Major Shibli Mostafa, the Company Commander of RAB-5, stated that a RAB team conducted a raid in Bahimali village around 11:40 pm on July 10, based on information that a group of individuals were engaging in suspicious activities there. During the operation, Osman and his accomplices opened fire at the RAB members. In response, the RAB personnel retaliated with gunshots, resulting in the "gunfight" that caused Osman's injuries. He was immediately taken to a local hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nurul was killed in a gunfight with the police at Purundapur village on July 12. After receiving a tip-off that a gang of robbers was planning to commit a robbery in the area, a team of police conducted a drive there around 1:45 am, said Mohammad Salauddin, Additional Superintendent of Kotchandpur (circle) Police. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, prompting the police to fire back in self-defense. Unfortunately, Nurul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Afzal
data.description: RAB-12 Crime Prevention Company-3 Commander Robiul Islam said that peddler Md Afzal, from Beguntol village in Tangail Sadar, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the RAB in his village on July 13th.

data.name: Ratan Hossain Mridha
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Chaugacha Police Officer-in-charge, Khandaker Shamim Uddin, reported that Ratan Hossain Mridha, the son of Abu Bakr Mridha from Dighalsingha under Chaugacha in the district, was killed in a reported gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers at Kayarpara under the upazila on July 13 at 2:30 am. The victim's mother, Farida Begum, told journalists at Jessore General Hospital on the morning of July 13 that her son went missing from Magura on July 12 at noon.

data.name: Putu Sarkar
data.description: In Bogra, a suspected drug peddler named Putu Sarkar, from Charsutrapur under Bogra Sadar upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Bhatkandi Bridge under Shajahanpur upazila in the district around 3:00 am, according to Additional Superintendent of Bogra police, Sanatan Chakraborty.

data.name: Murad Hossain Akanda
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Murad Hossain Akanda, 30, the son of Md Shahjahan Akanda from the village of Bogajaan in Bhaluka upazila of Mymensingh, died after sustaining fatal injuries in a gunfight with the police. Upon receiving information that a gang of robbers was preparing for a robbery in the Uthura area on the Bhoraduba-Uthura road in Bhaluka, the police conducted a raid in the area at around 2:15 am, according to Mazharul Islam, the inspector (Investigation) of Bhaluka Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals fired bullets at them, forcing the police to retaliate. Murad was shot during the ensuing "gun battle" and was immediately rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH), where the doctors pronounced him dead, the OC added. The police also recovered five sharp weapons from the scene. According to the police, Murad is accused in around six cases related to robbery.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: Two alleged drug dealers, including a former Jubo League leader, were killed in a "gunfight" between the police and criminals in Satkhira Sadar upazila on July 15. Faruk Ahmed, the Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station, said the police picked up both men around 5:45 pm on July 14. The shootout took place at the Koker Beel area around 2:30 am when a police team took the two men along to recover a consignment of drugs that was supposed to have come from India. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight" that left the duo injured. They were rushed to Satkhira Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.description: Two alleged drug dealers, including a former Jubo League leader, were killed in a "gunfight" between the police and criminals in Satkhira Sadar upazila on July 15. Faruk Ahmed, the Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station, said the police picked up both men around 5:45 pm on July 14. The shootout took place at the Koker Beel area around 2:30 am when a police team took the two men along to recover a consignment of drugs that was supposed to have come from India. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight" that left the duo injured. They were rushed to Satkhira Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Shohor Ali,
data.description: In Kushtia, Shohor Ali was killed in a gunfight between the police and suspected drug peddlers during an anti-drug operation near a bridge in Haripur village, under Sadar upazila, at around 3:30 am. This information was provided by Nasir Uddin, the officer-in-charge of Sadar Police Station.

data.name: Noman Khan
data.description: In Mymensingh, Noman was killed in a "gunfight" between suspected drug peddlers and the police at Raghurampur under Sadar upazila around 1:45 am when Kotwali police raided the area to arrest suspected peddlers and seize drugs, said Mahmudul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station.

data.name: Amirul Islam Pancha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Bhaturia. Golam Morshed, the Company Commander of RAB-6 in Jhenaidah, stated that on the night of July 17, they set up a checkpoint in Bhaturia village. A group of robbers, upon sensing the presence of RAB, opened fire on them at around 11:45 pm. Morshed mentioned that RAB retaliated by firing back, resulting in a gunfight between the RAB and the suspected robbers. After the gunfight ended and the suspected robbers fled, they conducted a search of the area. They discovered Amirul, who had been hit by a bullet and was in critical condition. They immediately took him to Harinakundu Upazila Health Complex, where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Enamul Haque
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with a joint forces team of RAB and BGB at Himchari on July 19th. Major Iqbal Ahmed, Second-in-Command of 34 BGB Battalion in Cox's Bazar, stated that Enamul and Farhad were killed in a gunfight around 4:00 am on the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road.

data.name: Farhad Hossain Arif
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with a joint forces team of RAB and BGB at Himchari on July 19th. Major Iqbal Ahmed, Second-in-Command of 34 BGB Battalion in Cox's Bazar, stated that Enamul and Farhad were killed in a gunfight around 4:00 am on the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two unidentified suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with RAB men at Jharna Point in the Khulshi area at about 1:30 am on July 20. Mintanur Rahman, the RAB-7 Assistant Superintendent of Chittagong Police, said they found the bodies of the two suspected drug peddlers after a brief gunfight at the location.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two unidentified suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with RAB men at Jharna Point in the Khulshi area at about 1:30 am on July 20. Mintanur Rahman, the RAB-7 Assistant Superintendent of Chittagong Police, said they found the bodies of the two suspected drug peddlers after a brief gunfight at the location.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.description: Khorshed Alam, a suspected drug trader, was killed in a gunfight with the police on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway in Daudkandi. Alamgir Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Daudkandi Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, the police stopped a car on the highway near Hasanpur Government College. The men on board the car opened fire on the officers, leading to the gunfight. Khorshed's body was found at the scene later, while the others fled.

data.name: Khairul Islam
data.description: RAB-5 Deputy Company Commander in the district, Abu Khayer, said that the suspected drug peddler, Khairul Islam, 42, of Char Islampur village under Sadar upazila, was killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB in a mango orchard at village Mollan under Sadar upazila in the district at about 1:30 am on July 21.

data.name: Shamsuddin
data.description: In Kushtia, Shamsuddin, also known as Sham, 38, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Bheramara upazila. The incident occurred around 3:30 am when a police team raided the Bankapul area after receiving a tip-off that a group of drug peddlers were having a meeting there, according to Aminul Islam, the officer-in-charge of Bheramara Police Station.

data.name: Mohammad Abdur Rahim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: In Dinajpur, Md Abdur Rahim, 45, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Parbatipur upazila. Two narcotics gangs were meeting in Bannirghat village, and they opened fire when the police raided the area around 3:00 am, said Habibiul Haq Prodhan, the OC of Parbatipur Police Station. Later, the police found Rahim with bullet wounds and took him to Parbatipur Upazila Health Complex, where he died from his injuries.

data.name: Mohammad Ismail
data.description: Cox's Bazar Correspondent of The Daily Observer reported that an alleged drug dealer was killed in a 'gunfight' between two groups of drug dealers in Chakaria upazila around 2:30 am on Saturday. The deceased was identified as Md Ismail, 42, son of Abu Salam from the upazila, said Bakhtiar Uddin Chowdhury, officer-in-charge of Chakaria Police Station.

data.name: Ahadul Islam
data.description: In Natore, Ahadul Islam, 38, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in Lalpur upazila at around 2:30 am after a gang of criminals opened fire at RAB men, forcing them to retaliate, said Major Shibli Mostafa, a Company Commander of RAB-5 in Natore.

data.name: Faruk Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Chapainawabganj, a suspected robber was killed in a "gun battle" with RAB in Shibganj upazila. The robber has been identified as Faruk Hossain, a 35-year-old resident of the upazila. Abul Khayer, Deputy Commander of Chapainawabganj Camp of RAB-5, stated that a patrol team was passing through the Mohammadpur area around 1:30 am when a gang of robbers barricaded the Paikortala-Mobarokpur road. Upon noticing the arrival of RAB, the robbers opened fire, prompting the RAB officials to retaliate, resulting in Faruk sustaining injuries. He was immediately taken to Shibganj Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Jakir Shikder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Narail, a suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Kachubaria village in Lohagara upazila. The deceased was identified as Jakir Shikder, 35, by The Daily Manabzamin.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Monirampur Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mokarram Hossain said that two unidentified suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" at Pulerhat-Rajganj road in Gangulia Jamtala area under Monirampur upazila in the district. The identities of the deceased could not yet be determined.

data.name: Unidentified

The identities of the deceased could not yet be determined.

data.name: Alamgir Badsha
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: RAB-11 Assistant Director Md Alep Uddin stated that Alamgir, the son of Manik Bepari, was killed in a gunfight with a RAB team during an anti-drug operation in Changrakandi under Sonargaon on July 24. Major Ashik Billah, the acting Commanding Officer of RAB 11, mentioned that Alamgir was a prominent drug dealer in the district. However, Alamgir's family and the General Secretary of the district's BNP claimed that he was killed because of his involvement with the BNP. On Monday, Alamgir's wife, Suraiya Akter, stated that three to four individuals forced her husband into a microbus and drove away after he left for work. His family was unable to locate him throughout the day and only learned about his death on the morning of July 24. She insisted that Alamgir was never involved in the drug trade and supported their family by renting out some of their shops and house in the Kanchpur area.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Sub-Inspector Quyyum Munshi of Jessore Kotwali police said that the police recovered the bullet-ridden bodies of two men after being informed of a robbery attempt at the scene around 2:55 am. He said that they sent the bodies to Jessore General Hospital for post-mortem examinations. The police officer also mentioned that they found three sharp weapons, pieces of rope, and sandals at the scene. Jessore General Hospital medical officer Kajal Mallick confirmed that the duo was brought dead to the hospital.

data.name: Imran Hossain Rocky
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Md Bazlur Rashid of RAB-6 said the suspected drug peddler, Rocky, was killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB members at a RAB check-post set up at Maheshwarpasha Paschimpara around 1:30 am. The victim's father, Sheikh Mizanur Rahman, claimed that his son was an employee of the Rampal power plant, not a drug peddler. He stated that plainclothes men picked Rocky up in a RAB car from the gate of the power plant, and many workers had even witnessed it on July 7 at around 5:00 pm. However, RAB denied his detention.

data.name: Sazzad Ali
data.description: Sazzad Ali was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Paba upazila, Rajshahi. Major Ashraful Islam of RAB-5 in Rajshahi alleged that the gunfight began when a RAB team ordered a group of suspected drug peddlers to surrender in the Kosba area at around 1:00 am. The criminals opened fire on the RAB officials, who retaliated. Ali was left injured as the others managed to flee. He was declared dead after being taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital. RAB claimed that 50 bottles of phensedyl, a pistol, and a bullet were recovered from the spot. Ali had at least seven cases for drug peddling filed against him, according to Maj Ashraful.

data.name: Jakir Hossain
data.description: Jakir Hossain, an alleged drug dealer, was killed along with two others in a reported gunfight with RAB in Chattogram. Among the other deceased, one was identified as Md Dalim Sheikh while the other remained unidentified. Both Jakir and Dalim hailed from Morrelganj in the Bagerhat district. According to Rab, Jakir was accused in one drug-related case while Dalim was accused in two. Mimtanur Rahman, an assistant director of RAB-7's media wing, said the "gunfight" took place at the Ambagan Railway Canteen Gate area after a Rab team signaled a private car coming from Comilla to stop. "Upon seeing the Rab officers, the car's passengers opened fire at them, forcing them to retaliate," he said. Afterwards, Rab discovered three bodies with bullet wounds inside the car.

data.name: Mohammad Dalim Sheikh
data.description: Md Dalim Sheikh, an alleged drug dealer, was killed along with two others in a reported gunfight with RAB in Chattogram. Among the other deceased, one was identified as Jakir Hossain while the other remained unidentified. Both Jakir and Dalim hailed from Morrelganj in the Bagerhat district. According to Rab, Jakir was accused in one drug-related case while Dalim was accused in two. "Upon seeing the Rab officers, the car's passengers opened fire at them, prompting them to retaliate," he said. Afterwards, Rab discovered the three bodies with bullet wounds inside the car.

The other two deceased individuals were identified as Jakir Hossain and Md Dalim Sheikh, both of whom hailed from Morrelganj in the Bagerhat district. According to RAB, Jakir was accused in one drug-related case, while Dalim was accused in two.
