"Upon seeing the Rab officers, the car's passengers opened fire at them, prompting them to retaliate," he said. Subsequently, RAB discovered the bodies of the three individuals inside the car, all of whom had been shot.

data.name: Nazmul Hossain
data.description: In Tangail, an alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Mirzapur upazila on July 26. Mizanul Haque, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Mirzapur Police Station, said that a police team arrested Nazmul from his house at around 3:00 am. When the police were on the Dhaka-Tangail highway, a "gunfight" ensued as a group of criminals attacked the police van. As the criminals sprayed bullets at the police, Nazmul attempted to flee. When the police fired back, Nazmul was left with bullet wounds while the other criminals fled the scene. After he was rushed to a local hospital, they sent him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital upon referral. As his condition deteriorated on the way there, he was admitted to the Sheikh Fazilatunnesa Mujib Memorial Hospital in Gazipur, where doctors declared him dead at 11:00 am, OC Mizanul said.

data.name: Masud Rana Farid
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In Tangail, police recovered the bullet-ridden body of former Aronkhola Union Parishad member Masud Rana Farid from Naira Baid area in Madhupur upazila on the morning of July 27. Upon receiving the information, the police took the body to the police station at around 8:00 am. Farid's brother-in-law, Rubel Miah, stated that he, along with Farid's wife and children, had attended a relative's wedding ceremony at Roktipara on July 26, and Farid was supposed to join them on the morning of July 27. Family members had spoken to him on his mobile phone at 8:00 pm on July 26, but since the morning of July 27, Farid had been unreachable by phone. Meanwhile, Zakir Hossain Sarkar, the President of the Modhupur Upazali unit of the BNP, claimed that Farid was a leader of Jubo Dal. He suggested that his killing could have been staged as a 'crossfire' incident.

data.name: Hazrat Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: RAB-12 Additional Superintendent of Police Sakibul Islam Khan said that the suspected robber, Hazrat Ali, 35, from the village of Udhuniya Pankhuriya under Ullapara in the district, was killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB members at Paikpara under Ullapara at approximately 3:00 am on July 27.

data.name: Al Amin Kausar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers, Al Amin alias Kausar from Maniknagar village in Titash upazila, and Ershad Mia from Kongshanagar village in Burichang upazila, were killed in a 'gunfight' with the Detective Branch of Police on the Batakandi-Asmania Road under Titash on July 27, according to the District Additional Superintendent of Police, Shakhawat Hossain.

data.name: Ershad Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers, Al Amin alias Kausar from Maniknagar village in Titash upazila, and Ershad Mia from Kongshanagar village in Burichang upazila, were killed in a 'gunfight' with the Detective Branch of Police on the Batakandi-Asmania Road under Titash on July 27, according to the District Additional Superintendent of Police, Shakhawat Hossain.

data.name: Lalon Hawladar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Rajbari, Lalon Hawladar, 42, from Sujanagar upazila in Pabna and also a local leader of the Lal Pataka faction of the Purba Banglar Communist Party, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at the Sluice Gate area under Pangsha upazila in the district at around 4:00 am on July 27, according to Fazlul Karim, Senior Assistant Superintendent of Rajbari police.

data.name: Shahidul Islam Sabur
data.description: In Comilla, Shahidul Islam Sabur, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Sadar upazila. Major Ataur Rahman, a company commander of Rab-11, alleged that the shootout took place when a RAB team conducted a raid at the Gomti river dam area in Kaptanbazar around 4:00 am to arrest Sabur, who was accused in 27 drug-related cases. Sensing RAB's presence, Sabur and his cohorts opened fire. When RAB officials retaliated, Sabur was left with bullet wounds while the others fled. Sabur was rushed to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rezaul Islam
data.description: In Satkhira, a suspected mugger named Rezaul Islam, 42, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Shyamnagar upazila, two days after he was arrested in Dhaka. Ziaur Rahman, Inspector (Investigation) of Shyamnagar Police Station, stated that a team from Dhaka's Pallabi Police Station apprehended Rezaul on the night of July 26 in Dhaka and handed him over to Shyamnagar police on the afternoon of July 27. The gunfight occurred around 2:00 am when Shyamnagar police took Rezaul to the Khanpur area to apprehend the other members of his gang, according to Inspector Ziaur. Rezaul's accomplices opened fire on the law enforcement officers, resulting in the "gunfight" that left Rezaul injured. The others managed to escape. Rezaul was transported to a local hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Kajol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Barguna, Kajol, a suspected member of the robber gang 'Jahangir Bahini', was killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB-8 at a char of the River Baleshwar in Patharghata upazila around 5:30 am. RAB-8 members were engaged in the 'gunfight' when the law enforcers challenged a trawler in the river. The suspected robbers opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate by firing.

data.name: Sohrab Hossain
data.description: In Munshiganj's Srinagar upazila, Sohrab Hossain, a resident of the upazila and an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Mohitul Islam, a Company Commander of RAB-11, said that the "shootout" took place when a RAB team raided the Chhatrabhog area at around 4:30 am, after receiving information on a drug consignment handover. Sensing RAB's presence, the criminals opened fire at them. As they retaliated, Sohrab was left dead on the spot as the others fled, claimed Mohitul, who is also an Assistant Superintendent of Police.

data.name: Mukul
data.description: In Rajshahi, an alleged criminal was killed in a reported "gunfight" with the police in the Nobogonga area. Kashia Danga Police officials claimed that the deceased was identified as Mukul, 45. He was rushed to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, RAB said.

data.name: Rajon
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with members of RAB at Basila under Mohammadpur. The deceased, Rajon, 25, son of Shahabuddin of Ekhlaspur under Begumganj in Noakhali, used to live in a rented residence at Nabinagar housing area under Mohammadpur in the capital. The family members claimed that Rajon, who was a human-hauler driver, had been missing since May 29 when he was picked up by unidentified plain-clothed men. Dhaka Medical College Hospital officials said that Rajon, who had been shot, was brought dead to the hospital around 3:30 am. Rajon's wife, Surama Akhter, who came to DMCH with her father-in-law around noon, said that her husband was picked up by a group of plain-clothed men on May 29 evening and has been missing since then. She said that they later went to different law enforcement agencies, who denied her husband's detention. "My husband was a human hauler driver and often used to take hemp but was not a drug peddler. He was accused in five cases but was free on bail in all the cases," she claimed. She said that they came to DMCH after seeing television news of the death of a man named Rajon in a "gunfight" at Basila.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: RAB-5 Deputy Commander Major AM Ashraful Islam said that the suspected drug peddler, Abdur Rashid, was killed in a 'gunfight' with a team of RAB at Tarash village under Puthia upazila in the district at approximately 10:15 pm on July 31.

data.name: Kabil Hossain
data.description: In Natore, a suspected drug peddler named Kabil was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of RAB at Mahishbhanga under Baraigram in the district on July 31st, around 11:40 pm, according to a message from RAB's legal and media wing.

data.name: Mohammad Sujan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: An activist of the AL was shot dead and 50 others, including five cops, were injured in a clash between its two factions at Kanchan Bridge area of Rupganj. Police and locals said two AL factions — one loyal to Kayetpara union council chairman Rafiqul Islam and another loyal to local MP Gazi Golam Dastagir — took positions on a bridge at about 11:00 am to inhibit BNP leaders and activists from taking to the streets and tackle any possible unrest over the verdict on a corruption case against BNP chairperson and five others. But at one stage, members of the factions locked into an altercation and started fighting. To bring the situation under control, police opened fire and shot tear gas canisters. At least six people, including Sujon, were shot at that time. Later, the injured were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared Sujon dead at about 1:30 pm, said Sub-Inspector Bacchu Miah, in-charge of DMCH police outpost.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight between a gang of forest robbers and RAB in the Dakatir Khal area. The identity of the deceased could not be determined. RAB-8 Deputy Commanding Officer said a RAB patrol team was patrolling in the area at about 6:30 am when a suspected forest robber gang opened fire, targeting RAB personnel. RAB also retaliated by firing. The gunfight continued for about half an hour, and the suspected robbers fled. Later, the RAB team searched the area and found the body of a 25-year-old suspected forest robber, whom fishermen identified as a member of the "Gariber Bandhu" robber gang.

data.name: Mohammad Faruk
data.description: A wanted drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Chauddagram upazila, Comilla. Major Ataur Rahman, a Company Commander of RAB-11 in Comilla, said that a RAB team raided the Komalla Munshirhat College Road area to arrest drug dealers. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug dealers opened fire, prompting the RAB team to retaliate. At one stage, Faruk was shot. Faruk passed away while being taken to Comilla Medical College hospital. Family sources said that Faruk was a tea stall owner.

data.name: Abdul Malek
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, the deceased was Abdul Malek, 37, the son of Bashir Ahmed from Hoanak Panir Chhara under the upazila. Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das of Maheshkhali Police Station said that Malek's name was on the list of suspected criminals prepared by the police. OC Pradip said that a team of police raided the area when suspected drug peddlers opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate by firing at around 11:30 am. After the gunfight, he said they rescued Malek from the scene and sent him to Maheshkhali Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Altaf Hossain
data.description: In Chittagong, the police recovered the bullet-ridden body of Altaf Hossain, the vice-president of the Mariamnagar union unit of the Awami League. He was from the village of Mariamnagar in Rangunia, along the Chittagong-Kaptai road in the Rangunia upazila. The incident occurred around 10:00 am. Imtiaz Mohammad Ehsanul Quader, the Officer-in-Charge of the Rangunia Police Station, stated that Altaf was wanted in 11 cases and his name was included in the list of drug peddlers prepared by the home ministry.

data.name: Mohammad Nizam Uddin
data.description: Two alleged drug traders were killed in a "gunfight" with law enforcement in Cox's Bazar. According to RAB sources, RAB-7 set up a checkpoint on Cox's Bazar-Chittagong Highway in Ramu upazila's Paner Chhara Bazar area. Maj Md Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7, said that when the RAB team signaled for a fuel truck to pull over, its passengers opened fire on law enforcement around 7:00 am. The elite force fired retaliatory shots, triggering the "gunfight". When the shooting stopped after a while, the RAB officers found two men with bullet wounds in the vehicle. The duo was rushed to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Ratan Rudra
data.description: Two alleged drug traders were killed in a "gunfight" with law enforcement in Cox's Bazar. According to RAB sources, RAB-7 set up a checkpoint on Cox's Bazar-Chittagong Highway in Ramu upazila's Paner Chhara Bazar area. Maj Md Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7, said that when the RAB team signaled for a fuel truck to pull over, its passengers opened fire on law enforcement around 7:00 am. The elite force fired retaliatory shots, triggering the "gunfight". When the shooting stopped after a while, the RAB officers found two men with bullet wounds in the vehicle. The duo was rushed to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Majharul Haq Swapan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: In the capital city, Majharul Haq Swapan, also known as "Killer Swapan," was killed in a "crossfire." The incident took place on the night of August 13 in the Khilgaon Nagdarpar area of the city. The Metropolitan police have informed that Swapan was killed in a gunfight with the Detective Branch (DB). According to sources within the Detective Police, on the night of August 13, the DB's East Division's Khilgaon zonal team went to the Rampura and Khilgaon area for a special operation. At that time, they received information while stationed in Khilgaon Meradia Bazar that a group of terrorists was preparing to carry out activities in the Nagdarpar area near the Rampura Demra Staff Quarter Road. Based on this information, the detective police team reached the scene at approximately 3:25 a.m. At this time, seven or eight agitated terrorists noticed the presence of the police and began firing. The police returned fire in self-defense. Advancing on the scene, the police rescued one individual in a bullet-hit condition and rushed him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Upon arrival, the emergency department's on-duty doctor declared him dead. Later on, the police investigation revealed the identity of the deceased. His name was Majharul Haq Swapan, known as "Killer Swapan.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Koyra upazila of the Khulna range of the Sundarbans. Twenty-three kidnapped fishermen were rescued, and seven boats were recovered during the operation on the Marcory Bawan canal of the Shibsha river, said Wing Commander Hasan Emon Al-Razib, the Commanding Officer of RAB-6. Acting on the information received, a team from RAB-6 launched an operation in the early hours of August 15 and successfully rescued the kidnapped fishermen. As the robbers opened fire, the law enforcers retaliated in self-defense, resulting in the death of the robber on the spot. The identity of the deceased could not be determined.

data.name: Mohammad Khairul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police near Kochamari Bridge in Gabtoli upazila. He was accused in four robbery cases, said Md Khairul Bashar, officer-in-charge of Gabtoli Police Station. A gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery by felling trees on Pirgachha road in the area around 2:30 am. At the time, a patrol team of police went to the area. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, forcing the police to fire back, which triggered a gunfight, said the OC. Police later rescued bullet-hit Khairul from the spot and sent him to Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital where he died around 6:30 am. Khairul sustained bullet injuries in his right leg. Meanwhile, the cohorts of Khairul managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Mostaque Ahmed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed at Meherghona Reserved Forest in Cox's Bazar on August 17. Cox's Bazar Divisional Forest Officer (North), Hoque Mahabob Morsed, said a group of local forest robbers had been cutting timber from Meherghona forest. Forest officials, upon receiving information, raided the area to apprehend the timber robbers. He added that the timber robbers opened fire on the forest officials, prompting them to retaliate in self-defense. The gunfight lasted for approximately half an hour, and later, the timber robbers attacked the forest officials with knives and locally made cleavers. During the gunfight, one timber robber was killed by a bullet.

data.name: Mohammad Mamun Morshed
data.description: RAB-7 Crime Prevention Company-1 Commander Safayet Fahim Jamil said that following a tip-off, a temporary checkpoint was set up by the RAB at Mahipal and the BSCIC area in Feni on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway. At about 4 AM, a speeding motorcycle crossed the Mahipal checkpoint when the RAB chased the riders, who opened fire while crossing the checkpoint at the BSCIC area. The RAB retaliated and chased them. As the firing stopped, Safayet claimed that the RAB rescued two men who had been hit by bullets and took them to Feni District Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Md Al-Amin
data.description: RAB-7 Crime Prevention Company-1 Commander Safayet Fahim Jamil said that following a tip-off, a temporary checkpoint was set up by the RAB at Mahipal and the BSCIC area in Feni on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway. At about 4 AM, a speeding motorcycle crossed the Mahipal checkpoint when the RAB chased the riders, who opened fire while crossing the checkpoint at the BSCIC area. The RAB retaliated and chased them. As the firing stopped, Safayet claimed that the RAB rescued two men who had been hit by bullets and took them to Feni District Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Azizur Rahman Azad
data.description: Teknaf-1 RAB camp in-charge Mehedi Hasan reported that RAB personnel, acting on secret information, set up two temporary checkpoints on the Teknaf-Cox's Bazar road - one near the Palli Bidyut office and the other near the upazila parishad. He said that the gunfight occurred when a microbus carrying five or six people sped past the Palli Bidyut office checkpoint, disregarding RAB signals, and opened fire. The RAB personnel retaliated by firing back. The microbus caught fire during the gunfight. RAB also discovered that Azizur had been hit by a bullet and took him to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A man arrested on robbery charges was killed in what police claimed to be a gunfight between officers and the man's accomplices in the village of Pattashi, Indurkani upazila in Pirojpur. Officer-in-charge Nasir Uddin of Indurkani Police Station stated that they arrested Zakir in Khulna on August 24 in connection with a case filed over a robbery incident that took place at five houses in the village of Ramchandrapur in Indurkani in January. Based on information obtained from Zakir, the police conducted a raid in the village of Pattashi to recover weapons and apprehend his accomplices. The OC mentioned that as they arrived in the village at approximately 2:20 am, Zakir's cohorts opened fire on the police, leading the police to retaliate with gunfire. "At one point, Zakir attempted to escape and was caught in a confrontation." He added that they immediately took Zakir to the Indurkani Upazila Health Complex, where the on-duty doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Bhadu Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police on the bank of the river Garai at Alankarpur village under Baliakandi upazila in Rajbari. Hasina Begum, Officer-in-Charge of Baliakandi Police Station, said that upon receiving information about a group of robbers gathering on the bank of the river Garai to commit robbery, a police team conducted a raid in the area. Sensing the presence of the police, she claimed that the suspected robbers opened fire on them, forcing the police to retaliate and triggering the gunfight at approximately 2:30 am. After the "gunfight" ended, she said that they found Bhadu Sheikh critically injured from bullet wounds at the scene and took him to Baliakandi Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Meher Ali
data.description: In Natore, Meher Ali was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in Lalpur upazila. The "shootout" took place around 2:15 am when RAB members challenged a group of people in the Chamtia area and came under fire. The RAB men retaliated, triggering a gunfight that left Meher injured, according to Maj Shiblee Mostofa, a Company Commander of RAB in Natore. He was quickly taken to Lalpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sharif Hossain Khan
data.description: In Gazipur, Sharif was killed in a reported gunfight with members of RAB in the Protyasha Math area of Tongi. The elite force gave an identical narrative of the "shootout" -- they opened fire on the grounds of self-defense after coming under attack by a group of suspected drug dealers, said Ishtiaque Ahmed, a Deputy Director of RAB-1.

data.name: Mohammad Rafiqul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion at Majher Char in the Baleshwar River under Patharghata upazila. According to Officer-in-Charge Molla Mohammad Khabir Hossain of Patharghata Police Station, Rafiq was a member of 'Noa Bahini', a gang that committed robberies and illegally collected tolls from fishermen in the Baleshwar River and the adjacent areas. RAB officials said the 'gunfight' occurred at Majher Char, also under the Sarankhola range of the Sunderbans, when members of Noa Bahini opened fire on the RAB men while they were on regular patrol.

data.name: Mohammad Farid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected forest robber was killed in what the police claimed was a gunfight between a team of river police and suspected robbers at Katiarkhal in the Sunderbans east division under Sarankhola in Bagerhat. Sarankhola Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Md Kabirul Islam, said a team from the river police's Dhansagar outpost, acting on a tip-off that the members of the forest robber gang 'Chhoto Bahini' had abducted six fishermen for ransom, conducted a raid at Katiarkhal in the Sunderbans at about 2:30 am. He said the team, suspicious of a boat, signaled it to stop, but the boat ignored the signal and the suspected robbers from the boat opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate by firing. The OC claimed that Farid was shot and died on the spot, while his associates managed to escape by jumping into the river and swimming ashore.

data.name: Abdul Matin Mondal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Fazlul Karim, Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police at Pangsha circle of Rajbari, said, "After receiving secret information, a team of police conducted a raid at Alokdanga village where a group of outlaws were holding a secret meeting around 2:30 am on September 2. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the gang opened fire and the policemen retaliated, triggering a gunfight. Abdul Matin was caught in the crossfire, and his body was recovered after his cohorts fled the scene. Police rushed him to Pangsha Upazila Health Complex where an on-duty doctor declared him dead around 3:30 am.

data.name: Rubel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and a gang in Savar. The deceased was identified as Rubel, 26, from Tangail. Abul Kalam Azad, Sub-Inspector of Ashulia Police Station, said the police were on the lookout for the gang since a highway robbery on the night of February 12. The DB police arrested Rubel, the prime accused in the robbery case, from the Kobirpur area around 9:30 pm. Based on Rubel's confessional statement, a team from Ashulia Police Station and the Detective Branch of Police (Dhaka North) jointly launched a drive in Ashulia's Tongabari area around 3:00 am to arrest the other gang members. They took Rubel along with them. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Rubel was caught in the line of fire. The other gang members managed to flee. He was taken to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: The main accused in a case filed for raping an eight-year-old girl was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Jessore town. Major Ziaur Rahman, Commander of RAB-6 in Jessore, said around 3:45 am, a RAB team raided the Kholadanga Mandalgati area on information that some criminals were holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the RAB members' presence, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. After the gun battle, RAB members found Al Amin lying on the spot with bullet wounds. He was rushed to Jessore Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Suman Pahar
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the DB police at Chhoygaon village. Based on a tip-off that a group of drug peddlers had gathered for a meeting at an orchard in the village, a DB team conducted an anti-drug drive there around 2:30 am, said OC of the DB branch of Shariatpur Police, Mohammad Azhar Ali. When the DB team arrived at the spot, the alleged drug peddlers hurled crude bombs and opened fire on them, forcing the police to retaliate. After the gunfight that followed, the peddlers fled the scene, and the officer claimed that they found Suman injured on the scene with bullet wounds. Suman was taken to Shariatpur Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead. Suman's brother, Rajon Pahar, alleged that some plainclothes men picked up Suman along with two other villagers in front of a shop in their village on August 31st evening. Although the two others were sent to jail, they did not receive any information about Suman.

data.name: Lal Suman
data.description: A team of RAB-7 conducted a raid in the Sultanpur Kabiraj pond area around 10:00 pm, acting on information that some drug traders had gathered there to sell drugs. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, prompting the officials to retaliate, according to RAB officials. Lal Suman was injured during the gunfight while the others managed to flee. RAB took him to Feni Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Raju Prodhan
data.description: Major Manjur Mahede, a Company Commander of RAB-1, said that a RAB team went to the 300 feet road area in Rupganj after receiving information that a gang of muggers had gathered there. Sensing the presence of the RAB team, the muggers opened fire. The RAB team retaliated in self-defense. After the exchange of fire stopped, RAB informed the local police, who took Raju to Rupnagar Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Kabir Hossain
data.description: Squadron Leader Shafayat Jamil Fahim of RAB-7 stated that Kabir was killed in a gunfight with RAB members at the Lemua area on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway in Feni on September 5th at approximately 4:00 am.

data.name: Mobarak Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Narayanganj, Mobarak Hossain, 35, allegedly a member of an inter-district robbery gang, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police around 4:30 am at Songargaon upazila. Officer-in-Charge of Sonargaon Police Station, Morshed Alam, said that acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was about to rob vehicles on the highway, the police conducted a raid at the spot. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. During the gunfight, the police arrested six robbers, including a bullet-hit Mobarak. Later, Mobarak was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Apan Ceasar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Caesar was killed in a gunfight with the police around 2:30 am in the Matidali area. Sonaton Chakroborty, Additional Superintendent of Police of Bogra Sadar Circle, received information that a gang was preparing to commit a robbery. As a result, a police team raided the Matidali area of the town. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, prompting the police to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight. Caesar, the leader of the gang, was hit by a bullet during the exchange of fire. Subsequently, the police took him to the Bogra Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital around 3:00 am, where the doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Shamim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two members of the banned extremist outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh, who were also suspected of being the killers of secular writer and publisher Shahzahan Bachchu, were killed in a 'gunfight' at a police checkpoint on KC Road in the Satgaon area of Srinagar upazila in Munshiganj. Munshiganj Superintendent of Police Zayedul Alam claimed that some members of the old faction of JMB had come to the area to commit robbery in order to collect money for their organization. The police claimed that, including the duo, three suspected JMB operatives who were wanted in the Shahzahan Bachchu murder case, were killed in 'gunfights'. SP Zayedul claimed that around 1:00 am on September 7, the police attempted to stop two motorcycles carrying four people at a temporary checkpoint set up on KC Das Road in Srinagar. The motorcyclists, disregarding the police signal, threw crude bombs at the police and also opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate, he said. He added that the two were caught in the crossfire and died on the spot, while the others managed to escape.

data.name: Ekhlasur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two members of the banned extremist outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh, who were also suspected of being the killers of secular writer and publisher Shahzahan Bachchu, were killed in a 'gunfight' at a police checkpoint on KC Road in the Satgaon area of Srinagar upazila in Munshiganj. Munshiganj Superintendent of Police Zayedul Alam claimed that some members of the old faction of JMB had come to the area to commit robbery in order to collect money for their organization. The police claimed that, including the duo, three suspected JMB operatives who were wanted in the Shahzahan Bachchu murder case, were killed in 'gunfights'. SP Zayedul claimed that around 1:00 am on September 7, the police attempted to stop two motorcycles carrying four people at a temporary checkpoint set up on KC Das Road in Srinagar. The motorcyclists, disregarding the police signal, threw crude bombs at the police and also opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate, he said. He added that the two were caught in the crossfire and died on the spot, while the others managed to escape.

data.name: Mohammad Abul Hossain
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion at Namotomla in Gomostapur upazila of Chapainawabganj. The victim's father, Alam Sheikh, however, alleged that his son had been picked up by unidentified people in plainclothes on September 6th afternoon at Rahanpur bus stand while he was returning home from Chapainawabganj after appearing before a court in a case. Acting on a tip-off that a group of 'drug peddlers' had gathered at a mango orchard in village Namotomla to trade drugs, a RAB team conducted a raid there around 12:30 am. Sensing the presence of the RAB team, the 'drug peddlers' opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight ended, the RAB rescued Babu, who had been shot, and rushed him to Gomostapur Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jasim Uddin Iqbal
data.description: Abu Bakar Siddique, Officer-in-Charge of Kapasia Police Station, said a patrol team led by SI Sumon heard gunshots while on duty in the Bhulesshor Netartek forest area on September 7, 2018, and found a bullet-hit body. The area is approximately 60 km away from Jasim's house. The OC said they did not know Jasim and therefore could not immediately identify the body. "We suspect that he was killed during a clash between two criminal groups," the OC said, adding that they sent the body to Kapasia Upazila Health Complex where the duty doctor declared him dead. Kapasia Union Parishad member Abdul Motaleb said the police called him over the phone around 3:30 am and asked him to go to the spot where he found a blood-stained body and a pistol. Jasim's wife, Happy Akhtar Chhaya, claimed that a sub-inspector (SI) of Mouchak police outpost in Kaliakoir called her husband out on September 7th afternoon. SI Saiful Islam, who was acquainted with her husband, called Jasim to show him his new car, Chhaya claimed. SI Rezaul Karim of the Detective Branch (DB) of Police was with Saiful at that time. She further said that she spoke to SI Saiful over the phone twice that night and offered "whatever they want" to speak to her husband. When contacted, SI Saiful denied the allegation of calling Jasim out of the home.

data.name: Barek Majhi
data.description: In Chandpur, Barek Majhi was killed in a gunfight with the police. Mizanur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Shahrasti Model Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, a team of police was patrolling the Shorshak area in Suchipara union of the upazila at around 2:30 am. When the "drug dealers" attacked them, the police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight" that left one of the criminals dead. The body of the "drug dealer" was kept at Chandpur Sadar Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Manik
data.description: In Rajshahi, Manik, 30, from Natun Para in Charghat upazila, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Muktarpur village. After receiving a tip-off about a group of drug traders gathered in the area, a police team conducted a raid there at around 2:45 am, said Nazrul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Charghat Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate. During the exchange of fire, Manik was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. He was taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Narayanganj, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with the police at Bandar upazila. The police claimed that he was accused in several cases filed with different police stations in Narayanganj and other districts. Bandar police OC Shaheen Mondal said 15-16 robbers were preparing to commit a robbery in the Sonachara Ramnagar area around 3:30 am. Upon receiving information, the police raided the area and came under fire. The police also retaliated. At one stage, the robbers fled, leaving behind Ibrahim, who had been hit by a bullet. He was declared dead at the Bandar Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Mohammad Dulal Mia
data.description: Alleged drug peddler Mohammad Dulal Mia was killed in a reported shootout between the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and drug peddlers in Rajshahi's Mohonpur upazila, according to Abul Kashem, Officer-in-Charge of Mohonpur police. Dulal was well-known as a wholesaler of different kinds of drugs and had been on the run since the crackdown on drugs began. The RAB-5, in a press release, stated that the "shootout" occurred at Dhuroil intersection in the upazila around 1:00 am when approximately six suspected individuals opened fire on the elite force pursuing them. The RAB retaliated and, after a five-minute shootout, found Dulal injured. He was pronounced dead at Mohonpur Health Complex.

data.name: Shawkat Ali
data.description: Shawkat was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Rangpur city. Upon receiving information, a team from RAB-13 in Rangpur conducted a raid in the area around 3:00 am, as stated by Moktarul Alam, Officer-in-Charge (acting) of Rangpur Sadar Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement officers, the drug peddlers opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, resulting in the "gunfight". During the exchange of gunfire, Shawkat was struck by bullets and died instantly, while others managed to escape.

data.name: Azizul Haque
data.description: Police found the bullet-ridden bodies of two siblings, who went missing after going to the village market, in two different locations in Jessore on September 16, according to the police and their family members. Azizul's body, with bullet wounds, was discovered in a garden in their native village, Samta, while Faruk's body was found in the village of Dharmapur under Keshabpur upazila in Jessore. Shahidul Islam, the youngest brother of the victims, stated that his two elder brothers went to the village market, Samta Bazar, on September 15 at around 7:00 pm and did not return. He said, "We searched for them everywhere on the night of September 15 but couldn't find them. Later, on the morning of September 16, I came to the hospital to look for them in case they had been in an accident and found out that their bodies had been brought in by the police." He added, "Although there were allegations of minor crimes against my brothers many years ago, they were leading a normal life now and earned their livelihood through farming." Sharsha police station officer-in-charge Moshiur Rahman stated that the police recovered Azizul Haque's body with bullet wounds from a garden in Samta village around 9:00 am on September 16. Sub-inspector Abdur Rahim Hawlader, in-charge of Bagabchra police outpost, described Azizul as a drug peddler and suggested that he might have been killed in a gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers at night. He claimed that Azizul was wanted by the police in at least seven cases.

Azizul's body, with bullet wounds, was discovered in a garden in their native village, Samta, while Faruk's body was found in the village of Dharmapur under Keshabpur upazila in Jessore. He claimed that Azizul was wanted by the police in at least seven cases.

data.name: Sirajul Islam
data.description: Sirajul Islam, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in the Katashkol Ikkhu Centre area of Boraigram. Acting on a tip-off that a gang of drug traders had gathered in the area, a team of RAB members conducted a raid there around 1:30 am, according to a RAB press release. When the elite force asked them to surrender, the gang members tried to flee the scene, firing gunshots at them, which triggered a gun battle. After a brief exchange of gunfire, the RAB team found Sirajul lying on the ground after being hit by bullets. He was then taken to the upazila health complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdus Samad
data.description: RAB officials said that suspected drug peddlers Abdus Samad and Mohammad Abu Hanif were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB at the Mariccha Bazar RAB Check Point at about 2:30 AM. RAB-7 Cox's Bazar Camp Company Commander Major Md Mehedi Hassan said that the gunfight took place after they gave a signal to a Cox's Bazar-bound truck to stop, but the driver tried to flee by firing on RAB men who retaliated.

data.name: Mohammad Abu Hanif
data.description: RAB officials said that suspected drug peddlers Abdus Samad and Mohammad Abu Hanif were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB at the Mariccha Bazar RAB Check Point at about 2:30 AM. RAB-7 Cox's Bazar Camp Company Commander Major Md Mehedi Hassan said that the gunfight took place after they gave a signal to a Cox's Bazar-bound truck to stop, but the driver tried to flee by firing on RAB men who retaliated.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In the capital, two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Saiful Malik, the operations officer of RAB-2, claimed that based on a tip-off that a group of robbers had gathered in the city's Rayerbazar area, one of their patrol teams raided the place around 3:00 am, resulting in the gunfight. The identity of the deceased could not be known.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In the capital, two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Saiful Malik, the operations officer of RAB-2, claimed that based on a tip-off that a group of robbers had gathered in the city's Rayerbazar area, one of their patrol teams raided the place around 3:00 am, resulting in the gunfight. The identity of the deceased could not be known.

data.name: Kurban Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Pabna, a suspected regional leader of the banned Naxal Bahini, Kurban Ali, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the police. Masud Rana, the Officer-in-Charge of Ataikula Police Station, stated that Kurban was killed in a shootout at Koujuri village, located in the Atghoria upazila of Pabna. According to the OC, the police raided Koujuri village after receiving a tip-off that the Naxal Bahini members were holding a meeting there. The OC mentioned that when the police approached the cremation ground in the village, the Naxal men opened fire, forcing the police to retaliate. Kurban was found lying on the ground, having been hit by a bullet, while his associates managed to escape. Kurban was then taken to the Atghoria Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Farid Mia
data.description: Farid Mia, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion near Tant Jute Mills at Shimrail in Siddhirganj, Narayanganj. RAB-11 Senior Assistant Director Alep Uddin said that a battalion team, acting on information that a group of drug peddlers had gathered near Tant Jute Mills, raided the area. Sensing the presence of battalion personnel, the suspects opened fire on them, and the battalion retaliated by firing back. After the 'gunfight' ended, they found Farid critically injured and rushed him to Narayanganj Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shahidul Islam Tapan
data.description: Police said Shahidul Islam Tapan, also known as Tera Tapan, was a suspected drug trader who was killed in a "gunfight" between two groups of drug traders in the Bablatola area of Jessore town. Acting on information about the gunfight, a police team raided the area at around 3:00 am, according to Naimur Rahman, Assistant Superintendent of Jessore Sadar Circle police. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the drug traders managed to escape, and the law enforcement officers discovered Tapan's body with bullet wounds at the scene, he added. The deceased's brother, Sajjadul Islam, stated that Tapan had been missing since the evening of September 20th, and he found his body at the hospital morgue. He further disputed the police statement, claiming that his brother led a normal life, was not involved in any criminal activities, and worked as a government contractor.

data.name: Mohammad Anwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Anwar Hossain, a suspected robber, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Baishari brickfield area of Naikhongchhari upazila. Anwar Hossain was the Second-in-Command of a notorious gang of robbers. The Officer-in-Charge of Naikhongchhari Police Station, Sheikh Mohammad Alamgir, said they conducted a raid in the area based on information that robbers were gathering there. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on the police, who retaliated, resulting in a gunfight. Anwar was shot dead on the spot.

data.name: Asadul
data.description: Asadul was killed in "gunfights" with RAB-2 at the Mirpur Beribandh area. The "shootout" took place around 3:00 am when an RAB-2 team raided the area based on information that some "drug peddlers" were holding a meeting there, said Saiful Malik, Operations Officer of the said team. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". Asadul was hit by bullets, he said. The injured was rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. Asadul's mother, Tahmina Begum, said that on August 21 at around 10 pm, some plainclothes men picked him up from Agargaon BNP Bazar when he was going to the Cattle market. During that time, local people rushed to the spot. Then the plainclothes men identified themselves as RAB. Later, they took him by a CNG-run auto-rickshaw.

data.name: Alim Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Madaripur, an alleged robber was killed in what the police claimed was a shootout in the Shirkhara area. Subrato Kumar Halder, Superintendent of Madaripur police, gave almost similar narratives of the gunfight and said that the bullet-hit Alim was declared dead after being taken to Madaripur Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Malek Abdul
data.description: Malek Abdul, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Mithul Islam, Assistant Director of RAB-11, said that after receiving a tip-off about a group of drug peddlers gathering in the area, a RAB-11 team conducted a raid there around 3:45 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, four to five members of the gang opened fire, forcing the elite force members to retaliate. After the alleged shootout, RAB officials found Malek with bullet wounds and took him to Munshiganj General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohamamd Sabuj
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mohammad Sabuj, a suspected robber, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Kattoli Beribadh in the Pahartoli area. After receiving a tip-off that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery, a team of police conducted a raid in the area around 3:30 am, according to Sadip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Pahartoli Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang opened fire on the police, prompting them to fire back in self-defense. Eventually, the police recovered Sabuj's body from the scene.

data.name: Mohammad Sabuj
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Sabuj, a suspected robber, was killed in a gunfight between a group of robbers and the police in the Uttar Kattoli embankment area. Officer-in-Charge (OC) Sadip Kumar Das of Pahartoli Police Station said that the gunfight took place around 12:45 am when the police went to the Uttar Kattoli beribadh area of Pahartoli to arrest a group of armed robbers who were preparing to commit robbery. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire and pelted stones, and the police retaliated with gunfire, the OC claimed. He added that they found the bullet-hit body of Sabuj while the other robbers managed to flee.

data.name: Pavel Sheikh
data.description: Pavel Sheikh was allegedly tortured to death by police in the Ananda Bazar area of Zanjira upazila in Shariatpur. The victim's family members alleged that Pavel and his cousin Shanta Sheikh were standing by a road in the marketplace area when a police team approached them. A policeman got out of the police vehicle and started checking Pavel's trouser pockets. At one point, the policeman began beating Pavel until he collapsed onto the ground. The police team then took the college boy to Shariatpur Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. Denying the allegation, Md Belayet Hossain, officer-in-charge of Zanjira police station, said that the police did not beat Pavel. "Pavel was an epilepsy patient, which might have been the reason behind his death," he said. The police superintendent of the district, Abdul Momen, also denied the allegation, stating that the police had tried to check Pavel's pockets when he collapsed and died.

data.name: Hasibul Hossain
data.description: Hasibul Hossain, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of RAB. According to a RAB-5 official, Hasibul was critically injured in a 'gunfight' with a RAB patrol team in an orchard at Afi Nepalpara at about 12:45 am and was taken to Mohonpur Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shafiuddin Mina
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Suspected robber Shafiuddin Mina was killed in a "gunfight" between two groups of robbers in Bakria, Jhenaidah, early Saturday, according to the police. Mina, in his forties, from Charkol village in Sadar Upazila, was named in at least five cases filed with different police stations in Jhenaidah. Emdadul Haque Sheikh, the officer-in-charge of Jhenaidah Sadar police station, stated that they received information about two gangs of robbers engaging in a "gunfight" over the distribution of stolen goods in the Bakria area around 2:30 am. The police raided the area, but the robbers fled upon sensing their presence. The police discovered Mina's body and seized a gun, two cartridges, and one crude bomb. The body was sent to Jhenaidah Sadar Hospital morgue for a postmortem examination.

data.name: Ali Nur
data.description: In Narayanganj, a suspected drug peddler named Ali Nur, 50, from Bari Majlish under Sonargaon in the district, was killed in a gunfight with the police at Chilarbag area of the upazila during an anti-drug operation at about 5:00 am, according to Narayanganj Assistant Superintendent of Police, Faruque Hossain.

data.name: Mohammad Imran
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, a suspected drug peddler named Mohammad Imran from Hnila in the district was killed in a 'gunfight' between his associates and the police at Dargabeel area under Teknaf upazila in the district at around 5:00 am, according to Teknaf Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ranjit Kumar Barua. OC Ranjit claimed that the 'gunfight' between Imran's associates and the police occurred when the police raided the Dargabeel area with Imran, who was arrested on the night of September 29, to recover drugs and apprehend his associates.

data.name: Mahmudul Karim
data.description: Maheshkhali police station OC Pradip Kumar Das said that suspected drug peddler and crimes suspect Mahmudul Karim, 37, of Dakhkhinkul under Maheshkhali upazila in Cox's Bazar, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police during an anti-drug drive in Shaplar Doba area of the upazila at about 5:00 am.

data.name: Abul Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Abul Hossain, an outlawed party leader, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Goutam Kumar Biswas, Additional Superintendent of Pabna police, said that acting on a tip-off, the police arrested Abul from his village on 30 September. During interrogation, Abu informed the police about their arms den. According to his statement, a police team took him to the Dhopaghata area to recover firearms and explosives around 3:00 am on 1 October. When the team reached near the Dhopaghata bridge, Abul's associates opened fire. The police returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Abul attempted to flee and was hit by bullets. The others managed to escape, the additional SP said, adding that Abul was taken to Pabna General Hospital where he later died.

data.name: Shafayat Tamrin
data.description: One of the three individuals detained following the murder of a Jubo League activist in Badda was killed in a "shootout" between DB police and "criminals" in the capital's Aftabnagar area. At around 9:30 pm, Shafayat, along with two accomplices, allegedly entered the Badda Jagoroni Club premises and shot Abdur Razzak, also known as Babu, who was 30 years old and the owner of Max Cable, a cable TV service provider. Babu was also an activist of Badda Jubo League. The two accomplices, Ovi and Helal, managed to escape arrest by blending in with the general public that night, according to Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (North Division) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. Mashiur stated that the gunfight, which resulted in Shafayat's death, occurred around 4:00 am in Aftabnagar when a team from the Detective Branch took him along on a drive to apprehend the other perpetrators, including Ovi and Helal. He explained that the criminals opened fire on the DB officials, who then retaliated. Shafayat was injured by a bullet while attempting to flee during the gunfight. After being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital by the police, doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mirajul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mirajul Islam, a leader of the outlawed PBCP Red Flag faction, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Gobindohuda village in Damurhuda upazila. Akram Hossain, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Damurhuda Police Station, said that a team from the police station arrested Mirajul with a firearm at his village home. Following information obtained from him, the police took him with them in a raid to recover a cache of arms at a hideout in Gobindohuda of the upazila. His cohorts fired at the police near Gobindohuda Eidgah ground around 2:00 am, prompting the police to retaliate. At one stage of the gunfight, Mirajul's cohorts fled, leaving his body behind.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with the DB Police. Iftekhar Alam, Assistant Commissioner (AC) of Rajshahi Metropolitan Police, said that the "gunfight" occurred around 1:45 am when a team of DB police challenged a group of "drug peddlers" in the area, and they opened fire on the law enforcers. Alamgir was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. He was declared dead at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Makbul Hossain
data.description: An alleged drug trader was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Lohajang upazila of Munshiganj. The deceased was Makbul Hossain, 36, from Uttar Medenimondal area of the upazila. Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP) Mahitul Islam of RAB-11 said that acting on a tip-off, one of their teams carried out a raid in Purbakumarbhog area around 4:00 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, a group of drug peddlers opened fire on them. The RAB members retaliated by firing back, resulting in a "gunfight". After the "gunfight", the RAB team found Makbul's body at the scene.

data.name: Ziaul Bashir Shaheen
data.description: According to family members, Shaheen was picked up in a microbus by a group of people who claimed to be law enforcers from a local mosque where he went to pray Jum'a prayers on 9 November. Some locals said they saw Shaheen being picked up by plainclothes men. He had been missing since then. However, Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station, said, "Shaheen was killed in a tripartite gun battle in Dorgapara area." According to the OC, a police team rushed to the spot following a tip-off that said two groups of drug peddlers had been locked in a gunfight in Dorgapara area. Sensing police presence, the drug traders opened fire at the law enforcers. Shaheen died on the spot during the "gunfight.

data.name: Asim Roy Babu
data.description: Mimtanur Rahman, Senior Assistant Director of RAB-7 (Media Wing), said that a RAB team had received a tip-off that drug peddlers would be crossing the Bibirhat Railway Gate area in Muradpur. As the team signaled a car to pull over at a temporary checkpoint in the area, its passengers opened fire on the RAB men. Members of the elite force fired back, resulting in a "gunfight". The shooting ended after some time, and the RAB team found Asim, who had been hit by bullets, lying injured at the scene. He was then sent to Chittagong Medical College Hospital (CMCH), where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sharif Ahmed
data.description: Shah Kamal Akanda, Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch of the police in Mymensingh, said that on receiving information about a group of drug dealers conducting business in the Kalibari area, a DB team led by him went there around 1:00 am. Sensing their presence, the group opened fire, and when they retaliated, Sharif received bullet wounds. He was declared dead at Mymensingh Medical College Hospital. Sharif's mother, Shirin Akhter, said Sharif went out with some friends after Juma prayers on the afternoon of October 12. She said, "My son was never involved in the drug business. In the evening, locals informed us that some people in plainclothes picked him up in a black microbus in front of Palika Shopping Centre in the Station Road area." Sharmin Akhter, his elder sister, said they immediately went to Kotwali Police Station and the DB office to find out his whereabouts. Sharif used to co-run a dry goods business with his elder brother. When asked, OC Shah Kamal Akanda of the DB police denied any incident of Sharif being "picked up".

data.name: Farhad Sharif
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A Purbo Banglar Communist Party (PBCP) leader was killed in a so-called gunfight with Rab in Tangail Sadar upazila. The deceased was identified as Sharif alias Farhad, 33, son of the late Chan Miah of the upazila. Major Rabiul Islam, a company commander of Rab-12, said the incident took place at Dainna Chowdhury Madhyapara area around 2:00 am when criminals opened fire at Rab men who retaliated, leaving Sharif with bullet wounds. He was taken to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead, Maj Rabiul said, adding that they recovered a pistol and four bullets from the spot. Sharif was the regional commander of PBCP (ML/Red Flag) and was accused in five criminal cases, including robbery and murder, according to Rab sources.

data.name: Sabbir Hossain Payel
data.description: In the incident in Mymensingh, the deceased was identified as Sabbir Hossain Payel, 26, who was accused in 11 cases, mostly related to drugs, according to police sources. Shah Kamal Akanda, the officer-in-charge (OC) of the detective branch of police (DB) in Mymensingh, said the shootout occurred when a police team, acting on information about an ongoing drug trade, raided the Purahitpara area in Mymensingh town around 1:15 am. As the police arrived in the area, the drug dealers sensed their presence and began shooting at the law enforcers. When the police retaliated, one of the criminals was left with bullet wounds while the others fled, he added. Payel was rushed to a local hospital where he was declared dead. Sources from Payel's family said he was sent to jail in a drug case around one and a half years ago and was bailed out on September 25 of this year. Police claimed to have recovered 100 yaba pills and 100 grams of heroin from the scene. Payel's family alleged that the police had picked up Payel earlier and fabricated the story of a shootout after killing him. However, the police denied the allegations. Payel's family has also claimed that Payel was not a drug dealer but was once addicted to drugs. "My son was never involved in drug dealing, but he used to take drugs before," said Payel's mother, Parul Begum. Parul said she learned from local witnesses about plainclothes men picking up her son from the Digarkanda bypass area on Sunday afternoon. Earlier in May, Payel's cousin, Rajon Mia, was killed in a similar "shootout" with the police, his family said, adding that they demand a fair investigation into the killing.

data.name: Mohammad Jahid
data.description: The OC of Kotwali Police Station stated that the police discovered the body of Mohammad Jahid, son of Abdul Mamman, with bullet holes after a supposed 'gunfight' in Mandalgati, Jessore, at approximately 3:30 am on October 16th. Apurba Hasan, the Officer-in-Charge of Jessore Kotwali Police Station, mentioned that the police confiscated some drugs from the scene. Sohel, the deceased's brother, claimed that his brother was taken by undercover police officers from a business establishment near Jessore Railway Station at around 9:00 pm on October 15th. However, the Kotwali OC denied the accusation.

data.name: Jahid Hassan
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station said they raided Mangalgati village. Jahid Hassan, son of Hannan Mollah, was killed in a gunfight around 3:30 am.

data.name: Billu Parvez
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight at Bablatala of Shankarpur. Apurba Hasan, the Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police, said that the police recovered the body of Billu, who had been shot, after a gunfight between two groups of criminals around 3:45 am. Acting on a tip-off, the police went to the scene and found the victim. They then took him to Jessore General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. However, the victim's family alleged that Billu had been taken from Sonaganda in Khulna town on the night of October 17 by some plainclothes policemen. The police denied the accusation.

data.name: Abu Bakka
data.description: In Jessore, police said Abu Bakka (35) was shot dead during an exchange of fire between two groups of drug dealers in the Choto Achra area of Benapole. However, his wife Safia Khatun said that Bakka was picked up from Jessore town on October 17th by a group of men in plainclothes claiming to be police. However, the police said they did not detain him.

data.name: Tipu Sheikh
data.description: In Pabna, RAB said that Tipu Sheikh, 45, who was killed during a "gunfight" with its officers, was accused in eight drug cases. Lieutenant Commander Ruhul Amin, Company Commander of RAB-12, said the gunfight took place when a team of the elite force raided the Rajapur Kaliko Cotton Mill area around 3:00 am after receiving a tip about the presence of drug dealers. He added that Tipu was shot when armed gang members began shooting at RAB men and they retaliated. Tipu was pronounced dead at a local hospital.

data.name: Mofiz Alam
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' at Maheshkhaliapara. He was reportedly a yaba trader, according to the list prepared by the police. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf police station, stated that they received information from locals about a gunfight occurring between two groups of drug peddlers on Marine Drive. Upon hearing about the gunfight, the police quickly arrived at the scene and also fired back. Subsequently, a body with bullet wounds was discovered, and the locals identified the victim as Mofiz Alam.

data.name: Hamidul Islam
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, the Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, stated that upon receiving information from the locals about a gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers in Ulochamry under Teknaf, they promptly arrived at the scene at approximately 5:00 am. He mentioned that upon sensing the police's presence, the groups initiated gunfire towards the police personnel, who retaliated in response, resulting in a gunfight. As the suspected drug peddlers managed to escape, a bullet-hit body was discovered, later identified by the locals as Hamidul.

data.name: Hasan Ali
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, Pradip Kumar Das, stated that the police received a tip-off about a gunfight that had broken out between local yaba peddlers and criminals during the unloading of yaba tablets at Sabrang Katabunia. He mentioned that the police quickly arrived at the scene around 4:00 am, and upon sensing the presence of the police, the peddlers opened fire. In response, the police retaliated, resulting in injuries to Hasan and Kamal, while their accomplices managed to escape. He asserted that the police rescued the injured peddlers and transported them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where they later succumbed to their injuries.

data.name: Haidul Farazi
data.description: Lt. Col. Rashed Khan, Commander of the 47 BGB Battalion, stated that a patrol team from the Joypur BGB camp requested the identification of a group of 14 to 15 individuals as they were returning home with drugs from India at approximately 3:30 am. The gang subsequently initiated gunfire, compelling the BGB personnel to respond in kind. Following the exchange of gunfire, the BGB officers discovered a deceased individual at the scene. The victim was later identified as Haidul.

data.name: Mohammad Azam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: In Kushtia Sadar, a suspected drug peddler named Mohammad Azam, aged 45, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police when the law enforcers carried out a raid in Kaburhat village around 2:30 am. Officer-in-Charge of Kushtia Police Station, Nasir Uddin, stated that they had received information about two drug peddling gangs gathering there. The drug peddlers opened fire at the police, leading to a gunfight that resulted in Azam's death. Nasir Uddin also mentioned that Azam had previously been accused in 13 cases related to narcotics. Another suspected drug peddler named Madon Ali was also killed in a reported gunfight with the police. A relative of Mohammad Azam, who preferred to remain anonymous, stated that both Azam and Madon had been arrested by the police on 29 October after a gunfight between drug peddlers and the Border Guard Bangladesh at the Jamalpur border in Daulatpur upazila.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Anwar Hossain, an alleged robber, was killed in an alleged gun battle with the police. A police team conducted a raid in the Kadigrah area around 2:00 am based on information about a robbery attempt. The "robbers" opened fire on the law enforcers, who retaliated. Anwar sustained bullet wounds and was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Zakaria Sardar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in what the Rapid Action Battalion claimed was a gunfight between a team of RAB and a gang of suspected robbers at Sukhparar Char in the Sarankhola range of Sunderbans' east division. RAB-8 Deputy Commander Sohel Rana Prince said that a team of RAB, acting on a tip-off that the members of the forest robber gang 'Sumon Bahini' were staying at Sukhparar Char area in the Sunderbans, conducted a raid there. Sensing the presence of RAB, the suspected robbers opened fire on them, prompting the RAB team to retaliate. After approximately 40 minutes, the gunfight ended and the suspected robbers fled. The RAB officials claimed that the RAB personnel searched the area and discovered the bodies of three individuals who were later identified by fishermen as members of 'Sumon Bahini'.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.description: Two young men were shot dead hours after they were arrested in Teknaf. Saddam Hossain and Saddam Hossain were arrested around 10:00 pm on October 2nd, said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station in Cox's Bazar. He claimed that they were shot dead around 3:00 am at Baharchara, where a police team took them to recover arms and yaba pills. The shootout took place when armed gang members opened fire at the police to snatch the arrestees away, the OC said, adding that the police retaliated and shot the two arrestees.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
