data.name: Abdullahel Kafi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Kafi, a listed JMB member in Mymensingh, was killed when a gang of robbers was planning a robbery, in which Kafi was allegedly involved, in the Jhaloi Bridge area on Rasulpur-Kathalia road in Muktagacha. "After receiving a tip-off, a DB team raided the area around 12:30 am. The robbers fired at the police officials, forcing them to retaliate. Kafi sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight," OC Akanda said. Kafi was taken to MMCH where he was declared dead. Police claimed to have recovered a gun and two used bullets from the spot.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain Gudu
data.description: Alamgir was killed in an alleged gunfight with the police in the Shaheed Kachari Bazar area beside the Mymensingh-Kishoreganj highway. Shah Kamal Akanda, the officer-in-charge (OC) of DB police in Mymensingh, said a team of detectives raided the area around 1:30 am after receiving information that a gang of drug peddlers had gone there. "When the police reached the spot, the drug peddlers fired at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, leading to the gunfight. Alamgir sustained bullet wounds during the incident," he said. Alamgir was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where he was declared dead. Alamgir's family members alleged that he was killed three days after he had been picked up by plainclothes men. The police, however, denied the allegation. Meanwhile, Alamgir's father, Mohammad Ibrahim, said, "Alamgir came home on October 30th evening. Around 10:00 pm, plainclothes men picked him up from our home," he said, adding that they searched for Alamgir at Kotwali Police Station and the DB office several times and asked about his whereabouts, but the police denied picking him up.

data.name: Zamshed Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. The deceased was identified as Zamshed Ali, 43, son of Osman Ali from Kosba village in the upazila. Harendranath Sarker, Officer-in-Charge of Gangni Police Station, said they raided a banana orchard in Hemayetpur village based on information that "robbers" were holding a secret meeting there to rob vehicles on Hemayetpur-Amtola road. The police team cordoned off the orchard around 3:30 am, asked the alleged criminals to surrender, and came under fire. The team retaliated, forcing the criminals to flee the scene after an hour-long gunfight. The law enforcers claimed to have found Zamshed, who had been hit by a bullet, on the spot. They took him to Gangni Upazila Health Complex where Dr. Ali Reza, who was on duty, declared him dead.

data.name: Ratan Ali
data.description: Ratan Ali was killed in what the police said was a gunfight. Khondokar Shamim Uddin, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Bheramara Police Station, said a police team rushed to the spot around 3:30 am and found Ratan's dead body on the spot.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: The chief coordinator of JMB was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Bogra police officials said that acting on a tip-off that some militants were holding a secret meeting in the Pirab Tatipukur area, a team from Shibganj Police Station raided the spot around 1:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the alleged JMB men opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to return fire, said Sonatan Chakraborty, Additional Superintendent of Police of Bogra Sadar circle. At one stage, the alleged militants retreated, and the police found a bullet-hit man. They took him to Bogra Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Enamul Haq Ena
data.description: Enamul Haq Ena was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Detective Branch (DB) of the Police at Nishchintapur village. After receiving information that two groups of drug peddlers were gathering at the village for an illegal drug deal, a team of plainclothes policemen conducted a raid there around 2:00 am, according to Officer-in-Charge of Meherpur DB Police, Obaidur Rahman. As the police team reached the location, the gang of drug peddlers opened fire on them, leading to a retaliation. After 20 minutes of gunfire, the police discovered Ena's bullet-riddled body at the scene. The deceased's elder brother, Sobdel Ali, stated that locals informed the family that some plainclothes men had picked up his brother from a local market on November 5th.

data.name: Salauddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Salauddin, a suspected leader of a robbery gang, was killed in an alleged "gunfight" in Shariatpur. Abdul Momen, the Superintendent of Police in Shariatpur, said a team from the Detective Branch (DB) of the police arrested Salauddin from Kajirhat in Jajira upazila on November 6th. After obtaining information from the primary interrogation, a police team from Palong Model Police Station raided an orchard near a mosque in the village around 1:30 am. The law enforcers had taken Salauddin along with them. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, his gang members opened fire, prompting the police officials to fire back. Salauddin was left with bullet injuries after the "gunfight". He was taken to Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ali Hossain
data.description: Inspector (Investigation) ABMS Doha of Teknaf Model Police Station stated that upon hearing gunshots in Dhalarmukh on Hoaikkong-Baharchhora road, a team of law enforcers rushed to the scene, recovered Ali's body, and sent it to Teknaf upazila Health Complex. Dr. Mostafizur Rahman, from the emergency department, reported that there were two bullet wounds on Ali's chest and back. Officer-in-Charge (OC) Pradip Kumar Das of the Police Station mentioned that Ali was a listed yaba trader. The body was sent to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Mohammed Nasir
data.description: He was arrested in Anwara following a tip-off on the afternoon of 10 August. The gunfight took place in the Dut Kumra area of Barasat union on 11 August, said Dulal Mahmud, Officer-in-Charge of Anwara Police Station. He claimed that the "gunfight" occurred after the police had gone to the area with the arrestee to recover firearms based on his confession. "Sensing the presence of the police, his accomplices opened fire on them. The police retaliated," said the OC, adding that the bullet-riddled body of Nasir was later recovered from the spot.

data.name: Abul Bashar
data.description: According to Officer-in-Charge of Chuadanga Sadar Police Station, Delwar Hossain, the law enforcers had information that a group of drug traders carrying contraband Phensidyl was entering Bangladesh territory from India through the Uzalpur border. A police team was sent to the area. When they located a group of people at Uzalpur field, the police asked them to stop. "But the group responded by opening fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate. The gun battle lasted an hour," the OC said. Police recovered Pappu's body after the "gunfight," he claimed. The law enforcers also claimed to have recovered a shutter gun, four crude bombs, and 170 bottles of Phensidyl from the spot. The OC said Pappu was an accused in six cases—one for murder, four for drug-related offenses, and one for explosions—filed with Chuadanga Sadar Police. His family members claimed that plainclothes men had picked up Pappu on November 5 near Chuadanga Judge Court soon after he appeared before the court in a narcotics case.

data.name: Mohammad Ali Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Acting on a tip-off that a group of troublemakers had gathered in the Kuthi Pachuria area, a police team conducted a raid, according to Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch in Rajbari, Kamal Hossain Bhuiyan. When the officers arrived at around 1:30 am, the suspected troublemakers opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate. After the gunfight concluded and the remaining troublemakers fled, the police managed to rescue Mohammad Ali, who had been shot, and rushed him to Rajbari Sadar Hospital. Unfortunately, the attending doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Shamsuddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Delwar Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Sitakunda Police Station, said that a group of robbers were preparing for a robbery in the Nonachara area of Mandaritola village. Acting on a tip-off, the police rushed to the spot. Sensing the presence of the police, the group of robbers opened fire, prompting the police to retaliate with gunshots.

data.name: Shamim Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: According to Deepak Chandra Saha, Officer-in-Charge of Dhamrai Police Station, Shamim, from Jessore, was the ringleader of a notorious robbery gang in Savar. He said Shamim was arrested by a police team from the Kalampur area of Savar on 11 November. Acting on Shamim's information, another police team conducted a raid in Ashulia's Tongabari area to apprehend his accomplices. Sensing the presence of the police, Shamim's cohorts opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, resulting in a "gunfight." Shamim was killed on the spot when he was caught in the crossfire while attempting to escape.

data.name: Mohammad Masud Rana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Rana, who was killed in Rangpur's Gangachara upazila, was preparing for a robbery along with his accomplices, said Saifur Rahman, Additional Superintendent of Police in Rangpur. Acting on a tip-off, a police team rushed to the scene. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire. Police sent the body to Rangpur Medical College for autopsy.

data.name: Robiul Alam
data.description: Robiul was killed in a gunfight with the police. The police claimed that he was the main accused in the Jolla Union Chairman Bishwajit Ghosh Nantu murder case. He was arrested by the police on 12 November. Acting on Robiul's information, the police team conducted a raid in the Pirerpar Fultola area to rescue drugs. Sensing the presence of the police, Robiul's cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, which triggered the "gunfight". Robiul was hit by a bullet. The police rescued him and took him to Ujirpur Hospital, where the attending doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sumon Mia
data.description: Sumon Mia was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Acting on information that drug peddlers were selling drugs in the Char Puliamari area, a team from the Detective Branch of the police raided the area around 12:45 am, according to Md Shah Kamal Akanda, Officer-in-Charge of DB, Mymensingh. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug dealers opened fire on them, prompting the DB police to retaliate. During the "gunfight," Sumon sustained bullet wounds, said the OC. He was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. Sumon's eldest daughter, Sumi Akhter, said someone called her father on his cellphone around 8:30 pm on November 13. They no longer had any information about his whereabouts. Family members and relatives demanded a neutral investigation into the killing, but the police denied picking up Sumon.

data.name: Mohammad Belal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Police recovered the bullet-riddled body of Mohammad Belal from the scene based on information from locals. Belal, who was in his thirties and the son of Nur Ahmed from Purba Pankhali Wakiapara of Teknaf, had several cases filed against him. His name was also on the list of suspected drug peddlers prepared by the home ministry, according to the police. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf police station, stated that locals reported hearing gunshots in the area around 1:15 am and immediately called the police. The police quickly arrived at the scene, recovered the body, and confirmed it to be Belal's. Das suspected that Belal may have been killed in a 'gunfight' between two gangs of suspected drug peddlers.

data.name: Mohammad Tajel
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Tajel, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with the police. Tajel had been jailed for seven years in a robbery case. Yunus Ali, the officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, the police arrested Tajel from Manirampur upazila in Jessore on 16 November. The law enforcers later took him to Pashchim Baroikhali in Sreenagar around 1:00 am to recover hidden firearms.

data.name: Farid Alam
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, Pradip Kumar Das, stated that they arrested Farid in the Lengurbil area on November 17th at noon. Based on the information obtained from Farid, a police team accompanied him to a house in Lengurbil to recover yaba tablets that had been brought to Bangladesh by Farid and his gang the previous day. The OC mentioned that when the team approached the house at around 3:30 am, Farid's accomplices opened fire on them, prompting the team to retaliate and resulting in a gunfight. After the gunfight ended, they rescued Farid, who was critically injured, and transported him to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. The doctors on duty at the health complex pronounced him dead.

data.name: Abul Hasan Manik
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mehedi Hasan, the Company Commander of RAB-7 in Cox's Bazar, stated that RAB conducted a raid in the Sonadia mangrove forest around 4:00 am after receiving a tip-off about a gang of robbers planning a robbery on the Bay of Bengal. "Upon sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire at the RAB men, which prompted them to retaliate. Following a gunfight, Manik was discovered with severe bullet injuries and was subsequently taken to Moheshkhali Upazila Health Complex. Unfortunately, he was pronounced dead at approximately 8:15 am.

data.name: Didarul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: RAB-7 Cox's Bazar Company Commander Mehadi Hassan said that upon receiving secret information that 20 to 25 pirates had gathered at North Amjakhali village before setting off to the Bay of Bengal to commit robbery, a team of RAB conducted a raid there. He claimed that as they reached the area, suspected pirates opened fire at RAB personnel, who retaliated by firing back, resulting in a gunfight. After the gunfight ended, they rescued Didar, who had been hit by a bullet. The RAB official stated that they sent Didar to Kutubdia Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ashik Jahangir Kudrat
data.description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in an exchange of fire with RAB-7 members. Major Mehedi said the criminals opened fire on them when the elite force members signaled a Cox's Bazar-bound truck to stop at a checkpoint in Teknaf's Keruntoli area. The two criminals came into the line of fire and died on the spot, while the others managed to escape the scene when the RAB members fired back.

data.name: Arif Hossain

Major Mehedi said the criminals opened fire on them when the elite force members signaled a Cox's Bazar-bound truck to stop at a checkpoint in Teknaf's Keruntoli area. The two criminals came into the line of fire and died on the spot, while the others managed to escape the scene when the RAB members fired back.

data.name: Mobarak Hossain

data.description: Mobarak Hossain, an alleged robber, was killed in a "shootout" with the DB police. Shah Kamal Akanda, the officer-in-charge of the Detective Branch of the police in Mymensingh, said that Mobarak Hossain was arrested on November 21. Based on his information, the police took him to Nayanpur to recover firearms around 1:00 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, his cohorts opened fire. The policemen returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". Mobarak was hit by bullets when he tried to flee. He was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nozir Ahmed Prakash and Abdul Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nozir and Amin were killed in a gunfight with the police. They were accused in several drug and robbery cases, according to the police. Pradip Kumar Das, OC of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested Nozir in the Sabrang area on 20 November. After gathering information from Nozir, the police brought him to Hariakhali to recover drugs. His associates, who were waiting there, fired bullets at them, forcing the policemen to retaliate. After the "gun battle" was over, the police found Nozir and Amin with bullet wounds. They were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.description: Nozir and Amin were killed in a gunfight with the police. They were accused in several drug and robbery cases, according to the police. Pradip Kumar Das, OC of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested Nozir in the Sabrang area on 20 November. After gathering information from Nozir, the police brought him to Hariakhali to recover drugs. His associates, who were waiting there, fired bullets at them, forcing the policemen to retaliate. data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.description: Shahidul Islam was killed by RAB in Moglabazar. The incident occurred when RAB officers raided the location based on information that some drug traders were having a secret meeting there, stated Main Uddin Chowdhury, Assistant Director of RAB-9. Shahid was pronounced dead upon arrival at Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Abul Hossain Sheikh
data.description: Abul Hossain Sheikh, an alleged drug trader, died in a "shootout" with the RAB. Major Ashik Billal, Deputy Commander of RAB-11, said that a RAB patrol team raided Deulbari village to detain Abul and his cohorts, who were holding a secret meeting beside Tongibari main road around 1:00 am. The "gunfight" took place when the gang opened fire on the RAB team.

data.name: Khokon Ali
data.description: In Kushtia, the police claimed that Khokon was killed in a "gunfight" at Sadar upazila. Nasir Uddin, the OC of Kushtia Sadar police, said that Khokon's body was found lying beside a road and they rushed to the Mollahteghoria area around 3:00 am. The deceased's father, Subarek Ali, said that his son Khokon had gone missing several days ago.

data.name: Ziaur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Cox's Bazar police claimed Ziaur Rahman, was killed in the Marine Drive road area of Teknaf upazila as law enforcers conducted a raid there around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of police, criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate. Ziaur was injured during the "gunfight". He was taken to a local health complex where doctors declared him dead, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf police. Nur Kalam Nuru, Ziaur's uncle, said that his nephew left home on September 20 for three months to attend Tabligi Jamaat, a non-political Islamic missionary movement. Nuru alleged some plainclothes men identifying themselves as police picked him up from a mosque in Gopalganj's Tungipara on 23 November. He was missing since then.

data.name: Emon Emu
data.description: Emon was killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch of Police. Masudur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (Media) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, said that acting on a tip-off, a team of DB police carried out a raid around 2:55 am near Dhupkhola Math in the Gandaria area where a group of armed criminals had gathered. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight" that left Emon critically injured. Emon was declared dead after being taken to Mitford Hospital, while his associates managed to escape the scene.

data.name: Selim
data.description: Selim was killed in a gunfight with the police on the Jessore-Chougaccha road. Tipped off that two groups of robbers were exchanging gunfire, a team of Detective Branch (DB) police conducted a raid in the area around 3:30 am, according to Maniruzzaman, the Officer-in-Charge of DB police. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing the DB officers to retaliate with shots. Eventually, the police recovered Selim's body, which had been hit by a bullet, and took it to the morgue of Jessore Sadar Hospital for an autopsy.

data.name: Babul Munshi
data.description: An accused in a murder case was killed in a reported shootout with the police in Savar in the early hours of Thursday. The deceased man was Babul Mia, 27, son of Babar Ali Munshi from Bagura district. Babul was accused of killing garment worker Mehedi Hasan. According to Sheikh Rezaul Haq Dipu, officer-in-charge of Ashulia Police Station, a team of police conducted a raid at Yearpur in Ashulia at around 1:30 am based on a tip-off. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Babul Mia, along with his accomplices, opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate. At one stage, the police arrested Babul with bullet injuries and took him to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, UNB reported.

data.name: Habib Ullah
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Model Police Station, said that law enforcers apprehended Habib on the night of 30 November as he was a registered yaba trader. Following Habib's statement, a police team accompanied him to the Shaplapur Puranpara area of Teknaf in order to recover yaba tablets. Upon arrival, Habib's associates fired shots at the police officials, prompting them to retaliate. During the exchange of gunfire, Habib managed to escape while his associates retreated. Subsequently, the police conducted a search of the area and discovered Habib injured. Unfortunately, he succumbed to his injuries later on.

data.name: Rabiul Hasan
data.description: Rabiul Hasan was killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB. Alep Uddin, Senior Assistant Director of RAB-11, said that based on a tip-off, a RAB team raided a house in Shahidnagar around 4:30 am. When a RAB official knocked on the door, someone inside the house began firing. In response, RAB members retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight." After entering the house, RAB discovered the body of Rabiul Hasan, who had been hit by a bullet. He was then transported to Narayanganj General Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Zillur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Narayanganj, alleged robbers -- Zillur Rahman, 35, and an unidentified man -- were shot dead in a gunfight with RAB on the Dhaleshwari River in the Alirtek area. Lt. Col. Kamrul Hasan, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said the gunfight ensued when a RAB team raided the area where around eight to ten robbers were preparing to loot ships.

data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang

data.name: Jahangir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Jahangir, 38, was shot dead in a gunfight with the police in the Jampur Mirerbag area of Sonargaon upazila. Narayanganj police said a gang of around eight robbers was preparing for a robbery on a road. When the police rushed to the spot, the robbers started firing bullets, resulting in the "gunfight".

data.name: Sabedul Haque
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A team of RAB, acting on secret information, conducted a raid at the remote hilly Jungle Salimpur in Sitakunda to recover illegal firearms and apprehend suspected robbers at approximately 12 noon, quoted RAB-7 Deputy Commander Ashiqur Rahman. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the robbers opened fire on the RAB personnel, prompting them to retaliate. The RAB official stated that Kalu was killed on the spot by bullets during the "gunfight" and that his body had been sent to Chittagong Medical College Hospital for post-mortem examination.

data.name: Jakir Hossain Milon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal leader died in custody just six days after his arrest while he was returning from a demonstration organized by the Bangladesh Nationalist Party in the capital. A prison official said that the inmate complained of a "health problem" at the jail hospital in Keraniganj at about 7:40 am and was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he died at about 8:40 am. The family said Ramna police picked up Zakir Hossain from somewhere between the Press Club and Naya Paltan, and handed him over to Shahbagh Police Station. His uncle, BM Waliullah, said they came to know from different sources that Zakir fell ill and was taken to the hospital. Dakkhinkhan police said that a robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in Dibrabari. They said local people caught five robbers during a robbery at a house in the Mollartek area of Dakkhinkhan Police Station. Among the five robbers, the police launched a drive with Jahirul Islam in the Diabari area around 3:00 am. Sensing the police presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, leaving Jahirul shot. Tapan Kumar Saha, Dakkhana Police Station Officer-in-Charge, claimed that after being rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, the duty doctor declared him dead. The family alleged that he was tortured in custody, which caused his death.

data.name: Mohammad Alamgir Hossain
data.description: An officer from the Mymensingh district Detective Branch of Police stated that they have arrested Alamgir, the main suspect in the murder case of Abul Kashem on February 2nd in Jaybanglabazar, under Sadar upazila. The arrest took place in the Gopalganj area of Mymensingh town. The officer further explained that they conducted a raid at Jaybanglabazar around 3:00 am. During the raid, Alamgir's accomplices threw bricks and opened fire on the police, leading the police to retaliate by firing back. Alamgir was shot while attempting to escape the scene. The DB police then took Alamgir to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where the doctors on duty pronounced him dead.

data.name: Sirejul Islam
data.description: Inspector Khondor Shaker Ahmed, from the Kotwali Police Station (Investigation), stated that they have apprehended Sirajul, who is accused of mugging and hacking a school teacher. Subsequently, the police conducted a raid on SA Sarkar Road to apprehend his accomplices. However, upon sensing the police's presence, Sirajul's cohorts initiated gunfire, prompting the police to retaliate. Unfortunately, Sirajul was caught in the crossfire and was immediately rushed to MMCH. Regrettably, the on-duty doctors at the hospital pronounced him dead.

data.name: Tarek
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Tarek was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Major Md Mehedi Hasan, the Cox's Bazar Camp Company Commander of RAB-7, stated that RAB had received information that the robbers were planning to extort money from the boat owners at Moghnama Ghat area. Acting on this information, they conducted a raid at the location. Upon realizing their presence, the robbers initiated gunfire, and the law enforcement officers responded in kind. Subsequently, RAB members discovered the body of Md Tarek.

data.name: Moshiur Rahman Dhulo
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Two accused drug dealers were killed in a gunfight with the police. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Charge of Damurhuda Model Police Station, said that the police, acting on a tip-off, rushed to Gobindhuda field where two groups of drug dealers were engaged in an exchange of fire to establish supremacy in the area around 1:30 am. When the police asked the gangs to surrender, they opened fire on the law enforcers. The police retaliated, and after a gunfight that lasted nearly an hour, officers found the bodies at the scene.

data.name: Jhantu Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Two accused drug dealers were killed in a gunfight with the police. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Charge of Damurhuda Model Police Station, said that the police, acting on a tip-off, rushed to Gobindhuda field where two groups of drug dealers were engaged in an exchange of fire to establish supremacy in the area around 1:30 am. When the police asked the gangs to surrender, they opened fire on the law enforcers. The police retaliated, and after a gunfight that lasted nearly an hour, officers found the bodies at the scene.

data.name: Jalal Yusuf
data.description: Jalal Yusuf, also known as Bahadur, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. He was included in the list of yaba traders prepared by the Home Ministry. Pradip Kumar Das, the Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that the police arrested Jalal from his house at around 10:00 pm on December 6th. Based on his information, the police took him to Moulovipara village at around 4:00 am to recover yaba tablets. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, his associates opened fire. The police then returned fire, resulting in the "gunfight." Jalal was hit by bullets when he attempted to flee from police custody, while the others managed to escape. The OC stated that Jalal was declared dead after being taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Khasru Miah
data.description: Two suspected criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. RAB-11 SP Enayet Hossain Manna, who led the operation, said the two "criminals" approached Ballabari mosque in Munshiganj Sadar upazila around 1:45pm. Acting on the information, RAB conducted the operation. He claimed that the criminals opened fire on RAB first, forcing them to retaliate. During the "gunfight", the two criminals were shot and died on the spot.

data.name: Md Sumon
data.description: Two suspected criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. RAB-11 SP Enayet Hossain Manna, who led the operation, said the two "criminals" approached Ballabari mosque in Munshiganj Sadar upazila around 1:45pm. Acting on the information, RAB conducted the operation. He claimed that the criminals opened fire on RAB first, forcing them to retaliate. During the "gunfight", the two criminals were shot and died on the spot.

data.name: Saiful
data.description: In Comilla, an alleged drug peddler named Saiful, 24, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Monogram area of the Sadar upazila. Abu Faysal Miah, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Kotwali Model Police Station, said Saiful had been facing three cases filed under the narcotics act.

data.name: Abdul Barek
data.description: Abdul Barek was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Muktapur Naldanga. Sub-inspector Rawson Ali of Damurhuda police station said that a team of Damurhuda police, acting on a tip that a group of drug peddlers had taken refuge in the Muktapur Naldanga area, conducted a raid there at about 1:30 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the peddlers opened fire on the cops, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. After the gunfight, the police found Barek wounded and sent him to Chuadanga Sadar Hospital for treatment. The doctors on duty at the hospital declared him dead.

data.name: Khairul Amin
data.description: Bullet-ridden bodies of two Rohingyas were found on January 5th after being arrested by police at the Mitapanirchara point of Cox's Bazar-Teknaf marine drive area. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed that the duo were involved in drug peddling from Myanmar. However, a Rohingya leader confirmed that both of them were detained beforehand. Meanwhile, deceased Abdullah's son, Mohammad Arakan, said that his father was arrested by 6-7 policemen from their camp in Unchiprang on January 4th, 2019, and has been missing since then. Khairul's brother, Mohammad Rafiq, alleged that police arrested his brother on January 4th from the house of a suspected drug peddler, Shah Alam, at the Unchiprang camp.

data.name: Zahid Miah
data.description: Zahid Miah, a suspected drug peddler, was allegedly beaten to death by the police in the Phultala area. The police picked up Zahid around 7:00 pm from a local market and took him to his nearby rented flat. Jahangir Alam, Zahid's brother, alleged that the law enforcers beat him up there. After two hours of detention, the police took him to the Kulaura Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead, Jahangir added. However, Officer-in-Charge of Juri Police Station, Zahangir Hossain Sardar, denied the allegation.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: Billal, who was the prime suspect in the abduction and killing of a Class III student, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police. Monirampur police station officer-in-charge Shahidul Islam said that they, as per information extracted from Billal, also recovered the body of the abducted victim, Tarif Rahman, 8, from a field at Satnal. The OC said that Tarif’s father lodged a case with the police on January 7, stating that his son was abducted by unidentified abductors while the boy was playing near their house, and the abductors demanded Tk seven lakh in ransom. Later, he said, they, as per their investigation, arrested the prime suspect Billal on January 8 at night. During the primary interrogation, the suspect confessed that he and his associates abducted Tarif and that they had killed him and hid the body at a place in their village. Shahidul said that they, along with Billal, later went out of the police station to recover the body, and as the police team reached village Satnal, suspected associates of Billal opened fire on cops who retaliated by firing, prompting a ‘gunfight’ at about 2:45 am. He claimed that Billal got shot and became critically injured, and they rushed him to Jessore General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jahangirl Alam
data.description: The bullet-riddled body of a reported yaba trader was found at Uttaran Housing Society on Cox's Bazar bypass road on Wednesday. The deceased has been identified as Jahangir Alam, also known as Yaba Jahangir, the son of Faridul Alam from ABC Ghona in south Rumaliarchara of Cox's Bazar town. Md Farid Uddin Khandakar, the officer-in-charge of Cox's Bazar Sadar Police, stated that a team of Cox's Bazar police discovered Jahangir's body in the morning after receiving a tip-off from locals. Police suspect that Jahangir was killed by his rivals. However, Jahangir's father, Faridul Alam, informed New Age that a group of plainclothesmen took Jahangir from his home at 10:00 pm on Tuesday and forced him into a microbus. "We learned in the morning that he had been gunned down," he said.

data.name: Misbah Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Bianibazar police Sub-Inspector Mizanur Rahman said that they arrested Misbah from Jaflong at Goainghat on the night of 31 August as he was wanted in a robbery case filed with the police station. According to information extracted from Misbah during interrogation, a team of police, along with Misbah, went to the Shewla Bridge area of Bianibazar at around 3:15 am to arrest his accomplices and seize arms from them. The police said that upon sensing their presence in the area, Misbah's associates started to open fire on them, which forced the police to retaliate with gunshots, triggering a gunfight. Misbah sustained bullet injuries as he tried to flee the scene during the gunfight.

data.name: Noor Mohammad
data.description: Another Rohingya, suspected to be involved in the murder of a local Juba League leader, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in the hilly area of Jadimura in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar, early Sunday. The deceased was identified as Noor Mohammad, 34, son of the late Kala Meah of Jadimura in Teknaf. Pradeep Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf police, said that they arrested Noor Mohammad and another Rohingya, Aman Ullah, during a raid at Ulochamari hill in Hnila, Teknaf, on Saturday afternoon. Later, on early Sunday, a police team, along with Noor, went to the Jadimura hilly area in search of his accomplices. When the police reached the area, Noor's accomplices opened fire on them in an attempt to snatch their leader, prompting the police to retaliate with gunshots, which triggered the gunfight, the OC said. After the hour-long gunfight was over, the police rescued Noor Mohammad with bullet injuries and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: Billal Hossain, who allegedly abducted and killed a fourth grader, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Monirampur. Police picked up Billal from Keshabpur upazila on January 7, 2020. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Billal's associates opened fire at the police. Cops fired retaliatory shots in self-defense. At one stage, Billal was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, according to the police. The Daily Star reported that a teenager, who allegedly abducted and killed a fourth grader, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Jashore's Monirampur upazila early yesterday. The deceased has been identified as Billal Hossain of Fedaipur village in the same upazila. Aged about 19, he was a class-IX student at Gopalpur High School, according to the police. Shahidul Islam, officer-in-charge of Monirampur Police Station, said Billal abducted Tarif Hossain, a fourth grader at Gopalpur Government Primary School, on Sunday and demanded Tk 5 lakh as ransom from his family over the phone. He provided the family members with a bKash agent's number for sending the ransom money. The following day, Tarif's father filed a general diary with Monirampur Police Station. Police picked up Billal from Keshabpur upazila on Tuesday when he went to the bKash agent to collect the ransom money. They claimed that during primary interrogation, Billal admitted to abducting Tarif. Gleaning information from him, the police later recovered Tarif's body from the Satnol Bridge area around 3:00 am yesterday. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Billal's associates opened fire at the police. The cops fired retaliatory shots in self-defense. At one stage, Billal was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. The police claimed to have recovered a gun and a bullet from the scene. They also detained Lima Khatun, 20, and Masum Billah, 35, from their Keshabpur homes early yesterday in connection with the abduction. Law enforcers handed over the two bodies to their relatives yesterday after autopsies were carried out on them at Jashore General Hospital. Speaking to

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: Two suspected traders were killed in a "gunfight" with the police. The incident took place in the Khurer Mukh area around 1:30 am when a team of police carried out a drive to recover illegal firearms, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug traders opened fire on the police, and a "gunfight" ensued when the law enforcers fired back in retaliation, Pradip added.

data.name: Abul Kalam

The incident took place in the Khurer Mukh area around 1:30 am when a team of police carried out a drive to recover illegal firearms, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug traders opened fire on the police, and a "gunfight" ensued when the law enforcers fired back in retaliation, Pradip added.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Border Guard Bangladesh officers said they shot dead two young Rohingya men in Teknaf while they were smuggling yaba pills. The Rohingya men, who were carrying yaba stashes, entered Bangladesh at Rongikhali in Hnila area around 3:00 am, according to Teknaf BGB Battalion 2 Director Lt Col Md Asad-uz Zaman. As BGB personnel patrolling the area asked them to stop, they jumped into the Naf river and tried to flee. The BGB men then shot them, he said, adding that Teknaf police were informed about the incident immediately.

data.name: Ashiqur Rahman
data.description: A garment worker named Ashiqur Rahman was killed in crossfire by the police when they opened fire at a crowd protesting the arrest of two people from a restaurant at the Modonpur bus stand area under Bandar Upazila in Narayanganj District.

data.name: Jahangir Akon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers who were arrested in Dhaka were killed in a "gunfight" with the police. The police claimed that Jahangir was accused in four robbery cases, while Russel had six cases filed against him. However, Surmani Begum, the wife of Russel, said her husband, who was a vegetable trader, was innocent, and they used to live in a rented house in Savar's Baliapur area. Inspector Humayun Kabir from the Palang police station (investigation) said that they, with the help of Dhaka Metropolitan Police's Detective Branch (North), arrested the suspects on 11 January. Based on their information, they also arrested another accused, Sohel Gharami. He added that they, along with the duo, also conducted raids in Mirpur, Dhaka, on the same day and in Bogra on 12 January. According to the information extracted from them, a joint team of DB police and Palang police, along with the duo, went to a garden in village Deobhog, where the detainees' accomplices opened fire on the police. The police retaliated by firing back at around 3:00 am. Jahangir and Rasel tried to flee the scene during the "gunfight" and died on the spot after being shot.

data.name: Rumman Hossain Romeo
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Romeo was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and his accomplices in the Karar Beel area. Romeo was accused in 13 cases of murder, robbery, and other crimes, according to the police. Regarding the "gunfight," Ilias Hossain, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Narail Sadar police, stated that a team of law enforcers raided Karar Beel based on information that a criminal group was hiding there. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate. Romeo, the son of Mizanur Rahman from Madhurgati village under Sadar upazila, was shot during the exchange of gunfire, he added. He was pronounced dead upon arrival at Narail Sadar Hospital, the OC said.

data.name: Moizuddin Ahmed Tulu
data.description: The police recovered the bullet-riddled body of a youth in Tala upazila of Satkhira on Wednesday morning, three days after he went missing after allegedly being abducted by a group of plainclothes people. The bullet-riddled body of Moizuddin Ahmed Tulu, 45, of Shikri village in the district, was found beside a road at Tetulia of the upazila. The police branded him as a drug peddler and suspected that it might have been a gangland murder. The family members said he was once a drug peddler but gave it up due to family pressure. The victim's wife, Rahima Begum Rekha, stated at a press conference at the district press club on Tuesday that her husband was riding a motorbike on January 13 towards the district headquarters to repay Tk 20,000. She alleged that a group of people identifying themselves as detectives abducted him, and his whereabouts have been unknown since then. The family filed a missing complaint with Satkhira police station the following day.

data.name: Mostak Ahmad
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh and the police in Teknaf. Lt. Col. Asad-uz Zaman Chowdhury, commander of BGB Battalion-2 in Teknaf, claimed that Mostak was an enlisted drug trader and had more than 10 cases against him with Teknaf Police Station. Upon receiving information, BGB members, along with police officials, took Mostak to the Uttar Jalaipara area around 4:00 am to recover yaba tablets. However, his cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, as claimed by the BGB official. Musu's bullet-ridden body was recovered from the spot after the "gunfight" ceased. Later, he was taken to a Cox's Bazar hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shamsul Alam
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police on the Domdomia Flood Control Embankment. Police alleged that Shamsu was wanted in 10 drug-related cases. Officer-in-charge Pradip Kumar Das of Teknaf Police Station said that a police squad arrested Shamsu in Lohagara, Chittagong on January 18. Based on information allegedly provided by him, a police team, along with Shamsu, raided the Domdomia Flood Control Embankment at about 5 AM to recover Yaba tablets and illegal firearms. When the police team arrived at the spot, Shamsu's accomplices opened fire to snatch him away from the police, prompting the police's retaliation. In the ensuing gunfight, Shamsu was critically injured after being hit by a bullet fired by his own gang members, who escaped, he said. The OC said that they rushed Shamsu to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, but doctors referred him to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Helal Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Moheshkhali, the police said a suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Shaplapur area. Helal Uddin, who was accused in at least 10 criminal cases, according to Suvash Chandra Dhar, the officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station. He added that the police were tipped off about Helal and his cohorts preparing for a robbery in the Matarbari area. A police team then went there and arrested him. Taking Helal along with them, the policemen then went to the Shaplapur area to catch other gang members, the OC said. When the police reached there, armed men started shooting at them. Injured during the gunfight, Helal was taken to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Mirza Mahtab Uddin, the commander of RAB-7 camp in Teknaf, said they had received a tip-off about a consignment of yaba being smuggled through Marine Drive Road near the beach around 2:30 am. He added that as RAB men went there, the drug traders sensed their presence and started shooting at them. The RAB men then retaliated in defense. After the shootout ended a few minutes later, two bodies with bullet wounds were found at the scene, he said. The bodies were sent to Teknaf Upazila Government Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" between a team of police and a group of drug peddlers at Mollateghoria village. Habibur Rahman was named in several cases and was on the list of suspected drug peddlers prepared by the home ministry, police said. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Kushtia Sadar Police conducted a raid in the area around 3:00 am while a group of drug peddlers took position there, Kushtia Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge M Nasir Uddin said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, one of Hubba's associates opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered the "gunfight". Following the gunfight, police recovered Hubba's bullet-ridden body and took him to Kushtia General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shahabuddin
data.description: A man suspected of raping a madrasa student in Chattogram has been killed in an alleged shootout with the police. The deceased suspect, Shahabuddin, and the arrestee, Shyamol Dey, worked as drivers. "They tried to abduct her again last night. The police found out about this and seized a vehicle, but the suspects managed to flee," said the police officer. The police then raided Chakbazar and arrested Shyamol. Based on what he divulged during questioning, a police team prepared to raid Firingibazar to catch Shahabuddin. "When the police tried to arrest him at Mariner's Road, Shahabuddin started shooting at the police. The police then fired back. Shahabuddin was later found shot and lying dead on the ground," said OC Mohsin.

data.name: Sohel Rana
data.description: A suspected drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB members in Keshabpur village. Acting on a tip-off, a team of the elite force conducted a raid in Keshubpur village around 2:00 am to prevent a drug deal, claimed RAB. Sensing their presence, a group of four to five drug dealers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. RAB later rescued Sohel with bullet injuries and sent him to Panchbibi Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, he claimed.

data.name: Asad
data.description: Two suspected drug dealers were killed in a shootout with RAB. The shootout occurred when a RAB team, acting on information that drugs were being smuggled, signaled a lorry to stop in the Silonia Bazar area of Daganbhuiyan upazila around 12:30 am, said Shafayet Jamil Fahim, commander of RAB-7 in Feni. Those inside the lorry began shooting at the RAB men while trying to escape, which forced the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering a gunfight in which Asad and Imamul sustained bullet injuries, he said. RAB recovered the bodies and seized the lorry.

data.name: Imamul Akand
data.description: Two suspected drug dealers were killed in a shootout with RAB. The shootout occurred when a RAB team, acting on information that drugs were being smuggled, signaled a lorry to stop in the Silonia Bazar area of Daganbhuiyan upazila around 12:30 am, said Shafayet Jamil Fahim, commander of RAB-7 in Feni. Those inside the lorry began shooting at the RAB men while trying to escape, which forced the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering a gunfight in which Asad and Imamul sustained bullet injuries, he said. RAB recovered the bodies and seized the lorry.

data.name: Nazrul Islam Naju
data.description: Nazrul Islam Naju was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Kamruzzaman, Assistant Superintendent of RAB-1, said that a team of the elite force conducted a raid in the town's Pubail area around 2:30 am based on information that a group of six to seven drug traders had gathered there. As soon as the RAB team reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Nazrul sustained bullet injuries as he was caught in the line of fire, but his cohorts managed to flee, added the RAB official. Later, Nazrul was taken to Shaheed Tajuddin Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurul Kader Rana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nurul Kader Rana was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB. RAB 7 media officer Masokur Rahman said Rana was a member of a robber gang based in the Bay of Bengal and was the prime accused in the MV Ma-Babar Dowa and MV Mahin robbery case on the Bay of Bengal near Hatiya of Noakhali on August 26.

data.name: Fazar Ali
data.description: Fazar Ali was killed in a "gunfight" between RAB and a group of suspected drug smugglers. RAB-9 media officer Md Moniruzzaman said that, acting on a tip-off, they conducted a raid in the Mitrimahal area at Goainghat upazila in the district at around 3:00 am to arrest some drug smugglers. He said that upon sensing the presence of the battalion members in the area, the suspected smugglers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. At one stage of the shootout, the attackers retreated, and Fazar Ali was found dead on the spot.

data.name: Nabab Uddin
data.description: Three villagers were killed and 16 others injured after BGB personnel opened fire on agitating villagers at village Baharampur of Haripur in Thakurgaon on 12 February. The villagers alleged that the BGB personnel opened fire on them as they tried to stop them from taking away cows they had reared for months on suspicion that they were smuggled from India. Villagers said Mahbub Ali, a resident of village Bahrampur, bought a cow six months ago and on 12 February, he was taking it to the local Jadurani cattle market to sell it. On his way, a group of seven to eight BGB personnel of Betna camp attempted to seize the cow suspecting it to be a smuggled one. They said that the BGB personnel also brought three other cows in a bid to take them away and took them on a BGB pick-up van about 11:00 am. Hundreds of villagers from surrounding areas and those who had been going to the cattle market gathered at the place and held protests against the BGB personnel. The villagers then locked in a scuffle with the BGB personnel and recovered the cattle from BGB’s possession. They held demonstrations protesting harassment by the BGB personnel in the name of seizing smuggled cows. On receiving information, other BGB patrol teams arrived at the scene to rescue the confined ones. The villagers became more agitated and threw bricks at them when the BGB personnel opened fire in the air to disperse the mob. At one stage, when the mob became more violent, the BGB personnel opened fire on the mob, leaving two dead on the spot and several others injured with bullets. One of the injured died on the way to Haripur Upazila Health Complex, officials at Haripur Police Station said.

data.name: Shanto Chowdhury
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nurul Amin, an additional deputy commissioner of police (Wari Division), said the police conducted a raid based on information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the Gopibagh Rail Gate area. As the policemen tried to apprehend them, one of the robbers indiscriminately stabbed the law enforcers with a sharp weapon and attempted to flee. When the police pursued them, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, resulting in a "gunfight," he said. Shanto sustained a bullet injury, while the two police officials, Raqibul and Shukanta, suffered stab wounds during the incident. Nurul added that Shanto was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where he later died.

data.name: Nazmul Hossain Malitha
data.description: In Kushtia's Sadar upazila, a "gunfight" between two groups of drug peddlers left one person dead, according to Nasir Uddin, the officer-in-charge of Kushtia Model Police Station. The deceased, Nazmul Hossain Malitha, 40, from the district's Daulatpur upazila, was a registered drug peddler and accused in 11 drug-related cases, as claimed by the police. Upon hearing gunshots, a police team quickly arrived at Shaldah village around 2:30 am and discovered Nazmul's body with bullet wounds, stated the OC. However, Nazmul's family members stated that he was taken away on Saturday. When questioned, the law enforcement officials denied the accusation. The police also reported seizing 600 yaba pills, a pistol, and two bullets from the scene.

data.name: Mangal Miah
data.description: Mangal Miah, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Comilla's Chandina upazila. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided the upazila's Pirerchar area to recover drugs. Sensing their presence, Mangal and his cohorts opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point, Mangal sustained bullet injuries. He died on the way to a hospital, as claimed by the OC. The police also claimed to have recovered a gun, two rounds of bullets, 500 yaba tablets, and 50 bottles of Phensidyl from the spot.

data.name: Humayun Bepari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Munshiganj's Sadar upazila, an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police early yesterday. The deceased, Humayun Bepari, 30, was accused in six cases, according to Alamgir Hossain, the officer-in-charge of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station. The "gunfight" occurred when the police went to the Taleshwar Bridge area of the upazila to recover firearms, as claimed by the law enforcers. Sensing their presence, Humayun and his accomplices opened fire, forcing the police to retaliate, according to police officials. At one point during the "gunfight", he was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet wounds. Later, doctors declared him dead at Munshiganj General Hospital.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with Coast Guard personnel at the Sonaimukhi canal area in the Sunderbans. Officer-in-charge Mokarrom Hossain of Dacope police station said that they learned the suspect was a member of a robber gang named "Asabur Bahini". Mohammad Bayazid, the Coast Guard west zone operation officer, stated that they received information that the members of Asabur Bahini had taken position at Sonaimukhi Canal in the Sunderbans, so they conducted a raid in the area. When the coast guard personnel reached the canal, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate by firing back at around 2:00 am. After the "gunfight" ended, he claimed that they found the unidentified suspect and took him to Dacope Upazila Health Complex, where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mofazzal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nazrul Islam, officer-in-charge of Daulatpur police, said a team of law enforcers raided the Katdah field on information that robbers were holding a meeting there around 4:30 am. "Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on them," the OC said, adding that the gunfight ensued when the police returned fire. At one stage, the alleged robbers fled the scene, and the police found two bodies on the spot.

data.name: Mohabul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Nazrul Islam, officer-in-charge of Daulatpur police, said a team of law enforcers raided the Katdah field on information that robbers were holding a meeting there around 4:30 am. "Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on them," the OC said, adding that the gunfight ensued when the police returned fire. At one stage, the alleged robbers fled the scene, and the police found two bodies on the spot.

data.name: Mehedi Hasan
data.description: Mehedi was killed in the capital's Shyamoli area. Mohammad Mohiuddin Faruqui, Company Commander of RAB-2 camp in Mohammadpur, claimed that Mehedi was accused in at least 17 drug-related cases. Acting on a tip-off, they set up two checkpoints in Shyamoli and Kalyanpur areas to recover drugs. Tracing the peddlers, they approached to interrogate, but the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one stage of the "shootout", Mehedi's bullet-ridden body was found while others managed to flee. Mehedi was taken to Suhrawardy Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zafar Alam
data.description: Zafar was killed in Cox's Bazar by the BGB. Lt Col Mohammad Asadud-Zaman Chowdhury, the commanding officer of BGB battalion-2, said they detained Zafar on the night of February 19th. According to Zafar's statement, a consignment of yaba pills was supposed to be smuggled in the sluice gate area. Based on this information, a BGB team conducted a raid there, claimed Lt Col Chowdhury. Sensing the presence of the BGB, the smugglers opened fire, forcing the BGB to retaliate. During the "gunfight", the BGB men recovered Zafar's body.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: In Mymensingh, Abdur Rashid was killed in a gunfight between the police and his cohorts at Trishal bus stand in the town. The officer-in-charge of the district DB police, Shah Kamal Akand, said he was tipped off that a group of drug traders would gather in the area, so a team of DB police conducted a drive. Sensing their presence, the drug traders opened fire on the police members, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight and left Rashid injured. Doctors declared him dead when he was taken to Mymensingh Medical College and Hospital.

data.name: Masud Kamal Rana
data.description: In Khulna, Masud Kamal Rana was killed in a gunfight between the police and his accomplices in the Nirala area of the city. Deputy Police Commissioner Maniruzzaman Mithu stated that around 4:00 am, a police patrol team pursued a group of drug traders in the area. The traders opened fire on the law enforcement officers, prompting them to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight. Masud, who was injured during the exchange of gunfire, was pronounced dead upon arrival at Khulna Medical College and Hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Al-Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Comilla, Al-Amin was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Darikandi area. The police said they arrested Al-Amin on the afternoon of February 21st, along with Tk 15 lakh of looted money, after a case was filed alleging that a gang of robbers, including Al-Amin, looted Tk 58 lakh from five bkash agents by intercepting their rickshaw in the morning. After gathering information from him, a team of Titas police and DB police jointly conducted a raid at the location with Al-Amin at around 3:45 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, a group of robbers tried to snatch Al-Amin from the police and opened fire on them, forcing the police to retaliate. The investigation officer of the case and DB police sub-inspector Shahidul Islam said that Al-Amin sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight and doctors declared him dead when he was taken to Comilla Medical College and Hospital.

data.name: Hazrat Ali
data.description: In Dhaka, Hazrat Ali was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at the Dayaganj area under Jatrabari police station in the capital around 2:15 am when the police raided the place to apprehend suspected drug peddlers, according to Kazi Wazed Ali, the officer-in-charge of Jatrabari police station.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.description: Belal Hossain was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh personnel at the Katabania area under Teknaf upazila in the district at around 5:00 am, said Lieutenant Colonel Asaduzzaman, commander of BGB-2. BGB seized 9,000 pieces of Yaba tablets from the spot, he said, adding that Belal was named in at least seven drug-related cases.

data.name: Mohammad Palash Ahmed
data.description: A man who allegedly attempted to storm the cockpit of a Biman flight was killed in a commando operation at Shah Amanat International Airport in Chittagong after all passengers were safely evacuated.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Four alleged members of a Sundarbans-based robber gang were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Chandpai range of the forest in Satkhira, according to RAB. The deceased include Arif, the leader of the gang locally known as Arif Bahini, said Mufti Mahamud Khan, the director of Rab's Legal and Media Wing. He added that the identities of the others were yet to be confirmed. He stated, "The gunfight occurred early in the morning when the bandits of Arif Bahini opened fire on a team of RAB-8, prompting them to retaliate, in the Jongra Canal area." "The four were caught in the line of fire while the others managed to flee," he said, further adding that the bodies were handed over to Dacope Police Station in Khulna.

data.name: Tofazzal Hossain
data.description: In Joypurhat, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Khetlal upazila. "Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-5 raided Tausara village to arrest a group of drug peddlers around 1:45 am," said ASP Azmal Hossain, Commanding Officer of Joypurhat RAB. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the miscreants opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering a "gunfight," the RAB official added. Tofazzal sustained a bullet injury during the "shootout" while the rest escaped. RAB members took him to Joypurhat Modern Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Emdad Khandokar
data.description: In Kushtia, an alleged drug dealer named Emdad Khandokar was killed in a "shootout" with police in Adabaria village of Kumarkhali upazila. AKM Mizanur Rahman, the officer-in-charge of Kumarkhali Police Station, stated that a team of law enforcers raided the Chechua Beel area after receiving information that some drug traders were holding a secret meeting there around 3:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug traders opened fire, resulting in a "gunfight" when the police retaliated, according to the OC. After the criminals fled, the police discovered the body of Emdad, who was accused in two narcotics cases filed with the Islamic University Police Station, at the scene.

data.name: Mamun Sarker
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Barisal, Mamun Sarker was killed in a gunfight with the police. Abdul Khalek, OC (investigation) of Kazirhat Police Station in Mehendiganj upazila, said Mamun was a robber and accused in at least 26 cases, including murder, rape, and robbery, with different police stations. The police arrested Mamun on the night of February 25 in the Muladi Bailey Bridge area and went to a brick kiln in the Kazirhut lake area to recover firearms around 2:00 am, he added. Mamun's associates opened fire on the police team, triggering a "gunfight". The OC said Mamun was injured during the "gunfight" and taken to the local upazila health complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Kamal Hossain was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Paltan area. The police claimed that he had several drug-related cases against him with the Paltan and Ramna police stations. Acting on a tip-off, law enforcers raided the area around 2:00 am to recover drugs. Sensing their presence, Kamal and his cohorts opened fire on the police officials, forcing them to retaliate, according to Syed Ali, sub-inspector of Paltan Police Station. During the "gunfight", Kamal's body, riddled with bullets, was found on the spot. When he was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, doctors declared him dead. The victim's sister, Johura Begum, who identified her brother at DMCH, claimed that her brother was a local activist of BNP and went missing on the evening of February 25th. "My brother had a rent-a-car business and he has never been a drug peddler," she claimed.

data.name: Shaheb Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: According to Lieutenant Commander AMM Zahidul Kabir of RAB-6, they conducted a raid in the Kolagachhia area of Satkhira's Shyamnagar upazila around 9:30 am to apprehend members of Shaheb Bahini, an infamous gang of forest bandits in the area. Sensing the presence of RAB, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Although other members of the forest bandits managed to escape, two members - Shaheb Ali, 35, the gang's leader, and Habibur Rahman, 28, the gang's second-in-command - sustained gunshot wounds during the hour-long "gunfight," as claimed by the RAB official. Later, doctors on duty at Shyamnagar Health Complex declared the duo dead.

Later, doctors on duty at Shyamnagar Health Complex declared the duo dead.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: Billal Hossain was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar. Lt. Col. Asadud Zaman, captain of the BGB battalion in Teknaf, claimed that the members of the paramilitary force raided sluice gate-3 area in Hoaikong union of Teknaf based on information that a large number of yaba pills were about to be smuggled. As the BGB men reached the area, smugglers attacked them with sharp weapons and guns, forcing them to retaliate, Asadud claimed. He added that Billal sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, doctors declared Billal dead when he was taken to Teknaf Health Complex.

data.name: Abdul Shukkur
data.description: According to BGB Battalion-2 Commanding Officer Lt. Col. Asadud Zaman Chowdhury, Abdul Shukkur and Mohammad Ilias were engaged in a "gunfight" with BGB men in Teknaf's Sabrang area. The incident happened around 3:30 am after BGB men took positions in the area based on information that a large consignment of yaba pills was about to be smuggled via Sabrang, he claimed. Sensing the presence of the BGB men, the criminals attacked them, forcing them to retaliate, added Lt. Col. Shukkur and Ilias sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, doctors declared them dead after they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Mohammad Ilias
data.description: According to BGB Battalion-2 Commanding Officer Lt. Col. Asadud Zaman Chowdhury, Abdul Shukkur and Mohammad Ilias were engaged in a "gunfight" with BGB men in Teknaf's Sabrang area. The incident happened around 3:30 am after BGB men took positions in the area based on information that a large consignment of yaba pills was about to be smuggled via Sabrang, he claimed. Sensing the presence of the BGB men, the criminals attacked them, forcing them to retaliate, added Lt. Col. Shukkur and Ilias sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, doctors declared them dead after they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Nazir Ahmed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers, Nazir Ahmed and Gias Uddin, were killed in a gunfight with Teknaf police. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed that they conducted a raid in the Howaikang area of the upazila based on information that a group of robbers was attempting to carry out a robbery in the Nayapara Battali area. Sensing the presence of the police, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing the police to retaliate, he added. On the other hand, family members of Gias alleged that the police had arrested him a few days ago. When asked, the OC denied the allegation.

data.name: Selim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Munshiganj's Sirajdikhan upazila, a suspected robber named Selim, 42, from Sonakanda in Dhaka's Keraniganj, was killed in a gunfight with the police. Asaduzzaman, the additional superintendent of Munshiganj police, claimed that the incident occurred around 11:00 am on March 1, 2019, when the police and a group of robbers engaged in a "gunfight".

data.name: Lalu Mia
data.description: Lalu Mia was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Kalibari area. "Upon receiving information that a group of narcos was trading drugs in the Kalibari Puratan Godaragaht area, a police team conducted a raid around 1:30 am," said Shah Kamal Akanda, the officer-in-charge of the Detective Branch of Police in Mymensingh, who also led the team. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug traders opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, which resulted in a "gunfight," he added. Lalu sustained bullet wounds during the shootout and was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Md. Nurul Islam
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a shootout with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar early Thursday. The deceased was identified as Nurul Islam, 32, son of Abdul Gafur. Acting on secret information, a team from BGB-2 conducted a raid at Delpara village around 4 am, said Major Shariful Islam Jamaddar, acting commanding officer of BGB-2. Sensing the presence of the team, the criminals opened fire on the BGB personnel, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gun battle. Later, BGB found Nurul's body at the scene.

data.name: Mustaq Mia
data.description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in what police claimed was an infighting among drug peddlers in Cox's Bazar's Ukhia upazila early yesterday. The victims were Mustaq Mia, 35, and Mokter Mia, 32, from the Balukhali area in Ukhia upazila. They were siblings. Nurul Islam, inspector (investigation) of Ukhia Police Station, said police went to the Patuar Tek area near Teknaf marine drive road around 3:00 am, based on information that some drug peddlers were exchanging gunfire. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, members of the gang fled the scene. Police found Mustaq and Mokter with bullet injuries, he said. Abul Khayer, officer-in-charge of Ukhia Police Station, said the siblings were listed as drug peddlers and wanted in several narcotics cases.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: GG Biswas, officer-in-charge of Mohammadpur Police Station, claimed that a police team had set up a checkpoint in the area around 2:30 am based on information that a mugging gang was supposed to gather there. Sensing the presence of the police, the muggers, who were riding in a car, sped up their vehicle in front of the police checkpoint. During the chase, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Both criminals were injured in the "gunfight". One of them was taken to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College and Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Badar Uddin
data.description: Budu, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with police.

data.name: Yasin Arafat
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar, hours after he was picked up by the law enforcers. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they detained Yasin from Teknaf town on the evening of 18 March over his alleged involvement in various crimes, including yaba trade and an attack on the police. "Based on his information, the police conducted a raid in the Mitha Panirchhara area around 2:00 am to arrest his accomplices," the OC added. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the miscreants opened fire, prompting the police to retaliate, which triggered a "shootout," he said. At one point, Yasin came in the line of fire and was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Jamal Haq
data.description: Mamun-or-Rashid, the officer-in-charge of Comilla Sadar Dakkhin police station, stated that a police team raided Dhanpur based on information that a group of suspected drug peddlers had gathered in the area. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the suspected peddlers opened fire on the law enforcers, who retaliated. The 'gunfight' came to an end within a few minutes as the peddlers fled the scene, according to the OC. During the incident, Jamal was shot and wounded. He was immediately taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Nur Mohammad
data.description: Acting on information, the police first arrested Nur Mohammad from the Zero Point area of Teknaf town around 7:00 pm on 21 March and detained Nurul Amin from the same area after gathering information from Nur Mohammad, said Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. The two were interrogated at the police station. Based on their information, the police, along with them, were going to the Rajarchhara area to recover firearms and yaba pills around 3:00 am, said the OC. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, some drug peddlers opened fire to snatch the arrestees, forcing them to fire back in self-defense, the police official added. During the "gunfight," Nur Mohammad and Nurul Amin were hit by bullets when they were trying to flee from police custody, he said. The injured were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Korban
data.description: Korban, the primary suspect in the Abu Taher Sagor murder case, was killed in a "shootout" with the Detective Branch of the police in the Khurushkul area of Cox's Bazar Sadar upazila around 3:00 am, according to Farid Uddin Khandakar, the officer-in-charge of Sadar Model Police Station. The police claimed to have found a firearm and three bullets at the scene.

data.name: Abu Taleb
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Abu Taleb, a suspected robber, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB in Banshkhali upazila of Chattogram. He was a resident of Chakaria upazila in Cox's Bazar. Major Mehedi Hasan, Deputy Director of Rab-7, told The Daily Star that the gunfight took place at the Chhoto Chonua area of Banshkhali upazila at around 4:00 am. He said that acting on a tip-off, a patrol team of Rab raided the area where the robbers were preparing to commit robbery in the sea-bound fishing trawlers. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering a gunfight. Later, RAB members recovered Taleb's body and handed it over to Banshkhali Police Station.

data.name: Mohammad Ilias
data.description: Shariful Islam Jamaddar, the acting commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Cox's Bazar, stated that a "gunfight" erupted between BGB and a group of drug traders in Teknaf's Kharangkhali area around 4:30 am while a BGB team was conducting an anti-narcotic operation there. At one point, the drug traders, who had crossed the Naf River to enter Bangladesh, retreated, according to Shariful. Later, the BGB personnel discovered two injured men with bullet wounds at the scene. The two individuals were immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead. The police later identified the deceased as Mohammad Ilias, 18, from Kutupalong Rohingya camp, and Faruk Mia from Balukhali camp.

data.description: In Pekua upazila of Cox's Bazar, two suspected robbers were killed in another "gunfight" with RAB in Magnama coastal area around 4:00 am. The identities of the two could not be confirmed. Mehedi Hasan, company commander of RAB-7, said they were members of a robbery gang operating in the Bay of Bengal. He claimed they recovered eight firearms and 26 bullets from the spot.
