data.name: Shafik
data.description: An alleged top criminal from Narsingdi was killed in a "shootout" with RAB in the Bhasantek area. Lt. Col. Kazi Shamsher Uddin, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said a RAB team raided a house in Bhasantek around midnight on March 26th to arrest Shafik. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on the RAB men. The law enforcers fired retaliatory shots, triggering the "gunfight," the RAB official added. Shafik, accused in at least 12 cases, was injured by bullets. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead around 1:30 am.

data.name: Kawsar Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Gazipur, Kawsar Mia was injured in a "shootout" with the police in Tongi around 4:00 am, hours after he was picked up by law enforcers from the Gazipura area. The police took the injured Kawsar Mia to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. OC Kamal Hossain of Tongi East Police Station said they picked up Kawsar, accused in several criminal cases, on the afternoon of March 26 when he was preparing to commit a mugging. Later, a police team took him to Tongi's Banshpatti area and conducted a drive to recover illegal arms. At one stage, Kawsar's associates fired bullets at the police to snatch him away. Law enforcers fired retaliatory shots, forcing them to retreat. The OC claimed the arrestee was hit with bullets fired by his cohorts. Kawsar's family members said he was not facing any murder or robbery case. The police picked him up from near his home around 3:00 pm on March 26. They heard the news of his death on March 27 morning.

data.name: Tarzan Manir
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, the Detective Branch (DB) of the Police intercepted a microbus around 4:30 am in the Aftabnagar area, according to Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of the DB. "The miscreants opened fire on the policemen from inside the microbus, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight," the official said. The two individuals were injured during the shootout and were declared dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, he added.

data.name: Mohammad Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mohammad Hossain was killed in a "gunfight" between a drug gang and law enforcers near Habirchara union of Teknaf upazila. Upon receiving information that a gang of robbers was preparing for a robbery in the hilly area near Habirchara, the police raided the scene around 4:00 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire on them, according to Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police. The law enforcers returned fire in self-defense, he added. At one stage, the criminals retreated, and the police recovered the bullet-hit body of Mohammad Hossain. He was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead, said the police officer.

data.name: Mahmudur Rahman
data.description: Three alleged drug peddlers, including a Rohingya woman, were killed in "gunfights" with the police and Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf. Police and BGB officials claimed that the three were involved in yaba trading. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said a police team went to the Moulvibazar Bridge area around 4:00 am on information that two groups of yaba peddlers were exchanging bullets. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire in self-defense, triggering the "gun battle," the OC said. At one stage, the criminals escaped and the law enforcers found the bullet-hit bodies of Mahmudur and Absar on the spot. They were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later shifted to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for better treatment. They died there around 8:00 am, the OC said. In another similar incident, a female drug peddler, Rumana, was killed by the BGB.

data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a 'gunfight' with DB police at Bhabanipur intersection under Kashimpur police station in Gazipur city. Gazipur Metropolitan Police detective branch Additional Deputy Commissioner Manzur Rahman said that a team of DB police, acting on secret information that a group of drug peddlers were staying at an abandoned house near Bhabanipur intersection, raided the area. "Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, which triggered the gunfight," the police official said. After the gunfight, the DB team rescued Jahangir with bullet injuries and took him to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ghano Shankor Chakma
data.description: Ghano Shankor Chakma, a suspect in the Rangamati seven-murder, was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the joint forces. He was a member of a regional political party, according to Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmed, the commanding officer of RAB-7. The RAB official stated that he was accused in the murder case. On the other hand, MA Manzur, the officer-in-charge of Rangamati's Baghaichhari Police Station, mentioned that a case had been filed against 40-50 unnamed assailants. Shankor's name was not included in the case, but the police were monitoring him, the OC said. Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of the army and RAB conducted a raid in the remote Dochhari area in Naikhongchhari around 10:00 am. Shankor was shot dead during the "gunfight," and nine to ten others managed to escape, according to the RAB official.

data.name: Jamal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two alleged robbers, Jamal and Nayem, were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB members in the Tejgaon area. Mohiuddin Faruque, Company Commander of RAB-2, said that the RAB team set up a checkpoint in Tejgaon based on information that the alleged robbers would escape with a stolen lorry through that area. When the RAB members signaled the vehicle to stop around 4:00 am, the "robbers" opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, claimed Mohiuddin. The two sustained bullet injuries during the "shootout" and were pronounced dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH).

data.name: Nur Alam
data.description: Nur Alam, Mohammad Jubayer, and Hamid Ullah - three Rohingya men suspected to be robbers - were killed in a "gunfight" with the police near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid near "H-block" of the camp based on information that a gang of robbers was hiding their arms in the area. Sensing the presence of the police, the gang members opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one point during the "gunfight", the three sustained bullet injuries. They were then rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the OC further claimed.

data.name: Shariful Islam Sharif
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Sharif, a suspected robber, was killed in a police firing during a robbery attempt on the Soydabad-Belkuchi regional road. After receiving a tip-off about an organized group of robbers placing a tree on the road to commit robbery, a team of police conducted an operation in the area, according to Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sirajganj Sadar police station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers attempted to attack them, leading the police to open fire. Shariful was shot while his accomplices managed to escape the scene, stated the OC. Later, he was taken to Sheikh Fazilatunnesa Mujib Memorial Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Mahram Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The Officer in Charge (OC) of Bhairab Police Station, Mokhlesur Rahman, said, "Acting on a tip-off, the police conducted a raid in the area around 2 am on Wednesday. A gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in the area. Upon seeing the law enforcement, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight. At one point, the police arrested Mahram, who had been shot, and took him to Bhairab Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ruhul Amin
data.description: A man accused in drug-related cases has been killed in an alleged shootout with the police in Chuadanga. The shootout occurred in Ukto village in Sadar Upazila early on Saturday, according to the police. The man has been identified as Ruhul Amin, 48, who hailed from Chuadanga Sadar municipal area. He was named on the drug trafficker's list and wanted in 16 drug cases. A patrol team of police took position in the village after being tipped off that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled through the village, Abu Zihad Fakhrul Alam Khan, chief of Sadar Police Station, told bdnews24.com. A gang of seven to eight drug dealers carrying sacks full of drugs was spotted crossing the area around 2 am, and the police team challenged them. At that time, the gang members opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate. “After 15 minutes of gunfight, the drug dealers fled the scene. Along with the local residents, the police recovered bullet-hit Ruhul Amin and took him to Chuadanga Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.”

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: Habibur Rahman, an alleged criminal, was killed in a gunfight with RAB in the Salna area of Gazipur town. He was accused in 13 cases filed with different police stations, according to RAB. RAB-1 Company Commander Lt. Abdullah Al-Mamun said the gunfight occurred around 2:30 am when RAB conducted an operation in the area, acting on a tip-off that arms were being smuggled there. Sensing their presence, the arms dealers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, the elite force claimed. Rahman's body was sent to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Mostafa Kamal
data.description: The deceased was Mostafa Kamal, 33, a resident of the village Kawak in the Ullapara municipal area of Sirajganj. A New Age correspondent in Sirajganj reported that Mostafa was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Ghoshgati under Ullapara upazila in Sirajganj at about 2:00 am on Saturday. Inspector (Investigation) Md Golam Mostafa of Ullapara police station said that they received a tip-off about a group of drug peddlers dealing drugs, so they raided the Ghosgati area at about 2:00 am on Saturday. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back and triggering the gunfight. Kamal was killed on the spot, while the other peddlers managed to flee, he said.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: In Cox's Bazar's Ukhia upazila, two Rohingyas allegedly involved in the drug trade were killed during a "gunfight" with BGB in the Keruntoli area, according to BGB Battalion 34 Commander Ali Haidar Azad Ahmad. Upon receiving information that a gang of peddlers was present at Keruntoli, the BGB dispatched a team to conduct a raid. Sensing the presence of the BGB, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the BGB to retaliate, stated Commander Ali. He further mentioned that the BGB subsequently informed the police about the incident. The police later discovered the two bodies, along with 20,000 yaba pills and four sharp weapons, in their possession at the scene, as reported by Sub-Inspector (SI) Dipankar Roy of Whykong Police Outpost in Teknaf upazila.

data.name: Mohiuddin
data.description: Mohiuddin, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with RAB-15 on Marine Drive road in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar. RAB-15 Wing Commander Azim Ahmed said the gunfight occurred when RAB was conducting an anti-narcotic drive in the area around 4:00 am. Injured Mohiuddin was rescued while 10,000 yaba pills, a firearm, and ammunition were recovered from the spot. Mohiuddin died of his injuries at Cox's Bazar General Hospital around 11:00 am.

Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire, which forced the police to retaliate, he added. During the "gunfight," Jabed Hossain, 21, sustained bullet injuries. Later, the police rushed him to Chattogram Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the AC further added.

data.name: Malek
data.description: An alleged smuggler was killed in another "gunfight" with BGB men in Jaluapara area of Comilla's Sadar upazila yesterday. The deceased is Malek, 30, from Naogaon. Lt. Col. Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, commanding officer of BGB Battalion-10, claimed they conducted an "anti-drug operation" in Jaluapara area around 4:30 am. During the raid, BGB and smugglers exchanged gunshots. At one point of the "gunfight," Malek sustained bullet injuries. When BGB rushed him to Comilla Medical College Hospital, doctors declared him dead, the BGB official added.

data.name: Alam
data.description: Md Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said that a 45-year-old man named Alam, also known as Gaja Alam, was killed in a gunfight in Dhaka's Diabari area. Alam, who was a resident of the area, was accused in at least 16 cases with different police stations. Kamruzzaman claimed that a team of RAB conducted a raid in the area around 2:00 am after receiving information about drug smuggling. Upon sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire, leading to a confrontation. During the gunfight, RAB discovered Alam's body with multiple bullet wounds. He was immediately taken to Tongi Shaheed Ahsan Ullah Master General Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Dil Mohammad
data.description: Dil Mohammad, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police hours after he was picked up by the law enforcers. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said the police arrested Dil Mohammad from Teknaf around 5:00 pm on April 23. Around 12:15 am on April 24, a police team conducted a raid near Marine Drive along with Dil Mohammad to recover firearms and yaba, he claimed. Sensing the police presence, Dil Mohammad’s associates opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, Pradip added. Dil sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, he was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Upon realizing the presence of the law enforcement, the suspected robbers initiated gunfire towards the police, leading them to retaliate by returning fire, resulting in a gunfight, according to Ferdous. Subsequently, the police discovered two individuals who had been shot and injured, and they were immediately transported to the Kutubdia Upazila Health Complex where the attending doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Rafiq Uddin
data.description: Rafiq Uddin, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Bhadalia Shawastipur area. Nasir Uddin, the officer-in-charge of Kushtia police station, stated that there were several cases against him for reported charges of drug abuse and dealing. Acting on a tip-off, a team from Kushtia and the Detective Branch of the police jointly conducted a raid in the area at around 3:00 am. Two groups of drug peddlers were exchanging gunfire when the police arrived. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the drug peddlers opened fire, forcing the police to retaliate and triggering the gunfight. After the gunfight, the police found Rafiq shot and wounded. They took him to Kushtia General Hospital, where the doctors on duty declared him dead.

data.name: Mujibur Rahman Jitu
data.description: Jitu, a suspected drug trader, was killed in a "shootout" with the police. Alamgir Hossen, OC of Moulvibazar Police Station, said that they were tipped off about a consignment of yaba pills being smuggled through the village. A patrol team from the Detective Branch (DB) of Police took position in the area, according to Rashedul Islam, additional superintendent of police in Moulvibazar. When a gang of alleged drug traders was crossing the area with sacks full of yaba around noon, the DB team intercepted them. The gang members opened fire on the police, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a "gunfight". After an hour-long battle, when the drug traders fled the scene, the police recovered the injured Jitu and took him to Moulvibazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Saiful
data.description: A team of RAB-7 conducted a raid in the Uttar Amirabad area around 3:00 am after being tipped off about Saiful's location. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Saiful and his cohorts opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a "gunfight". Later, RAB recovered Saiful, who had been wounded by a bullet, and sent him to Lohagara Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Bagha Babu
data.description: Ziaur Rahman, the officer-in-charge of Sadar Police Station, said that the police arrested Bagha from his home in Chunakhali village around 4:00 pm. Later, the police, along with Bagha, conducted a raid to apprehend his other accomplices in the Pulpara area. During that time, Bagha's accomplices attacked the police with sharp weapons and also opened fire. In response, the police fired back. Bagha, who was attempting to escape police custody, was struck by bullets, while the others managed to flee, according to the OC. Bagha was then taken to Chapainawabganj Sadar Hospital. However, as his condition worsened, he was transferred to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where he eventually passed away.

data.name: Jahirul Islam
data.description: Debashish Karmakar, Company Commander of Madaripur Rab, said that a team of RAB-8 from Barisal went to Char Airkandi around 4 am after receiving information that two groups of drug dealers were exchanging gunfire. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, resulting in a gunfight. Jahirul was struck by bullets and his accomplices fled the scene. He was quickly taken to Madaripur Sadar Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Shafiur Rahman Jyoti
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Sonatan Chakraborty, Additional Superintendent of Police (Bogra Sadar Circle), said they went to the Goalkandi Bridge area in Sherpur around 1:30 am on May 1st, acting on information that two groups of outlaws were trading bullets there. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals fled, leaving behind the bullet-hit body of Shafiur. He was rushed to Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, the police official added. However, quoting locals, Shafiur's wife, Rawshan Ara, 60, said that some plainclothes men introduced themselves as police and picked up her husband from Koichar Beel area in Dhunat on April 29th.

data.name: Abdullah Al Paleel
data.description: Border Guard Bangladesh officials reported that Abdullah Al Paleel, also a suspected drug vendor, was killed in a "gunfight" with BGB personnel at Bablalpura Akashashi Garden under Sadar upazila in Comilla district on May 3 at about 3:00 am.

data.name: Hazrat Ali
data.description: Officer-in-Charge Shah Kamal of Mymensingh Detective Branch of Police stated that they received information about a gathering of drug peddlers in the Savar area, located under Nandail upazila. Acting upon this information, they conducted a raid in the early hours of 4th May, along with local police officers. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the suspected drug peddlers fired shots at them, to which the police responded with gunfire, resulting in a gunfight that led to the death of Hazrat.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Khulna, a patrol team of the Rapid Action Battalion heard screams from the house of Kamrul Islam Gazi in Shantinagar, Dumuria. They advanced towards the house and discovered a group of robbers committing a robbery, according to Dumuria police station officer-in-charge, Md Aminul Islam. The robbers, upon sensing the presence of RAB, opened fire on them. The RAB members retaliated, resulting in a gunfight. The RAB personnel rescued an unidentified robber who had been shot and took him to Dumuria upazila health complex. The on-duty doctors at the health complex declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Abdullah
data.description: Lt. Col. Faisal Hasan Khan, the commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion, said that a BGB team had established a checkpoint at Khonkarpara on Marine Drive Road after receiving information about drug smuggling. When the BGB personnel signaled a motorcycle to stop around 4:00 am, the riders opened fire, which compelled them to retaliate. Abdullah was struck by bullets and was pronounced dead upon arrival at Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Solaiman Bahadur
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mashkur Rahman, Assistant Director (Media Wing) at RAB-7, said the "gun battle" took place in Choto Chonuya village around 12:15 am. A patrol team of RAB went there on information that some robbers had gathered on the spot to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the criminals opened fire, and the RAB personnel returned fire, triggering the "gunfight," claimed the RAB official. Mashkur said that after the "gun battle," RAB members found the bullet-hit body of Bahadur on the spot and took him to Banshkhali Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Muhammad Alam
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, a "gunfight" between alleged drug traders and the police left two Rohingya men dead in the Leda camp area of Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that Alam and Rafiq were detained by the police at their respective camps on the evening of May 5th. Based on their information, the police, along with Alam and Rafiq, conducted a raid to recover yaba and firearms from the area. Sensing their presence, cohorts of the criminals began firing, forcing the police to retaliate. After the alleged gunfight, the criminals fled the scene. The police found Rafiq and Alam with bullet wounds and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Muhammad Rafiq
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, a "gunfight" between alleged drug traders and the police left two Rohingya men dead in the Leda camp area of Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that Alam and Rafiq were detained by the police at their respective camps on the evening of May 5th. Sensing their presence, cohorts of the criminals began firing, forcing the police to retaliate. After the alleged gunfight, the criminals fled the scene. The police found Rafiq and Alam with bullet wounds and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Panna Rana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Panna alias Rana, Julhus and Kamruzzaman– all alleged robbers– were killed in a gunfight with RAB in the Sundarbans at Chandpai Range. Panna was the alleged leader of Panna Bahini, said Maj Md Shamim Sarder, company commander of Rab-6. The "gunfight" took place in Khonta Kodail canal area near the Pashur River, where Rab conducted a raid around 6:00am, he said. The criminals tried to flee after opening fire on the Rab men, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. After the "gunbattle" subsided, the three suspected robbers were found lying on the spot. They were declared dead after being taken to Mongla Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Julhas

They were declared dead after being taken to Mongla Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman Jewel
data.description: Mizanur Rahman Jewel got injured in a gun battle that broke out in Dumni, Khilkhet neighborhood of the capital around 1 am, said Md Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1. "A team of the elite force raided the area on a tip-off that drug traders had gathered there. The criminals opened fire, provoking retaliation from the RAB men. Jewel was shot and declared dead after being taken to the Kurmitola General Hospital," Kamruzzaman added. Jewel was accused in 13 cases, he further stated. A firearm, ammunition, and 1,950 pieces of yaba tablets were seized from the spot, the officer said.

data.name: Sujan Mia
data.description: Sujon Mia, who was accused in 11 drug cases, was killed in a reported gunfight in the Ramsingh area of Sadar Upazila in Munshiganj. RAB-11 police superintendent Enayet Mannan said they raided the area based on a tip-off. Sujon and his accomplices fired at the RAB, leading to a gunfight. Afterwards, the RAB took the bullet-hit Sujon to Munshiganj General Hospital, where the physician pronounced him dead.

data.name: Shahidul Islam Sumon
data.description: Shahidul Islam Sumon was charged with rape and extortion in nine cases, said Saifur Rahman, additional superintendent of police (circle-a), Rangpur. "Sumon and his cohorts were roaming around East Ichali village during the early hours of May 7th. A police team went there to apprehend Sumon, who was shot while attempting to escape. His cohorts managed to flee on motorcycles. "Sumon died while being transported to Rangpur Medical College Hospital. His body was sent to the morgue for autopsy," said SP Saifur.

data.name: Ashraf Ali
data.description: Ashraf Ali, a suspected drug dealer, was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Agargaon area. A team of RAB 2 had asked a group of people to stop at a checkpoint in Agargaon, but they opened fire at them, triggering a skirmish, said RAB sources. The suspected drug dealer was killed during the gunfight, according to the sources.

data.name: Mohammad Masum
data.description: Two men were killed in a "gunfight" between RAB and an alleged group of drug dealers in the Jhauban area. Tipped off that a group of smugglers were trading drugs, a team of RAB-15 took positions near the Diabetic Hospital Point around 2:00 am, the RAB official said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the smugglers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a "shootout," he added. Later, RAB members recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two men were killed in a "gunfight" between RAB and an alleged group of drug dealers in the Jhauban area. Tipped off that a group of smugglers were trading drugs, a team of RAB-15 took positions near the Diabetic Hospital Point around 2:00 am, the RAB official said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the smugglers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a "shootout," he added. Later, RAB members recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Belal
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Belal was killed in a reported gunfight with the police. Pranab Chowdhury, the Officer-in-Charge of Khulshi police station, said that during his surrender, Belal promised to give up criminal activities and informed them that he had illegal firearms. Based on this information, a police team accompanied Belal to Jalalbad Hill in Khulshi at around 1:00 am the next day to retrieve the weapons. However, as they arrived at the location, a group of unidentified gunmen attacked them in an attempt to snatch Belal away, according to the OC. The police officers retaliated by firing, which led to a gunfight. After the shootout, the police found Belal injured and rushed him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ziarul Islam
data.description: Md Shahidullah, Rajshahi Superintendent of Police, said that they received a tip-off about two groups of 'drug traders' exchanging gunshots in an attempt to establish supremacy. A police team immediately rushed to the scene at around 2:30 am. As the police chased the suspects, the drug peddlers started firing at them, forcing the police to retaliate. This led to a 'gunfight'. During the course of the 'gunfight', the drug smugglers managed to escape while Kalu sustained bullet injuries. Kalu was quickly taken to Bagha Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead. Meanwhile, Isma Begum, the wife of the deceased, claimed that four plainclothes men abducted her husband, Kalu, from the Kishorpur area of Bagha while he was returning home on his motorcycle with his business partner on the night of May 8th.

data.name: Yaqub Ali Kajal
data.description: Kajal was accused of raping a schoolgirl and committing an acid attack on a housewife, according to Gangni police officer-in-charge Harendranath Sarkar. Kajal threw acid on a housewife on May 10th, and upon receiving information, the police arrested him by raiding the village of Dhola in the Kathuli union on the same day. He confessed to the police about his involvement in the acid attack. Kajal also informed the police that he owned several weapons, added the OC. Later, the police, accompanied by Kajal, went to a bamboo orchard in Garadhob at around 2:30 am to recover the weapons. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Kajal's accomplices opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight, Harendranath added. After the gunfight, the police found Kajal with bullet injuries, but his associates managed to flee. The police took him to the Gangni Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dudu Mia
data.description: Dudu Mia was named in a list of narcos prepared by the home ministry, according to Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Acting on a tip-off, a police team arrested Dudu near his house on the night of May 10th and conducted a raid in the Moheshkhalipara area to recover a haul of hidden yaba pills and firearms. Dudu was taken along with them, stated the OC. Upon reaching the location, Dudu's associates opened fire on the police team, forcing them to retaliate, resulting in a "shootout," the OC added. Dudu was caught in the crossfire when he attempted to flee from police custody, he further added. He was then taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Shah Alam, who was accused of killing a woman, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Bakalia area. Shah Md Abdur Rouf, the Additional Deputy Commissioner of Chittagong South Metropolitan Police, stated that Shah Alam had been at loggerheads with local criminal Hasan. He went to the residence of Hasan's aunt in the Bojroghona Madina Mosque area around 10:00 pm on Saturday in search of Hasan. As Hasan was not there, Shah Alam became furious and attempted to shoot Hasan's cousin, Rubel. When Rubel's elder sister Bubli tried to stop him, Alam shot her, leaving her critically injured," he said. The injured woman was taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared her dead. Later, a police team raided the Bolirhat area, which is adjacent to the River Karnaphuli, around 3:30 am to arrest Shah Alam. When the police team arrived, Alam's associates opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, resulting in a gunfight that left Alam dead on the spot.

data.name: Mostafa Hossain
data.description: Shah Kamal Akand, Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch of the police, stated that acting on a tip-off, a joint team of the DB and Ishwarganj police conducted a raid in the area around 12:45 am. As soon as the team reached the spot, drug peddlers hurled brick chips and opened fire, aiming at the team, which resulted in a gunfight. Akand claimed that after the gunfight, the police discovered Mostafa at the scene with gunshot wounds. He was then transported to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Azim Ullah
data.description: Azim Ullah was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 23 in Shamlapur area, and Abdus Salam was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 15 in Jamtoli area, said Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. Acting on a tip-off that a gang of human traffickers had gathered some people in the Shamlapur Marine Drive Road area in an attempt to smuggle them into different districts in the country, a police team conducted a raid around 4:00 am, the OC said. Sensing their presence, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a "gunfight". Later, the police recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: Azim Ullah was a resident of Rohingya camp number 23 in Shamlapur area, and Abdus Salam was a resident of Rohingya camp number 15 in Jamtoli area, said Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. Sensing their presence, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a "gunfight". Later, the police recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Sayedul Mostafa
data.description: Bhulu was killed in a "shootout" with the police in the Katapahar area. The police were about to conduct a drive to recover illegal firearms, taking Mostafa along with them, said Farid Uddin Khandaker, OC of Cox's Bazar Sadar Model Police Station. As soon as they reached the spot, Mostafa's cohorts opened fire on them, forcing the police to retaliate, the OC said. Mostafa was injured during the incident and was shot. He was then taken to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hafizur Rahman Titas
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a police team raided a sugarcane field around 3:00 am where the miscreants were preparing for a robbery, according to Bahauddin Faruki, OC of Ishwardi Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on the cops, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight," said the OC. Later, the police recovered Titas with a bullet injury and took him to Ishwardi Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Jessore, a man died in a gunfight between the police and a gang of suspected robbers in the early hours of Tuesday. The deceased, Abul Kashem, had multiple cases filed against him, according to the police. The Jessore Additional Superintendent of Police said, "Responding to a tip-off about an ongoing robbery on the Jessore-Magura Highway near Nangarpur, the police were met with gunfire by the gang of robbers. The police returned fire in self-defense, and the gang retreated. Afterwards, the police retrieved a bullet-injured body. He was taken to Jessore General Hospital where the on-call physician declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Siraj
data.description: Mohammad Siraj, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police after being arrested. The incident took place at 8:30 pm on May 15, 2019, in a salt field near the Naf River in Teknaf.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.description: Mohammad Abu Salam Miah, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Model Police Station, said that they raided Shahidul's house early in the morning. Shahidul and his associates opened fire as soon as the police reached the place, triggering a gunfight. After the skirmish, the police arrested Shahidul with gunshot wounds from the spot. He was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: The officer-in-charge of Teknaf police station, Prodip Kumar Das, stated that associates of Ibrahim fired at the law enforcers during a operation to apprehend him in the area. In retaliation, the police returned fire, resulting in injuries to Ibrahim and his associates. While his associates managed to escape, Ibrahim was left behind, as reported by the OC. Ibrahim was pronounced dead after being transported to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Munir
data.description: Two suspected "hijackers" were killed in an alleged "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Hazaribagh Beribadh area. According to RAB officials, a gang of hijackers hijacked a covered van carrying nine tonnes of tea from Ishpahani Tea Ltd from Srimangal five to six days ago. Acting on a tip-off, RAB-2 set up a checkpoint in front of Madhu City under Hazaribagh police station in Old Dhaka and intercepted a van while it was crossing the checkpoint around 2:45 am. Sensing the impending danger, the hijackers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back. After a brief gunfight, the RAB recovered the bodies of van driver Munir and his assistant Gias from the spot, said RAB-2 superintendent Mohiuddin Faruqi.

data.name: Giasuddin
data.description: Two suspected hijackers were killed in an alleged gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Hazaribagh Beribadh area. According to RAB officials, a gang of hijackers hijacked a covered van carrying nine tonnes of tea from Ishpahani Tea Ltd in Srimangal five to six days ago. Acting on a tip-off, RAB-2 set up a checkpoint in front of Madhu City under Hazaribagh police station in Old Dhaka and intercepted a van while it was crossing the checkpoint around 2:45 am. Sensing the impending danger, the hijackers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back. After a brief gunfight, RAB recovered the bodies of van driver Munir and his assistant Gias from the spot, said RAB-2 superintendent Mohiuddin Faruqi.

data.name: Mohammad Monsur
data.description: Monsur was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Mohammad Mohsin, Officer-in-Charge of the Kotwali police, said that a patrol team of police chased a gang of muggers when they snatched a bag from a woman in the Tigerpass area at night. When the auto-rickshaw carrying the hijackers reached the Pologround area, they opened fire on the police, forcing them to fire back, triggering the gunfight. After the gunfight, the police rescued the bullet-hit Monsur from the spot and took him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Selim Miah
data.description: In Comilla, a suspected "drug peddler," Selim Miah, was killed in a "gunfight" with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Golabari. Lieutenant Colonel Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, Commanding Officer of BGB 10-Battalion, said that a special team of BGB raided the border area. Sensing the presence of the BGB, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, prompting them to fire back, triggering the gunfight. Selim sustained a bullet wound during the gunfight, and doctors declared him dead when he was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Nazmul Hossain
data.description: Nazmul Hossain, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch of the police in Meherpur. Obaidur Rahman, the officer-in-charge of Meherpur DB, said one of their teams raided Gangni upazila’s Karamdi village around 3:30 am based on information that a gang of drug peddlers was holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of the DB personnel, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire, he claimed. At one stage, the attackers fled, but Nazmul's body was found on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Hanif
data.description: The officer in charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station, Pradip Kumar Das, said that they detained Mohammad Hanif, 38, during a special operation on Wednesday morning. According to his confession, the police, along with Hanif, conducted a raid in the Malbari Marine Drive area early on Thursday to recover drugs and firearms. Upon sensing the presence of law enforcement, Hanif's associates opened fire on the police, which led to a gun battle. After a brief exchange of gunfire, the police found Hanif with a bullet wound and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where the doctor on duty declared him dead, the OC said.

data.name: Jakir Hossain
data.description: Kala Jakir, a suspected drug dealer, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. He was killed in the Palpara Bridge area of the city. Abu Salam Mia, the officer-in-charge of Kotwali Model Police station, said that a team from the police station raided the area after receiving a tip-off about the presence of drug dealers. During the operation, the suspected drug dealers started shooting at the policemen, who retaliated with gunfire. After the suspects fled the scene, the bullet-ridden body of Jakir was found, according to the OC.

data.name: Abdul Hakim
data.description: A meat trader was allegedly beaten to death by policemen in Gopalpur upazila on Friday. Eight policemen were attached to the district police lines last night for their suspected involvement in the incident. The deceased was Abdul Hakim, 55, son of Abul Qasem of Jhawail village. Hasan Al Mamun, the in-charge of Gopalpur police station, said a team led by sub-inspector Abu Taher and assistant sub-inspector Ashraful Alam conducted a drive on Jhawail Technical College playground in the afternoon. "They caught four men gambling. Hakim tried to flee and suffered a heart attack. He died while being taken to the hospital by his relatives," Mamun claimed. However, it is unclear why the policemen did not take the man to the hospital themselves. Locals said that Hakim fell sick after being beaten up by the police. He was rushed to Gopalpur Upazila Health Complex where the physicians pronounced him dead. His relatives blamed the police for his death and demanded exemplary punishment for the killers.

data.name: Hasan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Alleged robbers Hasan, Mustain, Mainul, and Haider were killed in a gunfight with RAB at Jongrakhal in the Sundarbans in Mongla upazila of Bagerhat. According to RAB, Hasan was the alleged ringleader of a robber gang called Hasan Bahini. The other three were members of the gang. Acting on a tip-off, a RAB team raided the Sundarbans area under Chandpai range at night, said Mufti Mahmud Khan, RAB's legal and media wing director. Sensing the presence of the RAB members, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the gunfight. The four robbers were hit and died on the spot.

data.description: Alleged robbers Hasan, Mustain, Mainul, and Haider were killed in a gunfight with RAB at Jongrakhal in the Sundarbans in Mongla upazila of Bagerhat. According to RAB, Hasan was the alleged ringleader of a robber gang called Hasan Bahini. The other three were members of the gang. Acting on a tip-off, a RAB team raided the Sundarbans area under Chandpai range at night, said Mufti Mahmud Khan, RAB's legal and media wing director. Sensing the presence of the RAB members, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the gunfight. The four robbers were hit and died on the spot.

data.name: Salimullah
data.description: According to information, a team of Border Guard Bangladesh conducted a raid in Noapara around 1:00 am, as stated in a press release issued by Lt Col Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, commanding officer of BGB-10 Battalion. Upon sensing the presence of the BGB personnel, the criminals initiated gunfire. In response, the BGB members fired back, resulting in a "gun battle". The "drug dealers" were struck and subsequently transported to a nearby hospital, where doctors pronounced them deceased.

data.name: Nannu
data.description: Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said the police were looking for the two "notorious youths" - Nannu and Babu - as they have been committing crimes like extortion and mugging for a long time. A patrol team of RAB-1 raided the Tongi Bridge area based on information that a gang of criminals was mugging people there. Sensing RAB's presence, the muggers tried to hide below the bridge. As RAB members approached them, they opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, claimed Kamruzzaman. At one point, the duo sustained bullet injuries. RAB rushed them to Ahsanullah Master General Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Saiful Karim
data.description: Saiful Karim, a notorious yaba kingpin, was shot and killed when the police exchanged fire with his associates in Cox's Bazar. Pradip Kumar Das, the Officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, stated that they apprehended him from Marine Drive in the tourist town around 10:00 pm on May 30. Saiful was arrested by law enforcement officials at Dhaka airport on May 25 upon his arrival from Myanmar. He had fled there after the government declared a war on drugs in May of last year. Pradip mentioned that during the interrogation, Saiful disclosed that a large consignment of yaba was being smuggled into Bangladesh from Myanmar through the Naf river. Consequently, the police accompanied Saiful to conduct a raid in the area around 4:00 am in order to seize the pills. "Upon sensing the presence of the police, the associates of the yaba kingpin opened fire, leading the police to retaliate and resulting in a gunfight," said Pradip. Saiful, along with four policemen, sustained injuries and were transported to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, according to the OC. Saiful was later transferred to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: A suspected drug trader has been killed in a "gunfight" with Border Guards Bangladesh (BGB) in the Hili border area of Dinajpur. The deceased is Delwar Hossain, 45, from Nandipur in Hili. The incident occurred in Chengram village in the early hours of Friday. Three BGB members have also been injured in the gunfight, Joypurhat 20 BGB battalion Commander Lt Col Rashed Md Anisul Haque said. Rashed said, "Delwar was detained in Nandipur, of the Hili border area, while trying to enter Bangladesh from India with 958 yaba pills. Later, based on his information, a BGB platoon conducted a special drive in the Chengram area. However, upon seeing BGB, a group of drug traders shot at them, prompting BGB to fire back," Rashed added. "Delwar was hit by a bullet in the gunfight. Three BGB members were also injured." Delwar was pronounced dead after being admitted to Hakimpur Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Abdul Gafur
data.description: Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, BGB Commanding Officer of Teknaf-2, said that after receiving a tip-off about the smuggling of a consignment of Yaba, a team of BGB conducted a raid in the Kayukhkhali area. Sensing the presence of the BGB, the yaba traders opened fire on them, which led to the BGB firing back and triggering a gunfight, he added. Later, the BGB recovered two individuals with bullet injuries from the scene and sent them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Shamim
data.description: Shihabur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Puraton Kasba Police Outpost, claimed that they raided the Kholadanga area around 3:00 am based on information that two groups of drug dealers would meet there. When the law enforcers reached the spot, the drug dealers were already engaged in a "gunfight," the OC said. He added that upon sensing the police presence, the criminals escaped the scene, leaving Shamim behind with bullet injuries. The OC stated that doctors declared Shamim dead after he was taken to Jashore General Hospital.

data.name: Mufizur Rahman
data.description: Based on the information provided by Mufizur, a police team conducted a raid on a clandestine location to seize weapons and drugs at around 4:00 am, as stated by Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf police station. Upon reaching the scene, Mufizur's accomplices opened fire on the law enforcement officers, compelling them to retaliate in self-defense, resulting in a gunfight. Pradip Kumar mentioned that after the conclusion of the gunfight, they rescued Mufizur, who had sustained bullet injuries, and transported him to Sadar hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Jubayer
data.description: Nur Alam, Mohammad Jubayer, and Hamid Ullah - three Rohingya men suspected to be robbers - were killed in a "gunfight" with the police near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid near "H-block" of the camp based on information that a gang of robbers was hiding their arms in the area. Sensing the presence of the police, the gang members opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one point during the "gunfight", the three sustained bullet injuries. They were then rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the OC further claimed.

data.name: Ismail
data.description: In Gazipur, an alleged drug peddler named Ismail was killed in a shootout with the RAB. "A RAB team was conducting an anti-narcotics raid in the river port area when drug peddlers opened fire on them," said Kamal Hossain, officer-in-charge of Tongi East Police Station. "Ismail was killed during the gunfight," he said, adding that a firearm, bullets, and several thousand Yaba pills were recovered from the spot.

data.description: In Chittagong, two suspected "robbers" were killed in Sitakunda upazila. RAB-7 Assistant Director (Media) Masuqur Rahman said one of their teams went to the area to foil a robbery attempt on the highway. "The robbers opened fire as soon as our team reached Chhoto Kumira around 2:00 am. After the skirmish, the bodies of two robbers, firearms, and bullets were recovered," he claimed.

data.name: Monirul Islam Babul
data.description: In Thakurgaon, according to Border Guard Bangladesh 42 commanding officer Lieutenant Colonel Gazi Nahid Uz Zaman, it was reported that a suspected drug peddler named Monirul was killed in a 'gunfight' with BGB members at Fakirganj under Pirganj in Thakurgaon. He stated that a BGB team arrested Babul on the night of June 5th. Later, the team, along with Babul, conducted a raid in the Fakirganj area to recover drugs. Upon sensing their presence, Babul's associates opened fire on them, which forced the BGB members to fire back, resulting in a gunfight. Lieutenant Colonel Zaman claimed that at one point, Babul was caught in the line of fire and died, while his accomplices managed to escape.

data.name: Shamsul Alam
data.description: Teknaf Police arrested Shamsul, Noor, and Habib from the Leda area under Teknaf for their alleged involvement in the abduction of a Rohingya child, demanding Tk 5 lakh in ransom. Police rescued the child. Then, the police raided the Leda area at about 11:45 pm on June 6th, along with the three accused, to recover illegal firearms and arrest their accomplices. Sensing the presence of the police, the accomplices opened fire, and the police also fired back, triggering a 'gunfight'. The trio became critically injured, falling in the line of fire, the OC said. The injured were immediately rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.description: Deputy Commander Shafayat Jamil Fahim of RAB-7 stated that a team of RAB, acting on information, positioned themselves at the Fatehpur level crossing on 9 June. During this time, a group of drug peddlers fired at RAB officials. Shafayat claimed that RAB officials responded with gunfire, resulting in a gunfight. Afterwards, RAB personnel discovered two severely injured 'drug peddlers' and promptly transported them to Feni General Hospital, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Unidentified

RAB officials retaliated with gunshots, resulting in a gunfight, as claimed by Shafayat. Later, RAB personnel discovered two critically injured 'drug peddlers' and promptly transported them to Feni General Hospital, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Abdullah Al Zonayed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Abdullah Al Zonayed (35), described as "an infamous gangster," died on Tuesday, five days after being injured in a 'gunfight' with the district detective (DB) police in Bogura. The incident occurred last Thursday around 2 am when a patrol team of the district detective police approached Adarsha College. At that time, terrorists targeted and fired at the police, who returned fire, injuring Zonayed. He was quickly rescued and admitted to Bogura Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital. When his condition deteriorated, he was transferred to the National Orthopedic Hospital in Dhaka for advanced treatment. District Detective OC Aslam Ali confirmed Zonayed's death, stating that he died around 3 pm while undergoing treatment at the National Orthopedic Hospital.

data.name: Russel Mahmud
data.description: Russell Mahmud, from Narayanganj, was shot during a police raid in Hoaikong area around 1:30 am, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. He was on his way to buy a haul of yaba pills from suspected local drug dealer Amir Hamaja when the police were conducting a drive in the area, the OC added. Sensing the police presence, the drug peddlers opened fire and the officers retaliated, he said. At one point, the drug peddlers fled the scene and the bullet-riddled body of Russell was found, he added. He was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dil Mohammad
data.description: Lt Mirza Shahed Mahtab, the camp commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf, said that a RAB team conducted an anti-drug operation in the Paharidhala area around 3:00 am. They acted on a tip-off that some drug peddlers would be smuggling yaba pills there. Upon sensing the presence of the RAB members, the drug peddlers opened fire. The RAB team retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight," according to the RAB official. After the exchange of gunfire, the RAB team discovered three bullet-hit drug peddlers. They were immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead, the official added. However, family members of Shahidul claimed that he was a trader. They alleged that at around 11:00 am on June 15, four plainclothes men in a microbus arrived at his shop on IBP road in Cox's Bazar town and abducted him. Shahidul's father, Abul Kashem, was present at the time and stated that the plainclothes men were armed. "My son had been living abroad for many years. He returned home six or seven months ago and started running a grocery shop. He has not been accused in any case," he said. Kashem mentioned that the plainclothes men returned to the shop after two hours and provided them with a mobile number for contact. However, he was unable to reach anyone as no one answered his calls. After Shahidul's abduction, traders from Cox's Bazar town's Boro Bazar submitted a memorandum to the Cox's Bazar police superintendent, requesting assistance in locating Shahidul. They also informed RAB about the incident. However, all parties denied any involvement in Shahidul's abduction.

data.name: Tanvir Ahmed Anik
data.description: Tanvir Ahmed Anik, the alleged ringleader of the criminal gang known as the "Seven-Star Group," was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Acting on a tip-off that Tanvir and his associates would be gathering in Basila, a team of RAB conducted a raid to apprehend them. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire, prompting the officers to return fire, resulting in a shootout. Afterwards, RAB members found Tanvir and quickly transported him to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Tofayel
data.description: Abdullah Al Mamun, officer-in-charge of Comilla Sadar South Model Police Station, said that based on information, a team of police conducted an anti-drug operation in the Rajapara Chowmohoni area around 2:15 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug peddlers opened fire on them. The OC added that a "gunfight" broke out when the police retaliated by firing back. Later, the police found Tofayel with bullet injuries and took him to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Lipu
data.description: DB police arrested Lipu on the evening of 19 June and went on a drive to recover firearms in the city's Dapa Balur Math area. When they reached the scene around 3:00 am, Lipu's associates opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate, said Kamrul Hasan, Sub-Inspector of DB police. Lipu came in the line of fire during the "gunfight" and was taken to Narayanganj General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

The gunfight took place around 12:30 pm when a team from Rab-7 raided Banshkhali upazila's Saral area in Chattogram. They went there to arrest the two robber brothers. Mashkur Rahman, assistant director of Rab-7 (media wing), said that as Rab members reached there, the robbers and their cohorts sensed their presence and opened fire on them. The Rab members retaliated by firing back. After a brief "gun battle," the law enforcers found two bullet-hit bodies on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Nur
data.description: In Cox's Bazar's Ukhiya, a suspected Rohingya drug trader was killed in a reported gunfight with BGB in the Rahmater Bill area. The deceased was identified as Mohammad Nur, 25, son of Nurul Kabir from the Thaingkhali Rohingya camp. Confirming the matter, Major Ashraf Ullah Rony, additional director of BGB, said, "The drug traders were caught red-handed while smuggling yaba pills, and they started firing at us, triggering the gunfight. Nur received a gunshot and died on his way to the hospital, while his associates escaped." The dead body has been sent to Cox's Bazar Hospital for autopsy, and a case has been filed with the Ukhiya police station.

data.name: Leon Siddique
data.description: Leon, an accused in at least 17 cases including murder, narcotics, and extortion, was arrested by the police in Konabari upazila of Gazipur on the night of 1 July, said Alamgir Hossain Majumdar, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Kailakair Police Station. The police official claimed that a team of policemen, along with Leon, conducted a raid in the Shafipur area of Gazipur’s Kaliakair upazila around 1:00 am to recover firearms. Sensing their presence, Leon's cohorts opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point during the gunfight, Leon was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet wounds, the OC added. Later, the policemen rushed Leon to Kaliakair Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hamid Prakash
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that the police arrested a "top-listed drug dealer" named Hamid around 4:00 pm on July 1st in the Moheshkhalipara bazaar area of Teknaf. Based on his information, a team of policemen, along with Hamid, went to the Moheshkhalipara area around 2:00 am to recover firearms, as claimed by the OC. Sensing the presence of the police, Hamid's associates opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point during the gunfight, Hamid was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries, he added. The police rushed Hamid to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead, the OC further stated.

data.name: Sabbir Hossain Nayan
data.description: The main suspect in the Rifat murder case was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and the police in Barguna. A team of Barguna police rushed to the Purbo Burirchar area around 4:15 am after receiving information that Sabbir Hossain Nayan, also known as Nayan Bond, who, along with another person, brutally killed Rifat Sharif in broad daylight on June 26, was hiding there. When the team reached near the Purkata ferry ghat, which is approximately 10 kilometers away from the district town, they were attacked by Nayan's associates. In self-defense, the police retaliated and exchanged gunfire, as stated by Maruf Hossain, the superintendent of police in Barguna, during a press conference at his office.

data.name: Ramzan Mia
data.description: Ramzan Mia, the suspected key planner of Badda Awami League leader Farhad Hossain's murder, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Badda area. Acting on information about Ramzan's return home, a team from the Detective Branch of the police conducted a raid in the Satarkul area of the capital to apprehend him. Sensing their presence, Ramzan and his accomplices opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcement officers to retaliate. During the exchange of gunfire, Ramzan was caught in the crossfire and sustained bullet wounds. He was immediately taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead, according to Deputy Commissioner (DB North) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, Mashiur Rahman.

data.name: Salim Ullah
data.description: Salim Ullah, a suspected drug trader, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB members near the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf marine drive at North Silkhali point in Cox's Bazar. Officials from RAB-15 media wing said a team of RAB personnel, acting on a tip-off that a group of drug dealers were staying in the area, raided North Silkhali point at about 4:00 am. Sensing the presence of RAB personnel, the suspected drug dealers opened fire, forcing the RAB members to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. After the gunfight ended, RAB members found Salim shot and killed on the spot and later handed him over to the Teknaf police.

data.name: Mohammad Waliullah
data.description: Shahed Mahamud, Officer-in-Charge of Bera Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, the police arrested Waliullah from the Bera municipality area on the night of 3 July, the OC said. Later, they conducted a raid in the Jorda area to recover a batch of hidden drugs and firearms, taking the arrestee along with them, he added. When they reached the spot, Waliullah's accomplices opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a "gunfight". Waliullah was hit by a bullet during the incident and was taken to Bera Upazila Health Complex, where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Ruhul Amin Ripon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in the Dhopaghat area of Sadar upazila in Sherpur early Wednesday, according to UNB. The deceased is Ruhul Amin Ripon, 30, son of Kalu Mia from Mirganj of the district town. The Superintendent of Police of the district, Ashraful Azim, said the police were conducting raids to arrest offenders who had previously attacked a man in the Gouripur area. During a raid at Dhopaghat, miscreants fired gunshots at the police around 3 am, and the law enforcers retaliated.

data.name: Anwar Hosen
data.description: Anwar was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Dhaka's Uttarkhan area around 2:00 am. Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said that a team of RAB-1 raided the Uttarkhan area based on information that a group of drug peddlers had gathered there. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point during the gunfight, Anwar sustained bullet injuries. RAB rushed Anwar to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: Saiful Islam was killed in a gunfight with law enforcers in Mymensingh's Bhaluka upazila around 1:15 am. The police official claimed that they raided the Hatiber area of Bhaluka based on information that Saiful and his cohorts had gathered there. Sensing the police presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point, as the "gunfight" ended, the police found the bullet-hit body of Saiful. They rushed Saiful to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saiful Islam Geda
data.description: Saiful Islam Geda was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. He had been arrested a day before his death. Arbinda Sarkar, the Officer-in-Charge of Sujanagar Police Station, claimed that a police team, accompanied by Saiful Islam Geda, conducted a raid in the Hasampur field area around 2:30 am to recover firearms. Sensing their presence, Saiful's accomplices opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight", Saiful sustained bullet injuries. The police immediately rushed him to Sujanagar Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Abdul Malek
data.description: Abdul Malek was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Malek was the son of Mokbul Hossain from the Natun Pallanpara area of the district, as stated by Prodip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. The police arrested him after a team conducted a raid in the Lengurbeel Mathchara area at around 12:15 am. Upon sensing their presence, a group of yaba traders opened fire on the police, which led to the police firing back and initiating a "gunfight," added the OC. Later, the police found Malek injured by a bullet at the scene and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Lavlu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB (North), said that the police arrested some individuals posing as RAB and DB members in different parts of the city. During the interrogation, they informed the police that a group of robbers would gather in the area. Subsequently, a team from DB conducted a raid in the area at around 1:00 am and intercepted a microbus. As four individuals in the vehicle attempted to escape, they opened fire. In the ensuing skirmish, three of them sustained injuries, while one managed to flee the scene. The injured individuals were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where Lavlu, aged 50, succumbed to his injuries around 4:00 am. Kamal Hossain, who was wounded by a bullet, also passed away due to his injuries at the National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopaedic Rehabilitation (NITOR) in Shyamoli, Dhaka on November 12, 2019.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang

Kamal Hossain, who was wounded by a bullet, also passed away due to his injuries at the National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopaedic Rehabilitation (NITOR) in Shyamoli, Dhaka on November 12, 2019.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: Manik was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Additional Superintendent of Police (Addl SP) in Natore, Harun-or-Rashid, told the press that the police had arrested Manik from Ishwardi on July 12. He was held in another case filed on charges of shooting a college student before snatching his motorcycle on July 5 in Natore's Baraigram upazila. Addl SP in Natore, Akramul Islam, said that a team of police was conducting drives to arrest Manik's accomplices, taking him along with them. When they were crossing the Gopalpur area around 2:00 am, Manik's cohorts opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back. Manik was caught in the line of fire when he tried to escape the prison van, he added. Later, the police took him to Lalpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mufid Alam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Mufid Alam was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Teknaf upazila. Pradip Kumar Das, the Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested Mufid around 8:30 pm on July 13. Gathering information from him, a police team conducted a raid around 1:30 am in the Nayapara area, accompanied by Mufid. Sensing their presence, Mufid's accomplices opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Mufid sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, he was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Biplob
data.description: Biplob was killed during a raid led by the Detective Branch (DB) of the police in Chandmari of Narayanganj around 3:00 am, said Kamrul Hassan, a sub-inspector of Narayanganj DB. "DB personnel led the anti-drug raid on a tip-off. Sensing their presence, the miscreants opened fire. A gunfight ensued as the police retaliated." "Biplob was found lying on the ground with gunshot wounds after his accomplices managed to flee. He was taken to the Narayanganj General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Amin
data.description: Amin drowned in the Padma River during a gunfight between the police and his cohorts at Kashiadanga, according to local police. "Based on a tip-off about a drug consignment being transported, a police team raided Kashiadanga around 3:00 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire, triggering a gunfight," said Monsur Ali Arif, Officer-in-Charge of Kashiadanga Police Station. Amin's body was found floating in the river after the other peddlers fled the scene, stated the official. The police took Amin to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Asmaul Saudagar
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in an alleged gunfight with officials from the Border Guard Bangladesh. Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Foysal Khan, Commanding Officer of BGB-2 Battalion, stated that one of their teams conducted a raid in the Jajimura Shikolpara area around 12:30 am based on information about drugs being smuggled through the Naf river. The criminals opened fire as soon as the border guards arrived at the scene. The BGB personnel retaliated in self-defense, resulting in two individuals sustaining bullet wounds. They were immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where they were both pronounced dead.

data.name: Zabed Mia
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in an alleged gunfight with officials from the Border Guard Bangladesh. Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Foysal Khan, Commanding Officer of BGB-2 Battalion, stated that one of their teams conducted a raid in the Jajimura Shikolpara area around 12:30 am based on information about drugs being smuggled through the Naf river. The criminals opened fire as soon as the border guards arrived at the scene. The BGB personnel retaliated in self-defense, resulting in two individuals sustaining bullet wounds. They were immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where they were both pronounced dead.

data.name: Hamida Begum
data.description: Three suspected drug peddlers, including a 32-year-old woman, were killed in two incidents of 'gunfights' with law enforcement agencies in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar, early Wednesday. The deceased are Hamida Begum, 32, wife of Sami Uddin from the Jaimora area in Teknaf, Asmaul Saudagar, 35, son of Rizwan Saudagar from Charmukundi in Chandpur, and Zabed Mia, 34, son of Jabbar Ali from Basundia in Jashore. Hamida is reportedly the second suspected female drug dealer killed since the beginning of the countrywide anti-drug drive. A press release issued by the Teknaf police stated that a police team, acting on information that two groups of drug peddlers were engaged in a 'gunfight,' conducted a raid in the Jadimora area near the River Naff at approximately 4:45 am. It claimed that the police opened fire to regain control of the situation, searched the area after the peddlers had fled, found Hamida with bullet wounds, and transported her to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the attending doctor declared her dead.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.description: Rafiqul Islam was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Nasir Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Kushtia Model Police Station, claimed that they raided Harora field based on information that two groups of drug peddlers were holding a secret meeting there. As soon as the police team reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight", the police found Rafiqul's body lying on the spot. The rest of the criminals managed to flee. The victim's wife alleged that he was picked up on July 18 from his in-laws' house.

data.name: Mohammad Hossain
data.description: Mohammad Hossain was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Teknaf. He had been arrested two hours prior to the "gunfight," according to the police. Prodip Kumar Das, the Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, stated that they received information about a large consignment of yaba being stored in Whaikhyang. A police team, accompanied by Mohammad, conducted a raid in the area. Upon their arrival, a group of drug peddlers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, as claimed by the OC. Mohammad sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight" and was immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Subsequently, the on-duty doctors referred him to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where he passed away around 3:00 am.

data.name: Shipon Mia
data.description: Shipon Mia was killed in a reported gunfight with the police. Tipped off, a team of police conducted a drive in the area, said AKM Mahbubul Alam, officer-in-charge of Bakshiganj police station. At one stage, Shipon and his associates opened fire on the police, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a 'gun battle'. Shipon sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee the scene. He was taken to Bakshiganj Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Khalek
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Khalek and Belal were members of a local robber gang known as Khalek Bahini. They were killed when they engaged in a "gunfight" with RAB members at Chandpai Range in the Sundarbans. Major Shajibul Islam, deputy commander of RAB-8, claimed that a team was patrolling the area when Khalek Bahini opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight", both individuals sustained bullet injuries. Around 7:00 am, RAB members rushed them to Khulna's Dacope Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Belal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Khalek and Belal were members of a local robber gang known as Khalek Bahini. They were killed when they engaged in a "gunfight" with RAB members at Chandpai Range in the Sundarbans. Major Shajibul Islam, deputy commander of RAB-8, claimed that a team was patrolling the area when Khalek Bahini opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight", both individuals sustained bullet injuries. Around 7:00 am, RAB members rushed them to Khulna's Dacope Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Habibur Rahman
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers, including a Rohingya man, were killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf upazila. The deceased were identified as Mohammad Kamal, 22, son of Islam of Balukhali camp, and Habibur Rahman, 23, son of Abul Shama of Nayapara in Teknaf upazila. BGB officials said that the gunfight took place along the bordering Najirpara area. A BGB-2 team raided the area around 2:00 am acting on a tip-off that a Yaba consignment was being brought into the country through the border point, said Major Mohammad Rubayet Kabir, additional director of BGB-2. The BGB team came under fire as soon as it reached the spot. Kamal and Habibur were killed in the ensuing gunfight, the BGB official said.

data.name: Mohammad Kamal
