The deceased were identified as Mohammad Kamal, 22, son of Islam of Balukhali camp, and Habibur Rahman, 23, son of Abul Shama of Nayapara in Teknaf upazila. BGB officials said that the gunfight took place along the bordering Najirpara area. A BGB-2 team raided the area around 2:00 am acting on a tip-off that a Yaba consignment was being brought into the country through the border point, said Major Mohammad Rubayet Kabir, additional director of BGB-2. The BGB team came under fire as soon as it reached the spot. Kamal and Habibur were killed in the ensuing gunfight, the BGB official said.

data.name: Maharaj Khalifa
data.description: Maharaj Khalifa, who was accused in at least 29 drug-related cases, died while receiving treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital after sustaining a bullet injury in the Satarkul area of Dhaka's Badda, according to Senior ASP Kamruzzaman of Rab-1. A RAB team conducted a raid in the area based on information that Khalifa and his associates had gathered there for drug dealing. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing Rab members to retaliate, claimed RAB. Khalifa was caught in the line of fire during the "gunfight," he claimed, adding that Rab members then rushed him to DMCH where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Najmul Hasan
data.description: Najmul Hasan, also known as Byanga Babu, was killed in Mirpur's Beribadh area around 3:15 am, according to Senior ASP Sajedul Islam of Rab-4. He was accused in at least 20 cases, including eight murders, as stated by Rab. He had fled to India a few years ago and returned to Dhaka to participate in a mission to commit murder, reported UNB, quoting Major Kazi Saifuddin Ahmed, second-in-command of Rab-4.

data.name: Sujan
data.description: Sujan was killed in a gunfight with the BGB.

data.name: Jaker
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Jaker, a suspected robber, was killed in a "gunfight" with Rab in Chattogram's Banshkhali. According to Major Mahedi Hasan, deputy director of RAB-7 (Chandgaon camp), a team of the elite force conducted a raid in Purba Chambal's hilly areas based on information that a robber gang was located there. As soon as they located the criminals and approached them, Jaker and his cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he claimed. RAB later found Jaker's body with bullet wounds at the scene, and it was discovered that Jaker's cohorts managed to escape.

data.name: Mohammad Suman
data.description: Lt. Col. Ashique Billah, the commanding officer of RAB-2, claimed that Suman, an illegal arms trader, was killed when a RAB team, acting on a tip-off, conducted a raid in the Hazaribagh area to seize firearms from him. He stated that when the team reached near Shikder Medical College around 4:30 am, Sumon opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight". Eventually, Sumon was struck and died on the spot.

data.name: Omar Faruk
data.description: Omar Faruk, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a "shootout" with members of RAB 2 in Teknaf upazila. Acting on a tip-off that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled into the country through Marine Drive road, a RAB team took positions at Baharchhara Uttar Shilkhani around 3:00 am, said Mohiuddin Faruki, Company Commander of RAB-2. The team signaled a car to stop, but the drug peddlers in the vehicle opened fire, forcing the RAB members to return fire. After the "gun battle," the team found Abdur Rahman and Omar Faruk injured with bullet wounds and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: Abdur Rahman, a suspected drug dealer, was killed in a "shootout" with members of RAB 2 in Teknaf upazila. Acting on a tip-off that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled into the country through Marine Drive road, a RAB team took positions at Baharchhara Uttar Shilkhani around 3:00 am, said Mohiuddin Faruki, Company Commander of RAB-2. The team signaled a car to stop, but the drug peddlers in the vehicle opened fire, forcing the RAB members to return fire. After the "gun battle," the team found Abdur Rahman and Omar Faruk injured with bullet wounds and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Arman
data.description: Arman was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion. He was accused in a case filed over the rape of a grade VIII student in the area earlier this month, said Mashkur Rahman, Assistant Director (AD) of RAB-7 (media wing). According to the RAB official, a team of the elite force conducted a raid in the upazila's Kusumpur union around 4:00 am on information that the suspected criminal was hiding there. As soon as the RAB team reached the area, Arman and his cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.description: Ibrahim was killed in a "gunfight" with BGB members in Teknaf. Lt. Col. Foysal Hasan Khan, Commanding Officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Teknaf, said a BGB team signaled a Cox's Bazar-bound auto-rickshaw to stop around 4:00 am in Kurearmukh area near Marine Drive road. "But the criminals ignored the signal and opened fire on the BGB team, triggering the gunfight," he said. The "criminals" then got down from the vehicle and continued firing. After the "gun battle," the BGB members found Ibrahim's body lying on the spot.

data.name: Hafizur Rahman
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Teknaf. The "gunfight" occurred on the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in the Damdamia area around 3:00 am when law enforcement signaled a lorry, carrying Hafizur and Sabbir, to slow down. Shah Alam, the company commander of Teknaf RAB-7 camp, claimed that instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at RAB members, prompting the RAB members to retaliate. The "gunfight" resulted in the death of the duo on the spot.

Shah Alam, the company commander of Teknaf RAB-7 camp, claimed that instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at RAB members, prompting the RAB members to retaliate. The "gunfight" resulted in the death of the duo on the spot.

data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, stated that a police team conducted a raid in the Nurullaguna hill area around 3:30 am after receiving information that 10 to 15 robbers were preparing to commit a robbery. As the police reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight," the police recovered the bodies of Junayed, Mehedi, and Ayub, who had been hit by bullets. The law enforcers immediately rushed them to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Soleman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Soleman was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Chunarughat upazila's Dewatali Kalinagar area. Nazmul Haque, OC of Chunarughat Police Station, said a team of police conducted a raid in the Dewatali Kalinagar area around 3:00 am after receiving information that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery. Sensing the police action, the robbers opened fire at the law enforcers, resulting in a "gun battle," according to the OC. The incident left Soleman injured, and he died on the way to the hospital.

data.name: Jahirul Islam
data.description: Shah Kamal Akanda, Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch of Mymensingh police, said that acting on a tip-off, they launched a drive in Phulbaria upazila's Kaladah Eidgah area around 2:30 am to arrest Jahirul. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals fired shots at the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. Police found Jahirul lying there with bullet wounds, and they took him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jony Mia
data.description: Police conducted a raid in the Char Puliamari area of Mymensingh around midnight, based on information that a group of suspected drug peddlers were gathering there. A "gunfight" ensued at approximately 12:30 am when the criminals opened fire on the law enforcement officers. The DB official stated that during the incident, alleged drug peddler Jony Mia sustained critical injuries. He was subsequently taken to MMCH, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: Lt. Col. Faisal Hasan Khan, captain of Teknaf BGB, said they launched a drive at Kharangkhali of Hoikang area near the Naf river around 3:30 am. "Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire at the BGB, triggering a gunfight," the BGB official said. Injured Nurul and Delwar were admitted to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later, they were shifted to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official added. The BGB said they seized 20,000 yaba pills, two firearms, two sharp weapons, and four bullets from the spot.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: Lt. Col. Faisal Hasan Khan, captain of Teknaf BGB, said they launched a drive at Kharangkhali of Hoikang area near the Naf river around 3:30 am. "Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire at the BGB, triggering a gunfight," the BGB official said. The BGB said they seized 20,000 yaba pills, two firearms, two sharp weapons, and four bullets from the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Aiyub
data.description: Aiyub was killed in a "gunfight" with the BGB in the Ruppati area. Anwar Hossain, Additional Director of the 34th BGB Battalion in Cox's Bazar, said a BGB team was conducting a drive in the area around 4:00 am. The team signaled a motorbike to pull over, but the bikers didn't comply and opened fire at the BGB men. The BGB personnel fired retaliatory shots. The "gunfight" lasted for about 10 minutes. Later, the BGB men informed the Inani Police Outpost about the incident. Police rushed to the spot and found Aiyub lying there with bullet wounds. Aiyub was taken to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead, said the BGB official.

data.name: Ashraful Islam
data.description: Muhammad Mohiuddin Faruque, superintendent of RAB-2, said they set up a checkpoint on the Dhaka-Tangail highway in Kaliakoir upazila based on information that a consignment of drugs was scheduled to pass from Dhaka to Chuadanga. In the afternoon, a car attempted to evade the checkpoint. Pursuing the car, RAB officials reached an isolated area. Eventually, the car became stuck in a roadside Tamarisk bush. Unable to find an escape route, Ashraful, the driver of the car, allegedly pointed a gun at the RAB officials, according to the superintendent. In self-defense, the RAB official fired a shot that injured Ashraful. In response, Ashraful fired back, prompting the RAB officials to retaliate with additional gunfire. The man died on the spot, as claimed by the RAB official.

data.name: Shishir Ghosh
data.description: Shishir Ghosh, an accused in multiple cases, was killed in a "shootout" with the police. However, Shishir's family has alleged that the police picked him up from in front of his house and killed him just hours later. Sunil Ghosh, Shishir's uncle and a local journalist, said a team of the Detective Branch (DB) of the police picked Shishir up on 6 August around 8:30 pm. "In the name of recovering arms, they took him near a brick kiln in the Mahidia area and shot him dead. They then left his body at the hospital," Sunil said. "I had called the DB's officer-in-charge [OC] over the phone [after Shishir was taken], and he said nothing would happen to Shishir and that they just took him for questioning. But I later found his dead body at the hospital.

data.name: Malek Fakir
data.description: Malek Fakir was killed in a "gunfight" with members of RAB. Raisuddin, Additional Superintendent of RAB-8, claimed that a team of the elite force challenged a group of drug peddlers around 4:00 am in the Jagua-Choupashar Pole area of the city. At one point, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Fakir sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, RAB members rushed him to Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Chinu Mia
data.description: Chinu Mia was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. AKM Mehdi Hasan, the officer-in-charge of Gobindaganj Police Station, claimed that they conducted a raid on the banks of the Karatoa based on information about Chinu and his gang's whereabouts. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire, which led the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight," Chinu sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Sajal Mia
data.description: Sajal Mia was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of the Detective Branch of the police at Nizam Nagar. Shah Kamal Akand, the Officer-in-Charge of the DB, said one of their teams raided the area around 1:30 am after receiving a tip-off that drug peddlers were selling drugs in the area. The drug peddlers opened fire as soon as the DB team reached the area, resulting in a gunfight, according to the OC. Sajal, who was shot during the gunfight, was arrested and taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Chan Mia Hawlader
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Chan Mia Hawlader was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Mostafizur Rahman, the Officer-in-Charge of Patuakhali Police Station, stated that Chan had been sentenced to 10 years' imprisonment in a robbery case but managed to evade capture. The OC claimed that they conducted a raid in the Karomjatala area of the upazila around 2:00 am after receiving information that a group of criminals had gathered there for a robbery. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, he further claimed. At one point, Chan sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Al-Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The Officer-in-Charge of Bhola Sadar Police Station, Md Sagir Mia, stated that a police team was conducting raids in the Rajapur area to apprehend robbers. Upon hearing gunshots nearby, they proceeded towards the location at Rajapur flood protection embankment around 2:30 am. He mentioned that two groups of pirates were engaged in a shootout over the division of their loot. The OC explained that when the police approached the area, the suspected robbers opened fire on them, prompting the police personnel to retaliate with gunfire, resulting in a gunfight. Eventually, the robbers escaped on trawlers, and the police conducted a search of the area. They discovered two unidentified suspected robbers with bullet wounds and immediately transported them to Bhola General Hospital, where the on-duty doctors pronounced them dead.

They discovered two unidentified suspected robbers with bullet wounds and immediately transported them to Bhola General Hospital, where the on-duty doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Babul
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar early today. The deceased was identified as Babul, 26, son of Anwar Hossain of Hinla Pashchim Sikdarpara in the upazila, said Pradip Kumar Dash, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station. Tipped off that some drug peddlers were dealing drugs in a hilly area, a police team launched a drive around 2:30 am, our Cox's Bazar correspondent reports. Sensing the presence of the police team, a group of drug dealers opened fire, forcing the lawmen to fire back in self-defense, triggering a "gunfight". After the gunfight, the police rescued Babul, who suffered injuries from a bullet, the OC said. Babul was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later shifted to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, said the OC.

data.name: Kamal Hossain Prokash
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Kamal Hossain Prokash was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Pekua. RAB conducted a raid in the Mognama Ghat area of Pekua based on information that a group of robbers, led by Badsha, was preparing for a robbery there. Major Mehedi Hasan, Cox's Bazar Company Commander of RAB-7, claimed that upon sensing RAB's presence, the criminals opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight", the criminals fled the scene, leaving Prokash with bullet wounds. RAB rescued Prokash and rushed him to Pekua Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Nur Alam
data.description: Nur Alam and another alleged Rohingya drug peddler, Sarker, were killed in gunfights with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB). A BGB-2 team conducted a raid in the Hoaikong Urubunia Katakhal area after receiving a tip-off about a large amount of yaba being smuggled from there, said BGB-2 Deputy Commander Major Shariful Islam Jamaddar. The BGB members signaled a boat to stop on the Naf River, but the smugglers ignored the signal and opened fire, triggering a gunfight. "Alam and Sarker were killed during the shootout," Maj Shariful said, adding that BGB members recovered the bodies and sent them to a local hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Ekhlas Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Ekhlas Uddin was killed in a reported gunfight with the Detective Branch (DB) of the police at the Chakua Daria intersection in Mymensingh. The incident took place nearly two days after he was allegedly picked up by plainclothes men. Ekhlas's father, Nurul Islam, said Ekhlas was a ruling party activist, and three young men, whom he was familiar with, came to their house and asked him to go out with them. Ekhlas then went to Sadua Marker Bazar on his motorbike around 3:00 pm on 20 August. "Around 4:00 pm, we were informed that plainclothes men picked him up. His mobile phone has been switched off since then," said Nurul. "I also asked the young men who took Ekhlas out about where he is, but they could not say. Even the motorbike has yet to be recovered," he added. The police also denied picking him up. The family then decided to lodge a general diary with the local police station yesterday, but around 4:00 am, they heard the news of Ekhlas's death on television.

data.name: Sumon Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Sumon Chakma was killed during a gunfight with the army at Baghaihat, under Baghaichari upazila in Rangamati. Sumon was an activist of the Prachit Jyoti Khisha-led faction of UPDF and also a suspect in the murder of Nannerchar upazila chairman Shaktiman Chakma, according to the police. An army team conducted a raid at Dopata to apprehend some hooligans. As they arrived at the location, a group of miscreants opened fire on them at approximately 10:30 am, and the soldiers retaliated by returning fire. The gunfight lasted for about five minutes until the attackers retreated. However, Sumon Chakma was shot and killed during the exchange of gunfire.

data.name: Abdus Shukkur
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf police station, stated that a "gunfight" occurred around 1:30 am when one of their teams conducted a raid in the Jadimura hill area. This action was based on information that some individuals involved in a murder case had gathered there. Upon realizing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals initiated gunfire, prompting the police to retaliate, resulting in the "gunfight". After the criminals fled, the police discovered Abdus Shukkur and Muhammad Shah, who had been hit by bullets, lying at the scene. They were immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Muhammad Shah

They were immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Abdus Sahid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Based on information that a group of robbers were planning to target the house of a Bangladeshi expatriate, the police conducted a raid in the Maricha area around 1:15 am, according to Meer Md Abdul Naser, the Officer-in-Charge of Zakiganj Police Station. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the criminals initially threw bricks and then resorted to opening fire on the law enforcement officers, which forced them to retaliate, he stated. "As we pursued them, they managed to escape. However, during a search of the area following the exchange of gunfire, we discovered Shahid lying on the ground with gunshot wounds. We immediately rushed him to the upazila health complex, where the attending doctors pronounced him dead," the OC explained. The police also reported the recovery of a locally made firearm, five empty bullet shells, and various sharp local weapons from the scene.

data.name: Hasan
data.description: Acting on information that Rohingya criminals were gathering beside Jadimura Hill, the police led a drive around 1:30 am, said Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, Pradip Kumar Das. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the policemen to respond. He added that the police fired 10 bullets in self-defense. After the gunfight ended, the police rescued the injured Rohingya youth from the spot and admitted him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. He was later transferred to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the OC said.

data.name: Nabin Jyoti Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)

data.description: In a press release, the Inter Services Public Relations Directorate (ISPR) stated that a gunfight broke out after the team arrived in Boradam based on information that seven to eight armed criminals from the UPDF (Prasit Group) had gathered there. Upon sensing the presence of the army personnel, the criminals opened fire on them, leading the patrol team to retaliate. The gunfight lasted for approximately 10 to 15 minutes. At one point, the criminals were compelled to retreat, resulting in the death of three members of the UPDF (Prasit Group), as stated in the press release.

data.description: In Chattogram, a patrol team of RAB encountered a group of armed criminals around 3:00 am, said Mashukur Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-7 (media wing). Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on RAB members, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, the criminals fled the scene. Later, RAB members recovered the body.

data.name: Rasel Mia
data.description: Rasel was killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch of the police in Comilla Sadar upazila. Mainuddin Khan, the Officer-in-Charge of the DB police in Comilla, said that a team of DB police conducted a raid in the Sreepur area based on information that a group of drug peddlers had gathered there. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, OC Mainuddin added. During the "gunfight," Rasel sustained bullet injuries. Later, the policemen rushed him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sujon Mia
data.description: Sujon Mia was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB-1. A RAB team conducted a raid in the Salna area based on information that some youths were selling firearms and illegal drugs there, according to Quamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate. During the "gunfight," Sujon sustained bullet injuries. RAB members then rushed him to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Iran
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Iran, accused in at least 10 cases filed with Banshkhali Police Station, was killed in a "gunfight" with members of RAB around 8:00 am. Major Mehedi Hasan, deputy director of RAB-7, said a patrol team of RAB raided the East Chambal area of the district based on information that a group of robbers had gathered there. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. Iran sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight" and died on the spot.

data.name: Rokonuzzaman Siddiq
data.description: Rokonuzzaman Siddiq was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Sukumar Biswas, the Officer-in-Charge of Damurhuda Police Station, said a police team raided Joyrampur village of the upazila around 2:30 am based on information that two groups of drug peddlers were distributing narcotics. Sensing the presence of the police, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. During the "gunfight," Rokonuzzaman sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Awlad Hossain Mithun
data.description: Mithun was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Narsingdi's Madhabdi area a few hours after his arrest. Abdul Gaffar, a Sub-Inspector of Narsingdi DB police, said that Mithun and his accomplice Sohel, 25, were apprehended on the afternoon of August 30th. Based on their information, a police team, accompanied by Mithun, conducted a raid in the area to recover firearms. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. During the "gunfight", Mithun was caught in the line of fire. He was then rushed to Narsingdi General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Kahlilur Rahman
data.description: Khalilur Rahman was killed in a gunfight with the Detective Branch of the police. The officer-in-charge of the DB, Shah Kamal Hossain, stated that a police team raided the Kalpa area based on information that a group of auto-rickshaw lifters had gathered there. As the police arrived in the area, the suspects opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate by firing back. The police apprehended Khalil, who was injured, as the attackers were retreating from the scene. Unfortunately, he passed away while being transported to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Zainal Abedin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: In Chittagong's Amin Jute Mill area, a 20-year-old "terrorist," identified as Zainal Abedin, the son of Nurul Islam, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. The incident occurred late on Sunday night, with Zainal's death confirmed on Monday morning at Chittagong Medical College (CHMEC) Hospital due to excessive bleeding. Bayezid police station OC Ataur Rahman stated that Zainal had been accused of stabbing and engaging in terrorist activities in the area. After arresting him near Amin Jute Mill on Sunday night, the police conducted a raid, during which Zainal's accomplices opened fire. In the ensuing exchange, Zainal was shot in the leg, and two policemen were slightly injured. OC Rahman confirmed that the police fired in "self-defense.

data.name: Mirazul Islam Miraz
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A man arrested by the police in connection with ten cases has been killed in an alleged shootout in Khulna. The gunfight occurred in the Boro Math area behind the Khulna Agricultural University, said Daulatpur Police OC Kazi Mostaq Ahmed. The deceased has been identified as Mirazul Islam Miraz. According to the OC, he was accused in connection with ten cases involving theft, robbery, and drug-related charges. Police took him on a raid to recover some stolen goods, he said. "Miraz's accomplices noticed the presence of the police and opened fire. Police retaliated in self-defense. Miraz was struck in the crossfire and died.

data.name: Saiful
data.description: A murder suspect was killed in what law enforcement officials described as a "gunfight" in Chattogram city's Bakalia area early today. The deceased was Saiful, 35, the main suspect in a case filed over the murder of Jubo League activist Lokman Rahman Rony. Police arrested him from Fatikchhari last night, according to Pranab Chowdhury, officer-in-charge of Bakulia police. "We took him to recover the murder weapon in the Kolpolok residential area where Saiful's men intercepted us and opened fire," he said. Police retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight". After the confrontation ended, Saiful's body, which had been hit by bullets, was found and rushed to Chittagong Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ripon Molla
data.description: A crime suspect was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Majhirkanda, Nawabganj, Dhaka, early Sunday within hours of his arrest. The deceased, Md Ripon Molla, 35, of Purba Swarmangal, Rajoir, Madaripur, was wanted by the police in at least 14 cases, according to the police. Nawabganj police station inspector (investigation) Saiful Islam told New Age that Ripon was arrested at Chitakhola Road, Dakhkhin Keraniganj, Dhaka on Saturday evening. Later, as per information extracted from him, a team of police went to Majhirkanda to arrest his cohorts and seize illegal firearms, he said. When the police reached Dangarchar point of Majhirkanda, he claimed, a group of miscreants tried to snatch Ripon by opening fire. The police retaliated and a "gunfight" ensued. At one stage of the gunfight, he said, Ripon fled and the police chased the suspects and found Ripon critically injured by a bullet. He said that they took him to the Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

In response, the police retaliated by firing back, leading to a gunfight. Subsequently, the police searched the area and discovered three individuals with critical injuries. They were immediately transported to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.description: Sujon Malitha was killed in a gunfight with the police. Nasir Uddin, the Officer-in-Charge of Kushtia Model Police Station, stated that they received information about a "gunfight" between two groups of drug peddlers. In response, a team led by Sub-inspector Mustafizur Rahman went to the banks of the GK (Ganges-Kabodak) canal in Mollateghoria village around 2:30 am. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the criminals began firing at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. According to the OC, a three-way "gunfight" occurred, resulting in Sujon being fatally shot and killed on the spot.

data.name: Rubel Mia

Shah Kamal Akand, the officer-in-charge of Mymensingh DB, said that during an anti-drug operation conducted by two teams of DB police, they received information about a group involved in drug trafficking in the Habirbari area. The DB police quickly arrived at the scene at 2:30 am, but the suspected peddlers opened fire on them while attempting to escape. In response, the police fired back, resulting in Rubel's death.

data.name: Tutul
data.description: Tutul was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Moharajpur under the upazila, said Inspector (Operations) of Sadar Police Station, Md Idris Ali.

data.name: Habib Ullah
data.description: Habib Ullah was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Muchani, Teknaf. Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das of Teknaf police station said that they arrested Habib in the hilly area of Jadimura Salbagan Rohingya camp when a gang of Rohingya robbers was preparing to commit a robbery on the afternoon of September 14. Later, based on information extracted from him, Pradip said that a team of police raided the hilly area of Nayapara Muchani Rohingya Camp at around 12:30 am to seize illegal firearms.

data.name: Abdur Rahim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Abdur Rahim was killed in what police claimed was a gunfight between the police and armed cohorts of a suspected robber, said Swapan Kumar, Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station. "A team of police arrested Rahim from Indronarayanpur village in the upazila on 15 September," the OC said. During the primary interrogation, Rahim told them the location of some hidden firearms. According to his information, a team of police raided the Kalibari area around 2:00 am, taking Rahim with them. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, cohorts of Rahim, who had taken positions near the spot, opened fire on the police. The police retaliated by firing back, triggering a gunfight which resulted in Abdur Rahim's death on the spot.

data.name: Masud Parvez

Sensing their presence, a gang of robbers who were preparing to conduct a robbery in the area fired shots targeting the law enforcers, prompting their retaliation which resulted in a "gunfight," claimed the Rab official. Masud was caught in the line of fire and hit by a bullet. Later, he was declared dead at Sreepur Upazila Health Complex, Kamruzzaman added.

data.name: Tuhin Hossain
data.description: Major Talukdar Nazmus Sakib, Deputy Commander of RAB-11 in Narayanganj, said that a RAB team picked up Tuhin Hossain from Comilla's Rasulpur area around 1:00 am on 18 September. Gathering information from him, the RAB team raided the Syedpur area of Narayanganj around 4:00 am to recover weapons and arrest Tuhin's associates. Sensing the presence of law enforcement officers, the criminals opened fire at the RAB men, forcing them to return fire, said Talukdar. At one point, Tuhin and his associates attempted to escape. Tuhin was shot, but his accomplices managed to flee, according to the RAB official. Tuhin was pronounced dead by doctors after being taken to Narayanganj General Hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Jamil

Based on their information, the police, along with the three individuals, conducted a raid in Teknaf's Baharchhara area to recover firearms. However, upon reaching the area, the criminals opened fire, which forced the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight," the three suspects attempted to flee the scene but ended up getting caught in the crossfire. Subsequently, the police rushed them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Asmat Ullah
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that they arrested the trio on 18 September. Based on their information, the police, along with the three individuals, conducted a raid in Teknaf's Baharchhara area to recover firearms. However, upon reaching the area, the criminals opened fire, which forced the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight," the three suspects attempted to flee the scene but ended up getting caught in the crossfire. Subsequently, the police rushed them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Russell
data.description: Abdur Rahim, Inspector of Investigation at Chandgaon Police Station, stated, "Russell was the main suspect in a murder case that was filed at the station regarding the stabbing and killing of Jiad Hossain, a 22-year-old." Acting on the information received, a police team conducted a raid at Jele Para field in Chandgaon at approximately 1:45 am in order to apprehend the criminals. "Upon sensing our presence, the wrongdoers attacked the police using firearms and locally made weapons. In retaliation, the police also fired shots. Eventually, the criminals fled the scene, leaving Russell dead on the spot," claimed Inspector Rahim.

data.name: Arif Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Arif Hossain was killed in a shootout with the police for his alleged involvement with a robbery gang. However, Arif's relatives said he was a CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver who had been missing for the last four to five days. AKM Azizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Laxmipur Sadar Police Station, said they had information that an armed gang was preparing for a robbery. "When a team of patrol police went to the spot, the robbers opened fire. Police retaliated, which forced the robbers to flee," the OC said. Police recovered Arif's bullet-hit body from the spot and took him to Laxmipur Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dil Mohammad
data.description: A Rohingya couple was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Cox's Bazar, hours after they were detained by the law enforcers. The incident that claimed the lives of the couple happened at a refugee camp in Hnila union. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they detained the couple with a gun. Based on their information, a police team, along with the couple, conducted a raid in the camp to recover firearms, as claimed by the OC. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point during the "gunfight," the couple got caught in the line of fire, he added. The police rushed them to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Shoshan Mitra
data.description: Superintendent Mohiuddin Faruki, the Company Commander of RAB-2, reported that three muggers on a motorbike snatched a bag from a man in front of Lab Aid Hospital around 12:45 am. Upon receiving the information, a patrol team from RAB pursued the motorbike. When the motorbike reached the Hatirpool area, the members of the elite force instructed the muggers to surrender. However, the muggers opened fire on them, prompting the force to retaliate. During the exchange of gunfire, two of the muggers, Hasan and Shoshan, sustained bullet injuries, while the third managed to escape. Subsequently, they were transported to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced Shoshan dead.

data.name: Sher Khan Mia
data.description: Family members of an arrested suspect in Palash upazila of Narsingdi claimed that their relative was beaten in police custody and died in the hospital while undergoing treatment. The deceased was Sher Khan Mia (23). According to Palash police station OC Sheikh Md Nasir Uddin, on the evening of September 22, 2019, police arrested Sher Khan from Borab market in the upazila. On the way to the police station, Sher Khan tried to jump off the police motorbike he was riding and injured himself. Following the accident, he received first aid at the Upazila Health Complex and was then brought to the police station. Soon after, his condition deteriorated, and he was taken to Narsingdi Sadar Hospital and later transferred to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH). On the morning of September 25, the duty doctor at DMCH declared Sher Khan dead. However, Faruk Miya, the older brother of Sher Khan, alleged that a six-member police team, including Sub-Inspector Iftekhar, Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Monjur, ASI Rubel, Constable Delwar, and Constable Manik, arrested his brother. Police beat him mercilessly when he tried to escape from the motorbike. When the family members visited the police station on the night of September 22, they found Sher Khan lying on the floor in the lock-up. The on-duty constable said a sedative injection was given to him as he was feeling unwell. When Sher Khan did not regain consciousness the next morning, his family members started crying at the police station, and only then did he receive medical attention, added Faruk Mia. Faruk Mia further said that Sher Khan was a fish trader and there is no case against him. Faruk Miya claimed that his brother died because he was beaten by the police.

data.name: Bikash Kumar Dey
data.description: Samir Sarkar, Superintendent of Police and Assistant Director of RAB-6, stated that following a tip-off about drug peddlers gathering at Dhanibunia village, a team of RAB conducted a raid there around 12:30 am. Upon sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire, prompting RAB officials to retaliate. Sarkar added that at one point, the criminals managed to escape the scene, leaving Bikash behind with bullet wounds. Bikash was subsequently taken to Dumuria Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Touhid
data.description: Touhid, 35, hailing from Chittagong, was hit by a bullet during a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch (DB) of the police in the Nagdarpara area of Khilgaon, said Mashiur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Khilgaon Police Station. Touhid was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dosto Mohammad
data.description: Two Rohingya yaba smugglers were killed in a "shootout" with BGB members in Hnila union of Teknaf upazila around 4:00 am, said Lt Col Foysal Hasan Khan, commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Teknaf. They were from Maungdaw in Myanmar, according to BGB. A BGB team on patrol in Jaliapara village found that around four to five drug peddlers were entering Bangladesh territory after crossing the Naf river by boat, the BGB official said. When the criminals were asked to stop, they started firing, prompting the BGB members to retaliate. During the "gun battle", two yaba peddlers were injured, while the others fled. The two injured individuals were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official said.

data.name: Abdul Karim
data.description: Abdul Karim was killed in a gunfight with the police. Acting on a tip-off, a DB team raided the Mukamiakanda Rice Mill area when some criminals were trading drugs around 1:15 am, the OC said. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, triggering a "gunfight," the OC claimed. At one stage, Karim was hit, while others fled. The police took Karim to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Yunus
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya drug traders were killed in a reported gunfight with the BGB in the Jaliapara area. BGB Battalion commanding officer Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan in Teknaf said that upon receiving information that a group of drug peddlers was trespassing into Bangladesh with a large consignment of yaba tablets, a BGB team cordoned off Hinllha Union's Jaliapara area of Teknaf and asked the drug traders to surrender. After the gunfight, the BGB soldiers recovered two individuals who had been shot from the scene and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later, they were transferred to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital in critical condition, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Jamal
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya drug traders were killed in a reported gunfight with the BGB in the Jaliapara area. BGB Battalion commanding officer Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan in Teknaf said that upon receiving information that a group of drug peddlers was trespassing into Bangladesh with a large consignment of yaba tablets, a BGB team cordoned off Hinllha Union's Jaliapara area of Teknaf and asked the drug traders to surrender. data.name: Mohammad Ayub
data.description: Ayub was killed in a shootout with the police. Abul Kalam Azad, OC of Chandgaon Police Station, said that they had received a tip-off that Ayub and his associates had gathered in the Annanya Residential area of Quiash Road. A police team conducted a drive in the area around 2:30 am, according to the OC. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the muggers opened fire on them, forcing the police to fire back, which eventually triggered a gunfight. The police rescued Ayub, who had been injured by a bullet, from the spot and took him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Faruk Mia
data.description: An accused, Faruk Mia, was allegedly tortured to death while in police custody in Habiganj Sadar. Mashuk Ali, the Officer-in-Charge at the Habiganj police station, denied the allegation, saying, "No one tortured Faruk Mia at the station. He had a heart attack shortly after he was brought to the station. We immediately took him to the hospital, where the doctors declared him dead." Dr Mithun Roy, a doctor of the emergency unit at the Habiganj Sadar Hospital, said that Faruk Mia had been unwell when he was brought there. He died early in the morning on September 30, 2019. The deceased's son, Masuk Mia, claimed that the police tortured his father at the police station. They did not even let him see his father. His father was tortured to death by the police. Masuk further said that his father borrowed Tk15 thousand a few months ago from Hannan Mia of their area. His father was returning the money in installments through checks; recently Hannan filed a check dishonor case of Tk45 thousand with the court. The court subsequently issued an arrest warrant against Faruk Mia. Faruk paid Tk5000 each to Hannan and the police to avoid the arrest. Nevertheless, the police came and arrested him later that night. Faruk's brother, Matin Mia, said that a while after Faruk was taken to the station, the police called and informed us that he was sick and taken to the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Amin
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, the Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they conducted a raid with the duo at Baharchora Shilkhali Hill area to recover yaba pills and firearms. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point during the "gunfight", Amin and Helaluddin sustained bullet injuries, the OC claimed. The police then rushed the duo to a hospital in Cox’s Bazar where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Mamarishpur. Mazharul Islam, Officer-in-Charge (Investigation) of Bhaluka Police Station, said they received a tip-off that some robbers had gathered at Mamarishpur to plan a robbery. A police team, led by sub-inspector Golam Mustafa, raided the area to arrest the gang members. Sensing the police presence, the criminals began firing at the law enforcers, who retaliated, triggering a "gunfight" around 1:15 am. The robbers fled the area at one point, and the police found Saddam, who had been hit by a bullet. They rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar early yesterday. The identity of the deceased has not yet been determined. Based on information that a group of smugglers were entering Bangladesh from Myanmar with a large consignment of yaba, a BGB team conducted a raid in the Hnila area on the bank of the Naf River, said Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, BGB commanding officer of Teknaf. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the "drug traders" opened fire on the BGB team, forcing them to retaliate and resulting in a "gunfight," claimed the BGB official. Later, police recovered a bullet-ridden body from the scene, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station.

data.name: Abdullah Al Mamun
data.description: A young man died while in custody at Kishoreganj police station in Nilphamari on August 10, 2019. Law enforcement officers arrested Abdullah from his residence early on August 10 on charges of stealing cattle and detained him at the police station. The victim's cousin, Mohammad Rashid, alleged that Abdullah was tortured to death while in custody.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers, including a Rohingya man, were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Cox's Bazar. Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said the duo was arrested in Teknaf around 8:00 pm on October 11th. Based on their information, a police team, along with the two "criminals", conducted a raid in the Hatiargona Malir Hill area of Teknaf around 1:00 am to recover drugs and firearms. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Abdur and Ahmed sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. The doctors on duty at the health complex referred the duo to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital as their condition was critical. When they arrived at the hospital, doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Zaynul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Zaynul Islam, a suspected robber, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB personnel in Srimangal. RAB Srimangal camp commander AK Kamruzaman said they detained some people in Sylhet on suspicion of their involvement in a robbery two days ago. Based on information from the arrested individuals, a raid was conducted at the Cha-Kanya area in Satgaon under Shrimangal at about 4:00 am to apprehend other suspects. As the RAB members arrived, the robbers opened fire on them and they retaliated by returning fire. Zaynul died on the spot after being shot during the gunfight, while his associates fled the scene.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Khorshed Alam was killed in a gunfight with RAB members at around 9:00 pm when RAB raided the area to detain some suspected miscreants and seize illegal firearms, according to Md Mashkur Rahman, Operation Officer of RAB-7 in Chittagong. RAB-7 Assistant Superintendent of Police Kazi Md Tarek Aziz stated that they conducted the raid based on information that a group of hooligans and extortionists had gathered near the World Trade Centre of Agrabad.

data.name: Kudrat Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Kudrat Ali, an alleged robber, was killed during a "gunfight" with the DB police in Shayestaganj upazila around 3:00 am. Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Shayestaganj Police Station, Mozammel Haque, said that after receiving information that some 10 to 12 criminals were preparing to commit a robbery in the Purashudha area on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway, a team of DB police raided the area. At one stage, the "robbers" opened fire on law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a "gunfight". Kudrat Ali was caught in the gunfight while his associates managed to flee.

data.name: Aung Chaimung Tongchoyonga
data.description: Followers of two member candidates, Ajmot Ali and Babul Kanti Chakma, clashed over fake vote casting at the Fatrajhiri Polling Centre in Ward 8 of Ghumdhum union. During the incident, BGB personnel fired bullets to regain control of the situation. Aung Chaimung died on the spot, and Shwechcha Aung passed away later at Cox's Bazar Hospital.

data.name: Aminur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in the Sundarbans. Tipped off that some forest robbers had taken positions in the Sundarbans, a team of RAB raided the deep forest between 3:00 am and 5:00 am, said Lieutenant Colonel Syed Mohammad Nurus Salehin Yusuf, Commander of RAB 6. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight, Salehin said. Later, the RAB members recovered three bodies with bullet wounds and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex, where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he added.

data.name: Iqbal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Moin Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Sonagazi police station, said that Iqbal was a leader of an inter-district robber gang. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Feni DB police and Sonagazi police jointly raided the area around 3:00 am, said Ranjit Barua, Officer-in-Charge of DB police. The robbers opened fire on the law enforcers as soon as the team reached the spot, forcing them to fire back, which triggered the gunfight. Iqbal was injured during the skirmish. His accomplices fled the scene, leaving him, the OC said. He was taken to a local hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Samsul Alam
data.description: Shamsul's daughter, Satana, said her father was a cattle trader and never peddled liquor. She also claimed that after detaining her father, the police personnel demanded Tk one lakh, but he refused to pay. "They tortured him throughout the night to death at the investigation centre," she alleged. Local people said the police detained Samsul Alam, 55, of Shantipur in Mithapukur, from Baradaroga Bazar in Pirganj. His body was found hanging from the grill of a window at Bhendamari police investigation centre. Pirganj police station Officer-in-Charge, Saresh Chandra, said the police detained a drug peddler named Samsul Alam with 25 litres of locally made liquor on the night of October 15th, and he committed suicide on the morning of October 16th at the police investigation centre.

data.name: Zia Babul
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Hoaikong Satgharia Para. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf model police station, said that the police arrested Babul at Hnila Bazar on the afternoon of October 16th. After interrogation, a team of police took him along with them while conducting a drive to recover firearms around 4:00 am. As soon as the police reached the spot, Babul's associates opened fire and tried to snatch him from the law enforcers, the OC said. Babul and Azim sustained gunshot wounds during the skirmish. They were taken to a local hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Abdul Motaleb
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Abdul Motaleb, who was named in at least seven cases, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the Detective Branch of the police at Rasulpur. Shah Kamal Akond, the Officer-in-Charge of Mymensingh Detective Branch, said they raided the area to apprehend suspected robbers when they opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate with gunshots that resulted in the 'gunfight', leaving Motaleb injured. Later, he was taken to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Aminul Islam
data.description: Aminul Islam was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Bhutgari. Tipped off, a team of police raided the area where a kidnappers' gang had gathered and, sensing the presence of the police, they opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back. At one stage, Aminul was caught in the line of fire. Later, he was taken to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Abul Hashem
data.description: Hashem and Kamal were killed in a "gunfight" with the BGB at Lambabil near the river Naf in Teknaf at about 11:30 pm. Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, the Commanding Officer of BGB 2 Battalion at Teknaf, said that acting on a tip-off that a group of drug peddlers were entering Bangladesh from Myanmar by crossing the Naf river in a boat with a large consignment of Yaba tablets, a BGB team raided the Lambabil area. The team asked the drug peddlers to surrender when their boat anchored on the river bank. "Ignoring the BGB's call, two peddlers began to run and managed to flee, but the other peddlers opened fire on the BGB personnel, who retaliated with gunshots, triggering a gunfight," he said. After the gunfight, the BGB personnel found two people with bullet wounds on the spot and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later, they were shifted to Cox's Bazar General Hospital in critical condition, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Aziz
data.description: Aziz was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Moheskhaliapara. Pradeep Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf police station, said the police arrested Mohammad Aziz in Teknaf as he was absconding in many criminal cases. After interrogation, a team of police took him along with them to conduct a drive to recover firearms and drugs around 4:00 am at Moheskhaliapara, the OC said. As soon as the police reached the spot, Aziz's associates opened fire on them and tried to snatch him from the law enforcers. The police also took the bullet-hit Aziz to a Teknaf hospital, but the duty doctor sent him to Cox's Bazar General Hospital as he was in critical condition. The doctor at Cox's Bazar General Hospital declared that he died before reaching the hospital.

data.name: Mahfuzur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others were injured as supporters of the Hefazat-e-Islami clashed with the police in Bhola's Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. At one stage of the clash that broke out around 10:30 am, law enforcers had to fire shots to disperse the mob, who had been demanding punishment for a Hindu youth they claimed was responsible for the hate conversation from his Facebook account since 18 October, according to the police.

data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others were injured as supporters of the Hefazat-e-Islami clashed with the police in Bhola's Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. At one stage of the clash that broke out around 10:30 am, law enforcers had to fire shots to disperse the mob, who had been demanding punishment for a Hindu youth they claimed was responsible for the hate conversation from his Facebook account since 18 October, according to the police.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others were injured as supporters of the Hefazat-e-Islami clashed with the police in Bhola's Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. At one stage of the clash that broke out around 10:30 am, law enforcers had to fire shots to disperse the mob, who had been demanding punishment for a Hindu youth they claimed was responsible for the hate conversation from his Facebook account since 18 October, according to the police.

data.name: Rahim Uddin
data.description: In Howaikong, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the Border Guards Bangladesh (BGB). The incident occurred near the Unchiprang refugee camp under the Howaikong union. The deceased is Rahim Uddin from Teknaf upazila. BGB Teknaf 2 Commanding Officer, Lt Col Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, confirmed the matter to the Dhaka Tribune. He said, "Acting on a tip-off that a fresh batch of yaba pills was being smuggled, a special team of BGB stopped a boat in the Madinar Jora area. Seeing law enforcement, the miscreants opened fire on the BGB, prompting them to fire back. This triggered a gunfight." Rahim was injured in the "gunfight," while the others managed to flee the scene. He was taken to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex in critical condition and later transferred to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where the on-duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Prakash Selim
data.description: Prakash Selim was killed in a crossfire with the police. The gunfight began when the police detained him to recover drugs and illegal arms after his arrest in the early hours of October 22nd in the Chamarkul area. Pradip Kumar Das, the Office-in-Charge of Teknaf police station, claimed that they were acting on a tip-off when they arrested Prakash on October 21st. Later, he was taken to the Keruntoli Primary School area to recover arms and drugs according to his confession. However, his accomplices, who were waiting in the area, opened fire on the police, and the law enforcers retaliated. Selim was hit and taken to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Najir Ahmed Sumon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Sumon, the leader of a notorious robber gang and the prime suspect in the murder case of Chittagong child specialist Dr. Shah Alam, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB. Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director (media) of RAB 7, said they arrested human hauler driver Omar Faruk, 19, in connection with Shah Alam's murder on October 22. He confessed to his role in the killing before the court and revealed the names of several men, including Kalu, who were involved in it. A RAB 7 team raided Bashbaria around 4:30 am to arrest Kalu. However, the criminals opened fire as soon as they reached the area. Kalu was killed on the spot in the ensuing skirmish, according to RAB sources.

data.name: Mehedi Hasan
data.description: Mehedi was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Lodipur Khari Bridge area. Naogon Superintendent of Police, Abdul Mannan, said a team of law enforcement agencies conducted a raid in the area after receiving a tip-off. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug dealers opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate by firing back. After the gunfight, Mehedi was discovered shot and killed, while others managed to escape, he added.

data.name: Abu Sayed
data.description: Abu Sayed was killed in a "gunfight" between law enforcers and his associates in Araihazar. The Araihazar police arrested Abu Sayed on the evening of October 26. Officer-in-Charge Nazrul Islam of Araihazar Police Station stated that, based on the information provided by him, the police took him on a drive in the Ilumadi area around 3:00 am to apprehend his accomplices. As soon as they arrived at the location, Sayed's associates began firing at the team, prompting the police to retaliate. After the gunfight, Sayed was discovered shot and lying on the ground. He was transported to Araihazar Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead upon arrival.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. After receiving a tip-off that a group of robbers had gathered in the Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team from RAB-7 raided the location around 2:00 am, according to Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing the presence of the RAB personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, which eventually led to a gunfight. Later, RAB members discovered three bodies with bullet wounds at the scene and handed them over to the police.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. After receiving a tip-off that a group of robbers had gathered in the Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team from RAB-7 raided the location around 2:00 am, according to Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing the presence of the RAB personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, which eventually led to a gunfight. Later, RAB members discovered three bodies with bullet wounds at the scene and handed them over to the police.
