data.description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. After receiving a tip-off that a group of robbers had gathered in the Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team from RAB-7 raided the location around 2:00 am, according to Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing the presence of the RAB personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, which eventually led to a gunfight. Later, RAB members discovered three bodies with bullet wounds at the scene and handed them over to the police.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Shahapur in Faridganj. Tipped off that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery, a team of police went to the Cherag Alir Bagan area around 2:00 am, said Abdur Rakib, Officer-in-Charge of Faridganj Police Station. Sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire towards the police, prompting them to fire back in self-defense, Rakib claimed. After the gunfight, the police took a bullet-hit person and took him to Faridganj Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ashhaf Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Gajaria area of Bajitpur in Kishoreganj early Friday. The deceased was identified as Ashraf Uddin, 30, son of Bachchu Mia, from Bhairab Upazila's Manikdi area. Aminur Rahman, the additional superintendent of police in the Bajitpur circle, said that acting on a tip-off about a robber gang preparing to commit a robbery in the area, a police team led by him conducted a raid in the Gajaria area of Bajitpur at about 1:30 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting the police to retaliate with gunfire, resulting in a gunfight between the police and the robbers, claimed Aminur. Later, the police spotted the bullet-hit body of Ashraf and rushed him to Bajitpur Upazila Health Complex, where duty doctors declared him dead, the police officer said.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a "gun battle" with the police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar early Monday. The deceased was identified as Abdur Rahman, 23, son of Shah Alam, a resident of Moheshkhaliapata. Upon receiving information that a gang of drug peddlers had gathered in Satghoria Para, a team of law enforcers conducted a raid there around 4 am, said Teknaf Model Police Station OC Pradip Kumar Das. Sensing the presence of the team, the gang opened fire on them, forcing the policemen to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. After the shootout, the police rescued bullet-injured Rahman and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nabi Hossain
data.description: Mohiuddin Faruque, the company commander of RAB-2, claimed that Nabi used to sell yaba in the city. A team of RAB took positions near Dhaka Udyan based on information that Nabi was carrying yaba from Teknaf, as stated by Mohiuddin. Nabi opened fire on the RAB men when they intercepted a CNG-run auto-rickshaw in the area that was transporting him, which forced the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. During the "gunfight," Nabi sustained bullet injuries. Later, he was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Delwar Hossain, a suspected robber, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Chhoto Sanua, Bashkhali upazila of Chattogram. Tipped off that a group of pirates were taking positions in the area, a team of the elite force raided the area, said Mashkur Rahman, assistant director of RAB 7. Later, the robbers fired gunshots targeting RAB members, prompting them to fire back, leaving Delwar dead on the spot, he said. Four firearms and 22 bullets were seized from the spot.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, another suspected drug trader was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Khoaikong Satgariapara in Teknaf upazila early Thursday. The deceased is identified as Abul Kashem, 32, of the area. Police arrested Abul Kashem on Wednesday night and conducted a raid with him to recover arms in the area around 3:00 am, said Dipak Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model police station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the associates of Abul Kashem opened fire on them and tried to snatch him away. The police then fired gunshots, triggering a "gunfight" that left Abul Kashem dead on the spot.

data.name: Bappy Rajib
data.description: An alleged drug trader was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Uttar Bijoypur in Sadar South upazila early Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Bappy, also known as Rajib, 26, the son of the late Delwar Hossain Delu from Uttar Rampur village in the upazila. The police said a team from Sadar South Model Police Station conducted a raid at Bijoypur around 2:30 am to recover drugs. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Bappy and his associates opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate in self-defense, which triggered a gun battle, said Inspector (Investigation) Kamal Krishna Dhar of the police station. Bullet-hit Bappy was found lying on the ground after the gunfight, and he was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, he said.

data.name: Mohammad Hridoy
data.description: Hridoy was killed in a "gunfight" with members of RAB. Additional Superintendent Jasim Uddin of RAB 11 said that a team of RAB, while on a routine patrol, was setting up a checkpoint on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway at Mridhakandi when they challenged a car due to its suspicious movement. However, the driver of the car, without stopping, tried to flee by opening fire and targeting the RAB personnel. He stated that the RAB personnel retaliated with gunshots, resulting in a gunfight at around 4:00 am, during which Hridoy was injured by a bullet. Later, he was taken to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Jabed Mahmud, Officer-in-Charge of Ashuganj police station, said that they raided the area around 1:15 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was present. The criminals opened fire on the police team as soon as they arrived, initiating a skirmish. At one point, Saddam was caught in the line of fire while attempting to escape the scene and died instantly.

data.name: Mahmudul Hasan
data.description: A Rohingya man was killed in what the police called a gunfight with them at Shalbagan in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar early Thursday, according to UNB. The deceased was identified as Mahmudul Hasan, 37, son of Baker Ahmed from Nayapara Rohingya camp in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf police station, said they arrested Mahmudul on Wednesday noon for possessing firearms. After interrogation, a team of police, led by additional superintendent Redwan Ahmed, conducted a raid around 1:00 am in the area near the Rohingya camp to recover firearms. When the police team reached the area, Mahmudul's associates opened fire, prompting the gunfight, claimed the OC. During the altercation, Mahmudul was shot while others managed to escape. He succumbed to his injuries while being taken to the Sadar hospital, Pradip Kumar Das added.

data.name: Noor Kabir
data.description: In Hnila union of Cox's Bazar, Noor Kabir, from Leda Rohingya camp in Teknaf, was killed in a "gunfight" between "drug dealers" and a patrolling team of BGB. While patrolling in the Chhurikhal area, a BGB team approached four individuals who were digging out a plastic bag from the ground, said Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, Commander of BGB Battalion-2. The men started shooting at the team, forcing the BGB personnel to retaliate, said Faisal. He added that the men fled the scene after approximately 10 minutes. Later, the team discovered Noor's body, riddled with bullets, on the ground. He was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Razzaq Mia
data.description: In Narsingdi's Shibpur upazila, Razzaq Mia was killed during a "gunfight" with the police. The police arrested Razzaq, who was accused in 16 criminal cases, at his home on the midnight of 14 November and took him on a drive to the Telia Shashan Ghat area, said Inspector (Investigation) Mominul Haque of Shibpur Police Station. As soon as they reached the spot, Razzaq's associates started shooting at them, said Mominul, adding that the law enforcers were forced to fire back to defend themselves. After the "gunfight," the police found Razzaq lying dead on the ground.

data.name: Yasin
data.description: Two alleged Rohingya criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with BGB. Yasin, 30, and Hossain, 22, of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp-1, were accused of attacking a BGB patrol team on November 11, according to BGB officials. After receiving information that Rohingya men and other members of the drug gang were in the Tumbru Notun Bridge area, a BGB team went there around 3:00 am, said Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, Commander of the 34th Battalion. Sensing their presence, the gang started shooting at the team, forcing them to retaliate. He added that the bodies of Yasin and Hossain, who were hit by bullets, were found on the ground after the "gunfight". They were taken to Ukhiya Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead upon arrival.

data.name: Hossain
data.description: Two alleged Rohingya criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with BGB. Yasin, 30, and Hossain, 22, of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp-1, were accused of attacking a BGB patrol team on November 11, according to BGB officials. After receiving information that Rohingya men and other members of the drug gang were in the Tumbru Notun Bridge area, a BGB team went there around 3:00 am, said Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, Commander of the 34th Battalion. Sensing their presence, the gang started shooting at the team, forcing them to retaliate. He added that the bodies of Yasin and Hossain, who were hit by bullets, were found on the ground after the "gunfight". They were taken to Ukhiya Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead upon arrival.

data.name: Badsha Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A suspected leader of an outlawed party was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in the Battola area of Harinakundu municipality early Monday, according to UNB. The deceased has been identified as Badsha Sheikh, 50, son of Helal Uddin from Jora Pukuria village in the upazila. He was a member of the outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP—Janajuddha faction). Md Asaduzzaman, the officer-in-charge of Harinakundu Police Station, stated that they received a tip-off that Badsha was attending a clandestine meeting with his followers in the area. As a result, a patrol team of police raided the area around 1:30 am. Upon sensing the presence of law enforcers, Badsha and his followers opened fire at the police, forcing them to fire back in self-defense.

data.name: Abdul Aziz
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A robber was killed in a gunfight with the police in the city's Nasirabad area early Monday. The deceased was identified as Azizul, also known as Aizza Dakat (The Daily Star identified him as Abdul Aziz). Officer-in-Charge (OC) Pranab Chowdhury of Khulshi police station said a gang of robbers took away gold ornaments, two mobile phone sets, and money from a residence in Garibullah Housing Society on Friday afternoon. The house owner, Ariful Hoque, filed a case with Khulshi police station in connection with the incident. "We arrested the driver of the CNG-run auto-rickshaw used in the robbery, as well as a jewelry shop owner and his associate with the stolen ornaments," the OC said. Acting on their statements, the police went to the residential area of Nasirabad Properties Limited to arrest Aziz, who was the mastermind of the robbery, early Monday morning, he said. As the police reached the spot, the criminals opened fire, prompting the cops to retaliate with bullets, which triggered a gunfight, OC Pranab said. Later, Aziz was found lying in a bullet-hit condition at the scene. He was sent to Chattogram Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, he said.

data.name: Nadim
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a team from RAB-2 conducted a raid in the area at around 4:00 am, according to Bachchu Mia, the in-charge of Dhaka Medical College Hospital police outpost. As soon as the elite force arrived, a group of individuals opened fire, leading to a confrontation. Nadim unfortunately got caught in the crossfire and sustained gunshot wounds. Subsequently, he was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman Mintu
data.description: Mizanur Rahman Mintu was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Md Kamruzzaman, an Assistant Director of RAB-1, said that upon receiving information that some drug dealers had gathered in the Swadesh Property area of the capital's Khilkhet, a RAB patrol team rushed to the area around 1:15 am. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers then retaliated. After the gun battle, RAB found Mintu with bullet wounds. He was quickly taken to Kurmitola General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Laxmindar Ali
data.description: Laxminder Ali was killed in a shootout with the police in the Bokarbhanga area. Mostafa Kamal, the Officer-in-Charge of Chhatak Police Station, said that the police arrested Laxminder on 22 November. The police took him to the Bokarbhanga area the next day to recover firearms, but he tried to flee. A gunfight broke out when his associates opened fire, according to the OC. Later, the police found Laxminder's body.

data.name: Ibrahim Khalil Rubel
data.description: Rubel was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Detective Branch of Police. He was named in at least 16 criminal cases. Noakhali Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge, Kamruzzaman Shikdar, said that they arrested Ibrahim in a raid at Purba Mahduri on the evening of November 27th with 60 yaba tablets. Later, based on information extracted from him, they took him with them during a raid at Paschim Mahduri to recover firearms. He claimed that Ibrahim's associates opened fire on the raiding police personnel as soon as they reached the spot at about 4:00 am, and the police also retaliated by firing, which triggered a "gunfight". During the gunfight, the OC claimed that Ibrahim was caught in the line of fire, but his associates fled the scene. He said they took Ibrahim to Noakhali General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mamunur Islam Dwip
data.description: Two Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) activists were killed in a shootout with police at the Bakchora intersection of Satkhira district town early Saturday. The deceased, Mamunur Islam Dwip, was a resident of the Munsipara area of the town, and Saiful Islam, of Saihati village in Kaliganj upazila. Mostafizur Rahman, superintendent of Satkhira police, claimed that the deceased were listed criminals. The duo were accused in a number of cases. Sources said that Dwip and Saiful were activists of BCL. Earlier, the Detective Branch (DB) of the district police and Kaliganj police arrested Saiful and Dwip. According to their confessional statement, a police team, along with the duo, conducted a raid in the area in the early hours to recover arms. Sensing the presence of the team, cohorts of Dwip and Saiful opened fire on the policemen to snatch away the duo, forcing the law enforcers to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. Police later rescued the bullet-injured Saiful and Dwip from the scene, but they died on the way to a local hospital.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: Two Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) activists were killed in a shootout with police at the Bakchora intersection of Satkhira district town early Saturday. The deceased, Mamunur Islam Dwip, was a resident of the Munsipara area of the town, and Saiful Islam, of Saihati village in Kaliganj upazila. Mostafizur Rahman, superintendent of Satkhira police, claimed that the deceased were listed criminals. The duo were accused in a number of cases. Sources said that Dwip and Saiful were activists of BCL. Earlier, the Detective Branch (DB) of the district police and Kaliganj police arrested Saiful and Dwip. According to their confessional statement, a police team, along with the duo, conducted a raid in the area in the early hours to recover arms. Sensing the presence of the team, cohorts of Dwip and Saiful opened fire on the policemen to snatch away the duo, forcing the law enforcers to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. Police later rescued the bullet-injured Saiful and Dwip from the scene, but they died on the way to a local hospital.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Delu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Delwar Hossain Delu was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Acting on secret information that a gang of robbers was meeting in the Karaitola area to commit robbery, the police raided Tulatoli village, said SI Gias. Sensing their presence, the robbers started firing at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate with gunshots, triggering a "gunfight," the police official added. At one stage, Delwar was shot while his cohorts managed to flee the scene. Delwar was rushed to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ali
data.description: Mohammad Ali was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Mohammad Basiruddin, Additional Superintendent of Jamalpur police, said one of their teams conducted a raid in Prajapati Char and arrested Ali from a boat on 2 December. The police, along with Ali, conducted a raid at Kutilarchar to recover arms around 3:00 am on 3 December. Sensing the police presence, Ali's cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Ali was caught in the line of fire and suffered bullet wounds while others managed to flee, he added. Later, Ali was taken to Islampur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Imam Hossain
data.description: Imam Hossain, a suspected yaba peddler, was killed in a gunfight with the BGB. The gunfight took place in the Keora Bagan area near the Zadimura border with Myanmar.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: Abdur Rashid was killed in a "gunfight" between the Detectives Branch of the police and suspected drug peddlers during an anti-drug drive, according to Shah Kamal Hossain, the Officer-in-Charge of Mymensingh police's Detective Branch.

data.name: Nur Hafez
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya drug peddlers were killed in a "gunfight" with the Teknaf police in the hilly areas of Rongikhali. Teknaf Police Officer-in-Charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that they recovered a huge quantity of illegal firearms and yaba while raiding the spot. The OC said that the Rapid Action Battalion arrested four people, including Nur and Sohel, on December 13. Later, the RAB handed the arrested individuals over to the Teknaf police. The Teknaf police OC said that a team from the department went to the Ronghikhali hilly area along with Noor Alam and Mohammad Sohel to recover arms and drugs. When they reached the spot, associates of Nur and Sohel opened fire at the police, triggering the gunfight. The OC added that when the gunfight was over, the police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of the duo.

data.name: Mohammad Sohel
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya drug peddlers were killed in a "gunfight" with the Teknaf police in the hilly areas of Rongikhali. Teknaf Police Officer-in-Charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that they recovered a huge quantity of illegal firearms and yaba while raiding the spot. The OC said that the Rapid Action Battalion arrested four people, including Nur and Sohel, on December 13. Later, the RAB handed the arrested individuals over to the Teknaf police. The Teknaf police OC said that a team from the department went to the Ronghikhali hilly area along with Noor Alam and Mohammad Sohel to recover arms and drugs. When they reached the spot, associates of Nur and Sohel opened fire at the police, triggering the gunfight. The OC added that when the gunfight was over, the police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of the duo.

data.name: Nurunnabi
data.description: Nurunnabi was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in the Catapahar area. Mohammad Iqbal Hossen, one of the Additional Superintendents at Cox's Bazar police, said Sub-Inspector Mohammad Taimur Islam and Sub-Inspector Abul Kalam apprehended Nurunnabi with illegal firearms in the Kalordokan area of Cox's Bazar town. Later, they took him to the Katapahar area, but the team came under attack from an armed gang that opened fire on the police. The police retaliated by firing back, but the attackers managed to escape. However, Nurunnabi was shot and taken to Cox's Bazar general hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Yasin Mia
data.description: Yasin Mia, an accused of rape and murder of a 14-year-old girl, was killed in a "shootout" with the police. Police arrested Yasin Mia in the Wireless-para area of the town on December 15, on charges of raping and murdering Fatema Begum, the mentally challenged daughter of Elahi Sharif of Rajendrapur College area, on December 12. Zamal Pasha, Additional Superintendent of Police in Faridpur, said they recovered the girl’s body with stab wounds in several parts of her body from the boundaries of the BTCL office around 6:00 pm on December 13, a day after she had gone missing. Following a case filed by the victim’s father with Kotwali Police Station, police identified Yasin upon analyzing the CCTV camera footage in the area. As soon as they reached Double Bridge Rahakhola Launch Ghat area around 2:30 am, Yasin snatched a gun from a policeman and tried to flee, forcing the law enforcers to open fire, he claimed. Yasin suffered bullet injuries in the "shootout". He was taken to Faridpur Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead on arrival. Meanwhile, his sister Rahima Begum said that he came out of jail on December 4 on bail and went to Dhaka the same day. Upon his return on December 15, police arrested him.

data.name: Shahrul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Officer-in-Charge (OC) Rashedul Alam of Maheshpur police station said that the robbers, who were planning a robbery on the Kaliganj-Jibannagar route, fired at a patrolling police team. In retaliation, the police fired multiple rounds, resulting in a gunfight. During the incident, Khokon was found injured while the other robbers managed to escape. The police took Khokon to Maheshpur Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Joynal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Joynal was killed in a "gunfight" with members of RAB. Tipped off, a team of RAB 15 raided the area and confronted some robbers, according to Deputy Commander of RAB 15, Major Rabiul Islam. During the confrontation, the robbers opened fire on the RAB team, prompting them to retaliate, which initiated the gunfight. After a brief exchange of gunfire, the bullet-ridden body of Joynal was discovered. Additionally, one gun and three bullets were found at the scene.

data.name: Abdul Karim
data.description: Abdul Karim was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB on the bank of the river Naf near Teknaf land port. Commander Mirza Sahed Mahatab, from RAB-15 crimes prevention Company-1, said that a team of RAB raided a hilly area near Teknaf land port after receiving information that some robbers had gathered there to commit robbery. Sensing the presence of RAB personnel, he claimed that the robbers opened fire on the RAB members, who retaliated by firing back, triggering a gunfight at about 2:30 am. Later, RAB members caught one person who was wounded by gunshots at the scene and took him to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain
data.description: Alamgir died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on 19 December. Alamgir, a father of two children, lived in the Phulbaria area under Uttara-10 sector with his family members. Relatives of Alamgir said that he was returning home after finishing his duty on the night of 13 December. When he reached near his home, Uttara West Police picked him up. Upon hearing this news, Alamgir's wife, Alo Begum, rushed to the police station. However, the police did not allow her to meet her husband. The next day, the police took him to court, but Alamgir was sick. Abdur Razzak, brother of Alamgir, alleged that the police tortured his brother after taking him to the police station, resulting in his death. Tapan Chandra Saha, Officer-in-Charge of the police station, stated that they did not torture Alamgir in their custody.

data.name: Siddiq
data.description: Siddiq and Shahjahan, who were suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of the BGB in Ukhia. Lt. Col. Ali Haider Azad, the Commanding Officer of the 34th BGB Battalion, stated that one of their patrol teams encountered a group of drug peddlers. Sensing their presence, the group of criminals opened fire, forcing the BGB men to retaliate. During the "gunfight", the duo was found lying on the ground with bullet wounds. They were then taken to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead, according to the BGB official.

data.name: Shahjahan
data.description: Siddiq and Shahjahan, who were suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of the BGB in Ukhia. Lt. Col. Ali Haider Azad, the Commanding Officer of the 34th BGB Battalion, stated that one of their patrol teams encountered a group of drug peddlers. Sensing their presence, the group of criminals opened fire, forcing the BGB men to retaliate. During the "gunfight", the duo was found lying on the ground with bullet wounds. They were then taken to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead, according to the BGB official.

data.name: Ratan
data.description: Ratan, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with the police at Amishapara union in Noakhali. The police arrested him from his residence on December 21, 2019. Later, the police conducted an operation with Ratan to recover arms. Sensing their presence, Ratan's cohorts fired at them. The police retaliated and fired back. At one stage, Ratan was wounded by a bullet. The police took him to Noakhali General Hospital, where the duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Monir Hossain
data.description: Monir Hossain was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the Goni Miar Doroja area. Anwarul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Chatkhil Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, they arrested Monir. A police team later raided the area along with Monir to recover firearms and Yaba. When the team reached the area, his accomplices opened fire and tried to snatch him. In the ensuing skirmish, Monir sustained gunshot injuries. He was taken to Noakhali General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rubel
data.description: Mirza Shahed Mahtab, Company Commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf, spoke to journalists after the "gunfights". According to officials, members of the elite force conducted raids in the two districts based on information. In both cases, "criminals" initiated gunfire against RAB members, prompting them to retaliate. During the "gunfights", both "criminals" sustained bullet injuries and died. In Cox's Bazar, RAB members quickly transported Rubel to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Amin Sheikh
data.description: Aminul Kabir Tarafder, the Commanding Officer of RAB-12 in Pabna, spoke to journalists after the "gunfight". According to officials, members of the elite force conducted raids in the two districts based on information. The "criminals" initiated the gunfire, prompting the RAB members to retaliate. Both "criminals" sustained bullet injuries and died during the "gunfights". In Cox's Bazar, RAB members rushed Rubel to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. In Pabna, Amin died on the spot of the "gunfight".

data.name: Mokhlesur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mokhlesur was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Nateswar of Sonaimuri. Sonaimuri Police Station Officer-in-Charge, Abdus Samad, said that when a patrol team of police challenged a gang of robbers around 12:45 am, they opened fire on the police officials, forcing them to fire back in self-defense, which triggered the gunfight. After the robbers fled the scene, the law enforcers took the bullet-wounded Mokhlesur from the spot. He was pronounced dead after being taken to Noakhali General Hospital.

data.name: Rony Miah
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Kamruzzaman, the Company Commander of RAB-1, said that the drug trader was killed in a gunfight between members of RAB-1 and a gang of drug traders.

data.name: Shahadat Hossain Swapan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Swapan was killed in a reported gunfight with the police. Arifur Rahman, the Officer-in-Charge of Companyganj Police Station, stated that a police team led by Inspector Mostafizur Rahman arrested Shahadat from Chowmuhani in Begumganj on the evening of December 29th. During interrogation, he confessed that his gang members would wait in the village to commit robberies at night. When a police team arrived at the location around 3:00 am to apprehend other members of the gang, the alleged robbers opened fire on the police, resulting in a gunfight. Shahadat sustained gunshot wounds during the exchange of fire. Later, he was taken to Companiganj Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Anwar Sadek
data.description: Anwar Sadek was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at a Rohingya camp in Teknaf upazila. Shaha Alam, the Company Commander of RAB-15 (Whykong camp), claimed that they raided the Nayapara Mochoni Rohingya camp to recover drugs. A gang of robbers opened fire on RAB members while they were conducting the anti-narcotics drive, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Sadek sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Shahin Bishwas
data.description: Shahin Bishwas was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB members in the capital's Shyamoli area. The incident took place when a RAB team signaled a CNG-run autorickshaw to stop at a checkpoint in front of the National Institute of Kidney Diseases and Urology around 12:15 am, said Mohammad Mohiuddin Faruqui, company commander of RAB-2. As the RAB men asked the three passengers and the driver to get off the vehicle, all but Shahin followed the instructions, the RAB official said. When the RAB men were forcing Shahin to come out, the others suddenly fired blank shots and tried to escape by crossing the adjacent boundary walls of the National Institute of Mental Health and Hospital. RAB members were forced to fire back when Shahin also started firing on them from inside the autorickshaw, triggering a "gunfight," Faruqui said. Hanif caught a bullet injury during the incident and was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Seven suspected Rohingya robbers were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB. Wing Commander Azim Ahmed, Commanding Officer of RAB-15, said that acting on a tip-off that a group of robbers was hiding in Shalbagan Lalporirjum Hill, adjacent to Jadimura-Nayapara 26 and 27 Rohingya Refugee Camps, a RAB team raided the area around 2:00 am. First, the RAB members cordoned off the area and then, using a megaphone, asked the robbers to surrender. However, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to fire retaliatory shots, he claimed at a press briefing at his office in Cox's Bazar. The "gunfight" continued for nearly four hours. After it ended, the RAB members searched the area and recovered seven bodies with bullet wounds.

data.name: Nur Alam
data.description: In the early morning in the Noapara Jadirkhali area, a drug trafficker was killed in a gunfight with the BGB (Border Guard Bangladesh). Locals identified the deceased as Nur Alam (30), son of Zafar Alam from the Mandu Chaliprang area of Akhia upazila. The commander of Teknaf Battalion (2 BGB), Lt. Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, reported that, after receiving confidential information about a massive shipment of yaba coming from Myanmar via the Naf River, a special BGB team was positioned at a point near the Jadimora canal in the Noapara BOP area. A few moments later, as some individuals attempted to flee by boat along the Naf River coast with the drug consignment, the BGB patrol team challenged them, and the drug traffickers opened fire. During this time, three members of the BGB were injured. The BGB retaliated with gunfire. A four-to-five-minute exchange of bullets took place between the two sides. Once the firing ceased, one individual was rescued from the scene in a bullet-wounded state and taken to the Teknaf Health Complex, and then sent to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for advanced treatment. There, the attending physician declared him dead.

data.name: Zakir Hossain Gazi
data.description: Zakir Hossain Gazi was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. He was accused in 13 cases with various police stations, according to Mirza Salahuddin Ahmed, the additional superintendent of Satkhira (Sadar circle) police. He was discovered dead after a "gunfight" between the police and "robbers" in the Damarpota area. Ahmed also mentioned that a firearm and two bullets were seized from the scene.

data.name: Emdad
data.description: Emdad was accused in the murder case of hawker leader Ripon, according to the police. Officer-in-Charge Pritom Sarker of Bayejid Bostami Police Station stated that the law enforcers conducted a raid at Majhir Ghona area around 2:30 am to apprehend Emdad. As soon as the police arrived, Emdad's accomplices opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate, said the OC. He added that the criminals fled at one point. After the "gunfight," the police discovered Emdad's body with bullet wounds on the ground. He was pronounced dead upon arrival by doctors at Chittagong Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Samuda Begum
data.description: Samuda Begum, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police. Acting on information that some drug peddlers had gathered in the Laboner Math area in Whykong union, a Teknaf police team conducted a raid there around 4:00 am. Sensing their presence, the criminals at the scene opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate, said Pradip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. After the gunfight, the police found Samuda's body, which had been hit by bullets, lying on the ground. She was taken to the upazila health complex and later transferred to Cox's Bazar Medical College Hospital, where the on-duty doctors declared her dead upon arrival, said the OC. The police claimed to have recovered 10,000 yaba pills from the scene. According to the Daily Sun, a suspected female drug peddler was killed in a gunfight between two groups of drug dealers at a salt field near Kharangkhaliof Whykang union in Teknaf upazila, Cox's Bazar, on Sunday morning. The deceased was identified as Samuda Begum, 40, the wife of the late Nur Salam from HoaikongSatgharia Para area of the upazila. Confirming this to the media, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Model Police Station, Pradip Kumar Das, said, "Four police members - sub-inspector Arifur Rahman, constables Rubel, Russel, and Habib - were also injured during the gunfight." As the police reached the scene after hearing the sound of gunfire, they spotted Samuda's body with bullet wounds, Pradip Kumar said. Later, the injured Samuda was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. The duty doctors at the hospital referred her to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital as her condition deteriorated. Samuda was pronounced dead upon her arrival at the Sadar Hospital, the OC said. He also mentioned that 10,000 pieces of Yaba pills were recovered from the scene.

data.name: Mohamamd Ismail
data.description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of the BGB. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, the commanding officer of the 34th BGB battalion, claimed that they conducted a raid in the Palongkhali area of the district's Ukhiya upazila around 5:00 am based on information that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled through the area. Sensing the presence of BGB members, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. During the "gunfight", two drug peddlers sustained bullet injuries. They were rushed to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he further added. BGB also claimed to have recovered 20,000 pieces of yaba pills, a locally-made firearm, and two cartridges from the spot.

data.name: Helal Uddin
data.description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of the BGB. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, the commanding officer of the 34th BGB battalion, claimed that they conducted a raid in the Palongkhali area of the district's Ukhiya upazila around 5:00 am based on information that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled through the area. Sensing the presence of BGB members, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. During the "gunfight", two drug peddlers sustained bullet injuries. They were rushed to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he further added. BGB also claimed to have recovered 20,000 pieces of yaba pills, a locally-made firearm, and two cartridges from the spot.

data.name: Abul Kashem Kaisha
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a reported gunfight with the Detective Branch (DB) in the Ramsagar Tajpur area of Dinajpur on early Monday. The deceased were identified as Abul Kashem Kaisha, 30, and Laskar Ali alias Rahmat Ali, 32. Both were residents of Sipahipara and accused in cases filed under the Narcotics Control Act, according to ATM Golam Rasul, the officer-in-charge of Dinajpur DB police. A police team took position near a road in the area around 1:30 am to intercept a gang of drug peddlers. When the DB team stopped a gang passing through the area, the criminals opened fire on them, Golam Rasul said. "After the gunfight, the DB team recovered two bodies from the spot," he said, claiming that sub-inspector Nahid Hasan and constable Mahabub Alam of DB were also injured in the skirmish. Golam Rasul said the team recovered 150 bottles of Phensidyl, a firearm, bullets, and Yaba pills from the spot.

data.name: Laskar Ali
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a reported gunfight with the Detective Branch (DB) in the Ramsagar Tajpur area of Dinajpur on early Monday. The deceased were identified as Abul Kashem Kaisha, 30, and Laskar Ali alias Rahmat Ali, 32. Both were residents of Sipahipara and accused in cases filed under the Narcotics Control Act, said ATM Golam Rasul, the officer-in-charge of Dinajpur DB police. Golam Rasul said the team recovered 150 bottles of Phensidyl, a firearm, bullets, and Yaba pills from the spot.

data.name: Abul Hasim
data.description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug dealers, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road. Mohammad Shah Alam, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) and also the in-charge of CPC-2 Hoaikyang Camp of RAB-15, said that a RAB team conducted a raid in the Shamlapur area on the marine drive road after receiving a tip-off about a large amount of yaba being smuggled. As soon as the RAB team reached the location, the criminals opened fire, resulting in a gunfight, he claimed. "Hasim and Ayub sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight," he said, adding that the two were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ayub
data.description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug dealers, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road. Mohammad Shah Alam, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) and also the in-charge of CPC-2 Hoaikyang Camp of RAB-15, said that a RAB team conducted a raid in the Shamlapur area on the marine drive road after receiving a tip-off about a large amount of yaba being smuggled. As soon as the RAB team reached the location, the criminals opened fire, resulting in a gunfight, he claimed. "Hasim and Ayub sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight," he said, adding that the two were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Aiyas
data.description: A Rohingya man, Mohammad Aiyas or Aias, who was allegedly involved in drug smuggling, was killed in a "gunfight" with the BGB. After receiving information that a large consignment of yaba would be smuggled into Bangladesh from Myanmar, a BGB team took positions in the Jadimora-Shikholghera area under Teknaf's Hnila union, said Lt Colonel Mohammad Foysal Hasan Khan, commanding officer (CO) of BGB Battalion-2. Around 3:00 am, the team noticed a boat carrying a group of people entering Bangladesh. Sensing the presence of the BGB men, the alleged smugglers started firing on the BGB team members when they came closer to the shore, a BGB official said, adding that they also retaliated with gunshots in self-defense, triggering a "gun battle" that lasted for 5-6 minutes. At one stage, three drug traders jumped into the river and swam away toward the Myanmar border, CO Foysal said. Later, the BGB men found a bullet-hit "yaba smuggler" on the boat, he said. After receiving primary treatment at Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, he was sent to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, the BGB official added.

data.name: Abu Bakar Siddique Babu
data.description: According to the police, Babu was detained on January 18, 2020, in the evening after a case was filed against him under the Digital Security Act. Inspector Iftekhar Islam took Babu to Dhaka Medical College Hospital in an unconscious state after he attempted suicide. Later, the attending doctor declared him dead. One of his relatives stated that AC Moinul and Inspector Iftekhar are responsible for this mysterious death.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.description: Anwar Hossain, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a reported gunfight with the RAB. RAB-1 officials claimed that he was a notorious drug peddler.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, a "suspected drug smuggler" was killed in a "gunfight" with BGB, said Lt. Col. Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, commanding officer (CO) of BGB 2 Battalion. He could not confirm the identity of the victim. The incident took place near Jadimura mosque in the union on the bank of Naf River when a BGB special patrol team noticed some people carrying sacks on their heads. As the BGB team challenged them, they opened fire on the law enforcers in response, triggering the gun battle, the CO said. BGB later found the victim caught a bullet and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Abu Hanif Bepari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Natore, a "murder accused" was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Gurudaspur. The deceased, Abu Hanif Bepari, was accused of murder and several other cases, including robbery, according to Akramul Hossain, the additional superintendent of police in Natore. Police detained Hanif from Dhaka's Badda area on January 22, 2020, said SP Akramul. The "gunfight" occurred when a team of police, accompanied by Hanif, went to the Pargurudaspur area and conducted a raid on a banana orchard to apprehend his associates. The Daily Star reported that two policemen were injured during the incident, which was confirmed by SP Akramul. Police seized a pistol, a pipe gun, and five bullets from the scene.

data.name: Nasir Uddin Munna
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Hoykong union near the river Naf in Teknaf on early Sunday. The victim is Nasir Uddin Munna, a man in his thirties, from East Satgoriapara village in Hoykong, said the Teknaf police, who claimed to have seized 10,000 Yaba tablets, three firearms, and 12 cartridges. Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Pradeep Kumar Das said that three of their colleagues — assistant sub-inspector Ohid Ullah and constables Abdus Shukkor and Mohammad Helal — were also wounded during the gunfight. When the suspects ran away, the police found a man shot and wounded. However, he died on the way to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Jumar Uddin
data.description: A man was killed and 20 were injured in sporadic clashes between law enforcers and stone workers over stone extraction at Tetulia in Panchagarh this morning. A team of police charged batons and tear gas shells at the protesters, triggering clashes between them. Jumar Uddin, 60, who sustained severe injuries during the incident, died of excessive bleeding at Panchagarh Adhunik Sadar Hospital, according to doctors at the hospital.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Yusuf
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Anwar Hossain Yusuf was killed and three police personnel were injured in a reported gunfight with police at Bircourt in Senbagh upazila. He was a member of an inter-district robber gang and wanted in 12 criminal cases, according to police sources. Tipped off, a team of police raided Jamidarhat in Begumganj upazila on the night of January 27, 2020, and arrested Yusuf around 9:30 pm, said Assistant Superintendent of Noakhali police, Alamgir Hossain. Later, police, along with Yusuf, conducted another operation to recover arms around 2:45 am in the Bircourt area of Senbagh upazila. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, Yusuf's associates opened fire on the police, forcing them to fire back in self-defense. Yusuf was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. Later, he was taken to Noakhali General Hospital where doctors declared him dead. A suspected robber was killed and three police personnel were injured in a reported gunfight with police at Bircourt in Senbagh upazila early Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Anwar Hossain Yusuf, 45, of Begumganj upazila. He was a member of an inter-district robber gang and wanted in 12 criminal cases, according to police sources. Tipped off, a team of police raided Jamidarhat in Begumganj upazila on Monday night and arrested Yusuf around 9:30 pm, said Assistant Superintendent of Noakhali police, Alamgir Hossain. Later, police, along with Yusuf, conducted another operation to recover arms around 2:45 am in the Bircourt area of Senbagh upazila. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, Yusuf's associates opened fire on the police, forcing them to fire back in self-defense. Yusuf was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. Later, he was taken to Noakhali General Hospital where doctors declared him dead. Three policemen were injured in the incident, according to police sources. One pistol, three bullets, four cartridges, seven bullet shells, three sharp weapons, and a gas lighter were recovered from the scene.

data.name: Jewel Hossain
data.description: Jewel Hossain, who was detained in Cox's Bazar, was killed in a "gunfight" with the DB police. He was one of the main suspects in the murder case of Ansar member Hossain Ali, according to Tauhidul Islam, an additional superintendent of police (ASP) in Jessore. A team from the Jessore Detective Branch (DB) arrested Jewel in Cox's Bazar on January 28, 2020, the ASP said. Based on his statement, the DB members, along with Jewel, conducted a raid at Hasimpur village around 4am to apprehend Munna, he added. Munna, the main suspect, and his accomplices opened fire on the DB team, forcing the law enforcement officers to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight. During the exchange of gunfire, Jewel sustained bullet wounds and was rushed to Jessore General Hospital, where the attending doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Nasir
data.description: Abdul Nasir was killed in a gunfight on Marine Drive Road at Montalia Puranpara after 1:15 am, according to Rab Company Commander Sha Alam of RAB-15. Responding to a tip-off about drug trafficking, a RAB team set up a checkpoint there, he said. The officers stopped several men who were carrying some sacks, but the men started shooting at the officers, forcing them to retaliate, Alam added. At one point, Nasir was shot while the others managed to flee the scene, he said. Nasir was then taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mozaffar Hossain
data.description: Abdul Wahab, the father of Mozaffar, quoted eyewitnesses as saying that a drug smuggler hired Mozaffar's auto-rickshaw. At one stage, the police chased the smuggler, but he managed to flee. Later, the police detained Mozaffar with the smuggler's shawl, three and a half kilograms of ganja, and his auto-rickshaw, and took him to the police station. Abdul Wahab alleged that his son died due to police torture while in their custody. The Daily Observer reported that a man died in police custody in Bhurungamari Upazila of the district early Monday. The deceased, Mozaffar Hossain, 30, was the son of Abdul Wahab from Uttar Chhoto Gopalpur Village in the upazila, and worked as an auto-rickshaw driver. The victim's father said that the police chased a drug smuggler who was a passenger in Mozaffar's auto-rickshaw, but failed to catch him. Later, they detained Mozaffar with the passenger's hemp from the Jhal Bazaar area in the upazila on Sunday evening and took him to Bhurungamari Police Station (PS), where he allegedly met a tragic end due to police torture. Meanwhile, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of the PS, Imtiaz Kabir, said that the police nabbed him along with 3.5 kilograms of hemp.

data.name: Kashidul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description:
Based on information that some robbers were preparing to rob a house in Kashidanga village in the upazila, a police team led by Akhiul Islam, additional SP of Hakimpur circle, went to the spot around 2:00 am, said Abdur Razzak, officer-in-charge of Hakimpur Police Station. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. The police returned fire, triggering a "gun battle". At one stage, Kashidul, the leader of the robber gang, was shot dead. Others fled the spot, the OC said. The Daily Star reported that a suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in the district's Hakimpur upazila early yesterday. Kashidul Islam, 44, of Nashipur village in the upazila, was accused in 11 robbery cases, according to the police. 

On receiving information that some robbers were preparing to rob a house in Kashidanga village in the upazila, a police team led by Akhiul Islam, additional SP of Hakimpur circle, went to the spot around 2:00 am, said Abdur Razzak, officer-in-charge of Hakimpur Police Station. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. The police returned fire, triggering a "gun battle". At one stage, Kashidul, the leader of the robber gang, was shot dead. Others fled the spot, the OC said. Two police personnel, including Sub-inspector Mahe Alam and constable Fazlul Haque of Hakimpur Police Station, were injured, according to the police official. The police also claimed to have recovered a firearm, several bullets, and cartridges from the spot. The body of Kashidul was sent to Dinajpur M Abdur Rahim Medical College for an autopsy. The injured were sent to Dinajpur Police Lines Hospital, the OC added. On January 13, two alleged drug dealers were killed in a similar incident with the police in Dinajpur Sadar upazila.

data.name: Aurangajeb Jebu
data.description: Aurangajeb Jebu, a suspected drug dealer in his fifties, was killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Detective Branch at Bankapur of Manda upazila in Naogaon on early Tuesday. Superintendent of Naogaon police, Abdul Mannan, said that a team of DB police arrested Jebu from Deluabari Bazar on Monday night. After obtaining information from Jebu, a team of DB police conducted a raid in the area in the early hours of Tuesday. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the suspected drug dealers opened fire on the police, forcing them to fire back in self-defense, which triggered a gunfight. At one point, Jebu was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while the others managed to flee the scene. Mozaffar Hossain, officer-in-charge of Manda police station, stated that Jebu was a listed "drug trader" in the area and wanted in 20 criminal cases. Three policemen, including DB sub-inspector Mehedi Hasan, were injured in the incident. A large quantity of heroin, Yaba pills, a pistol, and some knives were seized from the location. A case was filed with the Manda police.

data.name: Mongqueu Tongchonga
data.description: A suspected yaba trader was killed in a reported gunfight with BGB at the Balukhali Panbazar area of Ukhiya upazila in Cox's Bazar this morning. The deceased was identified as Mongqueu Tongchonga, 25, son of Chachinghla Tongchonga, of Bashfari area of Ghumdhum union under Naikhongchari upazila. Lt Colonel Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, captain of the 34th Battalion of Cox's Bazar BGB, said, "Tipped off about a big consignment of yaba trading in the Balukhali area, a team of BGB held their position around the spot and challenged a few people over suspicion while they were coming from the direction of Myanmar around 3:30 am. All of a sudden, the yaba traders opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back in self-defense, triggering the gunfight." After the gunfight, the police recovered the body of one of the yaba traders on the spot and took him to Ukhiya Upazila Health Complex where the duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Yasmin Begum
data.description: Yasmin Begum died several hours after being picked up from her home by the Detective Branch of the police in Gazipur. Her 17-year-old son, Yasin Arafat Jisan, said that around 4-5 men in plain clothes, who identified themselves as DB officers, arrived at their home in Bhawal in the evening. They claimed they were looking for his father, Abdul Hai, regarding allegations of drug dealing. When Jisan and his mother informed them that Abdul was not at home, the men began to beat her and took her into custody. Around 11:00 pm, Jisan received a phone call informing him that his mother had fallen ill and had been taken to Gazipur Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital. Due to transportation difficulties, he arrived at the hospital around 1:00 am and discovered that his mother had passed away. Jisan stated that there were visible injuries on her legs, arms, and other parts of her body. Meanwhile, Deputy Commissioner Manjur Rahman of DB in Gazipur stated that Yasmin was arrested with 120 yaba pills and taken to the DB office in the city. She later fell ill and was transported to the hospital. Jisan mentioned that his father was a drug addict and only came home once or twice a week, but he was not accused in any case. He added that the officers did not find any yaba pills in his mother's possession.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Police arrested the duo from Nawabganj on February 19, 2020. Gathering information from the two, a police team took them and raided Chhoto Magura village to recover firearms around 3:00 am, said Ashok Kumar Chauhan, officer-in-charge of Nawabganj Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, other members of the gang opened fire. The police retaliated, claimed the OC. Rafiqul and Wazed were shot dead while trying to escape from police custody. Rafiqul was accused in three robbery cases and Wazed in two robbery cases, according to the police. In Dinajpur, two members of a robber gang, Rafiqul Islam, 28, from Gaibandha, and Wazed Ali, 30, from Dinajpur, were killed in a "shootout" with the police in Nawabganj upazila. The police arrested the duo from Nawabganj on Wednesday. Gathering information from the two, a police team took them and raided Chhoto Magura village to recover firearms around 3:00 am, said Ashok Kumar Chauhan, officer-in-charge of Nawabganj Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, other members of the gang opened fire. The police retaliated, claimed the OC. Rafiqul and Wazed were shot dead while trying to escape from police custody. However, others managed to flee, he added. Four police personnel were injured in the incident, according to the OC. Rafiqul was accused in three robbery cases and Wazed in two robbery cases, said the police. The two bodies were sent to M Abdur Rahim Medical College in Dinajpur for autopsies, he added.

data.name: Habban Ali Sheikh
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a police team conducted a raid in the Char Shibrampur area of Pabna Sadar upazila around 2:00 am, said Rafiqul Islam, superintendent of Pabna police. When the police reached the scene, the criminals opened fire on them. The law enforcers returned fire. After the gun battle, the police found Habban, who had been hit by a bullet, lying on the ground, he said. Habban was declared dead after being taken to Pabna Sadar Hospital, the SP said. In another gunfight, a suspected drug dealer named Habban Ali Sheikh, 45, from Pabna town, was killed in Pabna. Acting on a tip-off, a police team conducted a raid in the Char Shibrampur area of Pabna Sadar upazila around 2:00 am, said Rafiqul Islam, superintendent of Pabna police. When the police reached the scene, the criminals opened fire on them. The law enforcers returned fire. After the gun battle, the police found Habban, who had been hit by a bullet, lying on the ground, he said. Habban was declared dead after being taken to Pabna Sadar Hospital, the SP said. He was accused in 12 cases filed with different police stations, the police official added. Four police personnel were injured in the incident and they were admitted to Pabna General Hospital, the SP said, claiming that the police recovered a firearm and five bullets from the scene.

data.name: Torikul Islam
data.description: In Chapainawabganj, the main suspect in the murder of a seven-year-old girl was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Horishpur, Sadar upazila. Torikul Islam, also known as Saddam, 32, from Manik Hajir Tola village in the same upazila, was accused of raping and killing the girl.

data.name: Jahangir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Loharpool Bridge in the Palpara area. The Kotwali model police station and district intelligence police conducted joint operations in the area. The robbers opened fire at the team upon sensing their presence. In self-defense, the police retaliated, according to police sources. Three police personnel and two robbers were injured during the incident. They were rescued and taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared the two robbers dead. New Age reported that at least three individuals, including a suspected child rapist, were killed in "gunfights" in Comilla and Chapainawabganj early on Friday and Thursday night. In Comilla, two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Loharpool Bridge in the Palpara area of Sadar upazila early on Friday. The deceased were identified as Arifuzzaman Emon from the Bhatpara area of Sadar upazila and Jahangir from the Araiwara area. The Kotwali model police station and district intelligence police conducted joint operations in the area. The robbers opened fire at the team upon sensing their presence. In self-defense, the police retaliated, according to police sources. Three police personnel and two robbers were injured during the incident. They were rescued and taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared the two robbers dead. The police recovered an LG gun, five cartridges, and sharp weapons from the scene. Pirmal Das, a sub-inspector of the DB police, confirmed the matter and stated that the deceased robbers were accused in three to five criminal cases.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Narayanganj, a RAB team installed a checkpoint on the Asian Highway in the Kalni area after learning that a private car carrying a drug consignment was heading towards Gazipur, said Major Abdullah Al Mehdi, camp commander of RAB-1 in Gazipur. "As we signaled to stop the car, its passengers started firing on us, which forced us to fire back in self-defense," he said. Later, the RAB personnel found a person with a bullet injury inside the car as the three others fled the scene. They took him to a nearby hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mozaher
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Four people, including two alleged members of a robbery gang, were killed in three separate "gunfights" with law enforcement in Cumilla, Narayanganj, and Cox's Bazar early today. The deceased was identified as Mohammad Mozaher (35) from Cox's Bazar's Teknaf upazila. Acting on a tip-off, a police team launched a raid at Hariakhali village in Teknaf upazila around 1:15 am to arrest Mozaher, a fugitive accused in a murder case filed with Teknaf Police Station. Sensing their presence, Mozaher and his accomplices opened fire on the law enforcement officers, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight, said the police. At one point, Mozaher was shot while his accomplices managed to escape the scene, said Pradib Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. He was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, the OC said.

data.name: Ali Hossain
data.description: Ali Hossain, 40, from Kodupur village, was killed in what RAB said was a "gunfight" with them. Samiul Alam, media officer of RAB-9, said, "During a drive to arrest Ali, he and his associates opened fire on RAB members, which eventually led to a gunfight. Five others were arrested at the scene.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Narayanganj, an unidentified youth was found dead in a car with drugs after a 'gunfight' with Rapid Action Battalion near a checkpoint in the Colony area of Rupganj, Narayanganj. According to Bangla News 24, an unidentified drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Colony area of Rupganj upazila, Narayanganj, early on Friday (February 21). The identity of the deceased has not been determined. Two pistols, two magazines, seven rounds of bullets, 296 bottles of Phensedyl, 5 kg of hemp, and a private car were seized from them, according to Company Commander of RAB-1 Purbachal Camp, Major Abdullah Al Mehedi. The dead body will be sent to Narayanganj Sadar Hospital for post-mortem. A case will be filed with Rupganj Police Station, said Abdullah Al Mehedi.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: Abdus Salam, an accused in three human trafficking cases, was killed in an alleged gunfight with the police. He was one of the main accused in a human trafficking case filed after a trawler capsized near St Martin's Island. The "gunfight" took place at the foot of a hill near Salam's house around 4:00 am, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police went to the area to arrest Salam and his cohorts, who were holding a meeting there, the OC said. Sensing the police presence, Salam's men opened fire on the law enforcers and injured three cops, he said. In self-defense, the police retaliated with gunshots. Salam's men fled at one point, the official said, adding that the police found bullet-hit Salam and rushed him to the upazila health complex. Later, he was shifted to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, the OC added.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" between two gangs of drug peddlers and a joint team of police at Bagowan village. Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of Daulatpur police and the Detective Branch of police conducted a raid at about 3:00 am while two gangs of drug peddlers were selling and buying drugs in a betel leaf orchard, according to Daulatpur police station officer-in-charge SM Arifur Rahman. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement, Shahid's associate opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight. After the gunfight, the police recovered Shahid's bullet-injured body while his associates managed to flee. They took Shahid to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Arpon Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A criminal was killed in a gunfight between his gang and security force members in Rangamati early this morning, according to an Inter Services Public Relations (ISPR) press release. The deceased was identified as Arpon Chakma, also known as Babudhan Chakma. Arpon was a member of the armed wing of the United People's Democratic Front, it added. According to the press release, the gunfight ensued when a patrol team from Shuvlong camp under Rangamati zone was patrolling in a boat at Banaschhari of Bandukbhanga area in the early morning. Suddenly, a group of armed criminals from a hilltop opened fire, targeting the patrol team and forcing the security force members to fire back in self-defense, the release said. After 15 to 20 minutes, the armed criminals were forced to retreat, and the security force members took control of the area, the release said. Later, they conducted a search in the area and recovered the body of Arpan.

data.name: Nurul Haque Keru
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Bagaritola area in Monirampur Upazila of Jashore district yesterday (Friday). The deceased was identified as Nurul Haque Karu, 52, son of Majed Gaji from Vojgati village of the upazila and was accused in at least ten robbery cases filed with different police stations. Md Jashim Uddin, officer in charge of Kashobpur police station, said that villagers arrested Nurul Haque and handed him over to the police station during an Easybyke robbery in Chingrakhali area of Keshabpur upazila on Thursday evening. During interrogation, he provided information to the police about his weapons and associates. Later, a joint police team from Keshabpur and Manirampur police took him to the Bagaritala area at 4:00 am. When Nurul Haque reached Begaitala area with the police team, the associates of Nurul Haque opened fire, targeting a patrolling police team who arrived at the spot around 4:00 am, the OC said. In self-defense, the law enforcers also fired shots, triggering the "gunfight". He died on the spot, officials said.

data.name: Shariful Islam
data.description: In Feni, it was reported that Nishan and Shariful appeared before a Feni court on 27 February in relation to a robbery case. The families stated that they were accused in a case filed in 2019 due to a feud with a local political leader. They were granted bail and attended the court hearing. After the hearing, Shamsul went to Feni Bara Bazar to shop for his sister's wedding, according to his uncle Delowar Hossain. Shamsul was called to a location by someone named Sujon, who also attended the court hearing in the case, over the phone. The family has been unable to locate him since 1:00 pm on 27 February. He stated that Shamsul was never involved in the robbery, but was falsely accused in an "imaginary case" last year due to the feud with local political leaders. Shariful Islam's father, Obaidul Haque, said that his son earned a living by driving a human hauler, but was accused in the case due to the feud with local political leaders. On 27 February, he appeared before the court and did not return home. Later on 28 February, they identified his body at the hospital. "My son was killed after being picked up by the police," Obaidul alleged. "He was never involved in robbery." Sonagazi police officer-in-charge Moin Uddin Ahmed denied the allegations. He stated that Shamsul and Shariful were robbers and were killed in an internal fight near Bismillah Brickfield in Mangalkandi village on the night of 27 February. Two locally made guns and eight cartridges were found at the scene as evidence of firing among the robbers.

data.name: Bulu Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Bortola of Moulvibazar Sadar upazila early Saturday. The deceased was identified as Bulu Mia. A gang of 10-12 robbers was fleeing the area after committing a robbery at a house in the area, said Alamgir Hossain, officer-in-charge of Sadar police station. The robbers opened fire when a patrol team of police signaled the auto-rickshaw carrying the robbers to stop, forcing the police to fire back, which triggered the gunfight. At one stage, Bulu was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Hafez Nazrul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Nazrul Islam was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Amanullahpur village in Begumganj. He was accused of the murder of Rakib Hossain, a leader of the student wing of the AL. According to the police, he held the position of second-in-command in the student wing of Jamaat's Pias Bahini. Harun-ur-Rashid Chowdhury, the officer-in-charge of Begumganj police station, stated that the police and the Detective Branch jointly conducted a raid at Jonokollyan High School field around 3:45 am. Members of Pias Bahini engaged in a gunfight with them, resulting in Nazrul sustaining gunshot wounds. The police then transported him to Noakhali General Hospital, where the doctors pronounced him dead, as reported by the OC.

data.name: Mohon Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mohon Ali was killed in a gunfight with the police at Golapnagar Moni Park in Bheramara upazila. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Bheramara police conducted a raid in the area near Kushtia-Ishwardi Highway while a gang of robbers was taking position there to commit robbery, according to Bheramara police officer-in-charge Mohammad Shahjalal. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, which triggered the gunfight.

data.name: Musa Miah
data.description: Four people were shot dead and several others injured after a BGB team opened fire on villagers in Matiranga upazila during an altercation over the seizure of tree logs. The BGB headquarters issued a press statement titled 'Unwanted Incident Created During Smuggling of Wood Logs'. Dulu Mia, one of the witnesses to the shooting, stated that BGB commander Ishaque, along with his team, was attempting to seize four jackfruit tree logs from Amir Hamza, which led to an altercation near Gazinagar Bazar. He mentioned that they discovered Amir Hamza had cut his trees on the instruction of the local power supply authorities. The BGB team wanted to take the logs away in a pickup van, but there was a commotion as villagers tried to resist the team, he confirmed. Ahammad Ali was filming the scene with his mobile phone, but BGB members confiscated it and got into a scuffle. During the scuffle, soldier Shaon and villager Ali Akbar fell to the ground, according to Dulu Mia, who also stated that Ishaque opened fire, targeting them. The DC formed a three-member committee, headed by additional district magistrate Khandker Muhammad Rizaul Karim, to conduct an inquiry into the killings.
