data.name: Ozi Ullah
data.description: A Rohingya man, suspected to be a robber, was killed allegedly in a gunfight with the police in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar on Friday. The deceased, Ozi Ullah, 30, was from Maungdaw in Myanmar's Rakhine state and sheltered at Nayapara refugee camp in Teknaf. Police say he was the nephew and second-in-command of Rohingya robber Zakir Ahmed. The gunfight reportedly took place in the Habirchhara area in Teknaf Sadar at around 4 pm on Friday, Teknaf police station OC Pradip Kumar Das confirmed. The OC said the police received a tip-off that a group of Rohingya robbers were staying on a hill in Habirchhara, and a team led by Inspector (investigation) ABMS Doha conducted a drive in the area. "When the robbers noticed the police team there, they opened fire. The policemen fired back. The robbers retreated after a while, and the police rescued a severely wounded Ozi. Three policemen, including Inspector Doha, were injured as well. The police sent Ozi to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, but he was moved to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital as his condition was critical," said Dr Naima Sifat of the health complex emergency room. Ozi succumbed to his injuries around 5:30 pm, OC Pradip said.

data.name: Zubair Mia
data.description: A Rohingya man, Zubair Mia (32), son of Yunus Mia, was killed in a gunfight with the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) at the Palangkhali border in Ukhiya, Cox's Bazar. The incident occurred in the beribandh area of Nafnadi near Rahmaterbil of Palongkhali Union early on Monday. Zubair was a resident of A-block of Leda Rohingya camp in Teknaf. Based on information regarding Yaba shipments from Myanmar, the BGB patrol team confronted some individuals, resulting in a firefight. Zubair was later found seriously injured and was declared dead at Ukhia Upazila Health Complex. His body has been sent to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for post-mortem, according to Inspector Nurul Islam of Ukhia Police Station.

data.name: Noyon Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police confirmed that the UPDF attacked a patrol team of the Army, and they retaliated, resulting in Sajek being shot dead on the spot. The Officer in Charge of the local police station confirmed that a gunfight took place between UPDF members and the Army. The deceased body has been sent to the General Hospital for autopsy. The UPDF claimed that the killing was premeditated.

data.name: Altaf Hossain
data.description: Altaf Hossain's family members said he was picked up from Jaamgara village in Muktagacha on February 28, 2020. A Mymensingh court sent him to jail on March 1. He was released on bail on March 7. His 12-year-old son, Arif Hossain, said he was home on February 28. "I came home from my madrasa around 2:00 pm and heard from neighbors that the police chased my father, caught him, and then beat him up with tree branches," said Arif. "Later, the police demanded Tk 85,000 from us. Since we didn't have the money, they took my father to Muktagacha Police Station where he was tortured mercilessly." After Altaf was released on bail on March 7, he lost his appetite and couldn't sleep. But the family couldn't afford to take him to a hospital, said Sirajul Islam, brother-in-law of Altaf. "As his condition deteriorated, we were taking him to Muktagacha Upazila Health Complex, but he died on the way," said Sirajul. Refuting the allegations of torture, the Officer-in-charge (Investigation) of Muktagacha Police Station, Jahangir Alam, said the court or the jail authorities wouldn't have accepted him if he was sick or injured and added that the allegation was baseless.

data.name: Mohammad Khokon
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Porimol Das, a sub-inspector of the Detective Branch (DB) of the police in Cumilla, said that a joint team of DB police and Chandina Police Station launched a drive in the Chhoygharia Sakin area on the Dhaka-Chattogram Highway around 1:30 am after receiving information that a group of robbers was preparing for a robbery attempt there. Sensing the presence of the police team, the gang of robbers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back, he said. During the incident, Khokon was caught in the line of fire and sustained injuries while the other robbers managed to escape the scene. He was taken to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, said SI Porimol.

data.name: Jahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Former Vice President of Chuadanga District Chhatra League, Zahidul Islam Zahid, died after being detained by the police. He fell ill after being arrested from Damurhuda upazila on Saturday evening. The police took him to Chuadanga Sadar Hospital, where he passed away while receiving treatment. The family of the deceased, Zahidul Islam Zahid (45), claimed that the police arrested Zahid and physically tortured him to death. However, the police denied this allegation and stated that Zahidul, who they referred to as a 'drug addict', was taken to the Damurhuda Upazila Health Complex when he fell ill after being arrested while intoxicated. From there, he was transferred to Chuadanga Sadar Hospital, where he died while undergoing treatment. Jahangir Alam, the brother of the deceased, said that after arresting Zahid, the police beat him up in front of the crowd.

data.name: Johurul Islam
data.description: A suspected drug dealer, who was allegedly wanted in 10 drug cases, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police near Makampur Ballabhpur Secondary School in Chaugachha upazila, Jashore at about 3:30 pm on Sunday. A press release from Jashore police stated that the deceased individual is Jahurul Islam, 38, a resident of Chhota Andulia in Chaugachha.

data.name: Abdul Mannan
data.description: Asaduzzaman, Deputy Commissioner (East Division) of the Detective Branch of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, said that the deceased - Abdul Mannan alias Mona, 35 - was the alleged leader of the mugging gang responsible for the death of a woman who fell from a rickshaw after muggers snatched her bag. Earlier, police arrested four muggers from the Mugda Stadium area and informed the media that they were searching for their gang leader, Mona. Later, based on the information provided by the arrestees, police conducted a raid in Khilgaon's Nagdarpar area around 3:00 am to apprehend other members of the gang, the Deputy Commissioner said. "Upon sensing the presence of the police, the muggers opened fire. This prompted the law enforcers to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight during which Mona was shot," the Detective Branch official claimed.

data.name: Abdul Alim
data.description: Abdul Alim was killed in a "shootout" with the police in Pabna's Santhia upazila, said Goutam Kumar, the additional superintendent of police in Pabna. Acting on a tip-off that a group of drug peddlers had taken shelter somewhere in the Khoyerbagan area, a police team raided the area around 2:00 am, he said. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, which eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, the police found Alim with a bullet injury and took him to Pabna Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Moniruzzaman Monir
data.description: Monir was allegedly beaten to death by the police. Monir's family members complained that several cops, some in plainclothes, raided the building at Chamarkhan of Uttarkhan. The victim's brother, Zakir Hawlader, said that cops from Uttarkhan police station raided their building at about 5:30 am and dragged his brother onto the rooftop. The police locked the door and beat his brother. The police then rushed Monir to a local hospital at about 9:30 am, claiming that he had a stroke, and doctors there declared him dead.

data.name: Sohel Hawlader
data.description: Sohel Hawlader was killed in an alleged gunfight with the police in the Khilgaon area, hours after he was arrested from the Airport Road area. Mashiure Rahman, the officer-in-charge of Khilgaon Police Station, said a police team, in association with the Airport Armed Police Battalion, arrested Sohel from the Airport area on the evening of March 22, 2020, after he arrived in Dhaka from Cox's Bazar. Later, based on his information, the police took him to the Nagdarpar area in Khilgaon around 3:00 am to recover hidden firearms and drugs, the OC said. Sensing their presence, Sohel's associates opened fire, prompting law enforcers to fire back in "self-defense". At one stage, Sohel fell in the line of fire, while his cohorts managed to flee the scene. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead, the OC added. Sohel's elder brother, Jamal Hawlader, alleged that they went to Khilgaon Police Station on Saturday night after hearing that the police had picked up Sohel, who was returning from Cox's Bazar. The police then told them to go to court, as he would be produced before it. "But they killed my brother," he claimed.

data.name: Rofiqul Islam
data.description: It is alleged that the police and Rofiqul were locked in a tussle about drugs, and then the police beat him grievously, resulting in his death.

data.name: Parvez Khan
data.description: Golam Mostafa, officer-in-charge (OC) of Kushtia Model Police Station, said they arrested Parvez on the afternoon of March 24, 2020, and obtained information about his firearm storage. Acting on this information, the police, along with Parvez, went to Shalda village in the upazila to recover the firearms. However, on their way, Parvez's accomplices opened fire on the police at around 3:30 am, which forced the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. During the "gunfight", Parvez sustained bullet wounds and died on the spot.

data.name: Surat Ali
data.description: Surat Ali was killed, and five others were injured in a clash between jute mill workers and the police in Biral. Amir Ali, a workers' leader of Rupali Bangla Jute Mills, said the mill authorities announced the shutdown of the mills without any prior notice amid the coronavirus outbreak. The workers demonstrated in and around the mill, demanding their three weeks' arrears, he added. At one point, the mill director tried to pacify the workers with the police, resulting in the clash, he added. Sheikh Mohammad Nasim Habib, the officer-in-charge of Biral Police Station, said they had to fire rubber bullets, tear shells, and charge batons to bring the situation under control. Surat suffered injuries during the clash and later died. Meanwhile, Abdul Kader, a sub-inspector of that police station, filed a case accusing 1100 unnamed people in connection with the incident.

data.name: Shanu Hawlader
data.description: Shanu Hawlader died three days after he was arrested. A doctor said there were multiple injury marks on his body. Police arrested Shanu on March 23, 2020, from his home in Kalagachia village of Amtali upazila on suspicion of being involved in a murder last year. He was not accused in the murder case, family members and locals said. His wife, Jhahanara Begum, and son, Shakib Hossain, alleged that police demanded Tk three lakh in return for releasing him. As they could not arrange the money on such short notice, Officer-in-Charge Abul Bashar and Manoranjan Mistry tortured Shanu to death. Shakib said he offered Tk 10,000 to Abul Bashar on March 24, 2020, but he refused to take the money and asked for the full amount. On March 25, 2020, Shakib and his mother Jhahanara went to the police station to meet Shanu, but they were refused by the police officials. Jhahanara's brother, Rakibul Islam, said, "I heard Shanu's scream in agony while I was waiting at the police station to meet him on the same day." Shanu was found hanging from the ceiling fan in Inspector Manoranjan's room on March 26, 2020, morning, according to Bashar. He added that Shanu was taken to the bathroom by a constable around 6:30 am. But he sneaked out of the bathroom moments later and hung himself. Manoranjan and Arifur were suspended for the allegations of Shanu's death. A three-member committee headed by Additional SP was also formed and asked to submit a report in three days.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, the commanding officer of BGB-2, stated that based on a tip-off, a BGB team conducted a raid on the flood control embankment in the River Naf. They intercepted a small boat arriving from Myanmar. A gunfight ensued when the criminals opened fire on the law enforcement officers in an attempt to flee the scene. After the gunfight concluded, three drug peddlers who had been shot were found lying on the ground, according to the BGB official. They were transported to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where attending doctors pronounced them dead. The bodies were subsequently handed over to the Teknaf police.

data.name: Musa Akbar
data.description: Musa, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with the Teknaf police. Teknaf police officer in-charge, Prodeep Kumar Das, said that acting on a tip-off, a police team raided village Tolatoli under Hoykong union at about 4:00 am. Sensing the presence of the police, miscreants opened fire on them, which triggered the gunfight. When the gunfight was over, the police recovered the bullet-hit body of Musa from the spot.

data.name: Sarwar Salo
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Goutam Kumar Biswas, additional superintendent of police, said that acting on a tip-off, the police and Detective Branch members jointly raided Shamukjani Bazar in Santhia upazila at about 2:00 am. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the robbers opened fire, triggering a skirmish, added the ASP. Sarwar, who was injured in the gunfight, was arrested from the spot and taken to Pabna General Hospital where the doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ferdous Fahim
data.description: Moniruzzaman Monir, officer-in-charge of Birampur Police Station, said that they were tipped off about drug traders bringing drugs from the bordering area. As a result, the police took positions beside Mirpur field. During the operation, the drug traders opened fire at the police, resulting in the death of Fahim in the ensuing gunfight.

data.name: Faruk Moral
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Lieutenant Colonel Rawshanul Firoz of RAB-6 stated that they conducted a raid in the area at approximately 7:00 am. Upon their arrival, the robbers opened fire at them, initiating a skirmish that endured for about 40 minutes. Subsequently, RAB apprehended Faruk at the scene and transported him to Mongla Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him deceased, he added.

data.name: Zahidul Islam
data.description: Parimal Kumar Chakrabarty, Officer-in-Charge of Patnitala Police Station, said that Zahidul was arrested on April 1, 2020. The police took him to Bakrail village to recover drugs. When the police reached the spot, Zahidul's associates opened fire. "He was killed in the ensuing gunfight.

data.name: Mohammad Ilias
data.description: Mohammad Ilias, a Rohingya refugee and suspected robber, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB at Jadimura refugee camp under Hinllah union of Teknaf police station. RAB claimed that 12 other people were injured in this gunfight. RAB 15 company commander Mirza Sahed Mahatab said a group of RAB raided Jadimura Rohingya Refugees camp at midnight to arrest suspected Rohingya robbers and seize illegal firearms. When they arrived at the camp, the suspected robbers opened fire on them and they retaliated by firing back. Later, RAB members found a Rohingya man shot and wounded and seized some illegal firearms from him. However, the injured man died on the way to Teknaf upazila health complex.

data.name: Minhajul Islam
data.description: Police arrested Minhajul from his residence on April 1, 2020. Later, the police took him with them to recover firearms at Tilabaduri village. As soon as the police reached the spot, Minhajul's cohorts opened fire. Minhajul was killed during the skirmish.

data.name: Mohammad Mizan
data.description: Two suspected yaba traders were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Cox's Bazar's Teknaf upazila. While searching a microbus, the police recovered five thousand yaba pills and arrested its driver, Mahmudullah, on April 5, 2020, around 9:00 am, according to Prodip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station. Based on his confessional statement, a police team conducted a raid in the Jhimongkhali area near the Naf river to recover arms and yaba, said the OC. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the cohorts of the arrestee opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. Mahmudullah and another attacker sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight and were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, as stated by OC Prodip. Doctors at the health complex referred them to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mahmud Ullah
data.description: Two suspected yaba traders were killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Cox's Bazar's Teknaf upazila. While searching a microbus, the police recovered five thousand yaba pills and arrested its driver, Mahmudullah, on April 5, 2020, around 9:00 am, according to Prodip Kumar Das, the officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station. Based on his confessional statement, a police team conducted a raid in the Jhimongkhali area near the Naf river to recover arms and yaba, said the OC. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the cohorts of the arrestee opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. Mahmudullah and another attacker sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight and were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, as stated by OC Prodip. Doctors at the health complex referred them to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Ali Hossain Titu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The Metropolitan Police's West Zone Additional Deputy Commissioner, Anis Uddin, said that they arrested five people at different locations in the city for their suspected involvement in robberies on the nights following April 1 and April 5. The arrestees informed them that Ali Hossain led their gang. He further stated that they located Ali Hossain in Mohammadpur on the night of April 13. Acting on secret information, a team went to the Bochhila area to apprehend him. Unfortunately, Ali Hossain was killed in a 'gunfight' with the DB police.

data.name: Mohammad Hassan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Bejgaon bus terminal area. Enayet Hossain Mannan, superintendent of police of RAB-11 in Munshiganj, said the duo had committed a robbery in Shariatpur's Gosairhat upazila a few days ago. The "gunfight" broke out on the Dhaka-Mawa Highway around noon when members of RAB-2 were pursuing the robbers, he added. Hedayetul Islam Bhuiyan, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said the two men were heading to Dhaka on a battery-run auto rickshaw. They opened fire on the approaching RAB team, triggering the "gunfight" which left the two dead, the OC said.

data.name: Masud Hawlader
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Bejgaon bus terminal area. Enayet Hossain Mannan, superintendent of police of RAB-11 in Munshiganj, said the duo had committed a robbery in Shariatpur's Gosairhat upazila a few days ago. The "gunfight" broke out on the Dhaka-Mawa Highway around noon when members of RAB-2 were pursuing the robbers, he added. Hedayetul Islam Bhuiyan, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said the two men were heading to Dhaka on a battery-run auto rickshaw. They opened fire on the approaching RAB team, triggering the "gunfight" which left the two dead, the OC said.

data.name: Jafar Alam
data.description: Jafar Alam was killed in a gunfight with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) at Golarchar in Teknaf. The BGB said that Jafar Alam was a drug peddler, and they seized 200,000 Yaba tablets from him. Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, the commanding officer of the 2nd BGB Battalion at Teknaf, said that BGB members were patrolling along the shore at about 1:30 am. At one stage, they saw a small wooden fishing boat coming towards Bangladesh from the Myanmar side, crossing the river Naf at about 2:00 am. The boat anchored at Golarchar near Shahparidwip. As the BGB members challenged the boat, the people aboard it opened fire on them. The BGB members also retaliated with gunshots, said Faisal Hasan. After the "gunfight," the BGB members found one bullet-hit person and 200,000 Yaba tablets on the boat. The bullet-hit man was immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where the on-duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Jashim Mondol
data.description: Jashim Mondol was killed in a reported gunfight between members of the Border Guard Bangladesh and a gang of peddlers at the Natunpara border area. Quoting BGB-58, Officer-in-Charge Saiful Islam of Jibannagar police station said that BGB arrested Jashim with phensedyl from the border area in the upazila around 3:00 am. Later, Jashim was killed in a gunfight during a drive conducted to recover more drugs, as per the information provided by Jashim, which BGB claimed.

data.name: Ekramul Hossain
data.description: Shot in an altercation with RAB at Shoshanghat, the victim and his crew started firing as soon as RAB entered the area, acting on a tip-off. The gunfight between the two sides lasted almost 10 minutes. The victim was declared dead by the doctor at Joypurhat Modern Hospital after being found lying at the scene of the raid at the end of the gunfight and being taken to the hospital by RAB.

data.name: Robiul Islam Robu
data.description: ASP Kamruzzaman confirmed that a group of drug peddlers were dealing drugs around 1:00 am. Acting on a tip-off, they went to raid the place. Robu was shot in the altercation with RAB and died on his way to the hospital.

data.name: Abdur Rashid Khorshed
data.description: The police began chasing the bike and its rider when it failed to stop after being signaled to do so on the Cox's Bazar-Chittagong Highway. When they reached Jowariyanala, Ramu, a group started firing at the police, prompting the DB police to fire back in self-defense. The police stated that they discovered a deceased individual (the victim), 20k Yaba pills, a motorcycle, and an LG at the scene.

data.name: Mannan
data.description: Milon, the younger brother of Mannan, alleged that Mannan was driving his CNG vehicle back to Kaliganj when two police officers stopped him and started beating him. They claimed that Mannan was driving during the lockdown and arrested him. The police, on the other hand, stated that the CNG driver had a heart attack when he was questioned and unfortunately passed away in the hospital due to a severe heart attack. The victim's brother mentioned that they witnessed their brother's lifeless body lying at the Police Lines.

data.name: Giridhari Chowdhury
data.description: CMP Deputy Commissioner (DC, South) Md Mehedi Hasan said Giridhari and a colleague of his were loading clothes from their shop onto a rickshaw after iftar, despite the market being closed. A security guard of Teri Bazar confronted them and asked why they were there amid the lockdown. The two staffers acted suspiciously during questioning, and the guard informed a police patrol team that was passing by. Police then took the duo to the outpost, the DC said. DC Mehedi said that at the outpost, officers asked Giridhari to call his shop owner, but he suddenly fell sick. Police rushed him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital (CMCH), where on-duty doctors declared him dead. Colleagues of the victim alleged that police beat him up and that led to his death. Police denied the allegation. ASI Kamrul Islam and his two constables were suspended for their alleged involvement in this incident.

data.name: Mohammad Abdur Rashid
data.description: CPC-1 Camp Company Commander Biman Karmokar confirmed that the Rohingya dacoit gang was preparing for a raid on the west side of the mountain, specifically in the hilly area of Shalbagan. Acting on this tip-off, a team of RAB went to the spot when the gang started firing at them, to which RAB fired back. After a few moments of gunfight, they recovered the dead bodies of the victims.

data.name: Mohammad Abdul Hakim
data.description: CPC-1 Camp Company Commander Biman Karmokar confirmed that the Rohingya dacoit gang was preparing for a raid on the west side of the mountain, specifically in the hilly area of Shalbagan. Acting on this tip-off, a team of RAB went to the spot when the gang started firing at them, to which RAB fired back. After a few moments of gunfight, they recovered the dead bodies of the victims.

data.name: Shahid Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Shahid was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the Beribadh area. A team of RAB 1 conducted a raid in the area at night, according to sources at the RAB headquarters. The robbers opened fire as soon as the team approached the area, resulting in a skirmish. At one point, Shahid was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, while the others managed to escape the scene, as stated by RAB sources.

data.name: Mohammad Sayem Firoz
data.description: Officer-in-Charge Anwarul Islam confirmed that they raided Khilpara Bazar on a tip-off, and the drug peddler gang started firing at the police when they reached the place. In self-defense, the police fired back. The doctors pronounced him dead when he was taken to Upazilla Health Complex after the gunfight. The dead body was sent to Noakhali General Hospital for post-mortem.

data.name: Juwel Ahmed Shobuj
data.description: Wing Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that Shobuj kidnapped a 5-year-old kid named Alif on 29th April. Earlier, RAB arrested Sagor, who confessed that Shobuj was the mastermind behind the killing. RAB recovered a decomposed body of Alif wrapped in a plastic bag. Based on this information, a team of RAB went to the spot to arrest Shobuj. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang started firing, and in self-defense, RAB started firing back and saw a dead body lying, which was later confirmed as Shobuj's.

data.name: Kanak Chowhdhury
data.description: Kanak's aunt, Rokeya Begum, alleged that Kanak died in Rajpara Police custody after being taken into custody for two days in a murder case. She also claimed that it was a preplanned murder in order to take possession of property. Sub-Inspector Jamal Uddin of Rajpara Police Station denied the allegations.

data.name: Syed Alam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Teknaf police have reported that the deceased individuals were part of a crime ring in the area and were preparing to commit a robbery. Acting on this information, the police went to Rangikhali hills at approximately 4:00 am to apprehend them. Upon arrival, the suspects initiated gunfire towards the police, which led the police to retaliate with gunshots, according to Teknaf police station officer-in-charge, Prodeep Kumar Das. Following the exchange of gunfire, the police discovered the bodies of the three suspects, along with 18 local weapons, 200 cartridges, and 55,000 pieces of Yaba tablets. Prodeep further stated that five police personnel, including a sub-inspector, sustained injuries during the altercation. Three cases will be filed in relation to this incident. The bodies have been sent to Cox's Bazar General Hospital for autopsies.

data.name: Mohammad Sadek
data.description: A suspected Rohingya drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the BGB. Tipped off, a team of BGB conducted a raid at the Rahmetorbill border area around 4 am, as confirmed by Lt. Col. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed. Sensing the presence of the guards, the criminals opened fire on the BGB men, forcing them to fire back in self-defense, which triggered the gunfight. Later, the BGB men recovered the body of the drug peddler from the scene. They also seized 30,000 Yaba Pills, a firearm, and three rounds of bullets from the location.

data.name: Maruf Mollah
data.description: Lt. Col. Rowshanul Firoz, Commanding Officer of RAB-6, said that Maruf died in a gunfight where two RAB personnel were also wounded. OC Tazul Islam confirmed that a team of the RAB raided the area while 7-8 drug peddlers were dealing with drugs in a field at the location around 5:55 pm. A gunfight ensued as the suspected drug dealers opened fire at the RAB personnel, and a youth was killed. The youth was brought dead to the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Rafique
data.description: It was alleged that the victims were involved in a Yaba trade. Acting on a tip-off, police raided and detained the victims. The police took them to search for more consignment of drugs. As they reached the spot, cohorts of the detainees opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight.

data.name: Noor Mohammad
data.description: It was alleged that the victims were involved in a Yaba trade. Acting on a tip-off, police raided and detained the victims. The police took them to search for more consignment of drugs. As they reached the spot, cohorts of the detainees opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight.

data.name: Shawkat Ali
data.description: A police team raided the Moragachtola area around 2 am to recover a consignment of Yaba. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire, to which the police fired back in self-defense. At one stage, Shawkat was hit, but his cohorts managed to flee. Three policemen, including ASP Nihad, were injured. He was taken to Ukhia Upazilla Health Complex, where he was declared dead by the doctors.

data.name: Sazzad Hossain
data.description: Villagers caught Sazzad after his name surfaced as the rapist and killer of a teenage housewife. They apprehended him while he was in a moving auto-rickshaw on May 6, following the arrest of the auto-rickshaw driver, who was also accused of raping the housewife. The villagers handed Sazzad over to the police. Together with Sazzad, the police went to the Moaranghona area to seize firearms. However, his accomplices started firing at the police, who retaliated by engaging in a gunfight. During the exchange, Sazzad was shot and killed on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Babu
data.description: Sheikh Tasmim Alam, officer-in-charge of Kotwali police station, reported that Babu, a suspected drug dealer wanted in at least a dozen cases, was declared dead at Jessore General Hospital following a 'gunfight' between the police and suspected criminals in the Sarapole area under the upazila at about 1:15 am. Dr. Mohammad Swapan, a doctor at Jessore General Hospital, said that Babu, who was shot in the head, was pronounced dead upon arrival at the hospital.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: Billal, who had more than 16 cases filed against him, was picked up by the police from the Goran area. The "gunfight" took place when they took him to the Shekher Jaiga area to arrest his accomplices around 11:30 pm on Thursday.

data.name: Abdul Jalil
data.description: Jalil was killed in Banani, who had 16 cases filed against him previously. According to RAB, the gunfight lasted for 10 minutes when the members ceased firing and retreated, leaving Jalil behind. He was taken to DMCH and declared dead.

data.name: Ariful islam
data.description: Police raided the local fish market on a tip-off that Ariful and his crew were gathering. Upon sensing the police's presence, a gunfight was triggered, and Ariful was shot. OC Pradip Kumar Das confirmed that Ariful was taken to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where he was declared dead. He had six cases filed against him previously.

data.name: Nurul Ansar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Police confirmed that they received a tip that a few armed local terrorists were in the local brickfield. A gunfight was triggered when the police went to retrieve the arms. A dead body was recovered after the gunfight and was taken to the Health Complex where he was declared dead.

data.name: Sawkat Hossain
data.description: Sawkat died within 24 hours of the murder of Nasir, where he was the main accused. OC Abdul Karim confirmed that Sawkat was arrested by the police because of the murder case. He was taken on an expedition by the police to recover arms, where his confidants started firing at the police, to which the police retaliated and fired back. Shot and injured, Sawkat was taken to a health complex where he was declared dead while being treated.

data.name: Mohammad Saker
data.description: Commanding officer Muhammad Faisal Hasan Khan said that a team of BGB patrol challenged a group of Rohingyas crossing Naff and carrying bags from Myanmar at about 3:00 am. The suspects opened fire at BGB members, who retaliated by shooting back, resulting in a gunfight. After the attackers withdrew, BGB members found Saker shot and wounded. They took him to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, Faisal Hasan added.

data.name: Noresh Chandra Dash
data.description: The deceased's son, Poresh, confirmed that SI Masud called his father three times, but Noresh did not answer. Then, around evening, two to three persons entered the house and took his father. Screams were heard from the scene of the incident. So, someone lit a light at the sound and saw Noresh lying on the floor, while SI Masud and others were running towards the police station. He was a previous heart patient and was declared dead at the Sadar Hospital. The police confirmed the calls but denied any torture. He had several drug cases filed against him.

data.name: Sujan Miah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: A suspected top gangster from Brahmanbaria was killed in a reported gunfight with the police in Bancharampur upazila of the district. The deceased, Md Sujan Miah, was accused in six cases, including murder and robbery. He reportedly killed a man named Babu Miah, 27, on Sunday morning around 11 am. Acting on the case filed on Sunday, we conducted a raid in a deserted place in Bhelanagar village of the upazila early Monday morning, based on a tip-off. Sensing our presence, Sujan and his associates started firing at us," said Bancharam police station OC Salauddin Chowdhury. "When we retaliated, a deadly gunfight ensued, injuring five of our policemen. After Sujan's associates fled the scene, we recovered Sujan's wounded body," added the official. The police took the injured individuals to the upazila health complex, where the on-duty doctor declared Sujan dead, confirmed the OC.

data.name: Kabir
data.description: Kabir was from Gazipur, as confirmed by Commander Mohiuddin Faruqe. Kabir was accused in at least 13 cases, including drug cases. RAB signaled Kabir to stop his motorcycle at a checkpoint set up in Agargaon Link Road area around 5:30 am. Kabir opened fire on them from the moving bike, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Kabir was hit by multiple gunshots during the incident and was rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abu Sufian
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Based on information that a group of terrorists were staying in front of the Modhumita rail track, RAB conducted a raid around 12:30 am to apprehend them. Sensing the presence of RAB, the terrorists opened fire on the elite force, prompting them to retaliate. An officer claimed that Abu died on the spot, while his associates managed to escape. It should be noted that Abu and Niloy lured a 7-year-old girl behind a brick heap on May 15, enticing her with chocolate, and then proceeded to rape her. When the child lost consciousness, they strangled her to death.

data.name: Hassan
data.description: RAB-1 Captain Shafi Ullah Bulbul confirmed that they went on a raid, acting on a tip-off, in the Majabosti area. Hassan and his associates started firing at RAB, to which they retaliated by firing back. They later recovered the dead body of Hassan, who is also accused in 14 cases.

data.name: Mohammad Helal Uddin
data.description: Helal was a resident of Pashchim Bhujpur and wanted in several cases. OC Sheikh Mohammad Abdullah confirmed that a group of miscreants led by Helal picked up two girls while the victims were returning to their houses from Kazirhat Bazaar and raped them, taking them to a nearby forest of Galachiopartek. A case was lodged in connection with this incident with the police, and subsequently, Helal was arrested. Along with Helal, the police went to arrest others, but as soon as they reached the spot, Helal's accomplices opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate. This triggered a gunfight where he died.

data.name: Mohammad Ishaq
data.description: A suspected Rohingya robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Cox's Bazar. The incident occurred in the Khandakarpara area of Teknaf on Friday afternoon, according to Abdullah Md Sheikh Sadi, assistant director (Media) of RAB-15. The deceased, Md Ishak, 32, was a member of a Rohingya robber gang called 'Jocky Bahini', said the RAB official. He further stated that acting on a tip-off about a gang of robbers gathering near Khandakarpara in Teknaf, a RAB patrol team conducted a raid. Upon the arrival of the patrol team, the robbers opened fire at them, prompting the RAB members to fire back in self-defense. Later, they discovered Ishak's body with bullet wounds at the scene and transported him to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where the on-duty doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Rubel Hossain Shaon
data.description: RAB-6 commanding officer Lt Col Rowshanul Firoj said that a RAB team went to the spot as part of its anti-drug drive and was attacked by miscreants, which triggered the gunfight at about 3:30 pm. He claimed RAB rescued Shaon with bullet injuries and took him to the Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rubel Islam Shaon
data.description: The police station confirmed that the victim had been accused in several cases previously filed against him. The patrolling team was on patrol in the morning when they received a tip-off about drug peddling. As soon as they reached the location, shots were fired at them, prompting them to fire back and retaliate. Unfortunately, Rubel was shot during the incident. The police rescued Rubel and rushed him to the hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: The victim was killed in a gunfight with the BGB when they went on a raid. As soon as they reached the spot, drug peddlers started firing shots at them, and they retaliated by firing back. While others managed to flee, Abdur was shot dead on the spot, as confirmed by Captain Lt Col Ali Haider Azad. The dead body was recovered, as confirmed by local OC Anwar Hossain.

data.name: Nurul Haque
data.description: Company Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that a checkpoint was installed to intercept a shipment of Yaba Pills from Teknaf to Dhaka. Just as the truck was about to be inspected, they opened fire on a RAB member, who retaliated and accidentally hit Nurul.

data.name: Nikhil Talukder
data.description: The victim and his friends were playing cards at the spot when the source, along with his van driver, came along the path. Everyone managed to flee except Nikhil, who was severely beaten by the police, especially at his knee and head. They broke his spine. He was taken to Barisal Medical College by his relatives, but had to be transferred to Dhaka Pangu Hospital when his health worsened. Unfortunately, he died while being treated.

data.name: Mohammad Sharif
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: OC Pradip Kumar confirmed that, based on information, a police team conducted a raid in the area to apprehend the robbers from the Zakir group around 9:30 pm. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire, prompting the police to retaliate. The police discovered Sharif's body lying on the ground, while the rest of the group managed to escape. The victim was immediately taken to the local health complex and then transferred to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Shafiqul Islam Shofi
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: OC Enayet said that two groups were involved in a gunfight near the East Meghna area. Upon reaching the scene, the pirates started firing at the police, who retaliated. However, they were unable to arrest anyone except for finding Shafiqul's lifeless body on the ground. The victim's wife alleged that the police had taken Shafiqul from their residence and killed him, a claim that ASP Sharker Mohammad Kaysar denied. The victim had several cases filed against him at the local police station.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Dukhu
data.description: When arrested, the victim informed the police about a drug trade taking place that very night around 12 am. The police went on a raid, taking him with them. Sensing the presence, the drug traders started firing at the police, resulting in a gunfight. Delwar was a victim of this gunfight. He was declared dead by the doctors of the local health complex after being taken there.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: RAB Media Wing Assistant Superintendent of Police Mahmudul Hasan Mamun said the incident took place at Boro Takia on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway. A gunfight took place between a group of robbers who had gathered to commit robbery. The victim was hit by a bullet while the other criminals managed to escape. He was declared dead after being rushed to the Upazilla Health Complex.

data.name: Liton Kha
data.description: According to Liton's family, Liton had a longstanding land-related dispute with the authorities of a local madrasa. Following the dispute, the Madrasa authority recently filed a complaint with the police and the upazilla nirbahi officer (UNO), mentioning that Liton killed their fish and constructed a house on the Madrasa Land. Liton's brother-in-law, Mofizur Rahman Gazi, said the police held Liton around 4 pm based on that complaint. Upon hearing the news, he rushed to the local police station and saw that Liton was sick. Some policemen were taking him to a local health complex. After receiving primary treatment, the on-duty doctors there sent Liton to Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital in Barisal, where he died around 1:00 am. When contacted, Liton's wife, Mazeda Begum, said Liton was completely well when the police held him. He fell sick due to being tortured by the police. "I want justice," she said. The victim's father-in-law, Matlab Gazi, said, "Liton was tortured to death.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman
data.description: Mizan was killed in an alleged gunfight. Police arrested him because of an alleged rape. The police took him to Sonakandi to recover the illegal arms that Mizan confessed to having in his possession. When law enforcers arrived in the area, Mizan's cohorts opened fire on the police and wounded Mizan. He was rushed to Noakhali General Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Mazid
data.description: ASP of RAB-7, Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, said that the gunfight took place at midnight after a patrolling team went there to arrest the accused. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, cohorts of the accused opened fire, to which RAB retaliated. Mazid was found with a bullet wound while his cohorts fled the scene. He was rushed to the upazilla health complex where he was declared dead.

data.name: Abu Hanif
data.description: Hanif had at least 8 cases filed against him previously, with different charges including drug peddling and robbery. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police raided the area along with Hanif to seize drugs and arms. During the raid, associates of Abu Hanif opened fire at the law enforcers. When the police retaliated, the assailants fled the scene and the police rescued Abu Hanif, who had sustained gunshot wounds during the gunfight. He was taken to a nearby hospital where attending doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hedayet Ullah Badsha
data.description: Senior Assistant Director Sohel Mahmud confirmed that their team went to the area on information that a consignment of yaba was being smuggled there. They spotted five youths emerging from the sea and instructed them to halt. Sensing the presence of RAB, the youths opened fire, compelling the law enforcers to retaliate. A body was discovered at the scene following the exchange of gunfire. The body and evidence were subsequently handed over to the police.

data.name: Abdus Subhan
data.description: SP Sheikh Rafiqul Islam confirmed that their team went near a graveyard as part of their anti-drug drive at about 2:30 am and was attacked by a group of miscreants, which triggered the gunfight. Police rescued Subhan with bullet injuries and took him to Bera Upazilla Health Complex, where he succumbed to his injuries at about 4:15 am.

data.name: Rayhan Sarker
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, RAB went to a rented flat where Rayhan was currently present. They conducted a raid on the house and entered Rayhan's room, where he fired three shots at the law enforcers. In response, RAB retaliated by firing shots, resulting in the victim's death.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain Pinku
data.description: Senior Assistant Police Superintendent Mohammad Kamruzzaman confirmed that they received a tip-off that suspects were present in the TNT Bazar area. RAB raided the area, and the suspects opened fire at RAB upon sensing their presence, to which RAB retaliated. Pinku was shot while the others managed to flee. He was declared dead after being taken to Ahsan Ullah Master General Hospital.

data.name: Robiul Islam
data.description: ASP AM Mohaiminur Rashid confirmed that they went on an anti-drug raid to arrest the drug peddlers at the scene. Sensing the presence of RAB members, armed drug peddlers started shooting at RAB, to which they retaliated, resulting in Robiul being fatally hit and dying on the spot. Robiul's mother claimed that her other son was also killed by law enforcement agencies in the same manner.

data.name: Imam Hossain
data.description: Police received a tip-off that a Yaba trade-off was going to be smuggled in a vehicle. The police signaled the autorickshaw to stop, and upon seeing this, Imran and his friends started firing at the police. In response, the police retaliated by firing shots. The remaining five individuals managed to flee from the scene, while Imam was left lying beside the vehicle. He was later taken to the local health complex and then transferred to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where the doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Rasel
data.description: When the police went on a raid to arrest Rasel, he and his accomplices started firing at the police, to which the police fired back. The gunfight lasted around 20 minutes. The police recovered Rasel's dead body from the spot.

data.name: Babul Molla
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The team of robbers killed the night guard, Abdul Mannan, by strangling him. A truck carrying a group of robbers reached a shop named B Shariat and Brother on the Feni-Noakhali road at Bakerbazar. Soon after they arrived, they broke the shop's lock and started looting on a truck when the night guard started screaming. In the meantime, law enforcers reached the scene, and a gunfight took place between them. During the gunfight, one of the robbers died on the spot, while three others received bullet wounds. One died on the way to Daganbhuiyan upazila health complex, while another died on the way to Feni 250-bed general hospital. However, no information from the victims' families has been reported.

data.name: Mohammad Bidyut
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The team of robbers killed the night guard, Abdul Mannan, by strangling him. A truck carrying a group of robbers reached a shop named B Shariat and Brother on the Feni-Noakhali road at Bakerbazar. Soon after they arrived, they broke the shop's lock and started looting on a truck when the night guard started screaming. In the meantime, law enforcers reached the scene, and a gunfight took place between them. During the gunfight, one of the robbers died on the spot, while three others received bullet wounds. One died on the way to Daganbhuiyan upazila health complex, while another died on the way to Feni 250-bed general hospital. However, no information from the victims' families has been reported.

data.name: Hamid Hossain
data.description: SI ABM Masud Hossain confirmed that a joint team conducted a raid to apprehend the robbers after receiving information that members of the Hakim robber's gang had sought refuge at Chakmapara in the Hoyakong Hilly area near the border. The SP stated that as they arrived at the location, the robbers started to escape by firing at the police, who retaliated by returning fire and pursuing the robbers. Following the shootout, the police discovered four individuals with critical injuries and transported them to a hospital where the attending doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Somrat Sohel
data.description: OC Safiul Kabir said that after arresting Sohel, they conducted a drive along with him in the Kutub Dighir Par area at about 2:30 am to seize the knife that was used to kill Mosaddekur. When the police approached the area, a gang of drug peddlers opened fire on the police from their hideout, forcing them to fire back, which triggered the skirmish. Sohel sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in the Satkhira range of the west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight.

data.name: Shariful islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in the Satkhira range of the west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in the Satkhira range of the west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf police station, said that a police team raided the area around 12:30 am based on secret information. A group of suspected drug peddlers opened fire on the team, triggering a gunfight. Abul Kashem sustained bullet injuries while his cohorts managed to escape from the spot. Later, he was taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex where the on-duty doctor declared him dead. The police also seized 10,000 pieces of Yaba Pills, a locally made gun, and six cartridges from Kashem's possession, said Pradip.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Due to an ongoing feud that had lasted for a long time in the locality, a confrontation between the two groups emerged. The police fired rubber bullets to stop the conflict, during which Billal tragically lost his life. Billal had rubber bullet marks on his body.

data.name: Mosharrof
data.description: The deceased were allegedly members of a ring who used to mug people in the guise of taxi drivers and passengers. Khilkhet inspector for investigation, Aminul Islam, said that the gunfight took place between the police and alleged muggers around 2:30 am in the morning at the 300ft area. Upon receiving information that a ring in an auto-rickshaw was mugging in the Khilkhet area, the police team signaled a speeding auto-rickshaw to stop near the Shewra bus stand area, but it refused to slow down. The police team chased the auto-rickshaw and informed another team ahead, who put a barricade on the road. Suddenly, two men jumped out of the rickshaw and opened fire at the chasing police, trying to make their way to a nearby waterbody, claimed Mashiur. The police also retaliated with firing, leaving two hit with bullets. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Nannu
data.description: The deceased were allegedly members of a ring who used to mug people in the guise of taxi drivers and passengers. Khilkhet inspector for investigation, Aminul Islam, said that the gunfight took place between the police and alleged muggers around 2:30 am in the morning at the 300ft area. data.name: Mohammad Yasin
data.description: Deputy Commander of BGB-2, Major Rubayat Kabir, told New Age that a BGB patrol team on the coast around 2:30 am noticed three people swimming. Suspecting them to be Yaba smugglers, BGB members attempted to detain them for interrogation. However, they opened fire at the BGB men, forcing them to fire back, resulting in a gunfight. The gunfight lasted for four to five minutes, and BGB members recovered two youths who had been hit by bullets. They were rushed to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Alam
data.description: Deputy Commander of BGB-2, Major Rubayat Kabir, told New Age that a BGB patrol team on the coast around 2:30 am noticed three people swimming. Suspecting them to be Yaba smugglers, BGB members attempted to detain them for interrogation. However, they opened fire at the BGB men, forcing them to fire back, resulting in a gunfight. The gunfight lasted for four to five minutes, and BGB members recovered two youths who had been hit by bullets. They were rushed to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Afsor Ali
data.description: The victim was taken into remand by the police. The victim's wife said the police murdered her husband. She added that he was beaten in front of his wife while being handcuffed. Additional Police Super Mahbub Alam Khan said he committed suicide inside the police station, while the Ward councillor vouched for Afsor, saying he was an honest and hardworking man.

data.name: Abdul Jalil
data.description: Sub-Inspector Moinuddin stated that both of them were shot and killed during a gunfight with the cops. The gunfight ensued when the suspects opened fire on the police, who were there to conduct an anti-drug drive. When the attackers retreated and the gunfight ended, they were taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex. However, the doctors referred them to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for better treatment. Upon arrival, the doctors declared them dead. The bodies were sent to the morgue of Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for autopsy. Saddam's father, Sultan Ahmed, was also killed in a gunfight with law enforcement agencies two years ago.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.description: Sub-Inspector Moinuddin stated that both of them were shot and killed during a gunfight with the cops. The gunfight ensued when the suspects opened fire on the police, who were there to conduct an anti-drug drive. When the attackers retreated and the gunfight ended, they were taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex. However, the doctors referred them to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for better treatment. Upon arrival, the doctors declared them dead. The bodies were sent to the morgue of Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for autopsy. Saddam's father, Sultan Ahmed, was also killed in a gunfight with law enforcement agencies two years ago.

data.name: Jashim Uddin Raju
data.description: The gunfight ensued when the police went on a raid to arrest him, but his cohorts started firing, and the police retaliated by firing back. Jashim was found lying on the ground after the gunfight ended. He was taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital, where he was declared dead.

data.name: Tanjib Hossain
data.description: Tanjib was arrested from Library Bazar, and later on, after extracting information, the police took him to Banglabazar to recover a weapon at around 2:30 am. When the police reached the Shibarampur Embankment's Battala area, his accomplices started firing at the police to snatch him, and the police also retaliated by firing back. At one stage, Tanjib sustained bullet injuries, and his associates fled from the scene, the SP said, adding that they took him to Pabna General Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hamid
data.description: Commander Ali Haider Azad Ahmed conducted the raid. Being tipped off, they went on a raid when the victims started to open fire, to which BGB men retaliated by opening fire as well, killing three of the people. They are said to be yaba traders.

data.name: Nazir Hossain
data.description: Commander Ali Haider Azad Ahmed conducted the raid. Being tipped off, they went on a raid when the victims started to open fire, to which BGB men retaliated by opening fire as well, killing three of the people. They are said to be yaba traders.

data.name: Nur Alam

data.name: Akram
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a team of police raided the area to arrest Akram. Sensing their presence, Akram and his accomplices opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight was over, the police found Akram with bullet wounds while others managed to escape, as confirmed by the Officer in Charge. Akram was sent to Noakhali General Hospital where the on-duty doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Syed Alam
data.description: Based on information that a large consignment of yaba pills would be smuggled into Bangladesh from Myanmar, a BGB team took positions around the area. Lt. Col. Foysal Hasan Khan confirmed that the team noticed two men roaming the area and another crossing the Naf River into Bangladesh from Myanmar. Upon seeing this, the troops asked the three individuals to stop, but they opened fire, defying the instructions and injuring two of the BGB members. In self-defense, the BGB men retaliated, triggering a gunfight. After the gun battle, the BGB team found a man with bullet wounds. The injured individual was taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex, which referred him to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital. Unfortunately, he was declared dead upon arrival at the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Bahar Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The deceased was a resident of Burichar Union under Hatia. Additional Superintendent of Police Jashim Uddin Chowdhury of RAB said that they also arrested four associates of Bahar from the spot after the gunfight, namely Mohammad Yusuf (35), Alauddin (40), Mohammad Murad (30), and Mohammad Sheikh (20). They were tipped off that Bahar and his gang were preparing for a robbery at Shurjamukhi Ghat area. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, members of the Bahar gang opened fire, prompting RAB to fire back in self-defense. Bahar was killed at one point during the gunfight.

data.name: Azidul Haque
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that a yaba consignment from Myanmar would arrive, the police conducted a raid in the area at 2 am. As the police team reached the village, drug peddlers fired at them, triggering a gunfight that lasted for five minutes. Most of the peddlers managed to flee the spot. The police then rescued the two brothers who sustained bullet injuries and rushed them to Teknaf Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead, the law enforcer claimed. Teknaf police sent the bodies to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Aminul Islam
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that a yaba consignment from Myanmar would arrive, the police conducted a raid in the area at 2 am. As the police team reached the village, drug peddlers fired at them, triggering a gunfight that lasted for five minutes. Most of the peddlers managed to flee the spot. The police then rescued the two brothers who sustained bullet injuries and rushed them to Teknaf Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead, the law enforcer claimed. Teknaf police sent the bodies to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: The gunfight took place around 3 am when a team of Mohammadpur Police went to apprehend a criminal, according to the police station sub-inspector, Sajedul Islam. Sensing the police presence, the criminal gang opened fire at the police, who were forced to retaliate in self-defense. SI Sajedul prepared the FIR of the incident, stating that a man sustained bullet injuries and the other criminals fled the scene, leaving him. He was later rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mizan
data.description: The officer in charge of Coxs Bazar Model Police Station, Abu Mohammad Shahjahan Kabir, said that a case was filed in connection with the looting of Yaba. Mizan was the prime accused and was in hiding. The Benapole immigration police arrested Mizan on 17/07/2020 and handed him over to Coxs Bazar police. Following Mizan's information, a team of police conducted a raid in the bridge area in the morning. As soon as the team approached the area, Mizan's associates attacked the police and opened fire, forcing them to retaliate and triggering a gunfight. The police rescued Mizan's body, which had been hit by bullets, and took him to the hospital. However, the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mamun Mia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mamun had four cases filed against him for murder, robbery, and carrying arms. Chandan Debnath, Assistant Director of RAB-14, said that on secret information, a team of RAB raided the area to arrest Mamun. However, Mamun opened fire on the RAB members, who fired back, triggering a gunfight. Mamun was shot dead on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Rajib
data.description: Additional Deputy Commissioner Shahidur Rahman said that acting on a tip-off, a DB team conducted a raid at 2:35 am. As the DB team reached the area, suspected drug peddlers opened fire on them, to which they retaliated by shooting back. As the attackers retreated, DB police found Rajib shot and wounded. He was taken to DMCH where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ekhlas Uddin
data.description: RAB officials said the deceased was involved in drug dealing and died during a gunfight, but the victim's relatives, however, claim that Ekhlas was picked up from Narayanganj on 04/07/2020 and killed in a staged gunfight. RAB officials refuted the allegation.

data.name: Ripon Howlader
data.description: Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police MD Salauddin said that, based on a tip-off about drug dealing, a team of RAB conducted a raid. As soon as they arrived at the location, the drug traders opened fire, forcing the RAB members to retaliate and initiate a gunfight. Unfortunately, Ripon succumbed to his injuries after being rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Al Amin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: The Inspector of Bagura Sadar Police Station stated that they had gone to the scene after receiving information about a gunfight between two armed gangs. Upon sensing the presence of the police, the gang fled the area. The police then rescued Rabbi's body, which had been riddled with bullets, and transported him to Bagura Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College and Hospital. The attending doctors at the hospital declared him dead.

data.name: Rasid Ullah
data.description: Biman Chandra Karmakar, Assistant Police Superintendent and Operation Commander of RAB, stated that a team of the Battalion was waiting around 2:30 am as a robber gang was preparing for a robbery. RAB officials said that the robber group opened fire at RAB members once they surrounded the gang. RAB members fired back in self-defense. The robbers stopped firing a few minutes later, and one person who had been hit by a bullet was rescued from the scene. He was sent to Teknaf Hospital for treatment, but the attending doctors declared that the person had died earlier.

data.name: Mohammad Belal Hossain Dofadar
data.description: Deputy Police Commissioner (North) Ashikur Rahman said that the deceased was accused in 10 cases filed over rape and molestation. He added that the gunfight took place at Shanti Nagar Samabay Residential area when the police went there to arrest the culprit. Sensing the presence of the police, his cohorts opened fire and the police retaliated, triggering a gunfight. The police found his bullet-hit body on the spot after the gunfight and recovered a gun and 500 yaba pills.

data.name: Ibrahim Khalil
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Kamruzzaman said that the incident took place at about 2:30 am when a team of RAB set up a check-post based on a tip-off about a suspected large-scale drug trade. Meanwhile, at around 2:15 am, a motorbike approached and RAB signaled for it to stop, but the rider ignored the signal. The rider opened fire at the officials, and in self-defense, RAB also fired back, leading to a gunfight. After the gunfight, Ibrahim Khalil was found dead.

data.name: Mohammad Taher
data.description: The Officer in Charge, Prodeep Kumar Das, stated that a police team arrested Mohammad Yunus with 10,000 yaba tablets. According to his statement, they subsequently apprehended Boktear and Taher from their respective residences on the same night. At one juncture, the accomplices began firing at the police, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight. Their bodies, riddled with bullets, were later transported to Teknaf Hospital, where attending doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Boktear Uddin
data.description: The Officer in Charge, Prodeep Kumar Das, stated that a police team arrested Mohammad Yunus with 10,000 yaba tablets. According to his statement, they subsequently apprehended Boktear and Taher from their respective residences on the same night. At one juncture, the accomplices began firing at the police, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, resulting in a gunfight. Their bodies, riddled with bullets, were later transported to Teknaf Hospital, where attending doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Abdus Salam
data.description: A BGB patrol team took positions upon receiving information that a large consignment of yaba would enter Bangladesh through the Naaf River, said Lieutenant Colonel of BGB-2 Battalion Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan. Soon, they saw two or three persons swimming ashore and asked them to surrender. The drug peddlers opened fire at them, and a gunfight ensued when the BGB men retaliated in self-defense. At one stage, the drug traders fled the scene, leaving behind the bullet-hit Ferdous and Salam. The duo was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and then to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where the doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ferous
data.description: A BGB patrol team took positions upon receiving information that a large consignment of yaba would enter Bangladesh through the Naaf River, said Lieutenant Colonel of BGB-2 Battalion Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan. Soon, they saw two or three persons swimming ashore and asked them to surrender. The drug peddlers opened fire at them, and a gunfight ensued when the BGB men retaliated in self-defense. At one stage, the drug traders fled the scene, leaving behind the bullet-hit Ferdous and Salam. The duo was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and then to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where the doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Kudrat Ali Mondol
data.description: Officer in Charge of Daulatpur Police Station, SM Arifur Rahman, said that acting on a tip-off, a team conducted a raid in the area while a gang of drug peddlers was selling drugs at 1 am. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug peddlers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back, which triggered the gunfight. After the gunfight, the police recovered a bullet-hit individual named Kudrat, while his associates managed to flee the scene. They took him to Daulatpur Upazilla Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sher Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Assistant Director (Media) Mohammad Mahmudul Hasan Mamun said that Sher was a notorious robber. Tipped off, RAB conducted a raid while a group of pirates were preparing for a robbery. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire, forcing the RAB to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight. RAB recovered the bullet-hit dead body of Ali, along with three weapons from the scene.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Lieutenant Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that they raided the incident area. As soon as they reached the spot, miscreants opened fire, to which they retaliated at around 2:30 am. Two of the criminals were hit by bullets while others fled. The deceased were not identified.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Lieutenant Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that they raided the incident area. As soon as they reached the spot, miscreants opened fire, to which they retaliated at around 2:30 am. Two of the criminals were hit by bullets while others fled. The deceased were not identified.

data.name: Mohammad Anwar
data.description: Mohammad Anwar, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with the police. The police, acting on a tip-off, rushed to Nayapara where two groups of drug peddlers were engaged in a gunfight over yaba trade around 4 am, according to Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in Charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire to escape while the police fired back in self-defense and found four of them lying on the ground. They were quickly taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ismail
data.description: Mohammad Ismail, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with the police. The police, acting on a tip-off, rushed to Nayapara where two groups of drug peddlers were engaged in a gunfight over yaba trade around 4 am, said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in Charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire to escape while the police fired back in self-defense and found four of them lying on the ground. They were quickly taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.description: Anwar Hossain, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with the police. The police, acting on a tip-off, rushed to Nayapara where two groups of drug peddlers were engaged in a gunfight over yaba trade around 4 am, according to Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in Charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire to escape while the police fired back in self-defense and found four of them lying on the ground. They were immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Nasir Uddin
data.description: Nasir Uddin, a suspected drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with the police. The police, acting on a tip-off, rushed to Nayapara where two groups of drug peddlers were engaged in a gunfight over yaba trade around 4 am, according to Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in Charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire in an attempt to escape, prompting the police to fire back in self-defense. As a result, four of them were found lying on the ground. They were immediately taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: In the Ghumdhum border area of Naikhongchhari in Bandarban, a person has been killed in an alleged gunfight. Police say the deceased, Shah Alam (45), was involved in the Yaba drug trade. The incident of gunfire occurred on Thursday (July 30th) morning during a mission to recover Yaba following an arrest. The Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Naikhongchhari Police Station, Md. Alamgir Hossen, reported that the police went to recover Yaba consignments near the China Friendship Road in Ghumdhum Union of Naikhongchhari Upazila, taking the arrested Shah Alam with them. At that time, 10 to 12 members of a previously informed drug smuggling ring targeted the police to rescue the arrested drug dealer and opened fire. The police also returned fire, and Shah Alam was wounded in the gunfight. He later died on the way to the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Badrul Mia
data.description: A press release issued by BGB Public Relations Officer Md Shariful Islam stated that a team of BGB personnel from the Alinagar border outpost seized eight sacks of 'Nasir' brand Indian bidi that had been smuggled into Bangladesh at approximately 4:15 am. The release mentioned that a group of 30 to 40 suspected smugglers, armed with sharp weapons and sticks, attacked the BGB personnel while they were on their way to the BOP and managed to snatch two sacks of the seized bidi. Despite warnings from the BGB personnel, the attackers became violent and attempted to take the remaining bidi, which led the BGB men to fire warning shots into the air. The release claimed that the suspected smugglers then tried to take the firearms from the BGB personnel, prompting the BGB personnel to open fire in order to protect their lives and government property. As a result, Badrul was killed.

data.name: Mostofa Kamal
data.description: Lt. Col. Raushanul Firoz, a commander, said they went to the Babu Bari area near the Rampal Thermal Power Plant on information that a secret meeting of drug dealers was taking place there. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the criminals opened fire and the RAB members retaliated, triggering a 'gun battle'. At one point, Mostofa was caught in the line of fire while the others fled. He was taken to Jhanjhania Hospital in Rampal where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Mohsin
data.description: Operations Officer Ziaur Rahman stated that a team of RAB, acting on secret information, conducted a raid in the Eastern Housing area. Upon sensing the presence of law enforcement, Mohsin fired at them, prompting RAB to retaliate and resulting in a gunfight at approximately 2:45 am. He further added that they discovered Mohsin critically injured and immediately transported him to a hospital, where attending doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Hasan
data.description: Police conducted a raid in the incident area around 2:30 am. However, upon sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. The police retaliated, resulting in a "gunfight". After the exchange of gunfire, the police discovered the bodies of Mohammad Hasan, Mohammad Zafar, and Jahir Ahmed, all of whom had been shot. On the other hand, Zafar's family claims that Zafar was taken from his residence in Vaiyar Dighir Par, Kochua by police officer-in-charge Habibur Rahman and SI Aminul Islam. After taking Zafar, the police officers contacted Zafar's wife and demanded a ransom of 50 Lakh BDT, stating that Zafar was a drug dealer and would be listed as a victim of crossfire if the family did not comply. This incident occurred on 29/07/2020, and two days later, a police officer contacted the UP chairman to confirm Zafar's death in a crossfire. The victim's family discovered the deceased body at CoxsBazar Medical College Morgue.
