data.name: Rashed Mohammad Sinha
data.description: The sources at Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital declared that the man was killed in a police shooting at a checkpoint. Cox's Bazar Superintendent of Police ABM Masud Hossain informed New Age that the police personnel at the checkpoint stopped a private car, and a man engaged in an altercation with them. At one point, the man brandished his firearm and attempted to open fire at the police personnel around 10:30 pm. In self-defense, the police personnel retaliated and later transported the injured man to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where the attending doctors pronounced him dead. The SP claimed that they later discovered the man was a retired army official. He also mentioned that two other individuals were arrested, but their identities were not disclosed. Cox's Bazar Deputy Commissioner Kamal Hossain stated that an inquiry committee, led by a Deputy Secretary and including representatives from the Bangladesh Army and the Police, was formed to investigate the incident.

data.name: Hafizur Rahman
data.description: Hafizur Rahman, a suspected drug peddler, was killed along with an associate in a "gunfight" with RAB in Teknaf. The "gunfight" occurred on the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in the Damdamia area around 3:00 am when the law enforcers signaled a lorry, carrying Hafizur and Sabbir, to slow down. Shah Alam, the company commander of Teknaf Rab-7 camp, claimed that instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at Rab members, forcing them to retaliate. The "gunfight" resulted in the death of the duo on the spot, he added. Two firearms, 11 bullets, and 40,000 pieces of yaba tablets were recovered, and the lorry was seized from the scene, according to the law enforcer.

data.name: Sabbir Hossain
data.description: Sabbir Hossain, a suspected drug peddler, was killed along with an associate in a "gunfight" with RAB in Teknaf. The "gunfight" occurred on the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in the Damdamia area around 3:00 am when the law enforcers signaled a lorry - carrying Hafizur and Sabbir - to slow down, according to Shah Alam, the company commander of Teknaf Rab-7 camp. Instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at Rab members, forcing the Rab members to retaliate. The "gunfight" resulted in the deaths of the duo on the spot, he added. Two firearms, 11 bullets, and 40,000 pieces of yaba tablets were recovered, and the lorry was seized from the scene, the law enforcer claimed.

data.name: Anowar Hossain
data.description: The victim was picked up from his residence on 02/08/2020, and the next day he was killed by the police. Later, the police held a press conference stating that Anowar was arrested and taken on an anti-drug operation to recover drugs. Upon reaching the location, his associates began firing shots, which struck Anowar and resulted in his death.

data.name: Abdul Mannan Munna
data.description: The Officer in Charge of Jakiganj Police Station, Mir Mohammad Abdun Naser, stated that they have arrested Mannan and obtained information that he had yaba pills and firearms at his residence. The OC claimed that they departed from the police station towards his home, and during the journey, his accomplices initiated gunfire towards the police team, leading them to retaliate. The police reported that they subsequently rescued Mannan and transported him to Jokiganj Health Complex, where the on-duty doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Akram
data.description: The family of the victim has accused RAB members of torturing him to death in custody. However, RAB has refuted the allegation and claimed that the man was a mugger and had been beaten up by a mob during a mugging attempt. But witnesses say that he was not beaten up by a mob. The documents of the unnatural death case, filed by RAB, also do not mention anything about mob beating. Seeking anonymity, a top official of the Chittagong Metropolitan Police (CMP) said they have no information on any incident of mob beating in the Muradpur area. Akram's family said he was never involved in any criminal activities. After Akram's arrest and based on Akram's information, RAB took him with them and conducted drives in different areas of the city. At one stage in the Shershah Area, Akram fell sick and complained of chest pain. He was admitted to CMCH's medicine ward where he died. Police declined to disclose the contents of the inquest report.

data.name: Raja Fakir
data.description: Raja's family alleged that the police tortured him to death, while the PBI turned down the allegation. The PBI stated that Raja had been on the run since he was accused of murder and was arrested at one of his relative's houses in Patuakhali, and then brought to Bagerhat. Raja's father, Babu Fakir, claimed that a PBI officer tortured his son to death. After his death, the police took the body to the hospital and did not allow family members to view it. However, the PBI denied these allegations.

data.name: Masud Rana
data.description: The victim's wife complains that her husband died in custody due to torture. The dead body has been sent to DMCH for an autopsy. Masud went to work at 8 am as usual and had a conversation over the phone with his wife at 10 am, but no contact has been made between them after that time. At 10 pm, Masud's younger brother Saiful confirmed that his brother had been picked up by the police. After 1 am, a call from the police station confirmed that Masud was feeling sick in the police station. The wife went to the police station and confirmed that Masud died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Rehana, the wife, also confirmed that there is video footage available showing the police and Masud scuffling, resulting in him hitting his head on the wall. The police tried to influence and threaten Rehana not to file a case in this matter as she has two daughters to feed.

data.name: Nurul Amin
data.description: Nurul Amin, an alleged Rohingya robber, was killed in a "gunfight" in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar with RAB. RAB said Nurul was the leader of a robbery group. He came to Bangladesh from Myanmar approximately 25 years ago and was involved in multiple cases. They stated that a team of RAB conducted an operation, resulting in a shootout with the gang. At one point, Nurul Amin was found shot at the scene. He was taken to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the attending doctor declared him dead. Two RAB members were injured in the incident.

data.name: Mazarul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Mazarul Islam, an alleged robber, was killed during a shootout with the police. He was accused of killing two traders while robbing them on the Cumilla highway. According to the police, a team of officers raided a neighborhood in Burichang to apprehend Mazhar. A group of robbers opened fire on the police upon their arrival. The police retaliated in self-defense. A man was found shot after the robbers fled the scene.

data.name: Unidentified
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two unidentified people died in a gunfight with the army. Locals and police confirmed that the gunfight took place at Rouf Tilla, and after an hour of exchanging bullets, two dead bodies, along with an AK-22 rifle, were recovered from the spot.

data.name: Unidentified
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Two unidentified people died in a gunfight with the army. Locals and police confirmed that the gunfight took place at Rouf Tilla, and after an hour of exchanging bullets, two dead bodies, along with an AK-22 rifle, were recovered from the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Adham
data.description: The gunfight took place near the 35th No Pillar. Captain Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed of 34 BGB confirmed that they took positions after receiving a tip-off about a yaba consignment coming from Myanmar. When the BGB spotted 10-12 men approaching from Myanmar, they challenged them. In response, the men fired shots, and the patrol team retaliated in self-defense. Adham was shot and injured, and the BGB rescued him and took him to the upazilla health complex. However, he was later declared dead.

data.name: Hazrat Matubbar
data.description: Matubbar was beaten inside the prison and died while being treated at the Zilla Sadar Hospital. He was accused in two cases, and on 27.09.2020, he was ordered to be sent to prison by the court. Matubbar's wife complained that the police killed him.

data.name: Rayhan Ahmed
data.description: Rayhan's family members were sad that he died in police custody and further alleged that the law enforcers had demanded Tk 10,000 for his release. Jyotirmoy Sarkar, Additional Deputy Commissioner (media) of Sylhet Metropolitan Police, said that the matter is complicated and they are investigating it. Rayhan had left his home around 10:00 pm and after a while, his mobile was found switched off, said his cousin Tanvir Ahmed. It is reported that "Around 4:23 am, Rayhan called his mother from an unknown number and told her that the police had picked him up and were holding him at Bandarbazar Police Outpost. He asked to send someone with Tk 4,000 so that the police would free him," his cousin said. "Hearing that, Rayhan's stepfather went to the police outpost with the money. There, a policeman in civilian uniform told him that Rayhan was injured in an accident and was sleeping at the time, and asked him to come again around 10:00 am with Tk 10,000," Tanvir said. "Uncle then went to the police outpost around 10:00 am when policemen at the outpost told him to go to Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital, as Rayhan was admitted there since his condition had deteriorated," he also said. "Upon reaching the hospital, he came to know that Rayhan died and the police members on duty there told him that Rayhan was beaten by a mob." Rayhan's stepfather, Habib Ullah, echoed the same and said, "We believe that Rayhan was tortured to death at the police outpost.

data.name: Syed Alam
data.description: A suspected yaba trader was killed in a so-called gunfight with the BGB. The identity of the deceased could not be immediately known. Tipped off, a team of BGB-2 challenged a boat carrying three people along sluice gate-1 of the Naf river. Sensing danger, the criminals opened fire on the BGB men, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. At one stage, all the criminals jumped into the river to flee. BGB members found a man with bullet injuries and took him to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Iqbal Ahmed
data.description: Syed Iqbal Ahmed, an alleged drug dealer, was killed in a shootout with RAB in the capital's Malibagh area. He used to bring yaba pills to the city from Cox's Bazar, claimed Rab-2 Company Commander Mohammed Mohiuddin Faruqe. The incident happened around 7:00 am near the ticket sales center of an intercity bus operator. The area is covered by CCTV cameras of different nearby shops and businesses. Employees of these shops told this correspondent yesterday afternoon that Rab officials had deleted the footage and didn't let anyone see what had been recorded. According to Mohiuddin, RAB officers were waiting there after being tipped off about a man arriving from Cox's Bazar with a yaba haul. After the bus arrived and the other passengers had left, Iqbal was waiting there with at least 12 bags, Mohiuddin said. At one point, sensing their presence, Iqbal started to shoot at the RAB members who then retaliated. He was killed during the shootout. Iqbal was accused in at least six drug cases, Rab claimed.

data.name: Nur Kamal
data.description: Saiful Islam and Nur Kamal, both alleged members of the Jokhi Robbers Gang, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on Shaplapur Marine Drive road in Cox's Bazar's Teknaf upazila. Company Commander of Rab-15 in Teknaf, Shahed Mahtab, said that acting on a tip-off, a team of Rab-15 conducted a raid in the area around 1:00 am where a group of robbers were preparing to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, forcing RAB men to fire back. Saiful and Nur were caught in the line of fire, and their bullet-ridden bodies were recovered later.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: Saiful Islam and Nur Kamal, both alleged members of the Jokhi Robbers Gang, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on Shaplapur Marine Drive road in Cox's Bazar's Teknaf upazila. data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Shah Alam of RAB-15 said that while patrolling the Baharchhara area, his team discovered some individuals attempting to flee. The team pursued them, and the criminals responded by opening fire. In self-defense, the RAB members returned fire, causing the criminals to retreat from the scene. Following the altercation, the RAB members discovered the lifeless body of a man who had been struck by a bullet. The official stated that the man was promptly transported to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors pronounced him dead. The body was subsequently taken to Teknaf Police Station.

data.name: Nazmul
data.description: Police Constable Hasan Ali used to own eight autorickshaws, of which one was operated by Nazmul. However, after the rickshaws were stolen, Hasan Ali suspected Nazmul of being the thief. Consequently, he went to Nazmul's house and subjected him to torture using scissors and a hammer. Tragically, Nazmul fell ill following this incident and eventually passed away.

data.name: Rezaul Karim Reza
data.description: A probationary lawyer at the Barisal district court, who was arrested by the police on December 29, 2020, died on Saturday night at the Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital prison cell due to excessive bleeding. The deceased has been identified as Rezaul Karim Reza, a 30-year-old resident of Abdul Karim Khan Road in Barisal city. The victim's family members have alleged that Reza died as a result of police torture following his arrest on false allegations. Upon hearing the news of his death, locals in the area staged a demonstration and threw bricks at the house of a police officer who allegedly detained Reza on the night of December 29. Reza's father, Md Yunus Mia, claimed that Detective Branch sub-inspector Mohiuddin, who is also their neighbor, picked up his son, accusing him of being a drug addict, and tortured him at the DB office. On January 1, he said, they received a phone call from the hospital informing them that their son had been admitted to the prison cell due to excessive bleeding through his urinary system. Prashanta Kumar Banik, the superintendent of Barisal Central Jail, stated that they received Reza with wounds in his groin and he was subsequently sent to SBMCH.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.description: A man was killed and three police officers were injured in a shootout at Teknaf. Hafizur Rahman, the officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station, said, "Police arrested a fugitive named Samsul Alam around 10:30 pm. Suddenly, his associates attacked the police in the Habirchara area and tried to snatch him." At one point, the criminals opened fire, targeting the police, which led to retaliation and triggered a gunfight that resulted in bullet injuries for some individuals, added the OC. "Later, we learned that a young man named Khorshed Alam, who was the brother of Samsul Alam, died on the way to the hospital," Hafizur Rahman continued. The body was placed in the mortuary of Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Abdur Rahim
data.description: 34 BGB Captain Lt. Col. Ali Haider confirmed that a group of men challenged a BGB team and started firing at them. The BGB retaliated and fired shots back at them, resulting in Abdur being shot. The rest of them fled away. Abdur was taken to Ukhiya Health Complex where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Rubel Shah
data.description: In Chandpur's Faridganj, a young man named Rubel Shah (30) has died while under treatment after being wounded by police gunfire. He died in a private hospital in Shyamoli, Dhaka on Friday morning. Rubel Shah's younger brother, Murad Shah, confirmed the death. On the evening of March 12, a group of police went to Rubel Shah's village home in the West Larduia area of Faridganj upazila to arrest him. At that time, the police claimed that Rubel Shah attacked them with a sharp weapon while they were attempting to arrest him. In self-defense, the police opened fire, and he was critically injured. Six cases have been filed in Haimchar police station against Rubel, the son of Nazrul Shah of West Larduia village, including for allegedly threatening the Prime Minister during her visit. Rubel's younger brother, Murad Shah, told Jugantor that his brother was killed without reason by the police gunfire. The bullet entered through the right side of Rubel Shah's back and exited through the front of his chest.

data.name: Shafiq Sheikh
data.description: A man who was killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB-10 in Dhaka's Keraniganj was a truck driver who ran over and killed a RAB member in Mymensingh's Bhaluka on February 14. Four days after the so-called gunfight, family members of the deceased identified the body at the Dhaka Medical College morgue. Shafiq's brother-in-law, Manik, said Shafiq worked as a technician at the Tongi truck stand and was behind the wheel of the truck that killed the RAB man in Bhaluka. Manik claimed that Shafiq had been missing since the accident on February 14. "Shafiq was not a drug peddler. He had been untraceable since the accident." Throughout the rest of the day, RAB officials did not disclose how the man died or who he was. In the evening, they finally spoke and claimed that the deceased was a drug dealer who was killed in a gunfight with RAB-10 earlier in the day in Keraniganj's Swapnadhara area. The officials did not give any further details of the deceased.

data.name: Wazir Mia
data.description: Family members said Wazir died because the police tortured him at Shantiganj Police Station after arresting him in the early hours of February 10. His brother, Dalim Mia, said, "He was severely tortured. He was released on bail the next day but fell ill. We took him to the hospital in critical condition." Villagers later blocked the Sunamganj-Sylhet road at Pagla Bazar for three hours, demanding justice for Wazir. Superintendent of Police in Sunamganj, Mizanur Rahman, said there would be an autopsy, and actions would be taken if evidence of torture is found. He was arrested allegedly for stealing. The SI of police, Debasish Sutradhar, has been transferred due to this incident.

data.name: Abdul Hamid
data.description: Three Rohingya youths - Abdul Hamid, Johir Ahmed, and Jokir Ahmed - were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion personnel at Teknaf in Cox's Bazar. RAB said the youths were involved in robbery, abduction, ransom, human trafficking, and Yaba smuggling. RAB-15 Deputy Director Mehedi Hasan said Jokir was the leader of the Jokir Group, and he had at least 17 cases filed against him with Teknaf Police Station for robbery, kidnapping, human trafficking, and Yaba smuggling in the past one and a half years. RAB had information that the group was planning to kidnap a Bangladeshi NGO worker. Based on that information, RAB raided a hill where Jokir and his accomplices had allegedly taken position, near Rohingya camp number 26 in the afternoon. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing the RAB team to retaliate, claimed RAB-15 Deputy Director Mehedi Hasan. After over an hour of gunfight, the group fled the scene, and the RAB team found three people shot and killed on the hill, said Mehedi. Earlier this month, at least two Rohingyas were killed in reported gunfights with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Naikhyangchari upazila in Bandarban.

data.name: Delowar Hossain
data.description: RAB said it seized four lakh pieces of contraband Yaba, one pistol, four bullets, and a bullet shell from his possession. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-7 raided the garden in Ramu upazila, said Lieutenant Colonel Mahbubur Rahman, the commanding officer of Rapid Action Battalion-RAB, Cox’s Bazar. As soon as Delwar and his men spotted RAB near the Valley of Hill, they opened fire, forcing RAB to retaliate in self-defense. While Delwar died on the spot, others managed to flee," Mahbubur said. KM Amiruzzaman, the officer-in-charge of Ramu police station, said the dead body was sent to Cox’s Bazar Sadar hospital morgue for an autopsy. No information has been found from the family in this connection.

data.name: Mohammad Rubel
data.description: Two alleged Yaba traders, Yunus Alam (35) and Mohammad Rubel (20), were killed in a gunfight with the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) at the Teknaf border in Cox's Bazar. The incident occurred around 3:30 a.m. last Monday at the Alugula project in the Beriband area near Nazirpara. Authorities recovered 360,000 pieces of Yaba, a gun, and a knife. Acting on confidential information about potential smuggling from Myanmar, the BGB patrol challenged five individuals entering Bangladesh by boat; three escaped, two were shot, and later pronounced dead at the Upazila Health Complex. Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan of Teknaf-2 BGB oversaw the operation.

data.name: Masud
data.description: A man who sustained bullet wounds when the police opened fire during a clash with a group of fishermen in the Meghna River in Matlab North Upazila died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. The clash took place when a team of River Police was conducting a regular drive against jatka netting. Mohammad Kamruzzaman, a member of Chandpur River Police, said that while patrolling in the Meghna River, they chased a group of fishermen who were catching jatka. Being chased by the law enforcers, the fishermen threw brick chips at them, prompting the police team to fire shotguns in self-defense. Kamruzzaman added that Masud was hit by a bullet in his left thigh. After the clash, the police detained Masud, who was hit by a bullet, and two other fishermen from the spot. Later, Masud was taken to Matlab North Upazila Health Complex, from where he was shifted to DMCH as his condition deteriorated.

data.name: Mohammad Ashik
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Mohammad Ashik, along with 18 other supporters of Hefazat-e-Islami Bangladesh, were killed, and over 500 were injured during protests against the recent visit of Narendra Modi, the Prime Minister of India, to Bangladesh.

data.name: Rony
data.description: Workers of the S Alam Group-owned coal-based power plant, SS Power Plant, alleged that the police opened fire on them, resulting in the death of Rony and four others. They were peacefully demonstrating for their five-point demands, which included the payment of their overdue salaries. Both the police and the workers confirmed that the incident occurred within the power plant project area. During the incident, seven vehicles, including six cement mixers and a microbus, were set on fire. Additionally, a cement godown was also torched. Anwar Hossain, the Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Chittagong Range, stated that the workers of the coal-based power plant in Gandamara at Banshkhali had been protesting for various demands. Although a meeting had been held between the workers and the authorities, the protesting workers resumed their demonstrations in the morning and eventually attacked the plant and the on-duty police personnel in the project area.

data.name: Shimul Ahmed
data.description: Two more workers, who were shot in a police firing on a workers' demonstration at Banshkhali in Chattogram on Saturday, died while undergoing treatment at Chattogram hospitals on Tuesday and Wednesday. Along with them, at least seven workers were killed and dozens injured after the police opened fire at a demonstration of workers who were pressing for their nine-point demand at the under-construction coal-fired power plant named SS Power-1 Limited of S Alam Group at Baraghona under Gandamara Union of Banshkhali in Chattogram on April 17. Among the deceased, Shimul Ahmed, 23, son of Abdul Malek, from Janahura of Srimangal in Moulvibazar, died at the ICU of Chattogram Medical College Hospital on Wednesday, confirmed CMCH police outpost in-charge Inspector Jahirul Hoque Bhuiyan. He said that Shimul succumbed to his injuries at about 6:30 pm.

data.name: Rajiur Rahman
data.description: Two more workers, who were shot in a police firing on a workers' demonstration at Banshkhali in Chattogram on Saturday, died while undergoing treatment at Chattogram hospitals on Tuesday and Wednesday. With them, at least seven workers were killed and dozens injured after the police opened fire at a demonstration of workers who were pressing for their nine-point demand at the under-construction coal-fired power plant named SS Power-1 Limited of S Alam Group at Baraghona under Gandamara Union of Banshkhali in Chattogram on April 17. One of the victims, Raziur Rahman, 22, son of Abdul Mannan Mandal, of village Jamadani under Phulbari upazila in Dinajpur, died at Parkview Hospital at Panchlaish in the Chattogram city at about 2:30 am on Tuesday, confirmed his sister Swapna Mustarina.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.description: A Rohingya man suspected of being a yaba dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with Border Guard Bangladesh in Bandarban's Naikhongchhari upazila. Mohammad Ibrahim was from Kutupalong Lambashia Rohingya camp in Cox's Bazar Ukhia upazila. Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, the commanding officer of BGB-34 Battalion, said that the "gunfight" took place in the Aambagan area near Baishfari border around 12:30 am. A BGB patrol team took positions in the Aambagan area based on information that a consignment of yaba tablets would be smuggled into Bangladesh through the border. When the BGB men challenged a group of five to six people, they opened fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, the criminals fled. Later, the BGB team found a body lying on the spot, which was sent to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Hamidur Rahman
data.description: A farmer named Hamidur Rahman (45) has allegedly died due to torture by Officer-in-Charge (OC) Shamsul Alam of the Potnitola Police Station in Naogaon. The incident occurred after Hamidur's wife, Fahima, filed a complaint about family disputes at the Potnitola Police Station, which ultimately led to Hamidur's recent divorce from her. Approximately 10 days before his death, Fahima lodged the complaint, and the police took Hamidur from his home on April 25. During a reconciliation meeting at the station, Hamidur refused to take his wife back, which angered OC Shamsul Alam. He allegedly beat Hamidur severely with fists and sticks, even striking his head against a wall at one point. Hamidur's cousin, Faruk Hossen, and neighbor, Noimuddin, who were present, took him home in an injured condition. On April 27, as Hamidur's condition worsened, he was first taken to the Potnitola Upazila Health Complex. Later, following a doctor's recommendation, he was being transported to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital on the night of April 28 but died on the way.

data.name: Sanaul Haque Biswas
data.description: Sanaul's younger brother, Masud Rana Biswas, said that the police arrested Sanaul in front of Sadar Hospital when he went out to buy eggs. Masud said his brother was tortured by the police and died as a result of the torture. He mentioned that his brother left behind his wife and four daughters. Masud added that his brother was a drug addict but was not involved in any drug trading. AHM Abdur Rakib, the superintendent of police in the district, stated that Sanaul was wanted in a narcotics case. The SP denied allegations of torture and claimed that they suspect Sanaul died of a heart attack. After the incident, he fled the area. Later, upon receiving information, a team from the Detective Branch (DB) of the police conducted a raid in Chanshikari village. Sensing the presence of DB officials, Sanaul attempted to run away, but the police managed to apprehend him. After the arrest, the accused complained of chest pain, and the police then took him to Bholahat Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Abul Hossain Molla
data.description: A 48-year-old man, arrested on 16 April in connection with the violence that occurred on 5 April between the police and locals in Saltha upazila of Faridpur, died in police custody on Saturday morning. The deceased was identified as Abul Hossain Molla, 48. Although district police claimed that Abul Hossain died of a stroke, his family members attributed his death to torture by cops, as reported by UNB. Faridpur Sadar Hospital's in-charge, Tofazzal Hossain, said, "Police brought the body of Abul Hossain to the hospital around 6:00 am. The cause of his death can only be confirmed after an autopsy." Faridpur police superintendent, Md. Alimujjaman, said, "Abul Hossain was found lying on the bathroom floor around 5.30 am. We suspect he died of a stroke." A four-member probe panel has been formed to investigate the death, he said. "The committee has been asked to submit a report within 24 hours." Abul's daughter, Taniya Aktar, however, claimed that her father was innocent. "He wasn't involved in any village politics. We demand a free and fair investigation and justice for my father's death." Abul Hossain was arrested on 16 April for his alleged involvement in the violent clashes with the police on 5 April, which resulted in the death of a young man and 20 injuries. On 28 April, the court of Faridpur judicial magistrate, Faruk Hossain, allowed a police plea to take Abul into their custody for five days for interrogation.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Police said that the gunfight took place between the police and a gang of dacoits when a youth was hit by a bullet and taken for treatment, where the doctors declared him dead. The incident took place near Ratan Khamar, Keraniganj, Dokkhin. Police sent the dead body to Solimullah Medical College Hospital for an autopsy. According to the Daily Sun, a suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the Detective Branch of the police in Keraniganj, the capital, on Sunday night. The identity of the deceased could not be known yet. Sakratul Islam, sub-inspector (SI) of Keraniganj police station, said that upon being informed, two groups of robbers were preparing to commit robbery in the Rataner Khamar area. A police team went to the spot at night. As soon as the police reached the spot, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back in self-defense, triggering a gunfight, the SI added. Later, the police recovered the body from the spot and sent it to Mitford Hospital morgue for an autopsy, the SI further said. A case was filed with Dakkhin Keraniganj Police Station in connection with this incident, he said.

data.name: Mohammad Jubayer Hossain
data.description: Jubayer was shot dead by the police during an altercation between the people and the police. The altercation started previously in an incident where the police were enforcing the imposition of a lockdown. According to The Business Standard, a man was killed in a shootout as angry locals vandalized and set fire to Saltha UNO residence, the police station, and Upazila Parishad in protest against "an assault" on a man for violating lockdown rules on Monday night. The police allegedly opened fire in self-defense during the attack, killing Jubayer Hossain, 18, of Ramkantpur Union, according to Ramakantpur Union Parishad Chairman Ashraf Ali Litu. Four to five other people were wounded in the shootout. The incident erupted after a local man named Zakir Hossain was allegedly beaten up by the assistant of Upazila Assistant Commissioner (land) Marufa Sultana Khan Hiramoni at Fukra Bazar under Sonapur union. Zakir claimed that while Marufa Sultana was inspecting the lockdown enforcement, a man got down from her car and started to beat him with a stick without any warning. Zakir was taken to the Upazila Hospital with a severe waist injury. Agitated local residents later engaged in a clash with a team of police led by SI Mizanur Rahman of Saltha police station, forcing them out of the Fukra Bazar area. Following the clash, residents along with Fukra Bazar shopkeepers first besieged Saltha Police Station and Upazila Parishad office seeking justice for Zakir. At one point, they turned violent and set fire to the UNO's residence, AC Land's office, and the police station. Two vehicles of the UNO's office and several motorcycles were also burnt in the attack. "Almost every government office in our upazila was attacked, vandalized, and set on fire in a medieval manner. They also attacked the Muktijoddha Mural and Muktijoddha Complex. We need a proper investigation into the matter," he said. Faridpur Superintendent of Police Mohammad Alimuzzaman said the public had misunderstood government instructions on the first day of the lockdown. "At one stage, rumors were spread and various government offices were vandalized and set on fire. Eight law enforcement agency members were injured in the attack," he added. Saltha Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ashiquzzaman said

data.description: Two unidentified suspected pirates were killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Char Kukri Mukri of Charfashion upazila in Bhola. Dakkhin Aicha Police Station inspector (investigation) Milon Kumar Gosh said a team of RAB conducted a raid at Jalia canal in the morning based on information that a group of pirates had taken positions there. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the pirates opened fire, forcing RAB personnel to retaliate by shooting back. When the suspects retreated, two of them were found dead on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Rasel
data.description: Two alleged muggers, Mohammad Rasel and Enamul, were killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch of Police in Dhaka's Khilkhet area. The shootout took place when a team from the Detective Branch of Police, along with local police, chased a group of muggers who were on an auto-rickshaw, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB-Gulshan of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police. He said around 2:15 am, as law enforcers signaled an auto-rickshaw at a checkpoint to stop, its driver refused and tried to speed his way towards the Purbachal area. The DB team then informed another one of their teams ahead, who intercepted the auto-rickshaw, he said. Then, two of the muggers came out of the auto-rickshaw and started firing at the law enforcers, who fired back in self-defense, leaving the men with bullet wounds, claimed the DC. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Manik
data.description: Manik, a suspect in the Shahin Uddin murder case, was killed in a gunfight with RAB at the Eastern Housing area of Mirpur in Dhaka. RAB-4 director Mozammel Haque said they raided the Eastern Housing area based on a tip-off about a group of thugs. Sensing RAB’s presence, the thug opened fire and RAB personnel retaliated. After the gunfight, the personnel found Manik shot and killed.

data.name: Mohammad Monir Uddin
data.description: Monir was killed in a gunfight with the zonal branch of the Detective Branch of Police. He was first grievously hurt in the gunfight and later declared dead by doctors at the Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital. Prothom Alo reported that another accused in a case filed over the murder of trader Shahin Uddin in the capital's Pallabi area was also killed in a gunfight on early Sunday. The deceased, Md Monir, was the sixth accused in the case. Police received a tip about Monir's whereabouts and conducted a drive near the Eidgah area in Pallabi of Mirpur at around 8:50 pm, resulting in his arrest. According to the police, they carried out a drive based on information given by Monir to recover arms in the Sagufta housing area at around 2:15 am. A gunfight ensued as miscreants started firing at the police, leaving Monir dead on the spot and two police members injured. Police recovered a foreign pistol, two magazines, and one round of bullets from the scene. A case was filed with the Pallabi police station regarding this incident. Iftekhairul Islam, additional deputy commissioner of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police's media and public relations department, confirmed Monir's death in the shootings. He stated that Monir was rushed to the Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital, where physicians pronounced him dead.

data.name: Rokon Mia
data.description: Rokon Mia, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with RAB on the Dhaka-Mymensingh Highway near Tongi bridge. Assistant Police Superintendent of RAB, Emran Khan, said a patrol team of RAB went to the spot on a tip-off that a group of youths were peddling drugs there. Sensing the presence of the RAB members, the drug peddlers opened fire, prompting RAB to retaliate. Rokon died on the spot.

data.name: Kamal Miah
data.description: BGB claimed that a group of cattle traders were coming near the 1215 Pillar of Bongao when the BGB patrol team tried to arrest them. However, the team of 30-35 cattle traders attacked the BGB and severely injured Lance Nayek Tui Hola Mong. In self-defense, the BGB fired back, hitting Kamal. Kamal was then taken to Sunamganj Sadar Hospital but unfortunately died on his way to being transferred to Sylhet.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Babul Das and another unidentified alleged robber were killed in a shootout with RAB in Chakaria upazila in Cox's Bazar. The gunfight took place around 4:00 am when a team of RAB carried out a raid after receiving a tip-off that a group of robbers had gathered at Purba Boro Bhewla area, said Maj Sheikh Yusuf Ahmed, a company commander of RAB-15. He said the robbers opened fire at the RAB men, who retaliated, leaving two of them with bullet wounds. The injured were taken to Chakaria Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Shamim
data.description: Iftekhaer Alam, spokesperson of Rajshahi district police, said that a group of assailants opened fire on the police while a team of law enforcers from Kakonhat police outpost was patrolling at Lalitanagar, forcing the latter to retaliate, which resulted in a gunfight. After the gunfight, they found Shamim injured while the others managed to flee the spot. Later, he was rushed to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. The Daily Star reported that a man was killed in a "gunfight" between the police and criminals in Rajshahi's Godagari upazila early yesterday. The law enforcers said that he might have been involved in the rape and murder of a class-IV female student on Sunday. The "gunfight" took place around 2:00 am when a team from Kakonhat Police Investigation Centre was patrolling the Lalitnagar area, said Iftekhaer, who is also the spokesperson for the district police. Sensing the police presence, some criminals opened fire at the law enforcers, prompting them to fire back and triggering the "gun battle," added the police official. When the criminals fled, the police team found a body, and locals confirmed that the deceased was Shamim. The police also claimed to have recovered a pistol, one bullet, a magazine, and a stolen mobile phone from the scene. The police official said that the mobile phone was stolen from the house of one of the neighbors of the girl, Sumaiya, 10, on the day of her rape and murder. "As we found the stolen mobile phone in Shamim's possession, we are considering that he [Shamim] might have been linked to the girl's rape and murder," said Iftekhaer. The police collected DNA samples from the deceased and sent them to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital for forensic tests, he added. Sumaiya's body was found in a pile of straw on the roof of a neighbor's house on Sunday morning. Police investigation later revealed that she was raped and strangled sometime in the early hours of that day. Her father, Anwar Hossain, a mason, filed a case with Godagari Model Police Station against unnamed criminals in this connection. Quoting locals, the police said that Shamim had been involved in mobile theft for a long time and that he had recently injured a girl when he failed

data.name: Hashimullah
data.description: In Teknaf, Cox's Bazar, Hasimullah (33), the alleged leader of the top Rohingya bandit gang known as Hashem Bahini, has been killed in a gunfight with RAB (Rapid Action Battalion). The exchange of gunfire between RAB and the bandit gang occurred at the foothills of the 27th Rohingya camp in Hnila Union late last night. The deceased Hasimullah was the son of Bashir Ahmed of block C in the 27th Rohingya camp in Jadimura. According to RAB Wing Commander Azim Ahmed, when a group of RAB from Teknaf camp reached the number 14 bridge of Teknaf Cox's Bazar regional road area, a group of robbers fired towards them. RAB personnel fired back, during which time Hashimullah was killed.

data.name: Lutfur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Lt. Col. Ali Haider, Commander of BGB, said that they went to Nalbania Shrimp farm to patrol the area. During this time, they gave a signal to some suspected persons. However, they fired towards them, which caused them to fire back. Then the suspected persons fled away. After that, they found a bullet wound on Lutfor, who was taken to the hospital where doctors declared him dead. According to Prothom Alo, a man was killed in what the Border Guard Bangladesh members called a gunfight with them in Ukhiya of Cox's Bazar on Thursday evening. Lutfor, 40, from Nalbania village in Palongkhali union of Ukhiya upazila, was involved in drug trading and smuggling, according to the BGB. The deceased was accused in 12 cases of robbery, drugs, arms, women and child abuse, and other crimes, the paramilitary force said. Speaking to Prothom Alo, Cox's Bazar BGB-34 commander Lt. Col. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed said the gunfight took place in the Nalbania Chingri Khamar (shrimp enclosure) area in the evening. A gun and 50,000 yaba tablets were recovered from the spot, he claimed. Two BGB members also sustained injuries in the gunfight, he added. Ali Haider Azad further said a BGB team went to the enclosure area as part of its regular patrol duty. On suspicion, they asked a few people to halt, but they opened fire aiming at the BGB men, injuring the two BGB members. The suspects fled the scene through Anjumanapara when the BGB patrolling team opened fire in self-defense, he added. The BGB members searched the area and found Lutfor, who had been shot, and recovered 50,000 yaba tablets and the gun, the BGB commander added. He was taken to Ukhiya upazila health complex where a physician declared him dead, he said. Ukhiya upazila health complex physician Ranjan Barua Rajon told Prothom Alo that the BGB men brought a bullet-hit man to the hospital, but he had died before arriving. The matter has been informed to the Ukhiya police station. The body will be sent to Cox's Bazar sadar hospital for an autopsy, he added. Lt.

data.name: Ashraf Ali
data.description: Ashraf Ali, who was accused of a double-murder case in the Rumaliyarchhara area of Cox's Bazar, was killed in a reported gunfight with the RAB. Tanvir Hasan, the deputy commander of RAB-15, stated that in the early hours of the morning, RAB conducted an operation based on their information. However, the criminals, sensing their presence, opened fire on them. In self-defence, RAB personnel retaliated, resulting in Ashraf being shot and killed.

data.name: Karimullah
data.description: Karim, also known as Kalimullah, a suspected robber and resident of Lambashia Rohingya camp under the Ukhiya police station, was killed in a gunfight with the RAB in Cox's Bazar. According to the RAB, he was the leader of the robber gang known as the Kalimullah group and was accused in five robbery and murder cases. Squadron Leader Tanvir Hasan, deputy commander of RAB-15, said RAB members launched a raid in the area based on a tip-off that a group of robbers was staying there. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight. When the gunfight ended, RAB recovered Karim's body and two firearms from the scene.

Abu Nayeem Md Talat, commanding officer of RAB-14. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, triggering a "gunfight," said the RAB official. After the "gun battle," the RAB members found two bullet-hit individuals - Asadul and Sumon Mia - on the spot, and they were taken to Gafargaon Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Parvez Ahmed
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The deceased is Parvez Ahmed, the ringleader of an inter-district robber gang. Tipped off, a team of RAB-1 conducted an anti-narcotics drive in the area at about 1:00 am. Sensing the presence of the RAB personnel, Parvez and his two associates opened fire on the RAB men, forcing them to fire back. At one stage, Parvez was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the two others managed to flee the scene. However, information from the family or other sources is unknown.

data.name: Dil Mohammad
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a team of BGB-34 Battalion conducted a raid at Garjanbania Chakmapara in Naikkhangchhari upazila, said Yar Hossain, Assistant Director of the Battalion. The BGB personnel confronted a group of "yaba dealers" who opened fire on the border guards, forcing them to retaliate in self-defense, he said. Later, the BGB men found two individuals lying on the ground with bullet wounds and took them to Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead. However, the accomplices of the two managed to escape.

data.name: Mohammad Liton
data.description: An accused in a drug case died while in the custody of Uttara-East Police Station early yesterday. The deceased, Liton, 40, was on a two-day remand in a case filed by RAB under the Narcotics Control Act. Saiful Islam, deputy commissioner of Uttara Division Police, said that Liton was a drug addict and hanged himself while in the lock-up. "There is CCTV in the lock-up. We have formed a three-member committee, led by an additional deputy commissioner, to investigate the incident." His son, Wahedul Islam, said Liton was a truck driver living in Narayanganj for the last couple of months. The owner of the truck informed his family about the arrest a couple of days ago. "Two days ago, a man claiming to be a lawyer called us and said my father would not be placed on remand if we paid Tk 6,000. We didn't have that kind of money and couldn't pay him.

data.name: Nurul Alam Nuru
data.description: Nurul Alam Nuru, an alleged robber, was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Teknaf upazila in Cox's Bazar. The gunfight took place beside a hill near the makeshift Rohingya camp in Damdamia Nature Park around 1:00 am when a RAB team rushed there on information of robbery and abduction, according to Lt Commander Mahbub Hasan, a company commander of Rab-15. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire at them, who retaliated -- leaving Nuru critically injured. RAB later took Nuru to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Md Kajol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Md Kajol, an alleged robber, was killed in a gunfight between a group of robbers and members of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB-7) in Chattogram's Bayezid-Foujderhat link road area of Sitakunda upazila. He was charged with the murder of truck driver Abdur Rahman, who was killed during a robbery attempt. Sitakunda Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Abul Kalam Azad said a RAB team raided the spot based on a tip-off that the robbers were preparing for a robbery there. "RAB later engaged in a gunfight with the gang of robbers," said the OC, adding that "after the brief gunfight, Kajol's body was discovered at the scene.

data.name: Tajul Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Tajul Hossain, along with Sajeeb Hossain, sustained bullet injuries in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Jhilmil residential area of Keraniganj and later died while undergoing treatment at the Dhaka Medical College and Hospital (DMCH). Bacchu Mia of DMCH police outpost said two youths were admitted to the hospital on 16/08/2021 with bullet wounds. They died at around 10:00 am on 17/08/2021. According to RAB-10, they launched a raid in the Jhilmil area on a tip-off that a group of robbers was preparing for a crime. Sensing RAB’s presence, the alleged robbers opened fire, and the law enforcers retaliated. Tajul and Sajeeb were injured in the incident and sent to DMCH.

data.name: Sajeeb Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Sajeeb Hossain, along with Tajul Hossain, sustained bullet injuries in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Jhilmil residential area of Keraniganj and later died while undergoing treatment at the Dhaka Medical College and Hospital (DMCH). Bacchu Mia of DMCH police outpost said two youths were admitted to the hospital on August 16, 2021, with bullet wounds. They died at around 10:00 am on August 17, 2021. According to RAB-10, they launched a raid in the Jhilmil area on a tip-off that a group of robbers was preparing for a crime. Sensing RAB’s presence, the alleged robbers opened fire and the law enforcers retaliated. Tajul and Sajeeb were injured in the incident and sent to DMCH.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Border Guard Bangladesh at Shah Parir Dwip in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar. Lieutenant Colonel Md Faisal Khan, the BGB 2 commander, said that a BGB team challenged two individuals in the Naf River at Golarchar point of Shahporir Dwip. They opened fire on the guards, forcing them to retaliate in self-defense, which triggered a gunfight. At one point, one of them fell into the river after sustaining bullet wounds, while the other managed to escape, he said. The body was sent to the hospital morgue.

data.name: Mohammad Shahjahan
data.description: BGB personnel received information that a large consignment of yaba tablets from Myanmar would enter Bangladesh, according to Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commander of BGB Battalion-34 in Cox's Bazar. When a group of four to five individuals attempted to enter Bangladesh through the border at around 4:00 am, the BGB personnel signaled for them to stop. However, they opened fire, which led to the BGB personnel retaliating and a "gunfight" ensued. Shahjahan was injured during the incident and was pronounced dead by doctors at Ukhiya Upazila Health Complex. No further information has been reported by the family or locals.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: The BGB official said three drug peddlers were crossing the Naf River. Following the "shootout," one of them was declared dead after being taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex with bullet wounds, while two others fled to Myanmar. The Daily Star reported that two alleged drug peddlers were killed in "gunfights" with members of Border Guard Bangladesh in Cox's Bazar early yesterday. In another incident, Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, commander of BGB 2 Battalion in Cox's Bazar, provided an almost identical version while describing the "gunfight" in Teknaf's Damdamia Natural Park area. The BGB official said three drug peddlers were crossing the Naf River. Following the "shootout," one of them was declared dead after being taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex with bullet wounds, while two others fled to Myanmar. He claimed that they also recovered 3.4 lakh yaba tablets and a firearm from the spot. Both bodies were sent to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsies. One of them killed in Ukhiya Upazila was identified as Mohammad Shahjahan, 27, while the identity of the other, aged between 25 and 30, killed in Teknaf Upazila could not be known immediately.

data.name: Sujan Hawladar
data.description: A fisherman, Sujan Hawladar, 30, was allegedly killed while being chased by members of the river police at village Charbaliatli on the bank of the River Rabnabad under Kalapara upazila during a drive against 'illegal fishing' nets on Tuesday morning. According to local people, members of the Banatibazar river police outpost led by ASI Mamun chased the fishermen in a trawler in the river Ramnabad. Four fishermen were able to flee, but Sujan got caught and was beaten by the river police, the locals alleged. After the beating, Sujan fell unconscious and was first taken to Bablatala Bazar by his relatives. He was later taken to Kalapara Upazila Hospital where the on-duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.description: Jahangir, a suspected drug dealer, was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Captain Azim Ahmed, the wing commander of Rab-15, said the incident took place behind Jaliapalong Forest Beat Office at around 8:30 pm. According to Azim, a group of drug dealers started firing at RAB personnel when they were on a drug recovery operation there. RAB fired back in retaliation, and later they found Jahangir's body on the ground.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Lt. Col. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, Cox's Bazar BGB-34 Battalion Commander, stated, "A BGB team took position in the Karibunia area after receiving information that a consignment of yaba tablets was being transported to Bangladesh from Myanmar via the Ukhia area." "At the time, BGB members saw a group of 4-5 people approaching from Myanmar and ordered them to stop," he said. "Sensing the presence of the BGB, the group split up and started firing at BGB members. In self-defense, BGB members also fired back. At one point, the attackers retreated and fled through the hills towards Myanmar," he said. Later, BGB members searched the spot and found an unidentified person lying on the ground with a bullet wound. When he was taken to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex, the doctor on duty declared him dead.

data.name: Md Alamgir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Md Alamgir, a suspected robber, was killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion (RAB-7) in Banshkhali upazila of Chattogram. According to RAB, he was accused in nine cases filed for various charges. Nurul Absar, media officer of RAB-7, said RAB had received information that a group of 10-12 people had gathered on October 13th at Gondamara union of the upazila to prepare for a robbery. When RAB members arrived at the scene, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing RAB to retaliate. After a brief gunfight, RAB members found a bullet-hit body on the spot, later identified as Alamgir.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: Al Amin, along with three other people, was shot dead by the police during a clash that erupted centering around demeaning the Holy Quran in Comilla. Shamim's brother, Ripon, said that his brother was selling bananas in a van. At that time, due to indiscriminate police firing, he was shot and died in the hospital. The Daily Star reported that three people were killed and many others injured yesterday as mobs and police clashed in Chandpur's Hajiganj upazila, while violence erupted in several districts following reports of "demeaning the Holy Quran" in Cumilla. Authorities imposed Section 144 in Hajiganj following the violence and deployed two platoons of Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) to restore law and order, as reported by our Chandpur correspondent. There were also clashes in Cumilla, Chattogram, Kurigram, and Moulvibazar, where Hindu idols and temples were vandalized as the country observes Durga Puja. At least 50 people were injured in the clashes in Cumilla. The administration in Chattogram deployed eight BGB platoons in six upazilas of the district last night after several temples of the Hindu community were reportedly attacked in Banshkhali and Karnaphuli upazilas. Talking to The Daily Star around 1:40 am today, Nazimuddin, sub-inspector of Hajiganj Police Station, said three people were killed in the clash in the upazila. "There are injury marks on the bodies, but I cannot say what caused those," he said, adding that at least 15 police personnel were injured. Of them, eight were admitted to the hospital. Local media outlets reported that at least 60 people, including journalists, police, and common people, were injured in the clash. Superintendent of Police in Chandpur, Milon Mahmud, said a procession was brought out from Hajiganj Biswaroad intersection area after Esha prayers last night. Encircling the main road near Hajiganj Bazar twice when the procession was crossing the eastern side of Hajiganj Bazar, a sudden attack was launched on the Lakshmi Narayan Akhra (Trinayani) Puja Mandap. Police fired tear gas shells and shots in the air to bring the situation under control. The police action led to the clash. According to sources at Hajiganj Upazila Health Complex, the deceased were Al

Shamim's brother, Ripon, said that his brother was selling bananas in a van. At that time, due to indiscriminate police firing, he was shot and died in the hospital.

data.name: Shamim
data.description: Shamim, along with three other people, was shot dead by the police during a clash that erupted centering around demeaning the Holy Quran in Comilla. Shamim's brother, Ripon, said that his brother was selling bananas in a van. At that time, due to indiscriminate police firing, he was shot and died in the hospital. The Daily Star reported that another man named Shamim, 19, died yesterday from injuries he received during clashes between the police and a mob in Hajiganj, Chandpur, raising the death toll from the clash to four. Shamim was a resident of the Randhunimura area of Hajiganj, said Harunur Rashid, the officer-in-charge of Hajiganj Police Station. The OC added that seven people were arrested in connection with the clash that left at least 23 policemen injured. The authorities imposed Section 144 in Hajiganj following the violence and deployed two platoons of the BGB to restore law and order.

data.name: Sagar
data.description: Sagar, a truck driver, was hit by bullets after the police opened fire at a procession under the banner of 'Touhidi Janata' in Hajiganj of Chandpur on October 13th. He later succumbed to his injuries at the Dhaka Medical College and Hospital on the 19th. He was the fifth person to die in the incident. Originally from Brahmanbaria, he lived in Chandpur with his family. A group of people organized a procession on October 13th to protest an incident of disrespect towards the Quran. At one point, a clash broke out between the protesters and the police. The law enforcers opened fire during the clash, resulting in the death of at least four individuals. Additionally, around 50 others were injured in the incident.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An unidentified youth, aged around 30-32, was killed in a gunfight with RAB-1 in Rupganj upazila of Naraynganj. RAB-1 Captain Abdullah Al Momen told the media that a group of robbers were preparing for a robbery when a patrol team of RAB was nearby. Sensing the patrol team’s presence, the alleged robbers opened fire and RAB members retaliated in self-defense. After the gunfight, the body of a bullet-ridden youth was found lying at the spot. RAB took him to Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead. Inspector Fazlul Haque, in-charge of Bholab investigation center under Rupganj Police Station, said the youth’s body had three bullet wounds in the front and four in the back.

data.name: Tajul Islam
data.description: Tajul was allegedly tortured to death. After the news spread that a man had been tortured to death by the police, a mob reportedly threw bricks at Haragach Police Station and vandalized a few police vehicles on November 1, 2021. On November 3, the High Court requested a probe report on the alleged custodial death of Tajul Islam in Rangpur. A four-member committee has been formed by the police administration to conduct an inquiry into the incident. The Daily Star reported that the High Court asked Rangpur police to submit the probe report, including the post-mortem report of Tajul Islam, and a copy of the case filed over the death by November 11. The HC bench of Justice Mamnoon Rahman and Justice Khandaker Diliruzzaman passed the order on a suo moto (voluntary) move after Deputy Attorney General Amit Das Gupta submitted a statement from the police on the incident. The statement said that the police had conducted an inquest on the body of Tajul Islam and found no injury marks. The bench set November 15 for passing further orders on the matter. A four-member committee has been formed, headed by an additional police commissioner of Rangpur, to conduct an inquiry into the incident. The committee has been asked to submit the probe report within seven days, according to DAG Amit Das Gupta. On Tuesday, the HC bench wanted to know about the alleged custodial death, the subsequent attack on law enforcers by a mob, and the government's steps taken over the issue. Our Dinajpur correspondent reports that Rangpur police has formed the four-member probe committee with Additional Police Commissioner Mehedul Karim as its chief. Additional Deputy Police Commissioner (DB and Media) of Rangpur Metropolitan Police Sajjad Hossain confirmed this. The other members of the committee are Deputy Police Commissioner (DB) Kazi Muttaki Ibn Minan, Deputy Police Commissioner (CTTB) Abu Bakkar, and Assistant Commissioner (Poshuram Zone) Kazi Arifuzzaman. According to locals cited in the media, Tajul Islam was tortured to death under police custody in Rangpur's Kaunia on Monday. The bench passed the order after Supreme Court lawyer Jyotirmoy Barua presented a Prothom Alo report on the incident and appealed to the court to issue necessary directives on the issue. data.name: Tofayel Mia
data.description: Tofayel Mia, along with Shaid Mia, were killed in a gunfight between RAB members and a group of unidentified individuals in Moulvibazar's Sreemangal upazila. Both were accused in a case filed over the murder of a local business association leader. Basu Dutta Chakma, Commander of RAB-9 (Sreemangal Battalion), said, "A group of individuals started shooting at a RAB vehicle in the morning inside the Mirtinga tea garden area, and RAB retaliated in self-defense. After the gunfight, the bullet-riddled bodies of Tofayel and Shahid were recovered from the scene," he said.

data.name: Sujan Saha
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: His family alleged that he was beaten to death and thrown into the river. The body of a youth in handcuffs was found floating in the Haridoa river of Narsingdi Sadar upazila on November 9, hours after his arrest. Sujan's sister, Pinky Saha, said police arrested her brother from the Brahmandi area of the district town and took him to the Hajipur area. There, police asked the workers of a factory to beat him, and then police threw him into the river. The Daily Star reported that the body of a youth in handcuffs was found floating in the Haridoa river of Narsingdi Sadar upazila on Tuesday, hours after his arrest. His family alleged that he was beaten to death and thrown into the river. The deceased, Sujan Saha, 27, of Hajipur Daspara area, used to work in a clothing store in the Shekherchar area of Narsingdi. Sujan's sister, Pinky Saha, said police arrested her brother from the Brahmandi area of the district town early Tuesday and took him to the Hajipur area. There, police asked the workers of a factory to beat him, and then police threw him into the river, she alleged. Locals found his body around 9:00 am. Saheb Ali Pathan, additional superintendent (crime and administration) of Narsingdi police, said Sujan attacked police and jumped into the river to escape while being taken to Narsingdi Model Police Station. The police officer said Sujan stood accused in at least 10 cases, including theft, robbery, and mugging. An unnatural death case was filed with the police station in this regard, he added.

data.name: Mohammad Mamun
data.description: After the gunfight, the BGB team found Mamun with bullet wounds and sent him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, said BGB Battalion-2 Commander Lt Col Mohammad Foysal Hasan Khan. New Age reported that a young man in his early twenties was killed in a gunfight with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Meena Bazar in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar early Sunday. Border guard officials said that the victim, Mohammad Mamun, son of Abu Siddique of Meena Bazar under Hoykong union in the upazila, was part of a group of at least five drug peddlers who had been engaged in the gunfight with a patrol team of the border force. They said that two BGB members had also been injured in the gunfight and firearms and Yaba tablets had been seized from the scene. BGB Battalion 2 commanding officer Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan said in a press briefing at his office Sunday afternoon that the gunfight occurred between the BGB patrol team and the drug peddlers Sunday early morning. On information that a consignment of Yaba tablets was coming from Myanmar, the BGB team of Zimmong Khali outpost was patrolling Meena Bazar at the time, he added. He said that the drug peddlers had fired at the BGB patrolling team when the latter had asked the former to halt, triggering a gunfight as the BGB members fired back for the safety of government properties. Later, the BGB members found the bullet-hit victim along with a long barrel gun and 1 lakh contraband Yaba tablets on the spot, he said. The BGB members rescued the bullet-hit man and sent him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where the on-duty doctor declared him dead. The injured BGB members, Nayek Sajjad Rahman, 37, and Lance Naykey Mostafa Ali, 32, were given first aid at the hospital, the officer said. The body of the victim was handed over to Teknaf police station and a case was filed with the police station in this connection too, he added.

data.name: Hamidul Haque
data.description: In Gaibandha, Hamidul Haque (35) died due to injuries sustained in violence following the union council (UP) elections. He passed away on Sunday morning while receiving treatment at Rangpur Medical College Hospital. Witnesses and family sources report that voting took place peacefully at the South Dhan Ghara Government Primary School center in Ballamjhar Union on Thursday. After the vote count, officials were leaving with ballot boxes and election materials when supporters of a defeated candidate obstructed them. Police intervened with batons and rubber bullets, severely injuring Hamidul. He was initially taken to Gaibandha General Hospital and later transferred to Rangpur Medical College Hospital, where he died on Sunday morning. Hamidul's relative, Ariful Islam, stated that he was fatally injured by rubber bullets, with 15 to 20 hits to his chest, head, nose, and abdomen.

data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.description: Jahangir Alam, 35, a resident of Jamidarpara village under Balukhali union, was killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in Balukhali union under Ukhiya upazila in Cox's Bazar. RAB 7 personnel claimed that they had seized 70,000 pieces of Yaba tablets and a gun from the spot. Flight Lieutenant Niaz Mohammad Chapal, senior assistant director (media) of RAB 7, said RAB members raided Kakra bridge in the Balukhali area based on a tip-off. At that time, a group of Yaba peddling suspects opened fire on RAB members, who retaliated instantly. Later, they recovered the body of the suspected drug peddler at the scene.

data.name: Kefayet Ullah
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya robbers, Kefayet Ullah and Korban Ali alias Shafiq, residents of Nhilla Rohingya camp, were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion near a Rohingya camp in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar. RAB-15 Senior Assistant Director, Additional Superintendent of Police Abu Salam Chowdhury, said the "gunfight" took place in the hilly region of Damdamiya, adjacent to the Rohingya camp in Nhilla union. A RAB team raided the hills after receiving information that a group of Rohingya robbers and drug traffickers were positioned there. Sensing the RAB presence, the drug traffickers and criminals started firing. RAB retaliated in defense. After the firing stopped, RAB officials searched the spot and rescued the Rohingya duo. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared them dead. Information from other sources was also obtained.

data.name: Farid Mia
data.description:
At least 50 supporters of a defeated member of the UP election candidate attacked police cars with lethal weapons after the result was announced. At that time, the police fired 16 rounds of blank shots to protect government goods and ballot boxes and bring the situation under control. During the incident, there was a chase-counter chase and random bullet shots exchanged between them, resulting in the death of Arif, an autorickshaw driver who was shot. The incident also claimed the life of Farid Mia.

According to Prothom Alo, a 30-year-old man named Farid Mia was shot inside a polling center in Narsingdi's Raipura and died on Friday night. Farid Mia was hit by bullets inside a primary school in Uttar Bakharnagar of Raipura. The man from Uttar Bakharnagar was declared dead at 9:15 pm after being rushed to the emergency department of Dhaka Medical College and Hospital (DMCH). Shah Alam, the brother-in-law of the deceased, said, "Farid was critically injured as the supporters of two rival member candidates opened fire at each other inside the school. He was declared dead after being rushed to DMCH." Farid Mia was a rickshaw puller and the son of the late Abdul Majid Miah of Uttar Bakharnagar. He is survived by two sons, one daughter, and a wife.

ASI Abdul Khan, acting in-charge of the police camp at DMCH, confirmed the matter and said the body has been kept at DMCH morgue for autopsy. The incident has been reported to the concerned police station. Abdul Khan stated, "A man who was shot was brought to DMCH from Narsingdi and was declared dead upon arrival. The concerned police station has been informed of the incident.

data.name: Arif
data.description: At least 50 supporters of a defeated member of the UP election candidate attacked police cars with lethal weapons after the result was announced. At that time, the police fired 16 rounds of blank shots to protect government goods and ballot boxes and bring the situation under control. During the incident, there was a chase-counter chase and random bullet shots exchanged between them, resulting in the death of Arif, an autorickshaw driver who was shot. The incident also claimed the life of Farid Mia. According to locals, Arif Mia, a 24-year-old driver of a CNG-run auto-rickshaw, was killed in police firing in Chanderkandi union of Narsingdi's Raipura upazila yesterday. The incident occurred when the law enforcers opened fire to disperse supporters of AL nominated chairman candidate in the union, Korshed Alam, and independent contender Mejbahuddin Khandokar, who were engaged in a clash. Arif was pronounced dead after being taken to the local upazila health complex.

data.name: Aditya Kumar Roy
data.description: Village Police Officer Sagendranath Roy, who was on duty at the center, said that when the announcement of the Khangaon UP election result was made, supporters of Nuruzzaman rushed to the center, besieged law enforcers and polling officials, and demanded the result sheets of the UP election. After half an hour, a team of BGB members led by Pirganj Upazila Nirbahi Officer (UNO) Rezaul Islam rushed to the spot to control the situation. Nuruzzaman's supporters started vandalizing the polling station and attacked the law enforcers, said Sagendranath. Then, the BGB members opened fire, leaving three people, including Aditya Kumar Roy, dead.

data.name: Md Sabbir Hossain
data.description: Md Sabbir Hossain, 28, accused of the murder of Comilla ward councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel and his aide, was killed in a reported gunfight in the city with law enforcers on November 30, 2021. Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (Investigation) of Comilla's Kotwali Police Station, said that several teams of the Detective Branch and Kotwali Model Police Station conducted a raid in Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15 am based on a tip-off. "The accused started firing at the law enforcers as they reached the Shangraish Beribadh area, forcing retaliation," the police official claimed, adding that once the firing stopped, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of Sabbir and Sajon from the spot. According to the Daily Sun, two men accused of the murder of Cumilla ward councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel and his aide were killed in "gunfights" with police at the Sangraish Balumahal area near Gomti river Beribadh in Cumilla early Tuesday. The deceased were identified as Md Sabbir Hossain, 28, the third accused in the case, and Sajon, 32, the fifth accused in the case. Satyajit Barua, officer-in-charge of Cumilla District Detective Branch of Police, confirmed the matter. The gunfight took place in the Sangraish Balumahal area near Gomti river Beribadh around 1 am, said the DB official. Being informed that several accused in the case were staying in Songraish and Nabagram areas, a team of Kotwali Model Police Station and several teams of DB started a drive around 12:15 am to arrest them, said the DB official. When a joint team of DB and police reached the Balumahal area at 1:00 am, the miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back in self-defense, which triggered the gunfight. After the gunfight, police found two people at the spot with bullet wounds. Later, the injured were rushed to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared the duo dead. The law enforcers claimed that three policemen were injured in the gunfight. Police recovered a pistol, a pipe-gun, several unused bullet shells, and shells of cartridges, added the DB OC.
