data.name: Parag Ali
data.description: During the third phase of the Union Parishad (UP) elections in Pirganj Upazila of Thakurgaon district, election violence led to the death of three people and injury of six others on the spot by Border Guard Bangladesh's (BGB) gunfire. Another person died while receiving medical treatment last Monday night. Under the leadership of Nayek Subedar Azahar Ali and on the orders of Executive Magistrate Abdul Karim, a team of 14 BGB personnel opened fire. In the incident, nine people were shot, with three dying on the spot. One more person died after six of the wounded were taken to Thakurgaon Hospital. Those killed in the BGB's gunfire were Shahabuddin alias Sahabuli (32), son of Tofajjul from Habibpur village; Md. Mozahar Ali Muja (38), son of Tamiz Uddin from Chit Ghidob village; Parag Ali (22) from Ghidob village; and Amit Roy Aditya (18), son of Avinash Chandra Roy.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a local police team, along with some detectives, conducted a raid in Chanpur Ratnabati Gumti Beribadh area of Sadar upazila at about 1:30 am, said Anwarul Azim, officer-in-charge of Kotwali model police station. Spotting the cops, Alam and his accomplices opened fire, forcing the cops to retaliate. Alam sustained bullet wounds during the exchange of fire, while his cohorts managed to escape. The injured man was rushed to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead on arrival, police said. New Age: The prime accused in the Cumilla ward councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel murder case was killed in a reported gunfight in Sadar upazila early Thursday. The deceased was identified as Shah Alam, son of Janu Mia, of Sujanagar upazila. Two policemen also sustained injuries in the exchange of fire, said the police. Acting on a tip-off, a local police team, along with some detectives, conducted a raid in Chanpur Ratnabati Gumti Beribadh area of Sadar upazila at about 1:30 am, said Anwarul Azim, officer-in-charge of Kotwali model police station. Spotting the cops, Alam and his accomplices opened fire, forcing the cops to retaliate. Alam sustained bullet wounds in the exchange of fire, while the others managed to escape. Alam was rushed to Cumilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead on arrival, police said. "Two cops also received bullet wounds in the gunfight. One gun and some bullets were recovered from the spot," the OC said. On Monday, two more accused — Md Sabbir Hossain and Sajon — in the murder case were killed in a gunfight, according to the police. On November 22, Sohel, Cumilla City Corporation councillor of ward-17, and one of his aides were killed, while four others sustained injuries when gunmen opened fire in his office in Pathuariapara. Based on his younger brother Syed Rumon's complaint, as many as 21 people, some 10 of them unidentified, were booked by the Kotwali police for the double murder. So far, a total of five people have been arrested in connection with the crime.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion in Patharghata upazila of Barguna early Friday. According to RAB-8, a team of RAB-8 took positions on the bank of the Bishkhali River in the Badurtola area at about 2:00 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire at the RAB members, forcing them to fire back, which triggered a gunfight. After the gunfight, RAB found a robber lying on the ground with bullet wounds. Later, the police went to the spot and sent the injured robber to Patharghata Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared him dead, said Abul Bashar, officer-in-charge of the Patharghata police station.

data.name: Babul Sarder
data.description: Police said Babul committed suicide while in DB custody, but his family claimed he was tortured to death. Babul's daughter Munni said he was completely healthy and that the police beat him. According to The Daily Star, a man died in the custody of the Detective Branch (DB) of the police in Satkhira, hours after being arrested from his house in the district's Debhata upazila yesterday. The deceased was identified as Babul Sardar (56), son of the late Jurun Sardar of Basantapur village in the upazila, as reported by our local correspondent. Satkhira DB Inspector Yeasin Alam Chowdhury said that acting on a tip-off, a DB team arrested Babul from his home with 45 bottles of phensedyl around 11 am yesterday. He was taken to the DB office for interrogation after a case was filed against him with Debhata Police Station under the Narcotics Control Act, said the inspector. Babul "hung himself from the window" at some point during the night while in custody, said Inspector Yeasin. Talking to reporters, the victim's daughter Sultana Munni said an unidentified woman came to their house around 10 am yesterday and met her father in his room. Later, a group of 4-5 people, identifying themselves as DB policemen, recovered 45 bottles of phensedyl from the room and detained him after beating him up, she said. Munni alleged that the woman who met her father kept the phensedyl in the room. She also alleged that her father was tortured to death in custody. The victim's wife Sahanara Khatun claimed her husband did not commit suicide and demanded justice for his death. Satkhira DB Inspector Yeasin Alam further said the body was sent to Satkhira Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy after an inquest report was made in the presence of a magistrate and a physician. Mohammad Mostafizur Rahman, superintendent of Satkhira police, said Assistant Sub-inspector Sheikh Sohel and Constable Sharful Islam, who performed duty in the DB office last night, have been suspended. The incident will be investigated, added the SP.

data.name: Hamidul Islam
data.description: In Thakurgaon, a man died in police firing when two groups of people were fighting over the announcement of UP election results on Sunday evening. The incident took place when the followers of two candidate members engaged in a clash at Dakkhin Asan Nagar Government Primary School center under Rajagaon Union of the Sadar Upazila around 7:30 pm. Police recovered the body and kept it at Thakurgaon Adhunik Sadar Hospital for an autopsy. District Superintendent of Police Md Jahangir Hossain confirmed the death of Hamidul. Details about the deceased could not be known immediately. "A group of people obstructed officials from performing the government duties of declaring the election results. Later, one person died when the police opened fire on the order of the presiding officer," he told Dhaka Tribune.

data.name: Abdul Khalek
data.description: Abdul Khalek was shot dead when police fired during a clash at Char Montaj Union during the 4th stage of the UP election. According to the Dhaka Tribune, a man was shot dead in Patuakhali, allegedly by police, during a clash between supporters of rival candidates after the union parishad (UP) polls results were announced. The incident was reported around 7pm on Sunday at a voting center in the Char Montaj union. The deceased has been identified as Abdul Khaleq, a 40-year-old supporter of member candidate Md Ziaur Rahman. The supporters later tried to snatch the ballots, and at that point, the police opened fire and shot rubber bullets. Char Montaj police Sub-Inspector Mizanur Rahman said that the police, BGB, and RAB members present at the polling center fired bullets to bring the situation under control. However, he stated that the bullets that killed the victim were not fired by their forces. Several others were also injured during the clash. The body has been sent to Patuakhali Sadar Hospital for an autopsy. Locals said that after the results were announced, supporters of the losing candidate Ziaur Rahman demanded a recount, but Presiding Officer Ajmal Hossain refused.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: According to local residents, supporters of the independent chairman candidate, Emran Hossain, blocked the Sylhet-Zakiganj road in Boitikar Bazar at 8:00 pm due to the poll results of two centers in wards 8 and 9 in Fulbari Union. A clash broke out between the villagers and the police when the police attempted to disperse Emran Hossain's supporters, resulting in the police resorting to opening fire. Abdus Salam, who sustained bullet injuries during the clash, was taken to MAG Osmani Medical College and Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Asad Sheikh
data.description: Asad's family alleged that RAB members tortured him to death while in custody. He was arrested by RAB from his house on January 1st on charges of drug dealing and taken into custody in the afternoon. According to RAB’s FIR, Asad was a drug dealer and was detained by RAB acting on a tip-off. RAB also claimed they seized 603 Yaba pills from Asad. However, the police later stated that they could not find any criminal cases filed against him. Asad’s brother-in-law, Alam, said that he was a mechanic and worked in a vehicle repair shop. According to RAB, a scuffle broke out between Asad and RAB members as he tried to flee. He was critically injured and taken to Tongi’s Shaheed Ahsan Ullah Master General Hospital in the evening. There, the doctors declared him dead. An inquest report by Tongi East Police Station sub-inspector Sajal stated that there were marks of wounds on Asad’s right knee and the left side of his chest.

data.name: Himangshu Chandra
data.description: Himangshu's father, Biswasar Roy, alleged that the police tortured his son to death in custody. Hatibandha police officer-in-charge, Ershadul Alam, said Himangshu tried to commit suicide when he was kept in a room after interrogation. When he was taken to the hospital, the doctor declared him dead. New Age reported that a person who was arrested on charges of killing his wife died in police custody at Hatibandha upazila in Lalmonirhat on Friday. Police arrested Himangshu Chandra, 35, on charges of killing his pregnant wife, Savitri Rani, 30, in Hatibandha and took him to the Hatibandha police station. After the interrogation, he was kept in a room at the police station where he died on Friday afternoon. Hatibandha police officer-in-charge, Ershadul Alam, said Himangshu tried to commit suicide when he was kept in a room after interrogation. When he was taken to the hospital, the doctor declared him dead. Police recovered the body of Savitri Rani from East Kadma Maldapara village on Friday morning and arrested Himangshu. Villagers and relatives staged protests in Himangshu's village after the news of his death spread. Himangshu's father, Biswasar Roy, alleged that the police tortured his son to death in custody. Ershadul said that Himangshu was arrested for torturing his wife to death. He was interrogated and then kept locked in a room at the police station. He said Himangshu tried to kill himself by hanging from the ceiling fan using a wifi wire. Hatibandha Health Complex Resident Medical Officer, Hirrmanoyan Barman Sagar, said that Himangshu died before he was brought to the hospital.

data.name: Johirul Howladar
data.description: Allegations have arisen regarding the death of inmate Johirul Howladar due to torture in Barishal Central Jail. Around 10:30 in the morning, Johirul suddenly experienced chest pain in the jail. He was then taken to Barishal Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead. However, his family has claimed that his death was unnatural, stating that a 23-year-old young man could not suddenly die, and that he was tortured. But the police are saying that these allegations are completely baseless.

data.name: Mohammad Sahed Hossain
data.description: Mohammad Sahed Hossain (32) died in Lakshmipur District Jail. Sahed, a construction worker from Abdul Haq's family in Koraitala village of Dalalbazar Union in the Sadar Upazila, was imprisoned in connection with a drug case filed at Raipur Police Station. He was arrested in a Yaba case on March 7 and sent to jail. On the morning of August 10, he suddenly fell ill and was rushed to Lakshmipur Sadar Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead. His body is being kept in the morgue for autopsy. Lakshmipur District Jail's Jailor, Rafiqul Kader, and Sub-Inspector Abul Basar provided information about the incident. Sahed's sister, Jesmin Akhtar, stated that her brother worked as a construction worker and was falsely implicated in a drug case.

data.name: Amir Hossain
data.description: Amir Hossain, a fisherman from Bandarpur Prokash-Kutubpur in Bhola Sadar upazila, was killed when the police opened fire during a clash with fishermen in the Meghna River at Sadar upazila of Lakshmipur. Shotgun pellets were found in his head and back, according to a source from the DMC morgue. The Daily Sun reported that a man was shot dead and five others were injured in a clash between river police and fishermen who were fishing in the Meghna River, defying a government ban in Sadar upazila of the district on Sunday, as per UNB. The deceased was identified as Amir Hossain from Kutubpura Matlabbari in Bhola district. Kamal Hossain, a sub-inspector of river police, stated that a team of river police conducted a drive in the Meghna River as a two-month ban on catching fish is currently in effect. When the patrol team reached Maju Chawdhury Haat, 40-50 fishermen from five-six boats surrounded the team and started hurling brick chips at the police. In order to bring the situation under control, the police fired bullets, injuring Amir. He was taken to Lakshmipur Sadar Hospital, but the doctors referred him to Dhaka due to the deterioration of his condition. Meanwhile, Amir died on the way to a Dhaka Hospital. Five people, including four policemen, were injured during the clash and received first aid.

data.name: Rabiul Islam
data.description: Rabiul Islam was picked up by the police from a Pahela Baishakh fair at Mahendranagar Bangla Bazar under Sadar upazila in Lalmonirhat district. He allegedly died due to torture while in police custody. Robiul and another man were arrested by the police on charges of gambling at a fair in the Mahendranagar Bangla Bazar area on the occasion of Pahela Boishakh, according to his family members. Robiul had an altercation with some cops while being dragged into a police van as he insisted that he was innocent, they claimed. He was badly beaten up by the cops for refusing to enter the police van. He had sustained injuries, which eventually led to his death, said a family member of the deceased. The two people were arrested by a police team from the fair on a tip-off. But Robiul fell sick on the way to the local police station and he was soon rushed to Sadar Hospital. He died while being shifted to Rangpur Medical College and Hospital, said the family member. As the news of the death spread, the agitated locals blocked the Lalmonirhat-Rangpur highway in the early hours of 15 April and demanded the punishment of a sub-Inspector of Sadar police station. Sub-inspector Halimur Rahman of Lalmonirhat Sadar Police Station was suspended following allegations of Rabiul's death due to torture in custody.

data.name: Mohammad Raju
data.description: Raju was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the Golabari area of Burichang upazila in Comilla. Local police claimed that he was involved in drug peddling and smuggling and was the prime suspect in the murder case of journalist Mohiuddin Sarkar Naeem. This is the first reported death in a gunfight with the RAB since the United States imposed sanctions on the force and seven of its current and former officials on December 10, 2021. According to New Age, the prime suspect in the murder case of a journalist was killed in a gunfight with the RAB in the Golabari area of Burichang upazila in Cumilla early on Sunday. This is the first reported death in a gunfight with the RAB since the United States imposed sanctions on the force and seven of its current and former officials on December 10, 2021. The deceased is Mohammad Raju, son of Sadek Mia from Bishnupur village. Local police claimed that he was involved in drug peddling and smuggling and was the prime suspect in the murder case of journalist Mohiuddin Sarkar Naeem, as reported by the New Age Cumilla correspondent. Journalist Mohiuddin Sarkar Naeem, 28, was shot dead by unidentified killers near the Indian border in Burichang upazila on Wednesday night. The victim's mother, Nazima Akhter, filed a case against six people, including Raju as the prime suspect, with the Burichang police station the following day. Major Mohammad Sakib Hossain, the local commander of RAB-11, said that acting on a tip-off, they conducted a raid in the Golabari area to arrest Naeem's killers. Sensing the presence of law enforcement, the criminals opened fire at them, and they had to fire back in self-defense, resulting in the gunfight. Raju sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight, according to the RAB officer, and was taken to Cumilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. A pistol and ammunition were recovered from the scene, and a RAB member was also injured in the incident, he added. Sardar Abdus Sattar, an official at Cumilla Medical College Hospital, informed local journalists that Raju was brought dead to the hospital at 2:15

data.name: Kawsar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: The Daily Star reported that a man was killed in what the Rab claimed was a gunfight with the law enforcers in Manikganj early yesterday. The deceased, identified as Kawser Ali Mondal, 45, from Joypurhat's Panchbibi upazila, was accused in at least 12 robbery cases, according to the Rab. Just four days ago, Raju, 35, an accused in a murder case, was shot dead in a "shootout" with Rab members in Cumilla. Raju's death was the first such incident since the US imposed sanctions on Rab for rights violations on December 10, 2021. Khandaker Al Moin, Rab's Legal and Media wing director, said the "gunfight" in Manikganj also left two Rab members injured as some armed miscreants opened fire at their microbus on Singair-Hemayetpur regional highway. A window of Rab's microbus was shattered, and a tire burst in the alleged gunfight. The law enforcers retaliated, leaving Kawser dead, he said, adding that the injured officials were taken to the Combined Military Hospital in Dhaka. An attempted murder case was filed by Rab-4 against the victim, while a murder case was filed against him and several unidentified miscreants, since two Rab officials were injured, even though the only murder victim was Kawser himself. According to the first information report filed by the police, the incident occurred around 1:35 am. "A critically injured Kawser was rushed to Manikganj Sadar Hospital, where he was declared dead by doctors at 5:30 am," claimed the FIR. The hospital is approximately 40 minutes away from Singair upazila. Furthermore, two of the witnesses named in the FIR said that they both saw a dead body lying on the road. "I was home eating sehri. Our house is 300 yards away from the spot. Rab officials came to our house and requested us to go and help them. I did not know what was going on

data.name: Najir Ahmed
data.description: Najir Ahmed was allegedly tortured to death in police custody in Brahmanbaria, according to his family's complaint. The police denied the allegation and claimed that he died of a heart attack. The victim's brother, Hossain Ahmed Tafsir, stated that Najir had bought a house in the area. A businessman named Najir Ahmed, 40, a resident of Sarail Sadar Upazila, was allegedly tortured to death in police custody in Brahmanbaria on Thursday, as reported by his family. The police denied the allegation and claimed that he died of a heart attack. Hossain Ahmed Tafsir, the victim's brother, mentioned that Najir had purchased a house in the area and had been targeted by a group of locals. On Thursday evening, a local named Jumman Mia broke into Najir's room. Sub-inspector Saiful Islam, along with the Sarail police team, went to the house and took both Najir and Jumman to the police station, according to Tafsir. After arriving at the police station, Tafsir was informed that his brother Najir had been taken to the hospital with injuries and had died there. Tafsir also claimed that his brother had been tortured to death and that the involvement of local municipality councillor Moshahed Ullah and Sarail police in the incident was suspicious. Officer-in-charge Aslam Hossain of Sarail police station stated that the allegations against the police were unfounded. He explained that Najir and his family members had assaulted a suspected thief on Thursday evening, resulting in his injuries. The police later arrived at the scene and took Najir and the suspected thief to the police station. Both Najir and the suspected thief were then sent to the hospital. Najir fell ill on the way to the hospital and was subsequently taken to the upazila health complex, where doctors declared him dead upon arrival. The body was sent to the morgue at Brahmanbaria General Hospital for post-mortem examinations during the night, he added.

data.name: Kulsum Begum
data.description: Kulsum Begum was killed by BGB firing during the vote counting at Gabtali of Bogra. The supporters of Awami League (candidate Yunus) interfered with the vote counting, resulting in a clash with the police and BGB. Then, BGB opened fire, killing four people, including Kulsum. Eyewitnesses said that during the voting for UP elections at Kalaihata polling station, locals vandalized the vehicles of BGB and the local administration due to delays in announcing the election's outcome. To bring the situation under control, law enforcement officers opened fire to disperse the locals.

To bring the situation under control, law enforcement officers opened fire to disperse the locals.

data.name: Abdur Rashid Pramanik
data.description: Abdur Rashid Pramanik was killed by BGB firing during the vote counting at Gabtali of Bogra. The supporters of Awami League (candidate Yunus) interfered with the vote counting, resulting in a clash with the police and BGB. Then, BGB opened fire, killing four people, including Pramanik. Eyewitnesses said that during the voting for UP elections at Kalaihata polling station, locals vandalized the vehicles of BGB and the local administration due to delays in announcing the election's outcome. To bring the situation under control, law enforcement officers chased and opened fire to disperse the locals.

The supporters of Awami League candidate Yunus interfered with vote counting, resulting in a clash with the police and BGB. BGB then opened fire, killing four people, including Alamgir. Eyewitnesses said that during the voting for UP elections at Kalaihata polling station, locals vandalized the vehicles of BGB and the local administration due to delays in announcing the election's outcome. To bring the situation under control, law enforcement officers chased and opened fire to disperse the locals.

data.name: Ayub
data.identity: Allegedly tied with an organized robbery gang
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that a police team conducted a raid in the Nurullaguna hill area around 3:30 am after receiving information that 10 to 15 robbers were preparing to commit a robbery. As the police reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight", the police recovered the bodies of Junayed, Mehedi, and Ayub, who had been hit by bullets. The law enforcers rushed them to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared them dead. The bodies were then sent to the morgue at Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for autopsy. Two policemen, including an additional superintendent and an inspector, also sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight," he further added. The police claimed to have recovered seven locally-made firearms, five sharp weapons, and 25 bullets from the scene.
